Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable and great location”
Reviews.Author: jltmet56
Reviews.Content: if you're looking for a clean and comfortable room at a reasonable price this is it. Great location . staff we encountered were friendly,and happy. Room was clean and easy enough to manouver around the property. had an early dinner first night at the buffet and there was ample enough choices for every palate. breakfast one morning at the buffet and again enough choices for every palate. Toby Keiths bar upstairs fun (for those who like country music) and if you dont it's still a fun bar to enjoy a drink. dinner another night at the Oyster bar. so good...we split fish tacos and a fresh Tuna on spring mix salad I wouldnt hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service!!!! Uncomfortable Room!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ddbkansas
Reviews.Content: We arrived mid evening to check in and waited in line for 30 minutes before we were even able to get to an associate. Once we finally got to our room it was over 80 degrees!!!! After adjusting the a/c to 70 we left to eat, thinking it would be nice and cooled off when we returned. Unfortunately, it was just as hot. Harrah's has economical/Green heating/cooling. When there is no movement in the room the system shuts off....it does not remain at a constant temp --- it just shuts off. So, for the 3 nights we were there for a conference my husband and I would take turns getting up out of bed, walk to the end of the bed so the sensor would kick on the a/c. Needless to say, we did not rest well while at the hotel. On 3 different occasions we had questions that we wanted to ask at the Information desk, however, there was NEVER anyone at the desk. Finally, there was not a line and I decided to ask one of the the people at registration. When I walked up I was met with "Information only and only 1 question." Never did we feel welcome. We definitely will NEVER stay here again and would NOT recommend it unless you enjoy waiting in line and losing a few pounds by sweating throughout the night. Definitely not a restful place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean rooms in the Mardi Gras tower. Good value @ $75/night.”
Reviews.Author: dfndr90
Reviews.Content: Great location in the center of the strip. Close walking distance to Mirage, Venetian, TI, IP, and other smaller casinos. There is a 24hr. Walgreen's walking distance to the north of the Venetian. Good place to stock up on water, snacks...etc...The little store inside Harrah's was okay, but expensive. Was on the 10th floor in a deluxe King room. Nice clean ample room. Flat screen TV, empty mini-bar, so used it to store water, coffee-maker. View of the AC units was not the best, so you might ask for a pool view. Bathroom was decent. Surprised there was a small flat screen in the bathroom, so nice touch there. For $75/night I can't complain. The spa/workout room was adequate with decent weights and machines. $20/day is a bit high, but it's Vegas right. Not sure what the rooms in the Carnaval tower are like. Starbucks on premises is nice. Casino was very smoky, but again it's Vegas. The bar on the south side was popping with activity and dancing. For the price, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An OK place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Steve H
Reviews.Content: I took my oldest sons to LV and we stayed at Harrah's for days 2 and 3. Of the three hotels we stayed at (Four Queens and Imperial Palace being the other two), it was by far the most expensive. If you are looking for a mid-scale hotel, with decent rooms and amenities, you could do worse (i.e., the Excalibur). Located in the heart of the Strip, the location of this hotel is perfect. The room was spacious and clean. The buffet was decent, if a bit overpriced. Parking was easy and free of cost. My preference when in Las Vegas is location, and this hotel fit that bill nicely. I could have easily stayed in a lower-tier hotel and been just as happy, though. Plus I would have only spent about thirty percent of what I paid here. I don't spend much time in the room, so it's just a place to crash more than anything else. As long as the rooms are clean and comfortable, I can put up with worn carpets and older fixtures. Just me... your mileage may vary.

Reviews.Title: “Tired but less Expensive”
Reviews.Author: mike t
Reviews.Content: Harrahs is losing its touch with this hotel. It is tired and behind the times. Poor amenities, room quality, general upkeep. Their people are wondeful. The staff is competent but the hotal is looking like they are waiting for the right time to tear it down and put a modern hotel on the site. I was in the Carnaval wing and it was really below average, especially for Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Gaylea
Reviews.Content: Our second trip to Las Vegas, our first time at Harrah's. We were with another couple, so had a 2 bedroom suite on the 32nd floor. The room was quiet. A good price, $110. The master room was huge, with spa, double sinks, shower room. The second bedroom had 2 queen beds and a, although smaller bathroom. In between the two rooms, a sitting room with wet bar. All 3 rooms had TVs. The sheets were wonderful, the beds comfortable. Lots of fluffy towels. We would return to Harrah's. BTW Fusions at Harrah's, was a good value for the food. I only gave Service 3 stars as there was quite a wait to sign in. I couldn't comment on breakfast as we didn't eat breakfast there.

Reviews.Title: “I guess I should not have asked for a smoking room”
Reviews.Author: goldengreeke
Reviews.Content: They offered to put us in a better room for no extra charge, but we wanted our morning cigs and ended up on the 14th floor of the Carnival Tower with a panoramic view of the parking garage. It was kind of fun looking out the window each morning watching people pack their luggage in their trunks, seeing as how the TV was a 1975 Zenith with squiggly lines and a picture tube about ready to blow out. The carpet was thin and worn, as was the chair, the mattress was lumpy, but the toilet only backed up twice a day, and the shower head only rattled when ever it needed tightening, so it wasn't all that bad. We did however, love the casino floor! Excellent cocktail service, friendly patrons, great assortment of slot machines and table games and very clean. If it wasn't for my suck room, I would give Harrah's five stars and I will come back, just won't ask for a smoking room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: dzeedar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Harrah's with my best friend for a girls trip we took last year. Before booking I heard Harrah's had good rates and pretty nice rooms. The location was great and we got upgraded to a corner suite for free. The room was a good size and pretty up to date. The food at the oyster bar was good and we had grey goose and patron oyster shots, which were amazing! Definitely worth the price. I would recommend Harrah's to anyone that is looking for a good value hotel but nice at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “a diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: albert808
Reviews.Content: a $50 /room/night hotel in the middle of the strip? sounds too good to be true, right? wrong. My family of 5 booked 2 rooms for 3 days, although there was a long queue at the check in area, we were really expecting the worst since we will be staying on april 6 to 9 and this was on a weekend and spring break at that, so if this is a better run hotel, they wouldnt charge a rate this low. When we saw the adjoining spacious clean rooms, the nice bed, plumpy pillows, we decided to extend our stay to two more days. This was our base for seeing the valley of fire national park, hoover dam, ethels choco factory, the amazing Charlston ( snow in the middle of the dessert), car museum right beside the hotel, cirque show at Treasure Island etc. we could practically stay at this hotel and do lots of stuff in vegas without getting broke. Upon check out, we forgot to get our money, passports and plane tickets from our room safe, luckily when we retrieved it after 3 hours, it was still there. valet parking is very convenient and reasonable, they dont charge you parking fees. The only drawback in staying at this hotel is the lack of wifi, we had to go to the nearby mcdonalds for a free wifi which was very slow. this is just a minor inconvenience, we would definitely go back to this hotel on our future trips. take advantage of the low rates before they get smarter. hahaha

Reviews.Title: “Six days wells spent at Harrah's Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Goodwin0904
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 6 nights at Harrah's Las Vegas, 4/15/2012 to 4/21/2012. We got in rather early on a Sunday- around 11am and attempted to check-in however the room was not ready. With much ease we checked our bags in and hit The Strip for some sightseeing. We called around 3pm and VIOLA! The room was ready. We stayed in room 1043 of the Mardi Grad Tower. It was a corner room with a sofa which is larger than the non-corner rooms. The room had a small balcony which overlooked the pool and Carnival Court. After reading some of the other reviews I was worried about the late-night noise but this was never an issue as long as the balcony door was completely shut. We found the room to be comfortable and accomodating. The bed was nice and plush. The TV was an updated flat-screen. We never once turned on the flat-screen in the bathroom, but we did use the coffee maker. (NOTE: If you are a coffee drinker hustle on down to Walgreens at the Venetian and score yourself some of your favorite roast because the coffee that comes in the room is NAST!) The drain in the bathtub was exceptionally slow - but, no huge problem. Afterall, the room was comped for 6 nights so I wasn't going to complain too loudly! We had an early dinner at Flavors Buffet (see separate review) which was lack-luster. But, that may have been because we went right at the end of lunch before the dinner items were put out. We also dined at KGBs and The Oyster Bar. (See separate reviews). We found the staff to be extremely helpful throughout our stay. The casino is dated and much smaller than most other Strip casinos, but if you are looking for a superb location with reasonable rates and comfy beds then this is the place for you! There is a walkway which connects Harrah's to Imperial Palace. There is also a monorail station right out back which is SUPER HANDY! Oh! Some folks complained about the cigarette smoke in the hotel. My thought is this: IT'S VEGAS! IT'S SMOKE! BIG DEAL! The smoke was not bad at all in any other area than the casino. I was more bothered by people who bring small children into the casino. But, that's a different story. Overall, I give our stay at Harrah's Las Vegas 4 our of 5 stars! We would DEFINITELY stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Girlfriends Goodtime at Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: CairnsMom
Reviews.Content: We are 8 friends from high school (37 years after we have graduated) who try to get away together once a year, this was our first trip to Las Vegas. Harrah's was chosen for its central location on the strip and that was great. The rooms were ok but I was disappointed with their "savings" on the Air Conditioning. It topped 98 when we were there & the rooms took a while to cool down if we were gone very long thanks to their "green" iniative of having the air co shut down after you leave your room. It also turned it off at night so we would get up once or twice to keep it cool at night. The breakfast buffet was excellent & a good bargain & Toby Keith's Bar & Grill was fun with great food. I was disappointed that there were no frozen drinks served to gamblers--I was told they weren't allowed because it cut into the NUMB Bar's business--so we went next door to Casino Royale for the $1 frozen Strawberry Margaritas. I am happy as I hit a jackpot that covered the cost of my trip, however this property is certainly not as upscale as many of the places on the strip. We stayed at Paris Las Vegas in February and it is nicer & the room stayed cool!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LVlovesLV
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrah's in March 2012 for 4 nights - all comped. Paid $15 per night for an upgraded room. Great view of the Mirage Volcano from our room and you could hear the music too! Had a small balcony to step out on. Bathroom had a TV and coffee maker (very rare in Vegas). Desk clerk was excellent - we had 3 different rooms between 7 of us staying there and she got us all on the same floor. Casino is a little smokey but so are most. Location in the middle of the strip was excellent. Right across the street from Mirage. Did not eat at the hotel but highly recommend going to the Wicked Spoon buffet at the Cosmopolitan for brunch with complimentary mimosas or bloody marys. Check-out was easy as it was done on the TV. Would stay there again as it was clean, reasonable and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: flaglyn
Reviews.Content: Read a lot of reviews about this hotel, some good and some not so good. I have stayed here twice and found it to be a great hotel for the price. I have stayed in the Mardi Gras and Carnival Towers. Both were nice and clean. This hotel offers a lot of great in-house entertainment! We really enjoyed the Mac King Magic Show and the Legends in Concert. This hotel is located in the Mid-Strip section, so you can get around pretty well. We were able to walk everywhere. It is a great location for the Monorail. We chose to take the bus that runs the whole strip for just $7. for a 24 hr period. I would only suggest this if the Strip is not real busy, otherwise it is a fantastic way to get around on the strip. The staff was nice. Had a great view of the Mirage's Volcano going off in the evenings!!! I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Still have no complaints”
Reviews.Author: comp_Nerd
Reviews.Content: Went to Harrah's with my husband for a mini vacation! Check in was a breeze I guess it was due to us being a little early. Our room wasn't ready so we had them check our bags and we went next door to eat at Denny's and stopped at Walgreen's or CVS located at the venetian and bought bottled waters, drinks and snacks. When we went back our room was ready and it was 2 hours before their usual check-in date We had a basic room in the Carnival Tower again I don't remember the room number we checked the bed/blankets, headboards,and nightstand for bedbugs luckily there were none.We did not hear any loud noises from the carnival court we were near the pool it was not loud there either. Housekeeping was great we always had fresh towels and our room was nicely done every morning. I have no complaints about Harrah's we enjoyed our stay once again!

Reviews.Title: “Last time at Harrahs”
Reviews.Author: jillibeanWork
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Harrahs twice a year for at least the past 12 years and sadly, our stay there in March will be our last. The hotel is just plain old.....the rooms are outdated, the casino is fun but I was not really comfortable with some of the stuff that was going on. Lots of young adults, drunk, loud, vulgar. I felt like I was in a seedy hotel. We will be moving on to something in the same area but perhaps a little classier. I am sad, I love Harrahs and have always felt a certain sense of loyalty to Harrahs, but after this last experience, I am moving on.

Reviews.Title: “30th in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda B
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Vegas and it seemed like an average hotel. Location was great but the hotel itself seemed like it could use some updates. The price was right though and we did have a good time! Other hotels had great themes although this one did not. The room was very clean and the service was good :)

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: dianemceElPaso_Tx
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights (19-23 April 2012) for a conference. I was apprehensive after reading the reviews but ended up being pleased with my room. I stayed in the carnival wing on the 21st floor-the view is nonexistent but the room was very clean and comfortable. I did not hear any noise from the hall or other rooms. The location can't be beat. The casino is pretty smoky but I didn't notice any smell in the room.Check in and check out were relatively quick. Do watch out for the hotel restaurants-the burger joint charges extra for everything (including mayo, mustard, ketchup...).

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's is outdated.”
Reviews.Author: beenthere28
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply outdated. The room was clean but very small and the furnishings were circa 1972. There are no amenities such as coffee maker or complimentary coffee in the lobby. Check-in took a exceptionally long time. The lobby is a complete mad house with throngs of people of varying states of intoxication. I was here to attend a medical conference and wished it was at a different hotel. On the plus side, Harrah's is located in the middle of the strip so you are immersed in the Las Vegas frenzy without even trying. After two nights, the hotel was fully so we moved to the Marriott which was quiet (no casino there) and large and the beds really comfortable. Of course, it was located near the convention center so everything else was either a long walk or an expensive monorail ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: CharlieA4
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with lots of restaurants and shops close at hand. Definitely will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We're going' back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara Genal N
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were there for out 30th wedding anniversary, this is the 1st time in 30 years we have gone on a vacation just the two of us,when we got to Harrahs I was so pleased to see in was right in the middle where all the action was. Our room was wonderful,the king sized bed and fluffy pillows gave me the most comfortable sleep ever being away from home, the staff was very accommodating, and friendly. While we were there, we ate at the buffett and Toby Keith's,I love this bar, and I did, I saw great pictures of Toby all over the walls, and my husband enjoyed the cute little waitresses. The shows we saw were Legions and Defending the Caveman, that man was GREAT and it is a must see for couples, he made you fall in love all over again with your other half, 2 thumbs up and if I had more he'd get them!

Reviews.Title: “Applaude the effort but......”
Reviews.Author: Lilygirl49
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Las Vegas and the last ime I will stay at Harrah's. The room was servicable but nothing special. Check in was a nightmare and probably took us a good hour, maybe more. Where I am all for saving energy, air conditioning in the dessert is not the place to do it. The air condintioner in our room was set to conserve energy and go off when there is no movement in the room, that means at night as well. It became so hot in our room at night that my husband and I were up and down several times in the night in an effort to get the air to cool our room down so we could sleep. On top of that the beds were so hard and the pillows like bricks which made sleep impossible. However I would like to say that the room was very clean. Speaking to the front desk brought no relief. The cascino was smoky compared to others and was very out dated. The buffet at Harrah's, while large, is very lacking in flavor.

Reviews.Title: “Great strip location”
Reviews.Author: Stephen W
Reviews.Content: Harrahs is perfectly located about half way along the strip. Our room was lovely with good fresh furnishings (maybe recently refurbished). We didn't book a room with a strip view but had a partial view which was a bonus. Very comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Carol N
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Harrah's in November 2011. It was our first trip to Vegas and we didn't know where to stay. I chose Harrah's based on reviews on this and other sites. We didn't eat there nor actually gamble there but the location was great and the room entirely adequate. We love walking to see the sights when we are vacationing and Harrah's central location on the strip certainly allowed that. Would we stay there again? Maybe, we had no complaints but we might just want to try another location.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's is definitely dated.....”
Reviews.Author: SimpaticoWesternMa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights for a convention and this place needs a total facelift and does not even begin to compete with the other strip hotels, expecially the theme hotels. Casino area very dark and smokey with terrible penny slot payouts, not even enough to want to continue throwing in more money. Very noisy, beep, beep, beep, sounds starting at 4 AM from delivery trucks in the area backing up. Even on the 24 th floor, it was like an hours long alarm clock. Rooms were clean but nothing special. Layout confusing with the main enterance in the back down some side alleys, and a dark and dismal front???? entrance. No nice stores and restaurants nothing special. Large lines in the AM for SBs water falvored coffee. Lines for breakfast with half the tables empty. Way to expensive for what it offers. Have a real experience and stay in a newer theme hotel. They should tear it down and build a new one. These old Vegas hotels are dinosaurs.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay mid Strip!”
Reviews.Author: Jane K
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise! Thought Harrahs would be tired and old but the room was quite the opposite. Clean and comfortable is what we found. Casino was OK - a little too smokey and dark for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: perWarrenton_va
Reviews.Content: I had read other reviews, but take each with a grain of salt as many are looking for everything for nothing. This hotel is worth much mire than its current rates and is a great bargain. My single room was clean, light and airy. It was well cleaned each day and always stocked with toiletries. Location is smack in the middle of the strip so it's easy to go any way when walking.Make sure you get a Rewards card before check in. That trick facilitates an early check in and long waiting lines at the 4pm official check in. The Rewards card is the total ticket around Vegas. It's easy to purchase in any hotel before check in. Lots of people and lines, but thats Vegas, so get over it!. Just plan on waiting for most everything Only down side is a noisy fan and A/C but I always travel with a sound machine and never have a problem. If you're a light sleeper , this could be a dealbreaker. If you want a good, inexpensive room in a great location, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Superbowl Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Brwisaacs
Reviews.Content: We went to Las Vegas for Superbowl Sunday, and stayed 3 nights at Harrahs on the strip, the price was good 218.00 dollars for the stay. The hotel itself is very nice, its in a great location, the buffet is excellent, we didnt win any money though. The only drawback is if you want to watch the Superbowl, be prepared to spend about a 100.00$ each to get a seat somewhere, even at Toby Keith,s bar which is part of Harrah,s, i would have thought they would give hotel guests a break on the price. Next year we are staying down on Fremont street for superbowl weekend, just a note, take the bus instead of a cab, only 7.00$ for a 24 hour pass, very easy and quite fun. See ya in Vegas, Bob.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaTra
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's, and got an upgraded room on the 10th floor. The room was nice, it also has a TV in the bathroom. The room amenities were good. Be careful, they charged us for beverages in the room that we never had. The hotel is noisy, a lot going on in the casino. The location is good, in mid town. We ate at the buffet, and it was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: travelingjenn79
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed there April 2-5 and had a great stay. When we arrived there was a long line for check in but it moved quickly. We had a comped room but upgraded for $15 a night for a room with a strip view we were able to see the Rio and Palms. Our room was clean and the beds were very comfy. The location was is great right in the middle of the strip. It was a great stay and we would stay there again. I loved that there was no resort fee. Last time we stayed at the Mirage and never used anything that was covered in our resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OUMOM
Reviews.Content: Right in the middle of the strip and can catch the monorail at this hotel. This hotel was very nice and actually pretty quiet. Mirage is across the street, so not far to walk to see the volcano eruption nightly. Used Bell Trans from the airport to the hotel. It's $13 roundtrip, good price. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value at $30 a night and middle of the strip!”
Reviews.Author: Robert A
Reviews.Content: I'd rate this as Very Good, not Excellent. The room was in the Marti Gras tower and was super clean and very updated, rich wood and marble, balcony that opened and as requested not next to the ice machine, however it was on the back side of the elevators (M624) and trying to sleep was hard w/o some advil PM. The best way to describe the sound was a bowling alley and the ball bing thrown down the wooden alley and never hitting any pins, constantly! Was close to requesting a different room and should have but stuck it out. The AC was a pain in the rear. Get back to the room and it's 80 degrees, the AC only works when there is motion in the room, so after 4-5 minutes on laying in bed the AC turns off, still 80 degrees! You have to wave your arms, the AC turns on. Slept the 1st night with the sliding door open and the outside breeze blowing in (bringht lights too). Next day went to Target on Flamingo just off the strip and bought a fan, that helped but only to move air, the AC only runs with motion and once you lay down it turns off till you wave your arms. Stayed from Apr 10-14 for $30 a night, book direct with your players club and shop for promo codes, another bonus with Harrah's is NO RESORT FEES! Now that's a true $30 a night rate. Do you really know what a Resort Fee is? Researh that bogus 'stick it to the tourist' fee and you'll never stay at a propert that charges a resort fee again! Took the fan back to Target in the original box and receipt for a refund on travel day, we'll stay at Harrah's again, just not next to an ice machine OR elevator. check in was prompt and friendly and the housekeeping staff was excellent. Room was always clean, only down side is the king size bed was kinda old, had the 'speed bump' in the middle and I felt like I was going to roll off the side. Bit of a challenge when spending 'adult time' with your Fiance'. Bottom line, very good value, very clean and modern. Middle of the strip so walking is not as bad. Bad would be getting in the parking garage, construction makes it a little hard but that will be fixed soon, grafitti as you exit the parking garage and walking to the lobby needs to be cleaned up. Yes, we'd stay with Harrah's again, very friendly people.

Reviews.Title: “Basic needs met from a great location”
Reviews.Author: CinciJim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at harrah's the first week of April 2012. Overall, we were very pleased with the hotel. We stayed in room 2608 in the carnval tower. The room was very basic - but clean and in good shape; if you're looking for luxury, the place probably isn't for you. The view from our room was of construction behind the hotel. Our biggest complaint would be that the air conditioning was very lacking. But, we spent most of our time "doing vegas", so the room served as a place to sleep. The hotel itself is ok - the casino is lively, and there are a dozen or so eating choices within the hotel. The best part about the hotel is location, location, location. It's right in the heart of the strip. Excellent! Also, if you want a cheap eats, there is a McDonalds located within 20 feet of the hotel. We'll probably stay here again next time - - - again, mainly due to its central location.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: MJaneM
Reviews.Content: stayed at Harrah's and what can I say, but it was a great stay. The room was quiet, and non smoking, as requested and clean and the service was superb. The only problem was the smoking in the casino, and that is to be expected in the US anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “dont know why there are so many complaints”
Reviews.Author: dibbly04
Reviews.Content: just got back from a trip to harrahs. had a great time. I thought the room was great, very comfy pillowtop bed and very clean...what else could you want. So what if the chairs are 10 yrs old, how much time are you in the room anyway.? We found check in and check out very smooth and staff very helpful. If you are rude to them first maybe they dont respond in a polite way all the time. Cant say I blame them after reading some of the comments here.The new fancy hotels will be older someday too, so you should pay the big money for them now and get the treatment you so desire. Our stay at harrahs was great, now complaints except couldnt win on the slots.Love how this hotel is so close to everything, perfect

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it!!”
Reviews.Author: DK2371
Reviews.Content: For the location & price, you simply can't beat it! Granted, I'm a Total Rewards member & got a deal by email (sign up if you aren't one), but the price was great for $30/nt. Stayed in the Carnaval Tower, 27th floor, & the classic room was perfect. We had a partial view of the strip & it just happened to look out over the volcano at the Mirage; awesome! No frills, but 2 comfortable beds, nice sized, very clean, no noise, & everything you would need for a great stay. The check in wasn't long at all, approximately 10 minute wait, & the check out was flawless. The casino is nice sized with plenty of slots & tables. The only bad thing I can think of is the casino can be smoky, but not overwhelming, so if you don't like the smell of smoke, it might get to you. It just goes to show you don't always get what you pay for, you get ALOT more! Great experience & would stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a place on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: ola3rd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for only one night as we would be relocating once our other friends arrived in Vegas. The price was pretty decent for a weeknight stay on the strip; $45 from hotels.com. But at check-in, the lady convinced me to upgrade to a deluxe room for $15 extra/ night Positives: - Good location on the strip - Good price for value - No resort fee/ or deposit taken Negatives: - At check-in they gave us free tickets to a comedy show but then when we tried to redeem them they said there was a minimum drink purchase required. BEWARE these tickets are not entirely free lol - Bathroom could be upgraded a bit - Entire room was a bit on the smallish side, for multiple people - No fridge Harrah's isn't a bad place but it is pretty mediocre in comparison to other Strip hotels. I would recommend other Vegas hotels within the same price range but with much better value

Reviews.Title: “superb location. comfy rooms”
Reviews.Author: gypsyCannock
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights during a 16 day tour, well the main thing about this hotel..is its not as grand as some of the others on the strip or anything special, but what the hotel does have is the best central location in the strip...!!!! the hotel is lovely , but most vegas hotels are lovely, was clean , and the rooms were spacious and comfortable, there are no hot drink facilities which is normal for vegas so im told...played the tables a few nights in the hotel and the staff were amazing and helpful, there is currently a lot of building work going on at the bak of the hotel, which can be noisy but wasnt a problem as we were out all day, and looks like it will be on going for a while yet...but wouldnt let this put you off....most the main hotels like bellagio , treasure island , and venitian are within 5 mins walk , and this hotel is one of the stops on the monrail route, which is easy to use and cheap 5 dollars , save those feet !! as u will walk your legs off in vegas !!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the savings”
Reviews.Author: Runinref
Reviews.Content: Yes, you can get somewhat decent rates if you book far enough in advance but it's not worth it. Plus they make promises on the phone that they don't honor once you arrive. I would ask for everything in writing via e-mail if I ever had to stay here again. We stayed four nights and I hated each day worse than the one before. Everything negative you read in the other reviews is true, The rooms are run down, the staff is rude (except for some of the dealers at the table games) and service is horrible. Another problem is the Total Rewards program. We gambled our butts off while there in hopes that our points earned would help when we wanted to stay at their properties in St. Louis or Kansas City. I called a week after our return from Vegas to book a weekend in June at the Harrah's in KC and they said it would cost us the standard rates!! There are plenty of options in "Sin City" and if this property doesn't make some major changes starting with management at the hotel level I don't see how they will survive. Spend some extra money and stay some other place. Heck, the management doesn't really seem to care anyway!!

Reviews.Title: “sleep but don't eat”
Reviews.Author: CBE&LME
Reviews.Content: nice maid service......fast elevators.......DO NOT eat the buffet ! unless you have a snout !

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade -Worth the view of the Mirage.”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer T
Reviews.Content: We go to Vegas all the time. Harrah we like because of location, Toby Keith bar and their valet guys are great. ask for the upgraded room otherwise rooms are average...jimmy and maria at toby keith are Great...go to carnival ask for awesome...yes thats his name he goes by...

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: IldikoGuelph
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's from March 4-8.We liked it We went for lunch in the buffet it was very good and lot's of food to choose from . It was good that Harrah's is in the middle of the strip.We did a lot of walking. The end of the day that was so good that our room was nice and quiet and the bed was big and comfortable we were able to relax. The staff was friendly and  helpful,they did a good job. There is a lot's of things to do in Harrah's lots of free entertainment .The twins in the piano bar did a good job and they were funny and sing really nice . We had lots of fun, if we will have the opportunity to go back again we would choose to stay Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “Good price - average room”
Reviews.Author: Ninska
Reviews.Content: We basically choose it because of the price and location. The room was very big and a little bit out dated. When we arrive they only gave us one of the two rooms we booked, we had to wait a couple of hours to get the other room. The decoration was very basic. If I ever go back to las Vegas I would like to try to stay in another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alex G
Reviews.Content: If you aim only good location x price, Harrahs Is your destiny, clean room, fair size and spectacular location, but...... that's It (realy).. But If you like places with good restaurants, beautiful people well dressed DONT go to Harras, the lobby is like a freeway, they have a tram stationinside the lobby and the come and go is umbelivable !!! Next time I will spend a few more money and stay at Cesar right across the street and 100 % better.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome and Underated!”
Reviews.Author: cyberness
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Bellagio my first time in Vegas so that impression is hard to beat. I do have to say that I would return again, service, food, entertainment was absolutely wonderful. This was not a pretentious atmosphere like the Bellagio and it was alot of fun. All the other guest were very personable and enjoying the time spent there too. The slots were much looser than the other top shelf resorts. Dueling pianos were outstanding; really enjoyed that!!! The Steak house onsite was amazing; make a reservation. Nice baby grand and nice music so I sat at the bar, met alot of nice folks and had a five start Dinner. It is called the Range! Awesome! Great location for my conference; close to all the things I wanted to visit.

Reviews.Title: “A LONG wait to check in, average hotel for the strip”
Reviews.Author: wofwnr
Reviews.Content: Waited 1 1/2 hours to check in as line was very long. Checking in around 2:00 and they charge a $16.00 early check in charge even though there is no sign anywhere saying what time check in is or that there is a charge for checking in early. Room was fine, however the towels leave something to be desired. Very thin and rough. Bed was good. Dealers were friendly and waitresses were there with the drinks.

Reviews.Title: “At least they let me cancel reservation.”
Reviews.Author: Bostonchip
Reviews.Content: After waiting in an unattractive lobby with scruffy sad looking people for 45 minutes trying to check in, I decided this place was already too awful to continue. I called and told them I need to get out of my commitment. She was nice and cancelled my reservation. Seriously, how long do they expect people to wait to check in? I think, had I waited, it would have been well over 1 hour. The place was really ugly too.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: GTW76
Reviews.Content: Yes, I know it's a cliche, but Harrah's LV is all about location! As with any rating I give, value is important, so let me preface this by saying I got a basic room for a steal of a deal just by joining the Harrah's Total Rewards Program - I rarely gamble, but just from joining you will receive e-mail offers for all Harrah`s properties! That being said I got a perfectly good room in a perfectly `great`location for about $30.00 a night! (Monday - Friday) Harrah`s LV is not The Mirage, The Aria, or The Venetian... it is older, without as many bells and whistles as the newer Vegas chic hotels, but it`s still a great place! The rooms are clean, the mattresses are great, I could have used a better TV, but this is Vegas so who cares about a TV. Harrah`s LV has lots of little shops - convenience type, jewellery, shoes, etc... something you`d never see at the Vdara! Harrah`s also has a few different restaurants, again mabne not as many as some other 5 star places, but a decent selection - Burgers, Toby Keith`s, a Chinese place, a cafe, and of course a decent buffet! I`ll throw in a special word about the Icepan Ice Cream place on the 2nd floor, and that word is `WOW` ...the show is worth the cost alone! The pool is decent, no frills... and the casino area bustles with game players. Bottom line, this is a great place - `competitive prices (if you get a deal through Harrah`s Club), in a very high rent part of the strip! ...I will be back, this is my kinda place!

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the strip.”
Reviews.Author: Chris P
Reviews.Content: We found Harrah's to be excellent value for money and provided us with everything we needed. The service given by the check in staff was very impressive, the room was spacious and everything we wanted in a base to go and explore the strip. There are plent of more lavish hotels on the strip but if you want a basic place to go and explore vegas from this is perfectly adequate!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased!”
Reviews.Author: Rubbercitygirl
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at Harrah's for the convenience of being in the middle of the strip and the price. My husband and I were married in Vegas on April 3, 2012 and we stayed here for 6 nights while in Vegas. We had nothing but great service. I reserved a mini suite a few months prior to our stay, and that is what we got. Our suite was on the 19th floor of the Carnival Tower. We did not hear any noise, we did not hear any music. Let me tell you about he bed... the best nights sleep I've had in years. We loved the bed! Our room was very clean, and we were very happy with our stay at Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “NOT AS PLUSH AS OTHER RESORTS BUT GOOD VALUE”
Reviews.Author: ZAMPANOBath
Reviews.Content: Good location - a little tired but for the price good value.

Reviews.Title: “Out Dated & Smokey”
Reviews.Author: BabyPSF
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's from Monday, April 2 - Saturday, April 7th and had 2 Rooms booked. Upon arrival there was only a short wait to be checked in, however the woman at the front desk was less than friendly, no smile, or greeting, just "ID & Credit card". we explained to her that we had booked 2 rooms, a Suite, and a Classic Room. They then informed us that 1. The Executive Suites are on their own floor, and 2. that it would require a $100 per night deposit. Neither had been disclosed when we booked. We asked if our friends could at least be in the same building, or upgraded, annoyed she said the best she could do is get them in the same building. The Classic Executive Suite on the 32nd floor was NOT worth it. It was very outdated, with uncomfortable furniture. This is our 6th time in a hotel suite in Las Vegas, and this room was by far the worst. The mattress sagged in the middle, as did the sofa. The pillows were way too soft. One night we decided to eat in, and noticed that the dinner table was unbalanced, and wobbled to the point of being unusable. Even all the way up on the 32nd Floor you can still hear the music blasting from Carnival Court till 4:30am. You can also hear it in the hallway, so soundproofing is non-existent. The Classic Room they gave our friends, was a dark double room. The A/C did not work, and they acknowledged that they were unable to fix it. Lucky for them April is not very hot or cold, but in the summer this would be a huge issue as it can get HOT. Another strange thing we noticed is that no one's cell phone worked in the rooms. once we got down to the casino or out on the strip it was perfect 4-5 bars, but not on our room floors. The Casino has zero ventilation, and is so smokey it was burning my sinuses. This casino is also very tight, we had some luck on this trip but every time we played here we lost. the drink service here was also very poor, during our whole trip were were only offered drinks on our last night. Casino employees were also somewhat rude. Also something that I noticed a lot here were a lot of messy drunks roaming around, perhaps due to Carnival Court? I almost forgot the pool, we could see it from our room, and that was enough. The pool here is very dull, and uninspired. just a lap pool, with chairs around it. This definitely doesn't live up to the Las Vegas standard found at other hotels. Harrah's Las Vegas was definitely all around disappointing, and I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: amishka
Reviews.Content: Overall, the place is not bad but there should be better places. "+": - Great location in the middle of the Strip - Good conference center - spacious room - bed was very good - AC worked perfectly, but it shuts down when you leave the room "-": - terrible lines at check-in at any time (and not so long at check-out) - old building - cleaning is not perfect (by the amount of dust near and behind the wardrobe I could tell that they never cleaned there) - no coffee machine, so that you go spend some extra bucks at the two Starbucks locations in the lobby - I had a broken iron in my room. Fortunately, they fixed it rather quickly - all necessities like toothbrush+toothpaste, etc. are available for purchase only - there is a construction right in front of the hotel (not sure when it is expected to end) - if you neighbors are coming late to their room, you'll know it. The sound is not isolated at all. - gambling at the hotel lobby is not very attractive. I felt like I was in Walmart... - early check in (before 3pm) will cost you $28. To sum up, if not for the conference that I attended there, I wouldn't stay in this hotel for the price they ask.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for Center Strip”
Reviews.Author: CJ4UNME
Reviews.Content: Yes, Harrahs is an older property in Vegas, but has remodeled rooms. Clean, quiet (for our visit), nice appointed, and reasonably priced. Great value for center strip! Oyster bar is a great break from slots if there not paying too! Pool and jacuzzi were not open during our January stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, otherwise kind of a dive.”
Reviews.Author: stromboliforyou
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. Can't beat the mid LV Blvd placement of this hotel. Close to most attractions and on the monorail as well. The hotel has a piano bar and the dueling piano players were fabulous during our stay. The piano bar patrons were entertaining as well. Housekeeping staff did a good job cleaning our room and were pleasant. Just to prepare yourself however, I'll include a little more info.... Check in included a nasty 45 minute wait in a long line adjacent to the very smoky, noisy casino floor. Carpets in the tower hallways were sad, faded, dirty and in places so lumpy you had to be careful not to trip on them. The outside of our room's windows were so dirty you could not see out of them. If you want WiFi you must pay extra. The staff member at the check out desk was rude.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIABLE- One of the worst in the city.”
Reviews.Author: OnTheGo1202
Reviews.Content: 1. HORRIBLE CIGARETTE SMOKE !!!!!! We were in almost every casino on LV, and the Harrahs was by far the worst. It was not must smoke, it was years of built up, nonventilate smoke. The non-smoking areas were just as bad. Someone had suggested a higher floor to avoid the smoke smell, but it didn't help since the floor below us and above us were smoking floors. 2. The slots were the tightest in the entire city. MGM and Mirage were most fun to play. We don't mind to lose money, and long as we get to play for a while and have fun. Losing $100 in 10 minutes at the slots isn't much fun to us. 3. The resturants had horriable service. (One forgot to enter our order, and it was over an hour before we got our food entered to be prepared) 4. Long lines for everything. Check in/Check out/buffet I'm sure that Harrahs and the folks at Ceasars read these, but obviously they don't give a crap.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Court18
Reviews.Content: I should start by saying that the only reason I stayed here is because my entire stay was comped. Therefore, I let a lot of things slide that I usually don't when picking a hotel. Harrah's is in prime location. Its midstrip and close to many great hotels like Caesar's Palace, Venetian, Treasure Island and the Mirage. In addition, the Monorail has a stop outside of the hotel, therefore you are a quick train trip away from hotels on either side of the Strip. Arrived on Thursday a little before 11AM. Though check-in isn't until 4PM the line was ridiculously long. It took about 30 minutes to check -in and our room still wasn't ready. However we were told to check the information desk at noon for the status, and if another room was ready they would give us that. We ended up going to IcePan on the 2nd floor (a great place where they make the ice cream right in front of you), and by the time we got back our room still wasn't ready however another one was so whe checked in. We were given a Premium room in the Mardi Gras tower on the 10th floor, which faced Carnival Court. If you are a light sleeper then the location of this room will not be ideal because music is being played until the wee hours of the morning. However, it didn't bother me that much once I was actually asleep. The room itself was a bit on the small side and it had some cosmetic flaws. For example one of the electric sockets was almost pulled out of the wall. The bed itself was comfortable (pillow-top I think). The room also has a motion activated AC Unit. Therefore, when coming back to the room after a long time of being away, it usually is bit warm. Also at night when sleeping, it shuts off because their is no movement. I found myself waving my arms numerous times in the middle of the night to get it to turn back on. The walls are very thin. I could hear the next rooms conversation easily. In addition the room had flat screen tvs in the bedroom and bathroom. The bathroom was also on the small side. The lights were over the sink which left the tub/shower combo a bit dark. However, the water pressure was great, and I had nice hot showers everyday. I was concerned about the doorknob of the bathroom door. If you closed it completely it seemed that it took a lot of work to twist the knob to open it back up. Their were many times when I thought I was actually 'stuck' in there. The room does have a safe which I utilized for my tablet (I read other reviews regarding people's stuff being stolen). The casino itself was medium sized, it took a couple of trips before I was able to walk around not get lost. The slots didn't seem that loose and they didn't have a lot to choose from i.e. I saw a lot of Penny and dollar machines but no nickel machines. We ate breakfast at the Flavors buffet. Their was a good selection and line wasn't long. However, make sure you have a Total Rewards Card you get a couple dollars off the price. That was the only meal we ate there, because we ventured out to other hotels. One great thing is that the hotel offers a shuttle for $7 to the airport, no stops in between. In addition, you can also use some of your comps to pay for it. All in all it was an okay hotel. However, I found myself longing for the Bellagio. But you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updated, cleaned and proper training for employees.”
Reviews.Author: Shockershel
Reviews.Content: The rooms need updated. The elevators and hallways were dirty with trash. The whole place smelled like an ashtray. The employees at the check-in counter were rude. We had 4 couples traveling together and requested to be on the same floor in our reservations and we weren't even in the same tower. One room had hair and vomit in the bathroom and so they asked to change rooms and the Supervisor at the check-in just threw another key card at them and said "Fine try this one". We won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Comp rooms are not always the best!”
Reviews.Author: metisdeb
Reviews.Content: I usually get comped to stay at Harrah's and again this year got 4 nights, which was very much appreciated. Of course, I could have kept my gambling money in my pocket and stayed at a very classy place, but that wouldn't be Vegas now would it! I called ahead and requested adjoining rooms due to my stepdad being handicapped. I was assured this would happen, but it did not. The handicapped room was on floor 10 and my room as on the 23rd floor, and we needed to take two different elevators to get to the rooms. So much for accommodating handicapped people! The room on the 23rd floor was supposed to be much nicer, with a flat screen TV and big shower & soaking tub, but it looked exactly the same as the other room. I was very disappointed. I will seriously consider paying for my rooms in the future and going somewhere nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: ohioguy0301
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned from Harrah's a few days ago. We had a 4 night stay which included a weekend. Our flight was great, took a cab to the hotel. Check in was very fast, but there were only maybe 2-3 people in front of us. The day we left there were many folks at the checkin counter so its just hit and miss. We booked the room thru a vacation site. At the counter upon check in I asked if there was a room available that had a view of the mirage's volcano and was told we could either have a king bed or the view. i didnt ask for any upgrades so i am not sure what we could have done - we got a room with a king bed, but a bad view. The bed was nice and comfortable, the shower and bathroom area was fine, nothing fancy (didnt expect it to be). The a/c was a bit loud when you first entered the room, its because they auto shut off the air when you leave the room. so when you first get there it blasts the air to get back to your temp. You just had to put up with it for about 10-15 mins before it became not so loud. As far as the room goes, the most out of date item was the tv. I'm sure the tv was pretty sweet, back in 1990. Considering how cheap lcd's are, to put small ones in the room would not cost very much. Of course, they dont want you watching tv in your room in Vegas. The casino part of the hotel was fine - they had acceptable limits on tables for the quality of hotel. Any of the dealers I encountered were polite. The sports book was ok, its not Caesar's but it gets the job done. I had read reviews of how bad the smoke was. My wife is allergic to smoke, and we didnt think it was too bad. We ate at Toby Keith's restaurant a couple times and enjoyed our time there. My wife is a big fan of his and I like a few songs. What makes Harrah's nice is the location. It is simply perfect. Quick walk to Caesars, Mirage, Venetian, Flamingo. You can stay at harrah's and avoid the big prices of staying at caesars or venetian. The monorail comes into the back of Harrah's, just a short walk. We used it to go down to MGM. We are Margaritaville fans and I was there every day for awhile - it is a great place to eat, drink, and gamble. Just nice from harrah's, its a very short walk there. If you are looking for a good, average hotel with a great location Harrah's will do the job. When it was time to leave, we checked our luggage at the 'bags to go' and got on the shuttle for 7 bucks a person to go to the airport. It could not have been any simpler or more worry-free.

Reviews.Title: “A Dump!”
Reviews.Author: gayla
Reviews.Content: Never, never again.....our stay at Harrah's was a big disappointment.....this hotel needs to be torn down. Our room was small, lighting was terrible, felt like I was living in a cave. Smoke permeates everything in the place......has that nasty old bar smell. No WiFi in the rooms and I'm sure if they did it would cost a bundle....guess they want you in the casino. Everything is so over priced....but that is all of Vegas. Drunks roam the halls at night disrupting your sleep....yelling, fighting, and hollering in the hallway. The whole place reminded me of a cheap, old motel....can't compete with the nice places in town.

Reviews.Title: “does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: cantoncross
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here four times now and I'm duty bound to write a review I suppose. I love it at Harrah's. Friendly bar staff (I spend a lot of time here) and down to earth customers. I don't even consider going any where else no.

Reviews.Title: “Good room good price and location”
Reviews.Author: LaLaLisaAnn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we got a good deal with my bf's comp points. Seeing as we spent little time in the room, it was just fine. We had a pool view room in Mardi Gras tower. The only thing that might bother some people is the music from Carnival Court (which is very fun) The only place we ate inside Harrah's was the CKB burger bar. I ordered my burger well done and was cooked to a crisp, but the cheeseburger soup (also available in room service) was great!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: lacottrelll
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for our anniversary in July 2011 on the Mardi Gras side. The location is dead in the center of the strip and is great for the price. There is nothing like stepping out your front door and being in the middle of everything. We purchased the buffet of buffets and ate several meals at the Flavors Buffet. I enjoyed the crab legs, clams, chocolate gelato, and cotton candy the best. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and when I return to Vegas I would love to stay at Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie G
Reviews.Content: This is the best deal in all of Vegas. It is located in the center of the strip, within walking distance or a monorail ride, to most of the popular hotels and attractions. It is also located next to a food court with a McDonalds, Chipotle, Pizza place (that serves single slices) and a Panda Express. Also the hotel next door houses a TicketTonight booth that offers half price tickets to many shows and restaurants. Never pay full price for shows in Vegas unless you are determined to see someone like Celine or Elton who will be sold out months in advance. The room was large, very clean, nicely appointed and the beds were comfortable. We did smell some pot on our no smoking floor but afterall, it's Vegas. The price for Harrahs was much cheaper than the surrounding hotels so it really was bang for the buck. The buffet was well worth it. Show your player's card and you get $2 off per person making it aobut $20 per person for dinner but it had prime rib, crab claws, sushi, high-end desserts, etc. Everything we tasted was delicious. If I had one complaint, it is that there was not free wi-fi. But it is available in the McDonald's next door. There were "pay" internet kiosks everywhere in Vegas where it cost us $7 to print 2 boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: ChilliwackBCFoodie
Reviews.Content: Booked vacation through Alaska Air. Upgraded upon arrival to 8th floor in the Mardi Gras tower. We arrived at 7:30 PM on a Monday; no wait at check in. Two flat screen TV's (one in bathroom). Updated, large room and bathroom, 2 queen beds (on the soft side). We had a balcony overlooking the pool area, towards the strip. The band from the Blvd tent was a little loud but I still slept. Loved no smoking floor. The Premium Club has no membership fee (did not join). Pool was open March 19-23. Flavors buffet excellent. Cave Man show good. Very convenient location in the middle of the strip. Across from the Mirage (crosswalk, not skywalk), and Caesar's. Only surprise; no complimentary WiFi. I read reviews before we left so used McDonald's WiFi next door to the Hotel lobby. NO RESORT FEES

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TCMitchell
Reviews.Content: Harrahs is right in the middle of strip. Can walk either direction for all the excitement of the Strip. We have stayed here 3 times and love the location. They have some of the friendliest staff to help with anything you might need on your stay. Hertz is in the lobby so you can rent a car to explore the outskirts of town. Toby Keiths bar and grill is a great place to eat. The buffet is not that great so I would skip that. Overall this is a great hotel for couples. Not geared for children like some of the other resorts. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: KeithNN
Reviews.Content: I’d only passed through the Casino of this hotel a couple of times on a previous Vegas vacation so when I learned that my tour company had transferred me here from the originally advertised hotel my heart sank. Luckily my misconceptions were proved wrong and I spent a wonderful three nights here! The room was pleasant and very clean, although I did have a faulty bedside lamp and the other one blew a bulb on my second night. I’m sure they’d have sorted it out had I called down but as I spent very little time in the room (apart from sleeping and getting changed) there didn’t seem much point with all the other available lights. The location of the hotel is excellent, right at the heart of The Strip with walking access to a lot of the attractions you’re bound to visit. The rest were easily accessed with a bus stop at the front entrance and monorail station at the rear (however, Harrahs/Imperial Palace has to be the most scariest to access of all the monorail stations for those of us with vertigo!) I didn’t get to see much of the staff so can’t comment on the service, although whenever I passed housekeeping they’d always smile broadly and say hello – something that rarely happened in my other US hotels. The best surprise was free use of the wall safe in my room! At a previous Vegas stay in another hotel this was charged per day so a huge gold star to Harrahs there. Another interesting note, while my mini bar was not stocked due to it being faulty there was a price list on it with some well thought out extras – such as toothbrush/paste, a mini first aid kit, sanitary towels and condom kits – at fairly reasonable prices too. Fortunately I’d read earlier reviews of the hotel and was forewarned about the doors not always closing properly so I’d made it my routine to check with a forceful push when leaving and, on my second time leaving my room for The Strip, discovered the door wasn’t secured. It was the only time it happened but I’m happy I caught it – not sure if this is a quirk of the hotel but it has now become part of my checks at every hotel stay!

Reviews.Title: “lack of communication”
Reviews.Author: bluesman49
Reviews.Content: I was there for a convention in March and when I booked was told the pool may not be open but I could use the sister hotels, then I had walked all the way to Flamingo and told by the security person I could not go in because I was staying at Harrahs, then back to Harrahs and yes he should have let me for a 15.00 charge??? no one knew what was what !

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs is a win !!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: POOLSIDE44
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend stayed at harrahs from March 19-22nd and I was a little nervous about staying here. We normally stay at the Wyndham Grand Desert but from now on we are staying at Harrahs. We booked a classic room for $87.00 for the stay, great price. We upgraded on arrival for an additional $15.00 a night to a deluxe room, mardi gras tower. It was awesome. Nicely upgraded furnishings, very clean and a nice view of the pool and mountains from the little balcony (that was nice, I was able to smoke out there). Service was great all around from the front desk to the waitresses on the casino floor and in KGB restaurant. Great location. The only negative I can think of is the line at the front desk was long. We kept checking back but it never was shorter. I would not hesitate to stay there again and I think it is better than a Holiday INN, I normally stay at a Wyndham, Marriott or the Ritz Carlton when I travel. Although it is not the Ritz I would put the room in a catagory of a Marriott or Wyndham.

Reviews.Title: “Daughter's birthday at the wrong place.”
Reviews.Author: romoanaya
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately this hotel is just not for kids, the decor, rooms, gaming experience and service were all excellent, but nothing to do with your children other than go to the pool (but it was cold that day) Fortunately for us, we were 2 miles south of a kid's place and had to spend our day there and return to our room to rest. What is the worst? the parking experience, which is all the same throughout all the hotels in Las Vegas, and I can't understand why the management at these properties can't realize that this is the first and last impression at their properties for us the clients, and this cause a bad taste even before we get inside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A solid, reliable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PirateChik
Reviews.Content: Time after time, I always end up staying at Harrah's when I visit Las Vegas. I compare all the rates and fees and Harrah's always wins. I love the location, right in the middle of everything going on on the strip, it's right on the Monorail, it's got a shuttle to the Rio (great seafood buffet!) and the rooms cover your needs. We stayed in the Carnival Tower this time and had a view overlooking part of the strip. We could see (and hear and feel) the volcano at The Mirage erupting at night, which was very cool. That being said, I always bring a small white noise machine to drown out unwanted hallway, street and Strip noises so that I can sleep peacefully. The walls are thin and normal voices in the hallway can seem quite annoying. 3 more perks to staying at Harrah's: NO mandatory resort fee! This fee can really add up at the other hotels! And usually it covers services you don't even use! Instead, if you want to use the the internet you get charged for a 24 hr period of about $11.50. The rate is discounted with multiple days. Second- If you drive to Las Vegas, parking at Harrah's is FREE! yeah! Third- you can purchase a Buffet of Buffets pass that lets you eat at about 6 different resort buffets such as Rio, Planet Hollywood, Paris, Ceasars, Harrah's etc as many times as you want in a 24 hr period. This is a great option, especially if you have "super eaters" in your group! You can get this without staying at Harrah's, of course...... The only down side to our stay was that the window overlooking the strip was VERY dirty and kind of ruined our view. But, that's a small thing in the overall review.

Reviews.Title: “Bachelorette party”
Reviews.Author: janipants
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's the week of March 18-22. There was 8 girls in total in our party.. we had 3 rooms between us, 2 double bed rooms and 1 suite. Our suite was great, Huge bathroom for all of us to get ready in, comfy bed and pillows. The pull-out couch wsn't the greatest.. after a few attempts, it was determined the best way to sleep on it was with your head at the opposite end away from the couch. The room was pretty clean, although we did find a stale pretzel on the carpet when we first got there. But not a huge deal. The location was PERFECT. Right in the middle of the strip, with easy access to the monorail, and all the other hotels, restaurants and casinos. The price was great for the location, and the rest of the girls in my party got a late checkout as they had a later flight then I did. This made it easy to hang out by the pool all day and get ready, with somewhere safe to store their luggage. On the Sunday I was the first to arrive, a few hours earlier then my friends, and since the room wasn't in my name, I was worried about checking my luggage, but it wasn't a problem. It was easy to check it in, and then go wander the strip and shop until I left for the airport to meet my friends as they arrived. The bellman was very friendly, even if he did send me to the wrong mall that I wanted to go to.. lol. I would go to Harrah's again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: imeldamks
Reviews.Content: This hotel is overpriced, difficult to maneuver and the air conditioning was awful. The ac fan runs for 30 seconds and kicks off for 30 seconds constantly! After calling the desk to fix it, they sent someone and the issue was still there. Not a great stay. Pool area is in need of MAJOR updating to be on par for the strip. Certainly not worth what we paid for the room!

Reviews.Title: “A++++++”
Reviews.Author: Jumpstart000000
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean hotel. Excellent restaurants, in the middle of the strip. I really didn't need to venture off too far because this place had everthing and great entertainment. Rooms are clean and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “uninspiring hotel”
Reviews.Author: joevincent
Reviews.Content: All right, the room and the bed were basically okay, large and comfortable, but the hotel itself is uninspiring. You have to go through casinos to enter or leave many hotels, but Harrah's tops the others. The whole first level is nothing but casino, and a rather loud smoky one as well. The pool isn't particularly grand or fun, and it closes around 5 or 6 PM (in March). You usually have to wait in line to check in or out. No free wi-fi. I had read reviews on trip advisor, so our room was at least quiet. It was up high and on the other side from the incredibly loud outdoor party area in front. Most frustrating was that it was impossible to adjust the temperature in our room in any meaningful way. The thermostat seemed to ignore whatever setting you gave and just blew out air endlessly at whatever fixed temperature it had. Our room was too hot initially, so we had them come up and adjust the system. At that point it blew out cold air and got the room very cold by morning. I called them back the next evening, and they said I had a choice of too hot or too cold, with the air coming out either way at a fixed temperature. He suggested too cold, because you could always just shut it off manually , which I did in the middle of the night. Still, is it too much to want a heating cooling system you can set to a particular temperature, rather than one that blows out air constantly at either too high or too low a temperature? That doesn't seem too much to ask for a hotel in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Solid standby choice”
Reviews.Author: jaumeAlaska
Reviews.Content: Compared to the newer properties on the strip, Harrahs is a bit dated. The rooms are not large and not totally sound proofed. But you can get a good price there so I had no objection to the deal in terms of price to value. If you want a fancy room, or to be in the hotel with the best shows, or the best visual effects, then Harrahs is not your choice. If you like me, want a place to sleep that is proximate to the other offerings on the Strip, and a friendly place to gamble should the fancy strike you, then Harrahs is a fair deal and a pleasant place to be, with a courteous staff, fair minimum bet tables (at least for the Strip) and reasonable meals, even if not gourmet themed. i will note my contining objection to paying for internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected !”
Reviews.Author: Deborah C
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 2 night stay at Harrah's in the Mardi Gras Tower. We had 2 nites comped for a classic room--but we paid the $15 per nite for a Deluxe room with Queen pillow-top mattresses (very comfy!). Room was clean, comfortable--main complaints--poor water pressure for shower and dim lighting in bathroom--They could take down smaller flat-screen TV in bathroom and replace with a lighted make-up mirror ! Bathroom is too small for a TV anyway ! Casino was clean--NOT smokey--great selection of slots and table games--Carnival Court was always hopping--live music--cheap food ! Will stay there again--location can't be beat & easy to go over to Imperial Palace to Hash House A-Go-Go---which is a great place to eat !

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Hula324
Reviews.Content: I've gone to Las Vegas several times and stayed in several different hotels and I've never had anyone steal from my hotel room...will, there is a first for everything, right? I went to Vegas for my nephew's wedding. I was out of the hotel room early in the day and by 3 pm, I was coming back to my room and the hotel maid had just finished cleaning my room. I went in and dropped off somethings and plugged in my Samsung Galaxy Tablet. I took a look around and then walked out of the room, being sure to make sure the heavy door closed shut. When I returned to my room at 11 pm, my tablet was gone, along with the charger. I called the hotel security and they were very helpful and took a report. I have enjoyed staying at Harrah's, but, I'm not certain I will book another night with them. Its a little disconcerting to know that someone was able to get into my room and take something that didn't belong. So, what did I learn? Most rooms have safes, from now on, I will place ALL my valuables within the safe and not leave something charging (like my phone) when I'm not in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Brian H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my lady for four nights in March 2012. The location is perfect, right in the middle of the strip. The accommodations are fair, but good enough for basic sleeping quarters. We had a room overlooking the strip, which was nice. Beautiful view of the mountains as well. Smoke doesn't normally bother us, but it was a little overwhelming in the casino. Not that everyone was chain smoking, but they can't seem to get the smell out at all. If you are overly sensitive to cigarette smoke, you might want to find another location. Staff was very courteous and helpful, room was good sized and well-maintained, beds were soft and comfy. Had one issue with the TV remote when we checked in (dead battery), and a maintenance guy brought a new one up within ten minutes. Not that I went to Vegas to watch TV in my hotel room, but I need a little sportscenter at the start and end of my day. Overall, it met our needs for a place to crash.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas get away”
Reviews.Author: bonaire07
Reviews.Content: We have been to Vegas many times and the last two times we have stayed at Harrah's. The rooms were great and clean. We were very pleased with the hotel staff and love the Casino. The pool was very disappointing. It is small with hardly any shade, because of the building on all sides you don't get much of a breeze. Our last trip was in March and the pool wasn't open so it didn't matter. We will stay there again when it's not pool season.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: odonogeezer
Reviews.Content: booked 3 nights with last minute.com deluxe room with free breakfast,when checking in we asked about breakfast were told there was no free breakfast deals but it was $9 each to spend in starbucks which would get us a coffee and a biscuit !!we then went to the room we dropped the cases and went out to eat,returned late went straight to bed,in the morning after opening the blinds i looked on the floor to find a potato chip,some toe clippings,but even worst a tablet! we went to reception they said they would send a cleaner up we said that was not happy with the room and we would like to be moved.after showing photos to a manager we were upgraded to a suite and given $60 credit to spend in the hotel,much better room, $60 did not cover a meal for 2 upstairs in bar grill restaurant but it was better then nothing,house keeping came to room in the afternoon we explained we had just come to the room and it did not need cleaning,next morning went out for the day returned late at night,and yes you guessed the room had not been serviced,we gave up!! checked out in the morning,will we return never!!!

Reviews.Title: “Reduce Quality and call it 'Going Green'”
Reviews.Author: aykayeh
Reviews.Content: Harrah’s We were here because it was the hotel for the conference we attended. Having never stayed there we thought it worth a try. We have been on other occasions to the Luxor, and the Paris, both of which were terrific. Harrah’s not so terrific. Things are tough all over, especially in Vegas it seems. The conference rate was $119, which when we booked seemed acceptable. Had to arrive one night earlier though, when the conference contract rate was unavailable. The rack rate for the extra night was $39.00. Rates on hotels are a crapshoot it seems, so be sure to look round carefully. Before heading off to Vegas I got an email from Harrah’s offering me an ‘upgrade’ to a ‘Luxury’ room for $15. Not knowing what that was I called them. At first they said it was a luxury room. But what does that mean I asked. Well, it’s on a higher floor with a view of the Strip. And is it bigger? No. More luxurious? No. have a Jacuzzi? No. It’s just not staring at a wall or a parking lot, it has a view. So we went with it and the view was fine. There was a little sign in our room that advised us to consult the ‘Guest Service Directory’ for telephone charge information. After making many inquiries it finally was revealed that there is no such animal. Somebody at the Information desk tore off a page map for me when I asked, so I could find my way to various places. She finally told me that when the hotel ‘went green’ the directory was discontinued. What does that mean, I asked, going green? Surely you’ve heard of the problems with the economy, I was informed, not very pleasantly. So green means cutting corners and claiming it is a virtuous thing one has done. Information goes first its seems, so be prepared to ask a lot of questions. The hotel advertises itself as having ‘no resort fees’ and one needs to know what that euphemism means. We went to the exercise room and were told that indeed there were no resort fees, but there was usage charge of from $10 to $25 per day. I asked at the front desk about this, and was told that some hotels build in a resort charge of up to $40 or $50, even if one does not use the gym etc. This fine establishment does not do that, but charges on a per use basis. Check out Harrah’s rates; they vary from $35 to $250. ‘No resort fees’ doesn’t seem to mean anything. Now, to be fair, the hotel was clean enough, the housekeeping person was fine and the room got made up regularly. The casino is ok if not great go visit the Venetian and Palazzo right next door. The barkeeper in the Palazzo turned off one of the hundred tv’s featuring March madness and found the Penguins/Rangers hockey game for us. Now for that kind of friendly service I’d stay in Vegas—just at some other hotel next time. One with a free gym. I mean $25 to sweat in a small mirrored room?

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: AshleyBL
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Easy to navigate in all the chaos of Vegas, very nice and comfortable. It helped make my first trip to Vegas a huge success. It was affordable and in a pretty decent location...somewhat in the center of a lot of things. I would definitely stay there again, and plan to soon. Oh, and the Pina Coladas at Numb bar were awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Mongrel08
Reviews.Content: I attended a seminar hosted by a professional association that was held at Harrah's. This was my first time in the hotel. Overall, it was a disappointing experience. I checked in around 10:30 PM on a Sunday night after taking a flight from the east coast. There are fourteen stations where you can be checked in, but only four clerks were working. The line was pretty long and contained many students on spring break. Check-in took almost 30 minutes, most of which was time spent waiting in line. The room I booked was not the one I received. I was placed in the Carnival Tower, which was supposed to be the quieter one. The room was offered at a corporate rate of $109 per night. Instead of one king size bed, I got a room with two queen sized beds. The rooms are very dated, soundproofing isn't very good (I could clearly hear conversations in adjacent rooms) and there are some amenities missing. There was no refrigerator in the room, nor was there any kind of hotel directory. If I wanted a room with a refrigerator, I could get an upgrade, for a price, of course. There is no wireless internet access in the hotel room which I had. Quite surprising since even places like La Quinta offer free wireless access. Perhaps it is available in other rooms, but internet access cost around $12 per day (wired connection, CAT-5 cable in room). The bathroom didn't have a ventilation fan. The fixtures are new, but there is no way to get rid of the steam from the shower or other bathroom odors. Access to the health club costs $20 per day if you go before 4:00 PM or is $10 after that. It closes at 7:00 PM so don't plan on a late evening workout. There is smoking allowed in the hotel and casino, and the smell of smoke is everywhere. Even in a non-smoking room, it can still be detected. It's very bad on the casino floor. Windows in the room are not very kid-friendly.
