The lower portion of the window opens into the room (see photos below) and there is no screen or guard on the outside. When the window is open, the gap isn't large enough for an adult to easily slip through, but a child could fit. Quite a scary thought when you are 23 floors up. If you are bringing small children, look someone else. For the positives, the room was clean, the bed was comfortable, the staff friendly and the location very good. You can get to just about anywhere on the strip as there is a monorail station at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “smokiest hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: rebelface1
Reviews.Content: ok.. so if you want a cheap hotel on the strip. this is the one for you. the rooms aren't bad, service is just ok..and if you like cigarette smoke this is the place for you!. seriously i am allergic to cigarette smoke and i had to run from he elevator to the front door because i felt like i was going to throw up!.. the ventilation is terrible. as for the plus side... well the spa was ok and the massage i had was really nice!

Reviews.Title: “Lux upgrade???”
Reviews.Author: yakywally
Reviews.Content: $15 luxury upgrade was a disappointment. Hotel is showing its age. Pillow-top mattresses and plasma TV does not make this room luxurious. These are normal amenities in updated hotels. We were told they overbooked the "Lux" rooms. Would move us in to a different "Lux" room after 2 nights. Same disappointments, different room. Opted for the King bed, instead of 2 doubles. Room was very small. Worn-out beds considered to be pillow-top. Housekeeping did a good job, though. Keep your $15, and ask not to be on Carnival Court side.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: CJSYD
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed ast Harrahs and it was good value for money. Sure, the TV is old and not a flat screen and internet costs about $11 a day, but parking is free. There are plenty of lifts so the most you would wait is a few seconds to a half a minute at most. We didn't use the breakfast vouchers at all as it is only for a coffee and pastry at Starbucks inside the casino, so we went elsewhere as the lines were long and there were few tables. Check-in took forever, about 30 - 40 minutes standing in line, it was the same at checkout, more staff on the counters would be better. The rooms were okay, not exactly 5 star, but okay all the same with blackout curtains to enable a sleep in if needed. We would stay there again as it is ideally located with a monorail stop at the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Stolen laptop - hotel management's fault”
Reviews.Author: Margaret L
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Harrah’s hotel Las Vegas for 3 nights. The first two nights were fine. The third night (March 14,2012), was horrible. My Macbook got stolen and for sure it was the housekeeper’s fault. On the 3rd day, Wednesday, we left the hotel about 1:30 pm to go eat and start our day. We left the room messy. When we got back to the hotel, at 10 pm, we thought to ourselves that the housekeeper didn’t come in as the pillows were on the floor. But when we looked to the bathroom, there were fresh towels and everything. The beds were obviously made, as there were new comforters (we had a child with us and he spilled chocolate milk all over the comforter). We then thought that maybe the housekeeper didn’t finish doing the beds and then left. We didn’t think too much about the pillows and went ahead and did other stuff. When I was ready to get ready for bed, around 12am, I was getting my clothes from my luggage, and my laptop was gone! My laptop was safely hidden inside my luggage. My laptop was inside a laptop sleeve and that laptop sleeve was inside a blue bag and that blue bag was inside another laptop bag and that laptop bag was inside my luggage. The luggage was even at the very far back with other luggage in front. I cannot believe that someone would actually take something from inside the luggage. It’s not like I had my laptop laying around visibly. We immediately called the front desk to tell them and they sent a security officer to our room. We told him what went down and all he can say was they will investigate and we should call a 1800 number for the results on Tuesday, March 20,2012. It takes them about a week to investigate and they didn’t even do any immediate actions. The security officer even complained that our room was all the way in the 11th floor and that his office was at the basement and it’s inconvenient for him to go up and down. There’s an elevator for god’s sakes. The hotel has no CCTVs. What if something worse were to happen… then they wouldn’t know because there are no security cameras. For sure that it was the housekeeper’s fault because before leaving we already noticed the doors not being locked well. When you close the door, it would seem that it is already locked but it really isn’t locked unless you pull it harder. Another evidence that it was the housekeeper’s fault is because the beds were somewhat made. And so, they were the last one to enter the room. I seriously despise this hotel and their staff. They weren’t even accommodating to our needs. I already filed a police report stating the incident. Now we still need to wait until Tuesday to hear from the hotel. I uploaded a video of how the door was defective. You can see what I meant of it not closing or locking well. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a_huez_uZnM&feature=youtu.be

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Krissy1320
Reviews.Content: This was first visit to Las Vegas in many years. I chose Harrah's because of the price and the location in the center of the strip. I found the rooms to be very clean and the staff to be friendly and helpful. One of the best things I liked about this hotel was the fact that it was not so huge as some of the others and if I wanted to go down to the lobby for something it wasn't a big deal, I could down and back up in a matter of 5 minutes instead of a 30 minute hike like some of the others. The employees in all of the restaurants were nice and efficient, especially Rudy at the buffet. He seemed to know what we wanted before we even asked and would bring it right away. I also liked the fact that even though I am only a Platinum total rewards member which at Ceasars in Windsor means nothing, at Harrahs you had special lines for check in and special treatment at the buffet (no waiting in the regular line and special seating and they even had champagne for us when we went to lunch) Sure you could spend a lot more money to stay at some of the fancier hotels but how much time do you actually spend in your room other than to sleep which in Vegas you don't do much of that anyway. If you have high expectations of living the life of luxury for your trip then no this is not the place for you but if you are looking for a nice clean room where the staff always says hello and the location was perfect then give it a try. I wasn't disappointed and will stay there again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money, clean”
Reviews.Author: Johanh83
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights for about $40 room/night, had a pretty good stay. Hotel is in the middle of the strip, so location is very good. We had the classic rooms, which offered plenty of space and were clean as far as I could see. Shower didnt have much water pressure, but ah well. We had the free breakfast, which is basicly a $9 value at the local starbucks every morning. We didnt use it because the lines were very long, so I recommend to not take the free breakfast into account when considering this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL GREAT-FOOD NO”
Reviews.Author: SNAKEBIT715
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Harrahs on 2/26/12-3/1/12. Staff was great, casino ok but need some lower limit table games, $10.00 min. is not for average traveler. The buffet was decent if it was priced like they used to be at around $5.99 but not worth $20.00. We went next door to McDonalds and fed all 5 of us for around $40.00. Toby Kieth bar was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good value at a great location on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: bandsinger
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I travel to Vegas annually, and we have stayed at many different hotels, but this year we returned to Harrah's for the first time in about 10 years. The price was right (comped) and the room was fine. We were on the 23rd floor of the Mardi Gras Tower and it was very quiet. We had a diagonal view of the strip and that meant we could watch the Mirage volcano in the evening. The room was nothing special, but it was clean and comfortable. As for the casino, we found it small and very smoky. The newer casinos with the higher ceilings do a much better job at keeping the gambling areas ventilated, but Harrah's is older, and we left the casino each evening smelling strongly of smoke. We enjoyed the gaming though, and found that we were able to win on a consistent basis. We also liked the restaurants in the hotel, and particularly enjoyed the Starbucks right at the bottom of the elevator (on two different floors) for that morning jolt of caffeine. Harrah's occupies a great spot on the strip. It is right in the middle of our favorite series of casinos (Venetian, Mirage, TI, Caesars) and it's easy to cross the strip right in front of the hotel since Las Vegas Blvd. narrows to just a few lanes there. (No dashing across 12 lanes of traffic while the electronic sensor counts down!) Overall, our trip was a success. If you are looking for a smaller casino at a great price, and you intend to use it as a home base while cruising the strip, then Harrah's is a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Vegas Experience!”
Reviews.Author: SCNR
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight on 3/15. We were already satisfied because we had gotten a good deal for a luxury room, but was just tickled pink when we were upgraded to a suite in the Canaval Tower. We were on the 30th floor and had a remarkable view of the strip. The room was beautifully furnished. The staff was very professional and courteous. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned”
Reviews.Author: budra
Reviews.Content: This is my first time in Las Vegas and the conference I'm attending got us a group rate at Harrahs. The hotel then offered an upgrade to a "luxury" room for an extra $15 so I took it. My room is not what I would call luxurious: nice bed, a small round table and a couple of chairs. That's it. No desk, no arm chairs, no kettle. The decor looks 1970s to me: beige trim, odd chairs. One of the doors on the TV cabinet is off its hinges. The TV itself is an old tube model. Not exactly HD. Having said that, the room IS quiet. That's partly because I'm on the top floor (which I recommend -- there's a lot of noise and music on the street). And the housecleaning has been very efficient. The casino is busy, and there are a number of restaurants and bars, some of which have daily line-ups so they must be doing something right. Final thoughts? I got a good price for a "luxury" room, so I'm happy. If I had to pay the regular price for his room, I'd be less so. Luxurious it ain't; it's just comfortable and bland.

Reviews.Title: “not clean”
Reviews.Author: hout5600
Reviews.Content: I stayed there Jan. 5-9, 2012, the rooms are old an stale. I found dried fecies on the back of the toilet while taking a bath. This was really awful. they moved us to another room, but we had been there 3 day already. the first night I woke up with hives on my arm. told the manager about this. barley got an apology. Had to go to the doctor get medication to clear. I will never stay at Harrah's Las Vegas again, they have the worst managers I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, just the basics!”
Reviews.Author: AVN_24
Reviews.Content: The only reason I gave it 3 because it's clean. No frills, not even a coffee pot.But from what I hear from other Veges guests none of the hotels give you anything. Be sure to get a Totals membership card before checking in especially if early. It will save you about 40 minutes waiting in line and a $15 early check-in fee. None of the restaurants are exciting just basic food overpriced. For the most part everyone working there is friendly and the Hotel is located in the middle of the strip. If you want a view be sure ask what you will be looking at, our view was the top deck of the parking lot. Thank God they had very good blackout curtains!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room!”
Reviews.Author: MelfromTO
Reviews.Content: The location of Harrah's cannot be beat. You are next door to all of the major strip hotels. Check-in took loooooong, they could stand to add some extra staff during peak times. The staff were all friendly, and the room was clean. We were in the Carnaval tower in a King room. The AC wasn't working properly when we arrived, but a quick call to the front desk and 10 minutes later a very courteous repairman knocked on our door and all was fixed in a matter of minutes. The room was not a renovated room, but was well appointed and met our needs perfectly. the Carnaval court noise did not effect us, nor did we hear any noises from other rooms. There was one oddity in our room though, the shower curtain didn't go to the end of the tub, so it was kind of cool when you took a shower. Overall a fantastic stay and we had no complaints! For the price you pay to stay at Harrah's it just may be the best choice in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Smokey, slow, old”
Reviews.Author: D H
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so bad I had to write a review. Check-in took over 40 minutes in line with only 6 people in front of us. The lobby and entire first floor, including elevators, are so smokey that we will never return. They must have NO ventilation! We don't smoke so it was a nightmare. Our 8 year old walked around with his shirt over his nose and mouth just to breathe. Our suite had floor to ceiling windows but the curtain valences are hung at about a 5' high level so you couldn't see out without lifting them up and walking under them -totally bizarre - kind of like living on the set of Being John Malkovich (1999). The cafe downstairs - again - lines took FOREVER just to be seated and don't be hungry. Food took 45 minutes minimum to arrive. And if you buy a bottle of wine in the shop, buy an opener. No openers in the rooms, room service won't bring one and the restaurants charge $25 to open your wine, even though you bought it in the store at Harrah's! There is not ONE reason to stay at Harrah's with all the choices of nice hotels in Vegas! Stear clear!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: São Fidélis, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: Laura Calomeni M
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the price! Across the street from the Cezar´s! Fast check in, Clean, nice buffet, great space! Worth every penny spent. The free breakfast is just a coupon for Starbucks (bage and coffee), but most of the Vegas hotel don´t offer breakfast anyways. I enjoyed very much and plann on going back!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Value, Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeccaLandeg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated right in the heart of the strip. The room that we had booked was a standard room and consisted of 2 double beds. The hotel also had a few restaurants, 2 Starbucks and a shop. It was exceptional value for the money we paid. I would definately go again!!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Not The Best”
Reviews.Author: m3montana
Reviews.Content: Long lines to check in, long lines at total rewards desk, speed dials on phone to call for service didn't work so had to call housekeeping and ask them to transfer. There was a small piece of plastic on the bathroom floor when I checked in that stayed there all week, telling me they didn't mop. Coffee pot dirty, I washed myself but the maid didn't always replenish the coffee packets. Casino very smokey. No attendant in spa. I was there for five days and paid for an upgrade to the Mardi Gras Tower but they put me in a room by the noisy elevators with a view of the hvac system on the roof. I've stayed with Harrahs in the past and enjoyed it, but it has really gone down hill. This wasn't an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “just got back from first trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Sandra S
Reviews.Content: The hotel and casino are good. The casino is a bit confusing the first day, especially since we were new to Vegas. Check in went slow and was busy, we were not given our reserved room. When we got to our room it had not been vaccuumed. The people working in the hotel are not very friendly, The most pleasant are the housekeepers! The Wyndman Resort employees are like vultures at the entrances and all their locations. Found them to be pushy and in my face:( Hard time getting to consierge because of these people. No one willing to help with information about their facility or how to utilize Vegas. The staff in Toby Keith's gift shop were complete idiots...after 25 minutes to check out we walked out without our merchandise. Get a rewards card right away, they do have advantages. The Flavors buffet is awesome. Go there at 2:50 and pay lunch prices, at 3 they switch to the dinner menu which includes prime rib, etc so you are getting a great meal at a great price! See Dave the Caveman and Improv...both are great!

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's-GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: CCRManitoba
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights at Harrah's with girlfriends. Awesome central location!! Booked through Westjet-so my rooms weren't comped. When we arrived I asked for a Total Rewards upgrade (as promised by the manager). Our "upgraded" room was conveniently located on the 6th floor of the MardiGras Tower (rm 616). The view was of the heating/cooling ducts which were noisy and the room was right next to the elevator-also noisy. Room did have very comfortable pillow top mattresses on the beds, 2 TV's (one in bathroom), small balcony, coffee maker & mini fridge...but not worth the "upgrade" for the terrible view and noise! Toby Keith's restaurant located in the hotel was great...as was the cafe! There is a Starbuck's in the lobby as well. Pool was open and there were plenty of lounge chairs. Comfortable, clean hotel in a great location. Would STRONGLY recommend seeing the DEFENDING the CAVEMAN show at Harrah's! Hotel price was right! Rooms from Sun-Thurs were about $35 a night!

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the strip location”
Reviews.Author: PandK09
Reviews.Content: Great location, right in the middle of the strip. We had a one bedroom "executive" room. Very nicely furnished and plenty of room. We ate one morning at the buffet. It's a little pricy unless you can use Total Rewards points to minimize the cost. Food selection was good and there were plenty of selections. Everyone working at the hotel seemed to be very pleasant. Great service.

Reviews.Title: “Another great vacation at harrahs”
Reviews.Author: Gerry-ped.
Reviews.Content: I had a solo six night stay in early Feb. had reservations for Deluxe room. (comped 5 nights, and paid for 6th) but think I got a regular room instead. Had a coffee pot, so i was ok with that. Room was 2543, in the Carnival wing, and had a great view of the Mirage Volcano. I have stayed here several times in the last few years, and never have had a bad experience. Great comfortable bed, room very clean and bathroom great. Shower pressure great, and plenty of towels, etc. Housekeeping is always fantastic at harrahs, cheerful, very helpful if you need anything. had some luck on the slots at harrahs, so made my trip more enjoyable!! CW. frequent, never had to wait long for service. (always tipped, even if only getting water) So love having 2 starbucks on site. (one up stairs is never very busy) Ate at the Buffet a few times for breakfast. A little dissappointed with temp of food, cold before I even got back to my table. And didn't seem to have the quantity of items that I remember from last trip. but I never tried it for lunch or dinner. Ate one dinner on Italian night at the Cafe (not sure of name). Great service, and enjoyed the food (I had the spagetti and meatballs) Huge serving, Way too much for one person. Used room service 2 times. Great quality of food, and plentiful. Always arrived before promised time, hot and tasty One comment on the elevators, there are separate ones for certain floors, one for up to 16th(I think) and another for the higher floors, so i don't think I ever waited longer than a few minutes for an elevator all the time I was there. Harrahs is a very comfortable hotel/casino, not huge like some and easy to navigate. Close to strip, next to Venetian, Accross from Mirage, Caesars, so easy to navigate to other places. Everyone from desk clerks, housekeepiing, CW, security, etc. were pleasant, helpful and never minded answering questions. I would definitely recommend harrahs, and i will return!!!

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: islandon
Reviews.Content: At $50 a night this was a steal. Immaculate rooms, great buffet, central location. Loved it. Did not win in the Casino. Guess they have to make up for the cheap room prices!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - cheap rooms - OK overall”
Reviews.Author: RayTheNaturePhotoGuy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 days in Vegas. We stayed at Harrah's for the first time based on feedback from various TA reviews. With a little effort we were able to get our rooms for about $23 per night including all taxes/fees - allowing us to spend our money on some awesome shows. There are a lot of complaints from other TA reviewers about having to pay extra if you check in early. So, DON'T check in early! We arrived at the hotel before 10am and if we had checked in it would have cost an extra $25. Instead, we simply checked in our bags (free), completed our preliminary paperwork (locking in the best available room early), then we explored part of the strip in 70 degree sunshine, ate lunch, took advantage of a timeshare presentation (separate review) to get ourselves several free show tickets, a $50 visa card, and a free 5-couse Italian dinner (salmon & pasta which was very good). We stayed out until almost midnight THEN we finished checking into the hotel when there were no long check-in lines (another common complaint by other TA reviewers). The room was in the Carnival Tower and when we did our preliminary check-in I specifically requested a refurbished non-smoking room with a king bed on a floor that was NOT pet friendly (based on other TA reviews - great advice). We were on the 17th floor and there were no barking dogs and no obvious smoking odors (unlike almost everywhere else in Vegas). The room was quite large, the bed was reasonably comfortable, we achieved decent sleep when we decided to stop for a rest, the bathroom was large and clean, and the shower head had multiple settings with plenty of water pressure. All in all, especially considering that we paid less than $23 total per night, Harrah's met our needs for this quick trip. The location on the strip was very good - a little south of the Venetian complex which has many interesting things to see, like a very nice simulated Venice setting complete with real canals and gondola boats that you can ride if you choose. The grand entry has very high hand painted ceilings that remind one of Michael Angelo's works in Italy. There are shops galore and numerous restaurants to enjoy, including the Italian (of course) "outdoor patio" place named Tintoretto that we enjoyed our free dinner at. One of the free shows (another gift for enduring the timeshare presentation) that we attended was at the Venetian (Blue Man Group). Just to the south of Harrah's is Caesar's Palace then the Belagio - where they put on an awesome lighted dancing water fountain display set to music several times each evening (free). Right across the street from Harrah's is the Mirage where you can watch a simulated volcano erupt (blasts of water lighted to the color of molten magma along with huge natural gas fired flames and fire balls). This too is free to observe from the street or as we did, from the elevated vantage point on the front of the Venetian entryway. My one rather significant complaint about the hotel - which is true for many Las Vegas hotels except for some of the newer places - is the extremely poor ventilation in and around the casino and the hotel lobby. One must walk through the casino every time that you want to head out to the strip for a walk to a show, a meal, or whatever else you want to do.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: fozb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Harrah's last week for two nights. Harrah's has a fantastic location on the strip and while the hotel is certainly dated - I was given a nice remodeled room in the Carnaval tower -and I ended up paying only $30 per night! The ventilation is not very good in the casino compared with some of the newer hotels - however I wasn't there very long. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay here is the REAL DEAL on this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: spachick
Reviews.Content: This hotel has got the biggest yet most ingenious scam running. They charge for almost everything. So you get in kinda early to this hotel, you're tired, you're weak and you just want to lie down. To check in early they charge $25. That's why when you walk in at about 11ish you see a crowd of people waiting in the lobby. It's free to check in with some type of member after 12 noon. Then you join YET ANOTHER LONG LINE out the door to check in again. Lesson - Book Your Flights to arrive in the afternoon. Now if you get the wrong room (and yes I was in the Mardi Gras tower) and you are coffee drinker, you are going to see a trail in the morning of folks with McDonald's Coffee cups in their hands because you may be gifted with a room without a coffee maker. And if you are - you are supplied with the cheapest coffee no name brand around. Lesson - choose another hotel or room that has a coffee maker. If you like to sleep - forget about it, the walls are paper thin. No free high speed internet. Overall, the only way I would stay at this smokey casino filled hotel is if I were paid for it. Never again - you lost me.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Stephen M
Reviews.Content: When in Vegas this is one of the places I often stay. I love the location and I find the rooms to be nice if a bit on the small side. Some of them are really nice and you may even get a TV in the bathroom if you are lucky. It is easy to get in and out of this casino and to the garage. I recommend Harrah's if you want a mid level hotel with a great location that is easy to get in and out of (as many of them are not).

Reviews.Title: “Best place stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Teresa H
Reviews.Content: My husband, sister and brother-in-law checked in early evening and had asked for an adjoining room in the remodeled tower when calling in the day before with a reservation. Bryant wasn't for sure if he had any adjoining rooms left and must have seen the disappointment on our face, he said he would see what he could do and went back to talk to his supervisor. He came back with the most amazing news ever - they upgraded our room to the VIP Executive Suite!!! "SWEET". I can't say enough great things about Harrahs. Have stayed there twice within about 13 months time and would definitely stay their again! I have to say Mike and Pete are always so accommodating, when lining up our ride to the airport. Thanks Mike and Pete :) Thanks Bryant for making our last night of our vacation the best!!! You were right, we didn't want to leave our room!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Harrah's - No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: berleygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's from Feb. 28 to March 3, 2012. We originally booked a classic room but then got an email stating we could upgrade to a deluxe room with a strip view for $15 more a night, so we did! The view was great and we could see the Mirage volcano right across the street from us. Our room was clean and has no complaints at all! Sure the hotel is not new but we found it to be very good and had everything we needed! I felt safe the entire time, even when hubby and I went our own ways. The hotel location was excellent!! Middle of the strip!! We did not eat at the hotel other than grabbing Starbucks in the morning. The hotel was easy to navigate once we had our bearings - as long as we found "Buck and Winnie", we knew where we were!! We went to the Piano Bar, Toby Keith's and Carnaval Court and had a great time at all places! We gambled til 4 in the morning every night and although did not win much, we still had a good time! We went to Freemont Street one night and also seen Garth Brooks (BEST concert ever!) and Terry Fator (Great show too!) plus did lots of shopping!!. We kept our cash and valuables in room safe and had no problems. I would love to return to Vegas soon and would stay at Harrah's again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in middle of las vegas boulavard!”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey1977
Reviews.Content: Really nice place on las vegas boulavard in the middle of strip! Near monorail near our convention at Sands Convetion center! Highly recomended!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a little worn and in need of an internal facelift.”
Reviews.Author: BKO57
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few nights during a conference. What is good is the location which is central, and the rooms are large with the usual large US style beds. The carpets and furnishings were old - and while the room was clean, the corridor carpets were dirty and a little musty. The bathroom was a good size but again dated fittings. This is a casino hotel so to get anywhere means walking through gaming tables etc.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Harrahs”
Reviews.Author: JofromWales
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights between the 6th-10th Feb. Checked in on a Monday at 6pm. Very busy check-in with a long line, waited about 15 minutes. Very friendly lady at the counter. Had reserved a King non-smoking deluxe room and that is exactly what I got. I was advised that my room may experience some carnival court noise but that was not a problem. Was allocated room 411 in the Mardi Gras tower. Room was exactly as described, very clean and comfortable. Would have been a pool view had the pool been open. Nice flat screen tv in the bedroom and bathroom. Coffee machine in bathroom and housekeeping left plenty of coffee supplies. Bed was very comfy with plenty of pillows. Basic tv channels but enough to keep me occupied. Just love Fox Vegas News in the morning!! In my 4 night stay I only heard music very faintly on one evening, did not bother me at all and certainly did not go on late. Housekeeping was great, left plenty of towels etc every day. Of course the best thing about Harrahs is the location. So easy to get around the strip, and very quick to get from room to Strip. Mcdonalds, Panda express, mexican and pizza place next door which is handy for a snack to take back to your room. Starbucks by the front desk for your morning coffee and pastry. Small liquor shop which is useful to buy wine/beer/snacks etc. Prices not too bad. Huge variety of slots to play, and drink service was good with friendly waitresses. Ate in the coffee shop for breakfast and for the Italian night. Food tasty with good service. Use your Total Rewards card for a discount. Saw the Mac King show which I would recommend. Asked the concierge for help with booking Rugby 7s tickets but she was unable to help as they were using an outside supplier, but did give me toll free number to call. Slept well, hardly any outside noise and no hallway noise. Never had to wait more than 1 minute for an elevator and felt safe in this hotel at all times. Yes Harrahs may be old but she is an excellent choice for a stay right in the middle of the Las Vegas strip. I would def stay again, but only in a deluxe room. Jo

Reviews.Title: “old”
Reviews.Author: gogramy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. The carnaval tower, 18th floor is where we were assigned. We made the reservation 4 months ago. Our room was run down, torn carpet, dust in the air vent and cob webs and dust behind the bedside tables. It was hard to sleep in it because of the affects on our allergies. We did finally complain on the 3rd day and was moved to the 16th floor where the room was in better shape and the tv much newer. The casino is very smokey also. We should have spoken up earlier.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: FDCPinto
Reviews.Content: Went to Las Vegas on Business. The hotel is very well situated on the Strip. It's easy to have some fun with out having to call a taxi. The down side is that the hotel is old, the internet some times doesn't work and is quiet noisy (Las Vegas never sleep). It's a regular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, prime location”
Reviews.Author: jeantax10
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 5 days in Vegas stayed at Harrahs, great location and hotel quite nice, lovely rooms but we stayed in the carnival part (for smokers) I dont mind the smell of smoke but the floor we stayed on absolutely stank of "pot" !!!! The rooms where really nice and clean and made up every day, not a good view but then again we weren't in the room for long. We visited most of the other hotels on the strip and to be honest with you they were all the same.... full of fruit machines, bright lights and hundreds of people.. We had a great time in Vegas but once you'd walked up and down "the strip" a couple of times you'd seen everything so I dont think well be going back.

Reviews.Title: “great value and location”
Reviews.Author: sgttrucker
Reviews.Content: I would stay hear again for sure, excellent strip location, clean room made up nicely every day, no strange smells or noises. The view is not great but we were so tired after the days events that the view didnt matter a bit. The best mattresses I have ever slept on. Good breakfast buffet, over priced but a nioce place to relax and get the day organized. Vegas is such a circus. I was nice to have a quiet place to drop back into. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: steelcity1w
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at Harrah's for 3 nights in early February. We were in the Mardi gra tower, 15th floor facing the strip & carnival court. The music was loud until 2-3am, so don't stay on that side if you want to go to bed early. We didn't, so it wasn't a problem. The room was newly remodeled and in great shape. It was clean with a very comfortable bed, flat screen TV, and a tv in the bathroom. Even had a little balcony. Check-in was a little slow. We arrived on a Wednesday afternoon at 4pm, and there was a long line, with only 3 people working the counter. Took about 45 minutes to check in. This was the only complaint I have about the place. Plenty of elevators that were quick. Parking garage was easy to access and was free. The breakfast buffet was excellent, but a little pricey, I think it was @ $18. The location on the stip can't be beat. You right in the middle of it all, and have a tram stop right there. Overall I rate it very good, and would stay here again. Just make sure you ask for a new;y remodeled room when you check in. I booked the cheapest room online, and asked for a new room at check in and got it at no extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Staying here was weirdly satisfying.”
Reviews.Author: chrismcgmcg
Reviews.Content: if you want chaos, it is here not just this hotel but, vegas generally, and they all manage it so well. Great location, and the best bit is the price, but don't be fooled, you have to walk through the casino very step you take, so what you save you spend in the Casino. overall great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's is the best!”
Reviews.Author: Jason J
Reviews.Content: I have an excellent time every time I stay here. The blackjack table are real fun. Most of the hotel workers are extremely helpful. The room rates are low compared to other hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's-good choice”
Reviews.Author: stkitts905
Reviews.Content: We chose Harrah's after reading reviews on trip advisor. We were on the 19th floor in Carnival tower in a non smoking room which was quite large and clean. Hallways also were clean and quiet. Staff was helpful and the location was perfect. We were really taken by the taxi driver at the airport so take the shuttle. Harrah's has a shuttle to the airport for $7.00 straight there-no other hotel stops.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's is great”
Reviews.Author: Melbatoast1950
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at Harrahs many times over the last few years..what impresses me the most is all of the employees are very cordial and are always happy to take care of all your needs and questions, sometimes you go places and by their attitude you are obviously bothering the employees. The location is great and right in the middle of the strip. They have several choices for shows and we have enjoyed all of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: VegasCat15
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before, the rooms are nothing extra special but the location of the hotel is the best part, its basically in the middle of the Strip. This trip we upgrade to a Mini-suite, which was nice but the only difference was it was physically bigger and had a minibar fridge, which we did not use. The bed was super comfy, the alarm clock went off at 7am every day because I didn't know how to turn it off (lol). We like to go to eat at Toby Keith's bar in Harrahs, good southern comfort food. Again, the reason we stay at this particular hotel is the location.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: Rocks_road
Reviews.Content: Harrah's is in the middle of the strip so it's convenient. We had a non-smoking room; it was small but clean and everything worked except the Internet which was a real problem since I was at a convention on business and needed connectivity. The hotel apologized and said a lot of people had the same complaint and there must have been too many people trying to use it. The place is aging but what really bothered me was that you have to find your way through the casino to go anywhere -- It's hard to find the exit to the street! I know the casino is why they exist but I want more than a casino. You can't find a chair unless it's in front of a slot machine. I won't be back to Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: millerb
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in the Mardi Gra Tower--1427--room was clean, two flat screens. Nice view with a small balcony, looking at the pool. Nose was not bad, we did not spend a lot of time in the room.Great location, we only had breakfast at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryCanucks
Reviews.Content: We visited Las Vegas for the first time. We picked this Hotel because of its location. It had a great price and great reviews. We were very happy with what this hotel had to offer and it's location on the strip. The rooms were clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Third visit to a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canuckgem
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Harrahs for the third time Feb 12 to the 17th. When I arrived from my flight at 10:30 pm it was a bit disappointing to have been put into a non-smoking room for the first night as they were out of smoking rooms! Had to arrange to change for the next day. My favourite tower is the Carnaval tower with a classic room. Nothing fancy needed, just a clean, quiet and comfortable room. Even enjoy a mountain view more than a strip view. The first night I amused myself by thinking of all those non-smokers who were stuck in smoking rooms while I was in the non-smoking one. I read so many complaints from non-smokers in that situation. Perhaps if I quit smoking I'll get the classic room I want and not a room in the Mardi Gras tower. The first night view was of the pool with a very small balcony to smoke on. The noise from the Carnival Court was very much present and not appreciated. Other than that it was another great trip. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The casino wasn't too crowded at the times I was awake and once I switched rooms, I was very happy with what I had. The room was very clean and there were plenty of towels etc. I will return to stay again (sometime this year).

Reviews.Title: “great casino host (lg)- so great room!”
Reviews.Author: cottage229
Reviews.Content: just got back and had a fabulous time. room was a suite with a view over ceasar's/strip. clean, safe, had a safe, wouldn't even attempt the huge soaking tub - great walk in shower. oyster bar was great and FRESH. buffet had good clams/crab (little hard to open), prime rib with champagne. already book flight for next time - airline rates will probably be up!! no husslers trying to sell you a "diamond" ring. security abundant. be kind and say thank you - it goes a LONG way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Strip locale but holy SMOKEY”
Reviews.Author: Kimbrahay
Reviews.Content: Central to strip, couldn't be more conveniently located. 't the first room I was given had wet carpeting and no lamps or phones plugged back in after someone cleaned the carpets. I went behind the bed to plug it all back in-and found dirty socks. Gross. Called down, they asked if I wanted a new room (ya think?)-and someone would bring me keys. Ok. The man grunted and handed me keys. I turned around to grab my bag and found another man using his newly given keys to get in the SAME room. I had already said the room was dirty, and I'd washed my face etc already...they were giving my dirty room to another victim. Next room was far better, great view and clean-all this was in Mardi Gras tower. We did have a great dinner at The Range, amazing service. It's just an older hotel, and of course there's smoking everywhere in Vegas. I'm sure you can get a good price on room, but frankly there has to be better choices even if includes a bit of a walk.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at great location”
Reviews.Author: fellowtraveler1962
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights in a luxury room in the Carneval Tower from 2/18 to 2/21. The extra $15 for a view of the Strip and the Mirage volcano was well worth it. The room was smallish but clean and neat, and the bath was spotless and functional, with good water pressure. The temperature control for the room was one of the best I ever experienced -- it was warmer or cooler with just the push of a button. Awesome. Bed was comfortable with nice linens. Housekeeping did a fine job. Had breakfast at the buffet and it was worth the price. Didn't gamble in the casino so can't comment on that. As others have mentioned, this hotel has a prime center-strip location that puts the rest of Vegas within easy reach. I would highly recommend this hotel and will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's is affordable and a great location on the Las Vegas Strip!”
Reviews.Author: BobOakLawn_Illinois
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Harrah's a lot I highly recommend it! They have a great location, a nice atmosphere, a monorail that stops there and a lot to do!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: frieda17
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at Harrah's and was pleasantly surprised at the accommodations. The room was large and the beds were quite comfortable. The bathroom also was large and shower was wonderful. The walk from the room to the front door was quite far and had to walk through the complete casino to get out of the hotel. If you gamble that's okay I guess. To get coffe in the morning was a hastle as there wasn't a coffee maker in the room. Check in and out was swift and painless All in all, good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Smokey and noisy.”
Reviews.Author: Macomfs
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Mardi Gras tower. Noisiest place I have ever been. Bass sounds of casino reverberated through room until after 3:00 AM. Otherwise okay. Meals at Oyster Bar among the best I have had. Ahí salad, linguini with clams with red or white sauce very good and chioppino also good. If you stay here ask not to be above casino but above convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne K
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed 4 four nights - Feb. 14th - Feb. 18th. We arrived really early - 11:00 a.m. and they let us check in right away. Before arriving they emailed us an offer of an upgraded luxury room for $15.00 per night & it had an awesome view of the strip. The rooms are a little small, but how much time are you really going to spend in the room anyway. Great selection of games in the casino, and the waitressess are very efficient in offering beverages while you are playing. Carnival Court is definitely a happening place with bands every day and highly entertaing bartenders. The only improvement we would like to see is maybe a food court type area inside. Doesn't seem like there are a lot of choices of places to eat unless you want to take the time to sit and have a meal. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: KatSchrag
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrahs Jan. 25-30. When we checked into room it was pretty late and it was like 80 degrees in our room. My husband turned it way down to get cool and we headed out. Upon returning to room it was like a sauna on there. We called the front desk, and the nicest man came and fixed it right away. Very prompt!!! I had read in bed bug registry of all the incidents at Harrahs and was actually nervous about it, having experienced it before in a hotel room. I am VERY happy to report that there were no bedbugs to be found...and I did do a thorough search!!! The hotel is in a perfect location and room was a nice size. We did eat at Toby Keith's and it was very good. We had a great time and would definitely stay there again. Great location, great price, nice rooms, comfy beds.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better than this on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: CleopatraBunny
Reviews.Content: We were booked here this past weekend for a conference, and had I not been forced to stay here, I would NOT. It's old and run down, smells of smoke and the check-in line took forever. They know a bunch of people are checking in for a convention but only had 2 people on the desk. I've noticed this with other casino hotels as well - check in takes a really long time!! When we did get to the desk, Stephy was efficient. The room was decent and relatively clean, but watch out for the "exploding" water when you flush the toilet! It soaked the floor and toilet seat - yuck. We upgraded to a "deluxe" room in the Mardi Gras tower that had a view of the ventilation system, and when we opened the window, smelled of fried chicken or some other greasy cooked meat. The meeting rooms were OK - typical of mid-tier convention hotels. And temperature was fine, which is uncommon (most seem to run on the cold side). At check-out, I inquired about printing boarding passes. They do have a kiosk but it costs money to print. When I asked by they didn't offer free boarding passes like most hotels, the clerk responded with a curt, "This is a business, ma'am!" and looked at me like I was trying to rip them off by wanting to print. This last impression sums up the Harrah's approach to customer service: they're running business that doesn't care about customers.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: LORRIANNE_9
Reviews.Content: Just spent four nights a Harrahs, I was a little concerned reading some of the other reviews, but seriously not a thing to worry about. We up graded to the Deluxe room which was still only $65 a night, we were told if we preferred quite to take the Mardi Gras Tower, which we did and It was quiet. The rooms were very nice,remodelled with very nice bathrooms, the beds were awesome, I take my pillow every where with me when I travel, I dont event think I used it. The location is great, right in the middle of the strip. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Honestly I am trying to think of something negative to say.....the internet kiosks in the lobby were slow, the casino is not as well ventilated as some of the newer ones, but its older. I dont smoke and smoke usually really bothers me, but it was fine, yes some of the newer hotels/casinos are better ventilated, this is a nice middle of the road hotel for a decent price. You get what you pay for, in this case I feel we got more than what we paid for. As for some tips, we had a wonderful dinner at Battista's Hole in the Wall and saw a great show, Gordie Brown at the Golden Nuggat in old LV $35 for a very nice buffet and the show, havent laughed that hard in years. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “It is old...”
Reviews.Author: harley01babe
Reviews.Content: I was at Harrah's because that is where my company secured accommodations for scheduled training. Imagine the disappointment when the training was moved from the Cosmopolitan to Harrah's due to lack of attendance. Harrah's casino and lobby areas are old and smell like 100 years of smoke and alcohol. Upon arrival, the front desk personnel were having unpleasant words with a couple of customers and then just simply ignored them. Guess that set the tone. Some areas have had an attempt at a facelift but the infrastructure remains OLD. Room was OK, not the King room as was reserved... not worth the charges. The tub would not drain so I showered with all who had showered before me. I was one floor above the pool deck and the sliding door would not lock. OLD, STINKY, OVER-PRICED... YUK,,,

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charleny A
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Vegas was great. The Harrahs staff was great all around from front desk to valet. It also turned out to be a great deal and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room with a great price!!”
Reviews.Author: R B
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to stay at Harrahs, and we were pleasantly surprised. Our room was very clean with a great, comfortable king bed in the Mardi Gras Tower. The front desk was quick and efficient and we enjoyed the casino. The location is terrific, almost middle of the strip!!! The only negative we had was with a casino cashier that had an attitude. Trying to cash a check was clearly not something she felt like doing, must be too much paper work. Other than that, we would recommend Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: ArcheryFamily-NJ Posted by a Wyndham Hotel Group traveler
Reviews.Content: I really didn't expect much from Harrah's Las Vegas when it came to their rooms. Walking through the casino, it was really loud, crowded, and smokey, a little outdated too, but the rooms were very nice appointed. The bath was more spacious than I expected too. Comfortable and clean. I could hear "bar" noises during the night. I had not looked out the window to see if we were overlooking a lot of outdoor space, but perhaps we were. We were only staying one night. I would consider going back again for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice! You should go their!”
Reviews.Author: Marjorie C
Reviews.Content: We had a king bed room reserved for one night at 45$. They gave us a suite, at the 35 floor! It was awsome! With a vue on the strip! We really enjoy our stay their. Staff was very nice with us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Khatter
Reviews.Content: Just another average strip hotel and nothing fancy. The location is great...kind of in the middle of the strip. Great outdoor bar with flair bartenders.

Reviews.Title: “Great room but....”
Reviews.Author: GWV1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at Harrah's on the Strip in the Carnival Tower. Got a fairly good rate on a "Mini Suite" so we booked 3 nights Harrah's, then 2 nights at the Golden Nugget. First - The Good: We got in around 11 pm Sunday and got checked in quickly and easily thanks to Meshan at the front desk. We've been to Vegas 15 times and she is CLEARLY the best front desk person ever. If I ran a resort, I would definitely try to steal her away - she's pleasant, efficient friendly and cheerful - an amazing person. Room was nice-sized, updated, and very nice. The bed was comfortable, and the rooms were the quietest we've stayed in, which is a big plus.The Carnival tower is fantastic, as the casino is pretty decent and the location is STELLAR! If you want to be on the Strip, you can't beat it. The rooms are not as plush as Caesar's, but they're larger AND you can get out and hit the casino or be on the strip in a couple of minutes. My other big plus for them is their valets are lightning fast. We went to no less than 10 casinos and none were nearly as quick and friendly as Harrah's. THE BAD! We got into room and it was 80 degrees - called the desk and were told it's motion activated cooling. If no one is in room, no air flow. Drank and gambled until 2 am, etc.. next moring 78 degrees. We moved to a smoking room the next evening (again, thank you Meshan) to find it at 80 degrees. We were assured it would cool down (uh huh, sure). Next morning 78 degrees. Called again - desk said she'd send someone while we were out. (NO idea if anyone tried.) Got in at 2am ... yup 78 degrees. Called desk, were told they "took care of it" and it would cool down. I hung up. Woke up to ... 78 degrees. Called again, they said it would be taken care of. Left for the day, got in at 2am again, 79 degrees. Wife called and BEGGED (as I laughed in the background) and to my surprise a maintenance man got there in FIVE minutes and fixed it!!!! I didn't get his his name but he was great. The temp was below 70 in about 10 minutes. Of course, we had to check out 9 hours later so I can't give a great review. If you want to stay on the strip, Harrahs or Flamingo are really the best "nice" option for the price, provided you get an updated room. (The older rooms are NOT great.) But frankly, our stay at the Golden Nugget was wayyyyyyyyyyyyyy better and we may stay on Fremont street instead on the nest trip, as the Strip casinos are just getting too pricey and their gambling odds are now too much in favor of the house.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Laura F
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at Harrah's in Las Vegas for 4 days. It was overall really good. The first night we stayed in a standard room, the last 3 we stayed in a suite with a king bed and a whirlpool tub. The bathroom was amazing, and the room was beautiful. However, our whirlpool did not work. We called maintenance in to fix it. The maintenance man was very rude to us, and did not fix it during the 8 hours we were gone, which he assured us he would do. The next day we called again, and it was fixed in 15 minutes. We went down to the front desk and complained about the first guy, they comped us $20 in food and beverages. In the casino, the bartenders were very friendly and pretty fast compared to others. The only real issue we had was, the 3 nights in the suite were supposed to be free for my birthday and they charged us $168 anyways. We attempted to argue that we were promised it would be free. But it did no good. I would stay at Harrah's again. My advice, don't get a whirlpool suite; we were barely in the room to use it.

Reviews.Title: “This place has one confusing lobby.”
Reviews.Author: Kathy R
Reviews.Content: So that made checking in, finding the elevator and checking out a bit of a challenge- rooms were fine though- I think I would try one of the hotels without gambling on the main floor next time just so you don't have to walk through the cigarette smoke each time you come and go.

Reviews.Title: “A surprise! Great Location, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Wayner76
Reviews.Content: My group and I stayed 4 nights in the hotel and wanted to say how great it was. Being our second time there, we originally thought of staying at one of the newer upscale hotels. We didn't have too. We stayed in a basic room that didn't have a view and really weren't disappointed. I mean how many times are you going to look out your window. Everything worked, had a fridge in the room, good air conditioning and a solid bathroom. One thing we also love about Vegas is free drinks and we totally had it. Everytime I was at a slot machine I was taken care of. One night, I stayed up until 6am not even noticing. Location wise it also doesn't get better. Caesar's right across the street and 5 minutes away from the Venetian you are set. Thanks Harrah's we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Barking dogs on pet friendly floor”
Reviews.Author: msdebagain
Reviews.Content: we have stayed here on previous trips to Vegas, so I was sure we would get a wonderful room. We were given room 332 in the Mardi Gras tower. The first thing we see when we get off the elevator was a sign that said 'Pet Friendly Floor'. in the room to the right of the sign was a barking dog. our room was at the very end of the hallway and we couldn't hear the dog once we were in the room. Good thing. I love animals, but i love my sleep more. The room we had was very small, but nice enough. NO VIEW, that is unless you like looking at Air Conditioning vents and smoke. No big deal as i'm not there for the view. Day 2 we went to the room after a day of walking around and shopping. The room next to us, room 330 had two barking dogs. NON STOP. After one hour i finally had enough, and went to the registration desk to complain. The lady was very apologetic, and offered us a suite and no charge for our next two paid nights. We took it. She told us that while pets are allowed on that floor, if they bark or are disruptive, then that isn't allowed. Not sure on how they police this. I mean, what did they do to the people with the barking dogs? The suite had a fax machine, a roll out couch, king size bed and a tv in the bathroom. (my dad would have loved that if he were still alive LOL). The room was huge, but i don't know why someone would call it a suite other than the size. And, the TV channels well, 3 network stations, 3 sports channels and the some keno channels. The room was only 32 a night, so I can't complain too much. We'll go back as we like the central parking. I will just make sure we don't get a pet friendly floor anymore!

Reviews.Title: “Very surprised - would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: CocoSianElle
Reviews.Content: I definitely booked this hotel with caution due to some of the negative reviews that had been posted about it. However what we were looking for this time in Vegas was a bed, good spot on the strip and somewhere fun - Harrah's was all three! We had initially booked a classic room so the cheapest money could get. Upon arrival I didn't think there would be a chance of an upgrade due to it being superbowl weekend but if you don't ask you don't get! The woman at check in was really nice so I asked if they had any quieter rooms and she gave us a room in the Mardi Gras tower. The room was very nice, lovely bed, nice tv, big bathroom - fab! Our room faced the strip so we had a good view of TI and the Mirage where we could catch a glimpse of the volcano show. As we booked via expedia we had the free continental breakfast. We were very happy to learn that this would be $9 a day each which was enough for a large coffee and danish every day! The only reason I wouldn't give Harrah's 5* is because one of my biggest bug bears in Vegas is paper thin walls and Harrah's had thin walls. Luckily our neighbours weren't too loud but still I don't want to hear other peoples conversations - that being said it wasn't too bad. Our favorite machine here was the Batman slot and it did pay out on near enough every occasion which is always a bonus! We used the shuttle to the Rio which was a nice freebie as we had tickets for Penn & Teller and the hotel also runs a shuttle to the airport for $7 each instead of being scammed by a taxi taking the tunnel.

Reviews.Title: “i won $33. and had a great time!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: habanadaydreamin
Reviews.Content: I had a great room with a black and white photo of my favorite piano player, McCoy Tyner. I ate a delicious breakfast and they gave me a $10. voucher and i parlayed that into $33. My buddies came by and we feasted on Sushi at one of the best Sushi restaurants on the planet. I am ready to move there!

Reviews.Title: “Average but wasn't expecting much”
Reviews.Author: AnnieTigers
Reviews.Content: We just recently spent 5 days and 4 nights at Harrahs Las Vegas Casino. Rooms are clean but very noisy. We wouldn't go to bed until around 4am and by 5-6am doors were slamming and there were chatter in the halls. There is a lot of wear and tear on the rooms as well--doors falling apart, stains on the floors, etc. We got the room for free so I can't complain much but there are better hotels out there if you are looking for luxory. If you just want a place to crash after a day of drinking and gambling then this will work.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location - Welcome to the 1980s”
Reviews.Author: Jantaro
Reviews.Content: I ended up staying here as I was attending a conference at Sands Expo nearby. Was surprised to get a room for under $50, so at this price I guess one cannot expect much. There is no wifi in the hotel (not even in Starbucks), but there is a cable connection in the bedroom. The cable is for some reason located next to the bed, so I had to carry a small table from the other side of the room so I'd have somewhere to work. The TV was an old box, and the bed below average. I received a few packages while staying there, and was surprised to be charged $5-7 per package in hotel handling fees. The breakfast buffet at Flavors was disappointing. There are virtually no healthy options, but great if you love grease. However, I enjoyed a burger at KGB and the service was good. This hotel seems to be cater to middle-aged Americans from rural America that enjoy playing slots while smoking from early morning, love wearing sneakers with any outfit, and that consider the rulator the best invention ever. If you fall into this category, you will absolutely love this hotel. Tip: There is a $7 shuttle bus that can take you to/from the airport. It leaves from just outside the reception area, and is much better than taking a cab. If you take a cab, make sure to request them to take the Paradise Road. Look up the route on Google Maps before coming as many of the cab drivers are crooks and will take you on a long ride around town to make some extra bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: dave3232
Reviews.Content: Okay, if you're looking for the Ritz, go elsewhere. If you are looking for a clean room, great location, and great price, keep reading! We booked a Sunday-Friday stay and our room rate was $30 a night. If you have never been to Vegas, Harrah's is almost exactly the center of the The Strip, directly across the street from Ceasar's Palace. $30 a night was a steal, and upon check in, we were given a complimentary upgrade to Strip View simply by asking. Our room was clean, average size, and equipped with programmable wall safe. The television was an smallish (27" CRT TV) but we didnt care, in Vegas who watches TV???? Housekeeping was consistent, every day we returned to a freshly made room and towels, never ever had a problem (this was our third stay at Harrahs). The Buffet of Buffets is a great deal @ $45. You basically get four meals (more if you want) for $11 per meal, at your choice of 8 buffets. We sampled many of them, until we found our favorite, even to the point of only eating a dessert or getting a drink at one of them. I was perplexed at the long lines for check out. USE YOUR TELEVISION.....self check out takes about three minutes using your remote control!!!! We rented a car, and there was ample parking even though it was Chinese New Year during our stay and the place was PACKED! Clean, economic and location, location, location.....you will be hard pressed to find a better deal than Harrahs. Of course you can easily spend much more money, but if you are going to hang out in your room, why go to Vegas/???????

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's Las Vegas - March 2011”
Reviews.Author: Estella N
Reviews.Content: Stay: 3/1 - 3/3/11; Carnival Tower; Non-Smoking Floor/Room First time staying at Harrah's and I was very impressed from the start. Arrived much earlier than check in time at 4pm and a room was available. Check in was smooth and the staff excellent. A king room was not available, but I was able to get into a double queen room right away. To my surprise, there was a Starbucks in the lobby right next to the elevators. Yay! Once I got to my floor, it was a non-smoking designated floor and no trace of cigarette smoke - Thank you!!! Room appeared clean, neat, and smelled great. I actually felt a little spoiled. Although my view was the roof of some part of the building w/the pipes and exhaust, I had a great view of The Mirage and the other hotels on The Strip. To my surprise, again, I was able to see the volcano show at The Mirage from my room! There was some noise with the exhaust from the pipe(s), a/c - you can turn off, volcano show, and delivery trucks (infrequent), but it wasn't to the point of annoyance. I slept well and I felt very comfortable. Some people say you don't go to Vegas to watch TV, but I do like to have a TV in my room to help me sleep and entertain me between the times I come and go. Good channels offered. I did notice as I was plugging in my notebook, the outlet under the desk was a coated with dust - didn't look like it gets touched regularly. A little scary with all the outlets in use and the plugs loose in the sockets, but not a major issue for me. No dust in the corners or near the beds, clean linens, clean bathroom, no dust or scary things in sight other than the outlet dust. Harrah's has great places to shop within the casino. I signed up for Total Rewards which was right off the lobby and in the casino. I recommend you sign up for the Total Rewards program as you can rack up lots of perks from gambling and also shopping at participating resorts! :) I didn't hit it big in the slots, but it was fun nonetheless. Everyone was super nice, the only person I had a "thing" with was the a gentleman cashier in the casino. The $5 Free Play ticket was not working and I was asked by the Total Rewards employee (who replaced my cards after I had difficulty registering my original card in the slot machines) to see the cashier for a replacement ticket. Right off he was defensive and said that the hotel gives out many of the tickets everyday and they have no problems. I repeated my question and request and got clarification on how to use the ticket and my card. Turned out it was my Total Reward card and not the ticket that was malfunctioning. I'm giving him the benefit of the doubt in that he was having a moment, although, good customer service is not great customer service. In the lobby they have the concierge, gift shop, other shops, and seated chair massage. Many restaurants to choose from within the hotel/casino and Starbucks, of course, carries fresh sandwiches and salads if you just need a quick bite. See the Mac King show if you can, I ran out of time to see it on this trip but I hope to see it next time. If you need mail services or the business center, it is on the 2nd floor of the Mardi Gras tower - easy to access elevator is in the lobby. I had to mail postcards and it was so easy and convenient. They have stations to print your boarding pass for a fee right by the elevators, if needed. Very nice. Right by the elevators there are express checkout desks, but the best part is that you can do video check out from your room! A first for me. I had no room charges so it was quick. Instructions are provided by the TV. Just drop off your key cards in the express checkout slot and you're done. Harrah's is located perfectly along The Strip. It's in the middle of everything and I just love the vibrancy of Vegas, so I was able to make the most of my solo vacation. Since my return flight was a late one, upon check out I was able to leave my bags at the luggage center right outside of the lobby. I had a great time and plan to return. Yes, I was approached by Wyndam employees by the casino entrance/exit, but they were very nice and not pushy. If you're a non-smoker, you will survive in this hotel as I found lots of non-smoking spots to eat, gamble, and browse in this hotel. Oh yeah, NO RESORT FEES!!! Thanks for reading. :) Oh yeah, this is a great hotel for extended stays. You can get all of your business and personal needs met at Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: Chattanooga_gal
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Harrah's multiple times thanks to comp'd rooms. Generally, I get a classic room which is a non-updated room with no view. It is your basic room with an older style TV. The bathrooms are somewhat worn, but clean and a great price. You can't beat the location on mid-strip & it is much better than staying at the neighboring IP. I like that the casino is small and as soon as you come down the elevator you are in the casino instead of having to walk for miles from your room. If your looking for a decent, basic, clean room than you should be happy with Harrah's. Note: One time I got upgraded to the deluxe renovated rooms and they are definitely a step up with flat screen tv's, a TV in the bathroom etc... so if you want more than just your basic room, you should upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & no fees”
Reviews.Author: FastMazz
Reviews.Content: The room itself is as like most of the pictures displayed here on Tripadvisor, however, one thing that is often missing is the TV chest/closet combo. The closet space itself is small, and so are the drawers. You'd most likely keep your stuff in the suitcase as a drawer instead of the console. Beds were comfortable, but I've slept on better on the strip. Location is excellent. Bathroom accessories were basic shampoo/conditioner/soap and in room hairdryer as well. However one thing that did suck is that I got a view of the AC ducts and a bare view of Treasure Island top. I know I don't spend a lot of time in the room, but its real nice if you get a view like I had at Treasure Island in my room, its mystifying to watch Vegas at night. If your staying here, insist on a higher floor and not over the AC.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: 1caspermom
Reviews.Content: Overall, good value for the money. Room was clean and pleasant, but no in-room coffee was a big disappointment for us. Our biggest complaint was the sales people for "promotions" - we HATED being accosted every time we went near the front desk. And you can't shake these people - a polite "no thank you" does not detract them. They continue to follow you and get in your face. I notice this is a rule now at many of the hotels and, frankly, we do not want to return to Vegas at all because of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Diane C
Reviews.Content: There are 2 things important to me for a hotel....it's clean, and it's in a good location. This hotel met both of these requirements. It's not the newest hotel on the strip, but it's been fairly well maintained, and the staff is very friendly and helpful, especially housekeeping. The hotel rooms are nothing fancy, but they were more than adequate. After all, how much time do you spend in the rooms? The beds were pretty comfortable too. We also enjoyed the restaurant Ming, located in the hotel. A great meal for two under $50, including tip. The hotel is also a stop on the tram, which comes in handy to move quickly up and down the strip to other hotels. This says it all: we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs is perfect”
Reviews.Author: chuekyj
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 night stay at Harrah's. It is in the perfect location. You can walk easily to the Mirage, Venetian, Caesars, Flamingo, Oshea's,Casino Royale, and Treasure Island without feeling like you just worked out. I recommend upgrading your room to a suite when you are checking in. Book a regular room online or over the phone, but ask about upgrading to a suite when you begin your check in and for a little bit more each night you get a great room that would cost you an arm and a leg at your surrounding hotels. I love the Oyster Bar located on the main floor of the casino. Their ribeye steak, fish tacos, and clam chowder are great. The Piano Bar is located on the main floor is also great. Mac King and Improv Comedy show are also in the casino and are a great value and give you a good laugh.

Reviews.Title: “What I thought of Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: grabec
Reviews.Content: for a classic room I thought it was extremely cramped....hardly enough room to turn around. So we called and upgraded for $44 per night. That room was big, spacious, had a couch and I liked the bed, very comfortable bed. Here is the rub....they wanted about $13/day for internet. I felt it should have been free as so many of the hotels I stay in now do have internet. So, after dragging my laptop on the plane with me I refused to pay the extra fee for internet. Also, even if I would have been willing to pay the fee they only had ethernet and the cord was very short by one end table by the side of the bed. It wouldn't even reach the table nearby. Very inconvenient. Also thought they should have let you use the gym free instead they wanted something like $25/day for it. It was very nice but felt like I was being gouged every time I turned around for these extras. We ate in Flavors, a buffet that I thought was consistantly good and lots of variety. Probably the best bang for our buck as every other restaurant was very expensive. It was about $20 in the buffet for all you could eat and lots of choices. Elevators very fast and hardly any waiting. Good staff, helpful and courteous. Good price on the shuttle to and fromt the airport, $7 per person.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: trlett
Reviews.Content: Harrah's Las Vegas is a nice hotel in a great central location on the Las Vegas strip. The casino is large and while it gets busy, it does not feel crowded. The rooms are clean and nice and you never have to wait too long for an elevator. There are plenty of restaurants from inexpensive to expensive. The staff is very nice and helpful. One of the best things about Harrah's is the location. It is in the center strip area, and many of the other casinos and restaurants are within walking distance. For the great location, reasonable cost and well kept property, this hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Still Nice/ But Green”
Reviews.Author: jpatt
Reviews.Content: we have stayed here many times over 10years. Our room in the Mardi Gras tower was lovely - it was over the outside bar - which is loud all night - we didnt care. They have cut back on amenities..no tea bags, body wash, or conditioner. Plus - now that they are green - they will not change your sheets - unless you specifically call and ask. The staff was great - especially the Cashiers. No big wins - or small for that matter - but LOVE the location...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Camtin
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our first visit to Las Vegas where we stayed at Harrah's. We were very pleased with our room which was in the Mardi Gras tower on the 14th floor. It was clean, comfy and spacious. The service at the hotel was great and the staff were really helpful. Breakfast was included in our deal, we got a 9 dollar voucher per person for Starbucks. Towards the end of our stay we were fed up with bagels and decided to try the breakfast buffet at the hotel. It was lovely but a bit pricey. The best thing about Harrah's is probably the location. It is within walking distance of most hotels and the forum shops are located right across the street. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: rackman0000
Reviews.Content: Great location. Food OK not great. Rooms nice. Bathroom was large and great Great bars. Nice casino Pool was nice but no not tub. How does a pool in vegas on the strip not have an outdoor hot tub or two?

Reviews.Title: “VALUE, LOCATION, CONVENIENT”
Reviews.Author: PATHRCO7
Reviews.Content: A bunch of us stayed here for a week while working the SHOT Show. Chose Harrah's because it is a true bargain (great room rates and no resort fees!), it's incredibly convenient to the Sands Convention Center and it's smack dab in the middle of The Strip. Stayed in Deluxe rooms in the Carnaval Tower. Very quiet on the back side near the parking garage. The side on The Strip can be noisy, especially if you're on the lower floors because of the Carnaval Court bands. The great room rates and lack of resort fees make Harrah's stand out. The other hotels nearby charge A LOT MORE and they really stick it to you with the infamous resort fees. Harrah's is also very convenient for getting out to other locations on the strip. Saves a ton on taxi fares. Plenty of free parking if you have a vehicle. We didn't dine here much....and the little dining we (attempted) turned out to be a pretty bad experience. Tried to have breakfast 2 days in a row at Harrah's Cafe. I say tried because it never happened! We got down there in plenty of time to make it to the trade show but on both days, we gave up after not being served in 30 minutes!! Not good. Ended up grabbing McDonalds next door in a rush to get to the show. This same experience happened to us a couple years ago.......should've known better but we hoped things had changed. We even prompted the server when we finally flagged her down that we needed to order quickly and be served in a timely manner. This is very frustrating......especially when the place wasn't even busy (maybe 15-20 people in the cafe, tops). Saw others leaving without their food, too. We mostly ate at Toby Keith's Bar & Grill in Harrah's and California Pizza Kitchen right across the street in Mirage and other restaurants within a few minute walk. Tons of places to eat within 10 minutes. The Range Steakhouse at Harrah's is great but a little pricey (but most steak houses in Vegas are really pricey). Room service comes late in the day but if you're out working a show or enjoying the city, that's not a big deal. Rooms are nice and big as are the bathrooms. For some reason these older hotels have very dark rooms....even with all the lights on. Bathroom lighting could really use a boost. Beds are very comfortable and our rooms were really clean. Front desk/Check-In area can get pretty busy but they were very accommodating and friendly upon arrival. Harrah's is a great "Value" alternative compared to a bunch of other hotels/casinos nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: mzzlol
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel at 8pm. We were upgraded to suite due to moms birthday! Very unexpected and very much appreciated! Staff was wonderful! Suite was very nice, clean and quiet. Location of hotel was awesome close to everything on strip. Had amazing time!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay At Harrah's!”
Reviews.Author: dshawmmiller
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Vegas, and our first time at Harrah's and we had an awesome time! Check-in: when we arrived there was a little bit of a line, but we waited no more than 15 mins Room: Nice spacious room on the 18th floor with a king size bed. Very clean and no complaints Hotel: This place is big! I got lost a few times lol has that "old vegas" feel to it, but everything is pretty new and modern. There are lots of slots/tables/ to play at, and the waitresses were quick to make sure you always had a drink(tipping also helps with this).
