And there is also a Starbucks located down stairs by the lobby, BONUS! Location: Right in the heart of Vegas centrally located on the strip. Within walking distance to other hotels and casinos (caesars palace, treasure island, mirage etc.) There is also a mcdonalds right next store Food: During our stay we ate a few times at the buffet at Harrah's. For only $22 we ate like kings! The variety of food was great! ( the first night I stuffed myself with king crab, rib eye steak, tamales halibut u name it, they had it!) the drink was also included with the price. I would definately recommmend their buffet! My only negative comment would be that there was alot of people smoking inside, which I guess to a smoker is a bonus. Also, where are all of the clocks? You lose all sense of time when your in Vegas unless you have a watch! But besides that Harrah's was a great hotel, and we would definately be back in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Chalfont_PAJessie
Reviews.Content: My husband & I went to Vegas with another couple for a vacation. I am a platinum rewards cardholder & so is my friend. We were both able to get 7 nights for 78.00 total, not per night that was our total bill for all 7 nights! How can you beat that. So we weren't expecting much for that price but we were pleasantly surprised. The room was on the 23rd floor non-smoking, it looked out over the parking garage but beyond that you could see the mountains, so it wasn't bad. It had a flat screen tv & a room safe. There weren't any king rooms available so there were 2 beds but we didn't mind. The bathroom was not huge but plenty of counter space, however, only 1 sink. Maid service was fine. The flavors buffet was really good. We did the 24hr. buffet for 45.00 we could get 4 meals out of it and you could go to any harrahs property. The best was Rio but Flavors at Harrahs was good & also Planet Hollywood's buffet was good too. Do Not go to Imperial Palace buffet it was very small & the food was not very good. Harrah's is right across from Ceasars & close to Venitan, Bally's Paris , & Planet Hollywood. Paris buffet was also good. The slots at Harrahs were good, won quite a bit on our first night but of course put it all back by the end of the week. Toby Keith Bar smelled good but we did not go in because it was SO LOUD & with country music which I can't stand. The lines for the buffets were long but because we are platinum card holders we were able to get right in, so if you are platinum, diamond or 7 stars there is a seperate entrance. Also check- in was also seperate so we did not wait at all. We were able to get a room right next door to our friends.They also printed our boarding passes for free the day before we left. All the staff were nice & helpful. The bad part was the long line at Starbucks in the morning because there were a lot of convention people. All - in -all we had a lovely stay & would recommend Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money and monrail right outside the back of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: dlobb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrahs for CES this year. We got a fantastic deal on a flight/hotel package from Allegiant Airlines. The room was fine and the beds were very comfortable. TV was an older tube type but I don't watch TV when I am in Vegas so it was a non-issue. Hotel is extremely convenient for CES as Monorail is right outside the rear of the hotel. Not one of the higher-end hotels on the strip but still a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “People Make Up the Difference”
Reviews.Author: Scov70
Reviews.Content: Probably the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in. However the room service personnel and most all other employees helped make the stay pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: ravibhopal
Reviews.Content: We visited las vegas in December 2011 and booked the rooms in this hotel through net. The hotel is located right on the strip and has all the facilities for a comfortable stay. The casino is also good. Its a real value for money. The breakfast is served at the Star bucks cafe which is fine but it would be better if arrangements are made for serving hot breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Nice”
Reviews.Author: patsea-travel-agent
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and a few hours early for the small group I accompanied as a travel agent. We were able to be checked in early, got a great mountain view and room was very nice. While the hotel is older and not as nicely appointed as the Venetian, let's say - for the price difference it was perfect. Rooms were very clean and nice and it was in a convenient area on the strip to bus stops and other hotels and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great price, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: cinalv
Reviews.Content: Harrah's is centrally located on the strip with very easy access to the Monorail, shuttles and bus routes. Our check in was very quick even though there were many customers at the front desk. We had a Classic (basic), double queen room. It was on the eighth floor of the Carnaval Tower. (We were unable to get an upgrade due to the facility being at capacity.) There was no view; however, it was VERY quiet. The room itself is a spacious, standard (not luxurious) type of room and it was very clean. The beds were very comfortable. It had a 32 inch flat screen TV, an iron, ironing board and hair blow dryer. It did not have a coffee maker. I gave this a "very good" rating due to the combination of the location, price and cleanliness. The staff were all very courteous and helpful. My only complaint is the aggressive time share sales people who seem to be all over the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: karebearss
Reviews.Content: Chose Harrah's for it's location and very reasonable prices. We originally reserved a standard room and decided to 'upgrade' to a delux room at check in. When we got there, the room had a bad odor like stale smoke and who knows what else. We left the bathroom llight on to keep the fan going and opened the window. After 5 hrs, the room still was smelly. I called the front desk and upgraded us to a mini suite which was nice and spacious. The room was dated but we weren't there to stay in the room. The pool is not for those who want to party like at the Flamingo but was still nice. There is a huge sun deck with a fountain you can 'wade' in to cool off. It is nothing to write home about but you will still get your tan! The dealers and front desk staff were always polite and eager to please. They even allowed us to get a late check out 1 hour later than all the other guests were given! We have stayed at the Flamingo many times but will probably stay at Harrah's instead due to it's price and just as good location.

Reviews.Title: “Room a little small, but fine”
Reviews.Author: RainyDevil
Reviews.Content: This is the only hotel I've stayed at in Vegas but it was fine. The room was a little on the small side and we had a terrible view (not that that matters much in Vegas).

Reviews.Title: “Refund Request”
Reviews.Author: bugly123
Reviews.Content: made a reservation here and had to cancel. I cancelled within the guidelines but am 3 weeks into and 3 phone calls to try and get my refund back to my credit card. I am beginning to wonder if this is some kind of game to see if they can keep from issuing refunds. They had no problem taking the deposit right away but getting it back seems to be a daunting task. will never book this chain again

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping not keeping house.”
Reviews.Author: GreggL14
Reviews.Content: A simple request for a rubber bath mat and coffee for the coffee maker went unanswered for three of my five day stay. Not only did I ask the housekeeper in person as I left the room, I left a note both in the bathroom AND with the $2 tip I left on the nightstand. She was able to find the $2 tip, but there was no coffee and not bath mat. Housekeeping did respond with a phone call to them when I got up to my room, but there was no coffee left only on the one day that the "regular" had off. I'm not sure why the simple stuff if being neglected when those are the most annoying things that tick off those who stay in hotels. I hope Harrah's improves their housekeeping services by the next time I stay there. There are way too many other choices for hotels in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, But getting a bit run down”
Reviews.Author: ruger007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Dec 2011. I've been to Vegas a few times, we booked here as some family was staying here also. The location is great, close to most on the strip. Rooms are a bit dated, we had a room on the 18th floor. We had a view of air conditioners. There was a lot of noise in the halls at night. Usually people with a bit to much to drink coming home rather loudly, but that can happen anywere. Buffet was overpriced, also drinks at the bars. The service fee for using the atm was a bit much.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and amenities for price”
Reviews.Author: lauriep81
Reviews.Content: Only complaint was starbucks did not adequately staff for a convention they knew was going on. Everything else good value. Food good at toby keiths and kgb burgers. Food a little expensive but not that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Big and clean”
Reviews.Author: mstub123
Reviews.Content: This was the cleanest hotel I've ever been in. The room was big although it could be called "vanilla." Nothing special but clean and large. The people were busy...busy. The casino was nice and fun. The food was very good with some things being great. Good location and a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: MFRTravelers
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Harrah's a couple times, usually as a deal through Allegiant Air. Great deal again this time for combined air and hotel. Arrived late on Dec 26. They had overbooked, which seems to be common looking at other reviews. We were put up in a FANTASTIC suite in the Carnaval Tower. Unfortunately, it was so late we went right to sleep and didn't really get to enjoy the suite as we were moved the next day. Our new room was in the Mardi Gras Tower which was visibly more run down and not as clean. Elevators were quite grungy as were the hallways. The room was small, but clean and comfortable. Internet access was awkward with no wireless, but a ethernet cable fastened to the small table between the beds. Couldn't even get the laptop onto my lap on the bed. The casino at Harrah's has a nice variety of slots including some of the newer ones, which makes it fun. Ate at the cafe for breakfast as we have in the past. The food was average, but way over priced...over $30 for 2 for breakfast. We have eaten here on previous trips and don't understand the operation, they consistently leave almost half of the tables empty while there is a long line waiting to be seated. I assume it's because of staffing, but good grief, staff up for the holidays and get people seated, you'll make more money. We also ate at KGB Hamburgers, again overpriced, by the food was very good. Harrah's wouldn't be our first choice, but it is located nice and central on the strip with access to the monorail, so if got another good combo deal, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Better room than I expected, but beware the noise.”
Reviews.Author: J3LV
Reviews.Content: Booked a 'Deluxe' room, ended up in the Mardi Gras tower on 10th floor. Room was a lot nicer than I expected, large, comfortable, and well appointed. Large flat screen TV in the armoire, and a smaller one in the bathroom. Very comfortable bed. There was a small safe in the wall behind the door and a coffee maker in the bathroom. Only down side was the noise from the Carnival Court. It was *very* loud and went as late as 3am on some nights. Harrah's has an excellent location on the strip, and the parking garage was convenient and quick to get to from my room. (hint: coming up the ramps in the garage, it's easy to go from the 3rd level to the 5th without even realizing you missed the 4th level, so there was almost always lots of parking close to the elevators on the 4th level) Didn't eat or gamble at the hotel (spent most of my time at Venetian/Palazzo, a short walk away) so can't say much there, other than to mention the casino wasn't over-crowded and not smokey at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good balance between quality, location, and price”
Reviews.Author: MJ0527
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Harrahs in December 2011 during the Christmas holidays. We've stayed here many times before and the quality has always been pretty consistent. Our stay was great. We checked in late, around 11:30 PM, and there were no "standard" rooms available, which is what I booked with a special through expedia. So, they upgraded us to a suite with a jacuzzi. It was a nice room and the bathroom was very large and clean, though it looked like a bathroom from the late 80's. The bathroom was all tile, from floor to ceiling, and nice in design, and would be considered a high-end bathroom of the late 80's. The room was clean and the bed was nice and plush. The furniture looked okay - no evident signs of wear. Our room had a side view of the strip, which was nice. We slept well and didn't hear any noises of folks walking outside or our neighbors. As for as the location is concerned, you really can't find a better value for the location. It's central strip and its located next to some very nice hotels (Venetian, Bellagio, etc.). Also, when you walk outside Harrahs, you are next to the small food court that's located on the strip with the McDonalds, Chipotle, and Panda Express (and maybe one or two more places...). This is especially good if you're traveling with a family and want to eat quick and cheap. Also, in terms of location, I will say that the Harrahs is very close to the booth where you can purchase show tickets at 50% off. This booth (forgetting the name) opens around 10 AM, so its a quick walk from your hotel and you can purchase tickets the shows the same day for significantly less than the box office. We used the valet service at Harrahs, which was very quick and courteous. They had heat-lamps outside, which made it okay to stand outisde in the cold while you waited for your vehicle. In the hotel, they have a Starbucks, which definitely comes in handy when you're up late or you wake up early. I would avoid Harrah's buffet - it's not a very good buffet. However, if you have to go, I think that same booth that sells tickets at 50% off sells coupons for discounted Harrah's buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CGVancouverIsland
Reviews.Content: Rooms a little tired but clean. Enjoyed casino (Thank you Harrah's ) . Buffet was disappointing with lots of variety but cafeteria standards of quality and decor. It was a nice easy place to stay and I would consider going back again. It was very close to a lot of off premises amenities and did not require a manual and tour guide to sort out the onsite amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's before Christmas”
Reviews.Author: northwestwoyuit
Reviews.Content: We had a good room overlooking the strip for a very good price, $30 a night average, including a weekend!! The downside was that it was small with a queen only but we didn't care. The room was cleaned every day and we have no complaints. Terrific location, we ate elsewhere on the strip. So easy to catch the Deuce at the Venitian going to Freemont or cross the street with the crosswalk out front to go in the other direction. If you're 60 or older and bring ID to the Bonneville Transit Station, out of towners can get a senior pass inside and walk outside to a machine and get a 5 day pass for $10. It's a great bargain, we went everywhere with it, much easier travel than I expected. Harrah's casino was full any time of the day or night.

Reviews.Title: “Broken Internet, Broken Dreams”
Reviews.Author: jay c
Reviews.Content: Horrible. I had to change rooms because of a busted modem, only to find my second room also had zero internet access. Being in town on business, this was a huge obstacle. The staff directed me to their telephone help line, wherein I spent an hour and a half trying to reset a broken modem, all the while my phone line was buzzing like a jet engine. I attempted to call the help line back on my cell (to avoid the inevitable screaming over the buzzing phone line), but alas, my room had zero cell reception. In the end, it was a total waste of time and energy, and the hotel staff did nothing to fix the problem. I was even more upset to find that several of my coworkers (in town for CES) had the same problem. Harrah's claims of working internet access are total BS. Super disappointed with my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice relaxed hotel”
Reviews.Author: LisaW813
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in December 2011. After reading some of the reviews on TA i didn't know what to expect. I was really impressed with the hotel. It's large but not so large that it's intimidating. very happy with the room, we had 2 double beds and was really large. I agree that there isn't enough wardrobe space or hangers in the room. The free safe came in handy along with the hairdryer provided. the beds are soooo comfy!! We had a connecting door in the room and our neighbours were really noisy (don't know whether they sounded louder due to the door being there). We stayed in the carnival tower overlokking the pool. As it was December the pool was deserted so it was a really quiet room (excluding the neighbours). A few of our party were in the other tower and they said they had quiet rooms as well. Ate in Flavours buffet a few times and was impressed with it. The hotel is in a really great location on the strip so you're not too far from anywhere. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's is a cheap and cheerful place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Simon O
Reviews.Content: While there was nothing spectacular about our stay at Harrah's we were pleasantly surprised that the room seemed to have been either very well kept, or fairly recently updated. The room was small, and nothing special compared to other Vegas hotels, but it served it's purpose for my wife and I during our 5 night stay. Staff was helpful when needed and the room was clean. Our floor was a bit noisy at times, and one night at about 3-4am someone tried repeatedly to enter our room, and finally realized why their card didn't work.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for budget-minded travelers”
Reviews.Author: Siliobear
Reviews.Content: Normally not my first choice on the Strip, but a weekday off-peak trip to Vegas offered room rates too low to pass up. Centrally located on the strip, it's an older hotel, but everything was clean and decent. For country music lovers, there's a Toby Keith bar and grill, with celebrity guitars on display. Harrah's is one property on the Buffet of Buffets pass. For $45 (after you've enrolled in their free Total Rewards card), you can eat at any of six participating buffets in a 24 hour period. For a small upcharge, you can upgrade to the Rio Seafood Buffet, which we did. My only disappointment, we were traveling with our teenage son and there was a $30/night surcharge for the additional person. Frankly, that was more than the room itself and I should've just booked two adjoining rooms! My reservation included a coupon booklet of 2-for-1s for food, spa and shows (but since we had the buffet pass, we didn't use any of them). They also "comped" us an afternoon magic show (pretty entertaining and funny...good for kids although some adult humor) but we still had to pay for one drink. Worth staying again for the low rates! Be sure to visit IcePan...a unique ice cream experience!

Reviews.Title: “Sagging, stuffy, dim and dirty, room 1059 Carnival Tower”
Reviews.Author: highlandbride
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights which was two nights too many. Ended up here as last resort during CES at gouging convention rate of $300 a night...not worth most of the cost. CES hotel rates in Vegas are headed in direction of COMDEX - so expensive and overpriced that attendees will think twice before deciding to go next year. Central, walkable location on strip cannot make up for sagging/sloping mattresses, scuffed furniture, dim lighting, long black hairs in shower (not my shade), broken AC/Heat thermostat and grim Internet access situation. Room not ready when I arrived so I came back later after dinner and settled into discover that the AC/Heat and fan were broken, the computer modem (no wifi!) was not installed properly. Building maintenance was in and out of my room for nearly 45 minutes to fix things, that if housekeeping was on the ball and proper maintenance performed might not have been necessary. Old building so not many electric sockets. Love having to crawl on hands and knees under desk to plug in computer and also find jack for Internet service cable, which was also missing from room so surly telephone operator barked that she would send one up. Mattress were low grade to start and due to heavy wear, sloped down in the middle so i had to sleep on an angle to avoid rolling into center dip area. To encourage me to leave tips, there was an envelope on the bedside table with the housekeeper's name. Now I know who was responsible for the high miscellanous hair count in bathroom that was was much higher than average, had my doubts about cleanliness of rest of room. Inside minibar was a half opened case of water bottles in torn plastic wrapper. Staff were otherwise pleasant and earnest but management has lost control of maintenance. escalators headed to monorail were not working during daytime and escalator to Monorail station on way up not working either. Lose major points for having one bedside lamp with hard to use switch, and impossible to turn off without getting out of bed! win 2 points for supplying regular hangars vs. the ones on rings/spoke system. Win 10 bonus points for being directly adjacent to a monorail stop, a lifesaver to get to/from convention center without sitting in traffic for 30 minutes every morning and evening. Why do maids feel the need to waste kleenex to make little flowers on top of boxes? every night I unnecessarily waste/throw out at least 4 - 5 tissues that someone has handled...ick! I

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay”
Reviews.Author: barkinglot
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a few days in Las Vegas. We stayed at Harrah's on the strip. The room was quite big and very comfortable. It was clean also. We booked a package trip on Allegiant airlines from Duluth MN so the price was pretty good for the whole package. The room was pretty bare bones, no fridge, no coffee maker but there was an ironing board and iron. The tv could use some updating and they had a mini bar fridge but they had a huge STOP sign warning you not to use the fridge to cool your own drinks. We weren't tempted to use it because it wasn't cold anyways. They nickle and dime you to death at this place. No free wifi, you have to pay for all internet useage. No free phone calls either, $1.50 a shot. No free coffee in the lobby either. You can line up to pay $5 for a Starbucks coffee. I discovered a McDonalds next door with free wifi (had a lot of trouble using it) and decently priced coffee. We didn't eat at Harrahs so I can't comment on the food. They have servers walking around to bring you free drinks. Make sure you tip really well or you will have a hard time getting them to come back. Check in was easy and quick and the lady at the front desk was really nice and helpful. The cleaning staff were super and pleasant. In fact most of the staff that we dealt with were great. Harrahs is in one of the best locations on the strip so it's convenient for sight seeing along Las Vegas Boulevard. Overall I had a good time at Harrahs and I probably would stay here again. The only problem we had was that we were charged over $4 for taking a toothbrush from the mini bar, which we never touched. I explained that to the lady on the phone who was really rude and snapped at me while I was nicely trying to explain that we didn't take the toothbrush. Bottom line, we didn't have to pay for the d__n thing.

Reviews.Title: “Back to harrahs”
Reviews.Author: guzzman
Reviews.Content: Hi all.....been to vegas 8 times now...usually stay at harrahs.....got the chance to spend the weekend there recently....being from pa where gambling is close to home, we dont get vegas that often any more and we heard how things had gone downhill due to economy.....being a loyal harrahs patron for alot of years, here is my impression as of january 2012....first, location is still great....center of the strip.....we used carry on bag on plane as it was a 2 night trip.......we breezed through mcarran airport and got the bel tran shuttle to harrahs....well worth the 6.00 fee......the cabs rip you off.......it was a friday night as we got to harrahs......was 6:30 pm.......line was kinda long to check in......the earlier you can get there the better....we waited around 15 minutes to check in......we had the room comped.....it was a classic but lady upgraded us to mini suite because we hadnt been there for a while......she was pleasant......we were in the mardi gras tower.....4 th floor.........overlooking the pool area.......pool is closed so it was ok for us......non smoking room......no noise....room was clean and beds were great.....had a 42 inch flat screen.....also a safe in the room which we always use.......bathroom was clean and had a 22 inch tv in it.....also a coffee pot and a hair dryer........shower pressure was very good.......also plenty of towels, soaps, etc......room keys worked well......a c in the room worked by sensor....was very quiet.......only thing, the air seemed dry......not bad though......in all, very happy with this room......maid service was excellent in the morning.............now, lets go downstairs........casino is ok for us........had alot of newer machines that we liked.....we did ok.... This is a full smoking casino so beware of that........can be loud as well........drink service for us was great........waitresses were always there.......tip a dollar, good to go.......beer was 6.00 a bottle at the bars.......the outside circle bar was great......had heaters......lot of good people...... Wings at toby keiths on the 2 nd floor are the best.......flavors buffet is pricey and the line can be long.......you can pay 5.00 if you want to move to the head of the line.......food is quite good....not great but very good.......also there is a burger place as well.......burgers were good but were 12.00....... Food was pricey but all in all worth it........you can catch shuttles to the rio and the other harrahs properties every 30 minutes.......tip a buck....driver appreciates it and you save a ton over cab fares.......you can also catch the monorail at harrahs......we walked to many close by casinos......o sheas, flamingo, margeritaville just to name a few........like i said, location is the best........security at harrahs was also good......we had no problems.....still always watch yourself.......pretty good sportsbook......overall, things have changed in las vegas but we were happy with our weekend experience at harrahs......january is a pretty good time to go as vegas isnt as crowded as it can be in the hotter weather.......was 70 degrees when we were there so we were lucky........enjoy vegas if you go and good luck.................guzzie

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Nibbler
Reviews.Content: Very well kept, clean and decent place to stay. It is within walking distance to most things. I honestly had never heard of it before but it's right on the strip with good views. Good amenities, decent sized rooms with closet space. The staff is friendly though the attendants at the exits pushing for comps and shows are pushy but that's their job. I would walk out in the morning and they would try to get me and not even 5 minutes after grabbing a coffee and returning they would be after me like we hadn't just spoken. I understand it is the job but just a warning. There is a Starbucks right in the place but the morning lines are crazy. Save yourself the time and hit the McDonald's right out side. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “you decide...”
Reviews.Author: Toad143
Reviews.Content: My room is average and I was ugraded to the "luxury room". I do have a decent view of the strip. Bed seems comfortable. Here are the negatives. 12.95 for wired internet in rooms. In fact, no internet in public spaces either. I was told to go to Mac Donalds to get online...Mc Donalds?.....Really? (Pardon me but it is 2012) No resort fee but I was just told it's 20 bucks to use the fitness center. They tried to charge me 25 bucks for checking into my room early. Olivia was nice enough to get that waived "this one time". No flat screen TV. I did get a decent rate considering the CES is in progress. It does have a nice bathroom with good water pressure. The monorail is right out back. This gives you easy access up and down the strip. Would I stay here again?....maybe

Reviews.Title: “Surprise!!!”
Reviews.Author: Autumndeere
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Harrah's many times in the past 6 years. Upon check-in, this sweet little gal by the name of Athena, gave us an upgrade. WOW! We were in a suite on the 35th floor. We felt like royalty. We can't thank her enough. We have always had great experiences at Harrah's and will continue to stay there. The room was clean, the beds were great and the bathroom was awesome. Thank you, Athena and Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing exciting but the price”
Reviews.Author: Danielle_saopaulo
Reviews.Content: The room was nice, very big and they have good mattresses. Very nice shower. The breakfast is a voucher for starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and a Great Rate”
Reviews.Author: MattinTx
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a deluxe room with a King bed and I was very, very happy. Great room with great amenities and I had a wonderful view. I would definately stay there again. Perfect location and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Some problems this stay.”
Reviews.Author: SC_Bflo
Reviews.Content: Traveling with family and friends. Arrived in evening and were not given the adjoining rooms we requested. Not a huge deal, but they would only put us on the same floor if one of us paid $15 a night for an upgrade. Again not a big deal, but we were both platinum members and didn't feel they were working to satisfy us. Went back to front desk to complain the next morning, and were given our requested rooms and the charges were reversed. The only problem with the new rooms was that the A/C would not work in one of the rooms. Room was a little warm, but it was January, so opening window, allowed enough cool air in. Have stayed at this location several times, this was the first I wasn't satisified. Will be back because the room is almost always comped.

Reviews.Title: “hotel review”
Reviews.Author: ozyt
Reviews.Content: great hotel, reasonable prices best of all there is free parking. located right opposite Ceasar's Palace right in the middle of the strip

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, if you get the right room”
Reviews.Author: culturecurious
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Harrah's on the strip during our stay in Las Vegas over Christmas and loved the location. We can walk to any of the neighbouring hotels, casinos and shows, saving $$ on cabs. If you drive, they have free valet service. Take advantage. The first night we were given a room on the 4th floor facing the strip. Sounds nice, but it was impossible to get any sleep from the incredible loud music from the outdoor performance centre. the sound reverberated in the room! We asked to be moved, so the moved us to the 24th floor facing away from the strip (the room is not much bigger, but apparently more expensive). This was so nice and quiet, we slept like a pair of logs. The next day they indicated we had to move again, this time to a room on the 17th floor, still facing away from the strip. Just as good of a room, but a hassle to have to move. The rooms are clean, but the maid service needs some help; on 2 separate occasions , the maids entered our room without knocking; once when my wife was alone, and the maid refused to leave upon several prompts from the customer! The other was in the morning when we were in bed - very embarrassing! Both times we brought it to the management's attention. The first time I just wanted it noted so it wouldn't happen again and they offered $30 towards food at the hotel (don't get excited, that does get you much). The second time it was unacceptable, but the hotel did nothing to compensate. I did not gamble a penny at this casino, or watch any shows here, but rather enjoyed all the other grand sights and shows of Vegas! For the price and the location, this hotel is worth it. We were just unlucky and had some troubles, hence a less than satisfactory experience this time around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Value but Internet Access is Non-Existent”
Reviews.Author: Stephen S
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Harrah's yesterday, we stayed for 4 nights in the Mardi Gras tower. We've stayed at this hotel many times, going back to when it was owned by Holiday Inn and was themed as a ship. The hotel is clean with a great location (center strip) and a great value. My HUGE gripe was the internet access. The rooms have no wireless internet and the ethernet cord they provided did not work. I thought I was back in the 1990's! I called the 800 number for customer service for the internet provider and went through a host of possible settings and he finally said it must be a bad ethernet cable. Tried the front desk and had room service bring another cable, still didn't work. I gave up! Mentioned this to the front desk upon leaving and they hear that complaint frequently and apparently those who are able to connect, complain about the speed. So if you need internet access for business purposes, I'd strongly suggest another strip hotel or even perhaps Motel 6! :)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel on The Strip for the price”
Reviews.Author: MHlush
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at Harrah's Las Vegas within the last 3 months. While I've stayed in different rooms, in different towers, I preferred the Mardi Gras tower room better. The MG tower seems newer, and the rooms are revampt. Also, when looking to book a suite within this hotel, I want to warn you that the Mini Suite is not your typical suite. It is essentially a standard room with deep corners, and it is one room. A suite to me would indicate a separate living room and bedroom, and this room is not the case. While it is larger than the standard room, it should not be classified as a suite. Overall, both rooms I've stayed in were clean, and housekeeping does a great job keeping it this way. For the value of your money, this is a good room for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't expecting it to be so good!”
Reviews.Author: tonestar24
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a Contiki tour, had stayed at the Venetian with family in July before the tour so I was interested to see the difference. I was really surprised by how nice the rooms were. It was a comfortable sleep, the bathroom was modern, the beds were nice and the tv set up was good with it in a cabinet that you opened and slided the doors back. We arrived at 3pm and were given our keys by our tour leader. Went straight up and re-arranged all my luggage with the tv on and then relaxed watching it, so it was a pleasant few hours of settling in before dinner. I was happy with the service and the rooms were quiet. Also, the air con was not too cold in the corridors which the Venetian was a little too cold, so overall it was a pleasant stay and I would definitely stay here next time because it is reasonably priced, plus you aren't in the rooms very much anyway, so who wants to spend a fortune? The pool was average but clean and big, just nothing fancy and the hotel is central on the strip right across from Caesar's. I have already recommended it to others staying in Vegas later this year!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and reasonably priced.”
Reviews.Author: Musicloverireland
Reviews.Content: Having trawled through lots of brochures and not sure of the location of any of the hotels on offer, American friends suggested Harrah's. We were not disappointed as the location is superb. This hotel is right smack in the centre of all the major attractions. It is typical of a 3 star US Hotel with most of the basic facilities included. Having now done the Las Vegas trip I realise that a lot of similar hotels in the brochures are quite a distance away from the centre. The Ticket Office for cheap tickets is just around the corner and a lot of the shows are nearby. American breakfast was fantastic in Denny's, just a short walk away but we also ate in the ground floor restaurants of the Hotel. Had a fantastic meal upstairs in the hotel (dress code for this particular restaurant), the service was excellent. For all the gamblers out there, the casino is buzzing. However being Irish and now accustomed to non-smoking in all our hotels, restaurants and bars, I was very much aware of the inhalation. However, the air conditioning is good and you're not looking through a fog of smoke. It's smaller than other's I have seen in the larger 5 star hotels but more than adequate - how many hands do you have!! Because we felt we saved on the price of the hotel we treated ourselves to the Helicopter flight to the Grand Canyon in Colorado. As the Yanks say "Awesome". Would highly recommend this hotel for location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Spoiled us!”
Reviews.Author: Linda85730
Reviews.Content: We upgraded our room to a suite with a jacuzzi in the Carnaval Tower. I don't think we could go back to a regular room! There were three tvs in the suite. I took atvantage of the jacuzzi both nights that we were there. There was also a frig in our sitting room. We were on the 30th floor and had somewhat of a view of the strip. The room had a king size bed.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: AMP89
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's the week before Christmas and I was expecting a bare bones hotel but was pleasantly surprised. The room was roomy, the bed was comfy and it was clean. It appeared to have been renovated recently enough where there only one water mark on the wall paper otherwise everything seemed fine. We actually were facing the backside of the Strip which was great because we didn't have a lot of light coming into the room and night and it was fairly quiet. We were there 3 nights and only one night did I hear some guests coming home late and being loud.

Reviews.Title: “THE place to go!”
Reviews.Author: Halobabe99
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really nice, and in the middle of the strip. The workers are very nice. They have several nice restaurants to dine in. We got a deluxe room, which is probably the same and the reg rooms, but a better location...and better it was...two minutes from the casino via a elevator ride! Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Center of strip and the service is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: MandyVB
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at other properties in Las Vegas but Harrah's is hands down my favorite. We have stayed at Harrah's 8 times now. The location can't be beat - Center of the strip. Located at an intersection where you can actually cross the street without having to use one of the up an over bridges. Directly across from the Mirage and the entrance to the mall at Caesar's. The service is great! - Every employee you pass smiles and says hello. The cleaning staff do a fabulous job - ever since the world got crazy over bed bugs I strip search every room I stay in regardless of where we are and the rooms at Harrah's are always immaculate. The standard rooms are nice, fairly recently remodeled, and of a decent size for two people. It isn't as glam as other hotel-casinos in Vegas, but there is an upside to that - the rates are very good!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: mrsgun
Reviews.Content: I read some of the previous reviews of Harrahs. I was a little concerned by some of the comments. Now that we have stayed there, I can state that everything went fine. There were 8 people checking in customers. The parking was free. There were no fees. The rooms were in the Carnaval section of the hotel. The rooms were very clean, fresh in appearance, and well maintained. The elevators are fast to respond to your floor. We did look out over a parking lot but we didn't mind the view. We did ask about a free upgrade and we were told the hotel was quite full as we were close to New Year's Eve. We would stay there again as Harrah's is centrally located on the strip with low cost food near by.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: Eric S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's in December of 2011. Check-in was very quick and easy. Our room was nice (not luxurious, but nice) and had a view of the volcano at The Mirage at night. The casino was fun and had a pary atmosphere. The location of Harrah's was great. It is right in the middle of the strip, just a short walk from nearly everything. We ate at Flavors, the buffet, and it was as good as any. We saw the Mac King comedy/magic show at Harrah's and enjoyed it very much (very family friendly). Harrah's is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location - Don't Eat the Food!”
Reviews.Author: richklhs
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel room to drop your stuff in and enjoy the Vegas strip, the price is right to make this home base. The place is average enough and the casino pretty mediocre for strip standards. If you want Vegas Luxury, go across the street to Caesars. Don't eat the buffet! I got horrible food poisoning that ruined 24 hours of my trip from that place. Good gracious I was sicker than a Kebler elf that found out he was allergic to chocolate.

Reviews.Title: “Fun time”
Reviews.Author: Sandybeaches56
Reviews.Content: This was my 1st time to Vegas. The hotel room was spacious and our room overlooked the Mirage which had an hourly show from 6pm to 11pm of the "volcano", since it was unseasonably cold outside the bird's-eye view of the volcano show was enjoyable. The hotel is located on the strip & was within walking distance to other hotels & local shopping. The room was clean & was well stocked with towels & tolietries on a daily basis.

Reviews.Title: “central location, good comfort, oldschool casino”
Reviews.Author: sor046
Reviews.Content: The location of the Harras is excellent to stroll around the strip in vegas. The hotel is from the 70ies and the Madris Gras towers have been renovated a few years ago. The rooms offer a good qualtiy for the price and and comfortably designed. The casino in the hotel is terrible as the celinigs are very low and the slot machine very loud, retro-style. The breakfast is included but is only offered at the in-house starbucks cafe. In summary, a good place to stay to explore Vegas but not for gambling or hanging out.

Reviews.Title: “Getting old.”
Reviews.Author: Gleemomih
Reviews.Content: We are here now and leaving tomorrow. We have stayed here before and really liked the location and still do but it is getting old and way too smokey. I have to say there is alot of smokey everywhere but its bad at Harrahs. The rooms are weathered and even the non-smoking rooms are smokey. We moved rooms and had to pay $15 more a night to a renovated room in the Mardi Gras tower and it was better but we won't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Emma-Louise-1980
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting alot when I booked the hotel....we got it for £20 a night on lastminute.com which included breakfast each morning. We stayed from 10/12 - 14/12. Let me start off by saying that when we checked in we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite, this was only for the first night as they had no other rooms available for us (myself, my husband our 10 month old daughter, my mum and her friend). Our room was FANTASTIC and worth the hassle of having to move the next day! The following morning we checked back in to our orginal room (classic) we had booked and was pleasantly surprised, very clean and tidy with everything in working order. I had a problem with the front desk clerk who was quite rude on checking in the second time, which I had to bring up with her manager so they gave us a $30 dining credit which we used at the buffet on our last day. overall the stay was great, we had no problems with noise.....and the room was fab for the price, the breakfast was a $9 per person credit at starbucks which was excellent.....I would definitely stay here again, especially as the location was perfect for the fashion show mall, caesars etc.....

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Sunall
Reviews.Content: Harrah's is a nice enough hotel - strip view rooms give you a view of a small section, but even better is the view of the mountains to the west - nice that there isn't a tall hotel directly across the street to block that. Rooms have been redone, beds are comfy, each room has a "mini-bar" but it only contains water & some other odd things - no actual bar items. Ours didn't work, but since it doesn't hold anything but water, we were fine with our own little cooler for our waters - ice machine was down the hall & always worked. The walkways in Harrah's are much narrower than some of the other hotels like Bellagio & Ceasars ... and no real "fancy" dinner place - but many nice restaurants right next door at Venetian. Harrah's is a great location - central to many other hotels, has a monorail station, etc. But it gets super crowded in the casino walkway areas. The machines were pretty tight on Christmas week - we did not break even there - had to go further south on strip to do that. Another plus is the ease of getting in & out of parking garage, both to drive out and to get from garage to lobby/check in area - much closer and easier access than many of the humongous Vegas hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Bad services, good location!”
Reviews.Author: legstogo
Reviews.Content: The stay started out bad. Check in had long line,there were 3 clerks checking people out and one checking people in. had to wait 25 minute to check in. When someone asked why there was only 1 person checking people in, she was told someone would be out in 15 min (never happen). My stay was 4 days and 3 nights and each day we received no maid services, had to call everyday. We would leave the hotel at 7 or 8 in the morning and return around 3 to take a nap and room was not cleaned, first day I was understanding but the second time i needed to speak to a manager. I have visited Vegas for the last 5 years (2x a year) first time and last time in Harrah's. The location was great access to other hotels and monorail service very easy accessible.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good place”
Reviews.Author: Jordan Y
Reviews.Content: i was expecting alot worse, but was pleasantly surprised that the room wasn't that bad. pros: on the strip, the two beds were pretty comfortable- slept very good, a/c wasn't loud plus it has sensor, and bathroom decently large. cons: the dresser where the tv was placed in was a little annoying- the doors kinda blocked the tv and it didn't pull out all the way. overall i enjoyed my stay at harrah's- i will definetely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great price for centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: SwarleyBravo
Reviews.Content: Harrah's is located in the center of the strip, it is conveniently located nearest the monorail though if you want to work off the buffet meals everything is within reasonable walking distance. We stayed in the Mardi Gras tower overlooking the strip, from memory we payed $170 for 5 nights which is a great deal. The room was lovely, well serviced had all modern amenities. The hotel had an excellent buffet for a great price. It also included a coffee shop, several other restaurants and a 24hr convenience store that had a great selection of quality items. All staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “good location and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: leena23
Reviews.Content: I was not sure what to expect when I booked the hotel but had a overall good experience. The hotel is ideally located on the strip and major attractions are located within a distance of 1-2 miles. The casino of the hotel is average. The rooms are spacious and clean with all basic facilities. The hotel should make arrangements for providing comp. hot breakfast in place of breakfast coupons of Starbuck's.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in the middle of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: maxmuscle03843
Reviews.Content: Harrahs is a hotel and casino for the middle class masses. The rooms are adequate and clean. The target market clientele for this hotel is middle aged middle America. Harrah's is similar in quality to a Mariott, which isn't necissarily a bad thing. The casino has a low ceiling in part of the slot area which I didn't care for too much, it gave a closed in feeling. It's not a place to stay if you want extras like fountains, volcanos, gondolas, or pirate battles. It's a no frills place that gives you a clean room in the middle of the strip for a good value. If you need someone to hold your hand or turn down your bed, you'd be best to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Don't think we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: ymbl
Reviews.Content: First time in years we've stayed at Harrah's. While I love the casino, I don't know if we'll be staying here again. We booked the room using AA Vacations so we could use my airline miles. When we got here they said they had no regular king rooms available. Had the area been booming with jolly Christmas tourists, I'd believe it. But I've never seen so few people in Vegas, so I have to believe we got a base room because we used my airline miles instead going directly through Harrah's. The room itself isn't horrible. Think La Quinta. However, the bathtub faucet won't quit running, we're directly over the heat/air units so there's a constant whirring. Also the bathroom lighting is yellow, so putting makeup on is a trial. The bed in comfy though, so that's a plus. Don't plan on using the TV while in the room. Even The Weather Channel is bad; however, you don't come to Vegas for TV, so maybe I should give the lousy cable/satellite service props for getting customers out in the gaming rooms spending money. The cafe was one of the biggest disappointments. almost $30 for eggs, bland potatoes and sausage links. You can definitely do better elsewhere on the strip. I wish we'd stood in the Starbucks line, grabbed coffee and banana nut bread instead. AND the Starbucks Internet that's free everywhere else, isn't free in Harrah's if you book through an AA Vacations program. I think we'll be back at MGM next time we come to town. One positive: the housekeeping and maintenance people are beyond nice. Also we wanted a late check out. When we checked in the girl at the desk said it wouldn't be a problem and if we'd just call down the day we left, the front desk would take care of that for us. She said it might cost $20 for a half day rate. When we tried to do so, the front desk person said no. Or yes, but only if we paid for an entire extra day. We already knew we wouldn't stay at Harrah's again, but this just sealed the deal.

Reviews.Title: “It's a simple, clean place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Bruin014
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the renovated rooms recently. It was clean, neat and basic but overal fairly nice. The beds were comfortable and there was the added bonus of a tv in the bathroom. You could tell where they still needed a few touch up here and there with the reno but based on the outdated or "classic" look of the rest of the building I'd say the renovations were a huge leap up. However on a note for people with dietary concerns; the food isn't lactose intolerant or wheat intolerant friendly. Good deals tho.

Reviews.Title: “Another satisfying stay”
Reviews.Author: sled_head67
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights December 15 to 20. We enjoyed our stay. The rooms were clean and the location is great. We had a rental car so we travelled around Vegas quite a bit. Harrah's is a great place to stay for the price. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Worth what I paid and then some.”
Reviews.Author: Karyn_DE
Reviews.Content: If I had listened to a few of the reviews, Harrah's would not have been a choice. For the perfect location and cost of the room, our trip was well worth the $$ and then some. Granted the air conditioning wasn't the best and the KGB was closed during our whole stay but the overall condition of the room and hotel were great. No complaints from me.

Reviews.Title: “Business and fun in vegas”
Reviews.Author: bizandtour
Reviews.Content: Love the location of this hotel right up to the sidewalk in the most bustling part of the strip. Great rates. The property is showing some age but there have been some updates. It appears Harrahs corp is positioning this property at the lower end of the price range and managing accrordingly (fill the space left by closed Sahara). Was surprised by a long wait in the buffet line despite the room being half empty. Once in however the quality and service was good. Its lively at night. Enjoyed the dueling piano bar. Easy to walk between casinos as opposed to the more sprawling remote properties. Very short walk to Jimmy Buffet's Margaritaville. Just outside on the south end is an outdoor stage with live acts going all the time and an open market. ITs monorail stop made for chaep and easy access to the convention center. My favorite place to stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid as much as possible. They are thieves.”
Reviews.Author: AlexMVilnius
Reviews.Content: We got our stuff stolen from the hotel room (exp. laptop, iPads, smartphones, papers). Nobody cares. Their staff confirmed with us and police that the door lock was broken initially but later they decided to "forget about it" and said that the door was working properly. Their risk manager R.T. Germain ignored our phone calls and email for about a week (10-12 phone calls, about 6 answering machine messages and NO REPLY)! I just suppose he supported the thieves. Their so-called 3rd party administrators (CCMSI Las Vegas) wasted about a month trying to get any info from the hotel and finally decided that "Door was ok" and as far as we haven't used their tiny safe (no room for laptop in their safe for sure) and door was ok hotel is right and we should get the [--] out of there. It seems they haven't contacted neither Hotel Security officer who signed up our report neither police who saw the broken door lock. Stay away from the hotel who support thieves and doesn't care about visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Harrahs”
Reviews.Author: greenridersfan
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Harrah's several times and we find that they provide a clean, welcoming and fun experince. Stayed in the Mardi Gras tower on the 15th flr, beds were very very comfortable and housekeeping did a great job. All the staff at Harrah's were friendly and helpful at all times. Would definitely recommend this hotel for good value. As far as the gambling went, I was able to finally play for quite awhile on my money and even won abit. It was good trip!

Reviews.Title: “Love my stay at Harrahs”
Reviews.Author: Christine C
Reviews.Content: This is my six stay at a Harrahs Casino Hotel in Las Vegas and Atlantic City. I love the location in both cities and the convenience to all attractions. I decided to upgrade to an deluxe room on my last stay and was slightly disappointed with the actual room size compared to the online images. The room was smaller than I expected. My cousin chose the standard room and her room was much larger. I did love the room locations because of the spectacular view. The room had a flat screen tv in the bedroom and bathroom area. Overall, the service was excellent and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: fencejumper
Reviews.Content: I go to Las Vegas several times a year for either a convention or to see shows. First time at Harrahs. Stayed on the 14th floor of the Carnival Tower. It was more than adequate for my stay-large, clean and comfortable room with a decent shower. Window at the bottom opened, and had a view of the mountains to the east. Was at the end of the hall-quiet. Elevators were rapid and usually empty. Good shows at the hotel. Got 2 free 24 hour buffet passes and it was a very expensive stay.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's Las Vegas December Visit”
Reviews.Author: pgirl1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's for the first time in early December. We had a comped room and ended up with a renovated room in the Mardi Gras Tower on the 6th floor overlooking the pool. The room was very quite and newly renovated. The bed was comfortable and the pillows were the best. There was a flat screen in the bedroom and a smaller flat screen in the bathroom. There was also a coffee maker in the bathroom which was a big plus. The room size was decent, the bathroom a bit small but overall it was a nice room. My parents also stayed at Harrah's and their room was not renovated. Very old and dated. They switched rooms the next day but it still wasn't as nice as ours. It was the luck of the draw as their room was also comped. Valet parking was easy and the check in counter is steps away from the valet entrance which is in the back of the hotel. There are two towers but both are close to the check in counter so you aren't dragging your luggage through the casino. We had no problems with our 3 night stay. The location is great but I must say I don't like the casino. The ceilings are low and it just feels cramped even though it is large. Drink service was so so. Not great, not terrible. Depends on the time of day, the server, etc.

Reviews.Title: “try to get you to up grade”
Reviews.Author: mytrip67
Reviews.Content: we stayed at harrah's las vegas last week and we booked a king size bed. when we checked in they said no king size beds were available, but of course they said we could up grade and pay for a suite. we said no we would take the 2queen beds and our room ended up having 2 double beds, so for the 5 day stay my husband and i slept in seperate bed.. i talked to other guest and 3 more people in the same week had this happen to them.. i started to wonder if this harrah's way of making you pay more and up grade?

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: ladysk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 9 day stay. I have been visiting Las Vegas for about 20 yrs on an annual basis. I have stayed at numerous hotels. My husband is now in a wheelchair and I was worried about this trip. I have nothing but good things to say...great room, great price, extremely friendly staff, location is tops. This is now my new place to stay in Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for more....”
Reviews.Author: cocotte300
Reviews.Content: Our vacation was from November 22 to December 2nd. Everything was like we expected and more. We arrived early like around 12h00 and we had no problem getting our room right away. We were offered and upgrade for a room with a strip view; $10 a night extra....why not since 5 out of 9 nights were comped. We got a nice room on the 17th floor facing the Mirage. Ok, the hotel is aging but everything is in good working condition, clean and quite. This is all we were expecting. If you want more fancy you need to pay for. To be honest, after visiting the newer casinos, we found the Harrah's more welcoming. What I mean is the larger the get, the colder they are. In 9 days, we went up and down the strip many times and always was happy to come back to Harrah's. Denny's restaurant is just next door and is always a good place to go when you don't know what to eat anymore. Not a buffet fan so can't comment on that. All the restaurants are pretty good and not as pricey as we were excepting. Staff is friendly and always helpfull. We will come back to Las Vegas one day and stay at Harrah's again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for your Money”
Reviews.Author: herrington5
Reviews.Content: We stayed there Dec 5-11 and it was on the outdated side but other than that everything else is great. We were impressed how clean our rooms were and promt they were with maid service and friendly staff were alawys willing to help you in any way you needed. I would recommend staying here the price is good and will be amazed at how clean it is I read and looked at pictures before we went and was kinda scared but once we got here and looked around I dont know where the picutres or bad review were because our experience was great. Our room view was amazing because we could look out our room and see mountains and the Mirage and watch the Volcano errupt from our room.

Reviews.Title: “great location; great value”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMonkee
Reviews.Content: Harrah's Casino is located perfectly on the strip. Easy to get to alot of NICE casinos, pools, ect. McDonalds is right out the front door and so is a liquor store. Perfect to grab a beverage and hit the strip. Rooms are nice, casino is nice and they have great entertainment as well: fun Piano Bar and an outside bar with great dance music.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay in the Tower Nearest Carnival Court”
Reviews.Author: Frenchy49829
Reviews.Content: When you check into Harrah's in Las Vegas, make sure that you request a room anywhere away from the music in the Carnival Court. I believe the music goes to about 4 a.m! There's no way you'll get any sleep if you are there with the music blaring through your windows.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time Around Alot Better”
Reviews.Author: clairhas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Harrahs last December and thought I would try the hotel again especially since we got our rooms for a very low rate and it was too good a deal to pass up. My mom and I stayed here for 3 nights and everything was great about this visit. Checked in after 8:00pm and there was no wait. I asked the front desk clerk for an upgrade and was told nothing was available but he told us we would be happy with our view. He did give us a 2 for 1 coupon book which saved us alot of money on shows. Our deluxe room was in the Mardi Gras tower on the 17th floor and we had our own set of elevators that were very fast and we never had to wait for them. When we got to our room and looked out our window - it was an amazing view of the strip with the Mirage Hotel directly in front of us and we could see the Volcano Show plus several hotels from both directions and the mountains in the background. The room was very simple and I guess my only complaints would be the 1980's TV and the old fashioned shower with curtain plus the rough sheets they use on the bed were that great. The bathrooms could definitely use an update. I would recommend the following restaurants in the hotel - Range Steakhouse had excellent steaks and the basket of different breads they bring you was so yummy. Toby Keith's Bar and Grill had excellent Catfish Po Boys and Ming's Table had really good eggplant and Pad Thai Noodles. If you want a really good frozen Vodka drink then you need to stop by NUMB Bar. I know everyone says this over and over again but it is true - this hotel is in a very convenient location on the strip because the walking distance to hotels on either side of us did not take that long so we were very happy with our location.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel and casino in the heart of the strip.”
Reviews.Author: rmg15
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at Harrah's. While the casino was a bit smoky, the rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. My only complaint about the room was that instead of providing a fridge, they provide a mini-bar and goodies that you can buy. The poker room was small and mostly empty but the action was good. I did less well at the sports book.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value - Center of Strip”
Reviews.Author: JeffCS
Reviews.Content: In my opinion if you want a decent, convenient, fairly valued room in the prime part of the Vegas Strip, Harrah's is excellent. The room was clean. The restaurants were good, not great. The locations is perfect for walking both north and south. There is a monorail stop. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They do not charge the "resort fee" (a form of robbery). I have stayed in 5-6 properties and my conclusion is for a value priced trip without all the over the top glitz....Harrah's is a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Price & Location are positives”
Reviews.Author: Rainbow9
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a short trip 12/1-12/4. Aside from issues with our drunk, LOUD and stupid neighbors, our stay was enjoyable. Checkin was quick because it was late and we got a room in the Mardi Gras tower as requested. The room was refurbed somewhat recently and fairly nice for the pricepoint of the hotel. Harrah's best features are the location on the strip, staff and casino size being easy to navigate. It's in the middle of all the action on the strip and the walk from your room to the street is quick. Unfortunately, we did not get to try any of the restaurants but we would stay again for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs Las vegas”
Reviews.Author: bvmlr
Reviews.Content: After visiting Las Vegas for many years this was our first stay at Harrahs. I did not find the employees very welcoming. They would answer any questions we had, but always seemed annoyed having to do so. The room was clean and comfortable, but did not like their air conditioning system. Their air conditioning is on a sensor, everytime you leave your room it shuts off. I did not like returning to a hot room when it's already 100' outside. Even after returning, the room never cooled. We called and reported the problem. Maintenance came to override the sensor so it would run continuously. We had maintenance come 3 times to do this over our weeks stay. We enjoyed the buffet where the food was always plentiful & hot. Pool is ok, nothing to brag about. We did love the location of being more mid-strip. I may stay here again because of the price, but will check out other hotels first. One big plus is Caesars properties do not charge the ridiculous resort fees.

Reviews.Title: “Non-smoking rooms”
Reviews.Author: Scootron
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Harrah's for a week and had a non-smoking room booked on a non-smoking floor. Unfortunately, there is no such thing in this hotel. Their air system is terrible and the room, halls, restaurants, and hotel lobby reeks of so much smoke that it was impossible to sleep or enjoy the stay (unless you really enjoy living in nicotine and smoke). Visited several other hotels while there and none were even close to this bad. Even the air in the other hotels casinos was better than that in Harrah's rooms. Needless to say, won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Getting Tired”
Reviews.Author: Flyboy328
Reviews.Content: Just back and I have to say they need to upgrade everything before the place is imploded. Attitude can go a long way but soiled and ripped uniforms on dealers/staff do not cut it. There seems to be an attitude of if we can hang on till we retire it will be OK. Staff was not as good as five years ago and I do not believe they have fixed or updated anything since then. One shining pt was the Ranch steak house which did its usual good job. When you go to Harrah's do not have high expectations and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Remarkable”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany P
Reviews.Content: Well, was expecting a lot from this place. Its very plain but does the job. Located right on the Strip street does definately helps but definately not the place for those looking for a luxurious stay Would recommend this place for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Located!!!”
Reviews.Author: Carrie F
Reviews.Content: Harrah's isn't the flashiest place in town but it was perfectly located and for such a great price I would have expected less but was pleasantly surprised. We had a great stay and will be staying here again next time we come. The rewards card didn't really seem worth the trouble unless you plan on dropping some serious cash. Great stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but don't let them take your money.”
Reviews.Author: patrod89
Reviews.Content: Harrah's Hotel and Casino is located on Las Vegas Blvd in Las Vegas, NV. A major plus for the hotel is that it is in the middle of the strip close to everything! Imperial Palace is too the left with the Venitian to te right and The Mirage and Ceasar's Palace across the way. The rooms are bland and cliche but nice. The hotel is clean and respectable. My room had a great view of Las Vegas and of the strip. There are some comedy shows in the hotel as well as restaurants. Don't find yourself saying Las Vegas has good food because it doesn't. Not even Toby Keith's place in Harrah's is any good. The casino itself is like any other Vegas casino on the strip. The "cheaper" gambling is located off the strip in Downtown Las Vegas. The cheapest in the city being El Cortez. Harrah's is less glitzy than most modern Vegas hotels but it is close to all of them and you can stay here for a fraction of the price. It lacks a "theme" like most other Las Vegas hotels but it tries to maintain a middle-eastern one which it fails at. Overall it is one of the better less-glamourous places to stay in Las Vegas with a good pricetag.

Reviews.Title: “Third stay at Harrahs”
Reviews.Author: trueblue001
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at Harrahs in the last two years. First time in a Deluxe room, 7th floor, Mardi Gras tower, facing Treasure Island. The room is more recently updated. Flat screen tv, and one in the bathroom. Bathroom is a little tight. A little awkward to turn shower on from outside tub. Toilet in the way. Not a big deal though. Decent water pressure in the shower. Room was clean with efficient maid service. Sliding glass door with tiny balcony, enough room just to stand. Bed was comfortable, but the pillows are my only complaint, too hard as usual. Did not have any noise issues, but there is always potential for that, depending on your neighbors. Will stay again. It's not fancy here, but I have always had a clean room and a decent price, with a great center strip location.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable but a little tacky”
Reviews.Author: katdarcy
Reviews.Content: Wanted to stay on the strip and Harrah's was recommended as being affordable. Room was nothing special but comfortable and a quiet haven when the slot machine noise became unbearable. The walk from car park to room was quite a trek, especially when moving in and out with bags. All in all it was good value, but if I could afford to upscale I would do so.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Rooms are Dated”
Reviews.Author: iluvmycharger
Reviews.Content: The Harrah's is best for location. The actual rooms well- they are not much to talk about. We had a door that did not close and did not realize it until one day when we left I went to go back in the room and it just pulled open. WHAT!! I passed out the night before with a laptop out and like 1000 sitting out!!! YIKES. Check your doors. The room was free for 10 ays or I would complain more. I stay to play and by the time I am in the room it looks like it is moving. GOOD LUCK! P.S. The Buffet is HORRIBLE!!! It was the greasiest thing I ever puked. Plus the pool is smaller than some people's bath tubs.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Harrahs”
Reviews.Author: Hospitaladmit
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Harrahs in Las Vegas many times and they never disappoint. The location is perfect. We like the fact that its not one of the largest places, so its easy to get around but yet theres still plenty to do. Even though the hotel has been around awhile, the rooms still look very good and clean. The lifts are very fast which is another plus for me. The flavors buffet is very good also. The people that work there are always very nice and helpful. And the cocktail servers are better and faster than most. We also seem to win more money there than most places. Harrahs is always my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back in march”
Reviews.Author: Karen R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrahs for the second time in two years. We stayed from November 14 - November 18, the rewards program with Ceasars properties is pretty good. My 50th birthday was on the 15th so this trip was booked well in advance. A month before we left Ceasars sent us a room comped for 2 nights. We travel to Vegas twice a year in November and March, and book with vacation packages usually Southwest. We already had a room so we took the second room comped for 2 nights and they only charged us 30.00 a night for the other 2 nights. This was the only bad thing I can say about this trip. We had rooms on the 8th floor in the Carnival tower, Well this is bad because being on a lower floor near the Carnival Bar the noise even with ear plugs is BAD. I called in the morning and this wonderful girl named Heather felt bad it was my 50th. She had us moved on to the 14th floor in the Madi Gras tower with adjoining rooms. The rooms were beautiful, they also had balconies. WE have always stayed where we the best rate is, on a good room in Vegas. We are going back in March and will be at Harrahs. They treated us great.

Reviews.Title: “Three day stay at Harrah's LV”
Reviews.Author: DezinerDiva
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's for three days after Thanksgiving. I asked for a room that was high up and something quiet. They gave us room 2958 which had a view of the mountains and was on the back side of the tower. The room was large and clean. I checked for bed bugs before bringing luggage into the room and found nothing. The rooms do not have a fridge or a microwave, so plan around that if need be. We did have some issues with that as I am on a restricted diet, so just be aware. You can request a small fridge to be brought to the room, however. The room had two queen beds and we had one bed while our 14-year-old son used the other. We were all very comfortable in the room thanks to how large it was. We will definitely stay there again. Free parking available behind the casino/hotel. Excellent location for accessing everything.

Reviews.Title: “Hurray for Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: MightyredEngland
Reviews.Content: Spent a lovely 3 days at Harrah's on the Vegas Strip. Not a 5 star hotel but it is centrally located and not far from the Wynn, Venetian and Bellagio. Opposite to the forum shops (Over 160 stores) @ Caesars Palace. Room was a king size with a decent tv. Even came with a breakfast deal at the internal Starbucks. Nice buffet available for lunch and best of all... No resort fees.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Thanksgiving Trip...Got Upgraded Room”
Reviews.Author: DuaneT
Reviews.Content: I've gone to Harrahs Las Vegas for about 12 years. After reading the reviews and after seeing the cost cutting changes in other Harrahs properties, I lowered my expectations. But after an overnight flight, we arrived on Friday (the weekend before Thanksgiving) around 10:00 AM. Our room was part of a comp promotion but we were pleased when they upgraded us to a mini-suite room facing towards Venetian with a quiet view of the strip and the Mirage volcano. The larger room was a nice upgrade and view was great. The bed was very comfortable and the this section of the hotel was quiet. Harrah's has gone "pet friendly". I've stayed at the other Harrah's properties over the past few years and Harrahs Las Vegas has had it share of cost cutting measures, but none were visible to us on this trip as compared to properties on the East Coast. Hint: Always ask for an upgrade. If there is no convention in town, there's probably a good chance there are rooms available. We enjoyed this stay to Harrahs and plan to return again. It's a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Multiple room rates”
Reviews.Author: SVMandanND
Reviews.Content: We paid three different rates for 3 consecutive days, not too bad average of 60.00 per night. Room was okay, King bed was comfortable. But, the noise between rooms was really something, we had a couple in the room next to ours and above ours, between the overhead noise and the people in the room next to ours who were screaming at each other it was noisey. The buffet was great, we got there just between changes from breakfast and lunch, had both.. the crab legs were great. Gambling in the casino was very unlucky,,, maybe just me. Otherwise it was nice. The show "Defending the cave man was funny" at the small theater.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time or money”
Reviews.Author: newlywed_traveler24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's this past Thanksgiving weekend from Wednesday to Sunday. The entire hotel was not very clean and smelled of smoke even in our rooms, which was on the 10th floor and was suppose to be nonsmoking. I know most casinos in Vegas smell of smoke, but this was beyond awful. When we returned home, I even had to wash my clean clothes because they all smelled of smoke. I would never waste my money to stay here again. It is a good location, but my best advice is to stay across the street at the Mirage for 20 more a night.

Reviews.Title: “RIGHT IN THE MIDDLE OF ALL THE ACTION!”
Reviews.Author: tyedyecouple
Reviews.Content: stayed thanksgiving week with a comp classic room.was offered an upgrade for $15 a night and i declined. was on the 18th floor of carnival court overlooking the pool which was closed.nice clean room and no problems with the hvac sensor. played slots and keno avoided the 6/5 blackjack. went to TI for v/p they had 9/6 JOB overall a nice stay for the price (COMP) this was a solo trip, would stay elsewhere if the wife comes along. did not eat at the buffett.took the shuttle from the airport total time was 15 min from the airport to harrahs, check in was fast and painless.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: lu123442
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and within close proximity to The Venetian, The Mirage, Caesar's Palace, Treasure Island and Fashion Show mall. The shuttles and monorail are right behind the hotel however we did not use them. Our room was quite large and located in the Carnival Tower. It consisted of 2 double beds (which were very comfortable), a desk, TV, wardrobe, 1 small table and 2 chairs and the bathroom was more than adequate for the two of us. The buffet breakfast was very good with a great variety of food. Overall we enjoyed our stay at Harrah's and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really good for 35$ +Tx”
Reviews.Author: SebTD
Reviews.Content: The cons : - They use a lot a air refresher (which could be overwhelming). - Sound proofing could be better (I heard the couple next door do the "activities" a four in the morning, at lest the seem to have both enjoyed them self). - Wifi cost 10$ a day !!!!! The plus : - Very clean !!!!! - Beds ware very conmy !!! - Wall safe - Fast elevator - Free parking - Starbuck in the lobby

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: buffalogal8202
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Harrahs for 5 days to attend the SEMA conference at the Convention Center. After researching rates everywhere, Harrahs had the lowest rates on a mid-strip hotel for that time. We arrived at approx 5 p.m. on a Saturday, with no wait line to check in.
