We had booked the lowest rated "Classic" room, and were offered at upgrade to a remodeled room for $15/night, so we took it. It was still the best deal on the strip. The room was small, but very nice. There was a flat screen TV in the bedroom and bathroom. Everything was modern and the bed was incredibly comfortable. We stayed in the Mardi Gras tower with a horrible view, but that was fine. I had specifically requested a room away from Carnival Court....so no view, but quiet for sleeping. Housekeeping was perfect our entire stay. It was a non-smoking room and smelled great, no problems there. Food was expensive in the cafe, so hubby headed to McDonalds every morning right next door to grab us coffee, juice and food. It was much cheaper and very convenient. The location was perfect!! For SEMA, Harrahs being on the monorail made it easy and convenient to get back and forth to the convention center. For activities on the strip, Harrahs location was perfect as well! It was an easy walk to upscale shows and restaurants at Caesers, the Venetian/Palazzo, Bellagio, Cosmo and Aria. When we wanted some $5 Craps or Blackjack tables on the strip, Casino Royale was next door and Shea's was a very short walk away. Carnival Court always had music and fun at all hours when we just wanted to sit down, have a drink and people watch. Sure, the casino was a bit on the smoky side, but most of them are. Overall, the value was amazing. A great room, a great location and a very low rate for the week we were there. We had an amazing time! We would def choose Harrahs again. It definitely helps us stretch our budget in Vegas while staying in the middle of the action, in a clean, comfortable, modern room.

Reviews.Title: “Good second stay at Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: Margaritamom
Reviews.Content: Trip dates: October 24 – 30, 2011 How I booked: I had stayed at Harrah’s in November 2010 so I used my TotalRewards card/membership to book a longer stay for me and my husband this year. Four of the six nights were comped and I was able to book a Deluxe room for the remaining two evenings at a good price. Received prompt confirmation of my booking and my preferences: non-smoking. Check-in: This is where you find out what “Preferences” really means. I had e-mailed ahead to confirm our stay and to request that the Deluxe room be on a high floor away from the noise of Carnaval Court. The reality? Although I had paid a extra to book a Deluxe room, I was told upon check-in that the room type I’d booked was a Preference and not a Guarantee. Fair enough but then why charge more for the Deluxe? Our arrival was disappointing and not a fabulous way to start my week in Vegas. The gentleman who checked us in also said that it was best to close up our account at the onset which we found out later did not allow us to charge items to our room (ie. buffets, etc). Room: Ended up in Carnival Tour in a Luxury Room that overlooked – you guessed it – Carnaval Court. We were high enough that it was only mildly annoying as long as we kept the window shut at night but during our last stay we were on the other side of the hotel and were able to keep the window open at night which kept it cooler when the motion-controlled A/C turned off at night. As we weren’t able to do that this trip, we occasionally had wave our arms to try and get the A/C going again. The room itself had a comfortable king bed and overall was still a good value considering we were able to have four nights comped. Housekeeping: Excellent! Room was clean and our towels and other amenities were replaced as required. Buffet: Purchased the Buffet of Buffets and started with a late breakfast in Harrah’s. Once again the food was good and the service was excellent. Mac King Comedy Show: Had a ticket for free admission with the purchase of two drinks at $9.95 each and paid $5 extra each for VIP admission which also gave us a 2 for 1 buffet VIP buffet pass in the hotel. This show was absolutely worth the cost as Mac King was excellent – entertaining and funny. Overall: The room wasn't what I expected and if they'd given me the room I'd booked (or even a Luxury room that didn't overlook Carnaval Court) - that would have made this a four star stay. The staff were great, the room was clean, and we had a six night stay for a great price. We would stay at Harrah's again.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's - good budget option”
Reviews.Author: Maureen F
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrah's November 10-14 with my sister for a girls weekend in Vegas. Chose Harrah's for its central location and nearby amenities (restaurants, shopping, lounge scenes). Room - had an upper floor in Carnival tower with 2 queen beds. Lots of room; Moderate decor and clean. View of Mirage volcano. No noise issues. Did experience the auto a/c issue at night but just opened window for some fresh air. Location - love the location; could shop at Forum or walk to Fashion show; quick walk anywhere. Liked the Carnival court area. Only downside is the challenge of getting a taxi in and out the back, however compared to the strip access at IP this was better. Restaurants - ate at Toby Keith's which was okay; food is good, service is so-so. Ate at cafe 3 times for the Italian feast night. We both enjoyed this - for under $20 you had a 3 course italian meal and a glass of wine. Gambling - enjoyed playing in the Toby Keith party pit (during the day); later the dancing girls came out, but that seemed more common in most of the casinos. Really enjoyed playing with the Dealertainers next door at IP. Overall - location, location location can't be beat; no resort fee; reasonable room.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: crystart
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Nov 2011. Booked basic room and was offered upgrade to deluxe room for $15/nt more. Rooom was clean, a was bathroom. Just like pic online. I like that the Ceasers hotel group doesn't have the "required" $15/nt resort fee like the MGM properties. Only downside to Harrah's (aside that the property is older and undergoing renos), is that there is a loud outside club near the entrance which can be heard in your room. I didn't ind it disturbingly loud but many probably would. I want to check out the Go Rooms at Flamingo - heard they were awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: kkstraveler10
Reviews.Content: Hotel location on the strip is fantastic, it's so easy to go north or south to see the sights. Check in was quick and easy. Our room was an average room, clean but not very modern. Our view was of another wing of the hotel, so not very exciting. Spent our check in night at their casino, and had an overpriced snack too. Didn't try out their restaurants since we were always out. Overall, the hotel just isn't memorable, but since we were only there to sleep, it's not a big deal. With their great location, it was easy to walk to the more exciting hotels.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay and play”
Reviews.Author: scarlet34075
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from Las Vegas we stayed at Harrahs the check in was easy and quick. Our room was clean and quiet we were on the carnaval side. The maids were pleasant when we met them in the hall they greeted us and asked if we were enjoying our stay. The casino allowed us to relax and had plenty of slots to please anyones needs. The restaurants in the casino were a little pricey but the food was good as were the portions. Overall we will return to Vegas and will stay at Harrah/s again

Reviews.Title: “Old”
Reviews.Author: Maryam A
Reviews.Content: Was here for a conference. It was OK. There is no wireless internet in the entire hotel!! Overall hotel old and needs updating. Conference facilites fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Compo1
Reviews.Content: Harrah's is set in a great location and I am sure that it would have been a fantastic hotel back in the late seventies/early eighties. The room we were placed in was horrible - dust everywhere, leaking taps, blocked toilet. It looked like Huggy Bear had left in a hurry. We asked to move twice and were told no other rooms were available. The worst part being that when we woke in the morning we had been bitten on our legs and stomach - the women on reception obviously denied all knowledge of bed bugs... There are much nicer hotels nearby - spend the little bit extra they cost as Harrah's may once have been a nice hotel but is now dirty and the people that work there could not care.

Reviews.Title: “If location is key then Harrah's is the place for you!”
Reviews.Author: kmoyer
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at Harrah's last week. Upon booking our trip like 7 months ago, I read lots of reviews on TA as I always do before planning a trip and like all places I read good and bad and decided to go with Harrah's for price and convenience. We had never stayed there, and hadn't been to Vegas in 11 years. Last visit we stayed at NYNY. Upon checkin we were offered to take the upgrade for add'l $15/night. I said let's check the room first, you never know. So we did. The room appeared fine, the bed was very comfy and since we didn't plan to spend time in the room we decided to stay with original booking. It was very mediocre. There wasn't even a comfy chair to sit in, just a small table with 2 dinette type chairs and the tv was old, but the room appeared clean and did not smell, it was o.k. Then the shower head was awful! There was not much pressure and the water leaked onto the floor and made a huge puddle. Hubby wanted to leave and go to upgrade and prob. could/should have, but didn't want to lug my stuff to another room, because the bed was very comfortable and that's really number one on our list. So, overall, I guess you get what you pay for, right? The location is prime, I mean it is right in the middle of the strip and the restaurants we ate in were good. Toby Keith's I Love This Bar is upstairs and was alot of fun. The piano bar is great, the bands out in the carnival court were usually really good and they had heaters out there and it was very comfortable at night. Overall I have to say average because the leaky shower would bring it way down, and lack of a comfy chair to lounge in too, but then the comfy bed and convenient location and other amenities that are right there, bring it back to average. We would not stay here again just because there are so many other options and we'd try another place, but it might not be until another 10 years or so. Overall Vegas is too damn smokey! I cannot believe there are not designated areas of non smoking. That's the way our casinos here in New York are and we'll just win our money closer to home for a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Its all I could ask for”
Reviews.Author: Gator1833
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at Harrah's. This time our room was in the Mardi Gras tower. The room was clean and every thing was in good working order. The staff was extremely professional, friendly and helpfull. The location is super and the shuttles and mono rail are right behind the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a night in hell”
Reviews.Author: Urocat
Reviews.Content: I was booked in this hotel because of my conference, it was hellish from the very start as you come to the entrance you will immediately experience a vail of dread as you view the dirty and cheap fixtures outside that look like they have never been cleaned. As you enter the hotel you will experience the longest check in time in the history of man as 2 check in people attempt to check a line 20 waiting guest. Then you walk past a sea of smoke to your elevator bank if you requested a non smoking rm forget about it by the time you leave this hotel everything you own will smell like a camel cigarette. The rooms define the word shabby. If you are hoping to go the gyn be aware they charge $50 to use the gym all in the experience sucked

Reviews.Title: “Adverage hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Daz793
Reviews.Content: The Harrah hotel is in a great location on the strip opposite Ceasers plaice. The room was clean but view restricted, and not of the strip but the hotel next door . A charge of 15 $ a night was charged to relocate our room to a recently modernised room wirh a view. The hotel has no WI FI but we used McDonalds next door which was a hassle, food in the hotel was expensive so we chose to eat out. There was a large free carpark at the Harrah.

Reviews.Title: “same place?I wonder”
Reviews.Author: TinaT61
Reviews.Content: Over the years have read many hotel reviews. always taken with a pinch of salt. Having already booked at Harrah's, read the reviews...?mistake. No. Arrived 9p.m on check in asked any chance of comp up grade? yes. up from cheapest room in hotel to deluxe refurbished, thank you! All the staff I meet from check in to room staff were 1st class. The room, clean with 2 LCD T.Vs minibar& safe.The bed? oh yes the bed..most comfortable hotel bed ever. The only down side for me, room wasn't made up til 3-4pm not a problem if I came back for my afternoon nap..as sson I had recharged rang housekeeping, room fixed within the hour, perfect. Would return anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location easy access”
Reviews.Author: nmfallguy
Reviews.Content: Harrahs is another casino thats been around for sometime,some of the rooms have been redone to bring them into this century but its a crap shoot if you get one,unless your a high roller.The resturants are over priced so travel a little and save some money.maggionios at the mall across from The Venetian has some great Itiallian food,if you want quick and easy try Casino Royal next door.Back to the rooms, nice quiet clean a bit older. I stayed there for 3 days on a comp. If you have a players card use it,deals are there to be had.Good luck hope this helps....

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: adinarj
Reviews.Content: I loved that this was right in the middle of the strip. Also good: the monorail was right next door at the Imperial. The breakfast buffet had a lot of nice choices. The beds were very comfortable. The service was terrific; everyone attended to our needs. I was on the 29th floor with an amazing view. The included amenities were few and far between, but that's to be expected. I do recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: JamaicaFan017
Reviews.Content: We originally booked our stay at the Flamingo but with the poor quality of the room we moved to Harrahs. We were impressed with the size and cleanliness of the Harrahs hotel room. The bathroom was new and quite spacious. The view was not great but we were not in the room long enough to care. The only problem we had was our remote would not work on the tv so we had to go to the front desk to check out. Other than that great place to stay. We ate at Cafe at Harrahs for breakfast (slow service but good food) and the Flavors Buffet for dinner (decent buffet for the price). The hotel is in a great location and has the Carnaval Court bar right outside which was nice. We will most likely stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay at a reasonable rate”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1065
Reviews.Content: Our room was nice with a large bathroom. The mini bar wasn't stocked which suited me just fine as I could use it as a fridge. I was told it would be stocked upon request. The buffet had a lot of selection but was kind of jumbled up - you'd find scrambled eggs beside seafood.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cancun4EveryOne2
Reviews.Content: My son and I met my daughter in Vegas and she had booked us at the Harrah's. Location was perfect as far as the "strip" location, rooms were nice and quiet, as well as cleaned. The amenities I felt they were a bit cheap as they only gave you a small shampoo and conditioner as most hotels of such caliber give you lotions, etc. Its a nice hotel, but its not a great hotel, but I would give up a thumbs up as they did meet most of my expectations. Lastly, the supposedly "view" room was a partial one and it was not worth the upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price for Great Location”
Reviews.Author: graywolfpack
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrah's Nov 2 - Nov 7. Booked a classic room which is the lowest category. It was our first time in Vegas and we wanted a decent budget friendly hotel in a great location. Harrah's was perfect. Location was awesome. Exactly the best spot close to The Mirage, Caesar's Palace, Venetian, etc. We asked for a quiet room, non-smoking, with a king size bed and a view if possible. We got a quiet room, non-smoking, with a king size bed with a crappy view of pipes. Overall not bad considering we booked the cheapest room possible. We had room 314 in the Mardi Gras Tower. Everything but the view was perfect. Renovated with nice tvs (one in main area and one in the bathroom). Bed was super comfortable, air conditioning was great, no issues. Very clean and lots of space. Granite table tops and in bathroom. Housekeeping was great, no issues. Hotel itself was perfect for us. Not too big. We enjoyed the Flavors Buffet Brunch and it was nice to have a Starbucks so close in the hotel for morning coffee. Casino was good. We really enjoyed our stay at Harrah's and would definitely stay here again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: AkFishinQueen
Reviews.Content: We went to Las Vegas for my husband's 40th birthday.We picked Harrahs because the rate was excellent, about $55 per night through Harrahs Hot Deals, and because of the location. That is the best part of staying at Harrahs. Otherwise, the room was basic, but clean. The pool was small, but I already knew this from other reviews. We were in the Mardi Gras room with no view, but we don't spend much time in the room other than to sleep. No coffee pot, no fridge in the room. However, there is a Starbucks near the monorail entrance. We only ate at Toby Keith's Restaurant at Harrahs once. We did not try any other of their restaurants. I thought the prices were a little to high and there are too many other options in Vegas. The first time I went to the pool, all the seats were taken. I didn't notice the stairs that went up to a second level with more loungers. Drink prices at the pool bar are expensive, like any other pool bar. We bought the large drink that comes in a Harrahs cup that you can keep and re-use later. Bus stops are reasonably close, if you don't like to drive. If you have your own car, the parking garage is convenient as is the valet parking. There is a small liquor store near the outdoor bar Carnival Court, and a Walgreens about a block away. To find the Walgreens, exit Harrah's on on Las Vega Blvd and turn right. If you are looking for luxury and lots of high end restaurants under one roof, then this probably isn't the place for you. Harrah's is no frills, inexpensive and convenient. If you just need a comfortable place to sleep, then Harrahs is fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Danielle O
Reviews.Content: Stayed Friday 11/4 for the night. For $100 on a Friday night on the strip, you really can't complain. Booked the most basic room and it had a king bed, couch/coffee table and sitting area. We stayed on the Carnival side, so the decor was a little dated but the room was clean and very comfortable. They checked us in early and gave us a late check out on Saturday. We were the first room by the elevator--not a prime location but it didn't bother us. If noise bothers you, ask for a room down the hall a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: Mjtaylor409
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas for a fun little vacay with friends and we stayed at Harrah's. Its a nice hotel definitely get the deluxe room. We loved the deluxe room. It was spacious, nice decor, even a flat screen in the bathroom. Harrah's is a great location right in the middle of the strip. The casino was nice. The karoake bar was always rockin'. Overall we had a great time! It's not the fanciest hotel, but it is still a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Treatment of a Loyal Customer”
Reviews.Author: Michael K
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Harrah's numerous times between Las Vegas and Laughlin. Until this trip, I only had one issue with them which the manager corrected. They had treated me great, especially in Laughlin. However, on my recent trip to the Vegas location, we arrived early so I wasn't expecting our room to be ready and it wasn't; no problem since we arrived at 2:30 and check-in is at 4:00. We were given a number to call to check on our room availability. It would have been nice if they could have sent us a text, but we waited until 4:00 before calling. We were told our room was not ready and they couldn't give us an estimated time when it would be. We called again at 4:30, same story. We called again at 5:00 and were told the 4:00 pm check-in time is just an estimate. After that lame excuse, I went back to the desk to inquire if we could at least be given an estimated time. The desk clerk said no, they have no control over when rooms are ready, that's a housekeeping issue. After a brief conversation, I was offered a room on the same floor with 2 queen beds instead of one king as requested. It turned out the room we were given was directly across the hall from the original room! We went out for dinner at 7:30 and housekeeping was cleaning the room adjacent to ours (still not the original room). How much effort would it take to devise a system where rooms are cleaned as they are assigned by the front desk instead of cleaning rooms no one is going to stay in that night?

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with however a very good location”
Reviews.Author: JC_and_JS
Reviews.Content: In contradiction to the other hotels on the strip, Harrah’s is not a thematical hotel and probably therefore not recommended for people who want to experience to stay a night in Rom, Paris, Venice or Luxor. But its location on the strip, just across Ceasars Palace and the Mirage, and next to the Venitian is very good. The rooms were standard and clean, the hotel staff was correct but with the laundry service we noticed that internal communication between them and the hotel staff could be improved as they tried to let us pay twice for the same service.

Reviews.Title: “This is an interesting moderate Hotel inteh Middle of the Action”
Reviews.Author: TravelinUndertaker
Reviews.Content: I was looking to be in the heart of the action on the Strip in Las Vegas and how much more action can you get when the party is right outside your door at Harrah's. When you leave the casino to the left there is an outside bar full of live music, great cocktails, plenty of beer and most of all plenty of shaken your tail feathers. This Hotel allows you to check in with the peace and quiet off the strip and when you want to be in the action you can be. The rooms are nice and the beds are comfy. If you stay pool side, expect to her the party til 3am ... but isnt that what you want anyway? or if you are looking for quiet romantic nights its suggested you do one of two things: 1. Ask for a room that is not poolside which may mean a view of nothing (Which is good if you have a view in the room via candle light and soft music of your own Hint Hint) 2. Pay some more cash and get a higher up strip view and you can be slightly voyer with the windows open but no one can really see you. Gaming here is wild and exciting. If you play slows they are tight but join total rewards. what you loose sometimes is worth it in comps.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location on the strip”
Reviews.Author: NewPaltzNewyorker
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Mardi Gras Tower, 15th floor, with a nice view of the strip for five days in August. Really nice stay and very pleasant front of the house on check in. Nice king size bed in the room, but very small closet/dresser because the fridge and snack bar were below the TV instead of drawers.. which was a draw back for folks staying five days..but the rooms in the Mardi Gras Tower have been renovated.. ours had a flat screen tv in the bedroom and bathroom and a coffee pot (not advertized at all on the website.. but a huge bonus for us) overall a nice hotel/casino in the middle of the strip. We will stay here again next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good "deal" - worth a "spin"”
Reviews.Author: MUTigerInIL
Reviews.Content: Harrah's has done some renovation to rooms and brightened up the casino a bit since the last time I was there. It's a clean, no-thrills place to stay - perfect for the person on a budget (i.e would rather spend money on gambling or entertainment vs. an expensive room). It's in a great, center-strip location, close to numerous casinos, restaurants, and other entertainment. It's a step up from its Imperial Palace neighbor.

Reviews.Title: “Tolerable”
Reviews.Author: CjC4
Reviews.Content: Got there a little early and they wanted an early fee so I checked bags and went over to Sand's Expo to set up my booth. Got back and my room was ready. Stayed on Mardi Gras Tower. Decent room, comfy bed and clean. I was close to the elevator so I heard all the commotion. I was there to work not party and was asleep by 10ish every night. i was on the side facing the IP and the party downstairs but the noise was not to bothersome, I slept through it. Gym was great even though I had to pay, pool was less than stellar no whirlpool-fail! Food was alright at the buffet and restaurant. The Oyster bar killed it. Location was good to find other places to eat and hang. Probably wont stay still a little to smoky smelling for me. Hint go to the Starbucks on the second floor by the tram entrance no line!

Reviews.Title: “They didn't take care of their most valued customers.”
Reviews.Author: Bigdogwdae
Reviews.Content: I've been coming to Las Vegas for 30 years and have achieved a valuable level of privilege. I've noticed it getting more and more, over the last couple of years, becoming the world of bean counters instead of what got me to come back here year after year. Personal care and the ultimate in service. They removed my casino host of over 20 years without even an explanation or where she went. They assign me to a person who for the last two trips doesn't even recognize me let alone get in touch with me. This past trip, saw no communication between me and my host. Not even a bottled water sent to the room. Then the tv blows up and I call engineering to come up and fix it. For two days not tv in the room. Just absolutely inexcusable for a suite holder to be ignored like that and not even an explanation. I wish I had the postage money they spend to get you out here. I could retire. But I did come out and I thought this trip was absolutely the worst customer service I've ever seen. I will start to look elsewhere where my business is more welcome and the customer service is respectable

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Las Vegas for Non-smokers”
Reviews.Author: Inlovewithcanyonvill
Reviews.Content: We hadn't been to Vegas since the late 90's and so we were a little apprehensive as to where would be a good place to stay for 2 nights in late October. We chose Harra's because of some of the great guest comment reviews. We were not disappointed. One of the biggest issues we feared was that the room would smell like smoke and we are non-smokers. We stayed on the 7th floor, room 707. The room not only had NO smoke odors that we could detect but it smelled very nicely scented. We found the room clean and nicely appointed. We would definitely come back to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Horrid Experience at Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: Joy M
Reviews.Content: Had back to back reservations, I told the hotel staff when checking in but apparently that information was not noted anywhere. Receved conflicting explanations about my reservation, whether or not I should move rooms, price of rooms, an alledged cancellation of the reservation -- amazingly these varying explanations all came from the same individual. Finally I was given 5 minutes to change rooms, no time to pack just stuff my things in hotel laundry bags, very kind and helpful bellhop (the only individual I encountered at Harrah's who appeared to care about the guests). I will never return to Harrah's and encourage others to avoid it. Casino was very smokey and smelled bad. Faucet in tub/shower dripped steadily through the 6 nights I was in first room, second room didn't drip.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Times in the Middle of the Strip (Harrah's)”
Reviews.Author: Coconut_Monkey
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrah’s October 23 – 26, 2011; room M935. Arrived at Harrah’s at 1pm and check-in took about 10 minutes; room was ready and clean upon our arrival. No resort fees at Harrah’s. At check-in, they warned us that the noise from outside is quite loud and offered to change us if we needed. No need to change rooms; no noise at all. Harrah’s is in the middle of the strip and quite convenient to all other major hotels/casinos. The hotel is clean and has a great sports book. Drink service in early morning hours (3am-6am) is a little slow; but then it picks up. We did the Buffet of Buffets and it was well worth the money to eat at different locations. Dinner buffet at Rio, breakfast buffet at Harrah’s, and dinner buffet at Planet Hollywood; for all one price. For the money, you can’t go wrong with a clean hotel in the middle of the strip. Fun times at Harrah’s!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Affordable Rates”
Reviews.Author: Kelowna163
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Harrah's for 3 nights to celebrate my 40th birthday. The location is fabulous, situated beside the Venetian and across the street from Caesars and Mirage. We stayed in the Mardi Gras Tower on the 10th floor in a room that has been upgraded. Nice flat screen TV's in room and the bathroom (not that we watched them). Bed was really comfortable pillow top mattress, nice linens and overall great comfortable space. We had a room with sliding glass doors to a very small balcony. This overlooked Carnaval Court. Other reviewers had mentioned that it is really loud and I was concerned when we checked in. However, when the glass doors are closed you can barely hear the music. I liked feeling a part of the party, from our room and it kept the lively Vegas feel still going, while sitting in your room or getting ready for a night on the town. We also had a small view of the Bellagio fountains and a bit of the strip. I have also read a lot of reviews on the air conditioner sensor. The system will only come on if it detects movement in the room. During our stay the temperature outside was in the 90's. When we would first come back to the room it was quite warm, but as soon as the air conditioner turned on, it cooled off very quickly. No complaints with this system. Check in was a breeze and we arrived on a Saturday at 3:30pm. The front desk was more than accomodating in looking to see what rooms were available to ensure we got just what we wanted. Check out was just as easy. No line-ups! There is a good choice of restaurants. We went to the breakfast buffet and there was a great assortment to choose from and everything was very tasty. We also tried KGB Burger and the burgers were really good. The portion sizes are really big too. There was no way we could each eat a burger and fries, so we split it. There is a $2 charge to split meals, but in the long run cheaper than buying two meals that we wouldn't have finished. I signed up for the Total Rewards program. The bonus was the coupon book. We were able to use the buffet coupon and paying $10/person for breakfast to each as much of what you want was reasonable. Unfortunately, this was a quick trip and we didn't get a chance to use any others at the Harrah's group of hotels (Flamingo, Caesars, Imperial Palace, Planet Hollywood, Bally's). The casino is small, but makes it easy to find your way out to the strip and enjoy the sunshine! I did notice a huge abundance of penny slots....this is a big change from my last visit many years ago, when it was hard to locate a nickel machine. Times have changed with the economy! The casino is smokey is some areas (mostly near the hotel lobby/check in). We would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Sue_Dave2011
Reviews.Content: This is a clean, beautifully located hotel in the heart of the strip. It is priced for the middle of the road traveller and has all the amenities of the better hotels in Vegas. It has a large casino that is pretty smoky most of the time (the bigger hotels have far better air quality) but it is always hopping and fun to be in. Buffets are pretty good and the price is reasonable. The valet service is quick and friendly. Overall it is a good choice if you aren't looking to be pampered too much. We couldn't have been more please with the customer service we received from Joyce at the front desk who made all the changes for us to accomodate a room change on day 2 of our trip - it made the difference between a good and very good trip.The location can't be beat for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Heaven142
Reviews.Content: We spent two wonderful nights here. It is always nice to be able to gamble and then when you are ready to retire, just go upstairs to your room. The rooms were spacious and very decorated. Mattress was very comfy. Slept like a baby. Gambled like one also. But oh what fun. Had breakfast at the Buffet and it was great. Visited the little shops outside the casino and they were interesting. We bought gifts we would have never thought of giving. Would reccommend very highly to anyone looking for good sleep, good food, and good gaming.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was Great (Minus the maintenance employee)”
Reviews.Author: ebk1174
Reviews.Content: We go and check out our room on the 4th floor (I requested a low floor room) in Carnival tower. The room was nice with neutral colors and clean. We unpacked and decided to relax and read for a bit. I am sitting on the bed reading and I hear running water. I go into the bathroom and see the tub faucet driopping a steady drip. I try to turn the faucet and can’t stop it. Call down to the hotel info and let them know. They tell me they will send maintenance up. Fine, go back to ready and about 10 minutes later there is a knock at the door. Go get it and it is housekeeping who apologized that she went to the wrong room. Another 10 minutes later maintenance comes up. Takes about 2 min and tells me it is fixed. I thank them and go back to reading. I start hearing the water again, go into the bathroom and it is dripping again. Call again and maintenance comes back in about 5 min. He comes in and really hard turns the faucet and it stops and tells me he is done. I tell him I don’t think it is normal to have to turn the handle that hard. He says it is stopped leaking now and that wasn’t even the problem he was told about for this room. He says he was supposed to come up here for a stopped up tub and shows me his piece of paper. I tell him I didn’t call down for that, I called down for a dripping faucet. Anyway, he leaves and the problem is still not fixed which I inform the front desk about at check out. This was the only negative to Harrah’s that we had- so overall a decent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Roomy”
Reviews.Author: Sherman557
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Harrah's hotel and casino. We loved it! The staff was very friendly. They did all they could to accomodate us. We were checking in on a Sunday (game day) and the woman working behind the counter had a smile on her face the entire time. She was very playful--as our rival teams just happened to be paired up that day. She wished us good luck as she sent us off to our room. The room was beautiful. It was spacious and very clean. We had a great view. The room was huge and VERY reasonably priced. It had a living room, small dining area and bedroom. The bed was very comfortable. We will DEFINATELY be back! We have stayed at a wide variety of hotels on the strip and this was by far the best experience. I will certainly recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: JP1975
Reviews.Content: Had no complaints with my 3 night stay at Harrah's. Room was very clean, everything in the room was in decent shape. We stayed on the 8th floor of Carnaval Tower, no issues with noise at all. Some reviewers noted issues with the air conditioners in rooms, but I didn't feel they were an issue, and I like rooms on the cooler side. Price was very good, and the location in the center of the strip was ideal. Lots of fun things to do in the hotel and in the area. If you're looking for an ultra-luxury hotel, this probably isn't the place for you. But if you're looking for a good, clean room to crash in after a long day in Vegas, it's perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Updated room”
Reviews.Author: fishseattle
Reviews.Content: Book a standard(classic) whatever the word is and when checking in ask about upgrading. We upgraded to Mardi Gras tower 2168. Everything was perfect...front room, couches, bar area...back room, bedroom and gigantic bath, hugh shower for two...yes two large TV's.....super quiet at the end of the hall, but a short walk from the elevator. Thanks Harrahs for a great stay, super comfy beds and very accomodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “OK -That's it”
Reviews.Author: dwluvsvegas
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in Oct. After finally getting into our room at 5:15 pm - I checked the sheets like I always do- There were crumbs and hair in them. So a call to housekeeping to come change them. Next morning the alarm clock in the adjoining room went off at 6:00 am. I finally callled security at 6:15 as it was stgill going off. At 6:30 security finally came to shut it off. Not a nice way to begin our stay here. We were comped for 3 nights out of 4, but I will not stay here again. I prefer the Rio. This is greta location if it is your 1st time to Vegas. I do not like the crowds and this is one othe busiest walkways on the Strip. Staff were not overly friendly. bed was okay. Housekeeping is pretty much non-existent- We had a piece of lint or something that was on the bathroom floor when we arrived and it was still there when we left- also a spider web right on the corner wall of the sink at eye level. I'm on;y 5'3" so I wasn't staring up at the ceiling. Counters weren't washed either, still sticky with hairspray. Low ceilings make for a really smoky environment.

Reviews.Title: “Really, really noisy”
Reviews.Author: June2623
Reviews.Content: I had the unfortunate luck to have a room at Harrahs facing the pool. The extraordinary noise that blarred from the pool area went until 3am one night and 4 am another night. At no time during check in did anyone inform me that I wouldn't get any sleep in a room facing the pool Be sure to ask about this if you go there. I expected some level of music, but also expected it would stop by 10am. Really ruined the stay for me and would never stay there again. No wireless access and not even the ability to check in for your flight online without paying a fee.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ednam090
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband have stayed at Harrahs twice. I love it here. It is a small casino, which I like. It is easy to navigate and to find your fellow travelers. Although the larger casinos are beautiful, I prefer a smaller casino. I do not want to walk a mile to get coffee in the morning. The rooms are small, but clean. The pool area is nice, but again nothing special. If you are looking for a good location (center strip) and nothing over the top than Harrahs is the place.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: trickym81
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Harrah's for four nights and enjoyed it a great deal. The location is excellent and right in the middle of the Strip. The hotel room itself was relatively simple, but it was fine for us. We could even see the mountains from our window. The "Flavors" buffet downstairs near the casino is great and you can get a discount (and $5 in free plays) if you sign up for the Total Rewards card for free. The staff was very friendly and helpful and would smile and say hello if you passed them in the hallway. Again, the best part of Harrah's is the location. You're right near anything and everything you'd like to see and do. I'd certainly stay there again and would consider Harrah's a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's review”
Reviews.Author: AMM34
Reviews.Content: Well I must admit after reading some posts on here I was a littel scared to stay at Harrah's. We arrived 10/14/11 at 9:30 am and were able to check in right away for a $25.00 charge which I thought was great considering our 4 night stay was only going to cost about $70.00 since they comped two of our nights. I was impressed with our room the carpet was fine the beds were clean the bathroom was clean as well as clean towels. We had no problems with our door locking and the safe worked perfect. We have been to Vegas and stayed many different places and I can honestly say I can't wait to go back and I will be staying at Harrah's again.

Reviews.Title: “Probably won't stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Lisalev
Reviews.Content: Overall, I suppose, the experience was not terrible. My sisters-in-law and two nieces had a girls weekend, and we had 3 rooms (7 of us in all). My main gripe was my key did not work 5+ times. Our room was on the 24th floor, so I had to go back to the desk to get a new key. Thankfully, the elevators are VERY fast. I was told to keep the key away from my cell phone and credit cards. This happened again that night - twice!!! By this time, I was pretty upset, as I was dead tired. Got another key, and this time it worked. The next day, both my sister-in-law and I went to the room together, and neither key worked. We were given several reasons - improper insertion (really???), the battery in the lock could be dying, maybe the latch had flopped over.... Another relative staying on the same floor, other wing had her toilet overflow. It took FOUR phone calls to the front desk to get someone up to fix it. By this time, it had run into the hall (thankfully not in her room). She was comped $50. And another relative lost her cell phone. Someone called her, and was told that Security had it. From some of the weird conversations back and forth, we were not sure if security really had it, or if someone was just pretending to be. Then she was told that Lost & Found was not open on weekends. Seriously??? IN VEGAS???? The service in the restaurant, although friendly, was not very quick. And $20 pots of coffee??? We've decided that when we come back, we will probably try another hotel. Oh, and our shuttle bus (Gray Line) did not arrive and the designated 3:15 a.m. time. Thankfully, we called and the 4:15 guy came early (4:00) and we made our flight in plenty of time. We were told by the shuttle driver on the way to the hotel and Gray Line was closing at the end of the month, so beware of service. He was a good guy, though.

Reviews.Title: “A lot better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Wiggy100
Reviews.Content: Stayed for seven nights early October. From the reviews I was not expecting anything great, and was very suprised to find the hotel rooms were well appointed and very clean. The room was cleaned to a high standard with fresh towels daily. Picked up a great deal on this hotel from Trivago at £27 ($40) per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value!”
Reviews.Author: Jasper2769
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here October 8 to 15. There was no wait to check in at all. The room (we were in the Carnaval Tower) was a good size and was clean. No complaints at all in regards to the room. It wasn't loud at all. It was easy to find our way around the resort. The pool could use some updating, but it was clean and not crowded at all. We ate at Toby Keith's and it was good. Also had breakfast at the buffet...it was awesome!! Excellent location and great value for the money. Our only complaint was that the casino could get a little smokey.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at Harrah's from October 5 - 12th”
Reviews.Author: Paula3926
Reviews.Content: Had a great time in Vegas from October 5th - 12th. Stayed in Carnival Tower 12th floor, room at the very end of the hall. Room spacious, clean, bed extremely comfortable. Air conditioning worked well. Tub did have water running continuously (did mention it to the desk) but it really didn't bother me. Staff friendly. Location perfect. Have stayed here before and will certainly stay again. Great price, great location, great staff.

Reviews.Title: “A decent place”
Reviews.Author: magnolia1e
Reviews.Content: Pros-- Clean, comfortable bed, large bathrooms, good restaurants within the hotel, rooms on the cheaper side comparativly, easy access to many things Cons-- They nickel and dime you to death! No coffee in the room, you have to go downstairs and wait in line to get your morning coffee and pay Starbucks prices, $10/day for internet, $5 to print your boarding pass--now THAT is rediculous! Breakfast buffet was very expensive. No conditioner in the room, you can hear through the walls even at a normal talking level I would rather pay a little more in room costs than be nickled and dimed for every item. It would be worth it to not have to get dressed to go get my coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's hits the jackpot”
Reviews.Author: palmbriez
Reviews.Content: stayed at Harrah's from 10/08/11-10/13/11....from check-in to check-out.... Harrahs was more than accommodating....every need met.... extremely satisfied with all the staff...thanks to Matt, in the diamond check-in who took great care in making us comfortable...Mari our waitress who remembers us year after year...and the cleaning staff who always had our room refreshed when we arrived back....hit 2 jackpots during our stay...so thanks also go out to the gambling gods...once again Harrah's hit's the jackpot......

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but not the worst...”
Reviews.Author: PCagle4
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at Harrah's in July and while it was not the best, it certainly was not the worst I have ever been in. The pros: close to everything with it's central location on the strip; has several restaurants, which were all decent; easy to check in; friendly staff; casion was ok I guess, since we went to do other things and didn't gamble. The cons: we were in the section with the funky air conditioning, and in the middle of July, you do not want to be in a room where the a/c stays off unless there is movement. When it was on, it was nice and cold, but when you settled down to sleep at night, you woke up because of the rise in temperature. We were tempted to get one of those flying kids toys and string it up to keep it on, but couldn't find anything to attach it to...lol The section was also kind of run down and dirty looking in the hallways, but the room was always clean but you wouldn't want to walk around in the halls without shoes on. The room could use some updating, as it had a pretty old tv and did not have a minifridge for our water. It did have a microwave, albeit an old one. The pool is really small compared to most hotels, however we didn't use it, so I can't say if it was crowded or not, but I did notice it was not open for long in the evening. If you like convience instead of comfort, then this might be just the place for you, otherwise, you might want to look around for a better room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location on the strip-clean and basic. Monorail station is key.”
Reviews.Author: Bourgo
Reviews.Content: First off this was a girls trip so we were looking for basic, clean accomodations, center strip. We all agreed that cleanliness and convenience were key so we decided on Harrahs for those reasons. we had read other reviews and weren't worried. We got just that. We arrived before check in time and could have checked in but our rooms would have been on different floors so we decided to wait so that we could get three rooms next to each other. The hotel was very accomodating. we had to wait, but so what we we did arrive early and, there were nine of us. They were not adjoining but we were fine with that. We had three rooms on the 15th floor., #s: 1533, 1535 & 1537. The beds were comfortable enough with comfy down comforters. The water was nice and hot but the water pressure was lacking. This was only my second trip to Vegas and I was told that that is a common thing in Vegas. With the water issue it wasn't a big deal. The drainage in the tub was terrible though, The air in my room, 1537, was clearly not working properly but the other two rooms were perfect. Housekeeping did a great job and were super friendly ladies. Tips were well deserved. The casino in Harrah's is, in my opinion, not so hot, it's dark and feels very confined, but I didn't spend much time in it anyway. TIP - for cheap and fun gambling hop on over the O'Shea's just next door. If your not familiar with tables games, as some of my girlfriends weren't, the dealers are GREAT. yes, it's old and a bit divey but good times. I didn't visit the pool - we were pretty unlucky with weather, but a couple of he girls did and said it was pretty cool and would've been fun to hang out at for at least a day if the weather was right. The Spa-one of the girls said it was really nice. Not the top of the line but she had a facial and a massage and loved them both. She told me the facilities were clean and welcoming. If I had had the time I so would have had a body treatment. Room service-tasty and a bit pricey but not really that pricey for what you get and, it's room service so it's always a bit more expensive. Restaurants- Starbucks. imited selection of food but the salads, muffins and breads are top notch and with no coffee pots in the rooms we had it was nice to have it in the buidling. There is also a McD's next door for cheaper, tastieer coffee anyway. I'm a Dunkin girl so Starbucks is just.. Starbucks, Friends went to the cafe for breakfast and it was good. Nothing extraordinary. Toby Keiths and KGB-both AWESOME!!!! Toby Keith's is down home fun. We went there a couple of times and all the food was delicious, especially the BBQ sandwich. KGB's burgers are OUT OF THIS WORLD!! All in all we had a great stay. No problems except for the minor ones but we went in knowing we weren't staying at Bellagio. The location is perfect and having the Monorail station right at harrah's is so great. Use it-it's a no brainer.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Patrick S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrahs for a 3 day trip. When part of our group checked in they asked if they could remove the items from the Mini-bar so that they could use the fridge, the desk said yes but there is a charge of $15 a day to use it as wel as remove the items. There is really nothing fun to do there other than the Carnival Bar which is over priced and not really that great of a place. The air conditioning did not get cold and would just shut off. The Only thing going for the place was the location on the center of the strip but it is not worth it to stay there just for that. We also paid for strip view rooms and they either faced the roof or the very corner showed some signs of being the strip.

Reviews.Title: “1960's Type hotel”
Reviews.Author: Samiam1946
Reviews.Content: I stay in hotels over 200 nites a year so I do know a little about hotels. Stayed Oct 10th for 3 nites, that's 3 nites too many. Got to the front desk to check in at 8PM, was told that my room wasn't ready yet. After a little fuss they miracleously found a room. I went to the room and tried to log on to my laptop, couldn't get a signal - called front desk and was told that there was no wireless in the hotel but instead some cable you have to stick in your computer that was really slow and cost 11.95 a day. Woke up the next morning and went to make some coffee, no coffee maker. Had to go to Starbucks in the lobby and buy outrageously priced coffee. Could not charge anything to my room until I went back to the front desk and they debited my credit card $100.00 A DAY IN ADVANCE (A FIRST). Employees at front desk rude, not friendly. Could not wait to check out & get back to staying at my Marriotts. Never again Harrahs

Reviews.Title: “Our First Las Vegas Vacation -- Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dcpacker
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Las Vegas took us to Harrah's Casino and Hotel, located on 'The Vegas Strip'. We arrived at the hotel before our room was ready, about 12 noon. Outside the front door is a luggage check-in area. They took our luggage, and held it until our room was ready. The ckeck-in process was very effortless. Once in the room, my wife and I were very pleased with the cleanliness and overall appearance of the room. The room had two queen beds, each with a foam mattress. The only difficulty we experienced while in the room was the television system. It was difficult to manage, and required some repetitive processes to change channels. Other than that, the room was a close to perfect as you could get. The casino is on the main floor of the hotel. All of your favorite games are available 24 hours a day. We found early morning play was the best time of day. Several on-site restaurants made dining convenient, and the food was very good and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: sandy2708
Reviews.Content: We stayed the first week in October. The bed was very comfortable. Once we checked in we took a quick nap and headed down to the craps table. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. The food and the band at Toby Keith’s bar were great. The Range Steak House was incredible. I can’t wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay & play”
Reviews.Author: DKLT
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on vacation & will definitely stay here again. Our room was clean, good bed, flat screen tv in both bedroom as well as bathroom. Our room was on the 7th floor at the far end of a hallway & only minimal noise heard from the band playing at Carnaval Court outside- not enough to bother us. Rooms are equivalent to a Hampton Inn or Holiday Inn Express quality. Unlike other casino hotels on the strip, Harrah's is not so big that you have to walk miles to get from one area to another. I won money in the casino- dealers are pretty friendly & comp drinks are plentiful. Do not try to eat in The Cafe - they are SO SLOW! We were seated & no one ever even took our order- we walked out. Buffet is good/ not outstanding. Toby Keith's had good appetizers & if you order a draft beer they bring it in a quart mason jar- 32 ounces!! Location of Harrah's is great- centrally located on the strip. Room rates very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “LUXURY REASONABLE COMPLETE”
Reviews.Author: JERSEYYOGI
Reviews.Content: A well situated basic accommodation with all auxiliary pluses and a broad range of casino attractions and shows and food choices. Note the Buffet and Steak house and Carnaval Court live music and Toby Keiths. Great place to keep coming back to.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: Bkk212
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine, not new but the room was clean and very spacious, could use a flat screen TV in the room. Got put into a smoking room and it was not so pleasant but overall teh hotel is nice. Didn't use the gym. The casino was crowded every night. Close to teh strip.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is awesome”
Reviews.Author: rebecca w
Reviews.Content: if u want to play keno and have a good time go to harrahs they make ya feel great

Reviews.Title: “Center of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: frank c
Reviews.Content: Our room was very clean all four days of our stay. No problem their at all. The place is somewhat dated and tired, though our room was comped so who cares, I know it was not going to be Bellagio. Though we did have a great view. We never ate at the hotel. Hash House for breakfast and several different restaurants off the strip that we know, if you like Thai food try Lotus of Siam. We had a car through Fox it was cheaper for the 4 days then taking even a few cabs and we wanted a car for our visited to Hoover Dam. We enjoy taking rides so having a car was great. In fact the fastest valet service I have ever experienced in my life and we always rent a car or have our own car in Atlantic City and the like kudos to the valet service personnel, we even had a minor issue with the car and the valet service could not do enough. We enjoyed gambling more at Caesar's so we would walk across the street. Saw Elton John and he was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: happytraveller60860
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a long weekend at Harrah's. Overall, it was a nice hotel. The "basic" room that we booked was simple, and no frills...no coffeemaker, no fridge...just a room, but that was fine with us. It was clean and comfortable. It was nice having Starbucks, (actually 2 counters) right in the hotel. The casino was large, very few $5 tables, and the smokiest that we non-smokers encountered. All of the staff that we encountered were very friendly and helpful. The Flavors buffet was very good...we came for breakfast and they changed over to brunch while we were there...carved meats, omelet station, cold shrimp, and a large dessert selection. One drawback of the hotel...We reserved rooms months in advance, and one night's stay was charged at that time. My brother arrived about 1130pm, and they did not have the suite that he reserved and paid for available, but said he can switch rooms the next night, which he did. I find that to be unacceptable since he even let them know of his arrival time. Overall, a nice hotel. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: mbellimer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrah's Oct 2-8 and gambled there a Our room on lot but never saw the half-naked dancing girls I have been reading about and my husband would have mentioned them if he had seen them!!!!! Our room on floor 25 of the Carnaval Tower was very nice, clean and kept that way all week. We had originally requested a luxury room with two queens but at check-in I changed to one king and they had none available in smoking so put in a deluxe room and of course discounted our room and it was more then just fine. View of parking lot but who cares only sleeping there anyway. Did the buffet first night since it was there, food seemed fine just not as cheap as I remember Vegas being. It's been over ten years since I have stayed on the strip but my sister lived there for over twenty years so we NEVER WENT ON STRIP, just went to local casinos so had no idea how much things had changed moneywise. A gazillion 1 cent machines everywhere, few if any $5 blackjack tables, did find one at Casino Royal next door and a Denny's for breakfast after that. Took Monorail from Harrah's but they only go as far south as MGM and there are like a million miles between hotels, expect to really work off that booze by walking. Rail only goes as far north as Hilton so took cab downtown, really alot of entertainment on Tremont street. FREE But this review if of Harrah's which is not the worst choice you could make for the money. It was fairly cold and rainy while we were there but our friends used the pool on Monday, did not have to pay $20 for lounge chair, there were plenty available. Temps in the upper 80's that day but downhill from there. We are from NH so the weather did not bother us, as matter of fact, my husband was happy, hates the heat. Check out Harrah's it was a good trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: Cathy N
Reviews.Content: My husband had his computer stolen from our room. On the second night we left our room for about 2 1/2 hours to have dinner. The next morning when my husband opened his bag to set up computer it was not there. I had locked the door that night when we went to bed with dead bolt and extra lock, so computer must have been stolen while we were at dinner. Spoke to hotel security and risk management who assured me no one had entered our room according to information on door lock. Very unsettling that someone could enter our room and not leave a trace. Our door was closed when we left for dinner. Wanted others to be cautious if you choose to stay here. Rooms were tired, but cheap- at least with the group rate.

Reviews.Title: “Exceedingly Convenient”
Reviews.Author: HappyVacationTime
Reviews.Content: Just back from Vegas where we were vacationing for only 60 hours. We stayed at Harrah's and it was perfect. We did their 24 hour buffet for $45. Not a buffet I am bragging about, but exceedingly convenient and when you do 4 buffets in 24 hours - dinner 9pm, breakfast, lunch and dinner at 8pm next day - it is unbeleivably reasonable at $11 per buffet. The buffet includes, juice, coffee and non-alcohol beverages. Breakfast was my favourite. They have an omelet station! Yum! Room was nice. Quiet. Comfortable. Clean. Location was excellent. We went to shows at Venetian - 15 minute stroll. Steak House at Imperial Palace - 10 minute stroll. Bellagio water show - 20 minute stroll. (I say 'stroll' as on the weekend too many people to walk briskly)

Reviews.Title: “Not a good stay-beware!”
Reviews.Author: jpbgagnon
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a three night stay at Harrah's. The hotel rooms are so so. The first room we stayed in the water would not shut off in the tub and it ran all night and we also were kept up with very loud banging and talking from a dumpster being emptied several times during the night. I called the desk and they changed my room to the other side of the hall. The second room had a leak in the ceiling that soaked the bathroom floor and splashed water all over the toilet. I let the desk know and it was fixed asap. In the second room I could hear a whistle blowing every few minutes from valet and the room was on the sixth floor. I bought ear plugs in the lobby and it did block out the noise. The casino is very smokey and the ventilation system is terrible. The location of the hotel is good but the homeless, drunks, loud music, half naked girl dancing in a cage, litter on the ground and the men and women handing out cards for hookers to come to your room in 20 minutes or less make Harrah's a two star at best. I would not feel comfortable walking with just women out in front of Harrah's down to Bills gambling hall and saloon. It was very, very seedy. I am not a prude and understand what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas and have had my share of fun, but a three star hotel should not allow what goes on the the front of the hotel to happen! I ended up going across the street to Ceasar's and the Mirage to gamble and eat(Ceasar's has a good food court)The higher end hotels do not allow the sleazy people conduct themselves in front of their establishments. I spent my first night at the South Point Casino and Spa off the strip because Harrah's was booked. Thank God I did some family stayed at the Imperial Palace(booked through Harrah's) the first night and told me there were prostitutes in the lobby and the rooms were terrible. I laughed when they told me when they looked out their window the roof above the valet had liquor bottles and luggage on it. It just sums up the overall feel of this section of the strip. My stay at South Point was very similar in price but feel and experience were night and day. One day we took a free shuttle to The Red Rock Casino because our group of 14 people wanted a change of scenery and we had a great time. The shuttle picks you up and drops you off at the Fashion Mall Valet. We had a great time and it was good to get away from Harrah's. A person in our party summed up the feel of this part of the strip as a combination of the Jersey Shore and the Atlantic City Boardwalk rolled into one. Two people in our party went to workout at the gym and were told they had to pay twenty dollars per person each day to use the gym!! Are you kidding me, they advertise no resort fees! This is only true if you do not want to use any of the facilities amenities. Charging a $25.00 a day per room resort fee is better than $40 a day to use an average gym. I do have to say that every employee we encountered at Harrah's was wonderful. They were always pleasant and helpful. I feel bad for them because they work very hard and it is not their fault the hotel is a little run down and sleazy out front. I would recommend staying at a higher end hotel. As a women I did not feel comfortable walking outside the hotel alone and my husband agreed. This is not my first time in Vegas, but it is the first time I felt uncomfortable. I have stayed at the Luxor, Mandalay Bay, Monte Carlo, Bally's, Excalibur, MGM, Paris, the Stratosphere and Treasure Island. I never felt uneasy walking alone in front of these hotels except for the stratosphere and Harrah's. It was not worth staying here for the cheap rate and I would gladly pay more so I can enjoy my vacation. I guess you get what you pay for. I traveled with people who had comp rooms with Harrah's and I was given friends and family rate of $40 per night. This was one of the few times I did not use priceline to get a good rate at a better hotel and I will be the last. I would recommend to anyone who is thinking of staying here don't!! pay more and gamble a little less and you will not regret it. I would also recommend staying off the strip at Red Rock, South Point or Green Valley Ranch they have everything you could possibly want and offer free shuttles to and from the strip. The food at the Harrah's was very pricey and sometimes not so good. I found the food at higher end hotels similar in price for casual to moderate dining. There is no food court at Harrah's therefore limited casual dining choices. My last day I went to Ceasar's food court and payed the same price for lunch but the choices and quality was much better than Harrah's. A friend went to Johnny Rockets at the Flamingo Hotel a few doors down and spent $20.00 on a hamburger, fries and a drink! I felt like I was staying at the airport with the food prices. This was not just Harrah's, but everywhere on the strip. It your in the area go see Mac King's show at Harrah's they offer two adult free tickets but you have to buy one drink so the ticket ends up being $12 per person. Fun show a little corny but worth it. If it was not for the staff I would have given this hotel less of a rating.

Reviews.Title: “Back again!! Great Room Choice.”
Reviews.Author: cop0251
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend in Vegas, Thursday 29th-Oct 4th. I have stayed at Harrahs once before two years ago. Then we stayed in a small regular room. This year I was comped the deluxe room and opted $50 a night for a suite with a seperate living room and bedroom. The room was very nice for Harrahs, it was updated with a nice couch two 32 inch lcd tv's, had a seperate shower and tub. Harrahs has motion activated hvac systems, I called and had maintenance come deactivate that feature, they were there within 10 minutes. We had a great view from our room of the Mirage volcano show, Ceasars and could see the Bellagio fountains from our living room. Walking in my wife noticed the smoke right away, I didnt think it was that bad. Neither of us smoke and after the first day she never mentioned it again. We spent most of our time seeing the sights since it was her first visit to Vegas. I spent most of saturday and sunday in Harrahs Sportsbook with 3 friends that came the same time we did. We also enjoyed the Imperial Palace for Craps and their BJ dealertainers. Carnival Court was LOUD as always, we enjoy that sometimes but this was a getaway from the kidos weekend. (thanks gparents!) We enjoyed Harrahs environment since we are more middle class. The Venetian, Caesars and Aria are great to look at and very nice but if you cant afford anything in their shops whats the use. Another great experience was at PJ Clarks over in the Forum Shops of Caesars, they offer $1 oysters at happy hour, sit at the bar where the guys are shucking them for a better experience. Also had the Lago Buffet at Caesars, prime rib was worth going back for. My wife really enjoyed her visit to the Spa by Mandara which is located inside Planet Hollywood. I had set up this visit for her since I spent a good bit of time with my friends. I'll be glad to answer any questions. Cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's is worth the price”
Reviews.Author: 4woodies
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the bargain hotel, centrally located on the The Strip, then Harrah's is for you! We stayed on the Southern end of the strip before and it was FAR to get to where 'the action' was. This time, we tried Harrah's...and for the price, it was perfect. I had a group of 18 people (9 rooms) and not one person complained. Everyone liked the hotel's location on the strip, comfort of the beds, and value. Only thing I will be leary of is the 24 hour buffet package that they sell....if you plan on staying close to those locations, watching the time closely (if eating is what you want to do), then this is for you....if you are, on the go type, this may not be your thing....they are STICKLERS when they say 24 hours....as we were standing in line for buffet when our's expired.....didn't honor it....spoke to managers and they all had same reply..."no exceptions, it's 24 hours!". So, stear clear of that...unless gambling and eating is the ONLY thing you do. (There are several buffets, at several hotels included...you just have to PLAN where you'll be for 'feeding time'.) Didn't work for us, but may work well for others. Over all, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good price - good location.”
Reviews.Author: Watchdog328
Reviews.Content: We've been to Vegas many, many times and try to stay at at different hotel casino each visit. Although we have stayed at several hotels more than once, this is the first for Harrahs. When comparing Harrahs to other hotel casinos along the main part of the strip......it stacks up pretty well. Especially for the price. I liked where they have the check-in area. Although it's located at the back of the hotel, it makes it much easier to get in and out of the hotel. This is important when your trying to avoid a extremely crowded strip on most any night. Rooms are okay. Try to stay away from the pool side if you want a quiet evening. I understand the bands are very loud and go on late into the night. I heard them when we were out.........and they are loud. Because of it's location, you can walk to most of the other major hotel casinos and you're pretty much in the middle of all the action. We did not like the idea that you could pay an extra 5 bucks to go to the head of the buffet line. Just another scheme to separate you from your money. Thats all Vegas is about now. Not much fun for the people that have been there alot.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's diamond card”
Reviews.Author: Sylvia635
Reviews.Content: Not sure if it was worth the effort to obtain the Diamond card. I can't get decent tickets to a show, I cannot get an upgraded room. I think I was doing better with the Platinum card. At least with the Platinum I got the Augustus tower at Caesars, now I can't even get the Red room at the Paris.I might try the M card when I go back to Vegas and see if their program is any more accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “First Time Staying at Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: Debbie M M
Reviews.Content: This was the 6th year my sisters and I have gone to LV. Every year we stay somewhere different just to see what each hotel is like. This year Harrahs and Imperial Palace were our choices, we had 6 comped nights. I will write a seperate reviw for each of the two hotels we stayed at. This one for Harrah's only. I had read several reviews about how the AC units could not be set to a comfortable temperature because they are on an echo friendly system and that was a real concern for me because there is nothing worse than coming in for the night to a hot room and no way to set the temperature. We asked upon check in if that could be fixed and the girl at the reception desk said she would send someone up to fix it. As soon as we got in our room someone was knocking at the door to overide the system.... it worked perfectly.We had a nice $16.00 cab ride from the airport...told the driver we wanted the cheapest route and that is what we got. $16.00 + tip divided three ways was not bad at all. Arrived at the hotel at around 11:00 a.m. and only had to waite in line about 10 minutes before we got our room. We were not asked which tower we wanted so we just took our chances. We got a room in the back of Carnival Court... nice and quite. short walk from the elevator and no noise at all. Beds were comfortable and no little creatures sleeping with us. There was not much of a view but we were not in Vegas for the view. We went down to play some slots and get something to eat. We ate at Flavors and were surprised at how many choices the buffett had. It was pretty good. Again we had a coupon for buy one get one free, spit three ways stilll not bad ...about $11.00 each. Slots were very tight and no one won any money there. We decided after the first night that this was a very large casino and all of us being in our late 50's were not up to all of the walking around and we needed something smaller next time. All of the staff were very friendly and we were close to many of the other casinos on the strip and easy to walk to Imperial Place, Casino Royal, O'Sheas, Flamingo. Caesars. and Bills. We had a great time and enjoyed our stay at Harrah's. The only thing that was a little bit of a dissipointment to us was to see the half naked girls dancing on a small stage up in the air around the table games which were right by the entrance to the caino. All of the small children going by the doors could watch this. I am not a prude but ths was a little bit too much for smaller children to see. They need to have them sort of in the middle of the casino but of course it is all about the marketing and what will draw people in. The bus ride up and down the strip was miserable. They pack you in like cattle and keep telling you to move back when there is no room to back up to. Quite a few homeless people on the streets begging for money or cigarettes so be careful of being alone on the streets anywhere. There are also alot of drunks stubling around. All in all this was a good trip and we enjoyed our stay at Harrah's. We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Shameful check in”
Reviews.Author: Tim C
Reviews.Content: Hotel was average (dated), carpet had been recently been shampooed and was still wet!!! told we would have to pay an upgrade fee for another room? seriously? we obviously did not get the same check in crew as some others, our trip was pre paid over 2 months before trip, however upon check in we were told by a disinterested desk person that it did not matter that we made and paid for reservations months earlier they may not have a room for us (doing us a "huge" favor he came up with a room for us, awesome being that we had already paid for one) terrible, terrible experience maybe our ordeal was a fluke....dunno, will never happen again for us or any of the other resorts with this group. room 659 smelled like wet dog the entire weekend....

Reviews.Title: “Decent for piano bar, then move on....”
Reviews.Author: Stevyc79
Reviews.Content: Rude desk clerks, marginal drink service, sloppy restrooms, dated facility in general. Room was very noisy and literally vibrating due to contsruction below us, and then they dared to tell me "if you arent in room between nine am and five pm, it should have no effect on your stay". I told them to upgrade us for free or check me out and ill be at the mirage instead, and they angrily did so and reminded me that the rate of room was fair. Do yourself a favor and stay elsewhere. Harrahs gaming is good, but their hotel rooms are garbage!

Reviews.Title: “What's that weird smell?”
Reviews.Author: rpcv_hamilton
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 nights for my husband's 30th birthday. The hotel has some pluses: decent price, good buffet, nice location mid-Strip. But the negatives completely outweigh these pluses. First, we couldn't check in until 4:30pm, which is extremely inconvenient when you have your bags with you (they'll store them for $10 per bag!). Second, $12 per day for internet? Third, when we finally got to our room it had a strange sulfury smell, which we later figured out was the water. It was knock-you-over strong every time we entered the room. Fourth, the room was not clean. After waiting so long to check in I would have expected it to be spotless. There was a torn up porno magazine on the bedside table, along with the previous guest's room keys and paperwork. Housekeeping did respond quickly when we asked for pillows that were not down (I'm allergic), but overall the room was very disappointing. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's - "old Vegas feel"”
Reviews.Author: jboToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 nights @ Harrahs. At check-in (which went smoothly and quickly Thurs AM) I asked for and received a "newly" upgraded/renovated room (in the Mardi Gras Tower). The room was upgraded with flat screens in the bedroom and bathroom. The room was not overly large but it was comfortable and the bed was quite comfortable.It was disappointing that the internet was not wireless. I feel the casino and hotel have an "old time Vegas" feel unlike some of the larger, newer casinos. It may not have all the flashy amenities of the bigger, name resorts but for those on a budget I would recommend Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: peaceloverocknroll
Reviews.Content: I arrived on a Monday afternoon and yes there was a bit of a line at check in but it moved very quickly. I was given a King bed on the 21st floor of the Carnaval Tower which was perfect! It had a view of the strip and pool and no problems with the A/C unit. The elevators are quick, plenty of food choices and helpful staff. The pool is impossible to find even after asking 3 staff members where it was located. The slots were loose too which made my business trip pleasurable. The remote control to the TV was disgusting! I always bring a large ziplock to put it in so I don't have to touch it. And there were some dirty water spots on the floor between the toilet and tub. Other than those typical items I was there 3 nights and did not encounter 1 problem. Now I want to plan on going back for fun!

Reviews.Title: “Decent -- old but very well located”
Reviews.Author: occhris
Reviews.Content: The location for the hotel is excellent. It's walking distance to everything, just park and walk. The rooms are very dated but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Suite in Carnaval Tower”
Reviews.Author: Quaris
Reviews.Content: I booked a standard room and got upgraded to a suite in the Carnaval Tower (maybe because I checked in late at night?). Room was huge. Not plush - but a great bed and nice bathroom. Never checked out the pool or amenities. Check in was a breeze with friendly staff. When I called the front desk they answered greeting me with my name (not used to that at other hotels). The room was quiet. I was able to check out by the TV. The casino though - not very generous! Room wise - I'd stay again. May post a photo later. Main complaints: no wi-fi and no free local calling.
