Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Dennisdw
Reviews.Content: This hotel was every bit as good as Planet Hollywood or other sister properties. First off - the beds were very comfortable & the room was clean, the most important thing with any hotel...next - the location was great (right in the middle of everything). Next -the staff was friendly and professional (Kathy in the VIP lounge area was great) - the sports book was much better than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Times at Harrahs”
Reviews.Author: lawrencea
Reviews.Content: I spent 7 nights at Harrah's at the end of August 2011. I obtained a fabulous deal for flights and accommodation through Travel bag but it did involve 3 flights there and back! Not for the faint hearted. Having gotten such a good deal I was a little worried about the hotel standard. I have been to Las Vegas before so I knew Harrahs was in a good location and furthermore I checked previous comments on Tripadvisor about the hotel but quite frankly they did not do it justice. If you want five star do not even consider Harrahs but for a no frills four star this is your place! I booked a smoking room and when I arrived the Receptionist said she had none. I was about to complain when she offered a room with a balcony which you could smoke on - first tick for the hotel. The room was close to the lift ( without asking ) thus near the ice machine and soft drinks machine. Some might think this would be a noisy locale but we were not disturbed. Room had two large double beds, 37 inch LCD LG TV and a smaller one in the bathroom!!! The room was immaculately cleaned every day and extra towels left without having to ask. - big tick here! We were not overlooking the swimming pool nor the night club so no noise disturbance but in fact could see the Mirage hotel opposite and a great view of the mountains in the distance ( fantastic sunsets!) Looking down wasn't the best view - but who's looking down! Staff were friendly in all areas- quite frankly can't say enough about them especially as it was so busy and they still kept smiling! Loved the Oyster Bar, loved drinks in the pool - watch out for the cocktails in the Harrah cups - $17.00 a pop but you only need one; but beyond a doubt the best thing about Harrah's is the dueling piano bar. It is rocking from Thursday to Saturdays; still good on the other nights but not quite as busy. it closes at 2am so we would get there from 12 on wards. There are many places to go to in Las Vegas but loved coming back to the piano bar. When that is closed if you have any energy go to the night club outside the entrance to the hotel - another rocking place! Las Vegas has become more expensive over the time I have been going there but of course the free drinks at the slots and gambling tables can make a difference there and you can still eat cheap if you look around. But make Harrah's you base. Unless I win the lottery and thus go back & stay in the Wynn then Harrahs' will be my first choice every time!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: syl188
Reviews.Content: from the easy check-in the staff were very helpful and friendly, arranged an upgrade room. the suite was lovely, bed was fab and room lovely and clean. the location of this hotel is brilliant and have stayed before. the only downsite is the smoke in the casino after years of no smoking in the UK and most of the USA it was very hard to get used to the smokey atmosphere. found that we spent most of the gaming time in other places such as mirage which was alot easier on the lungs, maybe harrahs need a better extracter system.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Spot”
Reviews.Author: threecows
Reviews.Content: Great service from the check-in staff, Lots of guests checking in but got through quickly. Was on the 11th floor they did advise us it would be noisey as I asked for a smoking room,we just put up with it. Loved the locaction of this hotel in the middle of everything could walk right or left and you were amongst all the Casinos.Had a deluxe room booked on line and got what I booked. Would stay at this hotel for location alone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Location, Average Prices on Food and Rooms”
Reviews.Author: KSTentCamper
Reviews.Content: To start, I cannot say enough about our maid Connie. She saw us come out of our room and stopped me to introduce herself, let me know her hours and invited me to ask the front desk for her personally if we needed anything during our stay. When she found out we were in town to get married she really went out of our way to make our stay special. She made sure to have our room clean before it was time for us to get ready for the ceremony. And, the morning after our wedding she gently reminded some of our guests that we had the Do Not Disturb sign on our door. At check in we asked if there were any free upgrades availble for us. The front desk clerk was unable to accomodate us for the first night but put a room with a better view on hold for us for the rest of the week. The next day, when we entered our new room we discovered that not only did we get an awesome view but we were also upgraded to an awesome room. The cocktail waitresses in the casino provided the best service on the strip in my opinion. I asked about some lessons on table games becasue I noticed that the hotel's website advertised that free instruction was available daily. However, I asked three different people and all told me that they did not give any instruction on any of their games. So many other casinos do though so we just went to a different casino to learn craps. The quality and price of food was average for Las Vegas, good but nothing special. The Carnival Court bar was our favorite just because it was the most lively on the strip the week we were there. All of the other bars were dead for some reason. Overall, a great place to stay for our first visit in Las Vegas becasue it was right in the center of everything. I'll definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY THEY HAVE BED-BUGS!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TDD2011
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I stayed at Harrahs over the Labor Day weekend, it was terrible from the start! The hotel is old and out dated, the staff is rude especially the manager Chris and to make matters worse my friends found bed-bugs in their room and I woke up with bites as well!! When we brought it to the staff's attention, they pretended like it was no big deal, no offered any kind of sympathy let alone compensation. Chris the manager is the worst of them all, he was very unapologetic and nasty and threatened to black list us if we told anyone they had bed bugs!!!! WELL I DONT CARE I WANT THE WORLD TO KNOW HARRAHS IN LAS VEGAS,NV HAS BED_BUGS!!!!! SO BEWARE!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUGS!”
Reviews.Author: sharon m
Reviews.Content: Definitely will not stay her Ever Again! we stayed here from friday to sunday 09/18/2011... I woke up saturday morning and noticed several marks on my arm which was confimed to be Bedbug bites..The manager was so unconcerned that he could not look me in the eyes. He never appoligized this is very Discusting and Unsanitary ..let me first say when we arrived the choice of rooms available was, one where previous guess had pets OR, handicap well my thing is, if its against the law to park in handicap parking space the rules should apply to the rooms ..

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel, over-rated casino. Much better elsewhere on the strip.”
Reviews.Author: npcommunications
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed her for two nights and two nights at the Monte Carlo at the other end of the strip. Dirty rooms, smelly hallways, old elevators and low ceilings make this hotel feel like it's already lived a full life and should be put down. Casino was loud and fun, but dealers were rude and actually laughing at you if you lost. Only redeeming factor about this place was the duelling pianos show. It was fabulous - but you don't have to stay at Harrah's to see it. We won't stay here again with so many other great options available to us in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “A bargain with great location.”
Reviews.Author: mamafury
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and the rooms were comfortable. Housekeeping staff were very accomodating. Great location on mid-strip can't be beat. The rooms are a little sparse on storage and furniture. No comfortable chairs. Harrah's is full of guests around my age (old sort of) and frankly it is boring. I like a mix of all people of all ages. Harrah's is a lot like me-needs a makeover and update. Still a great bargain in a great location,

Reviews.Title: “Valet Parking”
Reviews.Author: JoyceFabian
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Harrah's MANY MANY Times, Never a problem. THIS time, I took my 89 year old Mom, who lost my dad in March for what was to be a PLEASURE trip to try and bring her some happiness. WRONG. We got there in late afternoon, she was tired, and I got her out of the vehicle, We VALET PARKED THE CAR. We stayed 4 days, NEVER removed the vehicle from Valet. I had some loose change in a pocket on the door, it was GONE, which was no big deal, it wasn't a fortune, however, I also had 16 CD Slot Games, bought by my daughter for ME, in the TRUNK of the vehicle, in a drawstring bag, you could NOT see thru, Several days later, when unpacking the car, guess what it was GONE GONE GONE. SO other than Harrah's VALET, WHO would have had access to the vehicle. AND if VALET had the KEY the door should have been LOCKED and NO ONE ELSE could have popped the trunk.. $320.00 LOSS. NOT HAPPY

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel in need of an update”
Reviews.Author: dvnh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location but is obviously old and needs updating. Food is way over priced and shows are poor compared to all the other hotels. They offer guests very little in perks not even a coupon book...something you can get pretty much anywhere in Vegas. Pool is terrible half the chairs are in shade most of the day and because its boxed in its like an oven & water was too warm. WHATEVER. YOU DO STAY AWAY FROM FREE RIO SHUTTLE! Besides the driver being a complete JERK (Jim I.)...they allow silver star members to board first no matter how long you have been waiting. We waited over an hour and they were allowed to walk right up and take a seat. Its a small bus, some trips only 4 "regular" guests made it on. I say if your on a tight budget its Ok but next time I will spend a couple buck and stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service... Price is high”
Reviews.Author: Chama s
Reviews.Content: Service is horrible.... They were not helpful at all. I had to call room service for block in the bath tub and it was not ok.. We booked a room with 1 King bed.. When we get there they did not have it so we got a 1 Queen bed for the same price. Room A/C sounds like a boiler room. was not comfortable to sleep at all. Location was good right at the middle of the strip. Buffet was good. Should have pay little bit more to stay in a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “service is horrible and associates don't care!”
Reviews.Author: divergirl09
Reviews.Content: First I got to Vegas really early, when I made the reservation I was advised that I should check to see if the room was ready and if it was they would check me in no problem. LIE Yes indeed they will check you in but if it is before noon they will charge you 25.00. I happen to work in the resort industry(this is NOT a resort) and I know it costs nothing to check people in early as the room is setting there empty anyway!!! Second, I paid for an upgraded (15.00 a night) view of the strip, what I got a view of the roof and duct work with several yellow lights shining in my window all night long. But, the thing that happened to make me write this review happened about 5 minutes ago ( I am stuck here until Saturday thrill thrill) I forgot my toothpaste, you can get a single use tube of toothpaste at a motel 6 or what ever they are called. Here not so much 4.00 for a single use tube of toothpaste that is not acceptable. Talk about highway robbery!!! Spend the extra money and stay someplace else, this place doesn't know the meaning of customer service it only knows the all mighty dollar. I didn't choose to stay here I am in town for a conference. Believe me the meeting planner will be hearing from me TONIGHT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FUN!!!”
Reviews.Author: susham
Reviews.Content: Harrah's was a great hotel to visit! The people were very friendly and the room was very nice. It is a great destination for everything on the strip,not far from any attractions. The shows were great at the hotel, as was the food. I would recommend this place to anyone who would like to enjoy a fast-paced casino with a great staff and great things to do. The carival court music venue was fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Still a bargain but”
Reviews.Author: jay21212
Reviews.Content: Try to stay in the Carnival tower, the Mardi Gras rooms are small with loud air conditioners. The rest rooms by the piano bar were both closed all weekend which was very inconvenient for a place that already requires long distance travel to relieve oneself after consuming the "free" alcohol. Video poker machines were awful. You used to be able to play for hours on $40 but not anymore. 24 hour buffet deal is still a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Service and Rooms are Horrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel318
Reviews.Content: I hate to review this hotel because I had a comp from the hotel, but regardless, I will never stay here again. Cons: Bathroom smelled like sewage at all times. Bathroom sink stayed clogged. Room had a musk and mildew smell. Electrical outlets were broken and/or didn't work Carpet was filthy. Guest services was super rude. Casino smell like an old bingo hall. Everything was overpriced from restaurants to store on lobby level. Pros: Hotel located directly in the center of everything. Hotel room doors automatically locked when you exited them. Valet driver was super cool. Gentleman who operated the business center was very courteous and professional. Lady who worked in the convenience store was really nice. Located next to Palazzo and the Venetian Hotel Across the street from Caesars Hotel Places for entertainment/food: Carnival Court - Harrah's Outside Area Ghirardelli's - Near Carnival Court Quick bite: Big Hurt - Near Carnival Court

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure to stay here. . .”
Reviews.Author: kathyktemperance
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrahs over Memorial Day and it was awesome as usual. Our rooms are always comped, so we stay in a renovated room. I like to stay in the Mardi Gras tower overlooking the pool. We try and stay on that side, but farther down from the Carnival Court. Love the casino, CW service, and service at the pool. All the staff are always pleasant. Ate at KGB Burger for the first time, delicious!! Big sandwiches that next time could share. Plan on being back in April, and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Trippin26
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice, and the location is spectacular. It is right in the middle of the strip which makes it convenient to get to everything. The buffet was good, and had ample food. The only downside was that table limits were $5 in the morning and afternoon the first day I was there, but $10 every other day, at all hours. That was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “We won't stay here again....”
Reviews.Author: ms_long_legs
Reviews.Content: Average rooms in a great location. If you are allergic to smoke, this is not a good place for you to stay! The hotel reeked of cigarette smoke and the casino was so thick it was awful! The room was average, nothing special there . The pool and surrounding area was average at best.We did however, enjoy Toby Keith's Bar. Excellent food and great service! This hotel needs a serious face lift!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: DarlenePortMoody_BC
Reviews.Content: Give yourself time to check in as both times we have been there, there has been a lineup. If you are a Starbucks fan the lineup on the second floor is always shorter!

Reviews.Title: “Blah Blah Blah!”
Reviews.Author: HarlemJetsetter
Reviews.Content: I am not a big fan of gambling but took my mom for her 70th birthday. She had a ball, I on the other hand could not wait to get back to NYC. To start off the hotel clerk had trouble with our reservations and but everything on 1 bill (there were 7 of us). Our rooms were maybe 2 street blocks from the elevators (only one bank per building) :(( If you are not a fan of gambling the barely offered any entertainment to off set the casino floor. the pool is extremely small and expensive. the lounge chairs are crowed together, but you can rent the spacous one for $50. 0r $100. Oh pool closes at 6 or 7 pm. So if it 105 degrees, don't expect to hang out poolside for the night!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was like staying in a Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: pecandelgt
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed in Harrah's during your Vegas vacation in August 2011. Overall, the hotel was OK. I was very unsatisfied with the overall appearance of the carpets in the hotel room. The carpets in the rooms we stayed in all needed to be replaced. The carpets look as though they had not been shampooed in a while. My white socks looked grudgy after walking across the floor in my room. Also, this hotel has the iron attached to the ironing board with a elastic cord that is not long enough to reach to the opposite end of the board. Plus the fitness center and pool area closed entire too early (6:00 p.m.) I am uncertain if the other Vegas' hotel have kitchenette in their rooms, Harrah's standard rooms do not-- NO MICROWAVES nor NO REFRIGERATORS....Also, when I placed my reservation along with calling the reservation desk a week or two before my group arrived, I attempted to request that all our rooms be close to each other. I was advised on three separate occasions that the request could not be made until we checked into the hotel. Even though my group checked into the hotel about 4:45 p.m. (which is 45 minutesafter the check in time), our rooms were not very close to each other. This was my first going to Vegas and Harrah's hotel just allowed me know the next time I come to Vegas to look at hotel in the four (4) star category. Harrah's was not best hotel however it was not worst either. I just know that when I return to Vegas to shop for a hotel in a different catergory.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: zooland
Reviews.Content: I have visited Las Vegas 34 times and stayed at Harrahs several times. It is not the nicest hotel I have stayed at in Las Vegas. However, it is in a great location. Have found it to be clean, and it is usually a good value compared to other hotels. They along with other Ceasars properties do not charge a resort fee of $20 per day which I consider to be very unfair.

Reviews.Title: “out-dated casino but in a good location”
Reviews.Author: kgermain
Reviews.Content: i stayed here as part of an organised tour (and therefore had no choice over my hotel). although Harrahs is in a great location on the Strip, i found the rooms to be old and outdated. we had a few problems with our room (taps that wouldnt turn off, lights that wouldnt work). although i understand that las vegas is a very busy place with many people coming and going, the service at the check in desk was very slow and rude.

Reviews.Title: “Only one night, but a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Time2CheckIn
Reviews.Content: We booked through a Total Rewards offer and got a crazy low rate of $30, so thought we'd give it a try. We had been in Las Vegas for a convention, drove over to Utah to do some hiking for a few days, and only needed one night in Las Vegas before flying home. We had a rental car full of luggage, so thought we'd check in and then return the car to the airport and taxi back to the hotel. We were pleasantly surprised to find that there was a Hertz rental car return inside the hotel where we could return the car without any additional charge! The carpets in the common areas were showing their age, but our room was huge and very clean. Overall, a nice stay and we would definitely consider this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun to b had”
Reviews.Author: frendyindy
Reviews.Content: This was my yearly girls trip and we decided to stay at harrahs this year. After reading negative reviews regarding the hotel (I.e. rooms, safe, air conditioning) I was very skeptical. Much to my surprise, we had a great time and no drama. The maid we had was great and so were the waitresses that served us drinks every night in the casino. We would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great food, standard room... will return!”
Reviews.Author: AandN08
Reviews.Content: This was our third time going to Vegas, it is a great spot for a quick cheap getaway! Each time we have stayed at a different hotel, so far this is my favorite and plan on making it our return destination. Check in was fast we did a room upgrade to the newly renovated room only $15/night, this was very very worth it! The room was a standard hotel room, updated, clean, comfy bed and had a mini 'walk out' balcony.. you literally could only walk out on it. Basically all you need for Vegas. Unlike most of the hotels on the strip the walk through the casino and back to your room was reasonable, which made it nice when you want to have a quick recharge, freshin up or more importantly at the end of a long day and night where all you have done is walk and walk and walk... takes no time to get back to your room and put your feet up! Another upside was the restaurants, there are multiple ones inside the hotel all very reasonably priced and everyone we tried was outstanding! We had a breakfast and the italian night at the Cafe good prices, outstanding services, huge amount of food and all very very tasty. We also tried the KGB burger joint, that was out of this world.. by far best burgers either of us have ever had!! And the cocktails were very yummy standard booze prices for Vegas. As like most of the hotels had a very convienently located Starbucks. Pool is nothing special but it is large has a good bar and is easy to access from your room... elevator goes directly to pool level and then its about 20 steps to pool. Again a huge plus compared to other hotels where you have to walk forever, often through the casino to get to. All in all I liked the location, the clean updated room, and the easy short access to all amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Always a good choice”
Reviews.Author: Triniflyguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice already and will definitely return. It's a great value for money. Though the room we stayed in was a bit outdated, it was very clean and comfortable. This hotel's location is excellent as it's right in the middle of the strip, opposite the forum shops at ceasar's. It also had a monorail stop for easy access to other hotels along the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel at good price”
Reviews.Author: caintown
Reviews.Content: We picked Harrah's Hotel to stay at mainly due to it's location on the strip and also for price. Both were good choices. We booked on line for 3 nights with an average daily rate of $39 mid week. First night we got in a bit late and couldn't get a room with a king bed as requested. Got a room with 2 queen's instead. Bathroom wasn't very clean and room was somewhat outdated. Hotel moved us the next night to a king room at the end of the hall which was very quiet (not like some of the reviews of other locations at this hotel).First room was a bit noisey with people in hallways talking etc when they came home to their rooms. This room was much nicer and cleaner. Had a good night's sleep. Hotel overall is a bit dated but is still pretty decent. Buffet in hotel was okay but not great. KGB restaurant was good for a burger but a bit pricey. If you only want a fairly decent room at a good price then I would recommend this hotel. If you are looking for something newer and more upscale and obviously at more money then stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Beginning-Good Ending”
Reviews.Author: Sue49321
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at Harrah's, 3 of which were comped. Upon arrival there was a major mix up, not my fault. Was told comps were not available even though I had my receipt with me. Also the only room available was a handicapped room in the Carnival Tower. I would have to spend 1 night in handicapped then would be moved the following day. They wanted to charge me for every night & the amount quoted by the lady at the front desk was extremely high. I said no way, I want to talk to a manager. He did talk to me & got the cost lowered, but it was still high. After arguing for 30 minutes I felt I wasn't getting anywhere with these people so I went to my room. I didn't unpack knowing I would be moving in the morning. The longer I stayed in my room the madder I became over this screw up on Harrah's part. I went back down to check in & demanded to see a supervisor, not an idiotic manager. The supervisor was very concerned about the mix up, he spoke with someone in Total Rewards and the bottom line is I got upgraded to a deluxe room in the Mardi Gras Tower & my total bill was $30.00 I told the supervisor I wanted a smoking room, Mardi Gras is total non-smoking now but he gave me a room with a balcony overlooking the pool so I was able to smoke out there. My deluxe room was very nice, 2 plasma tv's, coffee maker & an awesome bed. Housekeeping gave me fresh linens & towels every day. Had a couple problems with air conditioning but upon calling front desk they had someone up to fix it within 15 minutes. Other than the woman that checked me in & the idiotic manager everyone else was friendly, helpful & caring. Handicapped room was awful, bed was like sleping in a bowl of jello. In the deluxe room the safe & the lock on the door worked just fine. I felt very safe & secure staying at Harrah's. I was very disappointed in the change they made at the Cafe-every night is Italian night so the original menu is gone. It is still open for breakfast and lunch though. Although I ran into some problems at Harrah's I would stay again but all the Harrah properties really need a facelift or refurbishing, they are showing their age. My following ratings are based on the deluxe room, not the handicapped room.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: FuntasticNYC
Reviews.Content: Got comp room last two days of vegas trip. Their buffet is pretty decent, staff was very helpful. I had a hard time finding my room in a drunken stupor and they helped me without batting an eyelash (I'm sure they get this a lot). I will be back to Vegas and will stay here again even without room comp. Rates are pretty cheap compared to the Mirage/Caesars/Bellagio/etc. Bathroom was overflowing with towels, room was nicely ventilated, beds were comfy, and I had a decent quiet view of their pool from my balcony.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: HAMILTONROUSE
Reviews.Content: loved our stay lovely room,great location slap bang centre of strip and a great price will defo return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Loction”
Reviews.Author: Gleavesy1992
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a large group, unfortunately we were all spilt up all over the hotel. The location was excellent!!! Right in the middle of the strip opposite the Mirage and Caesars Palace. We were staying in the carnival tower on the 14th floor and had a fantastic view of the Mirage hotel. The room was very large with two massive beds in. The mini fridge was empty other than two bottles of water and the safe didn’t work however the bathroom was large and extremely clean and tidy with plenty of fresh towels. The air conditioning in the room was very effective which was much appreciated! The casino was large and had a great range of machines and games to suit everyone’s taste. The outdoor pool was great, due to its Olympic size there was plenty of space for everyone with plenty of chairs around the pool. We didn’t spend much time in the hotel as we were out on the strip mostly however it was great when we arrived back in the early hours of the morning there was a shop open in the lobby so we could get food which was great! We didn’t hear any noise from any other guests which we were expecting to. I would defiantly return to this hotel, it’s not the smartest hotel on the strip but for the price and the location you can’t go wrong and let’s face it when you come to Vegas it’s not all about the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A Decent 3* Property”
Reviews.Author: wookeyh
Reviews.Content: First time staying at Harrah's and it was pretty much what we expected. Our room was on the 18th floor in the Mardi Gras tower and had a fantastic strip view directly across from the Mirage volcano. We had asked for high floor away from the Carnaval Court and were pleased with the location and the view. The room was small but adequate . The bathroom was a decent size and everything was very clean. The hotel's location on the strip is good and that's what prompted us to stay here. We didn't use any of the restaurants other than Starbucks for morning coffee - no free wi-fi there but it is available right next door at McDonalds. Although we didn't use the pool, we did check it out and there's nothing special or remotely attractive about it. I sat down on a padded chaise lounge just to observe for a few minutes and was immediately told that all the chairs on that side of the pool were reserved and I couldn't sit there unless I paid $20 to rent it.. I promptly left. I heard another guest complain about having to pay $25 to use the fitness facility but this seems to be standard in strip hotels. There's no wow factor here but it's certainly an acceptable hotel in a good location and the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Nice bed hotel”
Reviews.Author: TP2WXC
Reviews.Content: I attended a convention during my stay. I liked the fact the hotel is directly connected to a tram taking me to the LV convention center. The hotel is centrally located. Room is large and everything worked well. I enjoyed the large king size bed.

Reviews.Title: “Whiners need not apply”
Reviews.Author: Windsorborn
Reviews.Content: Let me tell you about Harrah's. It is awesome. Ok, so it is a little old but who cares we had a great time in Vegas and we used our hotel the way it is supposed to be used - as a place to sleep. The room is big and quiet. We stayed in the Carnaval Tower and loved life. The room was clean and was cleaned everyday that we stayed. As far as check in it was ridiculously quick and easy and we arrived at 1:30pm. What I particularly liked about Harrah's was the gaming staff. We gambled all over the strip and downtown but never had more fun than at Harrah's. Some of the newer and nicer hotels have hired the MOST boring people in the world to work their casino. A little spirit would be nice and that is exactly what we got here. Everyone on here that whined about security and staff issues must not have used the safe which is provided in the room or the latch on the door which prevents anyone from entering. I felt completely safe the whole time. The location is unrivaled and the burgers at KGB burger may be the best I've ever had. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Center of L V Strip”
Reviews.Author: allan08701
Reviews.Content: Yes this Hotel is in the center of the Las Vegas Strip. Very lively and young crowd , the music is loud and the slots are ringing loud. It is next to the loud Carnival Court and Bar. The Dualing Piano is fun and loud. The Hotel is clean, front desk is ok and busy ,long line depending on time of day. Food , Oyster Bar nice and busy all fresh staff nice. coffee shop also good the usual. Busy Starbucks. Gambling win some lose some , all Noisy . Room was clean , ask the staff for anything you need extra a couple of bucks goes a long way. Deluxe room flat screen tv worth the tip to front desk clerk and got the quiet side,yes we are in our early 60s.We had car , valet was fast. Took day trips from Harrahs and visited casinos in area and on strip. Ceasars and Ventitian are near by and great. But if you want center strip action and visit L V blvd casinos and malls and bars . you are ok here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location on strip”
Reviews.Author: AlexJeffery
Reviews.Content: Stayed at harrahs with 8 of my friends all aged 21 from the UK, this hotel was perfect location for us and very ideal. Id also like to comment on previous reviews about people being robbed at harrahs, i was very concerned arriving at the hotel due to these comments, however i just locked my suitcase and put any valubles/money in the safe and had no problems at all, every room has a safe that is attached to the wall which is free to use, so if u dont use it then thats just dumb!!

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs is a great place to stay!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: IUGrad
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure where the people whio wrote negative reviews about Harrahs stayed, but my family and I just got back from staying (4) days there. We arrived at 630pm, and we only waited to check in 5 minutes. The lady at the desk was very nice and upgraded the two rooms that I had. She kept us away from the pool area because of the music, and located us away from the elevators as requested. Our rooms were very modern, very clean and very quiet. We had the maintenance guy reset the thermostat so it stayed on all the time with no problem. Granted it is an older hotel, but I would stay again. We used the safe, always had coffee in the mornings, and had a good time. We also went to the pool and iot is nice. It's not the biggest, but we had chairs on the upper level under the misters which was great in the 110 heat.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, good location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Nicolaassebastian
Reviews.Content: We went from monday to Thursday and we had a great price, the room was clean and the hotelstaff really friendly. We recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Theives! Absolutely no care about guest satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: bbeckyb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrah's from July 31 - August 4. Our luggage was claimed by somebody else (this hotel didn't even check ID for something this important but they were sure to check it if I was buying a $2 cup of coffee). Harrah's didn't even offer us a toothbrush - they sent things to "risk management" who of course sided with the hotel. No apologies, no help in getting our stuff back, no compensation - lost suitcase with all clothes and toiletries as well as our airport carry on bag with a Nook and mini-computer. When asked if we should call the LVPD we were told we didn't need to worry about it, their security would handle it. We stupidly believed that they were looking out for us. When we finally went to LVPD four days later after Harrah's could not give us a straight answer - the cop told us that we should have called immediately when it happened. Harrah's is liable but since we waited there was little they could do other than take a report. It amazes me that this hotel would care so little about trying to help out their guests in a situation like this. I will never stay at Harrah's or any other property owned by Caesar's Entertainment Corporation. It really makes me sick that a big hotel chain such as this can care so little about guest satisfaction but it will not make a difference in their turnout. Be very wary about this hotel, when looking through reviews I found a number of other ones about stolen items.

Reviews.Title: “"Go to hotel" when looking for a value and great location~”
Reviews.Author: PODS1311
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at Harrahs with the first time being in the winter months. Was a little worried since I love my pool time sooooo much and Harrahs pool being so little, but it definatley worked. With it being 105+ degrees, laying out on chair is NOT an option. I just need to keep my butt in the pool all day long and be happy and I was. Was able to put my purse and clothes on a table right near the pool and was able to keep an eye on it the entire time. I kind of enjoyed the small pool once I was there. The people watching is so entertaining. Drinks were a great value ( Im a beer girl, so $6 for a beer or $20 for a bucket of $5 ) was quite the deal!!! I got used to the pool right away. The check in was suprisingly quick and efficient. We actually stayed at MGM mid week, then switched to Harrahs for the more affordable weekend rate. They were able to check us in early, which was a plus. We were in the Carnival tower and it was very close to the front desk/pool/Toby Keith Bar/casino. It was extremly convienient and easy to navigate. Drink service was great as well. Whether I sat at a penny slot or a table, the service remained the same. Stopping to gamble in some of the nicer hotel and casinos we noticed the drinks service was very poor compared to Harrahs. Our room was very nice and a good size, clean and had the basic amenities one would need. My husband always has to go to Toby Keiths, other than the giant Coors Light in mason jars, I dont enjoy it very much. Not a country girl and I think the service was slow just like the last time we were there. Great location on the strip. Cant beat it! Would definatley stay again, even though I like trying out new hotel/casinos, but if I needed a hotel I can trust, it would be Harrahs.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Trinidcq
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very conveniently located in the middle of the strip. Room was clean and comfortable. Over the weekend, maybe because it was summer, the hotel guest were a bit of a younger crowd, and a bit rowdy, but it was quieter during the week. There was a safe in the room and free parking, no fridge or coffee maker though. Public transport are very accessible, and even driving in Las Vegas was very easy. Everything was easy to find and close by.

Reviews.Title: “Positive rating”
Reviews.Author: Soxfanfrommaine
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Harrah's for a conference. My room was in the Mardi Gras tower on the fourth floor. It overlooked a roof with ducts, so the view was not scenic, to say the least, but the room was very quiet, with no noise coming in from outside. The room was a Deluxe room and it was very clean with marble (or marble-like) floors and two flat-screen TVs (one in the bathroom), and Corian or equivalent counters in the bathroom. It had two queen beds that were a bit soft but ok for sleeping. The bathroom was smallish but very useable. Both the bathroom and the bedroom could have used more lighting, but that seems to be a general problem in hotels these days. My room was no-smoking, and I did not smell any smoke in it or in the hallway. My only real problem with the room was the lack of storage space for clothing. This space was part of a large cabinet housing a TV and (pay as you go) refrigerator. There was room to hang only a few articles of clothing (and some of this room was taken up by the ironing board), and there were three very small drawers to hold socks, underclothing, etc. All this space was just adequate for me, as I was by myself, but I really think it would have bee inadequate for two or more people, especially those who travel with more clothes than I do, which is probably almost anyone. I do not know anything about Harrah's rooms that are cheaper than the Deluxe ones, but I would recommend not to go with these rooms if you can afford the Deluxe rooms. My room was fine as it was except perhaps for the lack of clothing space, but I think any rooms that were not up to Deluxe standards might be inadequate for some people. Some Tripadvisor reviews have warned about the air conditioning at Harrah's, which uses a motion sensor. While I was away from the room all day, the air conditioner worked minimally, and when I got back it was always at 76 degrees, which actually did not feel warm at all. (I kept my window shade closed all the time.) When I would walk in, the air conditioner would come on and quickly cool the room down to 66-68. During the night (some people have said the air conditioning doesn't work well at night, since sleepers aren't moving around enough), the air conditioner stayed on, and it was still in the high 60s range when I woke up, so the temperature at night remained very comfortable. I ate at KGB and The Range in Harrah's, and the food at both places was very good. All in all, I think Harrah's is a good value for the Deluxe rooms, with a very central location, and it almost seemed as if the people in the casino were enjoying themselves more than I saw elsewhere. But two or more people traveling together might want to inquire about the clothing storage space in whatever type of room they are considering.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Liz24California
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Harrah's in Las Vegas, and probably our last. In a town with so many other choices, the arrogance of the Vegas hotels amazes me. We arrived at the hotel about 6 PM due to a late afternoon flight, so I understood not getting exactly what I reserved because of arriving a few hours after check in time. We reserved a Mimi Suite with a king bed, & were given a Mini Suite with 2 queen beds. This was not a huge problem, but were told they had a lot of check-outs the next day & we could check to see if a king Mini Suite was available. We did that and were told they did have one available that was in the other tower but it did have a view as did the queen room, so we agreed to move. We were ledto think the king room was just like the queen room.....it was not. The view in the queen room was of the volcano on the strip, which we enjoyed watching, the " view" in the king room was of all the room windows of the Imperial Palace. The only "view" if you call it that, was if you stood with your nose u to the window and looked down 12 floors you saw Harrah's poolside cabana's & a "sliver" of the pool. No robes in the room, (queen rm had robes), only a portion of the amenities/toiletries offered in the queen room, only a few hangers, had to request more, had to request decaf coffee, none provided, no bath soap. All of these items were in the queen room. We were being picked up for brunch by family that live in Las Vegas, so there was no time to go down & request our original room back. We stayed four days, and voiced our disappointment to the desk clerk at check out, and her defense was that we should have been aware that the two towers are different. Very arrogant! We normally start at Harrah's Rincon in San Diego, & it"s a "palace" compared to Las Vegas! I understand it is newer, but, they treat their guests so much better. Like I said, we have so many other choices in Las Vegas, there is no reason to return to Harrah's Las Vegas. The first time we stayed there was in December of 2010, & encountered the same problems.....we're done!

Reviews.Title: “What Can I say, I'm Loyal to Harrah's for Good Reason!”
Reviews.Author: errynne
Reviews.Content: This visit to Harrah's was with several friends in celebration of a birthday (mine :)). I have been to Vegas several times, and stayed at many different hotels--including some of the more "ritzy" places such as Bellagio, Venetian, etc. This time I chose Harrah's, and I'm glad I did. The atmosphere at Harrah's is lively inside and out, and getting out of the hotel/casino itself doesn't take an hour like it does at many of the newer, larger properties in Vegas. As with all of their other locations, Harrah's is quite generous with comping free rooms even if you only gamble a couple hours with limited funds--and this is the major factor that keeps me coming back. Aside from that, the rooms are clean and easily accessed. My room was quite small but very well updated--but a couple of friends had rooms that were bigger however in great need of updating. In any event, the room is a safe, comfortable, fine place to sleep. If you want a room with ambience, a fancy pool (they have one, but it's nothing special), or glitz and glamour in your hotel's casino, stay somewhere else. Harrah's is a fun, down-to-earth place to enjoy gambling and base yourself out of a fantastic location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room, good location, but that's all”
Reviews.Author: capitol_couple
Reviews.Content: We were there for a bachelorette party and stayed in an odd level, high- floor of the Carnival tower. Check in process was a bit of a nightmare - like the lines at Disneyland. Once we got all into our rooms in the evening, they were nicely remodeled and the room I was in was fine, but others just down the hall had bathroom doors that got stuck (trapping them in the bathroom), runny toilets, etc. There was an awful mildew smell in the hallways (wet carpet cleaning?), but luckily the rooms smelled fresh and clean. I did not care for the scene/vibe of the casino itself or its restaurants. It was fine for sleeping and leaving - the beds were comfortable and its located very close to Caesar's with the nice shopping.

Reviews.Title: “"loved our stay"”
Reviews.Author: jewels2011_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the Harrahs after reading mixed reviews on here. We had a fantastic 11 night stay,check in was quick,our room was great on the 17th floor and a great view of the Mirage Volcano, it was clean,spacious everything we needed and maid service everyday. The hotel over all had everything one needs, Its a thumbs up for us and would stay here again when we go back to vegas.. Julie and Gary,,West Midlands, July 2011

Reviews.Title: “Good Rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: geoa5
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for seven nights, in early August. The check in was very quick, as we arrived early in the day, around eleven a.m. The line ups can be long around 2-5 p.m. The room was in the Carnaval Tower, room 2701. The room was closest to elevators, but far enough that I never heard any noise from there. It was overlooking the pool, and had view was that of Imperial Palace, and Caesars Palace. It overlooked the Carnaval court, but it was high up that I couldn't hear any noise from it. The room itself was nothing great, but it was very clean. The furnishings were older, tube TV, but again everything was well maintained. The bed and pillows were super comfortable. The bathroom was above average size and also very clean, and had a coffee maker - useful for me. I believe that I was upgraded from their basic room to a slightly better room maybe a mini suite, not sure, but it had the view of the strip which is considered an upgrade. The room had one burned out light, but I didn't care nor did I report it to maintenance to get it fixed. The few times I dealt with the hotel staff they were all very friendly and helpful. I used the pool on one day, I liked it, but it is a very basic swimming pool, so if it is vital for you to have a good pool complex then you won't like this pool. The location of this property is very central, so you can walk anywhere, you have a Mcdonald's right next door, which has free wifi. I ate at their buffet on a previous vegas trip, it was decent, but nothing to go twice for. It took me a few days till I was able to get my bearings with regards to where the exits to strip are from the room as the Carnaval tower was in the back with relation to strip. The cocktail service is average at best. Overall I like my experience at this hotel, the service was good, the rooms were good and the location was very convenient. Will definitley stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing Wouldn't Recommend It”
Reviews.Author: Nina T
Reviews.Content: After a very long check in by un helpfull staff we finally got to our room to find no fridge or coffee pot so we phoned down to reception & was told we d have to change rooms & pay an EXTRA $15 per day for the priviliged & if we want a fridge $23 per day what a rip off! The place could do with re vamping & if you think you ll get a peaceful night sleep you won't & the staff could care less. Should have stayed at Belagio & not listened to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Good - would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Xomex
Reviews.Content: Great position central on the strip. A bit "down-market" with loud, drunk, people throughout Other than that, was a good clean quiet room. Good value for money over a busy weekend.

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleased with everything”
Reviews.Author: MickeyWorobey
Reviews.Content: We were not too impressed by the transportation from the airport to the hotel. The airport was busy and we waited outside for over an hour to get room for 2 people on a shuttle bus.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Arl7
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very comfortable and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: ulrich04
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week. This hotel is located on the strip and in the middle of all the fun hotels and casinos. Must eat at KGB burgers......Also if you want to surprise your spouse or freinds get a limo from presidential limo. They will pick you up at the airport and take you to your hotel and then take you back to the airport when you leave.........

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to rave about”
Reviews.Author: WRITER1218
Reviews.Content: Room was comped from family. Very smoky and crowded casino area. Rooms are stocked with water, cameras, aspirin pack, condom pack, toothbrushes, etc. We have a toddler and 9 yr old and didn't want them getting into them (total price is about 40 dollars) and didn't think it was appropriate for 9 yr old to be seeing condom/lubricant packet so we put them up with a note not to restock, they were restocked, we put those up also and called front desk who informed us those items were on a sensor and there was no way to stop them from being stocked over and over. Big hassel. Went back and forth with front desk, housekeeping. Frustrating. We were in the Carnaval tower. My husband was disgusted w/ front desk people after asking where the 'C' tower was (it was listed on our check in as C845) and getting a snooty "We don't have a C tower." There are only 2 towers, Mardi Gras and Carnaval and yet he couldn't help my husband (this was the first time we stayed there). Checking in and checking out was a nightmare of long lines and impatient desk crew. Nice location, but pay the extra money to stay in a nice hotel (Wynn is gorgeous and the staff is wonderful).

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Polkadotsmile
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel as a mid-price option on the strip. It had a great location (Center of the strip) and a great price. When we arrived we had the option to upgrade to a deluxe room for additional cost- so we tried it out. We got a newly renovated room with a balcony overlooking the pool. The room was spacious enough, but not the bathroom. Very small and poor lighting. One of the features the bathroom had was a TV, but I would have loved a make-up mirror or perhaps some addtional square footage instead. To be honest I don't know why you would want to watch TV in there; It seemed a little foolish given the square fottage. As for the rest of the Hotel it was very average. The carpet in the halls and the elevators have seen better days. The pool is standard and the casino lay-out is confusing and very uninviting. Overall though, for the price it was nice. The bed and living space made up for what is lacked in other areas.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: vwp11
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for four nights here and we were very pleased with Harrah's. We belong to Total Rewards and of the Harrah's properties in Vegas, this one turned out to have the best rates and location for our timeframe. We got $55/Tue-Thurs and $95/Friday. The location is very central on the strip and the best thing: Harrah's is small and compact enough that there's not a lot of real estate between your room and the pool, Las Vegas Blvd, the front desk, or the casino portion. You won't need a GPS to find your room! The rooms were clean and comfortable. No evidence of bedbugs, which is something to say in a town that turns over customers as often as Vegas. The staff was helpful and nice and the casino slots seemed a little looser than their sister property at Caesar's. Did not experience the pool; it was closed for the winter. Recommendations in the area for cheaper, non-casino eats: - breakfast at Denny's just down the Blvd to the north (cheap and fast, even when crowded) - dinner at Battista's Hole in the Wall, south down the Blvd to Flamingo Rd, hang a left and walk a long block. (Decent 'all inclusive' Italian meals at good prices and fun, old time atmosphere. Very friendly ... maybe the bottomless house wine carafe helps!) Fun alternative entertainment: -Evolution Expedition Kayak Tours (Lake Mead and the Colorado below the dam) - Hoover Dam (the long tour that goes into the dam itself... great tour!)

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's is a good place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: lovestravel10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's for a week stay in Vegas. We went longer this year than last year and time seemed to fly by more so than last year. This is the 2nd time staying at Harrah's. I really love the location of the hotel(right in the middle of the strip). The staff is great, very friendly and helpful. The Keno is open 24 hrs! My only complaints with the hotel are that the pool really, really needs to be remodeled and the buffet was not as good as last year. Also, I understand that they are trying to be environmentally friendly, but I would appreciate if they did not control the AC with motion sensory. While sleeping it does not turn on. Other than that I have no other complaints. I will definitely be staying here again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's location and friendliness deserves *****”
Reviews.Author: Tizzy2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrah's August 7-13. We used $20 trick and were upgraded to a very nice room (1439 Mardi Gras Tower) we were offered a strip view but clerk told us about the remodeled rooms and chose those. The pillowtop bed was very comfortable, even a flat screen tv in the bathroom. We have stayed at the Wynn and enjoyed the luxury but Harrah's for the value is excellent. The location is the best on the strip. Saw Defending The Caveman this trip and it was very funny.

Reviews.Title: “WOULD NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: nihonmike
Reviews.Content: Quite disappointing on many levels. I have been to 3rd world countries that embrace customer service and offer services that put this place to shame. Amentities - none to list. You want it, you pay for it. Wireless internet is not an option in this hotel unless you upgrade - unbelieveable). The drink hostesses and bell service folks were nice and did a good job they should be promoted to Managers and run this establishment. Room clean on surface, howvever, bed hadn't been moved in some time. Had to move it to get to the internet cord lodged in the hole in the wall next to the petroluem jelly and toe nail clippings from a previous visitor(s) rampage. Bed was comfortable, slept good. Walls are paper thin and you can hear the folks talking in the next room. Don't ever buy anything in this place walk a block to Walgreen's and pay a fair price for something you need.

Reviews.Title: “If its hot turn up the air....NOT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: boltenfamily
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great very nice rooms... The problem is I like it cool in the room when I am getting dressed, relaxing or trying to sleep..... the lowest the thermostat went was 65 and it only got to 71.... Temp in the room ranged from 71-77 and your in the desert .....the air coming out was very slow and not cool AT ALL!!!! I know it wasnt just our room because we had 3 and they were all like this... When its 110 there you would like to cool off... Wont stay there again because its not comfortable...

Reviews.Title: “Great Time and Value for the Cost”
Reviews.Author: DS0402
Reviews.Content: I spent a few weeks before our trip looking for a deal on a Vegas strip hotel that offered various amenities and benefits for a great price. I found Harrah's to fit that bill. I was not disappointed. We paid only about $47 per night for an upgraded Delux room mid-week. Check-in on Monday afternoon was busy but the line moved fast. We had no problems with our reservations. The room was very nice and clean, albeit a little on the small side. But hey...how much time were we going to spend in it anyway? We had a choice of view from pool-facing (we were warned this would be noisy until 4am) or not much of a view but quiet. We went with quiet as our days of partying until 4am are past. We actually ended up with a decent view of Treasure Island and Venetian facing north for what it's worth. The room had two flat screen TVs (one in the bathroom) but the cable service does not offer HD. There was a small fridge intended for mini-bar but were were able to squeeze one or two leftover containers in it. As for the rest of the resort, it's in a great, central location at about the center of the strip, which means most other resorts, restaurants and shows are within actual walking distance. The casino at Harrah's is fairly decent (despite some reviews you read) and no more run down than most others. If want the Wynn, go there! Carnival Court is an ok place to hang out (just outside the casino between Imperial Palace). The bartenders are entertaining to watch and the bands at night are decent. We ate only at Toby Keith's I Love This Bar and Grill. It was decent, not wonderful. I had the fried balogna sandwich and it was good. My beer was served in a giant mug. There was a band playing and people dancing and having a good time. Nice country music decor. My wife had to remark about the skimpy outfits worn by the servers and hosts (halter tops and bottoms that say "HOTTIE"). I didn't mind. ;-) I understand from others the buffet was pretty good as well. I saw an oyster bar that looked busy and tasty. The steak house looked pretty decent. Next time.. We saw the "free" Mac King magic and comedy show. We were provided two vouchers for this at check in. Although you must purchase a drink for each person as part of the ticket cost (about $14 each after tax), the bartender really gave us our money's worth. Mine was like a TRIPLE Jack and Coke! Mac King was funny and entertaining. We enjoyed it. I give the overall rating five stars for value vs cost. You really can't beat it for the price. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: mongo61232
Reviews.Content: Booked through allegiant and got a great rate for a week. No line for check in at 8pm when we arrived. Got a room on the 14th floor of the mardi gras tower with a pretty decent view looking down the strip, could see the fountains at the bellagio. Room was right over the carnival court bar but never had a problem with the noise with the balcony door closed. Had good service the entire stay from the staff and was always warmly greeted by housekeepers and others we encountered. Good food at toby keiths bar and possibly the best cheeseburger ive ever had at kgb's. The only reason i didnt give harrahs an excellent ranking is the time share people they have at every possible exit to get in and out of the place. The wife and i would make bets with each other before we would head out to see if we could make it by them with out them running after us with offers of free gifts, it was just plain annoying. other than that, a great stay though

Reviews.Title: “Good room at a good price in a great location”
Reviews.Author: KansasPeople
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at Harrahs last week as a before he starts law school vacation. I have been to Vegas 40-50 times over the years and have stayed at the full ronge of hotel properties---Westward Ho and Imperial Palace at one end to Wynn and Bellagio at the other. Our room was part of a package with our air and worked out to about $40/night over air fare alone. Check in at Harrahs at 9 PM on a Tuesday was a 5 minute matter. Requested a quiet, nonsmoking room and was given one on the 16th floor of the Carnival Tower. No complaints on noise. The room was clean, reasonably furnished with two double beds. The beds were reasonably comfortable. I left the maid a note for thinner pillow and she accomodated. The bathroom was clean. View was of other towers, but we did not mind. I would compare the room to a 3-4 star hotel. We never had to wait too long for an elevator. There were no security guards at the elevators as you would find at a 5 star in Vegas. The location is great at center strip. Impossible to beat. We ate the Flavors buffet and thought it was pretty good-----better than we expected. The employees were pleasant and helpful. We had a several hour wait after checkout before it was time to go to the airport and the bell staff held our bags. When we were ready to go back to the airport there were no cabs available. The doorman approached a limo driver and asked him to take us to the airport for $20. We enjoyed the ride and gave a good tip. 3+ star room, good service and a great location. That is 4 stars in my mind.

Reviews.Title: “Hadn't been there in years, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: BrentwoodMary
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean. Rooms were comped but still nice for free.No coffee in the rooms but, had a Starbucks near entrance to hotel rooms. Staff was courteous and answered questions clearly.

Reviews.Title: “I am not a hotel employer”
Reviews.Author: Sam B
Reviews.Content: I also stayed at this hotel for a week and I too found the service very shabby compared to my last stay. I do not usually write reviews and stay in hotels all over the world including staying in hostels while back packing. I have never had to ask for my room to be made up and I too had a camera stolen from this hotel. Whilst I acknowledge this is not the Bellagio or Venetian, I think that I was entitled to a standard of service. I am not expecting to be on first name terms with all the staff or even expecting a free upgrade. However, this hotel did not make up my room, the taps in my room were persistently dripping and I was woken up every night by whistling and banging on my door. I am not a hotel employee and I live in the UK. I have stayed in the Flamingo and Planet Hollywood (when it was the Aladdin) and think that the Flamingo is a similar price but far better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing on several levels”
Reviews.Author: StomWiltshire_UK
Reviews.Content: First of all, it's important to say that there are positives . . . rooms rates are extremely reasonable and the hotel is in a great location on The Strip. Our room was in The Mardi Gras Tower. It was a good size and clean, albeit a little 'tired' looking. I feel some upgrading is necessary. Check in was a positive experience for us but, as far as I'm concerned, that's where the customer service ended. We just became faceless guests, who received no benefits from staying at Harrah's. Beware the 'compilmentary' Mac King ticket. If you use it you have to buy two drinks @ $9.95 each. Therefore, the show is not free. Also, if you go to see Mac King you can claim a 2 for 1 buffet voucher. . . but to do this you need to pay $5 each to upgrade to VIP seats, so at Harrah's it's true that nothhing in Vegas is free! The last time we were in Vegas we saw Mac King (who is excellent!) so we asked at Total Rewards if it would be possible to have some kind of concession if we went to the Improv. The answer was no. Then there's the gym! I have never stayed in a hotel where I have been expected to pay to use the fitness suite. It is open from 7am - 7 pm and will cost you $20 if you visit before 4pm. After that it's $10. This seems quite steep when all you want to do is run 5 miles on the treadmill. A couple of years ago we stayed at The Orleans and every time we used the lifts to the rooms we had to show our room card. No such system was in place at Harrah's, so I can only surmise that anyone could go up to the guest rooms. Our room had an adjoining door, so if you are unlucky enough to get a thoughtless neighbour, this could prove to be an issue. We had to put up with some loud television noise on one night. Finally - a security fixed iron! I've never come across that before. It has never crossed my mind to steal an iron from a hotel. Maybe this little touch is a reflection of the view Harrah's has of its clientele! (And the time -share Wyndham Resort touts were an irritation!) There are better places to stay in Vegas where I'm sure you are made to feel the management appreciate the fact you're spending your money at their resort.

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear- very dissapointing :-(”
Reviews.Author: katblackburn
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Vegas for a few years now and stayed at Harrah’s last year. It was a great fun hotel last year with music by the pool every day. The quality of service was good and we really enjoyed it, so much so that we went back. However, this year was a different story all together. We had to phone 4 times, over a 4 hour period, for someone to come and fix the tap in our room. We had to phone every day, after coming back from the pool, to ask for our room to be made up and our camera was stolen from our bag in the casino. To make matters worse, the hotel was so loud and we were woken up at 6.00am - 6.30am every morning by stag nights coming back. These groups of guys were blowing whistles, shouting and banging on doors. As 2 girls, we found this very intimidating. There was also no music by the pool and the volleyball seems to have been banned. The fun pool party seems to have been replaced with groups of middle aged convention goers swigging beer at the side of the pool and we were approached a number of times by 60 year old men! We'll be back to Vegas next year but definitely won't be back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay again and again....”
Reviews.Author: sallystyle
Reviews.Content: Harrah's may not be one of the fancier Hotels in Vegas but it's always clean and the staff is ALWAYS very friendly and helpful. I like that they have the monorail stop there also. This is my second time staying at Harrah's and I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great time”
Reviews.Author: classic_creators
Reviews.Content: We arrived a bit early[11am],so of coarse our room wasn't ready,that was ok,because our inlaws room was and we just put our luggage in theirs and went out until our room was ready.The main desk receptionist was friendly and put us into a room that we thought was great.We stayed in room 2709 of the Carnaval tower,with a view of the pool,Bellagio,Ceasars,and a bit of the Mirage. Our housekeeper was very friendly and did a great job so of coarse we tipped about $5 dollars a day.The room was very clean and no problems were encountered...let me think...oh yeah,the tub drained slowly,thats all folks. The safe worked fine and held everything we had to lock up.One day my wife left all her rings on the bathroom vanity and Evellene came and cleaned the room and even put my dear wifes rings all in one corner of the vanity! So,I can't see the bad reviews that people place here,the"bad service,items stolen,rude staff",I really tried to find fault but couldn't.Please note that most of the complainers are first time posters,makes me think maybe they work for other hotels...just saying. Yes,its not the Wynn or The Hotel,but the price was good,the location...well....location,location,location! No resort fees,the buffet was not bad at all,KJB burgers was good too,and Eddy the waiter is a blast,a great sense of humour! We had my 50th birthday supper at the Range and we highly recommend this place and James the waiter did the best to provide a good timeSorry we had to rush James,we had to catch the limo. All in all,we feel that most folks would do fine here and enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Central location with clean rooms!”
Reviews.Author: fet297
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Carnival tower on the 22nd floor. The rooms were awesome; clean with wonderful housekeeping and friendly service. The check in line was average and it took less than 15 minutes to check in and access our connecting rooms. Parking was fine, with access to the garage from the strip (no sidewalks to cross). The gaming was nice, they had $5 tables. If you dont like the gaming at harrahs there are so many options within walking distance. We WILL stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's will be my 1st choice next time. Had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: GottaLuvCruising
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at Harrah's Las Vegas this week (8/08/11 - 8/11/11). This was my solo trip mostly to do some shows. Room 1569 in the Mardi Gras tower was perfectly clean and comfortable. The room was a little on the small side and not one of the renovated ones, but I liked very much. The bathroom was very clean and well kept (not a hint of mildew); basic toiletries were provided. Only one bed (and one person), but three sets of towels were provided. Never had a problem with hot water and shower controller kept temp steady. Check-in was quick and painless. Front desk / bell services / housekeeping were friendly & efficient. Elevators were fast and I never had to wait long. The pool was nice - best part is that Mardi Gras elevators go down to pool level without having to go through lobby or casino or other public areas (my #1 frustration with Flamingo a couple months ago). I loved the length of the pool for swimming laps. But pool hours are too short (9am to 7pm) as I wanted to enjoy it away from the worst of the August heat. Chaises a being used by stray towels most of the day and pool attendants need to remove them and other "lost & found" items if no backside is resting! Reserved spaces available for a fee (I'd suggest charging a less for them during the week as there were few takers). Toilet tank was leaking one day and call to front desk brought engineering and prompt resolution. I loved the location (the reason I chose Harrah's in the first place). Harrah's buffet "Flavors" was great for breakfast (terrific coffee and fresh fruit). Being on the monorail was convenient as I did 5 shows during my brief stay and it was easy for me to get around. I liked the casino, but my slots didn't like me much. I look forward to returning soon and will definitely make Harrah's my 1st choice for location and value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but still had issues”
Reviews.Author: lm_jt_09
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel many times as well as some of their other properties. Even their cheap classic rooms are clean and comfortable. The fact that they don't charge the resort fee is a plus for me but they still try to "upgrade" you $15 a night when you check in. I presented my Rewards Card as well as a $20 bill at the counter hoping to get an upgrade. The clerk was pleasant but did not accept my tip. We got there Sunday evening at 5:00 pm and they said our room wasn't ready yet, but for an extra $15 a night, they have a room ready. Really? I need to mention that we had two rooms (one for my son and his girlfriend) and they had theirs ready but not ours. We weren't even on the same floor which we expected because one was smoking and ours was not. We made our reservations many months ago, our flight was an hour delayed anyway, so I was not happy with this news. The manager came over, tried to sell us the $15 upgrade again, told me we would have to keep calling the front desk to see if our room was ready yet, then finally told me he had a room ready. Again...really? This is how you treat repeat customers. I was not loud or unruly and there was no line waiting. I won't stay there again only because of the way we were treated at check-in. There was no call for this. And on top of that, he gave us a beautiful room with a view of the Mirage volcano. Why did it take so long? Granted the room was much smaller than the room my son got but we didn't mind. The room was very comfortable and clean. We did have trouble with the noise in the middle of the night even though we were in the Carnival Tower. There was an adjoining room to us and they came in loudly each night at 3 am. We put blankets on the threshhold of the doorway because you could see their lights shining through and hear every word they said. And I realize that it probably works both ways. We will go back to Flamingo next time or maybe try out Bally's. The pool at Harrah's has very little sitting but I went out there early each morning and was able to get a chair. If you got there after 9:30 a.m., you had trouble finding one near the water. I like the pool at Flamingo much better. It's a shame they treated us like they did at check-in because I like many things about Harrah's. Toby Keith's is awesome, the location is fantastic, and the beds are great! We rented a car this trip and it is very easy to access the parking garage from the Carnival Tower. I'm very worried that the lack of the resort fee is going to cause these hotels to start using very bad customer service tactics in order to get more money out of people.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: Pat425
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Las Vegas with my daughter and son-n-law. We were there the first week of July, which included July 4th weekend. Since we wanted 2 rooms cost was a concern. We knew we would just sleep and shower there so we didn't to spend tons of money. When I checked out Harrah's the prices were very reasonable, but the best part was that Atlantic City Harrah's card (which hadn't been used in several years) gave my husband and I a very substantial discount on the rooms. We are far from high rollers so we were very happy they even accepted our cards. Although Harrah's is an older hotel it is clean and the staff was very friendly. The casino had many new machines and we pleased with the results. All in all, I would return there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Farrell105
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's in the Carnaval Tower 24th floor August 4-8, 2011. We had a luxury room with strip view. The view was not worth it. We could have been upgraded to a suite for $5 more a night but without seeing it we turned it down because it didn't have a strip view. Even though we weren't in the room that often (just too sleep really), it would have been nice to have more room. Bed was super comfortable. TV needs to be updated - picture was hard to see. The air conditioning seemed to turn off when we were not in the room. It must somehow be motion activated because it turned on when we came in. The bathroom was spacious and the shower was great. Room was quiet and non-smoking. Excellent room for the price we paid (about $70/night, a little higher over the weekend). Hotel needs to update tv's and put small coffeemakers in the rooms. We did not use the pool. We did eat at Toby Keith's restaurant one night and the food was reasonably priced for sandwiches and burgers. We went there one night for drinks and the band was fantastic. They have live music every night. We also ate breakfast twice at the cafe on the casino floor. Thought that was a little overpriced for breakfast but the food was good. Went to the Piano Bar one night and that was a lot of fun. The outside bar, Carnaval Court, is also a lot of fun. We didn't gamble very much at the hotel. We went across the street to Caesars Palace. Harrah's sportsbook was a little outdated and the casino is small and was very smokey. Our room was cleaned to perfection every day. The front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. Check-in and check-out was quick. All in all, an excellent hotel for the money. Right across the street from Caesars and the Mirage and next door to the Venetian. Hotel is a little outdated (tv's and decor) and there were no coffee makers in the room - the hotel restaurants and bars are a lot of fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Value for Money - will go back again”
Reviews.Author: LWeirHalifax_Canada
Reviews.Content: Harrah's is conveniently located across from Treasure Island, Mirage and Caesars Palace. Its only a short walk to Paris Pais and Belagio. I recommend Deuce Bus $7/24hr pass to visit the north or south part of the strip. Lots of discount shopping up at MGM Hotel. The pool isn't great - med size and not enough chairs. Toby Keiths Bar was alot of fun. Great country music and excellent food. Make sure you register for a players card at every casino and you can get from $5 up to 50 free credits to play at the slot machines. Top things to do. 1) Celine Dion Concert - walk through Forum shops before/after and watch moving statues - free 2) Eiffel Tower view at Paris Hotel 3) Water show at Bellagio (best seen while enjoying a meal across the street at the sugar factory on their patio) - free 4) Mirage Volcano Show - free 5) Treasure Island outdoor performance - free 6) Secret Garden inside the Mirage 7) Venetian - shops and decore inside is beautiful. We saw all hotels on the strip by foot mostly over a 3 day period. Make sure you bring really good walking shoes andd hydrate yourself - Aug is a hot hot month.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel. Center of all activities. Very helpful staff. Easy check in.”
Reviews.Author: riverbypalm
Reviews.Content: We spend our Family Reunion at the Harrah's Casino in Las Vegas, NV. I booked 4 rooms for 3 nights for all our family members. Upon arrival, staff was very helpful and pointed out that we can use the Diamond Players' Check-in since I am a member (but only Platinum). The room was not yet ready since we were there before noon so we had to come back to get the card keys later in the afternoon. Harrah's is in the middle of everything. Across the street is Mirage, TI and Ceasar's Palace (also part of Harrah's chain of casinos). MGM, Luxor and Mandalay Bay are just a monorail ride away (at the back of the hotel towards the parking garage). Venetian is just next door and further on is Encore and Wynn's. Belagio is on the other side. We ate at the Ming's Table and also breakfast at the Flavors. Price for breakfast was a little on the high side ($14.99) but the selection is plentiful. Lunch is $19.99. We also ate at the McDonald and "Panda Express" chinese fastfood which are just next door toward Casino Royale. Plenty of things to do aside from gambling.

Reviews.Title: “Here's my Pros and Cons of Harrahs”
Reviews.Author: lovemuseums
Reviews.Content: CONS: 1. No refrigerator or coffee maker in room. 2. TV is in a cabinet and the cabinet doors don't fully open so you can't watch TV laying in bed. 3. They have an automated air conditioning system that is automated when the door is opened and it's not easy to override. 4. There wasn't a WI-FI. Harrah's uses an ethernet cable but the cable was located on the far side of the room. There was one desk in a corner of the room, but no electrical outlet in that corner so I had to move the table to the middle of the room so I could connect my laptop to an electrical outlet and to the ethernet cable. 5. Be ready for a lot of extra expenses. For example, to print something from the internet, I had to pay $5 to use an internet kiosk and pay an extra $1 to print a page. The ethernet Internet connectivity costs an extra $11.95/day. PROS: 1. Harrah's is one of the Las Vegas monorail stops so you can get to other strip casinos using the monorail. 2.
