There's a Subway and Panda Express next door. 3. Room was very clean and housekeeping staff was friendly. 4. They have a wall safe in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ebanda2188
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Las Vegas from Jun 5-9th 2011 for a romantic getaway. We statyed at the Harrah's and it was excellent. The rooms were clean. The hotel provided free shampoo and conditioner samples. The room did not smell old and the bed sheets were clean and comfy. One afternoon we woke up late and the cleaning lady had already passed up our room. But I saw her down the hall and asked her if she could go back. She said yes with no hesistation. The atmoshphere is great. I like their buffet--if you get a coupon you'll get a discount. The front desk clerks were friendly and when we got there (at approximately 10:00pm on June 5th ) There were several front desk help---so waiting in any long line. OVER ALL : I RECOMMEND IT --excellent hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Will return to Vegas but "won't stay here"”
Reviews.Author: sabpins
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived we were told that our room was not ready and that they couldnt guarantee us the number of beds we needed. Being that my trip was paid in full I wasnt accepting of that and after showing I was a lil irritated we got rooms. They were old and in need of some renovating the hallway was much cooler than the rooms. I called someone to come fix the unit 4 times that night come to find out they have a sensor that comes on when you leave the room and it's hot as hell when you come back to the room It saves them money I have NEVER stayed in a hotel that does this and will never stay here again!Management was not very friendly she acted like it was a problem to find us a room that we had already paid for thru our travel agent months ago. I read where people recieved free upgrades we were never even offered this and we were treated pretty rudely. I expressed to the manager that we would never stay here again and should have read the reviews!!!!

Reviews.Title: “would come back in a heartbeat!!!”
Reviews.Author: xlrvss
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the mega places, so i was somewhat leerie about an older propery with mostly bad reviews. No worries. the friendiest employees i've ever encountered ; fantastic suite upgrade;yummy steak house; oh, those crab legs!! and the prime rib that melted in my mouth. I don't understand the robbieries; use the safe in your room; lock up your valuables, even pc's fit in safes. but I regress; I found Harrahs to be very accommodating and I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Harrah's Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Smoke1439
Reviews.Content: Service was marginal at best. Room we requested wasn't available. Incorrect information or omitted information from front desk. We were solicited in the lobby by time share representatives. Very tacky on Harrah's part for allowing this to happen. Gaming was limited, so we spent our monies at other Casinos. Much better Casinos/Hotels to stay at for the same or a few more dollars. Again, My wife and I were disappointed with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “If it ain't broke don't fix it”
Reviews.Author: PeeDee2
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Harrah's many times over the last fifteen years or more and it has never let me down. It's is affordable, has nice clean rooms and it is in the middle of the strip. I stayed at the Flamingo Hotel in January of this year (I also wrote a review) and would never go back there even for a free stay. They are owned by the same property but the difference is night and day. I am one of those people who don't spend a lot of time in their room but when I do, I want a clean and comfortable room to kick back in. Harrah's gives you that and more. Down side is unless you're an Eskimo you won't like the temperature in the Casino they will freeze you right out the door.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the Las Vegas Strip!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaKayaker
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at staying with Harrahs in Las Vegas. We picked this hotel due to the location on the strip. We had a great time staying here. Harrah's is in the middle of all of the action on the strip. On one side, you could get $1.00 margaritas and on the other side, in the carnivale court area, there is a fantastic place to get an ice cream sundae. We were excited to find that we really liked this Hotel and Casino. We arrived early with our flight but that was not a problem. They have a staffed luggage room that you can check your luggage into and you can start your fun right away while waiting for the room to become available. This was a great feature to us. Our check-in was smooth and the staff was very helpful. Our room was very nice. We asked for a non-smoking room and the room did not have any unpleasant odor to it. We also liked the fact that the room had a safe in it. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was very clean. Our room was very nice but the only drawback that we found was that the air conditioning was not doing a good job at keeping the room at a comfortable temperature. I know that Las Vegas is very hot in July but the room unit wasn't up to the job. We tried keeping the curtains pulled but the room was at the best, just slightly cool. The hallways were a lot colder than our room. This wasn't isolated to just our room, the couple that traveled with us had the same problem. If you eat at the KGB cafe in Harrahs, be aware that they will let you split the hamburger plate. They charge a $2.00 fee to do this but it is a big plate for one person to eat and the burger is delicious. They even separate the fries for the plates. We really enjoyed eating here. Overall, this is a very nice place to stay. We would have no problem returning to this property in the future and, in fact, we plan to do so when we return to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “BAD EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: alahistorygirl
Reviews.Content: I agree with the previous post about stolen items from your room. I had that same thing happen to me. The room was not broken into but I had valuables missing. Risk management will not back you up. (of course) Do not stay at Harrah's. No security in the hotel hallways.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas was Amazing”
Reviews.Author: beachenvy36
Reviews.Content: The moment we stepped inside Harrah's we were greeted with open arms and there was not a long wait for registering for the room. We had a view of the north end facing the Mirage and Ceasar's Palace which looks great in the evening and at night. Word of advice make you you get your total rewards card the day you arrive since it has a lot of discounts on the shows and restaurants. We stayed at Harrah's for 3 nights the weather was hot as usual but I liked it. On the first day we walk north on the strip stopping at the Venetian which was spectacular inside with sky looking like it was real. All the shops and restaurants were beautiful and this was just the first one of many. I would recommend going to Ceasar's Palace to see the moving statues which plays about every hour and there is a huge fish tank there as well. As for the shows we seen Pen and Teller at Rio and they put on a awesome show . There was so many shows to see and not enough time what ever show you see it will be good. If you want to tour more areas of the strip you best off buying a 2 day tram ticket for $12.00 depending on who long your stay is of course. In all it was a very good trip just not enough time to see everything in 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Your Straight-Forward No-BS Kinda Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vancouver_gurl
Reviews.Content: Went in April with girlfriends and budget was a concern for some ladies so this was a good fit since it is centrally located. ARRIVING Took a cab from the airport. My husband told me prior that since the lobby / parking area is around back for Harrah's it would be more cost-effective and faster if we just told the driver to drop us off at Imperial Palace. Which we did, and just walked through the casino to the lobby. Short walk and we had only carry-on. CHECK-IN Arrived early (around 1030am) when check-in is usually 4pm, but luckily our room was ready. ROOM Your basic no-frills kinda room. 2 beds, non-flat/non-HD TV, small table and 2 chairs near the window. Good size washroom (for 3 of us to get ready in). **Our other friends arrived the next day, was asked for a room close to ours and was lucky enough to get the room next to ours which so happened to be adjoining. We used the safe to put our passports, keys and cash, worked out fine. however it's very tall and shallow. (Ex. if you have a laptop you have to stand it up vertical in there). The safe in our friends' room didn't work but we had to be in the room for them to come up and fix it (but the wait was an hour), so they just used ours the whole trip, which was fine. BED Sheets & pillow cased aren't anything to rave about. Feels like your average polyester cotton blend type, but clean and crisp nonetheless. Pillows were to mushy and soft for my liking. BUT getting into bed around 4am every night means that none of this really matters. LOCATION Excellent! Harrah's is the self proclaimed 50-yard line of the Strip, and it's right! It's within walking distance of the other hotels going North or South. The only place we took a cab to was The Hard Rock since it was off the strip. We walked every where else, from Fashion Show Mall to the Coca Cola store. FOOD We ate at the Mitzie's Cafe (i think that's what the name was) the day we left, and the portions are huge! (which we noticed was the standard in vegas). Nothing gourmet but sandwiches and soups were great! Service was good, was seated fairly quickly. CHECK-OUT We received a late check out of noon, flight was at 5pm, so we left our luggage in the room, was given a tag and came back for it. Was all accounted for when we did come back. Service was speedy. CONCLUSION If you're just looking for a place to put your stuff, shower and sleep, this is it! If you're not planning on spending much time in the room then why spend a lot of money on it? I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again as we spend no more than 6-7 hours in the room while in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in middle of the strip”
Reviews.Author: manycats
Reviews.Content: Harrah's is a basic hotel in the middle of the strip, which makes it easy to get to most places walking without having to take public transit. All staff were excellent and are room and casino were very clean. My only complaint is it has paper thin walls and you can hear everything from eithier room and I mean everything!!! Hotel rate was very cheap and no resort fees.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's for the location and Comp's”
Reviews.Author: Texassun
Reviews.Content: We had a total of 5 rooms for a group of 12 ladies. My room was comped and in the Carnival tower - we had adjoining rooms. The bed is the best part of the room. The room did seem a little small, but the bathroom was large. We had a fridge brought up and they charge $15.00 per night. Maid service was great, never an issue and everyone we passed in the hallway was nice. The lady that answered housekeeping was almost rude -but we got pass that -- we needed 15 extra hangers ( girls for 5 nights) - No issue with security - we always locked our door at night and used the room safe. Pro -- easy to get around and always close to the casino, smoke was not an issue - Con's - not all the glam of other resorts -- very middle of the road -- but if you know that then all is good. Pool is small - but we always found a seat and you could bring your own drinks down without the hassle you get at the Flamingo pool - like airport security. Again you stay here for the location - nice to be next to McDonalds- and several other fast food rest's and center strip. Also you can use the other CET pools and the free shuttle to Rio.

Reviews.Title: “So very close to getting 5 stars but...”
Reviews.Author: H0ppers
Reviews.Content: 6 of us spent 3 nights at Harrah's 30th July - 2 August. We picked Harrah's because it's pretty central. So, first of all to that lost point....we arrived after an 11 hour flight.....not a huge queue for check-in but only 2 people checking guests in. Waited over an hour - really annoyed me, there is no need. I could feel my life ebbing away...Apparently they were short staffed....I don't care, not my problem.!! So anyway, when we finally got our rooms they were pretty nice. 3 standard rooms, all in the Carnival Tower, floors 16, 17 & 18. 2 rooms over looked the pool, the other the back of the hotel. Clean, good size, comfy bed. No complaints at all about the room. Housekeeping was great, lovely lady, she noticed the birthday cards in my room and when she saw me in the hallway she asked me if it was my birthday (it was) and she wished me a happy birthday. I saw her the next day and she asked how my day had been. How nice that she took the time out to ask. Drinks service is good in Harrah's! We gambled in the casino most mornings before breakfast & late evening. Good selection of slots, didn't play the tables here, but did play next door at Imperial Palace which is also a Harrah's property - see my other review. The guy out back at the taxi line was a nice chap too - hooked us up with a 6 seater & driver to take us out to brunch one morning - the driver - Michael - was also a cool guy and entertained us on our short journey. So, if it hadn't been for the stupid check-in queue Harrah's would have got 5 stars. All the staff we spoke to were really helpful, the rooms were nice, bed was comfy, room was quiet, place was clean. Yeah, Harrah's isn't one of those fancy hotels, but we had a blast. Excellent location, friendly staff, comfy bed, great drinks service ;o) Harrah's does what i says on the tin.

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: Sailorgirl2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an adjoining room with some family. The view was of the roof....not wonderful, but you're not supposed to hang out in your room anyway I suppose. The room was clean and nice, showing a little age. The casino is SOOOOO smoky and cold. Toby Keith's restaurant was good and there was no wait, handy to have onsite. We went for a wedding but still found time to visit the pool, not impressed. Very few seats unless you go on the "balcony" by the fountain. The pool water was warm and the pool itself was rectangle and unexciting. I have been to Vegas numerous times and stayed other places, this was my first and last experience at Harrah's. If you just want t a place to put your bags and sleep it's fine, don't look here for frills.

Reviews.Title: “Coulda Been Better, Coulda Been Worse.”
Reviews.Author: NC1313
Reviews.Content: This is a review for people who've never been to Vegas as this was my first time to Sin City. Most of my peers had been there many times for the same convention I was in town to attend. I knew what to expect, but I was still off put by a lot of the reality of the hotels. First, smoking indoors...all the time. ALL the time. You can't walk through the lobby without black lung. And memorize your exits as most hotels don't make it easy to get out. To Harrah's credit, however, this was one of the more occupant friendly hotels in that regard. Their restaurants we're actually quite delightful. The burger place on the first floor - fantastic. Side note, get the "breakfast cupcakes" - I've been dreaming about them ever since. The rooms were quiet, but that might be because we had no view. I was willing to sacrifice that for proper sleep though. While Harrah's isn't the glitziest and certainly not the most updated, it was affordable and still provided comfort with pizazz. Their on site shows were entertaining (the legends concert isn't as cheesy as you'd think and the comedy was decent) and everything was very walkable. Another thumbs up goes to their staff. They were incredibly accommodating and rather patient when my business partner had lost both our reservation and his credit card. The housekeeping staff was also incredibly gracious whenever we asked for anything. All in all, while Vegas isn't my favorite city, Harrah's was certainly a fantastic haven after a long day at the Convention Center and taking in the city. If and when I have to go back, I'll probably be staying at Harrah's. Valet was also a breeze and very safe/accommodating. Only major downside was how expensive it was to use the gym. I think it was $20/day to work out. My advice if you're a gym person - bring some running shoes and enjoy the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: yasmus91
Reviews.Content: run out of blankets and hotel was not ready at 5pm , seriously bally's has there rooms ready at 10 am, The customer service was very bad , it seems like when they find out your a platinum member there attitudes change. Go to Bally's or Flamingo or Caesar's or plant hollywood, This hotel service was bad, the only good thing about the hotel is starbucks everything else is gross. Wish i know it was a low class hotel before we booked it .The cleaners clean the room at 4 pm , that's gross .

Reviews.Title: “great room @service”
Reviews.Author: vegaslover41
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before . Room was always adequate but view or something was lacking. This trip we stayed in the Marde Gras Tower. We were not far from the elevator but heard no sounds. We had a great view of the mountains our favourite view. The housekeeping staff was great as we are early risers @ early to bed but our room was always ready. Would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: rainbowdream
Reviews.Content: This has got to be the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. First of all they gave us a faulty door that didn't even lock properly. The door made a click when you close it but it wasn't even locked. This caused us to get robbed but the hotel didn't care. They did nothing for us. Also when we realized the door didn't work we were very careful about closing it but their housekeeping people went through out room and couldn't even close it properly and yet again the hotel did nothing about it. After switching to a different room, they locked us out of the new room. It took 6 trips to the hotel lobby for them to realize what they had done. Their security was also terrible. They made people wait 40 minutes just to talk to them.. I mean I could have been dying but they wouldn't have cared. Overall worse hotel, worse service. The rooms were dirty and disgusting. Don't stay here. Definitely not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room!”
Reviews.Author: macnife
Reviews.Content: We came to Vegas for my husband's birthday, had booked a classic room free with our player's card. Asked for an upgrade when we arrived and for $50 more a night we were upgraded to an executive suite. Loved the upgrade! The room was a 2 room suite, with the living room seperate from the bedroom. The living room had a bar area with a coffee maker, sofa bed, coffee table, end table with 2 chairs, large picture window and a big plasma tv. The bedroom had a king bed, 2 night stands, chair with ottoman, alarm clock, dresser, big plasma tv, big picture window, and mirrored closet doors. The bath area had a huge jacuzzi tub, an ottoman, a plasma tv, and a double his and hers sink. The toilet and shower were in a seperated from the rest of the bath area by a door. There was also a telephone near the toilet. Everything was clean and neat. The tv in the living room did not work, but we didn't ask to get it fixed, since we were not there to watch tv. The air conditioner in the room worked great with a thermostat in the living room and bedroom. Both were set at 65, and the room was never too warm or too cold. The hallway to the elevator was very warm though, and a couple of times the elevators were overly warm with no air circulation. We ate at the buffet twice for dinner. Food was standard buffet food with crab legs and fried shrimp being the big items. Didn't wait long to get in. Should have purchased the "Buffet of Buffet" pass, would have been a better deal for us. Definately would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Players Program”
Reviews.Author: cottage229
Reviews.Content: After reading such negative reviews, you have to wonder if people lock/bolt the door and use the FREE safes - I stay here 4 times a year and have never had a bad experience. Just a thought, if you lose a bucket of $$$ - don't blame the hotel :) Be a responsible traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fine-Honest Review”
Reviews.Author: Kellee17
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from July 21 -24 2011. Arrived at the hotel about 10pm. There were only 2 people working at check in and there was a line. I was annoyed because I was tired and just wanted rest. I was on the 14th floor of the Mardi Gras tower 1425. This was suppose to be a Non-smoking floor but the room smelled like smoke. As a non-smoker I could smell it. Called the front dest to change rooms, but of course was told that they were sold out and no rooms to change.. OK its thurs night.. WHATEVER, but they did offer to "ionize" the room. So went to get something to eat, came back and the room smelled better.. enough to go to sleep. The bed was wonderful! It was more comfortable than my bed at home. I thought that I would be cold because ther are no comforters on the bed, but I was was wrong. They have down comforters. I ended up not changing room, but had to get them to ionize it again. There were clean towels and washcloths everyday. The location is perfect. They claim to have a shuttle that takes you to Ballys, and Rio. But the shuttle takes you to the Rio and then you have to get on the shuttle to take you to Ballys. Doesn't make sense because Ballys is closer. Strange. The Carnival Court is nice, from the room I could hear the music, but it was nothing that kept me up or even considered annoying. Over all I would say if you want to save money, but still have a nice place to stay. Harrah's is a Winner!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room”
Reviews.Author: Joetoe
Reviews.Content: Lovely room, clean and comfortable and no stinky smoke smell. Great price. Would stay again next time in Vegas. Only negative was the bed was too soft and made my back hurt for a while in morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1_trip_planner
Reviews.Content: Great location! Great Customer Service. Our room was very neat and clean. We had no problems and enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right for the Right Price”
Reviews.Author: punkiefly
Reviews.Content: I was able to book Harrah's using the Total Rewards program where I got an excellent deal on a room for July 21st - July 24th. Our flight was late, so we did not arrive for check-in until 11:45pm Las Vegas time. There was no line for check in. Check in was a breeze, fast and the individual that assisted us was friendly and helpful. My husband & I ended up getting a room in the Mardi Gras tower of the hotel. Our room was on the 17th floor and about six rooms away from the elevator, which was great and helpful when we wanted to get to our room quick. The room was average...it was just right. The room was clean, included a safe and extra pillows, ironing board, iron and toiletries. We had a view of the strip and the roof of the casino area. The colors in the room were neutral, mostly browns and tan colors. There are two chairs and a small round table. Lighting could be better, but it was adequate. My husband and I were looking forward to actually putting to good use the mini bar that is supplied in the room. We were surprised to find that it wasn't a mini bar that we were used to. The mini bar contained 4 large bottles of water and shaving cream, razors, tampons, etc. It wasn't what we thought. It also included a sign that stated that we could not place any of our personal drinks in it even though there was plenty of room. All in all, however, the bed was very comfortable---just right after a long day and night at the casino and strip. We had read reviews about complaints on the air conditioner, water pressure and hot water. We had no problems what-so-ever! Water pressure was great and there was plenty of hot water. The air conditioner worked always and it felt good to walk in to our cold room after walking in the 110 degree weather on the strip. Everywhere we went at Harrah's Casino, we were treated with respect and in a friendly manner, especially at the Keno area where my husband and I spent a lot of time. The room was average but it was just right for the great price!

Reviews.Title: “Vegas for regular people, nothing fancy, but has everything you need for a great stay”
Reviews.Author: mcbarkr
Reviews.Content: Harrah's is one of the best all-around places in Vegas. Great gaming, affordable restaurants. The Cafe at Harrahs has good food, but service is kind of slow. KGB Burger is excellent. Right out the door is a McDonalds and a Panda Express. Good central strip location. The casino is hopping 24 hours a day. Good entertainment, including karaoke, dueling pianos and Toby Keith's I love this bar & grill. The best monorail station in central strip, the least distance to walk. One of the best features of Harrah's is the Carnival Bar located outside between Harrahs and Imperial Palace. Though very busy at night, it's a fun stop in the afternoon. Get a seat at the bar if you can. The bartenders are flair bartenders and are very entertaining. There is also a Ghiradelli ice cream store in this area that is a good stop. Harrah's has everything all wrapped in one place. Hotel rooms are nothing special, just regular hotel rooms. Harrah's isn't as big as other resorts, so it is easy to get around, especially for those with mobility problems. Pool is just a big square olympic-size pool, but is nice and worked fine for us. Nothing fancy. Friendly staff. A good sensible choice for the regular person traveling to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome..I don't have one complaint!”
Reviews.Author: katyk
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Harrahs and we enjoyed it even more this time. The staff was courteous and very helpful. The location is fantastic with plenty of things to do within walking distance. Toby Keiths Bar was so much fun as was the piano bar. We loved Flavors Buffet with plenty of great food and great service. We had a group of 12 so we got a great deal because we booked 6 rooms. We will be staying at Harrahs on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Average rooms but great location.”
Reviews.Author: Wildkat520
Reviews.Content: The Harrah's is an average hotel & casino. The rooms are clean and serve their purpose. The casino area is smaller and tight in places. Not a lot of extras inside of the casino. However, it is located in a great spot. Venetian-Polazzo, Wynn, Treasure Island, Mirage, Flamingo and Ceasars are all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the second stay”
Reviews.Author: Sinbad06
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to everything. I stayed in a different room this time in a different tower and the room was just as nice as the room I stayed in, in April. If your looking for a good deal without the frills with easy access to the strip, this is the place to stay. Right across the street from The Mirage, and Caesars, and next door to O'Sheas and The Flamingo. Will stay there again. Be prepared to wait in line at registration.

Reviews.Title: “Every man's hotel”
Reviews.Author: Type-A_Planner
Reviews.Content: A friend who stays at this hotel during his frequent trips to Vegas generously got us a great rate for our week's stay. He prefaced the description by saying, "Harrah's is an every man's hotel." I felt safe in my room, was able to catch daily workouts in the gym, and made some money at the slot machines. And, the price was great! Was it the most glamorous of the hotels on the strip? Not necessarily. In fact, we spent most of our time visiting other hotel pools and restaurants, which is easy to do since the tram stops right at the Harrah hotel. We also changed rooms 3 times because of noise and the staff's insistence that we try to get a better view, which was really thoughtful of them. I might try to stay someplace else next time. But the price is luring...

Reviews.Title: “Nice first stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: cnnroma
Reviews.Content: I booked my trip through American Express. My husband and I enjoyed the entire 4 night trip. The room at Harrah's was small but nicely updated. Very clean. The only downside for us was the very late night noisy band/dj. We were on the 14th floor and it was still very loud over carnival court. We were forewarned by the front desk about the noise and they offered us another room at check in -- and we declined. We are night owls anyways. We were told the music would stop at 2 am -- every night it was loud until 3 or 4 am. If you are an early bird and early riser don't get a room overlooking carnival court.

Reviews.Title: “DEFENDING THE CAVEMAN”
Reviews.Author: RicktTorpey
Reviews.Content: We saw this show on Monday night...Fantastic! We are still laughing and quoting the show. This is THE show for couples who love each other, and want to enjoy Vegas together. Caveman is hilarious, insightful, and from-the-heart. I'll admit, I was a little leery about going to see a Broadway show, but my darling wife insisted. I expected a lot of bashing of women and/or men, but was pleasantly surprised by the affectionate nature of the jokes in the show. This one's a winner. Don't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “The Heart of the Action”
Reviews.Author: domsousa
Reviews.Content: As a hotel and for location I would have given this property a 5/5. Unfortunately we were travelling as a family, essentially to visit the Grand Canyon. Fabulously located in the heart of the action , I advise no family with kids below 21 to venture into this high testosterone section of the strip ! :) There are quieter areas ..... but an interesting experience. No complaints about the hotel. 2 adequate double beds, good view at least from where we were in the tower.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every (discounted) dime”
Reviews.Author: Jaman
Reviews.Content: Solid though not exceptional. Arrived at 1am due to airline delays and stood in line 45 minutes to check in -- one staffer on duty at first before two more finally arrived. Room was very clean, truly smelled non-smoking, and housekeeping was thorough. Good variety of casino games (though Asia Poker has been removed) and experienced no waiting even though a weekend. Goofy rules at table games here and there, like $5 min bonus bet at Pai Gow poker. Parking a car is a hassle -- approaching the place necessarily from behind (from the east) to park is a maze, even my Garmin didn't know the names of the roads -- the garage is tight and dark, so valet is recommended; no car even better. Staff was quite friendly with few exceptions. Total Rewards card gets very nice room discounts! Several other casinos within walking distance, even in 100-deg heat.

Reviews.Title: “theft at Harrahs”
Reviews.Author: bunny_1982089
Reviews.Content: My husband and i planned a vacation to Las Vegas for some time now. the day finally came for our trip and we were very excited. we've never ben to Vegas. we took off Saturday, July 23rd. we arrived and checked into the Harrahs Hotel that we had reserved for some time now. we went out site seeing and then later on that nite gambled and had some drinks. we went back to our room around midnit. we were getting ready for bed wehen i stummbled and knocked over a lamp. the lamp had fallen to the floor and the light bulb broke and there was glass all on the floor. i called the front desk to let them no that there was broken glass on the floor from the broken light bulb. they told me that they would send somebody up to clean it and i tolsd them no that that was fine cause we were going to sleep already. that it could wait for the morning.. so we fell asleep and woke up around 6am the next morning. I had noticed that the broken glass had ben cleand up. we startd looking around an noticed both our wallets, money and valubles were all gone., we were histerical. so far from home and EVERYTHING stolen. A hotel staff employee had gone in in the middle of the nite while we were sleeping to clean up the glass and we can only assume that there the ones who stole our things. we calld hotel security asoon as we noticed our thing gone. so the manegers and security came up to our room. we startd telling them that we were burglarized and that we thot it could possibly be there staff that did it since they came in in the middle of the nite to clean when i had told them not to. they didnt even care that our stuff was stolen they were VERY rude and made us vacate the primisses using the broken lamp as an excuse why they were kicking us out. they made us pay 300 dollars for a lamp that only had the bulb broken. if we didnt they were gona hve us arrested. they refused to show us any survalince or to investigate there employees. in my opinion i think they were all in on it. if yall every decided to take a trip to Vegas....stay away from the Harrahs hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & good buffet breakfast”
Reviews.Author: mel1711
Reviews.Content: Great location smack bang in the middle of the strip, easy walking distance to nearly all the attractions. Room was a good size, nice bathroom, was clean & quiet (suprisingly) on the 17th floor. Buffet breakfast was awesome & well priced, so much to choose from! We definitely don't do buffets like that here. Also ate at Ming's Table (inside casino) which was also good & room service was quick & well priced. The casino itself is like a maze, pool area is fairly average, Carnaval court provided some nice afternoon entertainment. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and we'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: MoreBags
Reviews.Content: We had a room in the Carnival Tower facing the parking lot. Room was quiet and in very good shape. Hotel location in the middle of the strip was perfect. We took a shuttle from the airport. It was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Sirrusthevirus
Reviews.Content: I picked this location because it was in the middle of the strip and the location was pretty much perfect. Rooms were really clean and big the only small thing is the walking distance to the rooms but this is Vegas so you have to expect a lot of walking. I was very happy with the hotel and will be staying there again. We did not spend a lot of time in the casino but there was great little food stand out side that was great when you were hungry and it was late.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Trip”
Reviews.Author: DoctorJones911
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to Las Vegas to celebrate my wife's 30th birthday on the 4th of July. We stayed in a standard room, but we had a pool view, which was very nice. Since it was my wife's birthday I had asked for an upgrade, but they immediately said no. Having no experience in soliciting upgrades I settled for the room I had reserved. To my surprise anther couple who arrived later that day asked for an upgrade an immediately were upgraded to a suite. I didn't understand why we wouldn't have been considered since it was a special trip for my wife and I, but whatever.....We had a great trip nonetheless, the pool wasn't anything extraordinary, but we enjoyed our time there. Carnival Court was right there and thought that was pretty neat. Would stay there again for sure! The only complain that I have is that when we checked in the sink in the bathroom didn't work and was leaking all over the place and it took quite some time to get it fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great "upgrade"”
Reviews.Author: SurferBear
Reviews.Content: My husband & I were comped a stay with Harrah's. Sadly I opted for the upgrade for a view of the strip. So for $$ we got to see through a slit between buildings and overlook the a/c on the rooftops below. Wow! a good impression was not made. Otherwise the room was clean and we had a good time in spite of the view.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jucogjct
Reviews.Content: I was worried about staying here, but a friend said it was a great place to stay. We stayed in the Carnival Tower. The rooms were very nice, clean, and comfortable. We were 4 nights. Our mini-fridge was not working but we didn't care as we would not have bought anything from it anyway. The casino was lively and all the employees seemed very happy. The bartenders are very nice. I had met Bob on my last trip and he was fantastic, so I had to take my friends over to meet him. He is very friendly and always ready to serve us whatever we wanted. I wish he lived here so I could go get a mudslide from him. For the price I will return to Harrah's! Thank you for a great 4 nights!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location on Strip!”
Reviews.Author: slotqueenEastCoast
Reviews.Content: I was really surprised, considering some of the negative comments. The room was nice, upgraded to a strip view. Standard room and bathroom. Requested maintenance set thermostat to 70 degrees, otherwise AC is on a sensor. Bathroom tub faucet leaked, but maintenance fixed asap! The pool was not big, but very comfortable. Excellent bar service at the pool. Toby Keiths restaurant supplies the food poolside. Casino not filled with smoke like posted on TA. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised but watch your bill.”
Reviews.Author: lrichards51064
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Harrahs as my sister chose a room there and I was surprised how nice the rooms were. I got a deluxe room which was remodeled with two flat screen tv's, granite in bathroom and a pillow top bed. My sisters classic room was better than expected too as the bed was very comfortable and e rooms were clean. The hallways were also clean unlike the Flamingo. I was concerned though when I had an Internet charge and a refreshment charge in my bill but they did remove them so check out in the room so that you can check your bill. Oh, and the pool, although it was not large and plain, it was not busy so it wasn't too bad. If they would update the pool, then the hotel would be an even better rating. Totally surprised with the service and the quality. I expected motel 6 and got more of a Marriott experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not Our Favorite”
Reviews.Author: Suefranss
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Harrah's Las Vegas while in town on business. Harrah's used to be known as one of the better hotels on the Strip. It's not anymore. The hallways are dirty and have litter on them as do the elevator. The room we checked into had a carpet that was soaked with something. The parking lot is filthy and poorly lit. The pool area is just plain tacky and sad.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LongIsland_NyCab55
Reviews.Content: Room was small but clean. Staff very friendly. Good if you're not looking for fancy. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Back to Harrah's for another trip, and would do it again!”
Reviews.Author: bowsky77
Reviews.Content: Harrah's did not dissapoint. The location is absolutely perfect. We arrived at around 11:00AM, and check in was about a 20 minute wait. No problem, as long as our rooms were ready! Both rooms were ready, and we conveniently were able to be in our rooms by 11:30AM. The rooms were very clean and the beds comfortable as always. Housekeeping was prompt and experienced no problems at all with our stay. I would also recommend the buffet at Harrah's, Flavors. It was actually really good. I ate here for breakfast once, and lunch twice. The 24 hour "buffet of buffets" pass is the way to go. It's like $44.00 and you can eat at any Harrah's/Caesar's owned property's buffet for a 24 hour period. We bought ours at 7:00pm on Thursday night, ate at the Spice market buffet at Planet Hollywood (it was great) for dinner, then we had breakfast at Harrah's on Friday, Lunch at Harrah's on Friday, and Dinner at the buffet at Paris (damn good) on Friday night all for a total of $44.00. I was eating so good that I was sick of prime rib and crab legs! Also lounged out at the pool on Friday and Saturday... It is pretty hard finding a place to lay down, but once you do, it's great! Good music, and a bucket of five 16oz. beers was only $20.00. Not bad for a Vegas Pool experience. Bottom line is this... Yeah this place may not be fancy and glitzy like some Vegas properties, it is MORE than suitable. Clean, hopping, and the location is like no other. Plus, the rooms were comped, so even better. Come to Harrah's, you won't be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great for those on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: EnjoyingLife23
Reviews.Content: My husband & I traveled to Las Vegas with his parents to celebrate their 40th wedding anniversary. We chose to stay at Harrah's because my husband & I, as well as my in-laws, were able to comp our rooms. My husband & I were given the choice to upgrade our room for $10 a night & we jumped at the chance. We had a great room on the 14th floor in the Mardi Gras tower overlooking the pool with Caesar's Palace to the right of us & the mountains to the left. I had read other reviews of people complaining of the noise from the Carnaval Court below ..... we heard absolutely nothing. We loved the convenience of the location of Harrah's to EVERYTHING from other hotels/casinos & the monorail to McDonalds & other cheaper places to eat. We found that the slot machines in Harrah's brought us luck although the table games just took our money. We greatly enjoyed breakfast in both the cafe & Flavors buffet. We also greatly enjoyed drinks & entertainment in the Carnaval Court at night. My husband & I took advantage of a couples massage on my birthday & were VERY impressed by the couples suite complete with mimosas, fresh fruit, & one of the best massages we have ever had. We never actually went to the swimming pool, but could easily see it from our room. The pool area was VERY small with limited lounge chairs. It was extremely crowded during daytime hours & it was not something we wanted to deal with when we could be exploring the strip. Overall, we enjoyed staying at Harrah's. The rooms aren't as nice as the rooms in other Harrah's hotels (such as the Harrah's in New Orleans), but they are certainly adequate, clean, & comfortable. We stayed at the Vdara in March of 2010 & knew that the two hotels were in totally different classes. However, having that said, Harrah's did not disappoint us, especially since we (voluntarily) paid $40 for 4 nights. We could've paid nothing at all. The only reason why I rated Harrah's a 4 as opposed to a 5 is because of what they did to my in-laws (which honestly, if I based my review on the following, I would've rated it a 1). My in-laws changed the dates that they would be staying at Harrah's a few months before our stay. My mother-in-law changed the reservation online & was given a confirmation number which was the same number as their original reservation. Two days before we planned to leave Vegas, my in-laws were alerted to the fact that they should be checking out the following day. When they went to the front desk to straighten things out, the receptionist insisted that a change in reservation had not been made & that there was "no way" the same confirmation number would be given for a changed reservation. Attempting to avoid any further inconvenience, my in-laws requested a room for one night & were willing to pay for it even though it should've been a comp room. The response of the receptionist was that "according to their point play, there are no rooms available for the night". That one comment lost the business of my in-laws, who have been loyal to Harrah's for many, MANY years & also lost the business of my husband & I. We checked my in-laws into the Excaliber with no problems the following evening & upon our return to Vegas in January 2012, we will be choosing a MGM/Mirage hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Go grilled cheese”
Reviews.Author: genobear
Reviews.Content: Over good experience. The pool though sucks nothing compared to Tropicana or mandlay bay

Reviews.Title: “Free Upgrade, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dan717
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on the hotel through Hotwire and they were nice enough to upgrade my room without asking. Room was clean and updated. My only complaint is that they didn't over free WIFI, but most of the big hotel/casinos in Vegas do.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Week!”
Reviews.Author: AJCinMass
Reviews.Content: July 2-8 and it was terrific. The hotel room was totally adequate with a large bathroom and view of the mountains. The room was always cleaned perfectly and we enjoyed the buffet and eateries. The slot machines were "loose" and we came home with the exact amount of money we brought with us. The pool area was great and t\he Legends show was excellent. We found the employees to be very accomodating and I felt sorry for the front desk clerks because they had to deal with "low-life" drunks checking in. We took full advantage of the coupon books given to us and was able to get great deals on breakfast at both the Harrahs and Imperial Palace buffets. Toby Keith's made the most spectacular margarita's and their food was yummy. My only minor complaint is the casino gets much more smoky in comparison to the newer casinos. If you can, definately get tickets for Celine and the Legends shows. They both were worth every penny! We would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: frebrd69
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the pros: The location is great, center strip. The rooms were clean, in-room safe, but This is my first experience with an air conditioner controlled by a motion sensor. Took a little while to figure out that the AC came on each time we entered the room and was always 8-10 degrees above the setpoint. I'm all for energy conservation, but expect my room to be at set temperature. Waking up hot at night, only to hear the AC turn on after it detected my movement, is not my cup of tea. After all this hotel is in the desert.. I won't revisit this one, can stay at a lot nicer hotels for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but ....”
Reviews.Author: Trip-Monkey-Girl
Reviews.Content: The location was great - right in the middle of where it was all happening but the staff really didn't care about customer service and the food in both Ming's and the cafe was very very average. The hotel itself was quite shabby and the air conditioning unit in our room sounded like an aircraft taking off - it would switch itself on all through the night which was most annoying

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: traveler50chi
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. Had room near pool, but did not hear lot of noise even though pool was crowded. Flavors buffet was great! There is a taco stand at end of strip near Wynn hotel that has the best tacos I have ever tasted!! Very authentic. They make the tortillas right in front of you. Only problem I had with trip was being overcharged by taxi driver. FYI: never take freeway to your hotel. Overall, trip was great and I am looking forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cam2317
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed at Harrah's for 3 days with a check-in on Sunday. When we arrived we quickly checked in. I as I always do, requested a quiet room away from the party side and they were very kind in meeting my request. The room was located in the Carnival Tower and was pleasantly appointed. One thing I like about Harrah's is I can always get a room comped. Second, the rooms have decent beds in them which is very important to me. This is why I will not stay at the Paris in a regular room. Have to upgrade to get a decent bed. At Harrah's their standard beds are decent. The rooms are generic with no real flare. A little narrower than usual but this didn't matter. The crowd at Harrah's is a budget crowd. Meaning the folks there are less likely to be interested in what they look like and more interested in playing games. The Casino in my opinion is perfect. It is a gamers casino, not all the flare but straight up gaming. The hotel has a Starbucks! Major plus, however they are slow. This hotel has one of the best locations on the strip and for the money, which I didnt pay, it is totally worth it. Don't come expecting glitz however if you come expecting a good time then this place will not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: emily_fagan
Reviews.Content: We got into the hotel around 2:30 am for check-in due to late arrival of our flight. They did not have any of the standard rooms that we reserved. We were given the option of the Pet Friendly floor or a suite for the first night and then move. We opted for the Pet Friendly. They guaranteed that no one complains of these rooms (carpets shampooed after each stay). We really liked the location, 3rd floor (no time spent on elevators) and the room was close to the elevator. We didn't do much else in the hotel but it was a good central location to everywhere we wanted to go. The shuttle to the Rio (World Series of Poker) was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Linda85730
Reviews.Content: We stay at Harrah's at least twice a year. The location on the Strip and that the monorail station is outside the hotel are a definite plus. I like to stay here since it is not as big as some of the hotels. The spa is nice. I had a massage with Tina. I'd ask for her again. She definitely got rid of my stress! The buffet is good, tho not as good as TI or Mirage. Ming's Table is very good for Asain food. I have usually stayed in the Carnaval Tower but had a room in the Mardi Gras Tower this time. I prefer the Carnaval Tower better. The rooms are nicer. If you don't want to stay at a mega hotel and aren't in the room except to sleep, I highly recommend Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's is really going downhill”
Reviews.Author: pbj2174
Reviews.Content: i have stayed at Harrah's Las Vegas many times - i really noticed this time that the hotel is going downhill and is in need of major renovations. I'm not someone who is hung up on the look of the room, but i do want things to work. During our stay, the tub/shower wouldn't drain. We called several times and couldn't get it fixed. The other thing about this hotel is they have some type of system on the air conditioning that if you it doesn't sense movement over 10 minutes, it completely shuts off. This means at night, in June, when it is 100 degrees outside, you go to sleep and the room heats up to 82. Even though my room was free and would be if i went back again, I'm not sure i would stay. One other disappointment on this trip - we always eat at the Range steakhouse. It is expensive - plan to spend $40-50 for a steak. Usually the food is excellent - this time all our steaks were overcooked. We sent them back and then they came back raw - now i eat my steak medium rare, but this meat was raw. I understand mistakes happen, but the manager didn't come and apologize nor did we get any type of reduction on our bill.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Decent!”
Reviews.Author: pezworld
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much - after all, Vegas casino hotels would rather you spend the time in the casino, right? I was pleasantly surprised, however. I guess the best part was that the bed was extremely comfy, which I didn't expect - more comfortable than most hotels I stay in for business. The bathroom had nice granite counters, the bath/shower was great and the room was an OK size. The walls were a little thin, or maybe it was just too easy to hear the obnoxious drunks babbling away at all hours. And the in-room coffee maker was a bit funky - but at least one was available. And we didn't bother with the pool, which was small and had few shade opportunities. Still, I'd stay here again... mostly because the bed was comfy and it was a good value in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Lovelyy_1717
Reviews.Content: We were anxious to stay at Harrahs this time because we love the casino. We have stayed at numerous other hotels before on the strip and Harrahs would be the last one I would come back to. We usually at least win enough to play back during our stay but we couldn't get a dime out of any slot machine, or a little come up on the card tables. Our money went fast. The buffet has declined in taste and value. We were probably the 10th in line and waited a good 45 + minutes to be sat. There were far more open tables than people waiting in line. This was confusing. For an extra $5 per person you can jump to the front of the line. If you do not want to pay this fee you will probably stand in the same spot for 40 minutes while people walk right up and get seated before you. The room was ordinary, the view was of a rooftop- nothing special. Staff was also ordinary, not really happy to be working there but also not rude. We got a comped room so cannot complain too much- but we will pay for a room somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: citywayne
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through their website. Very easy to do even though we were directed to their 1-800 number. The hotel is conveniently located in the middle of everything. Steps from Caesars, Venetian, Mirage, Treasure Island, and the Fashion Mall. Not too far away are Wynn and Bellagio too. Check in was efficient and rooms were clean and well serviced. The price was right too. We stay here most trips to LV..

Reviews.Title: “Not satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Josephine M
Reviews.Content: The hotel was outdated,no flat screen TV.My makeup kit was missing from my other purse. Reported it to Security but no reply yet on what the resolution would be. Room carpet was very dirty. The housekeeper did not do a good job. Toilet shower wall was not scrubbed well. Under the sink was fillthy. No flat screen TV. Bathroom amenities was only shampoo and lotion. Will not stay there on my next trip especailly that my makeup kit was stolen from my purse.

Reviews.Title: “great value, better location”
Reviews.Author: BigMike5556
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a "classic" room and it was a nice suprise. I was not expecting much because it was so cheap, but the room looked recently updated. It did take a long time to get the room ready once once we checked in. The carpet was clean and the beds were ok. The location is great and close to many attractions on the strip. For the right price, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comparable to other strip hotels”
Reviews.Author: karoleigh
Reviews.Content: Check-in was quick and friendly. We arrived early (about 1:00 or so), but they let us check in anyway. The casino was hopping. There are plenty of games to play, both machine and live. The hotel is mostly kept up. The elevator appeared to need vacuum cleaning, but the rest of the hotel seemed to be clean. The room in the Mardi GRAS tower where we stayed was not very large, not like some we have stayed in on the strip, but it was comparable to the room we had at the Monte Carlo or New York, New York. If you want a big room, it is better to stay somewhere likes Bally's. This is not s place children would like that much. The large rectangular pool is nice enough but there is nothing like s sliding board or lazy river for the kids to enjoy. If you want your kids to have fun,go to the Monte Carlo or Mandalay Bay. They have great pool facilities. The Harrah's pool is adequate for adults. I did not see a hot tub, and that would have been a nice enhancement. We took the free shuttle from Harrah's to Rio. They have a great buffet at Rio's. One negative is that there is no free high-speed Internet.

Reviews.Title: “It does the job, at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: toddgr
Reviews.Content: Stayed the third week of June for a conference that was held on-site. I too had some concerns about security after reading some earlier reviews, but after being there I can say that ended up not being a concern at all. I was in the Mardi Gras tower and had a 'remodeled' room - there was a deadbolt and a door latch in addition to the regular door lock. There was an in room safe as well. There was the usual 'mini-bar' and a small TV in the bathroom as well as the main TV. The AC kept the room cool, and didn't need any kind of 'motion sensor' to keep running - mine ran all the time. I was on the 15th floor and could definitely hear the 'Carnival Court' music downstairs at night. It wasn't extremely loud, and I was able to sleep just fine, but if you are a light sleeper, absolutely ask for a room away from Carnival Court because you WILL be able to hear it. Everyone I dealt with on the staff was very pleasant and courteous. Housekeeping did a pretty good job, no complaints about cleanliness. I only ate breakfast on site, the conference catered lunch and evenings I ventured out to explore and have dinner elsewhere. As far as the restaurants on site, the 'Cafe at Harrahs' is NOT a good deal. $15 for pancakes, plus $6 for a side of bacon? The Flavors Buffet is 'ok', it does the job, although the stories about wonderful cheap Vegas buffets must be a thing of the past - the breakfast buffet was $16, and you are only allowed one type of drink (coffee, juice, milk, etc that is brought to your table) and ice water with breakfast. I did figure out pretty quick though that I could order coffee or juice, and then snag a half pint milk carton where the cereal was. ;) Sorry, but for $16, you should have self-serve beverage w/refills. The food itself was fine, if you're just looking to have a decent breakfast to start out the day. This is an older casino, so the ceilings are low which makes it seem much smokier - the higher ceilings at the newer casinos help with the smoke a great deal. I'm not a big gambler, but I thought the slots were pretty tight, and I didn't run into anyone at the conference that hit anything, but who knows for sure - I probably asked 10 people or so out of 300. There is a free shuttle back and forth to the Rio that runs every half hour until 1 AM, definitely worth going over and doing some gambling over there. As far as location, Harrah's is in a great spot - very centrally located. Overall, if you are looking for somewhere inexpensive to stay, it's a decent choice.

Reviews.Title: “"WARNING" ITEM STOLEN FROM ROOM!”
Reviews.Author: hockeyhound46
Reviews.Content: Upon reading earlier warnings about items gone missing in rooms, I sincerely hesitated to bring my laptop. However I needed to reply and send orders out while I was on my holiday, and now I am regretting my decision big time. My family and I left our room at 5:45 pm and returned around 10 pm, it was when I went to grab it near my suitcase that I realized it was gone. Went downstairs to security and filled out a "report" for RISK MANAGEMENT. That is the biggest waste of you time, trust me. The hotel takes no responsibility, and it is passed on to RM, which by the way, looks after ALL the hotels in Vegas. A HARRAH'S STAFF MEMBER WENT INTO OUR ROOM AND STOLE. I will tell you this is happening more and more in Las Vegas because it is desperate times there for many people. My laptop no doubt is in a pawn shop right now, my home insurance deductable is $1000 so I have no recourse. How I was treated by hotel management was beyond believe and they know it is a problem in the hotels. DO NOT BRING ANYTHING OF VALUE AND LEAVE IT IN THE ROOMS.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back!! It was better then what I expected”
Reviews.Author: milanovictraveller
Reviews.Content: I travel with a tour group and we were very bluntly told by the manager of the tour but also by the hotel that if we got loud or disturbed any of the other patrons that we would be out! That was fine by me. The rooms are larger then expected, the bathrooms are good with showere/bath, toilet. Theres a safe for use, phone, good big tv! The beds are big even for the double room I had, comfy after a long day and night. The hotel is in the center of everything, bus stop just a few steps away. The staff are friendly and helful, I asked them for a bit of info which they gave me. Expect either to wait to get onto internet that is free or to pay a bit for it. To my suprise there were several lift to the floors which was odd to a hotel. The slot machine are got a bit loud and smelly at times but that was normal for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Option for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Terri S
Reviews.Content: If you come to Vegas to enjoy gambling and walking the strip this is definitely an option for you. The rooms are basic and clean, but nothing to write home about. We stayed here due to the comp rates and location and were glad we did. I wish the pool was a bit more fun - it's very basic. We'd consider staying here again mainly due to it's central location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: brookdj1
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate at this hotel. Location is terrific. Staff friendly. The hotel room are a little 'tired' but no worse than any of the older properties on the strip. The duelling piano bar was a hoot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Strip location!”
Reviews.Author: Sandnsea
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the week of April 9-16 2011 at this casino. This was a comped trip except for $38.00. Harrahs has been very generous, and we are NOT high rollers by any means, although we are fairly consistent players. It's a very nice hotel, we enjoyed the flair bartenders at the carnival court out front, and it has a terrific location on the strip. Beautiful view of the Forum Shops across the street. The room was pretty basic, a little on the small side, especially as compared to the Harrahs property in Windsor, which is where we most often stay. Food choices were adequate, casino winnings were nonexistent, room services were excellent, bed and bedding very nice, pool is very busy and pretty small, location is by far the strong suit for this property

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: TrepasseyKate
Reviews.Content: 5 couples traveled from Newfoundland to Vegas in from May 17 - May 24, 2011. We stayed at Harrah's. The rooms were huge, very clean and we didn't have any problems. We couldn't believe the price. Drinks in the piano bar, Toby Keiths etc are expensive but if you gamble at the machines your drinks are free. The buffet at Harrah's is amazing and reasonably priced. Great location as it is mid strip and within walking distances of different shows. When we return to Vegas, we will definitely stay at Harrah's again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: chatterbox-2007
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great, near center strip. The rates were good (I did have a Total Rewards rate)--NO RESORT FEES is great!! The rooms were spacious and beds comfortable. I wouldn't say it was in the greatest shape - I think the toilet was leaking a little. There was no do not disturb sign thing in the room. Stray hair under one of the cups in the bathroom when we checked in. The bag of the ice in the ice container did not look fresh. Check in was pretty quick at ~2:30pm and they were nice enough. Didn't eat at any of the restaurants or go to any of the bars or anything on the property..or check out the pool, mainly a place to sleep and a good central home base.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: TennesseeFirstLady
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Staff was very helpful and kind. The resturant was great. The buffet was the best. We dined there for both breakfast and supper. Great stay for the price. You will get your money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Don't fall for the e-mail trickery of 15.00 upgrade with "strip view"!”
Reviews.Author: Melaniealamedaca
Reviews.Content: It should have said "partial strip" view. Felt very deceived and tricked when opened curtain & saw only one inch of "strip view" to the right. Hotel clerks did nothing when mentioned this deception and I showed them a picture! Will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, good value ,somewhat dated”
Reviews.Author: ProCruiser
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of April 20111. We had reserved a room with king sized bed. Upon checking in we were told only a smaller room was available with 2 doubles. We stayed in that room for one night and decided to ask again to be moved to our original king sized. One had become available, but it was in a noisey location over the bar area. They offered to upgrade us to a deluxe room for an addition 12 or $13 per night, which we took, however I didnt find anything "Deluxe" about it. It had nicer furniture and flat screen TV and the bathroom had marble floor. The view consisted of overlooking a roof several floors below. Both rooms were in the MArdi Grs tower Esch day the hallway smelled of some type of cleaning solution or pest control dust. The location of this hotel is pretty much central to most other area/ hotels you want to visit. The Duelng Piano bar was a lot of fun with good talent at the keys. Breakfast at the hotel was slow in service for a sit down breakfast. The is a McDonalds almost next door if all you want is something quick. Displeasing was the amount of people hustling "Girls to you in 20 minutes". These people were abundant only in certain locations such as Harrahs and The Flamingo. Didn't see any of them accross the street at Mirage, Bellagio, Paris The city or Harrahs needs to clean this up. A taxi from airport costs $35 to $40, but there is a shuttle for only $6 Also convienient to Harrahs is that there is a Monorail stop directly behind the hotel. That was helpful when we walked all day and ended up at the Luxor. Short on time and energy we took the monorail back to Harrahs for $5 each

Reviews.Title: “Ok to crash out”
Reviews.Author: SuziQWorcestershire
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at Harrah's as part of guided tour around west coast. Good position on the strip but obviously does not compare to some of the newer hotels. Our room overlooked a car park but was clean, comfortable and quiet. We had to wait for some time in a queue to get breakfast but, once seated, the service was fine. Visited the pool area but this quite small and all sun loungers taken. When checking in one of the employees was very abrupt when I asked him directions to the correct lift. The room was C and then a number. He obviously knew that C stood for Carnival Tower but when you're a stranger and tired after a long trip it's not that easy. He seemed to be positioned in the lobby to help people checking in but had obviously had a bad day. Didn't spoil my trip to Vegas, which I thoroughly enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Had the best time.”
Reviews.Author: kham8480
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Harrah's on a Contiki tour last November and had an amazing time. The hotel was smack bang in the middle of the Strip, which was very convenient. Rooms were spacious, clean, modern. The beds were extremely comfortable and the bathrooms were amazing. I would definitely stay here again. Can't wait to go back to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will definitely be back!!”
Reviews.Author: SmithtonJules
Reviews.Content: This is the third time for my friend to stay at Harrah's and my first time. She booked the trip and the hotel reservations, etc. at Harrah's because of her previous experiences there. When we arrived, we did not have to wait long in line to check in, under 5 minutes. We were checked in quickly and went straight to our room, which was clean and very nice. We stayed for four nights and our room was cleaned each day. We had no noise problems. The casino in the hotel was great. We saw Rita Rudner who was playing at Harrah's -- she was great!. It was nice to be able to just come down from our room and go to the theater to see her show. Harrah's is centrally located on the strip and we liked that. We used the tram to travel to other parts of Vegas. All in all we really enjoyed our stay at Harrah's and hope to do it again this year.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: travelnmoma
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't pay more than $40-50 per night, but if you can a room for less than that, it's a good deal. We had a room in the carnival tower which was supposedly an upgrade. We tipped $20. The other couples we traveled with didn't tip at all and got the same rooms. Ours did have a strip view, but that was the only difference. It was a nice, comfortable, clean room -no complaints, but nothing worth mentioning either. The gambling was horrible there. We had much better luck next door at Casino Royale and downtown. They do have a McDonald's next door which was nice since there is no coffee maker in the room. We also ate at Flavor's Buffet for breakfast. If you check in on Foursquare you get a 2 for 1 coupon. Using the coupon, I thought it was totally worth it. Without one, I doubt I would go. Everything was delicious though. Our server was a little rude. The employees at the Total Rewards counter were very friendly and helpful. One of my friends won a $20 dining credit on the free spin they give you. We ate at Toby Keith's. It was just ok. Huge portions and if you are into fried, greasy food, you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfy”
Reviews.Author: trueblue001
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at Harrahs. Spent three nights in the Carnival Tower, 23rd floor Classic room. Room was clean, good water pressure in the shower. Maid service daily, replenished everything. Very quiet and rested well. Pillows were the only thing I did not like. KGB Burgers was very good. Only on site meal. Saw a number of staff assisting guests with directions/?s etc. Casino smoke continues to be a problem, low ceiling and poor ventilation, older property. I have read some bad reviews, I don't seem to have any problems. Its a three star property with a great central strip location. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Will Never Go Back to Harrah's, Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: bouboulina52
Reviews.Content: We had visitors from Greece who we took to Las Vegas. Our trip was booked through Delta Vacations and Harrah's was a reasonably priced facility, so we choose it. We booked 2 rooms (there were 5 of us). When it was time to go up to our rooms, the one was NOT cleaned. Had to wait for them to do that. That rooms sink kept on clogging and the water would not go down. We called the Front Desk and finally the second day they fixed it. The other room had the same problem and they never fixed that. We left our towels on the floor so they would change them and they LEFT them and were not changed. A couple of us went to the Buffet at Harrah's and we were NOT impressed at all. The day before we had gone to the Paris Buffet and that was very good. Concierge was not a big help. We asked a few questions and they didn't have the attitude to want to help us. Like I always do, I put the DO NOT DISTURB sign on the door the day we check out and I forgot to put it back in the room. My daughter and I were walking down the hall to leave and the "housekeeper" was YELLING at us about why we left the sign up!! Couldn't believe that one. I went to check out and I was telling this to the Front Desk person, not even a "sorry about that." The last Harrah's employee that we had contact with was the car BellHop person and he was so RUDE that my daughter wanted to pop him one!!! *The people at Harrah's need an attitude adjustment. You would think that they would want to be helpful and make your stay a nice one. NOT AT HARRAH's!! (the only saving grace for this place is that it is in a great spot on the Strip)

Reviews.Title: “great value hotel in the heart of the strip”
Reviews.Author: Gord_Mtl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the central part of the strip right across from Caesar's Palace and next to the Venetian and the Flamingo. It is located on my favourite part of the strip. I was booked in the standard room but got upgraded to the deluxe room as they had run out of my bedding choice. The deluxe rooms look recently renovated and are nice. The beds were a bit higher off the ground than my liking but regardless I had an ok sleep. My complaint about the room is that when we first got into the room, the housekeeping staff must have had to clean up something that was pretty bad in the room previously as it smelled completely of cleaning solutions. As I was too lazy to get the room changed, I ended up opening up windows in the room to let it air out. I got to spend some time lounging around the pool. The pool area at Harrahs was completely packed around the pool but there is another area just up from the pool which was fairly quiet. As with all the other hotels along the strip, parking is free.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: DogButt
Reviews.Content: Like most of you reading this, I was worried about security in the room. Upon getting into my room and storing my stash in the in-room safe, it wouldn't lock. I called maintenance and stopped waiting around. After a few hours, I returned to my room with a room voicemail saying they couldn't enter the room without me there. They fixed the safe and at no time, did I feel like I wasn't secure. The dealers were great. The hotel felt dirty, it's showing it's age. We ate at the buffet and it was average. Checkin was quick, hotel location was great. I played slots, table games and VP and getting a CW was hard to do. I ended up going to the bar for some coffee in the morning. I'd stay there again if my room was comped, but felt that other hotels on the strip felt more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “lack off wont be back”
Reviews.Author: Kentishlady11
Reviews.Content: room comfy but no tea and coffee machine,also for the 1st 2 days ice machine on our floor not working,free gift turned out to be a con to buy a time share,food from buffet good selection but hot food cold.Also adjoing room not ready on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the younger crowd”
Reviews.Author: Sarge7474
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 5 day trip to Vegas with family. We stayed on the 9th floor of the Mardi Gras tower. What we did not relize on check in was that we were overlooking the carnival court. My husband and I could not sleep due to the noise and music. We had to contact the front desk at Midnight to request a room change. Thankfully they were able to move us to a room on the same floor in order to stay near family. The customer service was hit or miss. Some of the employees of Harrah's were outstanding but this was the exception. Most of the staff acted like they were bothered when asked to work. The negative attitude was easily seen and felt. At least they could pretend to be happy to work as this is part of their job. The rooms were very clean and nicely appointed. It would not be good for any more than a couple as they were tight on space. I would only recommend this hotel to a younger person who was a night owl. It would be perfect if you were on a budget and just wanted to come to Vegas to party. DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU ARE OVER 35, NEED YOUR SLEEP OR EXPECT DECENT CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Still a Gem”
Reviews.Author: wrenvander_11
Reviews.Content: Harrah's is an older hotel located right on the strip. The staff was friendly and very knowlegeable and our room was smaller but certainly adequate and was appointed nicely. I think what's great about this hotel is the location, and it's certainly a bonus to have the monorail station located on site. Theres some decent night life on the ground floor on the weekends too. My only misgiving would be that I only wish they had a larger pool, but other than that- was a great experience altogether.

Reviews.Title: “Would Go Back”
Reviews.Author: wood5
Reviews.Content: Styaed at Harrahs at the end of May. For a group of 11 of us - it was the perfect place. Location is great. We stayed in the Carnival Tower. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Carnival Court was fun. There were always chairs at the pool. Staff was very accomodating for the large group. The only bad part of our stay was TOBY KEITH BAR - the service was AWFUL and the food was COLD. Our table had ordered before 2 other large groups came in. The other 2 large groups got their food 1st. When we asked the waitress - she said one of our entrees had been forgotten but was coming right out. Well, the 1 entree was hot - the rest had been sitting under a warmer for a LONG time. The waitress would not come back for any other drink orders or to see how the food was. She dropped off the ticket and ran away from our table and did not come back. When we asked to see a manager - we were told that it would be a 1/2 hour wait to speak to anyone. I would recommend everything about this hotel EXCEPT for TOBY KEITHS.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck and Yuck”
Reviews.Author: bacointhe04
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Harrah's three times for work. Each time has been equally disappointing. The casino is one of the worst (if not the worst) in terms of the smoky air. The rooms are very dirty. The lights literally flicker when you turn them on (like a cheap motel in a movie); the curtains in my room had holes in the blackout so light filtered in every morning. There is a consensus from my coworkers that we should try to ensure we never stay in Harrah's again. It is one of the worst hotels I have ever visited.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's was a very nice experience.”
Reviews.Author: PG_Coach
Reviews.Content: Finally got back to Vegas a little over a year after being married there. For those of you planning on getting married in Vegas be warned: you will have no time to yourself to see the sights. Having said that, this time it was my dear wife and I on a little trip to see the sights. We bought our package through Allegiant Air and when we checked in we opted to upgrade for a few dollars more ($140/ 5 nights) for a room in Carnival Tower. Not much of a view of the strip, but we had an awesome view of the Mirage volcano. Well what we could see through the very dirty window. Anyway, our room had a safe which is great because with all the electronic gadgets one has these days, it is nice to know you can lock them up securely. Room service was great and we returned to a very clean room every time. I find the service at Harrah's quite good, so I thank all of you folks who work hard so we can have a great time. Never tried the restaurants too much. I find the food on the strip so expensive. If you have a rental car, I would suggest driving to the casinos in North Vegas (10-15 minutes away), where buffets are $12-16 and if you sign up for a players card, you get money off and even 2 for 1 coupons for future visits. Two really great things about Harrahs: One, they never ever charge resort fees which many other resorts do. Seems strange to me that a casino will charge you an extra $10-20 night for the privilege of using the pool, etc. Secondly, not a biggie, but Harrahs has video checkout which is a nice thing to do if you are in a hurry to leave. Harrah's was so good that I'll be going back in few weeks to stay there when I go see Paul McCartney.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay here again! Rooms hot, staff rude and Food made me sick!”
Reviews.Author: CatheyH
Reviews.Content: - have stayed many places in Las Vegas but will never stay at Harrah's again. You have to ask them to bypass the A/C system in order to keep the room somewhat cool. The staff really could care less if your there or not and they are great at giving you incorrect information. Food BECAREFUL where and what you eat.
