I was in bed for 24hours due to food poisoning from Toby Keith's Bar/Rest. Overall Bad place to stay service was the worst and rooms are tiny and Hot.

Reviews.Title: “good vegas good location”
Reviews.Author: arttt
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Carnival Tower Rm. room was ok for price . very clean, bathroom small and taps driped a little .Flavors Buffet was good.the twin piano bar is always nice,enjoyed tobys keith upstars and for a noisy mad crowd head for the carnival its all about location location location here i taught the slots were paying good enough and i taught the poker roon is tough

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Crystelshine
Reviews.Content: It is a very clean hotel right in the middle of the strip and offers great value for the money! Their rooms were very clean and large with good views depending on which side your room is. The swimming pool is also good size but is right in the middle of a lot of other buildings and offers no privacy. It was a bit loud at night in the hotel but then again, its Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for Vegas Newbie”
Reviews.Author: Canuckgem
Reviews.Content: Went to Las Vegas for the first time as a solo traveller. Hotel was great! Staff were helpful and knowledgeable. Stayed in the Carnival Tower Rm 1527. It was clean, comfortable and quiet. Liked the size. As a single traveller I didn't need a lot of space. The Cafe and Flavors Buffet were good. I would have preferred another choice for take out coffee as I'm not a big fan of Starbucks. Went out to Denny's for very early breakfast rather than get a Starbucks coffee first thing in the morning. Location was very convenient to everything I wanted to do...figured out the transit (bus) system by researching online before I went and was able to get myself around quite easily. All in all, had a great trip and am already planning the next one.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average with a great strip location”
Reviews.Author: mspenn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at Harrahs several times in the last few years. The hotel is very average but considering that our room was comped down to next to nothing, it's a hard bargain to turn down. We have stayed in a variety of rooms, including a "strip" view. It's more like a view of the top of the casino and the Volcano which you could hear go off all night. The pool area is below average. Tough to get much sun when it is situated between two tall buildings. We will be headed back again this October and I will make a point to be more safety consious based on the recent reviews. The main attraction to Harrah's is the ideal midstrip location. A close walk to just about everything.

Reviews.Title: “very good clean value right at heart of strip”
Reviews.Author: devolutionisreal
Reviews.Content: Our room was in the carnivale tower. Standard room, no upgrades. yes it had a non-lcd tv, who cares? the room was very clean, we were so confident in it's cleanliness, we both took baths. We requested a non-smoking floor and king bed upon check in and that is what we got. the floor and the room showed no hint of smoke and my wife is very sensitive. Out room was prepaid as we booked through orbitz and we were not required to leave a credit card at the desk for incidentals, i was surprised. The casino was just like every ther casino we went to. We didn't find anything at any other casino that ours did not have. There were $5 table games at some times and $10 and up at others. My only complaint is that the walls were thin. That however would not stop us from staying here again. it's vegas! yes there was hallway noise when the drunks came home! When i wore ear plugs, i slept great. i've stayed in fancier rooms, but a more fancy room would not have improved my stay one little bit in this case. Walgreens right down strip on other side of venetian. Check in staff and concierge both helpful. i will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER! FREQUENT TRAVELER”
Reviews.Author: SC4navy
Reviews.Content: Now to start I was originally supposed to stay at the Flamingo which is a sister property but they over booked and had to put me at Harrah's. They were supposed to upgrade my room and refund and comp my room for the screw up. I get to Harrah's my room is upgraded but not comp'd I end up having to pay MORE for their room. I ak to soak with a manager the guy at the desk tries to act like he is until I call him on his lie. Then miraculously all the managers are on break. I've been traveling all day and just want to eat and relax so I leave it alone til later. Get to my non smoking room that reeks of smoke and had a dirty ash tray in it change clothes and head out for dinner turning on the air conditioning as I leave. Get back from dinner and it is even hotter on the room than before I left. It is literally cooler outside. To cool down I hop in the shower and when I get out the water will not turn completely off. There is a steady stream that comes from the shower head. I call the front desk to report it they tell me they will put in a ticket but can't switch me rooms and basically blow me off. The next morning after being kept up by heat, running water, and the hotels loud crowd as I check out I mention all my problems again and the desk clerk replies with the same putting in a ticket managers on break line. Also might I add being in a suite there is no mini fridge so don't expect one. I am a frequent traveler as well as active duty military and I have stayed in some dumps and I have stayed with harrah's at other locations with no issue but this ruins it for me. This company will never get another dime of my money and I plan to tell everyone about this. I would have been better off to pitch a tent on the strip and sleep. Will be filing an official complaint with corporate Harrah's and reporting them to the BBB.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Underrated Hotel in Las Vegas-Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ChrisSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: I love Harrahs!! The Hotel is clean-The beds are very comfortable-The Staff is Great-The Restaurants are Great-The location is second to none--I just can say enough great things about this Hotel-This place beats the fancier Resorts on the strip by a mile-Oh yeah and its a great value

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's is the place to go!!! Don't be put off by a few negative reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiRita
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a package with airfare,,hotel and car, and Harrah's was one of the more reasonable priced choices. We were concerned about the hotel, as we had stayed at the Imperial Palace next door several years ago..and were not pleased.(old,smokey,etc) And we read a number of recent negative reviews about Harrah"s, but could'nt have been happier with our choice. You're right on the strip, across from Caesars,.and there is a lot of activity in that area. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful, and we were in the Carnival Tower, in the back of the building, Our room was spacious,quiet, very clean, with one of the most comfoartable beds ever. Any questions or concerns were taken care of immediatley. Lots to do within the hotel, we ate at Toby Keiths' Bar and Grill, no cover to get in, with live band and great food. Many other choices within the hotel. Don't be put off by some of the negative reviews...this is a great choice!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would think twice!”
Reviews.Author: Tweety629
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night and a half, we got comped rooms. Check in was ok, except they kept taking the check out guests before the check in guests very confusing. We had booked a classic room 2 queen beds non-smoking, with early check in, We were given what we reserved in the Carnival Tower 2806 and were in our room by 1130am, not a real view of anything you could see the mountains. The room and bathroom was very small and outdated, all you could hear was doors opening and closing all night long, we were on a non-smoking floor but all you could smell was cigarette smoke. The pool area was very small, busy and hard to find a place to lay out. The buffet was small but had all the breakfast staples.

Reviews.Title: “Best sleep while on vacation and great location.”
Reviews.Author: curlingchica
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with another couple stayed at this hotel from April 18-21st. Upon check-in we were assigned a room in the mardi-gras tower which appears to be the newer of the two towers. We arrived late and the hotel was full so we were assigned a room on the 3rd floor which is a pet friendly floor and our view was of air conditioning and kitchen vents and a catwalk. Not the best, so we kept our curtains closed. The room did have a nice bathroom with a flatscreen TV and the room also had a flatscreen TV. The bed and the pillows were amazingly comfortable. Unfortunately, after going to bed very late we were woken up at around 6:30 am by screaming kids and an angry mom along with barking dogs. We requested a room change and got it without problem. Our second room was in the carnival tower which had similar rooms but had older tube style TVs and the rooms were not as pretty as they were in the mardi gras tower, but they were bigger and the view was of the pool and strip. We had no problems at all with the room and the beds were just as comfortable. We did have a sight problem with the AC shutting off at night as the AC worked on a motion sensor but was not too big of a deal. The location of Harrah's was amazing as it is mid strip, across from Caesars Palace and within walking distance of most of the main attractions. In terms of location, Harrah's is hard to beat. We did go to the pool on two occasions and I will say that I would not stay here for the pool, it is small and there is not a whole lot of room. We did not have a hard time getting a lounger, but we did have to go to the 2nd level and the 3rd level the second day to get a lounger. The pool is on the first level. The casino is very smoky so for me, it was not the place I want to be, especially when a smoker decides to sit next to you but there are many other casinos that have better ventilation systems that you can play in. I recommend the Wynn or the venetian they are super nice. We did got to two shows, Mystere and Le Reve for which we purchased tickets for at tickets4tonight and got our tickets for less then $100 each for really good seats. Definitely recommend these shows, they were fantastic. We only ate at one restaurant in the Hotel, KGB burger which was great. Best burger I ever had and we were able to use 2 for 1 coupons that we got on check-in. (Be sure to ask for coupons when you check in). They let us use two coupons at our table of 4 for the burgers were less than $10 each with fries. Great deal! They also have these really great sweet potato tots there which are really good. Overall we had a great experience at Harrah's and for the price that we paid ($30 per night for the Sun-Tuesday night stays) it was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “YUCKS. This hotel is YUCKS”
Reviews.Author: 1bhinandan
Reviews.Content: This hotel sucks. We stayed here on our vacation to Vegas and it ruined every minute of it. We were changed 4 times in our 4 night stay because nothing worked in any of the rooms. This hotel needs to be pulled down and a new hotel like the Caesars Palace be built on it. Gosh! I would never go back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: 2009G8
Reviews.Content: Check in felt cold and impersonal. At check in they indicated to me that there were no rooms left with one king bed. Not usually a big deal but on this trip without the kids, a room with one king bed meant something to us. It wasn't until I offered to pay for an upgrade that she was able to find a king room. Upgrade costs are minor, especially since our rooms were comped anyways but we just didn't feel very welcome here. Since we upgraded our room to a "deluxe" we got our King sized bed and the room had a coffee maker (but we had to find our maid in order to get the coffee refilled for the next morning). The room overlooked the pool which was ok. The big thing here was just how tiny the room was. I was very disappointed in that. I understand it's an old hotel, but I wasn't prepared for the two of us to be tripping over each other especially since we upgraded. Elevators were efficient, valet was fine, room was clean enough. The casino is huge and I do love where it's located on the strip. We used the pool area to lay in the sun and really enjoyed moving back into the sun deck area and be able to listen to the bands play on the stage located between the Imperial Palace and Harrahs. If I'm in a pinch to save money I would stay again, but I would probably check Ballys first.

Reviews.Title: “UNSAFE”
Reviews.Author: ROROTHOMAS14
Reviews.Content: Let me first start by saying that I'm a avid Harrah's patron at all locations. I arrive Friday and by Saturday morning had been robbed of $1700.00 cash 175.00 casino chips and a new digital camera while I was asleep in our room. My husband at 5:00 am had left me sleeping while he went to get coffee and look around, my small carry bag was beside me one the side table, I always use the safe for my vaulables when I am "NOT IN THE ROOM" by the time my husband came back someone had come into our room and taken my purse with everything in it. We call security made a report and only after pushing for a answer on reviewing the security tapes did we find out the this property did not have any on cameras on room floors, we were "Agast" that there were cameras everywhere else to protect the casinos money and property but none to protect us or our property. I do not think we are expecting to much from this "Million dollar property" to take our protection a little more seriously. We come to Vegas quite often but I will not stay in a hotel unless there is some security on the hotel floors where most of customers need it. Not the way I expected to spend my 50th birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, nice hotel, horrible view”
Reviews.Author: zsofka
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a winter trip with my friends, at it was really great. However, we booked a room with one large bed, at reception they told us they only had one with 2 double beds. It was fine, we fit, however my boyfriend is like 6`3 so his feet were off the bed :) Amenities were okay, and the room was clean, just the view - of a generator and a parking lot...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: kelnron05
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised at Harrah's. We alway stay at MGM but because the rates were outrageous for our weekend and we were looking to save some money we chose Harrah's. We were a little scared from reading the reviews. To our surprise it was nice! We stayed in room 934 in the Mardi Gra Tower. The room was a remodeled room. Nothing fancy but it did the job. The bed was very soft and comfortable! The pillows were large and fluffy. The room was very clean. The room cooled off very fast. The bathroom has a small flat screen in it. The water pressure was awesome. After many miles walking the strip I sometimes had a hard time getting out! :o) We ate at the Buffet one night for dinner. Food was decent and we were satisfied with it. Saw the Mac King Show and it was really good. Even though we are MGM fans, I would definitely book at Harrahs again and not think twice.

Reviews.Title: “Been to Vegas many times; 4th trip with my toddler”
Reviews.Author: Digoryk
Reviews.Content: I've been to Las Vegas countless times for the last 10 years; I average about 3 trips per year. I've stayed at the following hotels: Venetian, Palazzo, Treasure Island, Paris, Mirage, South Point, Bally's, Caesar's Palace, Stratosphere, Sahara, Hilton LV, Planet Hollywood, Orlean's, and Rio. This was my first time staying at Harrah's and my 4th trip to Vegas with my 18.5 month old. Things that were great about Harrah's: -Location, location, location! It was very central to the places I wanted to visit (Forum Shops at Caesar's and Canal Shoppes at Venetian were both nice places to go with my toddler; both were within close walking distance) -The breakfast buffet was more expensive than I expected, but had food that was of much better quality that I expected---I would recommend it even for the price! -The KGB (Kerry's Gourmet Burger's) was amazing! They had these sweet potato tots that were yummy!! My hubby and I went for lunch while my mom watched my daughter. -We got upgraded to minisuites, which was a pleasant surprise. We got 2 rooms (1 for me, my hubby, and my daughter and 1 for my mom). We may have gotten this because both me and my hubby are Total Rewards members (players club). Although neither or us are huge gamblers, I guess the frequency of out visits helped us out in this case. Oddly, they gave my mom the bigger room of the 2 even though she was alone. -Check in was easy and quick (not always the case in my experience with other Vegas hotels) -Staff was very nice -We got to do a free spin on a slot machine in the Carnival Court because we are Total Rewards members; my hubby won $20 in dining credit while me and my mom got free T-shirts (the minimum prize) -The room rates were very good considering the location. Things I did not like abotu Harrah's: -There is NO WIFI in the rooms! There is a cable to connect to the high speed internet (for a fee), but it's next to the bed, not next to the table! -The casino was very smokey, likely due to the low ceilings. -The rooms are very basic, even our "mini-suite" didn't feel luxurious, but clean. -There was no light over the shower, so it was pretty dark when we pulled the curtain to use the shower. -The pool area was too small for the size of the hotel -There was no kiddie pool Just an FYI---some Vegas hotels DO NOT allow you to push STROLLERS in their lobby; I have seen signs outside of some of the fancier hotels stating that they do not allow stroller use because they are concerned for the enjoyment of their guests (i.e., guests without kids). So, if you are traveling with small kids, remember to ask about this before you book at ANY hotel! Feel free to contact me if you ahve any questions!

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's was great!!!”
Reviews.Author: MGoose1215
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's over easter weekend. Check in was quick, our room was clean and the beds were comfy. The hotel is not expensive,is in a great location on the strip, has lots of great places to eat, (loved Toby Keith's Bar and Grill), and the Piano Bar was so much fun. The pool area is nice and clean, but if you want a place to sit by the pool, you better get there early. There are lots of chairs, but most are on the second and third tier, and the pool is on the first level. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It's really a cheap place for the strip but not for the family. Go to the MIRAGE”
Reviews.Author: Rnplus2
Reviews.Content: As we got there, I was asked if I wanted an upgrade for an additional $15 per day. Sure, why not! When we got to the room, our view was the central air conditioning system of the hotel and the refrigerator didn't work with a lovely note saying sorry for the inconvenience. Made me think what was the state of our original room. I asked if we could change our room. For one, I have toddlers and I need a ref to store their milk and stuff. The front desk answered me that sorry that their ref is not to be used for personal stuff such as that. If we prefer they could send a personal ref for $30 a day. What! More than my upgrade??? The point is that their ref is really BUSTED! It was just a way of getting out of the situation. General summary: it's a cheap hotel for teenagers looking for a good time and old folks who are there to play. ( Who cares about the room cause you're out most of the day.) Well I DO!

Reviews.Title: “Second Review - Second Stay”
Reviews.Author: rjamcfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in November of 2010 and wrote a review then. This is my second stay, this time during April 2011. My review doesn't have any drastic changes about room quality or the like. I got to stay in the opposite tower this visit and even though I could tell the halls of the tower seemed to need a bit of help, the rooms are fine. Very clean, nice amenities, a nifty view of the show over at MGM from the room at night, but not loud. I can't help but feel though that the staff was not as attentive, not as friendly, and the cleanliness of the common areas was questionable. I know cleanliness is a 24 hour job in Vegas where foot traffic has a whole different meaning, but it still has to be attended to. Unlike my November visit I also got to use the pool, I was not impressed, there was not even remotely a party vibe nor was there seemingly an enticing drink selection pool side. Access to the monorail is still, in my opinion, a well kept secret at Harrah's. I know half of the fun is to walk the strip, but the foot traffic in the hotel doesn't even come near the monorail platform traffic, although it did seem it was up since my November visit.

Reviews.Title: “Keep your valuables in your room safe.”
Reviews.Author: bentonshopper
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Harrah's from April 20th through 25th. The check-in process took quite awhile due to a reservation mistake - they did not have us as coming in on the 20th. After several phone calls the issue was resolved, and it did not help matters that I did not remember to take our confirmation number. We were assigned Room CC1817 and the accommodations are adequate for an older facility. I had taken several pieces of jewelry and had my items in a holder with several compartments located in the bathroom on top of the counter. While my jewelry is not precious stones, it is relatively new high fashion jewels, and I liked what I had. I left the pouch in the bathroom while we were gone, and it was zippered shut. The towels were changed daily while we were away. When I got home I realized I had left my computer cord in the room, and after unpacking my jewelry sets, I realized several pieces were missing. I called Harrah's and left a voice mail with the Security Lost and Found about the articles that were missing. They called back a day later to inform me that no items had been turned into their office and that they were sorry to hear I had a loss. Be sure and put all of your valuables in the safe! My jewelry did not walk out of that room on its own. I hand carried my jewelry on and off the airplane, therefore, it had to have been taken from our hotel room. I suspect it was a person from housekeeping or other staff member with a key card that helped themseleves to some nice pieces of jewelry. I would stay at Harrah's again, but I would make sure to utilize the safe! I recommend you do the same.

Reviews.Title: “If you can sleep in the heat with no A/C then this is the place for you!”
Reviews.Author: gregdwayne
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. I booked at Harrah's in Las Vegas because I had stayed there in the past, but it had been at least 10 years. The location is the selling point. Being centrally located on the strip is great. It's easily within walking distance of Ceasar's Palace, The Venetian, Mirage, Treasure Island, Bally's, Flaminingo and The Bellagio. The Carnaval Court Bar outside of Harrah's is always a party with live music which what seems to be around the clock. Here is the problem: We stayed in the Mardi Gra Tower. Upon entering our room, I noticed a not-so-normal looking thermostat for the air conditioner with a sign below it. The sign stated basically that in order to conserve the earth's resources, the air conditioner is set to go off when no one is in the room, and then return to normal operations when someone returns to the room. WRONG!!! All it is is a motion sensor on a thermostat. When you leave your room for more than 5 minutes, the air conditioner shuts off until it detects movement inside the room. Then the air conditioner comes back on until it again detects no movement. It all sounds great, right? Well, when you go to bed, if you don't move for more than 5 minutes, the air conditioner shuts off. It doesn't take long in the Vegas heat for the room to heat up. So, you must wave your arm, kick your leg up, or actually get up and move around for the air conditioner to come back on.. We got very little sleep in the 3 nights that we spent here, which made for a really long trip to Vegas. We had friends/family that stayed right next door to us at Imperial Palace that said their room was great AND the A/C stayed on all night. Imperial Palace is always cheaper than Harrah's. I would say if you are on a budget, go there and walk to wherever you want to gamble are hang out.

Reviews.Title: “LACK OF SECURITY - not a safe place”
Reviews.Author: kcarmo
Reviews.Content: We just recently stayed at Harrah's Casino/Hotel (April 26-29, 2011). This was our second time staying in this hotel after a successful stay in 2007 - liking the location, the value, and the security. This stay, however, proved in so many ways that Harrah's has cut back on their security (and openly admitted it). You need to be aware of this before you make a decision to stay there. After arriving Tuesday afternoon, we were gone all day on Wednesday out sight-seeing and shopping. We left our "do not disturb" tag out because we didn't need any fresh linens or our room cleaned. When we returned, my husband immediately went to charge his phone but the charger was missing. After looking around for a couple of seconds he then started looking for money he hid in his suitcase. Our safe was closed upon arrival and he didn't want to carry around extra cash so he hid it between business papers in his suitcase. It was gone. I then noticed that my suitcase had been gone through - nothing missing though. So we were missing a phone charger and money. The first thing we did was call hotel security and they were in our room within 15 minutes. We had to fill out an incident report. We were then told several disturbing things during our conversation with security. We asked how fast it would be before getting footage from the hallway cameras and we were told that Harrahs has NO HALLWAY CAMERAS. We then asked why there wasn't a security officer down by the elevators checking hotel keys/IDs like there was the last time we stayed there. We were told that because of the economy/cuts in staff, they eliminated those positions and security officers walk up and down the hallways every couple of hours or so. Great! So all criminals in Las Vegas know this! We asked about a key entry because housekeeping was right across the hall when we left and our “do not disturb” sign was hanging from our door. He said that he would run our door and see if there was an extra key entry. We haven’t heard anything yet. The security guard checked our door and discovered it didn’t quite close all the way on its own. Well, we had been tugging at it when we left, but there could have been that “one time” that we didn’t. Either way – doors should be properly maintenanced so this doesn’t happen because apparently there are “door pushers” who walk up and down the hallways “pushing” on doors to see if they will open. I expressed my concern about not feeling safe in the room so the security guard talked to the manager on duty and we were moved to a suite (which wasn’t a suite at all, just a little bit bigger regular room). When we went down to switch out our keys we talked to the manager about the lack of security and he told us that it was ILLEGAL to have video cameras in the hallway. What? Then why do the Mirage, Caesars, Bellagio… all have security cameras in their hallways? I will no longer stay in a hotel without security cameras in the hallways. Sounds to me like the criminals (or housekeeping) have caught on since the last few posts on here are about theft. Seems like a bunch of us should get together and file a class action suit against Harrahs for their lack of security and knowledge that it is a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Smokey and bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: Goladin
Reviews.Content: I was there for a conference. After checking in, the hotel do not give me internet access even though my booking has it. After paying for it, the internet was not working until a technician has been sent to repair the line. The corridor is filled with smoke and the room are dusty. My ordered package went missing even when I left the instruction to have it returned. All in all, a bad service.

Reviews.Title: “Very centrally located”
Reviews.Author: m0m23rats
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews, we had a great time at Harrah's. I was mainly concerned about the noise and sleeping but we had no problem at all. Even my husband, who's a light sleeper, had restful nights. We ate at the buffet for brunch and there was a huge selection. We were there for my daughter's 21st birthday so there was mixed group. There was something for everyone. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Please read before staying here! Terrible and Horrified”
Reviews.Author: hoosierh3
Reviews.Content: First time in Las Vegas. I booked 4 nights with Harrah's because of the price and good reviews. After my $35 cab ride from airport to the hotel, I stood in line for about an half an hour to check-in. The check-in lady was nice and the rooms were nice for the price. Everything went well there until after the 3rd night. When waking in the morning after the 3rd night, I was horrified when I saw that there was what looked like brown dried stuff and blood about the size of a small dinner plate in the middle of my bottom sheet. I established that there is NO way I did that!! I was the only one who slept in the bed. Why didn't I see the mess before? Was the stain there the entre 3 nights I slept there? And why didn't the cleaning lady see it and change the sheets? I called the manager and the housekeeping manager came and looked at it. I told him the story and he said "that's unacceptable, what do you want me to do"? I said you can start by giving me new sheets! That is all that was said. I figured at the least they would send me a apology message or give me a free dinner or something. I went to check out the next day. The check-out lady was so rude to me for no reason and told me there was no shuttle service going to airport (I found out later there was and took it). After that I brought up the incident of my dirty bedding. The manager came over and I explained to him what happened and how disgusting it was. He asked me why I never saw it the 3 days before. I told him that I didn't know why. Nothing else was said and the 2 of them looked at me like I was crazy. I have lived in Asia and have traveled extensively and have never seen this and have never been treated like this by a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “More than happy with our stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: XxHollyxX
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Harrah's Las Vegas for our spring break (April 20-24) and we were very happy we chose this location. We originally reserved a classic room, at first as we were checking in at 4pm, we were told that our room was not r e ady. When we asked if their were any complimentary upgrades theady who was checking us in rudely said no. As my boyfriend and I did not want a 2 bed queen room, we agreed to wait until our room was ready. We went back to check in about 45 min later, and a manager told us that our room was still not ready but offered us a complimentary upgrade but wanted us about loud music and we said we didn't mind,(I still don't understand why the first lady denied us this, she must have been having a bad day!) We settled into room #703 in the mardi-grand tower and had a nice view of the pool and the carnival court. Our room was serviced everyday and did not have the smoke smell like the rest of the casino. Yes the music was a little loud but it didn't bother us, I would open the screen door to let music in as I was getting ready to go out!! I was able to fall asleep right away at night. So overall, Harrahs a great location and place to stay if you are not looking for luxury. Yes the room did have a flatscreen tv and a flatscreen tv in the bathroom also. But who comes to Vegas to stay in their room?!?! I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “April Trip”
Reviews.Author: jlcrn1
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4/21 to 4/26 at Harrah's. Checkin was fast and friendly. Room 856 in Mardi Gras tower. Roof top view...didn't mind...we were in Vegas!! Room was very clean, slightly worn around the edges but overall in good shape. Plenty of storage space in wardrobe. Room had a safe which held my DVD player, jewelry case, and loose odds/ends. Room also had an iron/board which was handy. Didn't use the honor bar. No coffee pot but we don't drink coffee. Bath was clean, plenty of towels and lots of storage space. Hairdryer also in bath. We never waited for a drink while playing. All the employees we came in contact with were polite and friendly. Casino was clean and bright. Didn't notice any heavy smokey smell. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “could not get any rest”
Reviews.Author: pinpuller
Reviews.Content: billion dollar hotel and u have motion senors on the a/c? when i am asleep i don't move! every time i got to sleep, a/c would quit and i would wake up, burning up, just rolling over [movement] and a/c comes on, and exactly 4 minutes later off again. isn't this what a thermostat is for. just get housekeeping to turn off a/c when they leave, to save a little money. i'll turn it back on when i get into room, doesn't take but a minute to cool off. i know u want everyone in casino, but sometimes you need to rest up for those ole crap tables.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some serious attention”
Reviews.Author: Nogami
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Harrah's for the past three times I've been in Vegas on business, and the quality seems to be going downhill rather quickly. It's got a good central location on the strip, however the rooms are suffering: -I was "upgraded" to a strip view room that overlooked the carnival court between Harrah's and the Imperial Palace, which resulted in thumping rock music in my room until 3 or 4am every night. -Bed was extremely uneven. Side near the window was so soft it was like a sponge. Other side was rock hard, resulting in sliding towards the window every night while you slept. -TV didn't work properly, doors on cabinets were missing handles, found bobby pins on the floor near the headboard. -Paid internet access was very slow (20-30k/sec max) -Hearing hotel security evicting some undesirables from a room across the hall from me. Nice. Don't think I'll be coming back, there are too many other options in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “No security!!”
Reviews.Author: cjyeags
Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas for my Birthday, we had booked 3 rooms. The 1st problem they put us on all different floors. The next and last problem was when we checked out I accidently left my new birthday dress in the closet. I went back to the desk an hour later to get back in the room, and was told it was already cleaned. so we had to wait for security to let us in. I went in and my dress was gone. I filed a theft report which took over an hour and was told I would hear something in a week. I did, I got a letter from there insurance carrier telling me that they are not responsible for personal belongings left in a room. Even when you stay there and leave the room, any one who works there can get in your room!! I have always stayed at Harrahs, I wont be doing that again since I can not be guaranteed and sense of security.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again in a Heartbeat.”
Reviews.Author: DaveLavo
Reviews.Content: Heard a lot of good and bad about Harrahs before staying there this past week....I must say for the price and the location it's a great hotel to stay at. We stayed in Carnival Tower looking straight down on the pool and Carnival Court. The rooms were cleaned every day, and although the casinos were pretty smokey, the rooms smelled clean and fresh everyday. The in room safe was a great convenience to put our passports and other valuables in. Mentioned Carnival Court, it's THE spot to head for a few drinks and entertainment. The Spazzmatics are the headline band on stage, and the bar staff is second to none when it comes to mixing and serving drinks...and of course the free shots if you are a drinker....All in all, it was a great week and I would highly recommend staying there....The one downfall, is that the comps aren't that great, I spent well over $300 on machines and only got a little more than $1 in return. Great location beside Imperial Palace and across the street from Ceasars and The Mirage...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, restaurants, BUT....”
Reviews.Author: JenniferBenson_MN
Reviews.Content: We have been Harrah's regulars. We have stayed there four times in the past twelve months. My only complaint is we can't get comp points because we play outside at Carnaval Court. You have to play 25.00/hand and since we don't average this, we don't get one point. This is a real negative when we played outside for 16 plus hours. Other than this I really don't have any complaints. We ate at the Oyster Bar twice. The service was not so great on Friday, but spectacular on Saturday night. The food was exceptionally good! We stayed in the Carnaval Tower on this trip. It was much quieter than our last trip when we stayed in the Mardi Gras tower. Overall, this is a great value. If you use your player's card you will receive great offers for future visits. Just don't play outside at Carnaval Court!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good for Monorail”
Reviews.Author: Simon1944
Reviews.Content: Stayed for business at the Convention Center because it was convenient for the monorail - and the monorail was much easier to get to than at some of the other hotel stops. $11.00+ a day internet charge rankles. All the public spaces including the pool are noisy - nowhere outside the room to relax. An old fashioned, average, casino hotel - but very good if you need the monorail.

Reviews.Title: “Just as good the second time around”
Reviews.Author: ZydecoGal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here again while I attended a conference. We had stayed at Harrah's in October. It was still a great value, and quiet except for a few guests who talked in the hall as they were entering and exiting. We stayed in the Mardi Gras tower this time, which we liked as it was closer to the exits and we never had to wait for an elevator. We took an electric tea pot and some breakfast goodies with us as we knew there was no coffee service in the room and starbucks takes lots of bucks we'd rather spend on shows in the evening. I have a little tea bag kind of gizmo that works well with making "real" coffee from gound beans and boiling water. Other than a having a dirty glass in the room when we checked in, everything was clean and comfortable. I was able to log onto a free wifi system close by as well.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's is a great central location”
Reviews.Author: sydneymom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's to be close to the shows and we were not disappointed. We were treated very well by all the staff. We had a little problem with the a/c and the manager sent someone up within 15 minutes. Very clean rooms and staff is very fast. We had an East facing room(away from the Strip)and had great views of the Mountains and even could watch the planes land at night at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Executive Suite - Review”
Reviews.Author: Gamxiated
Reviews.Content: Since my first review of Harrah's Las Vegas, I have stayed two other times thereafter. The last time was in July 2010 having an upgraded room free to the Carnaval Towers with a strip view (Mirage Volcano can be seen). Most recently got a $50 upgrade to an Executive Suite to the Carnaval Tower. Although some people may say Harrah's is worn down, needs update, etc., the value is exceptional with good service, great location, and comfortable rooms. The suite was amazing with the view of the airport and canyons of Vegas. Bathroom was large with a whirlpool tub, shower, and two sinks. Bedroom was large, which could have fit a walk in closet rather than a small closet for clothes. Bed was comfortable with this pillow I wanted to take home cause it rested my next wonderfully. Living room had a bar with sink and fridge, but wished it had a microwave. The living room also had a sofa bed, which could hold a few more people in the room. The only issue with having a room facing the airport is that you can hear the planes take off up to 2 am in the morning. However, it was not an issue since most of your time spent in Vegas is being up all night. The casino floor had two new slots, Wheel of Fortune and American Idol, which was loose in bonus rounds, but better winnings in Imperial Palace next door. As always, Flavors buffet is a good deal, but wished they didn't use powdered eggs, but real eggs for breakfast. Service is flawless with smiles and hello's from all the employees. Although Vegas can take all your money, in the end you take home an amazing time that will always want you to come back and visit the monies you left behind. I highly reccomend Harrah's Las Vegas for its value, location, and suprising upgrades you might get for a low price or free-99. BON VOYAGE!

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: FenFen
Reviews.Content: Good : Location ~ very centralized. Clean. Luxbus stops here. Bad : No hot-water available in the room. When asked for it, was charged USD2.50 for one pot. Bed too soft (think of sink-in in the middle).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Sinbad06
Reviews.Content: Great location on the strip. Rooms were clean and well prepared. We stayed on the 28th Floor. Right across the street from Caesars Palace and the Mirage. The casino area was extremely smoky compared to other hotels we visited.

Reviews.Title: “My Vote is Yes”
Reviews.Author: luv2goLa
Reviews.Content: It's amazing how people staying at the same time have such different opinions of a hotel. After many reviews my trip has come and gone and I give Harrahs a thumbs up. Is it the fanciest of hotels...no or the largest rooms...no, but it was clean, comfortable pillow top beds, comfortable pillows, clean bathrooms. We had fresh clean towels everyday. As for the old TV (no flatscreen) we survived! The staff was very nice and helpful. We stayed on 21st floor Carnival Tower and found the room quiet. Of course I did bring my foam earplugs to make sure I slept good! Our view from bed was looking at Caesars forum, Rio and mountains. Yes, it's at northern end of strip but great locations to the casinos I love to visit. It's directly across from Mirage and Caesars, and right near Venetian/Palazzo over bridge to Wynn/Encore. The elevator to rooms are in lobby by check-in and very convenient. Close to monoratil where we zipped to MGM area one day. Only once on arrival I found tub drained slowly and showerhead broke, and it was fixed immediately and rest of week was fine. A/C worked fine where we stayed. Casino slots were not kind to me, but it was fun. Love listening to the Piano Bar at night. I never had problems while playing looking for a drink..the waitresses were friendly and brought back drinks quickly. For the right price, I have no problems with Harrahs.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of the action!”
Reviews.Author: C_Marce
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews that grade Harrah's poorly I was a little nervous to stay here. Let me start with the only complaint I have. The walls are rather thin which means if your an early sleeper your going to have a not so restful night. My husband and I generally go to sleep late in Vegas so this didn't affect us much. Check in was quick! Less than 5 minutes. Check out again quick! The staff was extremely plesant and one particular cocktail waitress truly made me feel welcome. If you're ever in the slots area by the sports booking look out for Sulema! She's the best. All in all it was a pleasant weekend and I would definetly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Defending the caveman at Harras.”
Reviews.Author: Plasmatt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to see the cave man show at Harras. We bought our tickets at "Tixs for less". We bought regular seating not VIP, thankfully, the showroom is small. The show itself was ok, a bit short but funny for the money. No big production, just a guy, a stone chair and a stone TV. Go to the early show, save your evening for something else.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's Center of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: RichK_1
Reviews.Content: The hotel and casino is great, It is located at the center of the strip and in the perfect location. The staff is above great, they take care of you like you were family and not just a customer. Every one from the maids to the security staff are friendly and willing to help with any thing. It has a very good casino and plenty of great places to eat. Room service is top notch and not a long wait. All in all a great place to stay for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay at in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ethansmith
Reviews.Content: This January, my girlfriend and I went on a short holiday in Vegas. We stayed at the Harrah’s Las Vegas Casino & Hotel and we liked it a lot. The hotel has nice location on the northern part of the Strip, which means longer walks, but that was perfect for us as this is what we needed. All the places that we have planned to see in Vegas where walking distance away. The staff was quite polite and the service offered was good. The price for the room was also tempting, especially when we compared it to the rest of the hotels such as Mirage, Paris, Venetian and Bellagio for example. What we did not like was the breakfast, as the buffet was not very rich and the saloon was rather overcrowded. The onsite restaurants we went to for lunch and dinner were nice. All in all, however, Harrah is a nice hotel and comes with nicely furnished and very comfortable and well-sized rooms. We had a nicely decorated and very clean room at the Carnival Tower, which is nicer that the Mardi Grad Tower. Our bed was very comfortable and we had a coffee maker which I liked and a TV in the bathroom, which was truly appreciated by John. It was quiet, so we had a good rest. The view from our room was fantastic, especially at night. Harrah’s has plenty of options for the free time as well. We visited one of the shows onsite and used the free shuttle to RIO to watch the Penn and Teller show there. We also tried our luck at the casino. I won some money playing at the roulette, while John lost some at a Black Jack table. The Casino was quite smoky though, so two hours was the longest we could stay there. On Friday night we went to the Dueling Piano Bar and had fantastic time with the piano players who were very good! We stayed late, danced and had a lot of drinks. In general, we liked our stay at Harrah’s and we will return, if the price is still right!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room for the price.”
Reviews.Author: VickiMO
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was a bit leery about staying at this hotel. My husband's work was footing the bill, but even if they were not, it was still a great value. Our room was very clean and appeared to have been recently redecorated, it did not smell, the bed was comfortable and was not noisy as some have suggested. We were in the Mardi Gras Tower. Not sure if that makes a difference. Agree the casino is smokier than others but it is on par with other casinos of it's age. The location is great, very central and just two doors down from $1 margaritas and beers at the Casino Royale.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are OK-nothing special--”
Reviews.Author: Eucker
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 day trip and stayed at Harrah's Vegas. Rooms are OK but nothing special........we were not looking for a spacious room as most of our time was spent in casino or by pool. We checked in around 10 p.m. and had to accept a king bed on the Carnival side. As everyone else stated, if you want to sleep do NOT get a room on that side. Band and DJ plays till 4 a.m. We were able to switch rooms on the same floor and worked out fine. Most blackjack tables were $10, but next door Casion Royale was $5 all day long and right next door. Lack of cocktail waitresses is a "true" statement, they need more help. Overall worth the money. Make sure to go Downtown at least one day, worth the trip--cab ride was $20 or $25 1 way. Pool area was nice and wife enjoyed that.

Reviews.Title: “Best cocktail service on the strip”
Reviews.Author: coprhdaz
Reviews.Content: We vary our stays among Harrahs properties. We always go to gamble at Harrahs. Our favorite machines are near Flavors. Our favorite waitress is R'lene. She takes care of us every time we go. She even remembers our name. We go there 2-3 times per year. The rooms are nice. They're always comped because of our game play.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the cocktail waitresses???”
Reviews.Author: ed52VictoriaBC
Reviews.Content: I stay at Harrah's 2-3 times a year, comped suite. Love Harrah's, no complaints about room, hotel staff or food. Should hire a few more cocktail waitresses, coverage was non-existent in some areas, while other areas were good! I don't like spending $200.00 before I even see a waitress. One night at 1:00 am I was in the dollar pit for an hour, never saw a waitress, moved to the penny pit, was there another hour & spent another $100.00 before a waitress approached me & asked me if I would like a drink! When you are spending a fair amount of money, a drink would be nice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Poor Service, Poorly Maintained”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryMegawatt
Reviews.Content: I work in the hospitality industry at a very guest-focused hotel, so admittedly I have high expectations from hotels. My first point of contact was when I called the hotel on my day of arrival to request two queen beds. Four times I was transferred by the operator to the front desk, and four times no one picked up the phone. When I asked the operator if she could put a note on my reservation, I was told "no, only the front desk can do that, and they never answer the phone". Wow... At check-in, the front desk agent was very pleasant and efficient, however only my friend's name was on the reservation, my name was not requested. If there were any sort of incident in the hotel, I shudder to think of how difficult it would be for the front office team to determine which guests were registered in their guest rooms. On arrival, I called housekeeping to request foam pillows, my name and room number was not confirmed, and I received a grunt in response to the request, which made me wonder if it had been acknowledged. However, when I returned, the foam pillows were on the bed. Staff cutbacks are obvious, especially in housekeeping; The corridors were not vacuumed regularly, the elevator was not well-maintained or vacuumed, and the guestroom bathrooms were adequate at best, with the corners of the sink "gunky", the showerhead dirty, and the glasses dirty. The positives of this hotel are comfortable beds, price and location, however this is my second poor experience with a Harrah's property and I will not be booking with the chain again. In the future I will book either the Mandarin or one of the Wynn properties where I know I will receive adequate guest service and a clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: livelovelaugh63
Reviews.Content: Can't get enough of Vegas. 5 days free with plat. card. Asked and got a room near the elevators. Bad idea. Good thing we were too tired to hear them all night. Otherwise, room was nice. Coffee pot included now. Another saving. Shuttles to Rio, Sams town and near buses and Monorail. Great Buffet. Spa worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location - exits right onto the strip!”
Reviews.Author: Vikas J
Reviews.Content: Harrah's was a great option for us to stay. The hotel isnt the most glamorous in comparison to other vegas hotels but it is right beside the Venetian where we caught the Blue Man show as well. I think they have built it in a way in which the back exit of the hotel lets you onto the strip. 4 of us stayed in one room and there were 2 double beds - the beds were a bit small but for the rate we paid we didnt complain. Room was clean, spacious and fairly luxurious. Service was a bit slow but ok. If you are in Vegas for a night out, of fun and dont need the hotel for much entertainment - then its perfect.

Reviews.Title: “All in all a good experience”
Reviews.Author: R6Man
Reviews.Content: Made a quick stop in Las Vegas on the way to Palm Springs and spent two nights at Harrah's. All in all it was a good experience. We had a "Deluxe" room in the Mardi Gras Towers. From the photograph the room like mighty large, but in real life it was a mighty average size, standard-looking room. The bed and bedding was very comfortable and everything was clean. There were flat screen TVs in the bedroom as well as in the bathroom. Other than the bathroom TV, there was nothing special about the bathroom. A special feature of the room is thin walls - sound travels very well so I recommend that you pack a set of ear plugs if you are seeking a quiet night (we were there on St. Patrick's Day so it might have been a particularly rowdy time). Harrah's is right in the middle of the Strip so the location is perfect for visiting all the top spots on foot

Reviews.Title: “Location is gd . Everything else is basic .”
Reviews.Author: hunnybunx
Reviews.Content: That says is - being located in mid strip is great. Cheapeats with mid-range places easily available . Rooms ate really only so-so . I supposed no complains since the location far outweighs room condition . Good for those who wants to live up tp the Mid- weeks to experience the atmosphere ...

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's Loyal”
Reviews.Author: nrkm11
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed there 2 times last year, in March with a friend and again in September by myself. I have had a very good experience at Harrah's for several years now. It's a perfect center location on the strip. If it's hot, I can shuttle or pop in and out of casinos, if not I can walk. The staff has always been great when it comes to service and friendliness. It was hard to believe when I came in a year later and the coctail waitresses not only knew my name but what I was drinking the year prior, and that was several years ago. I feel so welcome and they have been there for whatever my needs were. I have had some real bad service at other casino's ( not Harrah's properties ). I waited for service and was treated like I was invisible because I wasn't a HIGH roller. Not at Harrah's. It doesn't matter. I'm there to relax and have fun whether I'm penny or nickel machines or what ever I feel like playing. Good time!!

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: happymamma
Reviews.Content: The location is great. We had a car and free parking was appreciated. Check in was smooth and staff were pleasant. We asked and were given $10.00 tickets to the Mac King show. The $10.00 was to buy a drink and gave you free admission. It was a great comedy magic show. Our room was in the Mardi gras tower. We could not get the pre sent thermostat to cool off. As another reviewer mentioned, it was stuffy. The safe did not work. We were in a non smoking room, so we were surprised to find a cigarette butt on the floor by the nightstand. The bed was comfortable, the pillows were not comfy at all. We got a good $55.00 rate mid week. Enjoyed the location and food we ate there. There was no resort fee, that many are charging. Seems strange that all hotels charge for internet. But we were disappointed in the room. Will stay elsewhere next time

Reviews.Title: “Always enjoy harrahs, Great hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Gerry-ped.
Reviews.Content: I stayed at harrahs for 5 nights comped this march, This was my 6 or 7th time at harrahs in the last 3 years, and i have to say i have never had a bad experience, From the front desk, to casino personnel, to housekeeping, to security, to total reward staff, all the staff are professional, welcoming, cheerful, and helpfull. My room (MG521) overlooked the pool/carnival court, but I never felt overwhelmed with noise, never had trouble sleeping, and the pillowtop bed was sooo comfortable.!!! Room was very clean, great fluffy towels, marbletop countertop in bathroom with flat screen tv in room and bathroom. Small balcony, (very small, no room for chair!) but great to be able to open up for fresh air. The only thing i would have liked would have been a comfortable easy chair and a small desk (besides the 2 beds there were only 2 hard back chairs at the small round table.) Housekeeping was great, I only had room cleaned 2 times during my 5 day stay, but great service, (and i always tip $5.00), as I believe they do an excellent job, restocking, cleaning, etc. I enjoyed the buffee for 3 mornings for early breakfast, got there by 0700 and there was never more than 5 or 6 people in line. So no wait, and with my play all 3 meals were comped. Also have to say variety and food choices for breakfast were great. (didn't have any other meals there) I am not a foodie, so did not go to any other restaurants in Harrahs, (accept Starbucks), I will return, (already have a reservation for Sept. ) Certainly enjoy the hotel each visit, and always feel very welome there.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the second stay”
Reviews.Author: MalekV
Reviews.Content: We try to stay at a different place on each trip to Vegas but the convenience of being at the conference location convinced me to visit Harrah's again. Check-in was painless and quick on a Saturday night. They had my reservation and the room was ready. The room was clean but rather spartan. The beds were clean and comfortable, the bathroom stocked but simple. The tv was a holdover from days of bell-bottoms and shag carpet but it worked. I didn't even know they still made giant 27" Zenith tvs. My only real room complaint was the air conditioning. If I understand correctly, in order to conserve energy, the a/c goes into a standby mode when it doesn't detect motion in the room. I didn't notice any problem with this while sleeping, but when I would return to my room after being out for the day it was very stuffy. It didn't take long to cool off and lose the stale odor but my first whiff of the room after being on the casino floor wasn't a good one. My lower service rating is based on the lack of modern wireless internet in the rooms. $13/day for a (slow) wired connection is unacceptable in a modern hotel. The housekeeping staff were all very friendly as I passed them in the hallway and never disturbed me as long as my "do not disturb" sign was out. If they saw me leaving the room they would typically greet me and politely ask if I needed anything - towels, sheets, soap - which I found very inviting. Desk staff and cashiers were equally as polite even when delivering the canned "Welcome" responses. I would recommend the Spa to anyone interested. It's not the cheapest and most likely not the most luxurious, but it was well worth the visit. The Dueling Pianos in the the bar on the floor was a fun show and the burgers at KGB were certainly more than just palletable. Overall, it was worth the second stay and will most likely rate a third later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: lakoria
Reviews.Content: Service was wonderful, had to search for a great deal so look and you can get it for less than $100 on a weekend. Sign up for their email specials. Stayed in a basic room and it was comfortable with a great bed, very clean. The location of Harrah's is excellent! The monorail is quick to several places of course it's Vegas so plan on walking!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: dpd60
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Harrah's in February, 2011 very much. We traveled with family and friends. Nice central location on the strip. Did have some problems with our room key, but was corrected by management with great service. Toby Keith's Bar was lots of fun - the band was really good and personable - food and drinks were a little expensive, but the atomsphere was great. Rooms were clean and modern. Ate at the 'Buffet' a couple times - was very, very good. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy-should have said something when we checked in”
Reviews.Author: sunnski
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's LV on a weeknight. Got a great deal through my total rewards. Our first room was average in size. But the issue was the outside bar was below and very near our room. The bass was blaring and even with the windows closed and the air on I could see it was going to be a problem. I spoke to the front desk and when I told her about the noise issue she shook her head and said she knew about it. They moved us to another tower still facing the bar area but we were 22 floors higher. With the air on, curtains closed and earplugs in I slept well. Make sure you ask for the quite side of the hotel when you stay here. I know Vegas never sleeps, but I had to.

Reviews.Title: “Custmer Service Great”
Reviews.Author: lock8527
Reviews.Content: Checked in no Hassles,.Rooms were average not in it very long. We had such great service. From the buffet which is great had Prime rib for brunch two days go a .little earlier and you pay breakfast price. People on the casino floor are so helpful. If you go and see Penny Jo say hi so funny.You can also eat at other Harrah properties and charge it back to your room. Toby keiths a little pricey, go to O sheas, and Flamingo casinos a lot of fun check out the dealers in the back. Great time walk around a lot to see no need to sleep!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: SunDevilBlonde
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Harrah's Casino Hotel was a great experience. It was a very central location and we were able to get around easily to other hotels, restaurants, clubs, etc. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: steveNdor
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and had a great time. Our room was on the 16th floor and we had a small view. It was very clean and nice. Beds were very comfortable. Everyone one was so nice and helpful. We enjoyed the buffet of buffets deal. It is so convenient to just walk down and eat and we wished it stayed open all night. Location is great. We did not have a coffee maker in our room and missed that. We would like to stay at harrah's again.

Reviews.Title: “When in Vegas, Harrah's is the place to stay due to excellent location and fine service.”
Reviews.Author: Flyaway60
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at Harrah's for 10 years now. I always go back. Overall it ia an excellent location and the rooms and service are excellent. The staff has always been accomodating if I have a question or need information. I have a choice of staying other places but always bo back to Harrahs because you cant beat it's location. The monorail, Deuce bus , and free shuttles to Rio and Sam's Town are wonderful. It easy to walk to many fun places from Harrahs also.

Reviews.Title: “Really it's a 3 and a half but”
Reviews.Author: Antony T
Reviews.Content: I can't rate it that. Pros: central strip, great buffet, monorail station, industry leader, fun casino cons: pool area is too small, little outdated, too crowded to walk in the carnival court, rooms are nothing special. Service average Overall ok but recommend staying elsewhere and coming in for a breakfast buffet and a little gamble. Location is the best thing on offer so it's ok but certainly don't pay 3 figures a night. If about 60 or $70 or less go for it.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: millerb
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights room 2042-CT--The room was clean, bed was comfortable.Our room was cleaned every day. Nice quiet location-20 floor-no noise.We had hot water no issues at all.We would stay here again.The casino was ok, we had a couple of wins, nothing big.Legend show was good, we only had breakfast at the hotel at the caffee.Good location, they need more help, some of the lines were long. Not a bad place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ok not great.”
Reviews.Author: wolverinejim
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Harrahs for two nights. Room was typical Harrahs, nice but a bit tired. Stayed in Carnival Tower. Since room was comped I didn't mind much. Room could use a refresh. Great location in the middle of the strip. I didn't notice the smoke smell in the casino as much this time as in the past. Ate at the buffet for dinner one night. Usually I like the Harrahs buffet but this was horrible. I couldn't cut the roast beef. Other food not much better. The next morning I ate at the cafe and the food was cold and the server was having a bad day. Not a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but rooms need to be upgraded”
Reviews.Author: SouthCarolinaAnnSC
Reviews.Content: Our room was not in the best of shape. A hole in the bathroom door, chipped tiles in the bathroom and no storage other than the TV dresser. Very small room and the noise from the Carnaval bar went on to wee hours of the morning. Very good location and right next door is Casino Royale with $1 beer and margaritas. Also machines paid off better at C/R than at Harrahs. We spend 4 nights in the casino at Harrahs and hardly won anything. Staff was friendly but we started visiting other casinos nearby that were not as smokey and in better shape. Harrahs definitely needs to be updated in the casino to get rid of the smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the money”
Reviews.Author: realestatebroker041
Reviews.Content: I had a real estate conference to go to and , to save money, I booked my airfare and hotel as a package deal with Expedia. the price for the room was a lot less that my best deal at Caesars Palace where we had the convention. The weather was great and it only took me about 7 minutes to walk to Caesars. My room was on the ninth floor in the Carnaval tower. It had two Queen beds, non-smoking and looked like it had been remodeled recently. The batheroom was all marble and large. The room size was average. The only mild criticism was that tthe two chairs and the round table showed signs of wear and there was no easy chair or chair with ottoman. Also no flat screen tv . The staff that I met were friently and helpful but the best part was my room price of about $60 per night. Also very good location to walk to most of the major resorts on the strip

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: WindsorCanada91
Reviews.Content: Checked in at around 11:30 pm, got in to our room right away. The hotel is right in the strip. Went to Carnaval the first night. Won some money at the Black Jack table there....only complaint was with the pit supervisor.....had to inform me that I had to play $25 to get rated. I found that to be a bit insulting given that I am a Diamond card holder for Harrahs. Also went to the Dueling Piano bar.....that is excellent. People were throwing theire money to then piano players for song requests. The highest tip I saw was $160 for the to play Delilah by Tom Jones

Reviews.Title: “UNSAFE AND DIRTY!!”
Reviews.Author: chewy107
Reviews.Content: When we checked in our hotel room. I felt something under the sheets! I found a used condom! I was horrified! I assume the Hotel would be somewhat apologetic but all I got was we'll have someone remove it when we service your room! I want it out NOW! I'm not about to touch the condom! Also, My gf and I had a extremely intoxicated man follow us to our room. We called security and had these two security guards that need canes come to our room with really bad attitudes. They banged on the door and really scared my gf. Then we explained what happened and really thought we were getting carried away. In conclusion, if you want to stay at a hotel where it absolutely disgusting and have the lowest of low stay at the same hotel than this place is for you! NO wireless internet and charge 12.95 a day for plugged in internet!

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's - Excellent Vegas Home Base”
Reviews.Author: LakesAndWoods
Reviews.Content: I spent a few days in Vegas for some golf and winter sun. We landed at Harrah's as our home base and couldn't be happier. We relied much on TripAdvisor reviews and found that those reviews that debased Harrah's as old, dingy, unfriendly and in need of great repair were not accurate. We had a nice (not incredibly fancy, but plenty nice; perhaps comparable to a Hampton Inn or the like) in the Carnaval Tower. The housekeeper, Sylvia, was especially congenial and fun. We want to name her for her excellent disposition and work. The rooms were spotless and in good repair. The walls are thin at Harrah's, no doubt. But our stay was still pleasant and relatively quiet. The location of Harrah's can't be beat. All but the farthest reaches of either end of the strip are within walking distance. Parking is free in the Harrah's ramp behind the casino/hotel. The airport is just minutes away. The casino is smoky - this critique is true. We spent little time in any casino during our stay, but walked through a number of them. We felt nearly all Harrah's staff were very friendly. This portion of the Strip is very alive. We enjoyed O'Sheas down the block, a restaurant at the Mirage across the street, the fountain/light show at the Bellagio about a block and a half away, the Hash House A Go Go at the Imperial Palace right next door and the beauty of the Venetian and its ceiling frescoes and canals a few blocks away in the other direction. For some of the lowest prices for lodging on the Strip, you'll have a satisfying, if non-luxurious, stay at Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “more than what we expected. In the center of the strip”
Reviews.Author: tourist428
Reviews.Content: Very well located in the strip. Easy access to most Casinos and a lot of activity. we walked to most everywhere we wanted to go. we only left the area 3 times in a five day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: southwestchef
Reviews.Content: My sister and I spent a few days at Harrah's and we had a great time. The staff were helpful and the housekeeper Sylvia was so friendly. The room was spotless and large enough for us. The shows were great especially The Mac King Magic Show. Places we wanted to visit were within walking distance. I would definitely return to Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: BVGinPSC
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised was the theme for my stay here at Harrah's. I've often walked hurriedly through this venue trying to avoid the smoke and the scent of the guests and given little thought to the hotel above their dank casino or any of the places to eat inside. Well... then along came an offer to good to refuse that placed me in a room at Harrah's. I cringed, but then decided to take up the offer... who spends much time in the casino they book anyway, right?! Upon arrival, check-in was fast and I was upgraded to a Deluxe room. I was in the Mardi Gras tower (closest to the strip) and had an awesome view of the TI sign, the top of the Mirage and lots of A/C units above the casino, but, whatevs.. I've had a view room before and I don't need to see the strip anymore. I just need a comfortable bed in a safe space and Harrah's had both of these. The room was a little smaller, but the prices are A LOT smaller than other strip hotels, so you're still getting more than what you're paying for. The bathroom mirror had a TV in it -- cool! The beds were nice, and I slept well every night. I wish there'd been more electrical outlets, but given that this hotel was built long before everyone needed 20 outlets when they travel.. it was alright. I will definitely stay here again. The location is almost perfect. Across the street from The Mirage and Ceasar's.

Reviews.Title: “average down the middle hotel”
Reviews.Author: biginvegas
Reviews.Content: my stay was an average, no frills stay. this was the 2nd time i stayed at Harrah's. 1rst time i spent less and got better service with drinks and friendliness. 2nd time i stayed i was pretty much on my own for finding drinks. Stay away, i repeat stay away from the TIGHT SLOTS. if you want to gamble on the tables, my experience was varied. had a couple of rude dealers who at 4am in the morning one robbed me out of $40 when i finally got a strait. Definatly sign up for Harrah's Total Rewards. U can gamble at their other properties with the Total Rewards Cards and get alot of offers for COMPED stays at their Hotels.(Ballys RIO Paris, Cseasars Imperial Palace. I haven't payed for a hotel room yet in vegas, (unless you consider money that i gamble :( This March 2011 i'm staying at Bally's.still a pretty decent location on the strip. Over all Harrah's is a decent hotel i recommend it. just stay away from the rooms on the parking lot side. at 4am in the morning someones horn went off. and it made me sick for the rest of the morning, with a headache. we got a room farther up and on the other side so staff was curtious about finding us another room.

Reviews.Title: “What did you say???? What ??? I can't hear you....... I'm in my room”
Reviews.Author: Walker06
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else says "Great location!!!!!!!!".... yep, can't argue with that one. It's slap bang in Centre Strip. It's an easy walk to Mirage, Treasure Island, Venetian, Wynn, Imperial Palace and most other properties..... except Circus Circus maybe.... and why would you ever want to go there in the first place? I've even met rats that have moved out mumbling something about "It's gone downhill lately......" Harrah's has pretty much everything you want from a Vegas hotel. The casino is a good size with a wide enough variety of machines. The cocktails come fast, come strong and come often. The Buffet is a little on the pricey side but still worth a trip....... only the once though. It has the fitness centre and business centre that you'll walk by and never use (it's Vegas...... i mean who wants to be sending a fax??) The Monorail is out the back should you wish to use it and generally the check in speed is up there with the best and the lifts work well (take note Imperial Palace. Waiting 20 minutes for an lift might put your paying guests in a bit of a bad mood....... except if it was a lift like the one in Willy Wonka's factory... i'd wait an hour for that one). All in all then, a good hotel for your first trip to Vegas, easy to get around for the physically challenged and good value for money..... however... A hotel is only as good as the quality of sleep you can have there, and on this score i'm afraid to say Harrah's is terrible! If it's not the bar downstairs blasting away until the early hours it's the group of 30 students who've decided to have a party in the room next door (seriously, this happened every night for a week.... with different people too..... you're in Vegas and you decide to have a party in your room? Is this the Las vegas branch of Agoraphobics Anonymous or something?) In conclusion, it's a nice hotel and everything, but I wouldn't stay there again. You might have to wait 20 minutes for a lift to your room in the Imperial Palace but at least you'll be able to sleep when you get there! Plus you'd still be in the Centre Strip and it's "Great Location!!!!!!!!!"

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: midwest_familyof5
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay here. The location is so convenient with the monorail right behind it and the 2 deuce stations within a block or so. Have stayed at both towers and at both the beds are extremely comfortable and you are provided plenty of pillows. Only complaint was house keeping knocking on our door Sunday morning at 7:30 am. Really on a weekend in Vegas at that hour? Had meals at 3 of their eateries.Was disappointed to find they no longer have a 24 hour restaurant. The breakfast buffet here never disappoints. Was rather surprised at the increase in prices at the coffee shop diner. Paid $4 for a glass of iced tea which was higher than anywhere else on the strip. KGB Burger was really good and the sweet potato tots the waiter recommended were amazing. There is a Chipolte and Mickey D right outside the entrance if you prefer. The casino has a good variety of machines and enjoyed listening to the karaoke from the piano bar while playing.If you just want to relax and gamble this is a great place, It does not have the fancy decor that some of the high end hotels casinos have. Friendly waitress who came around often. Avoid Imperial Palace next door which is small,smoky and crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, wish could say the same abouth the hotel”
Reviews.Author: martymania85
Reviews.Content: It is an okay hotel, straight up average nothing to brag about. The decor is kind of dated and the casino is dated too compared to some of the new/remodeled ones down the strip. Although what the hotel misses on that they make up in location, they are flat in the middle of the strip and within walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Caution housekeeping came into room while wife was alone sleeping at 10 pm”
Reviews.Author: traveltimCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's for two nights Feb 4 and 5, 2011. We got up early on Feb 5 and spent the entire day out. We came back to the hotel room around 5 pm and the room had not been cleaned or the bed made up. We went out for the evening and my wife was feeling tired around 9 pm so we went back to the room so she could sleep, the room was still not made up. My wife went to sleep and I went back down to the casino. I went back to the room at 11:30 pm and my wife was scared. She said that the a lady unlocked the door and came into the room and this scared her and woke her up, the lady said she was from housekeeping and asked her if she had called to have the room cleaned. This sounds a bit strange to me and I think t6hat maybe if my wife was not there that perhaps they were looking to take things from the room. I went to see the magager the next morning to vioce my concerns and she was not helpful at all and made me feel like I was making it all up. When we checkout an hour later and I asked for the manager's business card so I could follow it up. They would not give me a card only the first name and the first letter of her last name "Carrie O " saying they had two Carrie's. Be very careful if you decide to stay here and don't mind not getting your room cleaned or feeling unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location - love it here”
Reviews.Author: jpatt
Reviews.Content: this was our 10th Jan is Vegas..always stay at a Harrahs property. Was unsure if Harrahs was going to disappoint, or look old. We stayed in the Mardi Gras tower - 14th floor - view of the courtyard. Loved our room - flat screen tv in bathroom, comfy bed. The music is loud till about 3am - but did not bother us a bit. We love the outside Bar...went to see Legends - very fun...good seats. Bought tix and the half price place. We also ate at the new burger place - delicious, but very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mistyfordgraham
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Jan. 2011. Upon arrival, my room was not ready but they offered to "upgrade" if I payed an extra $50. I agreed because I wanted to get my vacation started with minimal waiting. (I would have had to pay a resort fee at any other hotel anyway.)
