The room was decent with a balcony overlooking the pool on the 7th floor. This provided quick and easy access to the bar on the casino floor. Yeah! The bartenders were courteous and nice considering 300+ Harrah's employees are being laid off due to terrible management. Tried the Buffets of Buffets and was pleasantly suprised that Harrah's and Flamingo turned out to be the best buffets with this plan. If you purchase around 7pm, you will definately get to eat at least 4 meals. (This was a steal compared to other Vegas food prices.) You cannot beat the location of this hotel!!! Right next door is Casino Royale!! $1 beers, loose slots and $5 table games!! I would definately recommend staying at Harrah's for this reason alone!! Oh, and the world's BEST Mcdonalds!!! ;)

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: Walker1987
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here this past weekend. The visit was less than stellar. The hotel is very smokey, the staff is rude and the extra fees for ammenities such as internet and television are outrageous. This hotel is old and not kept up very well. For the price one could stay at a much nicer establishment. We attempted to dine there one evening, and waited 15 minutes for our drinks alone before we left and went elsewhere. I would not reccommend Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “Best price and location”
Reviews.Author: traveller65432107
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated at the best place on the strip, you can go to every resort in around 20 minutes of walk. The rooms are freshly renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Mid Week Traveler”
Reviews.Author: RideHigh10
Reviews.Content: Made the reservation through Harrah's website and found the price of the room to be quite reasonable, considering that there were several events occuring during the same time period. The room (Carnival Tower) was comfortable and faced the Strip which presented noise, but cut off at around 11 each night. The bath was clean and kept that way. The bed was comfortable and new sheets were fitted each day. Towels smelled fresh and were relatively new. I could not honestly tell you about the restaurants since all the meals were with clients outside the hotel. Reception was fast and efficient as well as friendly. Although I have heard horror stories about parking a car, the garage provided convenience and availability when needed. It was a very good Harrah's experience and look forward to staying there next time....about 4 weeks away.

Reviews.Title: “harrahs-outstanding buffet and location”
Reviews.Author: squirrelland
Reviews.Content: we just stayed at harrahs's for two nights-we were upgraded to a nonsmoking room with a balcony. the beds were unbelievably comfortable, i have not slept that good for years. the balcony was no more than a tiny sqeeze off the sliding doors and way up there, so we didn't get to utilize it like an actual balcony. now the best part-their buffet is still as great as ever. between the variety and the quality-outstanding, and i am a picky buffet critic. the location is awesome, very busy but easy to get around. we didn't have good luck gambling here like the other places but for the price of the room and the buffet and the overall cleanliness, it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Safe & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: myreview818
Reviews.Content: I was a solo traveler, meeting up with friends. Took the bus from the airport straight to the hotel which worked out wonderful. Check in line a bit long, but went really fast. You can avoid lines and check in electronically, but I'm lame when it comes to new technology. The hotel room was a decent size and clean. The bathroom was great. The t.v. is old fashioned, but only needed it for news in the morning and to fall asleep. All staff were very friendly and the hotel is centrally located. There is a convenient mini-market just outside the hotel, drugstore down the street and Starbucks in the lobby. Rates for this hotel are excellent during non-peak days. I can be fussy, but no complaints here. Life is good!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service Possible”
Reviews.Author: GreenEarthLand
Reviews.Content: I visited Harrah's from Jan 12-15th. I have stayed at Harrah's several times over the past 3 years and have always enjoyed myself. This trip was probably the worst vacation I have ever experienced. I stopped by KGB burger in the hotel one night around 12:30am and order a philly steak sandwich to take to the room. $15 which wasn't bad. They charge $1.50 for the container to take it to the room. No Big deal really but after I paid, I told the hostess that I forgot to get a soda to go also. She came back and told me $13.50. I asked her if she was kidding and she said no. I asked if I heard her wrong at $13.50 but she explained no. I asked the reasoning behind a soda for $13.50 and she said that was the price. I explained to her that I didn't want it but couldn't believe what I was hearing. I experienced some awful service with the dealers too. I sat at a table game and the dealer told me that I talk to much and that I shouldn't be complaining about no winning another $5 during a hand. I was talking with another guest and telling them that I wished I would have bet at the end since I won and the dealer told me to stop complaining. Another dealer didn't even understand how to deal the game, so we as guests had to tell him when we lost or won. This experience was so below acceptable that I will never return to Harrah's again. I wrote them a letter and they replied with thanks we will strive to improve. They even told me that I must have misunderstood the hostess about the cost of the soda. I expressed to them that I didn't and that other hotel guests were there and couldn't believe it either. I wouldn't recommend this hotel even if the price is cheap. I got a great deal but will spend more if necessary to have a better experience. On a positive note, I ate at Flavors Buffet twice and really enjoyed the food and the hotel room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “worst vegas hotel experience EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: Brianbiker
Reviews.Content: I am a seasoned vegas traveler, I have stayed at nice places (monte carlo, ny ny. etc) and not so nice places (boardwalk). I can honestly say Harrahs was by far the worst I have ever experienced. 1st. casino was so smoky from cigarettes that it burned your eyes to walk through, smoke was so bad you could smel lit on the 10th floor of the mardi gras tower 2nd HVAC diddnt work in room the temp would not go below 73 deg F, it was nicer outside than in the room, and the windows diddtn open. I called engineering and the lady on the phone was rude,and obviously diddnt care 3rd. had to pay for internet service. That is unheard of in 2011, I travel all over the country for my job.. and have never had to pay for internet service. internet service is like a utility, I half expected to get a bill for water, and electricty when I checked out. 4th. casino workers trying to sell you stuff, having people back by the checkin kiosk trying to sell you stuff. bugging you everytime you walked within 10 feet. I must say I have been coming to vegas at lease once per year for the last 12 years.. and I wont be coming back for a very very long time.

Reviews.Title: “First time at this hotel and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: KarenT2
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I spent 4 days in Vegas from Jan 9-13th 2011. This was our Christmas present to each other. It was my 5th trip and hubby's first! I had never stayed at a hotel so centrally located on the strip so I was excited. We checked in and got a king room in the Carnaval tower. Loved it! We could see the Mirage volcano and mountains from our hotel room! The room was very clean. It was a little smaller from the rooms in MGM where I have stayed twice, but it was still quite nice. Liked the fact that they have in-room safes as some of the hotels (Luxor, last year) don't have them. HATED the fact that I had to pay $35.00 for 3 days of internet, (booooo) also, did not like the TV. OK so I DO NOT expect a flat screen TV in all the rooms, got more to do than watch TV in Vegas, but it was and older picture tube thing and it was blurry - and the hotel should at least give you a TV channel guide. When you turn off the TV it resets to the Harrah's/Vegas channel. Had to hunt each night for our favourite channels that we thought we found the night before. Free cocktails were hit and miss at first. You have to find a good slot machine and plant yourself in one spot for the night. That is the way to meet the "Right" girl! On night 2 after spending $$ in the Essentials store buying our OWN drinks for the casino in disgust, we finally found a good waitress. With $1 tip per round and a good memory - she kept us happy for the duration of our trip as far as drinks go! LOL! Did not do the buffet offer (7 buffets in 24 hours). Not sure why, but for some reason we thought it was too expensive. By the time we decided we should have done the offer we were going home soon. We will do the buffet thing next time. Loved the free shuttle to RIO as we had a show to watch there (Penn and Teller) and it was totally convenient. Took the deuce "Bus" To Fremont Street, (You get it from the Flamingo, Margarita-ville) It was a cheaper way to travel and on the way home it drops you off at the Mirage which is just across the street. All in all I had a terrific time. Hubby had a blast on his virgin Vegas trip and we WILL be back to Vegas. Will we be back to Harrah's? If the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: TheDMan62
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at Harrah's Las Vegas. Both times staying fully comped so it was a great value. I would compare the rooms in Carnaval Tower with Holiday Inn. I've always been pleased with the cleaniness of the rooms. The location can't be beat. It's center strip, so you're right in the middle of all the action. Also, Harrah's has quite a few restaurants to choose from. I've eaten at all of them with the exception of the buffet and the new KGB Burger. I've always been impressed with the service and the quality of food in all of the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: tblount
Reviews.Content: Great location on strip. Room was clean, housekeeping did good job. No problems. The Buffett of Buffetts was a GREAT deal. The shuttles to Rio and other places were running smoothly. All staff I spoke with were pleasant and helpful. Actually won on slots and $5 table games. I would definately stay at Harrah's again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be the best - Tahoe - can not believe it was the same place in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: MtShasta40
Reviews.Content: From the time we checked in - all went wrong. First room was filthy - hair on floor, unchanged sheets, dirty bathroom, sandpaper toilet paper, no coffee maker in room, cheap soap...So we upgraded - or so we thought of course at a cost to us - The next room - had left over food in the room, smelled bad. But we called, they came and picked up the left over food from previous "guests" - then later we found even more left over food in the Not really refrigerator. Then, I purchased some wine from your gift shop - but of course had to purchase a wine opener. Well it broke off in the cork - I took it back to the gift shop - they said there was nothing they could do - so I asked for a manager - they (yes two ladies came) said sorry they could not open it as the gift shop did not have a license - so they game me another bottle of wine - and another opener - and yes it broke also. So back I went, this time asked them to have someone from Plant Operations bring something to open - still could not do it. I asked for a refund, they said ok but only for one bottle of wine and one opener - REALLY? Of course I only wanted one, but it was very insulting and demeaning that they wanted to make that very clear to me. The staff gave me the feeling that I was bothering them. I am an HR Director of a large hospital system in California, I know customer service - and I am sure none of the owners or executives of Harrahs would stand to be treated as we were. To be fair, the lady in the cashier cage was LOVELY, she was very helpful to tell me how to play - etc. She was the only one. Although we are not "high rollers", this is not the way to get anyone to become one. Our friends do play a lot and they have said they will never come back to Harrahs. They will go to another "nice hotel". Due to my customer service background, I don't feel that is fair without letting those who can do something about this - know what is going on. I feel somewhat responsible for suggesting Harrah's - so that is why I am writing to you. I see from your other comments - I am not alone. I hope you will take my comments in the spirit of which they come and really try to change your guests experiences. It would be a shame to see such an institution crash and burn as it appears you are. Lynda Dasaro, 240 Hidden Creek Drive, Auburn CA 95603 Phone: 916 919 4053. My answer to the next question is based on this experience only - not on previous stays at Tahoe and future will depend on your response. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: bogeyboi
Reviews.Content: To be completely fair, I stayed at Harrah's for a week on business and shouldn't be too harsh on them as it's not a place known for business. However, this place doesn't measure up regardless. Check in was great and, overall, service acceptable. The rooms wreaked of second hand smoke (casino was unbearable), NO WIRELESS, $25 per day to use gym, outdoor club music blasted nightly until 2am, ....... It's the perfect location at the center of the strip and all it has to offer. But Harrah's is simply an old hotel that put fake granite tops on bathroom counter,added flat screen and called it an "upgrade". Checked out and went to Planet Hollywood = UNBELIEVABLE!!! I plan to visit again on business and will certainly never stay here again. Service great, everything else NOT!

Reviews.Title: “irresponsible staff”
Reviews.Author: HG1972
Reviews.Content: -The business center of the Hotel Lost my package. Value of the pack was 2800$ In spite of trying to contact Risk Manager( R.T.Germain) repeatedly, they never got back to me and put me in a round mode until I give up and get tired. Security staff made me make a report twice my case nr “DL20100789829”. They assured me that they get back to me and whether find my parcel or claim it from insurance. After returning to the country of my residence Holland, I made over 100$ phone bill in order to contact these guys but they never got back to me. To make the long story short I lost 2800$ and nobody takes responsibility. I contact Hotel staff daily. Business center tells me I have to contact security, security never gets back to me. I would not recommend this Hotel to anyone. Except the place of the hotel which is in the middle of strip, everything else is horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever - staff STEAL your PASSPORT”
Reviews.Author: hotlikesummer
Reviews.Content: Passport stolen from room by hotel cleaning staff, need I say more? Passport was locked inside the safe, came back to find it gone. Hotel staff was NOT helpful, they only insisted I had misplaced it. Offered no compensation or support, even hesitated to let me use their phone to call the embassy. Needless to say, it turns up in the cleaning ladies cart. Pressed charges and got the hell out of there!!!!! Will never return, and will never ever recommend this place to others. Never trust them with your valuables, they are most likely all in on a scam to steal their guests identity. Feel free to contact me for any questions: hotlikesummer@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: rjamcfan
Reviews.Content: I really loved Harrah's. I was a bit worried about staying here because the rating here on TripAdvisor was not that high. Turns out I had no reason to be concerned. I checked in on a Thursday about 9 AM (I turned up knowing that they may not have a room available, being told so by the reservations agent) but they did. I had reserved a Standard Room, and that's what I got. Room was very nice, plenty large, clean, everything I needed. Beds were very comfortable and there must be some pillow management because I didnt have any pillows with the thickness of a dime. TV picture quality was only so so, but I wasn't there to watch tv. Heat and A.C. seemed a bit tricky to control with their "go-green" programs, there were times I would get up to see if I had set it right because it wouldn't do anything and then all of a sudden it would click on. And I do have to agree, the marble floors in the bathroom are a death trap. I about fell twice, caught myself both times on the counter. What's really nice about this place, that they don't seem to promote is the monorail. It's a great way to get up and down the strip without dealing with the guys flicking those cards at you. It's also the same route to the monorail to get you over to Imperial Palace so you can avoid their little mall between the two. Common areas very clean, they make internet very accessible even if you don't have a laptop, and of course - because you have to walk through it I'll mention it - not smoky on the casino floor at all. I would like to see what this place is like when its busy, it may change my rating significantly, but for my late November stay, I have absolutely no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but the A/C is obnoxious!”
Reviews.Author: Engineer911
Reviews.Content: I'll make it brief... Came for like 5 nights over the 4th of July last year. Just wanted a cheap room to crash at. Checked in and asked for an upgrade, they tried to upsell me and I had to pay a small amount extra for a "premium" room which was recently renovated. Room was good, flatcreen in living room and small LCD in the little bathroom. Little balcony overlooking the pool area. My issue was with the A/C. I like it very cold and obviously vegas in the summer can get hot. The A/C has a motion sensor and won't keep running unless it senses motion in the room. So basically if you're sleeping it stops running, and that's rediculous. Location and price are good. But if all the rooms have this motion sensor nonsense then I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - right on the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: Brizzz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the heart of Las Vegas Blvd, so for location, it is great. The rooms are spacious and were reasonably clean. The bathroom was also spacious. Staff were professional and helped where they could. The casino downstairs was not bad as well. Overall, a decent place to stay and if you get it for a reasonable rate, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is getting old and dirty and waitress service is almost unavailable”
Reviews.Author: vegascarol
Reviews.Content: Harrahs used to be customer oriented, now it is just a big conglamorate out to make a buck. They are starting to charge for Blue Moon beer , if you are not a high end roller. We were were playing $5 slots and that wasn't high enough to get a free Blue Moon.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to explore north Strip area”
Reviews.Author: ToddNugent
Reviews.Content: Harrah's is a good value hotel to stay on the strip, falling somewhere in the middle as far as hotel ratings go. You get a basic clean room, staff service is commendable, location is convenient. We stay here when there is a good promotion and we don't want to stay too far from the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “NOT IMPRESSED! Won't be back!”
Reviews.Author: ventureful
Reviews.Content: Where of WHERE do I start? Oh, let's start with the filthy carpet and the fact that they don't have refrigerators or microwaves. Oh and the small, crampy room with marble bathroom floors that you can break your neck on if you happen to fall in the bathroom.They indicate that you can request a refrigerator, but what they FAIL to tell you is that they will charge you $15 per day. Went to the buffet on Christmas, stood in a long line, paid $54 for what was INDEED the WORST meal I have ever eaten. No steak, just rare prime rib, and I had to request that my almost RAW prime rib be thrown on the grill because I despise anything that isn't cooked well. One guy refused to put the prime rib on the grill but thanks to Teodoro, I was at least able to consume something worth the half hour wait Salvatore, you can go kick rocks, your attitude was HORRID! Most of the wait staff were friendly, but serving school cafeteria spaghetti at a buffet that costs $24.99 per person plus tax is a DEALBREAKER. Oh, and you guessed it, I couldn't use the crappy coupon that they gave me. I'd say to anyone planning a trip, do your research, a lot of the low budget hotels have better amenities than the hotels on the strip, and of course they're (strip hotels) collecting so much money that they could care less, but guess what, little things count when it comes to service, and charging people for refrigerators when the other hotels offer them for free is just bad business. Businesses aren't going out of business because of the recession, they're going out of business because most human beings are tired of paying money and being treated like garbage. Did I forget to mention the ancient televisions. I had to go to the sports bar down the street to watch the game because the tv is terrible. Oh, and HARRAH's if you don't remember anything else, remember this, customers only need one casino channel, not 3. Harrah's tv is not what I want to see when I turn on the television, get some real channels.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas 2010 Las Vegas Strip Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: WanderingWomanTN
Reviews.Content: We flew in to Vegas for a romantic Christmas getaway. Almost everything was open for Christmas with the exception of the Carnival Court. You would never even know it was Christmas day there. Nothing shuts down. Diamond check in was a breeze and we were upgraded to a jr. suite on 27th of Carnival Tower. Huge room but bathroom was small and not one of the upgraded granite counter tops you may read about in the room descriptions. Room was very quiet and comfortable. It had a coffee pot, but I have read other reviews that they don't have them in most rooms. I had packed a little coffee pot that I got at a walgreens for $10 and brought my own coffee and condiments. The valet parking was as fast and smooth as it could be. For being Christmas, the streets were absolutely jam packed with people of all kinds. If this is your first time to vegas, BEWARE THE SLAPPERS! There are these peddler type people on the street trying to force hand bills into your hands. These people should be arrested. They block the flow of the already congested sidewalks and cause little bottle necks of chaos. IGNORE THEM, do not accept their junk and just keep walking. We took the Deuce down to Freemont Street and arrived with no problem, getting back to Harrahs was a joke. It is too far to walk but the bus was crawling in the really log jammed traffic. It was total gridlock. We finally gave up and got out and walked. Harrah's Flavors buffet is good, but their sister property Planet Hollywood has the Spice Market Buffet and it beats Flavors, but not by too much. Christmas day Dinner, oh my god, the lines (being a Total Rewards Diamond Player has its rewards). I felt so bad for all those people standing on line for hours! Literally. Diamond has its own private entrance and no wait (yes, I felt guilty, but not too guilty to eat-lol). Casino floor service was very good. Always had a cocktail waitress around when we wanted one and they never forget to come back as long as you tip them. The room was not the reason we came to Vegas, but I have to agree with some of the other reviews that the rooms that don't have the flat screen tvs are a little dated in many ways. The elevators are quite fast and the other guests did seem to respect the other guests. We hardly heard a sound from the hallway. A couple of tips I have learned from traveling a lot, take a safety pin to close the drapes better. Bring a small plug in night light for the bathroom to find your way in the dark, and bring a small extension cord to plug your phone chargers into so you don't have to fight to get to the plug behind the bed. Also, we used Tickets 4 Today located at the far end of the Casino Royale (next door to Harrahs") The show tix are way discounted and a real bargain. We got tix for the Luxor Titantic Exhibit and really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: thisisme08
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a family trip to Las Vegas with my wifes family. Overall the hotel was a decent place to stay for us first timers (her parents have made the trip many times before) as it provides a great location to begin sightseeing from. The check in process was pretty convuluted but with a little patience we made it through. Despite being "upgraded" our room was a normal queen room with a horrible view of the buildings air conditioners. Other than that the rooms ameneties were as advertised. The casino was Ok but far from perfect and the drink service was fairly slow. My father in law won on the table games but none of us "kids" had much luck. Word of caution: Stay away from the restaurant in the Imperial Palace that was shown on Man vs Food, terrible service and terrible food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LambChops26
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an ideal spot, right across the street from the Mirage and Ceasars Palace and a short walk to many other casinos and shopping. I stayed on the 8th floor in the Carnival tower, the rooms are nothing special but the beds are comfortable, the room is DARK and its quiet when your sleeping. This was my first trip to Vegas and I'm glad we chose this hotel. Is this the hotel for your honeymoon? Probably not. It's also not kid friendly compared to some of the other hotels we stopped in.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable and enjoying stay at Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: greenridersfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrah's Dec 10-17/2010 for the third year in a row. Very friendly and helpful staff, room was in the Mardi Gras tower with a small balcony, 2 T.V.'s, and coffeepot. Had a view of the Mirage volcano. The location on the strip is our favourite as it is close to most attractions and restaurants. Would stay at Harrah's again!

Reviews.Title: “Happy Happy”
Reviews.Author: jsandoval562
Reviews.Content: After spending the first night of a five night trip at a sister facility I checked out due to unacceptable room conditions. I checked into Harrah's Casino with Connie's assistance at the registration desk. She is a gem. She assisted me in obtaining a new room with a decent view. Although the room was not completely "compt'ed" it was pretty close to it. One drawback are the apparently thin walls. No problem falling asleep (thanks to friendly bar staff) but everything going on next door(s) was very audible in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Okay If You Want Simple and Middle of Strip”
Reviews.Author: clairhas
Reviews.Content: Check-in didn't take that long. We had originally booked the Classic room, but once we did the $20 trick we were upgraded to a Luxury room and had a little view of the strip which was the entire Mirage hotel and the mountains behind it which looked beautiful at night. Our room was at the end of the hall which was quiet for the most part , but the walls are thin because we heard a person coughing a few times in the room next to us. Be sure to always ask for a coupon book upon check-in because it saved us on dining and shows. Room is very simple but a dirty glass was left in the shower and the toilet wasn't very clean so you definitely get what you pay for. It was a great location right in the middle of the strip so getting everywhere was very easy. The concierge/box office was able to book all six shows that we wanted to see (even at other hotels) so that was very convenient. There was a Starbucks located right by the room elevators so that was a definite plus. First two days we ate breakfast at McDonalds right outside our hotel which saved us alot of money since any meals in Vegas can add up. Le Cafe in the hotel was a good place to eat breakfast also. Would also recommend the bar Numb if you like frozen drinks which were delicious. The Range Steakhouse was excellent so would definitely recommend eating dinner there. Went to the Improv and be sure to drink first because the comedians we saw were not very funny. We did see the Mac King show which I would recommend because he was very funny and entertaining. Also I would recommend Legends in Concert because some of the impersonators were so good. In the long run, I would 100% recommend seeing Terry Fator (playing at the Mirage across the street) In the long run, I probably won't stay at this hotel again, but I did get an excellent deal through Southwest Vacations so it was too good to pass up at the time. Everyone was very nice and helpful to us so that made our visit alot easier.

Reviews.Title: “Below average hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tr7v8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Monday through to Sunday, for a variety of business sessions. Check-in was a pain, a 45 minute queue to check-in is unacceptable in any hotel, especially after a 10+hours flight, lots of desks empty but only 4 staff on, one of whom left half way through. I eventually got checked-in by someone who obviously didn't want to be there & was borderline surly & no apology. The room in the Mardi Gras tower is quite scruffy & in desperate need of redecorating. No tea making facilities only a coffee percolator which you cannot make tea with. Starbucks has long queues most of the time & becomes expensive at $3.19 per cup of tea. Queues for breakfast are also massive & again unhappy, miserable staff. The pool is closed, I never worked out why, other hotel pools were open! Check out is a miserable 11:00 which they would only grudingly extend until is 12. Check out was a lenghty process again taking 35 minutes, with only 30% of the desks occupied. I did at least get an apology for the delay this time though. I know you can Express check out but over the years I've had enough wrong bills to know that correcting them after the event is a lengthy process. For $61 a night it is accommodation but grim & basic. The queues for food in there & the enforced check out time meant I left for the airport very early & preferred to eat at Burger King.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location, Decent Lodging”
Reviews.Author: Recruiting
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Harrah's Mardi Gras tower. Nice clean room, comfortable bed, etc. This is probably my fifth stay at Harrah's and I keep coming back because they have a great players club and comp program, offer reasonable Hilton Garden Inn type level accommodations, and offer one of the most ideal locations on the strip to get around and see other casinos. If you are coming to Vegas for a decent deal and to gamble this is a great place. If you want luxury go a few doors down to the Venetian. One other thing - the Oyster Bar is absolutely incredible for both quality and value - don't miss dining there for lunch or dinner if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: suemay61362
Reviews.Content: Our plane arrived over an hour late so we did not get to the hotel until about 1 AM. Then we were told our room was not ready yet! Could have another one but the girl at the desk said this was one of their nicest so we decided to wait the xtra hour. The room was not nice-very small and nothing special about it. Thought the hotel was rather dingy looking. Did tell the person at the desk when we checked out how unhappy we were and that we would not be staying at their properties again. The next 2 nights were at MGM and were marvelous. We have been to Harrah's in St Louis and love the casino but LV Harrah's was a huge disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful service.”
Reviews.Author: Point1
Reviews.Content: Hi, My name is Fit Pointville and I was a guest at The Harrahs Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas, Nevada on Dec. 3, 2010 through Dec.6, 1010. It was the most pleasant experience of our lives. Unfortunately it didn’t start off that way. Our trouble started the day we arrive and for some reseason or another our reservation was the one that got drop or misplace from our group. Me and my wife was very disrupt at this point. One of your manager Phil was so, helpful and so, understanding with our situation, He made us fill at easy with our situation and offered us a room. We were not able to come to an agreement with the third party booking agency that we use. Phil and the staff at the Harrahs hotel and casino was so, still provided us with a room for the weekend at a reasonable price that we could afford. I think Phil and the Staff at the casino for all there help and patient for all there help on our first trip to Las Vegas. We will differently be back to Las Vegas and make the Harrahs hotel and casino our number one destination. Should you require additional information or would like to comment, please reply to this email in writing.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: DenisV
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay right on The Strip, enjoy one of the best buffets in Vegas and be in the middle of night life - this hotel is for you. Harrah's buffet restaurant is great for dinners. Walking distance to all the other hotels on The Strip. Connected to the mono-rail. The only problem is to find a spot by the pool

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeggles
Reviews.Content: I'm 52 and travelled with my elderly 82 yr old Mum. We had 3 nights, Saturday to Tuesday, in what was supposed to be a Luxury room with a view of the Strip - according to the Expedia site I booked with, but our view was of the car park and the other wing, so I suspect the hotel put us in a Classic room. I didn't pick this up until I started to write this review, so it's my fault for not querying it with the hotel at the time. And to be honest, it's very true what everyone says - your room is definitely only a place to catch up on some sleep in between being amazed at all there is to see and do in Vegas, so the view doesn't really matter! Our room was clean and comfortable. One of the net curtains had started to come off it's track, which I though might have been noticed by housekeeping but that is a minor point. Not having tea or coffee making facilities in the room was inconvenient. Coming from New Zealand, this is the norm in hotels 'down-under' and we found it strange that we couldn't even request an electric jug from housekeeping - they simply don't have them. I guess it's all part of getting you to pay for as much as possible and may be standard in all Las Vegas hotels - don't know about that. The hotel is definitely one of the older properties, and can't match the glitz and glam of the newer hotels, but what it lacks in 'bells and whistle's', it makes up for with its location - right smack bang in the middle of all the action - across the road from Caesars and the Mirage. We loved Vegas - but 3 nts is definitely not long enough. Granted I had to slow my pace to match Mum's, but even if I had been able to race around at my usual pace, I think 5 nts is the minimum required, and a week would be great - especially if also wanting to visit the Grand Canyon and Hoover Dam. We didn't have time for this. I've heard Vegas described as 'Disneyland for Adults', and it's an apt description - there's something for everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average service”
Reviews.Author: PetenDeb
Reviews.Content: Our stay was for 4 nights. Each day the room servicing got later until last day- arrived back in room at 8pm and room had not been serviced at all. Took almost 1 hour to have maid come and clean. Second issue was internet. As we were having trouble connecting (no-one advised we needed to add a '2' before room number we submitted)- we called the number they advised, but then hotel tried to charge us $45 for the call! If it had been handled correctly in the beginning, there would be no need for the call to help desk.

Reviews.Title: “Worn out and dated property”
Reviews.Author: BobH57
Reviews.Content: When I checked in I was told that my room was newly remodeled in the Mardi Gras Tower. The room was small with two beat up chairs a small table and an uncomfortable bed. The flat screen tv had few channels and was not HD. The room was not equipped with wi fi. The "spa fitness center"cost $25.00 befor 4 pm and $10.00 after that time. The fitness machines were few and old. The meeting room was also worn and old and the fee to use their Internet computer was high about a dollar per minute and fifty cents per page to print. Not worth it look for someplace else to stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: JenniferBenson_MN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's for three nights from November 19-22, 2010. We had a comped room. I wasn't sure what to expect after reading the reviews. Upon arrival, we only had to wait five minutes for check-in. The staff member was very friendly. We were offered the option of upgrading which we declined after previous reviews stated that it is not worth it. The room was clean and quite large. The bathroom was updated with granite countertops and marble floors. It was also comfortable with a quality mattress. My only complaint about it is the thin walls. There was a group of guys in the adjoining room who were quite loud and boisterous. At times, it seemed that they were in our room or certainly their ipod speakers were! You could hear everything they were saying. The walls are seriously paper thin in the Carnaval Tower. We ate at a couple of the restaurants which were good. We also went to the Mac King show which was good--especially with the tickets they give you upon check-in. You just need to buy a drink for admission. Carnaval Court is a great time! I highly recommend it (I will review that separately). I also have to say that Glenda who is a waitress at Carnaval Court is excellent! She and the dealers out there are so much fun! We had a blast. Although we were comped the room this time we will stay here even if we have to pay. It is in a great location with so many things to do.

Reviews.Title: “great location in middle of the strip.”
Reviews.Author: mally43
Reviews.Content: this is our third trip to vegas and our first stay in this hotel.we stayed for 10 days and could not fault this hotel the staff were very friendly and very helpful.nothing was too much trouble for them.my only gripe was that there was no tea or coffee making facilities in the room which would have been a nice touch.other than that we had a great holiday.one word of advise if you are planning to go in november/december take some warm clothes it can become very cold/

Reviews.Title: “In need of remodel”
Reviews.Author: scomean
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed is in need of a makeover. Wallpaper peeling off the walls and carpets fairly worn. Comfortable beds make for good sleeping. Could have used an in-room coffee maker. Location was great. Casino was very smokey.

Reviews.Title: “a great value”
Reviews.Author: zeromaster
Reviews.Content: When my brother and I came up with plan B for a vacation this year, Vegas was at the top of the list. I was thinking of something like Mirage until I got the lowdown on resort fees. Fortunately Harrah's properties (Planet Hollywood up through Harrah's as well as Caesar's and Rio) don't get in on this scam. I'd been in the casino multiple times but it seemed a little garish. Nonetheless friends of mine that stayed there had nothing but good reports, so when we booked a package we took it as the hotel option. It was well worth the money. Not only did we get to check in early, but the desk honored our request for a spot away from Carnaval Court. The table minimums are reasonable, and it's within quick reach of a lot of properties, making it an ideal Strip location. The rooms are reasonably appointed and the towels are much larger than expected. Of course there's the obligatory room fridge with it's threat of charges, but exercise a little self control and you won't have to deal with it. We were able to checkout from the room (no room-related charges) and the bell desk was very prompt and helpful on both ends of the stay. For my part the craps tables were favorable, and we did well on our sports parlays, all things considered. To top it off, the Numb Bar inside is staffed with some adorable female bartenders that are quite customer-oriented. While we didn't really hit the other bars and restaurants much, they seem well-staffed and the patrons appeared to be enjoying themselves. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Good value but Lack luxe!”
Reviews.Author: MigratingBirdie
Reviews.Content: The pros: Great location, can't be beat, right in the middle of the strip, across from the Mirage and next to the Venetian. This is where we spent most of our time wining, dining and doing shows. Cirque du Soleil's Love, Delmonico Steak House, Made Tussaud's Wax Museum, The Dolphin Habitat and Samba Brazilian BBQ, and the Forum Shops are all easily walkable from here. The rooms are comfortable, I actually slept quite well here. But no frills, outdated decor and the mini-bar wasn't working. But that's understandable since the deal was unbeatable. Why I won't stay here again: The smoke-filled casino is bad enough to give you emphysema from your walk to the front door to the elevators. It's seriously bad, maybe its because of the low ceilings... although the casinos I visited in Old Vegas weren't even half as bad. No spa services available. None of the eateries are worth your while either (although I'm a bit of a food snob and love to take advantage of the best while I'm in Vegas). My recommendation: This is a great place if you're a group of college frat boys trying to live it up on a dime! If you want a bit of the luxe life in Vegas, you'll have to pony up for one of the more expensive establishments nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Luv Vegas and Harrahs.”
Reviews.Author: jeff7031
Reviews.Content: Our fifth year in a row staying at Harrahs however was very disappointed that your restaurant calld the Cafe was never open in the evening.All other restaurants their are too expensive so went to the food courts for food.Food drinks and your high bus fares may be one of the reasons vegas is hurting for business...............

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUGS IN ROOM AND MANAGEMENT VERY RUDE WHEN ADVISED OF THE PROBLEM!!! DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Buddyhollie
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Room 2168 in Mardia Gras Tower. I checked into the hotel on 11/24/10 and I was first given a deluxe room which was dirty and had a horrible odor of sewage, I then went down to the front desk and was offered an upgrade to a suite for $50.00/night which I took. the shower in the room did not work properly and the room was also dirty and the refrigerator stunk like rotten eggs. My husband and I went to bed and awoke with bites marks all over our body, we checked out the next morning when I had the room booked for 3 nights. Later in the evening on 11/25 more bites appeared all over our body and hives all over. I called the hotel to report the bed bugs ( I own a pest control co so am 100% sure these are bed bugs). I spoke with Carrie Gargano at 1200 AM and she informed me that there was no one at the hotel to take a report and I had to call back the next day, I asked for her manager who she advised me was Sal Goerella and he was not available either. She was very rude and I was treated like I was making this up. I just wanted to report it so they could have the problem corrected and this would not happen to someone else. I visit all the Harrahs properties in Las Vegas and in Atlantic City but will think twice about returning to a Harrahs owned casino in the future after being treated like this. Do not waste your time or money staying here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs - Las Vegas. Ideal for the Family”
Reviews.Author: hifromshreya
Reviews.Content: We travelled with Kesari tours, so we had no choice in the matter of picking accommodation. More so, I travelled with with two younger cousins, and no adult family. So the review is from the point of view of a 20-something. As for all major Vegas hotels, Harrahs is located on the Strip, or the single road that defines Vegas. The hotel leans towards the expensive side, but is well worth it. The rooms are clean, well stocked and up to the standard expectation level. No views though. Do NOT expect and sights of the Strip, all lit up in the night from the hotel rooms. One has to step of for that experience. The service is decently good and reasonable. Harrahs has the entire ground floor as a casino, replete with all slot machines and poker tables. Nevada law does not allow minors (21 years and less) to gamble. So please have identity proof ready. Children, even accompanied by parents are not allowed near the tables and the staff ensures this. Other than this precaution, the casino is a great place to enjoy. The hotel also provides an anonymous service which can be set to control the amount of money played or gambled by a patron. Harrahs has a large multi-cuisine buffet restaurant called Buffet Of Buffets. Multicuisine is a slight understatement, as the hotel provides at least ten cuisines with around 20 dishes in each cuisine. The food is good but not out of this world. The buffet does live up to its name! From the number of shows hosted by the hotel, we saw the Mac King Comedy Show. The show host happened to complete 20 years of stagework that day. His tricks are good, falling on the 'cute' side but certainly not mediocre. These are supplemented by wisecracks and some gags. Its an engaging show for the family. The theatre has an attached bar, with no free drinks, unfortunately! Rita Rudner is another popular show, aimed primarily at couples. Our tour made a good choice of hotel. But a bulk booking may have reduced the prices. That said, for a general Las Vegas 3-day experience, Harrahs is a good hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room with good location”
Reviews.Author: LauraPh
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for it's location and price. We were only going to be in Las Vegas for two nights and didn't plan on spending a lot of time in the room. It was easy to get to - our Garmin took us directly to the parking garage. Check in was easy and the room was ready right when we got there at 2:00PM. The lady who checked us in was very nice and helpful. We ended up on the 14th floor on the Mardi Gras Tower in a "luxury room with a view". As others have noted, "luxury" must mean something else at Harrah's, but the room was nice enough. It was clean with a comfortable bed. We had a view of The Mirage so we could see the Lava show every hour. The curtains were thick enough to make the room nice and dark at night. We could not hear any outside noises. The hotel and casino were easy to navigate. The casino is not as glamorous as most of the others, but that's ok. We spent most of our time walking through all the grand hotels most of the day anyways. All the staff we met was nice... from the bartenders, waitresses, the dealers... it wasn't stuffy at all. The waitresses were prompt with the drinks in the casino. People were friendly. This was our first time in Las Vegas and happy with our choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Toby_Maxx
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to a Mini Suite on a comped room. We have stayed here many times in the past and have never been disappointed. The room was immaculate, very functional, and very reasonably priced. Our total stay of three nights came to less than $100. And the location is perfect as it's right in the middle of the strip. If they have a Mini Suite available for a reasonable rate when you arrive, upgrade as you'll get much more room. Also, try to check in early as the check in lines get a bit longer as you get closer to 6-7pm.

Reviews.Title: “Old favorite headed the wrong way”
Reviews.Author: johnintulsa
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the middle of Las Vegas this is the place. The problem is that because the room rates are low, they get those special people as guests that you don't want to be around on your trip. The rooms are clean, but the main floor is crowded with tourists and other "special" people. And very loud! Do not play the slots here...they're aweful. They don't pay Blackjack correctly, so the uneducated gambler - beware. The Range Steakhouse is still a great place for a good steak and they open the crab legs for you.

Reviews.Title: “When Luxury means much less”
Reviews.Author: vergato
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before but this hotel was definitely not what was described. The room was billed as a Luxury room. Not exactly my definition of luxury. Tiny room, no wireless, thin towels,old model TV, and very loud A/C that went off and on every 2-3 minutes (couldn't hear the TV when it went on). I scoured the internet for reviews and found Harrahs was mostly given a 5 star rating for cleanliness. Upon arrival in the room I found a very large chewed piece of pink bubble gum on the floor and in the refrigerator a beer and old food from someone's previous stay. I complained to the manager who gave me a $30 food credit; however 3 days later upon departure, the food was still in the refrigerator. I had given the gum to a Hotel employee who found my 'gift" very distasteful. Definitely would not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: pinaybabae
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay with Harrah's hotel. We got a good group rate as we were there for a family reunion. As previous reviewers have mentioned, the line to check-in can be very long. It took maybe 30 minutes by the time we could check-in. We asked for two rooms be right next to one another. Worked out well with having a door in between so my 1 year old twins could run around. they were also able to provide us with a crib. But my twins ended up not even using it. The location of the hotel was fine. Right off the strip and not too far from the other hotels and attractions. The monorail is quite a walk though. I never realized how big the hotels really were in vegas until we walked from the front of the hotels (at the strip) to the very back to catch the monorail. Traveling with two kids, my husband and mother-in-laws it was a convenience for us when we had to get to the far end of the strip. We didn't eat at any of Harrah's restaurants. I can't say how the food was. We only frequented the Starbucks near the elevators. They do have a convenience store which came in handy when we needed to buy our twins some milk. They also have fresh fruit there you can buy. If you're there a good number of days you might be able to grab some ripe bananas that they put on sale. The staff and cleaning crew were all very nice. The rooms were just fine for what we paid for since we didn't spend a whole lot of time in the rooms anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: CXH
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and great location!!! Room was very clean, hotel staff was very helpful. Will definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Harrah's!”
Reviews.Author: Margaritamom
Reviews.Content: My 16-year-old daughter and I stayed at Harrah’s Las Vegas for four nights from November 8 – 12, 2010 in room 2943 (Carnival Tower). 1. Check-in: We arrived in the early evening - there were 4 folks in front of us and the line-up moved quickly. The interaction was pleasant and we were soon headed upstairs. 2. Room: We received the room I had requested when booking – two queen beds, non-smoking room, and a quiet location. Room 2943 overlooks part of the strip and we had a perfect view of the Mirage and their volcano which my daughter enjoyed watching each night. The room itself was clean, a nice size with a small table and two chairs by the window, and the beds were comfy with lots of pillows and puffy white comforters. We could hear folks around us once in a while (in the hallway or adjoining room) but overall the room was very quiet which was perfect for my teen who likes to sleep in whenever possible. I had booked a Luxury room through Expedia for $62.73 a night CAN (no resort fee) and it was well worth the minimal extra cost. There was also a coffee maker in the room which was a lovely to have in the mornings so I could have some caffeine while waiting for the teen to roll out. The A/C was hit and miss but when the room warmed up too much, we’d just open the window and let in some fresh, cool air from outside. 3. Harrah’s restaurants: We tried the Flavors buffet on our first morning in Vegas. The service was great – I was given a carafe of coffee and lots of creamers and my daughter’s chocolate milk was good. The food itself was basic buffet breakfast fare and was tasty. There are two Starbucks in the hotel– the one on the main level was always open and I grabbed a few latte’s from there during the week. On our last evening we treated ourselves to the from-scratch homemade ice cream at IcePan on the second level and it was delicious. We both tried the non-fat ice cream and it was excellent. 4. Room attendants: The ladies who worked on our floor were very nice – every time we saw them in the morning, they were smiling and pleasant and we exchanged a “good morning”. Our room was kept clean and restocked as required. 5. Location: Excellent! So many great hotels are within walking distance – the Mirage, TI, Venetian, Caesar’s Palace, Flamingo, Paris, Bally’s, Bellagio, etc. The shows we’d booked were all within walking distance – the only time we needed transportation was for shopping and the attractions that are farther down the strip. 6. Getting around: We were in Vegas to shop (and go to shows) so on Day 1 we each bought a $20 3-Day All Access bus Pass (Premium Service) that included the Deuce bus (goes up and down the strip) and the Gold Line bus (which goes to both outlet malls and Freemont). Excellent purchase for getting us to the locations that were outside of walking distance. We checked out the RTC website in advance and knew which bus stops were closest to Harrah’s for each bus. We also ended up using the monorail twice because it was the quickest route to get us from Harrah’s to MGM. It’s nice to use but you have to walk all the way to the back of each hotel in order to use the monorail where the buses stop right out on the strip. The Deuce is the double-decker and it’s a lot of fun to sit up top and check out the sites as you’re traveling. And you will definitely use the bus pass if you’re there for a few days and the Bellagio seems a lot further than it did on Day 1 because your feet are giving out on you. One warning though – the Deuce fills right up to capacity when Vegas is hopping and sometimes it can be hard to get on and it seems like forever (ie. 20 – 30 minutes) until the next bus comes along. And the evenings can be cooooold - especially if it's windy. 7. Shows: We saw Mystere, Blue Man Group, and Terry Faytor and loved them all. We’d go back to each one. Mystere wasn’t full and one of the ushers asked us if we’d like to sit in the front row – which of course we accepted. The show has lots of “wow” moments and is quite funny. Blue Man Group was also funny and we were in the 2nd row. The first 4 or 5 rows are poncho rows and we were happy to be sitting off to the side a bit as we didn’t really need the poncho (although it was nice to have just in case as folks in the middle did need theirs). Terry Faytor has an excellent voice and we enjoyed the selection of music he used in his act. 8. Attractions: There is currently a deal where you can pay one price ($54 each) and you can pick three attractions to go and see. We chose the Titanic exhibit (Luxor), the Bodies exhibit (Luxor right beside the Titanic exhibit), and the CSI experience (MGM). The Titanic exhibit was amazing – it was goose-bump-raising to see items from the ship and the presentation was more than I expected with a walk through third class, the higher classes, the winding staircase, and information about the passengers. We thought the Bodies exhibit was very interesting but it’s probably not for everyone as it is genuine cadavers that have been peeled and posed to show different parts of the body (ie. nervous system, muscle structure, bones, etc). The CSI Experience at MGM was a lot of fun – you get to choose 1 of 3 mysteries and have to search for the facts to solve your case. We used the monorail to get from Harrah’s to MGM as the monorail stop at MGM is right next to the CSI Experience. We also went to Madame Tussaud’s wax museum at the Venetian which was excellent as usual. We were going back and forth about whether we wanted to see it but then a gentleman out front gave us a coupon for $8 off of each of our tickets so we decided to go in. We didn’t regret it as they’ve added quite a few new wax figures since my last visit in 2008. 9. Other restaurants/buffets: Our favourite restaurant this trip was definitely the Rainforest Café in MGM. This place is great for children and adults – great food/value plus there are animatronic animals that move around, lots of big fish, and a thunderstorm each hour. I had a burger and my daughter had a salad and both were excellent. Least favourite meal of the trip was the lunch buffet at the Luxor – the service was excellent but the food was cafeteria-style at best and wasn’t very good. Favourite buffet that we tried was definitely the lunch buffet at Treasure Island. Man I love their cookies.

Reviews.Title: “Hooray for Harrahs!”
Reviews.Author: gamblingggirl
Reviews.Content: As frequent Las Vegas goers - we are diamond members of the Harrah's Total Rewards Loyalty Program. In October, we stayed just for 3-day weekend. We usually stay at Caesars comped - but decided to stay at Harrahs this time - as only two nights at Caesars were comped. We have stayed at Harrahs, Flamingo, Ballys, and Caesars - and enjoy al of them. The pools at Caesars and Flamingo are the best. The decor in Caesars is beautiful and the restaurants are outstanding. My favorite burger in all the world is at Caesars st Bradley Odgen. It melts in your mouth. Eat in the barside side and pay only $20 for the best classy burger and fries. Flamingo is always busy and looks a little worn but it is a fun place with a lot of action - and the connected Margaritaville bar is also fun. The updated Go rooms are very nice. Bally's is my least favorite as I don't like the long ramp to enter the casino but the Italian restaurant is good. You can't beat the location for any of these Harrah's properties. (Paris, Rio, and Imperial Palace are also Harrah's properties - but those don't interest us.) We are always treated well as diamond members and we were upgraded free to a mini suite at Harrah's- room was great - very spacious, clean, and updated. The steak place is wonderful at Harrahs also. We always enjoy the Carnavale Court - the drinks, bartender entertainment, and the live music. And if you like piano duets, the twins are always entertaining. If you like to gamble - I'd recommend joining the Total Rewards program - it offers many perks and comps. There are many Harrah's properties across the US (I have reviewed some locations besides Las Vegas properties as well). We had a great time at Harrah's Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: iowateach
Reviews.Content: After one sleepless night at the Imperial Palace, I walked over here and got a room. What an improvement! My room was huge, modern, and clean. I will definitely stay here again. The location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great room , right in the middle of the strip, can't beat the price!”
Reviews.Author: yaahoos
Reviews.Content: Nothing wrong with a room for $34.00 ($38 with taxes) a night , clean , although the carpet is dated. When you see reviews like "Internet costs money, or staff was rude" , or the like , think about how the person who said it . Does anyone do any research before they go? Very few casino hotels in Vegas offer FREE Internet. I always treat the "service people" with a smile , jokes, and laughter and we ALWAYS get upgrades, and extras. The hotel was great for the money. Book ahead, sign up for deals, and use them. Harrahs is a great property right in the middle of all the strip action. First time there at Harrahs , but will return.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs-Think twice before you book at Harrah's!!”
Reviews.Author: Bunny49Lacon
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Harrah's with my husband only to find that he was not the only one sharing my bed, there were bedbugs in it also. The Manager on Duty Christopher Wilbourn laughed at me when I told him there were bedbugs in my room. He told my that you find bedbugs in New York's 4 & 5 star hotel not in Vegas. Later on he told me they have had only one case of bedbugs. Well, what is it.... none or one??? Makes you wonder how many cases they actually have had if they have to hire a third party to take care of all their claims?? I had to ask for a new room he never offered to give me one. You would of thought I had asked for the Presentational suite all I wanted was a bug free room. Harrah's out sources these kinds of problems to a company called CCMSI. Margie from CCMSI called me today and offered me $200 but in order to get the $200 I have to sign a release. What if I brought them home or they are in my car, who would pay to hire an exterminator if I signed a release? The only thing I asked for was for them to reimbursed me my room, she said that she could not do that!! WHAT! Harrah's comps rooms all the time but they cannot reimburse me for my room that had bedbugs in???? Margie did tell me that Harrah's did find bedbugs in our room but yet they cannot reimburse me my room????? What is wrong with this whole picture? I had to go through all my clothes and clean them how do you know if I killed them and what do I do with my shoes? I had to leave our suitcase out in the garage how do I decontaminate them? I could even have them in our car. How do I know if I brought them in our home, wait until I get bit and now I have bedbugs that I have to get rid of. So if you find bugs in your bed at Harrah's do not expect them to comp your room they will probably charge you extra!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cndnsask
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our 5 nights at Harrah's. Good location,our room was a good size,very clean,pleasant staff. We realized at the airport we didn't have our camera and thought we may have left it in our room,we called the front desk they immediately sent up security to our room to see if it was there,it was. We asked if they would be able to mail it to us,we were quite willing to pay for the shipping - they had it shipped to us within 10 days - no charge! Appreciated that very much! Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Harrahs”
Reviews.Author: lilsorrel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Harrahs for four nites this past July. We has no complaints at all. However, our room in Carnival Tower, which was comped was a bit on the small size. Service throughout the hotel and casino was excellent. I especially enjoyed the sportsbook. Every evening while my wife got ready to go out, I would wait in the sports book, and bet the horses. Never had to wait long to place a horse bet, and always found a cushioned seat. My wife and I are already planning trip for next July, and will stay at Harrahs again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and there are ways to save more”
Reviews.Author: ZydecoGal
Reviews.Content: Be sure to get a Harrah's or sister casino Total Rewards card if you can. I got mine in New Orleans just to access better rates for our October vacation. I saved $100 on 4 nights just by having the card and the rate was better than I could get from other internet sites. Our first room had an AC vent fan that sounded like a machine gun. We were promptly and cheerfully moved to another non smoking room. The floor was quiet and the room was spacious and clean. The staff were all pleasant. The only thing I would have done differently is not get a strip view and pay more for it because all we saw was a view inbetween the adjacent Imperial Palace and the front part of the hotel. If you like your coffee or tea, bring your own one cup maker or electric pot. We didn't t have coffee makers in the rooms. There is a starbucks downstairs by the elevators. The buffet, Flavors, was surprisingly good with lots of fresh, well seasoned, and healthy choices as well as chow down meats and potatoes. You can get discount coupons for the buffet at the Tix tonight venue about 1/2 a block away inside the Casino Royale, just past McDonalds. There is also a food court in Casino Royale including pizza by the slice and a Subways that takes coupons. Harrah's is within walking distance of, well ,everythingon the strip if you're healthy and it's not too hot--closest though, to the Imperial Palace, Caesars, the Venetian and Pallazio, and Treasure Island. Internet is available for a daily fee by a hard connection located close to a lamp on a bedtable. I tried to sign up with some wireless services in range that were cheaper and couldn't. Water in the hotel shop and vending machines is about $2.50. You can get cold bottled water from street vendors on the elevated cross walks on the street for $1.00. The tap water was OK but I could taste the chlorine.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's: Great Location, Decent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: undum
Reviews.Content: The entire visit was very good. THe check-in and check-out were efficiently handled. The room class I had requested was the room class I reseived. THe appointments in the room were as expected. The housekeeping staff was very good and the room was kept in fine order with sufficient towel and toiletries to serve our needs. The music outside the window was a bit loud until very late hours but that's Vegas. The pool at Harrah's is not the best, as it is in the shadows more than it is in the sun due to the surrouning structures. The waitstaff was attentive however and that made up for it a bit. The Casino was lively and fairly airy. I like the fact that it is brightly lit and the dealers are very friendly. The restaurants were satisfactory. All in all, I would stay there again if offered the chance, mainly due to its location mid-strip. I would rate this hotel below Mandalay Bay and New York New York, but way above Excalibur, all places I have stayed in the last 5 years. Book early. Expect some delay at check-in as they are a busy place (although we had no extended waiting). Take a taxi from the airport not a shuttle. spend a few extra bucks for the convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Kudo's out to Leslie....”
Reviews.Author: palmbriez
Reviews.Content: Just want to thank Leslie for making our Vegas trip most memorable...We had a little glitch at check-in and she professionally swept us away...THANKS LESLIE, for making our stay at HARRAHS great.......our waitress.... kudo's to her also for remembering us......the staff superb......

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice suites but no Guest Directory”
Reviews.Author: JackHoliday
Reviews.Content: Hard to complain much; Price right, location excellent, suite large, Front Desk better than average (but always a line), Housekeeping nice, decent food, happy bar/casino workers and mixed gambling (won on slots near street, lost big on 3 card poker/deeper slots)...won more on tables/slots in other casinos. Would go again. Strangely after night 1 the Guest Directory was removed and replaced by a Room Service menu. Called and was told "everything is in there... nothing else we can give you". Pain to call for info like check out time, laundry, etc. TV sucks and TV check-out out of order.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at Harrahs”
Reviews.Author: tails22
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrahs 10/11-10/17, first half of trip was business, second half was for fun. My conference was at the Venetian Hotel, priced at $259 per night. Since I was staying for the whole week I decided to stay somewhere less expensive. I got a 'luxury room' for an average price of $80 per night. Check in was fine, there was a long line but I got in my room within 20 minutes, the person doing the checkin was very helpful and tried to accomodate a couple of things I requested, no luck on the requests but she did try. The luxury room (strip view) apparently hadn't been upgraded so they moved me into a room in the Mardis Gras tower which had a pool view but no strip view. The room was fine, clean and comfortable. I had an air conditioner issue the first night but it was immediately addressed. Later in the week I had a need for a roll away bed and extra towels, these were provided very quickly by a very pleasant gentleman. Very easy to get to the Venetian conference area from there, took me 10 minutes to walk it from my room to the conference center. I had breakfast in the restaurant, food and service was fine. Dinner one night in the gourmet hamburger place was not so good, I do not recommend the Captain Crunch milkshake, alright, I know I probably should have known better but the kid in me spoke loudly. The hamburger was overdone, all in all not a good meal. Gambling at the Casino... didn't really try it there as the smoke was really bad. Other casinos have done a much better job at removing the smoke and creating a pleasant gaming experience. Harrahs needs to do that. Most of the blackjack tables (all that I saw except single deck) were 6:5 payouts which I won't play, you have to work too hard to win (if it is possible to win). So outside a few slots that my wife played there we took our gambling somewhere else. Best places to gamble: Mandalay Bay and MGM, found $5 blackjack tables and played all day. Both places comp'd meals. Dealers were great. As a homebase to wander the strip, at an affordable price, Harrahs is a good value. I would stay there again. All in all great trip to Vegas, food comp'd where we gambled, great show, saw Beatles Love... hint, look for discount ticket codes on line and choose the cheap seats, best seats in the house, 2nd time I have seen the show and I will see it as often as I can. My wife won money so the trip cost us nothing!!! Gotta like that!

Reviews.Title: “Great 20th Anniversary Memories”
Reviews.Author: WolfEsence
Reviews.Content: We came to celebrate our 20th anniversary - neither of us had been to Vegas before. The staff was super friendly and helpful regardless of our questions, etc The maid service did an excellent job cleaning the room. The bed was comfy but not like home. Bonus - had a view of Mirage Volcano exploding, and could hear it from the room (not loud enough to be a nuisance however)! Excellent location to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Modest hotel with excellent mid-strip location”
Reviews.Author: cyber_x
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent visitor to Vegas and have stayed in all manner of accommodations ranging from off-strip budget motels to high end luxury hotels. Harrah's is fairly modest for a Vegas hotel: the rooms are simple and of average size, and the property doesn't have the glitz and glamor of the newer hotel casinos. The price and location, however, are tough to beat. Harrah's is right in the middle of the strip -- many other hotel casinos (including Caesar's Palace for those of you into sports gambling) are easily walkable -- and offers excellent value for the price. If you're in Vegas to be out and about, to party with friends, or even traveling for business (maybe attending one of the many conventions held in Vegas) on a budget, Harrah's is an excellent choice for a very reasonably priced bed. If you're looking for a romantic trip with just you and your significant other, or would prefer to spend all of your time eating, gambling, and attending shows inside just a single casino, then one of the other newer, bigger, more upscale properties may be worth considering instead.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised with accomodation, service in the range steakhouse left alot to be desired”
Reviews.Author: LALALA777
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with our recent 5 night stay at Harrahs. Okay the rooms probably arent as modern/updated as some of the other nearby hotels, however the room in which we stayed in the Carnival Tower was very clean and very spacious. We also had a great view of the Strip particularly Caesars Palace and the Bellagio. Noise from the Strip never an issue, only noise issue was the housekeeping staff in the mornings in the hallway when we were trying to have a sleep in. The prime location of the hotel on the Strip was undoubtedly the best point of the hotel, with the result hat we never even needed to use the monorail. We went to Cirque Du Soleil shows in both the Mirage and Treasure Island, both hotels within easy walking distance. Casino good and staff there very friendly. Only real low point was our meal in the steakhouse in the hotel, The Range. While the quality of food was top notch the service we received from our waiter on the night was very very poor. As we had been to a show that evening we received vouchers for 50% off certain main course dishes in the resteraunt. Nonetheless we still paid around $110 for our meal. However from the moment we showed the voucher to the waiter it was clear he was not interested in providing a quality service to us, with the result he ignored my partner's original drink order and forgot to bring our side dishes with our main course. His attention was visibly focused on a nearby table of 10 people, therefore trying to catch his attention to ask him for drinks/our side dishes/the bill proved very difficult!

Reviews.Title: “Why would you stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: bowsky77
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrah's from October 15-18, 2010 and loved it! Pro's: LOCATION PRICE FUN ATMOSPHERE SHOWS (saw Mac King and was very good) BEDS (very comfortable) Toby Keith's Bar and Grille was GREAT Con's: Tight Slots Comps come VERY slow The room was very clean, and houskeeping did a nice job replacing everything for us daily. I really have no real complaints. Other than losing gambling money, the stay at Harrah's was top notch, and I would highly recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: reptar777
Reviews.Content: We have never stayed at Harrah's in Vegas, but it was awesome. We origionally reserved a strip view but were upgraded to a newly remodeled room without the view and it was very nice and comfortable, well worth not having a view. We drove and it is so nice not having to wait on people on the strip to get in to park, which is a big deal if you ever had to park at another resort. The service was excellent from top to bottom. We have been coming to Vegas for 15 Years and stayed at many resorts and Harrah's was deffenitly a #1.

Reviews.Title: “great trip”
Reviews.Author: nansim
Reviews.Content: our room was perfect, 15th floor. the service excellent. they help us with the location of a car, find us a map to go to Grand Canyon and Hoover Dam, even find us an excellent italian restaurant "Battista" 4-5 minutes on foot from the hotel. $20.00 per person and the wine was included (all you can drink). help us with the bus. (we mostly speak french so......)We stayed 5 nights and it was the greatest hotel to go for the location (in front of the Ceasar's Palace) and for the price. Thank you Expedia.ca we always have problems with beds, not this time. we slept like logs

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, fab location, cheap”
Reviews.Author: TheAugusts
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Las Vegas on 3 previous occasions we decided to try another different hotel and after reviewing hotel on tripadvisor decided to give 'Harrahs' a go. We were not disappointed. the room was a good size with a fabulous view of the strip ( room 2235) could see the volcano at the' Mirage' from our window!! the bathroom was immaculate and the shower was powerful, the beds had feather pillows and the air con worked quietly and efficiently. (as per all Vegas hotels no tea and coffee facilities). Check in and check out were smooth and easy - didn't get asked for any extras or expected to hand over any more cash!! Pool area spacious with plenty of beds and complementary towels. Breakfast buffet was superb. Location Location Location - Perfect. Would definitely return to this hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would stay here next time in Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: jpgpsu
Reviews.Content: We went out there to see the Kenny Chesney concert in May. I have never gone to Vegas before but found Harrah's to be one of the best deals. Not only was it a great value, its right in the middle of the strip! They are in walking distance of TI, Mirage, Imperial Palace, Bellagio and so many more. Plus the monorail station is right at Harrah's. Toby Keith's bar in Harrah's is so much fun too. We were there every night getting the big mason jars of drinks. The only drawback I saw was the pool area. there is not enough chairs around the pool. We were there about 10am and couldn't find a chair. We had to go to another area where they had more chairs. But we couldn't both enjoy the pool at the same time because we had to take turns watching our stuff since the chairs weren't visible from the pool. Overall would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rate, service”
Reviews.Author: deansteg
Reviews.Content: Be sure to sign up for a player's card at any of the Harrah's locations and you will get better rates on future stays.

Reviews.Title: “worst show theatre ever been to”
Reviews.Author: brit-xpat
Reviews.Content: The seating layout of this theatre is bad. Only buy vip tickets (you cannot get these from the cheap buy on the da y booths as they are restricted on what they can sell) if you dont you could end up in a cramped seat with you back to the stage. not pleasant. dont use the timeshare for free tickets you get the worse seats in the house. good buffet here and the all day includes using the other 7 casinos in their group.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money”
Reviews.Author: Keri74
Reviews.Content: We won a trip to Vegas from Australia so we nervous about the quality of the accommodation as we didnt choose it, but were very happy! The standard rooms are very spacious, clean & very comfy bed. After reading reviews on here we asked for a quiet room NOT overlooking the pool, and by doing so avoided being given a room above the bar thats open till 2am. We were also offered a better strip view room for an extra $20 on checkin but that is just a sales ploy for them - we ended up with a great room on 18th floor mardi gras tower with no need to pay extra! The casino areas stink of smoke but our room & floor didnt. You cant beat the location as it is right in the centre of the strip opposite Caesars Palace. Perfect! Didnt end up eating there as there is too much choice elsewhere. They have a deal of about $45 per person for 24 hours worth of all you can eat buffets in any of the Harrahs hotels, sounds great, but be careful as you can find cheap food around and we didnt end up eating that much so we spent less than that per day anyway. The only down side I could report, which is everywhere in Vegas, is no free internet. Internet in Vegas is very expensive!
