All staff were very friendly & helpful so we would definitely stay here again & would recommend :)

Reviews.Title: “Large clean comfortable quiet room in the middle of the strip”
Reviews.Author: carpsenior
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights (Tue-Thu) at Harrah's. The room was large, clean, the bed was comfortable. Arrived at 6 PM by taxi from the airport - $17. Check-in was quick. High-speed internet cost $12 per day. There was a small charge for local calls. Right on the strip across from Caesar's Palace you could walk anywhere - north to Wynn or south to Mandalay Bay. There was a free shuttle (tip the driver) to the Rio where we saw Penn and Teller. The strip buses - the Deuce and the Gold Line - had a stop next door at the Flamingo. For our one day trip to the Grand Canyon South Rim we were picked up at the Flamingo. We did not gamble. We ate at a hamburger joint in the hotel. The food was very good. All in all a good choice. For our other meals we went elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “inexpensive luxury stay”
Reviews.Author: good2bad
Reviews.Content: We took a long trip from the Yellow stone National park, with my parents and my sister's family and four of us. We were so tired when we got there, it took us a long time to sign in, but it turned out really good. We booked the rooms before the trip, it was really a good deal, for 49 sth. per night, but need to add internet fee. Bed is really comfortable, gave us a good night sleep. Especially when we had 2 young kids and 2 elders. This hotel brighten our trip and a good refresh for driving back.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some not so good”
Reviews.Author: Samantha1952
Reviews.Content: I was at Harrah's in Las Vegas this past week for a vacation with my partner and some extended family. My review is mixed. The not-so-good: 1. We had specifically asked for a quiet room near the elevator, both when we made our online reservation and at the time of check-in. The desk clerk looked right at us and assured us that it was a quiet room. The first disappointment was that it was not near the elevator, but rather towards the end of a long hallway. But more importantly, the room was extremely noisy. We were put on the 6th floor of the Carnival Tower and were overlooking a service road and dumpsters. There was continual noise from trucks. Furthermore, the air conditioners in the room were extremely noisy. Between this and the road noise, I had a very difficult time sleeping. I know that we could have asked for a change of room, but after unpacking for a week long stay, the thought of moving again was not appealing and we made the best of it. The part that was most disappointing was the fact of the desk clerk lying to us. 2. If you like to play blackjack and adhere to basic strategy with traditional rules, this will be a disappointing place to play. 99.9% of the tables had a 6/5 payoff for blackjack (this seems to be prevalent at all of the Harrah's properties we visited in Las Vegas). Toward the weekend, they opened up additional tables with 3/2 payoffs, but essentally we played at other casinos through the week and were not able to give Harrah's much play. The good: 1. For an older property, I thought that the hotel was reasonably well maintained (except for the air conditioning!). The room was extremely comfortable and a good size (we had upgraded to a petit suite) with a flat screen TV. The bathroom toiletries were Gilchrest and Soames and were higher end than I would have expected. 2. Location: You can't beat the centrality of this hotel. It's a great taking off point if you want to go either right or left or across the street with very easy and quick access to a dozen casinos. All that said, I would not stay at this hotel again on the forseeable future nor would I recommend it. There are too many other available options.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for strip adventure”
Reviews.Author: MHardies
Reviews.Content: I love the location of this hotel! It is pretty much located right in the middle and traveling to other hotels is a breeze. You get the same amenities that you would at a pricier hotel for cheap cheap cheap! The staff was wonderful, had a ton of fun with most of the dealers. Would stay there again, in fact I am in November!

Reviews.Title: “Located at the heart of the strip - perfection”
Reviews.Author: vegasyes
Reviews.Content: Centrally located and always hopping is the way to define Harrahs. Nice rooms, good food/drink choices, great location and more.

Reviews.Title: “BUSY”
Reviews.Author: TRULYBLESSEDAT50
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this location for a reunion and if Las Vegas is your liking, then this is at the right location; right on the strip within walking distance to all the major hotels: Ceasar"s Palace, Tropicana, the Mirage, Planet Hollywood, etc. When making reservations, I was told I could have a street view for an extra $20 dollars a day; please save that money for a meal. Even though I could see the street instead of the parking lot, I mostly saw ROOF from the 12th floor in the Mardi Gras Tower. If you're used to smoke free environments then you may have a problem but then again, it's Vegas. The room was comfortable and the maid service was fine. Very busy over the Columbus Day weekend. You can choose from valet or self parking; I parked myself on the 1st and 3rd floor in the garage with no problem walking across to the hotel lobby. Several restaurants are available within the hotel and casino but do your research; there are a variety of eating establishments in close proximity. There's also a free shuttle that takes you to Bally's and Rio Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and awesome location”
Reviews.Author: tiburonn89
Reviews.Content: The location cannot be beat. It is right in the middle of the strip and all the action. We were able to walk to any of the other casinos on the strip since it is so well centralized. Loved it. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not my style, but good value and location”
Reviews.Author: WanttoGetoutMore
Reviews.Content: I think we got these rooms for under $40/nt including the 24-hour buffet. The casino was busier than a lot of other nicer hotels, so I liked the energy. We went to the afternoon magician show and there were a couple of good illusions. The buffet is forever busy and more complicated to sign up for than it needs to be. It's about impossible to find someone in the lobby to answer a question. We enjoyed the outdoor "flea" market type area next the hotel. The country western restaurant was fine, and they were able to handle the drunk patron quite well, as her companions were not. I wonder if she survived. We tried to figure out where the rail station was, kept following the signs, but never did find it. The small outdoor pool gets crowded quickly in the morning, so stake out your chairs early. Won some money.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's has everything, great service, good food, and excellent intertainment!”
Reviews.Author: guitarbabe55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's in September for our 37th anniversary. It was our 1st trip to Las Vegas and we were so excited to be staying at a great location right in the center of the Strip. Our check-in was very fast, we arrived around 10am and they had a room ready and waiting. Everyone was so friendly, from the desk agents to the housekeeping staff. The room was very clean, quiet,and nicely appointed. For a standard room, you couldn't beat it for the price. Only thing missing was a coffee maker, but after some research before we left we took our own hot pot. Toby Keith's was a lot of fun and so was the Piano Bar and Carnival Court. The only thing I wasn't too thrilled about was the casino. The slots are some of the tightest on the Strip! Other than that, we had a great trip and are planning to be back in December!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sterlingcentralcoast
Reviews.Content: fantastic hotel great staff easy check in but could have delays if you got there at the wrong time as we did see long lines with impatient people. all you can eat buffet was great value slots were a bit tight but you have got to have a go when your in vegas. did well at the black jack tables if you dont like smoking dont go to the casinos the location is great right in the middle of the strip. worth buying bus tickets to travel up and down the strip as it was extremely hot (Sept.) short walks were the go during the evening all in all was a great hotel

Reviews.Title: “You will smell like an ashtray every day”
Reviews.Author: JustHavingFun048
Reviews.Content: First the good: great bed and a friendly check in staff. Now the bad: two holes in sofa, torn up carpet and generally dusty room. tried to make coffee with in-room machine; both cups were GREASY and the machine was not fully cleaned from previous usage - unacceptable at any hotel. The casino was terrible. A low ceiling makes for one of the smokiest casinos on the strip. The blackjack tables have burn holes and in a generally shabby condition. Also, there was a loud, drunk player effecting the players around him which the dealer and pit boss ignored. Again, unacceptable at any casino.

Reviews.Title: “Mini Suite in Carnival Tower”
Reviews.Author: TNGal08
Reviews.Content: I checked in just before 3:00 pm on Weds and there was no line, which was a relief since we typically wait at least a half hour or more in Vegas - THANKS! I scored a facebook fan rate that was the cheapest I've ever seen for a strip hotel so we took a chance and I was given a King room in the Mardi Gras Tower. Unfortunately, when I got to the room it was not cleaned/serviced so I called down to the desk to let them know and the young man on the phone apologized and asked me to come back down to the desk and they would upgrade me to a Mini Suite for my trouble. We were in a corner room on the 9th floor nearest the elevator and it was very large, clean and QUIET! Loved the bed and linens but it could use some updates in other areas like the OLD TV...but who stays in the room watching TV in Vegas anyway?? We were up and out early each of the 4 mornings we were there and when we returned in the afternoon our room was cleaned and serviced - VERY NICE! Harrah's location - as everyone says - can't be beat and is right in the middle of the most popular strip hotel/casinos, as well as having it's own monorail stop. If you are looking for an upscale experience you need to book elsewhere, but if you can luck up on discounted room at Harrah's.....you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “I love Harrahs!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gerry-ped.
Reviews.Content: Stayed at harrahs Sept 19 thru 24, all 5 nights comped thru previous play. Stayed in Delux room overlooking the pool area, even had a coffee pot and small balcony.(Very small!!!) Very clean room , very comfortable pillowtop bed, flat screen tv, (also one in bathroom ) even tho I never watched tv, I did use it to check out, Great convenience. Check in was quick, only waited a few minutes, had to wait a few hours as my room wasn't ready, but checked my bags in the holding area and when I got to my room later and called, my bags were at my door within 5 min.!!! I didn't use the 24hr buffee pass, but did enjoy the buffee for 3 breakfasts. Wonderful variety, and the made to order omelets were to die for!!! 2 of the Breakfasts were comped . Didn't go to any of the other restaurants there. Not much luck gambling,((at any of the casinos I played at!!!) a few small wins, which were donated back over the 5 days, but CW made freq. rounds, never had to wait for my coffee or soda to be replaced.... ( I always tip $1.00), Compliments to all the staff, from front desk, housekeeping, security, bell desk, CW, people cleaning around the casino and slots, etc. great group of people working at harrahs, cheerful, happy, and It is so pleasant to stay someplace where you can see that people enjoy their jobs.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's is my new favorite hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Metalhead55
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrah's with a friend from Sept. 25th through Sept. 30th 2010. What a awesome Hotel. This was my first stay at this hotel. It's centrally located and near everything! There is always something going on! The room was clean and roomy. The bed was a slice of heaven! I slept sooo good for the few hours I did get sleep!!! My view was of the back of the hotel but was able to see part of the strip if I craned my neck, but who comes to Vegas to spend time in the room for the view? I didn't even have to ask to have the room cleaned, I would always come back to a tidy room with plenty of fresh towles. The casino was always busy. I'm not a big gambler but was able to win a little bit of shopping money : ). I did try the buffet and the food was typical of a casino buffet. Servers were very nice. Over all this hotel was excellent! I can't wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Trash Cans outside our room”
Reviews.Author: Boatmoore
Reviews.Content: After upgrading our room to a mini suite we thought we would really enjoy our three nights at the hotel. The room was nice until I heard a loud noise outside and opened the windows to two huge trash cans that we being dumped. Next too that was the ugly view of the top of the building just below. When I called down to complain, I was told they would move us to a different room. They did three stories up, so a had a even better view of the trash. We we're here for a family reunion and this was taking for ever to resolve, well when I call to the front desk, they said they would check on another room and never called back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, OK rooms”
Reviews.Author: bri5050
Reviews.Content: This was my third time staying at Harrah’s. They keep sending me great offers, so I’m not about to pass them up. There was only one person in front of me at check-in. When I got to the front desk, the clerk told me the room wasn’t ready yet. OK – I was early anyway. She told me to check back in an hour. I did, and the room was ready – #1234 in the Mardi Gras Tower, facing away from the Carnaval Court so I didn’t have to listen to the loud music all night. I called the bellhop once I got up there, and my bag was delivered in less than 5 minutes. The room was fine. There was some wear and tear on the walls, on the bed and in the hallway,, but nothing that bothered me too much. I don’t spend much time in the room anyway. I liked that it had a safe as well. The room was also on the small side - but again, this didn't bother me as I was traveling alone. The staff was very, very friendly across the board. Drink service in the casino was very fast and efficient. The buffet and the café were both were good, although I liked the breakfast buffet better than the dinner one. I never got around to eating at Toby Keith’s on this trip. And I’m really hesitant about eating in a fancy restaurant when I’m alone, so I can’t comment on any of the other restaurants. I had decent luck with both blackjack and rapid roulette. Every slot machine I put my money into turned into a human vacuum cleaner. That is, until the last day. I was playing a $1 Triple Diamond and got Triple Diamond-Triple-Diamond-Triple Bar. $720!!! It was nice to come home with some cash in my pocket! I would recommend Harrah's to anyone on a budget who's looking for a great hotel in a great location. As long as you know going in that it's not the Wynn, you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Room was too hot!”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine48
Reviews.Content: First time to stay at Harrahs, although we have been to LV many, many times. We checked in at 1 am (late flight) dropped off our stuff and headed to the casino. Went back to the room at 5:30 am and slept 2 hours. Up, showered, and ready for a "new" day. I noticed that the cooling vents were thick with dust as was the filter (in the ceiling). We pointed this out to housekeeping who said they would report to maintenance. We came back to the room around midnight to go to bed and noticed that nothing had changed. Went to sleep, really tired, woke up 30 minutes later- the room was very hot. Apparently as an energy saver the air conditioner kicks on when it senses motion in the room and cools quite nicely. As soon as we settled to sleep the room got stuffy and Hot HOT HOT. I would get up, walk around, and it would kick on again for a few minutes- just long enough for me to fall asleep. Needless to say this went on ALL night. Got up in the morning and went on with our day. Returned to the room, hot again, my husband called down within a half hour someone came and waved a magic wand over the thermostat and we were comfortable the rest of the night. Wish I had tried that the first night but that first night was very short. Oh well As you can tell we don't spend much of our LV time in a room so don't ask for much. On a positive note the room although dated and worn was clean, with the exception of the vents. The location can't be beat!! We travel light these days and I depend on the complimentary tolietries provided by the hotels, but these products are BAD- bad shampoo and bad lotion. Bring your own. We have stayed at Ballys and Rio as well as other non total reward places and will choose those locations over Harrahs for future trips. We ate the breakfast buffet- had to wait in line 30-45 minutes, but it really was quite good and offered a lot of selections.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: onepan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 nights here this month. Check in and check out was a breeze. Staff very friendly and attentive. Going in I knew to request a room away from the pool. They put us in the carnival tower. Nice clean room, slept well. Ate in Flavors, the Cafe and KGB burgers, all were very good. Carnival Court was a blast. You can't beat the price (3 comped nights, total of $150 for the 5 nights) and location is great. If you want something fancy and upscale, don't stay here, but if you want a nice clean, comfortable room in a great location, why stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Good Scene, Bad Rooms”
Reviews.Author: BCLVfan
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 nights in Vegas, two of which were spent at Harrah's. You can't beat the location, and the clubs and restaurants were great. I was celebrating my friend's 36th birthday and we had a blast at the piano bar and carnaval court. However, the room was HUGE dissapointment. I usually stay at MGM owned properties and have never had a problem, but this was by far the most tired crappy room I've had in Vegas. I was in the mardi gras tower and my drains were clogged, blinds were broken, carpet was stained and bathroom smelled of mildew. (On the positive side, the beds were really comfortable, and housekeeping was good.) I was told I could switch rooms the next day after I complained, then after waiting in the check out line again I was told there was nothing by a somewhat aggitated attendant. Not the best customer service, although I had great serve in the bars, restaurants and at total rewards desk. I'd come back to party, but not to stay when I can get a way nicer and cheaper room at another property and just walk down here. I've seen nicer rooms at a fairfield inn or holiday inn - - this is not 3 star quality. PS -- tv was giant outdated box and not a flat screen. Didn't even know they had those anymore anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good experience”
Reviews.Author: ldymacbeth89
Reviews.Content: I was there Sept. 20-22 for a professional conference. I traveled on my own and had my own room in the Carnaval tower. I had an older room that overlooked the pool, but it was very clean and comfortable. The toilet had a few issues with not flushing quite right and the sink had a slow drain, but neither were worse than what I have at home so it didn't bother me. The bed was very, very comfortable. I heard that if you request a wake-up call, Elvis calls you. Complaints - I arrived around 4:30 on Monday evening and had to wait an hour in line to check in. I don't know what the delay was as there were several staff working and they added another one while I was waiting. My room had a door to the adjoining room and a LOT of noise could be heard when they got going at 6:30 a.m. I didn't mind too much since I had to be up around 7 - it was just a little annoying. Others at the conference were in the Mardi Gras tower and some of them had problems hearing the band late at night. They charged $12/day for their internet service - I skipped that and just checked my e-mail on my phone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but beware of minibar”
Reviews.Author: PJH67
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at harrah's for 6 days and I can thoroughly recommend this as a great place to stay in Vegas. Good rooms, clean and no resort fees, plus right in the middle of the strip. However, beware of the minibar. If you put anything in it yourself it automatically locks and you then need to get reception to unlock it for you.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's was a great choice!”
Reviews.Author: Screwball
Reviews.Content: Harrah's was chosen by our good friends to help celebrate a wonderful girls 50th birthday. We were 5 couples in all. Check- In was a breeze, (we arrived at approx. 10:30 am and our rooms were ready). Our rooms were scattered between both the Carnival Tower and the Mardi Gras Tower. All of us were happy with our rooms. My boyfriend took a chance and requested a view of the strip and we received the keys for room 1556 in the Mardi Gras Tower. (See pictures). We were able to watch the erupting volcano at the Mirage from our window every night!! Some people have complained about the noisy hallways and thin walls however we didn't encounter any of these problems. On our last night however, our neighbors must have had one too many and woke us up when they were trying to get into our room at 3:00 am. We ate breakfast at the Flavours buffet at Harrah's and, although the food was not bad, it was very pricey, (about $33.00 for the two of us). Most days, we ate breakfast at the McDonalds nearby. The birthday celebration dinner was held at Harrah's in the Range Restaurant. Beautiful ambiance and all of our meals were tasty. The service was very good. The pool wasn't the nicest that we've enjoyed but it certainly did the job. It was nice that we were allowed to "discreetly" bring our own beverages to the pool. That saved us a lot of $$ as both the drinks and dinners were quite pricey. The choice of music played by the young DJ's failed to target the average age of the crowd. (On a few occasions, the average age was roughly 40-50 yrs and the young male DJ was playing heavy rap and some other "noisy" stuff). I approached him and made some requests and he was very accommodating. Harrah's has a perfect location - smack dab in the center of the strip. The staff is friendly and helpful and the Casino and rooms are kept very clean. We had a great time and shared many laughs and most importantly made a memorable 50th for a wonderful friend. My boyfriend and I really prefer all inclusive resorts in the Caribbean as a vacation choice however if we were to return to Las Vegas, Harrah's would certainly be up there as a choice to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ghitor
Reviews.Content: Nice size room, clean bathroom, great shower, excellent location, beautiful swimming pool and no resort fees. I had a nice view of the mountains and I love the fact that I could open the window. Great value for the money, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Athmosphere, Service and Price”
Reviews.Author: boricua_travel
Reviews.Content: It is the 5th time I go to Vegas with friends and the last 3 times we have stayed at Harrahs. The hotel is clean all the time, staff is friendly and accomodating. The location can't be beat. It's center strip. My friends did not want to leave the casino. Very good luck there. The pool is a party with music and lots of nice, friendly, hot people. Every year we keep going back to Harrahs.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: jay21212
Reviews.Content: We go strictly for video poker and football. Saw 2 people hit royal flushes at video poker bar by the party pit. Great rock music on Saturday night had everybody at the bar singing. Sunday and Monday they played country for some inexplicable reaso. Many complained to Harrahs personnel but nobody could do anything about it. Other than that all other apsects were great.

Reviews.Title: “Good time”
Reviews.Author: Ozzie0526
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice and had plenty of space and it also had a safe in the room which was very handy. The casino had a bright and cheerfull feeling to it. the best part is that it's right in the mist of the strip and close to the other known casinos. I thought that the food was a little high for some of the meals but the service was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, will be back next September.”
Reviews.Author: broheiser
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Sept 5th - Sept 11th 2010. What a great experience here at Harrahs. The staff is very friendly, (especially Nicole @keno and Vince and "all rise" a few of the bartenders). The entire place is spotless all the time. Great mixed crowds all week. One of the best parts was we each won and played with Harrahs money all week! The girls dancing in the cage are a great addition while you play blackjack!! All dealers there are super friendly, (JO, all 3 Meliss's and all the other girls in Toby Keiths pit area). Pool area was great! DJ all day and lots of sun! A MUST is to eat at the Oyster Bar. Prices are reasonable and food is excellent! Also KGB Burger is very good. They have fried pickles, yummy! All in all this was our best trip to Vegas. We have been there 6 times before but this was the BEST. Thanks Harrah's for the great time! We will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great room & great price”
Reviews.Author: Nabrab
Reviews.Content: Nice and very large room with 2 double beds and all the amenities (fridge, safe, ...). We paid $ 60,-/night which is a super price. A really good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, friendly service, great price”
Reviews.Author: muppetx
Reviews.Content: We stayed the friday of the labour day weekend, and the hotel was practically sold out. It was very busy, and crammed with people checking in. Even with the large crowd the check-in went smoothly and fast. I simply asked if we could have a room on a high floor and they offered me a complimentary upgrade to the mardi-gras tower. Considering I was only paying peanuts for the room on a holiday weekend, and we don't have a gambling history with Harrahs, I was pretty pleasantly surprised. I made sure the room was not facing the carnival court though! The room itself was decent, on par with a nice holiday-inn. It had a nice LCD tv, a coffee maker in the bathroom, and a comfortable bed. Nothing special, but definitely a comfortable room for a great price. The bathroom had a small LCD tv in it, but was otherwise dwarfed by the large toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip!!!!”
Reviews.Author: diamondp64
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrahs from Sept 1st to the 5th. Reading the reviews I was alittle unsure of my choice, I was pleasantly surprised!! The check in staff was very friendly and helpful.I upgraded to a Deluxe room in the Marde Gras tower for $15 a day was well worth it. The room was very clean, the bed was very comfortable (pillow top). It had a balcony overlooking the pool although very small was nice to step out and get some fresh air. It's all about location and you couldn't get better. We took advantage of the Buffet special $39.99 for 24 hrs well worth it, you can eat at any of 7 buffets at any of their properties. The pool was small but had a DJ everyday which really made it lively. Went to the Venetion pool one day friends were staying there, although nice very quite and boring. All in All I would say Harrahs was a great deal and alot of fun!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Dara123
Reviews.Content: This being my third time to Vegas, I've stayed at two other hotels before. This was the best of the three. The beds were soooo comfy, and the bathroom was huge! I really enjoyed hanging out at the pool with my friends, and on the weekend there was a DJ at the pool! It was so much fun. The hotel is in a great location, the rooms were great, and the beds were so plush!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: bebelechekid
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 5 day stay at Harrah's. VERY clean. Housekeeping WONDERFUL. Staff WONDERFUL. Food-mediocre ... except for new IcePan on 2nd floor... AWESOME - and wonderful staff there as well; especially Mark, WONDERFULLY personable & helpful, even at 2 a.m. (after leaving TKs, whose bartenders were EXCELLENT (and funny). Overall, fab first time experience at Harrahs, and will be back before 2011. (Also very centrally located. Only rented a car for one day, because no problem walking to other venues). Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad.”
Reviews.Author: adamchand
Reviews.Content: i had a nice visit at Harrah's. The staff was friendly and helpful. The pool was small, but served its purpose. You cant beat the location. Paid 15.00 per night for the upgraded room.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay and experience at Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: comp_Nerd
Reviews.Content: Went to Las Vegas on a much needed vacation decided to stay at Harrah's we stayed for 5 days 4 nights. Our flight was early so we had no problem checking in however, we were hours early so a room was not available yet. The lady that helped us check in was very helpful and wasn't rude at all! also as usual we were asked if we wanted to upgrade to a bigger room we declined. The room we were told was going to be where we were staying was in the Carnival Towers room 1611, we went walking around for a few hours and we went to see if our room was available and luckily for us it was! The room was basic but clean the bed is definitely comfortable but I did not care too much for the pillows. Housekeeping was great our room was always clean and we asked for extra towels and we got them each time our room was cleaned. Room service was great we did not have to wait too long for our food to arrive! I was worried about the noise from the carnival court but we did not hear anything at all! Had a view of the pool from our room, the view from our window looked even better at night! The casino is in a great location which I really enjoyed. We decided to get eat in Chinatown we heard great things about their restaurants and everyone kept saying we should eat at Makino it was a buffet that served sushi...being that my husband and I love sushi we took their advice and ate there....WORST DECISION EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! almost instantly we knew it was going to be a disaster the sushi wasn't made right it tasted funny...and unfortunately that night we both suffered from mild food poisoning which resulted in us missing a night out having fun! To redeem our vacation we decided to go eat a nice dinner at one of the restaurants on the strip but we were not sure which one to choose we went to the information desk where we met a nice girl named Courtney who was a tremendous help ...I suggest whoever goes to Harrah's make sure to ask for her! Even though we got sick we still had a fun time in vegas and hope to go back soon we will definitely stay at Harrah's again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ElisaLeone
Reviews.Content: Maybe it is not one of the most famous hotel in Las Vegas, but in my opinion it is a good hotel and not too expensive. Good position, you can easly reach almost every hotel, especially Paris, Treasure Island, Bellagio, Caesar Palace and so on. Big and comfortable room. The casinò was one of the most crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Loud Music heard from their bar on 1st floor until 4am we were on 19thfloor”
Reviews.Author: vic2ward
Reviews.Content: Never again will I stay in this hotel, and we have been guests with them for 20 years. Sad to say they have gone this direction.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE AND HELPFUL STAFF - CLEAN ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: sallystyle
Reviews.Content: The staff was very nice and helpful when checking in, when having to fax something to my lender and with restaurant tips. Also the lady at the Total Rewards counter was very friendly and helpful. The room wasn't fancy but it was nice and it was clean. I would stay here again. Don't go to Toby Keith's unless you plan on spending a lot of money for a meal !

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's - No Hip Hip Horray”
Reviews.Author: kmc1021
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Mardi Gras Tower this past week for 3 days. Disliked - room was clean but old. Air conditioning unit was tooo noisy and did not cool the room off. It is on a timer when you leave the room and takes a while to get the room comfortable when you return. Not many of the newer slot machines, too much smoke, no food court to speak of. Liked - the pool area and DJ, great beds and clean bathroom, not much noise between rooms, hallways clean Felt that there were better choices on the strip that had more modern amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you get a great deal...”
Reviews.Author: cristjw
Reviews.Content: pros: found a good price, right on The Strip, Toby Keith's Bar cons: the pool was atrociously crowded and pool service was bad, the room was really really really old-ish, wonderful alley view I will not stay here again- there are too many choices to make this mistake again.

Reviews.Title: “Consistantly good. Killer location.”
Reviews.Author: AZTXgrl
Reviews.Content: Another great stay at Harrah's on the Center Strip. Yes, it is not a 'fancy' hotel, but I will say that the management keeps this hotel consistently clean & maintained. Many other hotels that age are already showing deferred maintenance. Our room in the Carnival tower was clean and comfortable. It was a good size with a table and chairs in a nook in the back. Bed was much more comfortable than some hotels I've been to lately. Bathroom was kept in good working order (i.e. no slow drains or drips) and no deferred maintenance (unlike some so-called 4 star hotels on the Strip...do you hear me Monte Carlo??). As far as sleep quality, there will always be drunk idiots walking by your room at 4am…it’s Vegas, just expect it, bring earplugs if you’re a light sleeper and thank me later. But, I will say Harrah’s seems to have thicker walls than some other mid-range Strip hotels. Food options are great at Harrah's too. The Buffet isn't super fancy, but the selection is great and the staff keeps things friendly and moving quickly. Also, you can't beat the Monorail station located right at the back of the hotel and the connection to the Imperial Place just steps away. Pool isn't exactly a tropical paradise, but it was enjoyable. Harrah's guests can also use the pool at the Flamingo (there may be a fee, I'm not 100% sure), but there is no charge for 21+ ladies to enter the Flamingo "Go Pool".

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Donner2
Reviews.Content: Price of the hotel dropped every month after I first booked it. Re-booked a month before trip and got the room for $35/night and got a 24 hr buffet pass for 2 people. Have stayed here before but was pleasantly surprised to see a renovated modern room, comfy bed, nice bathroom. For the price, I gave up a view (overlooked the hotel's utilities). Harrah's true value is its location. Walking distance to many hotels. Liked Harrah's outdoor concerts, Mac King Comedy show, piano bar and casino. Buffet was ok - get players card for buffet discount. Took airport shuttle in ($6) , taxi back to airport ($22). Got a 3 day RTC bus pass to travel strip and go to Fremont street - have EXACT amount to buy, no change provided at auto machines or from driver. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than expected”
Reviews.Author: LauraEH
Reviews.Content: We booked Harah's through a package with southwestvacations.com due to it's location and price. I had very low expectations and must say I was pleasantly surprised. We opted for the 10.00/day 'deluxe room' upgrade and were glad we did. It got us a view of the pool/strip and a newly renovated room. I never saw the 'regular' rooms, but heard that they were very old/outdated. The room was clean and had plenty of room. The bed was decently comfortable, the pillows were not--flat as pancakes, but OK if you stacked 2 or so. The one complaint I do have about the room was how thin the walls are. The night before we left, we were in bed around 1:30am and I was not so happily awoken by our VERY loud neighbors around 4:30am which lasted for about an hour. It sounded like they were literally sitting on the bed with us they were so loud. The casino was comparable with all the others..lots of slots, gaming tables, and SMOKE! The service was fine. This is an older hotel, so keep in mind the casino is not as glamorous as many others. There is a beer/liquor store very close which is nice. If you are planning on drinking at the pool, definitely bring your own (even though they tell you not to, it seemed that as long as you were discrete, this was not a problem). You'll pay about 1/2 the price or more if you buy them from inside the hotel or at the liquor store around the corner. Overall, a good deal for the room/location. Would probably stay there again if we go back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “EAT AT THE OYSTER BAR WITH RAYMUNDO AS YOUR CHEF!!!”
Reviews.Author: DAWNDAC
Reviews.Content: The oyster bar was absolutely amazing! Raymundo created magical culinary delights! Absolutely the best oysters, grilled shrimp, and the most delish halibut. All delivered with a smile, knowledge, and personality. Even if I am not a guest at the hotel I plan to always dine with Raymundo and the staff of the oyster bar when I'm in town!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: prettyivy25
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I have to admit I was a bit nervous about staying at Harrah's. My hubby and I visit Vegas anually, but this is our first time staying at Harrah's. We checked in on August 7 to a beautiful suite on the 35th floor of the Carnaval Tower. I was immediately impressed. The room was a good size and the bathroom had two separate sinks/vanities and a jetted garden style tub. The pillow top mattress reminded me of home. We had a separate living area which we used to entertain friends. We traveled with a group of 18 and everyone else stayed across the street at The Mirage. When they came to our suite many of them were salty because they felt like they had been robbed. We paid much less for our suite than they did for a room. The location on the strip is excellent. The monorail stops at Harrah's which allows easy access to other parts of the strip without a lot of walking or expensive cab rides. The location is important to my husband and I because we always vacation in LV for 7 days. Transportation costs can become an issue if you are not prepared. There are several food choices that meet every budget. Harrah's exceeded my expectations and I am already planning my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room at a good value”
Reviews.Author: countdowntovacation
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 1262 in the Mardi Gras Tower. Room was clean. Comfy bed, tub and sink drained good and no issues with toilet. Quiet room. We paid extra to get a room with a strip view but the tower is actually far from "the strip". Top of air conditioning units, duct work, pipes, etc. on roof top of lower Harrah's building can be seen below. However, at night you can see some of the hotels lit up. Especially the Rio and Palms off in the distance. In the daylight hours you can see the beautiful mountains off in the distance. There is an ironing board and iron and safe in the room. NO micro-wave, refrigerator and worse of all, no coffee maker. You need to leave your room in the morning to get coffee. There is a McDonald's right next door or you can go to the Star Bucks inside Harrahs. (Near the check-in and check-out area. The hotel states for safety there is personnel at the elevators after 9 p.m. to verify only guest use these elevators. All three nights we never did see anyone doing this. Not good for safety of the guests. We did select the 24 hour buffet option with our room. This was well worth the extra money. The 24 hour buffet is where you can eat at any of the buffets at Bally,s Flamingo, Harrahs, Imperial Palace, Paris, Planet Hollywood, Rio and Caesar's Palace as often as you want withing a 24 hour period. Your time starts when you pay for your first buffet. Hint: Go to dinner late (7 p.m. and after) for your first buffet meal then you can eat at any buffet until that time the next day. This way you get dinner for two days. This is well worth the little extra you pay for your room each day. If you don't get the buffet through your hotel you can still purchase it separately.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElliSonn
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival it took 50 minutes to check without there being a long que. Rooms were clean and basic, pool was basic but nice except for young adults drinking and smoking in the pool even when there were young children about. Complained but hotel staff didn't seemed bothered! Casino very smokey due to the low ceiling but we only passed through. Overall a OK hotel with excellent location but otherwise nothing special

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: gobroncos55
Reviews.Content: Just returned from four days at Harrahs. Had a great time. Clean and comfortable rooms and the food was delicious. Had an awesome time in the piano bar. When we return to Vegas, we will stay at Harrahs.

Reviews.Title: “Good Time at Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: crmo2
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights in March of 2010. Positives: 1. Services: Check in/out good. Helps to be Diamond status, very quick and easy. Housekeeping: Good and competent. Slot Attendents: Friendly and responsive. Beverage Servers: For the most part ample, a few exceptions when they didn't appear at all. Had to go elsewhere for service while playing. Security: For the most part visible. Later hours , very few present. Location: Centrally in the middle of many other casinos, restaurants and attractions. Rooms: Clean and quiet. Hallways: Quiet Elevators: very quick, never had to wait more than a couple of minutes. Transportation: Free shuttle service available to other Harrah's properties, run every 30 minutes. Monorail access. Reataurants. Utilized: Flavors Buffet and The Cafe. Both offered a variety of items. Pool: Did not utilize. Gaming: Variety of slot machines. Did not win anything to speak of....Never do anymore. Did not utilize table games. Entertainment: rated enjoyable: Rita Rudner, Legends in Concert and The Piano Bar-This is a total fun place...A must see. Outside area: Carnival Court: Always loud and jumping. Atmosphere of casino: Always busy and music can be loud at times. Clientele: Older and younger ages. Negatives: 1. Beverage service can be lacking at times or not at all. 2. No Host contact. 3. Lost all points on My Total Rewards for some reason and they were not restored. Do join the Total Rewards program though.. 4. Do not touch refridgerators in rooms unless you intend to pay for it. 5. Beware of Timeshare hawkers, they will try to hustle you. I have been coming to these properties for 13 years and will continue to do so as I have not paid for a room in as many years. I will be returning to Harrah's-Las Vegas at the end of this month(August).

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Hotel, Nothing Flash or Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: ukkylie
Reviews.Content: We just got back from spending 5 nights at Harrahs. We got a sweet deal on the hotel room so we were not expecting much as the 5 nights cost us under $400 (US). We did request in our reservation that we have a king bed and a strip view room. They came through with the bed, however for the view, not so much. If you turned your head to the left and put it on a 45 degree angle with your left eye closed..... you catch my meaning! The rooms are dated, and ours was clean upon check-in with one exception - we found a towel in one of the dresser draws. Our rooms were cleaned daily with restocked towels and toiletries. The housekeeping staff don't remove anything from the room that is not in the garbage cans - so if you have an empty water bottle on your bedside table, it will still be there after the room is cleaned. Our room had a very easy to use safe, which gave us some peace of mind with regards to passports etc. Our A/C temperature did not move, despite trying to change it several times. In the end we gave up as it was acceptable at 69 degrees. The rooms do have a faint smell of tobacco, despite being in a non-smoking room, on a non-smoking floor! We had a TV in our room which was a very, very old CRT style and the picture was so bad, you could not have any lights on in the room if you wanted to watch it. We also had an iron and ironing board - which came in very handy. The power outlets are old and you need to watch it if you are charging items. The plugs sometimes partially fall out of the outlets and the batteries don't get charged! The remainder of the hotel was reasonably clean, even if a little dated. One thing about Harrahs is it's owned by Wyndham so be prepared if you stay here or any other hotel owned by Wyndham, you will be pestered by timeshare sales men. The first night we were there we were approached 7 times!!! There is a monorail stop at the back of the hotel which is perfect if you want to see other places on the strip - don't think you can walk from one end of the strip to another, you will never do it, there are too many people and disjointed walkways - it will take forever. Check in was fast - under 20 minutes and upon check in we were given books upon books of coupons - these do come in very handy so don't discard them. Check out was also quick and easy. There are no in-room coffee or tea facilities, as there are 2 Starbucks in the hotel which can make things very spendy. There are several restaurants in the hotel. We ate at Flavors buffet which was pretty average as well as KGB Burgers, which was reasonably priced and a little better than average. If you want a big meal at a very, very reasonable price, check out the Hash House A Go Go at the Imperial Palace. It's incredible. All in all, for what we paid, we were happy. It does not have the flash of other hotels in Vegas, but as I say, you don't go on holiday to stay in your room!

Reviews.Title: “HAD GREAT TIME!”
Reviews.Author: JEWELL10
Reviews.Content: THIS WAS THE FIRST TIME FOR MY Fmily and i to vacation in las vegas i was a lot hesitant to book AT THE HARRAHS after reading all the negative reviews we booked three rooms there and all of them were really nice i was pleasantly surprise . all the staff was nice and the rooms were cleaned each day ,check in was not long at all but i have to admit at check in they offered me an upgrade and i ask why should i get an upgrade i paid for nice rooms and thats what i expect, we were on the main strip it was busy all the time with a lot of people but i think its the best location if you dont have a car the walk is a beast!

Reviews.Title: “very outdated”
Reviews.Author: l_Vanilla_l
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is very outdated and should definitely be renovated!! Old decoration, stained carpet, rooms are not sound proof and you can here the doors slamming. I didnt get to sleep at all!! You can smell cigaret smoke in the rooms because of poor climatisation system. When we moven to the treasure island it was a big change. The Wynn hotel seemed very nice also, I would go there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Boring, Old, Crowded, Outdated Games, Dark, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: driftnup
Reviews.Content: Harrah's Las Vegas use to be a very nice place to visit. That was then. I would tear it down and build a Hotel/Casino/Resort that can hold its own amongst the other more modern more exciting Hotels on the strip. Room was okay, stained carpet. Old CRT television with bad picture and sound. bathroom dirty and dried tothpaste from previous guest in sink. We set the A/c to 60 but the room stayed at 78. Food expensive for what you get. Old slots with a few modern ones placed here and there. Small check-in area and always crowded and the Concierge was awful-rude. I waited in the designated area and people just walked up to the desk asking questions bypassing the designated area and the Concierge did nothing, I walked away after 10 minutes. met only one nice lady cashier at the buffett and the valet was fast and courteous. too many choices now, for alittle more money you can have a better place to donate your hard earned money. Business center charges 10.00 for first 15 min to use their old computer. there is no wifi anywhere. you have to use the swipe your credit card computers near the monirail station.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: hulagirl98
Reviews.Content: This is my second trip to Vegas within a 5 month period and Harrah's is much more centered on the strip than the hotel I stayed in last time. This is probably one of the best reasons to stay here. Rooms are basic. Somehow we got "upgraded" to the room with the coffee pot and tv in the bathroom in the mardi gras tower while the friends we were traveling with had the bare basic rooms in the carnival tower. I really don't know how much of a difference this made to us as we did not use either feature, but still it was fun to brag- hey we have a tv in the bathroom. The room was clean and maid service did a good job each day. They do leave a little envelop for tips and at the end of our stay we did put a little money in there. Staff was friendly and check in and out went quickly. Staff was able to answer questions we had and quickly fix the one problem we had- one of the redemption machines ate a voucher without giving my boyfriend the money on it. We really didn't win money while playing slots here - maybe a few odd dollars, but wait staff did circle the machines and offer drinks even when we were playing on the penny slots. We ate at the buffet here twice (dinner and breakfast) and both times it was good. I highly recommend getting the buffet of buffet deal . you pay about 40 bucks and get unlimited access to several buffets for 24 hours. I know this may seem gluttonous but if you eat 4 meals (you do not have to overindulge) it is about 10 bucks a meal and in vegas that is a good deal. If you are a beer drinker and do not care about what kind of beer you drink - the place next door had dollar beers and also dollar margaritas if that is more your style. Not a far walk at all for cheap drinks. We did go to the pool one day for an hour or so. The pool is not much to look at and really pretty plain, so if you are wanting a place with a great pool you may want to go elsewhere, but this was no big deal for us. Over all I was pleased with this hotel as a place to stay. I would also venture to say that the friends we traveled with (8 of us) enjoyed their stay here. I recommend staying here if you are looking for a hotel that is pretty centered and not very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory, clean room, seedy sidewalk area,”
Reviews.Author: NinafromCharleston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed here for 5 nite in July. I chose Harrah's because of the great rate they were offering. Even on their "deluxe" rooms, 5 nites came to under $500 including 2 passes to 24 hours worth of buffets at any Harrah's Vegas property. I had read the TA reviews and initially had reserved at Caesar's Palace for the same promotion, but for a higher overall rate. After reading the reviews I decided it was worth saving the $100+ by staying at Harrah's. The hotel was pretty standard - the casino was not overly smoky, the staff was very friendly, our room was spotless, very comfortabale mattress, fresh clean bedding,, with two flat-screen tvs, one in bathroom! Bathroom was spotless as well, with "upscale" toiletries. The center-strip location was Harrah's best feature; although, every day and nite there were extremely seedy men and women handing out flyers "girl for you in your room in 20 minutes"! I didn't see these people in front of any other center Strip hotel, and wondered why Harrah's allows them there. All I could think of was first amendment right - tt was a public sidewalk. I considered complaining to the management, but blew it off. We spent our days hiking in Red Rock Canyon, Mt. Charleston, and even drove 2.5 hours to Zion National Park in Utah! If you're looking for a clean hotel with good housekeeping services, friendly staff, and great location, and you're not in Vegas to spend a lot of time in your room, Harrah's is fine. If I ever go back to Vegas (It was fun, but not amazing), I think I might step up one level.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's is going down hill”
Reviews.Author: HappyJenn
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Sunday July 18th with another couple(separate rooms). We asked for King beds, the answer we received was "one queen or 2". I again asked if they had any King beds and the reply was "one queen or 2". When asked a question it is polite to answer it. We were given room 420, and looking forward to a nice cold beer. Upon opening the mini fridge, the only thing left in there is toiletry kits and bottled water. To our surprise the previous guest took polaroid pictures of their poop and left them in the fridge. We spent 30 minutes calling the front desk, they transferred us around, said they would send house keeping, and no one ever came. This also triggered a charge to our room which we later had to fight at the front desk. There are signs all over the room about going green. Why does every room have a mini fridge plugged in to refrigerate shaving creme? The carpet in our room had a huge stain between the beds, one in front of the dresser and along the bedside. Someone had spilled a red drink along the nightstand, which is dried in drips down the side and still lays on the floor. How can you make the bed every day and not notice this? We had connecting rooms with our friends, there was gum stuck between the doors. The other couple we were with had their room only cleaned once and we were there for a 5 days. There is a massage room on our floor that had spilled sea salt in the hallway, It sat for 2 days before being vacuumed. Overall there are definite signs that the economy has effected Vegas. Harrah's had fewer cocktail waitresses, fewer maids, and fewer people in guest service. 2 other couples we met were complaining also, one had their key reader malfunction and were locked out of their room 15 times. It took 2 days for someone to change the battery which solved the problem. Another complained they had 6 guys playing cards for over an hour and never had a waitress come over.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is......”
Reviews.Author: madrefish
Reviews.Content: I haven't been to Las Vegas in three years and the recession seems to have taken a toll on employees and hospitality. We stayed at Harrahs because of the location and room rates. It took an hour to check in on a Monday afternoon! The room was tidy, but could use a good cleaning. There were dust bunnies behind the furniture and on the phone. The casino was crowded, so we took the shuttle to the RIO, where I have stayed in the past. Harrahs was o.k., but I doubt I'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed My Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: lovestravel10
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Harrah's. It was clean, staff was friendly and it was perfectly located on the center of the strip! My only complaint is that the walls are thin and you can hear if someone is in the room next to you or someone walking by. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Ear Plugs”
Reviews.Author: Loganshome
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas for my 1st time and I had waited 55 years to get there. We reserved a room with a view and got one of the Air Conditioning ducts for the hotel. At 8 AM our third morning we were awakened by hammering, power saws and grinding and when we called the desk they had "NO knowledge of any construction anywhere". My husband went up 7 floors and could still hear the noise on each floor but could not find the source. There were used glasses from the restaurant downstairs on our nightstands when we left and when we came back hrs later, they were STILL there, just covered with coasters. We found the mini fridge in the closet and it contained a note saying DO NOT PUT ANYTHING IN HERE and they hadn't either. WILL NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: ecormack
Reviews.Content: We chose Harrah's for the location, which is probably the best thing about this hotel. The rooms and service are satisfactory; nothing special, but nothing terrible either. We had planned to do a day at the pool and should have researched that better as the pool at Harrah's is quite inadequate. It is very small, it feels like a concrete coffin tucked in between the buildings, definitely an afterthought vs. a feature. There is no shade at the pool unless you pay a hefty daily rental fee ($100) for a cabana and spend an equal amount in food & beverage credits. That seemed awfully steep and when we were there, we didn't notice that any of the cabanas were occupied. I won't make that mistake again when a day at the pool is a planned activity. We arrived at 7:30 on a Friday evening and our check-in went very quickly though I have yet to stay at a hotel on the strip where the automaton at the front desk makes you feel like a person rather than a number (off strip, have had much better luck). We had no problems with noisy neighbours keeping us up but you can definitely hear through the walls. The mattress I slept on was fantastic so worth it for the quality of sleep. It would not be horrible to stay at Harrah's again but I will definitely check out the options.

Reviews.Title: “A Sister trip”
Reviews.Author: livelovelaugh63
Reviews.Content: We found everything to be perfect except the location of our room. It was a freebie, so I guess they think you should be one the 7th floor at the end of hall. The view was the garage across street. The room itself was outdated but okay since we only spent about 5 hours in it each day. The casino location was perfect .

Reviews.Title: “Bad Pool!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelor1976
Reviews.Content: This was my second time. I went last year 2009 and stayed @ Bellagio. This time I went with my gf for the 4th of July Left 7-3-10-7-7-10. The hotel was fine I upgraded to the Deluxe Exclusive Suite with a Jacuzzi Male/Female sinks. The room was great, but we didn't stay at the room. We mainly walked the strip. The last few days we wanted to go to the pool, but it was 2 crowded. it was just a normal pool nothing big, fancy, decorative. We did do the 24hr buffet which was unbelievable and the 24hr bus rides. It u were going to Vegas for the 1st time I recommend this hotel. but next time I am going to check different hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Started off Bad”
Reviews.Author: LoriHockeyMom
Reviews.Content: I booked our rooms back in April for son's 21st & the reservation was put in my husband's name. When our grown (unmarried) children arrived with their printed confirmations, they were not allowed to check in without their dad's permission. Since he was still in flight & flight had been delayed, the family could not check in until he arrived at 10:30pm. Finally got into room to find beds unmade & bathroom dirty. Switched us to another room. Rooms were good size & beds comfortable, but could hear everything adjoining & above us including music at pool all nite/morning long. Wouldv'e switched for something not pool side, but too tired to care. Hotel seemed short staffed & desk admitted staff had been cut in half. Also couldn't use fridge in room for personal items. Daughter checked out...switched to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Experience was a little disappointing, but ok considering price”
Reviews.Author: Mamalee025
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Mardi Gras tower. For the price, this place is a good deal. Pretty basic but the location on the Strip is great. But to keep it real.........Room and bed was very small and uncomfortable. Pillow was a joke. The room was akin to a Comfort Inn room but with a more uncomfortable bed. It was clean and housekeeping was good and friendly. Check in is slow. Good breakfast in the cafe in the casino. Stayed here 6 years ago and remember a bit better experience. All in all though it is a good deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, what more do you need in Vegas?!”
Reviews.Author: hayleyep
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here for two nights in June with a large group, but thought that the location of this casino is fantastic (about in the middle of the main strip) and was actually surprised at how nice the rooms were. Sure the view wasn't great but honestly didn't care cause room was very comfortable and when in Vegas you don't spend that much time in your room anyway. Bathroom was also nice and alot bigger than some other hotels in the US. Would recommend for short stays.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to sleep & shower, GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: NashvilleTNGuy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 521 July 8-11, 2010. Room was clean and comfortable. That's it. Don't expect 5 star here. Just a nice clean room where you can sleep and shower then get back to it. You can't beat the location on the strip! If you don't want the "wow" factor from you hotel on your Vegas trip, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: chacha561
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's July 6th-july 11th 2010. We stayed in The Mardi Gras Tower. The room was small with a queen size bed , but nice. We had a view of the pool or small pool or whatever it was. The music from the bar across the way will keep you awake if you stay on that side of the hotel. The buffet is horrible. The service of the hostess in the platnum lounge on Saturday July 10th at 10:30 am was horrble , poor customer service. The hostess said didyou know this is the platnum entrance, Duh I think I can read it says it on tne sign outside, She was just plain rude. The casino is ok. I stay at Harrah' s because of location, but I may have to just re think it.

Reviews.Title: “Well Placed on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Kyla64
Reviews.Content: We arrived a day before the 4th July weekend expecting it to be chaos, whilst the hotel was busy, we didnt have to wait in a queue to check in, the reception staff where very helpful and informative. We upgraded our room to a jacuzzi suite in the carnival tower and the 32nd floor. The floor was quiet and the room was very spacious with a very large bathroom and jacuzzi. The hotel is undergoing renovation of its rooms and this room hasnt yet been done, so was a little tired. The view was out onto the strip. We used room service who where very quick and the food was good. We didnt eat at the hotel otherwise. The valet parking team were very helpful on both arrival and departure and we also used the monorail which was quick and convenient from the hotel. We did use the pool and sun loungers, which considering the size of the hotel was exceptionally small. Some loungers incurr a premium to use on a day to day basis but get there early as all beds are taken early....

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: MICommish
Reviews.Content: Had stayed at Harrah's last year and didn't have any problems, so we decided to go back. Check-in was quick, we got the type of room we had requested and it was clean. The only problem was the air conditioner. Harrah's has put motion sensors on them so they don't run when you're not in the room, which if fine. But the problem is they don't run a lot of times when you're in the room because of the location of the sensors. Several times we had to get up and walk directly in front of them to get the air to kick on. This was a problem at night, because as least once every night we had to get up to get it to kick on. I found out later that you can call and have them come and turn them off sensor mode, so definitely do that. Check-out was smooth. Overall, it's a good value for the money considering great location and festive atmosphere, and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “WORST buffet in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: SandraTheTravelBug
Reviews.Content: We waited in a very short line for over an hour for a terrible buffet at Flavors in Harrah. It was listed as one of the best buffets and things must've changed a lot since that review was written, because the hostesses/servers would only let one table in whenever one left like a club or something and when we complained, they didn't apologize, they actually said we were welcome to leave. After already having waited an entire hour of our precious vacation time and when I said that I didn't want to leave after waiting all that time and I just wanted to know why they had it set up like that (having worked in restaurants myself and not understanding this concept) they called security on me. However security agreed with me and just stood around to prevent the rest of the line from bursting out into a riot. Then, once we finally were seated, we were treated to the worst sushi I've ever had in my life, poorly rinsed crab legs, butter that was little more than grease, overcooked chicken and a terrible layout. If you're looking for a variety, go to the buffet at the Mirage, it's definitely much better and you won't have to wait in a ridiculous line for no apparent reason.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: tnfolks60
Reviews.Content: Our family group (7) stayed at Harrah's the first week of July. We had one suite and 2 standard rooms. Everything about the hotel was wonderful - clean, great beds, ample room, good sized bathrooms. Naturally, the rooms in the suite were larger and more extravagant, but the standard rooms were nice. Harrah's is a very convenient location on the strip, and Las Vegas is a great location for easy access to a lot of outdoor trips.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again...”
Reviews.Author: SVScooter
Reviews.Content: Like a few others I was nervous about staying at Harrah’s after reading some of the reviews, but I thought what the heck I’d go for it. I stayed over the July 4th weekend on 2 nights comp, and 1 night partial comp (Total Rewards membership pays). Arrived on Friday mid-afternoon and took less than 20 minutes for check-in. Stayed in the Carnival tower, room 2540, the room was clean and well stocked with plenty of towels and pillows. Two VERY MINOR complaints about the room: 1) bathroom size. You had to close the door all the way to access the shower, but overall it’s not a bad size. 2) internet access. Since I arrived on a normal work day, I needed to access the internet to get some things done before the weekend. Took me about an hour on the phone with their tech support to find out there was an issue with the in-room equipment. They dispatched a tech to fix the issue and it was done within an hour. Somebody had also disconnected all the cables and left it in a huge mess behind the desk. I was there with a group of about 20 friends and family for a wedding at another hotel. We purchased the buffet of buffets pass which was well worth the price. Since many people had teenagers, after one dinner and a breakfast, at any of the Harrah’s properties, e.g. Paris, Harrah’s, Cesar’s Palace, etc., it paid for itself. I would recommend staying away from the Paris buffet. It’s really gone down hill over the past few years. The staff was very helpful and tried to accommodate your needs.

Reviews.Title: “NICE-CLEAN-Spacious”
Reviews.Author: nlw33052
Reviews.Content: Girlfriend Trip so 4 gals stayed in Carnaval Tower with connecting rooms 2356 & 2354. The rooms were an excellent size with all the in room amneities we needed. Exceptionally clean with wonderful beds & 3 pillows each !! Bathroom was great -super shower. Everyone we encountered in the Hotel itself was helpful & pleasent. The hotel pool is small. No free internet connect. BUT great location almost in middle of strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Centre Strip Location, Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: McGeepers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in June. Our room was in the Mardi Gras Tower, overlooking the pool. The room was modern and stylish, LCD TV in the main room and smaller one in the bathroom. The bathroom was clean with a full size tub. The lifts were quick in this tower and we never waited more then a minute in either direction. The buffet is good value with plenty of comfort food. The pool is plain, but plenty of fun. And finally the location is handy to all the centre strip has to offer. The only negative is the check in line is occasionally long, but do what we did and grab a beer, sit at a slot machine and wait for a break in the crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Very suprised, great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: kpotter_10
Reviews.Content: So, I was really worried about staying here, after reading the reviews. My husband had gotten a killer deal on expedia.com but reading teh reviews on here, one would think it was nothing but trash with roaches pouring out of the walls! However, I couldn't have been more wrong! The line was a mere 30 minutes for check in and the front desk was pleasant. They were not rude at all. Our room was very clean, and updated (I plan on posting my pics tomorrow). Everything seemed new and clean and the bathroom was pretty. Beds and pillows were very comfy! Now, if you are expecting insanely fancy, go somewhere else. These rooms are nice though, no complaints. Housekeeping did a good job. I did read some reviews were people had their rooms broken in to (that is terrible!), but use all your locks! When we left the room we used the safe for our valuables and at night, used the deadbolt and the other locks. I was very happy with our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: jessnhopers
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I took our 1st trip to vegas a couple weeks ago. i booked everything online with ease./ Check in took about 30 min which wasnt bad for the # of people in line. Our room was clean and fairly updated. I was disappointed that we didnt have an in room fridge, but we could have ordered one. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “The best place I have stayed.”
Reviews.Author: tojoego
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at Harrah's very much. I felt safe at all times. The games are great and I feel the machines are fun to play because you can actually win a little or alot.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Harrah's.”
Reviews.Author: dietcoke85
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with ten other friends just returned from a week stay at Harrah's Las Vegas. Most of our group had the delux room with the two flat screen TV's and in room coffee maker in the Mardi Gras tower. The beds were comfy and the room was very clean. We'd be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nightnmare Stay at Harrahs”
Reviews.Author: bonnylass4
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY AT HARRAHS!!! We were robbed in our room at night while we were asleep!! I had my purse stolen, along with my glasses, digital camera, cell phone, credit cards. My husband had his ATM card and cash stolen. ALL WHILE WE SLEPT. The next morning we complained to hotel management and security, none of whom seemed to even care. They fed us a meal but that was about it. We were told there was only 1 security guard on duty at the time. When we got home, we complained to the CEO of Harrahs. He said he'd "investigate" meaning he'd have their third party claims adjuster call us. They have completely denied any claim. We are still losing sleep over this and have suffered mentally as a result. We will NEVER stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Where did the security go?”
Reviews.Author: pendrug
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at this hotel since it was the holiday -- I've always enjoyed it and it's been even better as Harrahs -- but I felt it was a hotel 6 this trip -- no security checking hotel room keys at night -- and there were unsavory people waltzing around our floor hallways one morning we had a pizza coupon under our door!!!!!!!!!! My wife felt very unsafe -- and our food at the Range was a major disappointment for the first time ever. Very bad experience

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: kezfiesta
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in early june. Check in was approx 30 minutes and the front desk were very helpful and gave us a quiet room in the carnaval tower. The rooms are very comfortable. The bed has a mattress topper on and was far comfier than my bed at home. i had no problems sleeping what so ever!!! the mini bar did not work in my room but that was not a problem as I wasnt using it anyway. The water pressure in the showers is excent and great for a 'Power Shower' wake up! The lifts/elevators were always quick and we did not have any problems with them. the most important thing about this hotel is its location. It is located right in the heart of the stip and all hotels are fairly accessible and easy to walk to. There is also a monorail stop on site. The hotel was jumping most nights but not overly crowded. I did feel I could still easily walk around. All in all out of the three hotels I stayed in this trip I would recommend this hotel very very highly. the price is right. The rooms are very clean and accomodating. The staff are helpful and polite. Excellent location. Its not noisy if you ask for a quiet room. Its just great. The only negatives I have are the car park, it goes from level 3 to level 5 with no 4.......go figure. Hubby and I did manage to lose the car but I think that was because of a hangover!

Reviews.Title: “Location! Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Scatterling
Reviews.Content: This has been my second stay at Harrah's and it is just great. We paid $55 per night for the standard room ... what more do you need in a room?? ... two queen beds, TV, and good bathroom. The location of Harah's is right in the middle of the action. The casino is fun with lots of loud tings and music as you win on the slot machines, and Harrah's was part of the great meal deal of $29 for 24 hours of food. The queue was a little long waiting for the buffet area, but was worth the wait, as the food was excellent. We also tried Flamingo's buffet, but not a patch on Harrahs. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Surprised, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Spit
Reviews.Content: Being a Total Rewards member and staying at the other establishments belonging to Harrah's, I was always hesitant about staying here because of the Carnival Court noise when trying to get to sleep. When I checked in I asked about upgrades but was told it would be an extra $$ per night so I stayed with my original room choice. She was very nice and put me in the quiete part of the hotel on the 26th floor. The room was very nice, clean and maid service game every day. The sunrise view I had one morning from my room was awesome, it made my trip and that day I did my best gambling, I won money. The buffet was the best I had eating at the Harrah's property's. I would definatly stay here again. All the employee's I came in contact with were very nice. The only complaint, if any and it was nothing to me, was my trip to the pool one day. The DJ started up and mistakenly said welcome to the Paris pool. No big deal but she could have excused herself and corrected it. They probably rotate the DJ's among the other pools.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay as I Expected”
Reviews.Author: azeddie
Reviews.Content: I had a very nice stay at Harrah's I upgraded to a Deluxe room which was very nicely appointed and the resort's location is fantastic being in the center of the strip. I told the clerk the view as not important so a view of the roof with air conditioners was perfectly fine, but what was important was a comfortable quiet room where I can sleep. My view indeed was of air conditioners on a roof and the room was very comfortable and quiet just what I wanted. Good job on the clerk's part. If you are into buffets Flavor's is an excellent buffet along with the other restaurants in the resort and the Oyster Bar has excellent food an atmosphere. The staff was prompt and courteous and efficient. The piano bar with dueling pianos which seems to be an in thing on the Strip was a favorite and the Carnival Court was fun. In short Harrah's is a good average resort a bit on crowded side for me, but the crowds do add for a good energy to the place.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping could use some work”
Reviews.Author: LovingLasVegas
Reviews.Content: We always stay at Harrah's when we visit Las Vegas due to it's center strip location and decent prices. Normally our stay is pleasant, but this time could've been better. When we first arrived at our room there were dirty dishes and glasses up and down the hallway corridors. There was a large pile of dirty glasses right outside of our door. I moved them further down the hallway. 4 hours later they were still there, even though I had called housekeeping to let them know that they needed to be cleaned up. I also had to ask housekeeping to bring us toilet paper. There were no extra rolls to be found, and the roll that was still on the dispenser had, at the most, 20 squares on it. The hotel stocks drinking glasses in the bathroom. The 2nd day we were there I left the dirty glasses in the sink. When we returned hours later, the room had been cleaned but the dirty glasses were still sitting in the sink. The bathroom floor was filmy and sticky on our 3rd day. I had to clean and disinfect the remote control for the TV. It was covered in some type of ketchupy substance. It was clearly visible to the human eye, so how the housekeeper missed it I'll never know. Please, Harrahs, we want to return to you someday....but not if we have to deal with your lousy housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our choice”
Reviews.Author: auwjol
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrahs for 5 nights in June. Check in was about average. 30min. Front desk help was friendly. Hotel was very easy to find your way around. We stayed in the carnival tower, our room was nice, clean and had a safe we didnt have to pay to use. Surprisingly, thats hard to find in vegas. The elevators are fast, never had to wait more than a couple seconds. The water pressure was the best I ve ever had in a hotel. The maid service was excellent and even called when we left our , do not disturb, sign on. The slots payed better than any other hotel on the strip and off the strip, and trust me we tryed them all. The buffett was the best one we tryed. we have stayed at many hotels on the strip and this is, hands down, our favorite. The location cant be beat and its not pretentious feeling, like the higher end hotels. I hate pretentious places or people. Rented a car at the hotel and it was a very fast and easy process. Had a great time, cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location....~!”
Reviews.Author: SRBox
Reviews.Content: I am a veteran Vegas traveler. I go several times a year and have stayed at Harrah's more times than I can count. In comparison to other hotels, it is not as glamorous, spacious or gawdy, etc. If I am on a 4-day trip and I am briging someone who has never been, it is typical that they want to stay at a more glitzy hotel of which I comply and split the trip evenly - 2 days at their choice and 2 days at Harrah's.
