Every time, they wish we were back at Harrah's. You can not beat the location. You walk outside and you see the Mirage volcano across the street, next door to the Venetian, and across the street from Caesar's. The Range Steakhouse is highly recommended (even if not staying there) and the Carnival Court is ok if you like a bit of partying, which is immediately outside. It just depends on what you want. If you are looking for gorgeous pools and a completely themed hotel, this is not the place for you. If you are looking for location vs. price, you can not beat it. You can find cheaper hotels that are nicer but there is a reason Harrah's room rates are not the lowest. I split my trip up at Harrah's and the Luxor & Mandalay Bay. It was dead at that end of the strip and the hotels are so huge, they are not in walking distance, which proves to be a drag. It is my go-to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “View from a wheelchair”
Reviews.Author: Affe
Reviews.Content: This review is based on wheelchair accessibility ONLY (rating, too). LOCATION Excellent, right in the middle of the Strip. Consider that walking distances in Las Vegas are pretty long (even to get from your room to the street). COMMON AREAS All areas are accessible. ROOM (handicap room no. 2029) This room has a partial strip view. Of course it is carpeted. It has a bathroom with low bathtub. They also have handicap rooms with roll-in shower. STAFF HELPFULNESS Average. GENERAL RATING (not related to accessibility) Excellent price/quality ratio. Excellent buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Polite Staff, Clean Rooms & Perfect Location = Excellent Value for Money!”
Reviews.Author: Lizzie1570
Reviews.Content: I stayed for my first trip to Las Vegas at Harrah's Hotel, and I am glad we chose to stay there. The Hotel may not seem as huge and grand as it's neighbour; Caesars' Palace, but an attractive foyer and reception impressed us on first arrival. A swift check-in by a friendly and laid-back receptionist, then we easily found our rooms with the good sign-posts, and weren't looking around for ages like in some other big hotels. The rooms were great! Fantastic memory foam-like mattresses, soo soo comfy! Better than my own bed at home! We stayed in a Double Deluxe room, which my Fiance and I thought would have just one double bed in it, but wow we had two! one each!! spoilt! Coffee facilites, hairdrier and complimentary shower gel and soap, a flat screen tv and plenty of storage space made it a comfy retreat from the bustling busy strip. The Cafe at Harrahs' was our favourite choice for breakfast, my Fiance recommends the "four aces and a kicker" off the menu (hash browns, eggs, bacon, pancakes) with a big cup of coffee to start your day in Vegas. Handy tip for us British people, when asking for a cup of tea, ask for hot tea, as otherwise some places will serve you iced tea! Go to the piano bar one night at harrah's it was a good laugh. My Fiance and I ordered room service a few times and wow it was gorgeous food brought to us on a silver trolley with flowers and a butler! Fantastic service, what a treat! We ate one night in Bally's chinese restaurant - avoid. They don't serve alcohol in there for starters (?) and the food gave me and my family bad stomach's! Don't miss out on visiting Caesars Palace Colliseum shops, and eat at Planet Hollywood, the portions are huge but the food is sooo good! Lastly, don't miss out on the Bellagio fountains, soo romantic (that is where my Fiance proposed!!) and if on when you are visiting, go to the Titanic exhibition in the Luxor, and the Shark Reef at Mandalay Bay. The only reason I would not give this hotel 5* is that the outside Carnival bar played very loud music until 3am every night, but hey it's vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: Samanta71
Reviews.Content: I just got back today from a 4 day stay at Harrah's, from the time I arrived here until the time I got back home I was treated very well by everyone I came in contact with. Since I was traveling alone for the first time to Vegas I had asked the clerk at check in if I could have a room near the elevator. She upgraded me to a room in the Marti gras tower. I had a third floor room with easy access to the elevator. The room was neat and clean, not as big as some of the ones I've stayed in at other hotels but I didn't care. I didn't plan on spending alot of time in the room anyway. It had a nice flat panel tv in the main room and a small flat panel in the bathroom (I never turned it on) The slots were much better at Harrah's compared to the 8 near by casinos I checked out. The $1.00 blazing 7's were awesome, I had so much fun there, that was were I spent most of my slot play. I played enough on my winnings to be comped for most of my meals. I tried the buffet, was ok for breakfast but I didn't much care for the dinner buffet. The Range steakhouse was great, I enjoyed the blackened prime rib. I also ate breakfast at the Cafe, it was good and the lines weren't as long as the buffet lines. All the hotel employees were great, friendly, helpful., didn't have to look for the drink waitress. They came around regularly. I am a woman in my 50's and I decided to make this trip solo, I wasn't sure how I'd feel about it, but it was great! I felt safe the entire time I was there. I would recommend Harrah's to anyone looking for a good time in Vegas, and any other women out there that are thinking of traveling to Vegas alone but were unsure about it. I am going back next year and will definately staying at Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you read the fine print!”
Reviews.Author: CurlyMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights at Harrahs. Great location in the middle of the strip,room was recently refurbished, good beds and quiet except for the idiot car alarms going off in the middle of the night. One reason we chose Harrahs was the internet advertised in every room. No mention in the room description that there would be a fee of almost $12 a day!!! Also no coffee machine, the "minibar" is locked - and if you try to put your own drinks etc. in there you will pay! When I discussed these with the manager (mid 30's, rude, arrogant and very skilled in handling complaining customers - must get plenty of practice) the basic message I got was "you are getting a cheap rate for the room - now we are going to screw you for the rest". I made the booking through Hotel.com.au - their response to my complaint about the internet charge was met with "yes! we said there was an internet connection but we didn't say it was free" I have now used them twice - first and last! Moral of the story - if you are an inexperienced traveler, make sure you read the fine print, ask questions, don't assume ANYTHING. Other people may not have the same attitude to honesty in advertising that you do.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone is entitiled to an opinion - here's mine”
Reviews.Author: myblackdog
Reviews.Content: We recently enjoyed a 5 day, 6 night visit to Las Vegas. I had researched the hotels and chose Harrah's as giving a good "bang for the buck". I was a little hesitant because of some of the very negative reviews I had read here. We were completely satisfield. Not luxurious, but we didn't go to Las Vegas to spend out time in a hotel room. We had a comfortable, CLEAN spacious room. Non smoking as requested. No view (daytime) but nighttime was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “not great”
Reviews.Author: mr711lucky
Reviews.Content: arrived at 11:00 am (after six hour flight from east cost )but could not check in, could not upgrade, desk cleark was rude at best. Had to check back every hour to see if we could check in. checked in at 5:00 pm so there was my day shot to hell. Room was 2445 in the Carnival tower, not a updated room. Mini bar had warning about touching anything you would be charged, but was empty, must have been broken. Room was not that clean, beds sucked bad nights of lack of sleep. View of the Mirage. Ate at Toby's was very good, great service, also tried the cafe, was ok, but food was cold and the price was way to high - $50 for breakfast for two and the service was as cold as the food. These are the only two places we ate at harrahs The casino was smokey and not great, had no vibe to it. Did not want to even gamble there at the end of a long day out and about. Slots were old The Carnvial court is a zoo on friday and saturday night, makes getting in and out of the hotel a real pain Had Sunday brunch ar belgio, was great 5 years ago but now at $77.00 was a big disappointment. Saw Terry Fator at the mirage, was great!!!, also saw Cher, was very good. Did atv valley of fire tour with adventure tours was great!!!!!!!. also did hummer tour with rebel tours was ok. Went to Laughlin as well was a good day away from the strip Check out was a pain, one clerk working at 7:00 am, long line I complained loudly and another clerk showed up. I noticed very long check in lines every afternoon. I do not think I would stay here again, last year I stayed at harrahs poor sister imperial palace, yes it is a dump but was a much better stay. Most of the harrahs staff I dealt with were rude and did not care at all

Reviews.Title: “Okay for Comp - But I would't pay to stay”
Reviews.Author: travellbugge
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night comp at Harrah's. I asked if the room was nice and the front desk personal told me that if I wanted to upgrade to the Mardi Gras rooms it would cost us $20.00. So we opted. These are newer rooms. The room was clean, usual sized standard room, but still has seen some wear and tear. Make sure you get a room where you cannot hear the band late at night. The front desk was helpful with that. The hallways also have some wear and tear. But, if you are getting comped there - upgrade and everything should be fine. I wouldn't pay to stay here however - there are much nicer places. We stayed the other two nights - comped - at Bally's. We upgraded for again $20.00 to stay in the newer North Tower. Large, clearn, nice rooms. Nicer then Harrah's. I would pay at Bally's as long as they were offering a deal. The casino at Harrah's has low ceiling. and is darker and older then Bally's. Bally's is brighter, cleaner and seriously nice. More to offer at Bally's

Reviews.Title: “I've been in nicer Holiday Inn rooms”
Reviews.Author: GloeyBolingbrook_IL
Reviews.Content: I asked for a newer room and was refused. Walls were paper thin, neighbors kept us up all night, so loud you would think they were in the same room. For the price, I would stay again, but if I found a better deal, bye bye.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: BoboToronto
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 2:00 am and waited over 30 minutes to check in. We were told that the they had overbooked the non smoking rooms and that they would upgrade us to a better room. This would have been fine, but not only was the upgraded room something out of the 1970's, but we had to check out after the first night. We had a convention to attend the next day so this was a huge inconvience. I did complain to the manager and was upgraded us to a renovated room in the Mardi-gra tower. I do not remember her name, but she was professional and helpfull. The renovated rooms are very small and needed a good cleaning. As with other reviews, you can hear toilets flushing and doors slamming at all hours. If you like the smell of cigarette smoke, this casino is for you. This may be typical of the older casinos, but they need to upgrade their ventilation system. Hotel does have an excellent location, but needs a mega makeover. Bottom line, we only paid $59/night and got exactly what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Harrahs”
Reviews.Author: JuneandChris
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrahs for 6 nights from 23/04/10 in a carinval tower room, it was fab.The room was very spacious and clean. Maid service was excellent, hotel staff very friendly. TJ's show at the piano bar from 6-9pm is not to be missed. We can recommend the Range restaurant and the Champagne Brunch is very special at Flavours Buffet. There's nothing negative to say about this hotel. The location, staff, rooms and enetertainment are all ace, Will return asap June and Chris from Scotland

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cindee2
Reviews.Content: clean rooms , queit , great location. what more can i say!

Reviews.Title: “Fine if you aren't too picky about a clean room”
Reviews.Author: scgirlmw
Reviews.Content: If we didn't get comped, I probably wouldn't stay here again. The room was fairly small and cramped and not clean. Apparently the maid has never heard of dusting. Sure there is a flat screen in the bathroom but the cord to the flat screen had about 3 inches of dust on it. I used my own colorx wipes on the tub and sink and they picked up a lot of dirt. After a long wait to check in (on a Thursday!) we finally get to the room and the bathroom only has two small lights in it - one was out. We called for a new bulb and after an hour and multiple trips (turns out the bulb wasn't the problem), maintenance said the light was fixed but it never worked properly the whole trip. Our upgraded and remodeled room had stains on the carpet, a big crack in the tub and what looked like tread marks on the walls - maybe somebody was bored and trying to run up the walls? Who knows! Another fun part was that we were told we were in the Mardi Gras Tower BUT if you are in that tower on floors 5 or 6 they have a sign posted that you have to use the elevators for the other tower to get to your room. Huh? One would think they might tell the people at registration this so they wouldn't send us the wrong way. According to the bellman, this is not something new. Anyway, stayed in much better rooms before! I Love This Bar had good food at a reasonable price but the coffee shop food was slow and cold. The cocktail service at the tables and slots was fairly good and most of the dealers were friendly. I might gamble here again but not stay.

Reviews.Title: “Been here and for the price is okay”
Reviews.Author: TNLZ
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this property is it's locatoin. Room quality is okay/fair. The location enables you to tap into the nearby hotel casinos. Enjoyed the Spa services and gym. Smells like smoke everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: CasinoGirl32
Reviews.Content: It's not one of the most fanciest casinos on the strip, but they certainly make up for it in customer service. Check in was a breeze and VIP services called me every night to make sure everything was up to par (which it was). Great waitress service, someone comes up to you within 2 minutes of sitting at a machine to ask you what you would like and returns with your drink in less than 5 minutes! Wonderful staff - upon sitting down at the machine my first day there, I was welcomed by an attendant and was told that if I needed anything, he would be happy to help! Central location on the strip, which makes travel up and down the strip fast and easy. Never used the monorail, love to walk up and down to see all the sights and enjoy the weather. Definitely recommend the 24 hour buffet pass - well worth the money! It is good at all of the Harrah's properties. If you don't want to wear the wristband, just get a player's card and they will apply it to your account. I've stayed at New York New York, Caesar's Palace and Imperial Palace (a dump) - this is my favorite by far! Down to earth, comfortable and friendly casino. Will stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another great trip with the GirlFriends”
Reviews.Author: girlsfromVancouver
Reviews.Content: I'm starting to lose count of the trips the girlfriends have done, but gotta say Harrah's was awesome again.We called down to the hotel to get ajoining rooms but with regret they could't fulfill our request so they udgraded our rooms, which we're very comfortable clean and really close to the elevators.Gambling was great saw lots of winners one lady won $9180.00 on a penny machine another a $1000.00 also on a penny machine.Drinks came really fast just tip your waitress and she's there every 10 mins. the bigger hotels you can wait up to 1/2 hr to get a drink will gambling. The buffet coupon that's new $29.99 eat at 6 differant hotel buffets for as much as you want in a 24 hour period is great value!!!!!!! Going back in October will stay at Harrah's or the Flamingo whatever one that has the best deal there right in the middle of the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Price”
Reviews.Author: habsfan44
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a stay at Harrah's Las Vegas. It was a cheap option for my friend and I (we are students) and I am happy with the stay. The rooms were clean and the Mardi Gras Tower was newly renovated. It can be a little noisy at night... but the balcony door did a great job of blocking out the sound. It is in a great location, close to lots of food and ease to walk around. My one big con for this hotel is the smoke in the casino. I'm Canadian.. so I'm not used to smoke in public places... so I found vegas very smokey. However, most casino's didn't bother me because they have such high ceilings and are really spaced out. Harrah's casino does not have this high roof/spaced out luxury. Therefore I found our casino made me sneeze and made my eyes hurt way more than any other. That's pretty much my only real con of Harrah's, although when we walked around.. we did marvel in the beauty of every other hotel along the strip. But for a quick get away for a cheap rate... it definitely did the trick!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: iwannagotovegas
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. Room had been renovated so was fresh and clean. View was nothing to brag about, but that wasnt a deal breaker for us. Quick elevators and easy to get to the street. Casino was busy at all hours. Ate twice at the Cafe and was very good with ample portions. Only complaint would be lack of hotel staff at check-in. Probably waited about 30mins. We loved everything and would go back for sure. Fantastic value..even better location. Carnaval Court bar is one of the best bars... check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Old, & dingy hotel with claustrophobic casino, cental location is the only thing going for it.”
Reviews.Author: travelson
Reviews.Content: Buffet bracelet for 24 hours with shared casinos is the best deal on the strip only Harrahs Buffet "Flavors" is the worst of the lot. Requested late check out the day before & was told I would have to talk to the day of shift in the morning, called at 7:20 A.M. told to talk to next shift starting at 8 but give them a little time to get organized so call back around 8:30 - 9;00. Front Desk was overwhelmed with people checking out on Sunday A.M. so they didn't answere the phone. I bought a beer early morning hour from the casino bar & the tender triedt the old "6 dollars from 10" routine, since I had just given him a $20. I know the slots are a rippoff but does the staff have to get into the act? Will NEVER return. Maid did a good job on the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: robwvu
Reviews.Content: Getting around the Strip on foot isn't as easy as it sounds. There are tons of crowds and, even if you are only going a few hotels away, each one is about like a city block. Given that, Harrah's is in the perfect location to hit the maximum number of sites in short order. The hotel itself was very clean. of course they talked us into shelling out the additional $15 per night for the upgrade, so the rooms were nice enough - even had a flat screen in the bathroom. It was a really good middle-of-the-road option. It wasn't nearly as expensive as Ceasar's or TI, but the quality was way above budget. The casino had mid-to-high entry points, so we gambled next door at Casino Royale.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price...would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Snowstomper
Reviews.Content: This is actually our third time staying at Harrah's in Las Vegas. We love this hotel because of it's price and it's location. You just can't beat being in the middle of the strip, and it's a plus to have Harrah's on the monorail stop. The rooms are nothing fancy, but they are clean and comfy. We stayed in the Mardi Gras tower room 1163. It was quiet at night, but our view was nothing but roof tops. Oh well, not like we planned on sitting in our room staring out the window any ways!! The service at the hotel was good, and all of the staff that we encountered were friendly. We only ate at the Flavors buffet once for breakfast, and it was fine. Again, nothing fancy but just a good buffet. We certainly did not leave hungry. As stated above, we love that Harrahs is right on the monorail stop and we used that several times throughout our trip. All in all, we would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good place to stay on the strip. If you are looking for something ritzy, then this isn't the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel...VERY noisy”
Reviews.Author: vulcanvacations
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at Harrahs for a convention we were attending in Las Vegas. First of all, the hotel is clean, okay rooms, the main resteraunt there is good and we had Burgers from Toby Keiths resteraunt as well and they were good. Pool is VERY small, but there is a large area with chairs in it so that was good. Service at the pool is really good, but the drinks at the pool were expensive for a place like Harrahs. My main complaint about this hotel is the noise. The walls are very thin. You can hear people talking, using the washroom, etc all the time. When people were in the hall it was very noisy. I'm a travel agent and try and go to a differnt hotel every time I go to Las Vegas, and this is a good budget hotel if you don't mind being woke up all the time from the noise. I wouldn't pay more than $80/night for this place so be aware. They advertise on their website that their weekend rate is $175/night. Not worth that. You can stay in a much nicer hotel on the strip for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice older property”
Reviews.Author: hhsdlh
Reviews.Content: All was very nice except elevators were not working properly one day resulting in very long delays. Missed not having coffee in room

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: tdub24
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Harrahs was quite enjoyable and I would certainly recommend it as a moderately priced hotel in a great location on the strip. We had a basic room in the Carnival Tower, which was a typical (simple styled) hotel room - a couple comfy queen beds, a sitting area, an old style TV in a large double closet cabinet and a older style bathroom. Important part of it all, was that is was clean and a decent size. Service at the hotel was good. Most of the staff were friendly. The house keepers were the most impressive with smiles and "hellos" everytime we saw any of them. Bar service was good. The only restaurant we ate at was the buffet and it was quite good. Lots of choice and well priced (make sure you get coupons). The casino was active and offered everything one could want with regard to gambling but then they all do in the area. One of the best spots to be entertained in the hotel was the piano bar where there is a dualing piane act starring two gorgeous blondes. They were very entertaing, along with the guy that spotted them off for breaks. Probably our best night in Vegas was spent there. All in all, we had a great time at Harrahs! We will return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spring57_10
Reviews.Content: We are are in our middle 50's and my son and girlfriend came along with us. This was their first trip to Vegas. My son thought this hotel was just perfect for them with the Carnival court right outside of the hotel and also with being in the center of the strip it was close to all the hotels. Our room was very large and nice and clean the bed was very comfortable. We found all the staff very helpful and friendly. We checked into our room as soon as we arrived which was noon. My son and girlfriend had to come back at 4:00 when their room was ready. Great trip had a wonderful time we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: soccerocker90
Reviews.Content: Nothing to rave about as most reviews have said. Decent and clean rooms/bathrooms. Slept comfortably. Excellent location in the heart of the strip. Front desk seemed overworked and not in a mood to make guests feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location - hated the pool”
Reviews.Author: CC_Cali
Reviews.Content: There were many things to like about our stay at Harrah's. They allowed us to check-in early (1:00pm) and the woman at front desk reception was very friendly. After reading some of the reviews here regarding noise, we requested a room that would be quiet and that's what we got (other than the room's air conditioner, which was quite loud...but no street or carnaval court noise). The bed was comfortable. I like having the room safe as well. The location was perfect - exactly where we wanted to be...we didn't have to drive anywhere and the monorail station was a plus. Unfortunately one of the reasons we picked Harrah's over other similarly priced hotels in that vicinity is because we wanted a hotel with a pool, but their pool area was unappealing (feels run-down), strangely laid out (there wasn't much seating area near the pool itself, then a big "sunning" area away from the pool) and the music was REALLY annoying and loud. If you like loud thumping base, when you're relaxing by the pool then maybe you'll like it, but we sure didn't. The only other thing that surprised me was that there is no security on access to the room towers (but to be fair I'm not sure how common this is). I'd go ahead and recommend the hotel to some...just depends on what you're looking for.

Reviews.Title: “wot a great hotel very central and a great base”
Reviews.Author: bubblesfife
Reviews.Content: after reading reviews, there was 8 of us 4 couples, we could not fault this hotel. one of the smaller hotels but you had no problem getting out of it not like some of the bigger ones. if you are looking for a base and a clean room harrahs is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. No complaints.”
Reviews.Author: loverofchocolate
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Las Vegas so I wasn't sure where to stay. I had originally booked the Flamingo but then found a deal for Harrahs. I was debating between the two but went with Harrahs as some Flamingo reviews mentioned that it was very big and that it could take a while to check in and get to your room. I had no such problems with Harrahs. I was given a room in the Mardi Gras Tower and it was great. It was a short walk through the casino out to the street and there were only two people infront of me when I was checking in and out. All the staff I came across were friendly and helpful. The room was clean, spacious, quiet and wasn't outdated. There were nicer casinos in other hotels but they were only a short walk away. I had heard that the casino could be smokey and I was worried about that as I hate smoke but I didn't notice it at all. The location in the middle of the strip is great and I had a view of the Mirage Volcano from the room. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: cdandersib
Reviews.Content: Last October 2009, my mother, who turned 82 while in Vegas, my oldest sister, my twin boys, 20 years old at the time, and myself, stayed at Harrahs and had a blast. We try to visit Vegas at least once per year, but this was the first time for my twins. I had always wanted to take them to Vegas, but never the right time. Travel times like these are unforgettable because you never know, it might be the last trip as such for many. Harrahs has always been great to my mother and my sister, who gamble and stay at Harrahs all over the country. I must say, it keeps my mother young at heart. The food was great along with the courteous employees. Our trip to Vegas was a trip that my twin boys, Cody and Dusty, will never forget, especialy since my mother, Hazel Hughes, turned 82 while in your fabulous city. I advise anyone to visit the city, along with Harrahs, for an unforgettable experience. Thanks so much. D. Anderson

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding bar service! Wow!”
Reviews.Author: bellabullets
Reviews.Content: We did not stay here, but spend a LOT of time here because our hotel (the Sahara), was pretty blah. So right off the bat, I can't comment on the rooms. We loved this place! The bartenders are absolutely top notch here at Harrah's. Believe me, I frequented many bars and came in contact with many bartenders in Vegas during our stay, and Harrah's has the best. If you're looking for a FANTASTIC time at night, hit up the Carnival bar, which is outside. Talk about fun! We didn't get over charged on any of our drinks, and the quality is just unbeatable. Trust me on this one, folks. If you're looking for a fun party atmosphere on your Vegas trip, you need to spend a LOT of time at Harrah's!

Reviews.Title: “If you want your wallets and cell phones stolen, by all means stay at Harrahs”
Reviews.Author: jenhen1918
Reviews.Content: This was our very first family vacation EVER. My adult children accompanied us along with another couple and their adult child. Two of the boys had recently turned 21 and the other boy is 25. My husband had promised them that we would go to Las Vegas when our youngest was 21. So we hooked up with another family with a son who had just turned 21 as well. In fact it was his birthday present! Some present it turned out to be! We arrived on Friday April 2, checked in to 3 rooms. One for each couple and one for the 3 boys. We did some sight seeing, ate dinner, went to see downtown Vegas. We came back about 9:30 pm. Myself and my older son went back to our respective rooms and to bed by 10pm. The other boys and fathers were down in the casino gambling. My husband and the other father came up to the rooms around midnight. They had just been with the boys checking on them before they came up. One of them was alone at a blackjack table with a pile of chips in front of him..Both boys had had a couple drinks but were not intoxicated. They came up to the rooms around 1 am. There were two other men in the elevator with them when they came up. (They didnt think anything of it at the time, and it is maybe significant, or maybe not.) My oldest son had been in the room sleeping since 10 pm. At 1:45 his alarm clock on his phone went off by mistake..he hadnt shut it off from back home.....All the boys woke up at that time. Then went back to sleep. When they woke up at 7 am the next morning, their wallets, and cell phones were GONE. Sometime between the alarm going off and 7 am when they woke up someone had entered their room. All 3 wallets and 2 of their cell phones had been stolen...one cell phone was on the floor and not visible. All their credit cards, cash and photo id's were gone. We notified hotel security, who came up to take the report....who told us this was rare. Dont believe you!!!! As the process moved along it became clear that they were not going to accept any liability in this matter and that they were blaming the boys for not using the deadbolt latch. They even went as far as to accuse them of leaving the door ajar. Which by the way is impossible even if you let the door shut from one inch away it closes securely and locks. They were asked why they didnt use the safe.....DUH Because they were IN THE ROOM!! About an hour and 1/2 later a security guard found 2 of the 3 wallets in a trash can on the first floor...of course emptied of the important stuff. Proof that someone had taken and disposed of them. We needed to file an official police report so that the boys could have proof that their id's had been stolen in order to get back on the plane to come home. We were then sent on a wild goose chase to a Las Vegas Police substation. It cost us $60 to get there and when we did IT WAS CLOSED!! Then we had to go to the airport to file the police report. Finally we found the police to make the report. The police there told us that this happened all the time. Hmmm I thought it was rare, according to Harrah's Another hour and half of our vacation wasted. By the time they were through with the reports we were all starving...soooo we ended up eating lunch in the airport of all places...just what I've always dreamed of. WOW what a great vacation. The hotel did not offer to comp the boys room or offer us a free meal or anything. We insisted that they move them out of that room and they did do that much. We were given phone numbers to call when we got home and led to believe that there was going to be an investigation and a detailed report. We have tried to call several times and Security tells us to cal Risk Management and vice versa. The hotel manager was no help either. Every one is passing the buck, That is what is most disturbing!! This was Felony Theft not to mention an unauthorized person in our childrens room. What if they had been hurt? Wow it all just gives me the creeps!!! Bottom line--I will NEVER stay at that or any other property owned by Harrahs and you shouldn't either. Their disposition and excuses and blaming totally ruined our first family vacation experience...

Reviews.Title: “Average, Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: XNAGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's since it was the official hotel of Monster Jam World Finals. It was convenient for us only because the shuttle buses took us to Sam Boyd Stadium from next door's Imperial Palace. This hotel is just average. It reminded me of a Comfort Inn or Holiday Inn. The pros: Good location, smaller casino, front desk was helpful and got us into the room quickly. The cons: Hotel is outdated, ceilings are low, the casino is small, no glitz or glamour, the rate was very high the weekend we were there. The casino was smoked filled. Toby Keith's restaurant is loud and overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot Complain”
Reviews.Author: mgkendra
Reviews.Content: Overall, nothing exciting or terrible about this hotel. Best things to say were clean and comfortable room in a good location. Many other hotels/casinos in walking distance. Worst thing to say was 35 minutes to check-in; NASCAR weekend but only 4 people behind desk to check you in on Thursday afternoon. I was in Vegas for NASCAR weekend (Thurs Feb 25 thru Sun Feb 28). I was offered three free nights from many of the Harrah’s properties and selected Harrahs since I never stayed at this hotel before. NASCAR weekend is one of the top 5 busiest weekends in Vegas. I arrive to Harrahs and there is a long line of people waiting to be checked in. I had to wait 35 minutes in line for one of the 4 check-in receptionists. Why only 4 people behind the counter on one of the busiest weekend, I just do not know. Luckily the couple behind me was NASCAR fans (in fact most all people in the line were) and we struck up a conversation so the 35 minutes was not too painful. I took the elevator to floor 6 and then to my room. The room was a standard with two beds, tube TV, small table with two chairs. The bathroom was pretty generic, tub/shower combo, that needed some updating. Overall, nothing to complain about the room; I just want a clean and comfortable room to throw my bag down, sleep and take a shower. Maid service was good and there was a safe in the room that did not charge a usage fee (as does Bally’s). I used the express check-out and had no unexpected room charges. The casino was okay. They have 14 foot craps tables (did not see any minimum lower than $10; always 3-4-5 x odds) and some blackjack tables paid 3:2 on blackjack. I did not play any slots since I do not care for slots but mostly I have read that Harrah’s slots are really tight. The casino is a bit worn and can use a face lift, but I have seen worse casino atmospheres than this.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value at Harrahs”
Reviews.Author: meholder
Reviews.Content: For a little background my husband and I traveled with his brother and his wife. They travel to Las Vegas at least once a year and our rooms were comped on their Total Rewards accounts so I can't really comment on the price of the rooms as we didn't pay for them. We had the basic room level in the Carnival tower which was perfect. Our view was of the Mardi Gras Tower and The Mirage. You could also see Treasure Island and the Venetian off to the side. It was clean and the beds were comfortable. We weren't fans of the pillows so if that's important to you you might want to consider bringing your own. They were feather pillows and got very flat when you put your head on them I prefer more support than that but my brother in law loves them and that's part of why they keep going back to Harrah's. It's sort of a personal preference thing but thought I would mention it. The only other thing I'll mention and by no means did this ruin our trip but while we rarely heard anything coming from the hallway or other rooms the noise coming from the windows was surprisingly loud. It's almost like they spent a lot of money on soundproofing the rooms but put in windows that aren't soundproofed at all. For example we were on the 12th floor but could hear people talking down below and one morning woke up to a semi backing up...beep beep beep at about 5 a.m. My brother in law's room however looked over the pool and Carnival Court and they could hear music bumping until about 4 a.m. so I am not complaining about the street noise at all. If you are a very light sleeper or this will bother you you might want to take ear plugs or do some research on a room that would be the quietest and request it. Otherwise the hotel was great with a perfect location right in the middle of the strip across the street from Caesar's Palace. We ate in the Cafe in Harrahs once and the food was good - not amazing but good. We also ate dinner at The Range one night and that was amazing. Very good food - great steaks. I had the wedge salad and the Peking Duck Confit from the appetizer menu and it was delicious and the perfect amount of food. My husband had the filet and it was cooked to perfection and so tender you could cut it with a butter knife. It is a little pricey but still worth it in my opinion. We also ordered room service for breakfast one morning and that was very good as well but pretty expensive but that's to be expected for room service. We aren't big gamblers but I played some slots and my husband played a little blackjack. We both won a little money but neither of us played enough to get anything comped. We ended up in the dueling piano bar one night. I'm not sure if it was late enough that they stopped charging a cover (we got there about midnight) or if they didn't charge that particular night but we paid no cover to get in. It was very entertaining but if you are sensitive about dirty or "adult" jokes you might not find it entertaining. We really wanted to make it to Toby Keith's bar and the buffet, but didn't make it. Maybe next time! If you have any questions feel free to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping great & friendly. Some at front desk rude.”
Reviews.Author: OregonHoot
Reviews.Content: We arrived at about 10:30 PM. My brother & his wife were given a room right away. We were told our room would not be ready until midnight. The lady we dealt with was very nice so we let it go. But MIDNIGHT! That was the last good encounter I had with the front desk. We had to come back to pick up our keys we couldn't get them at that time. So I spent another 10 minutes in line to pick up our keys. Our flight out was not until late afternoon so I called for a late checkout. We were refused and rudely at that. We packed up & were out of room before 11:00AM. We went to the front desk to check out & find out where they store your luggage. Wrong move. I'm pretty sure the lady I talked to was the same one as the one I asked for a late checkout. She was incredibly rude to us. She did not want to deal with us. We did find out about luggage storage but I went back to our room & called for a checkout. Though the rest of our stay was fine the front desk ruined it for us. Housekeeping were great & friendly. We had a plumbing problem & they had someone up to our room right away. The front desk could learn something from the housekeeping staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Management acts like High Schoolers.”
Reviews.Author: Newbie10108
Reviews.Content: I was attempting to check-in my hotel room on a trip I have been looking forward to for months! After a few clicks on the computer, the nice front desk agent excused herself. I wonder what the problem was...ten minutes later a "Hotel Operations Manager" named Sal came out. He was already walking arrogant before approaching me. I had to read his name of his name tag because he never introduced himself to me nor greeted me. Just informed me that they gave away my room to a different "VIP" guest. He smirked as he said it as if he was proud of it. I asked if there was another room type like mine available. He rolled his eyes and typed in the computer and then smiled and said "no...there doesn't appear to be anything in here for you." The old guy was getting a kick out of making me, a diamond guest, look like a no-body. I hate to see what this guy does to normal, off the street, hotel guests. If I get this type of rude treatment, and I am a long time loyal...wait...excuse me.... former loyal Harrah's guest, no one is safe. Rooms were mild if anything else. Bugs everywhere. Dirty sheets and dirty bathroom. I called down and, lucky me, I got Sal again. He said he would send someone up to clean my room. No one ever came. So I slept in used sheets that night. The morning came and I checked out early to go over to MGM. Thanks Sal!

Reviews.Title: “Not trying very hard to keep customers...”
Reviews.Author: Redi2go68
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel a few times over the past few years and this recent stay may be the last. Some of the improvements that were made now less than great. Room prices make the hotel quite busy but you get what you pay for...not much. We had an incident with housekeeping that was handled poorly.Security is a bit lacking.

Reviews.Title: “couldnt pick a better place”
Reviews.Author: EricM10
Reviews.Content: was a wonderful place to stay,was clean the room was big and the hotel is well taken care of for being an older hotel and casino

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE - ENERGY WAS INSANE -- EVERYONE WAS GREAT”
Reviews.Author: LETITRIDE99
Reviews.Content: Great place from check in to leaving -- Booked a classic room with comps and paid an additional 10 dollars a night for strip view -- That was our only mistake -- was not really a view and could have saved 50 dollars -- Room was very clean and quiet - Was there for five nights of March Madness. Ate in Toby Keith's once , decent food at a reasonable price -- didn't eat anywhere else in Harrah's -- Really enjoyed the Piano bar -- There was a 5 dollar cover charge to enter - which we were willing to pay, but was so crowded couldn't get in - Stood by an open window outside where they had a rolling bar set up listening to the music, and singing along just the same ! All in all everyone at Harrah's was very nice and understanding -- Let us check in at 10 am for no extra charge, even though we were told by a telephone operator a week earlier that we couldn't even buy a guaranteed early check in ... Met some nice friendly people (staff and other guests) -- and had a blast !

Reviews.Title: “Great Time & Great Rates”
Reviews.Author: goindians2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends and had an excellent time and couldn't beat the price for the location. Got an excellent rate from www.casinoresorttravel.com. Staff was very friendly and the pit bosses had a great sense of humor. Never had a problem finding a cocktail waitress either. Will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “surpassed expectations”
Reviews.Author: naturekid
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews here, I half expected some issues of some sort or another, starting at the check in. quite the opposite. they offered to upgrade our $40 a night "classic" rooms to 700 sq ft jacuzzi suites for $50 extra a night. heck ya. $90 a night for a las vegas jacuzzi suite on the 35th floor? you'd be crazy not to. they were very nice, in the carenival tower, and newely remodeled. could still smell the paint. check the photos. All the staff was friendly, cocktail waitresses were attentive, and the dealers and pit bosses in the party pit were really fun (and patient with the drunks). as far as the building being old and shabby as stated elsewhere, sure it's no palazzo or wynn, but I didn't see anything shockingly rundown. It is a 30 yr old mid-range casino that offers $40 a night rooms, so I don't know what the negative reviews are expecting. Also keep in mind, people are much more likely to complain than to praise. unfortunately one bad experience can mentally ruin an entire vacation for people. I would have no problem reommending this hotel to anyone who asks. One last thing, don't get suckered into upgrading to merely a "strip" (luxury) view room. the towers are set back from the strip and the central location, you'll never get a very good view. try the Rio if you want a true strip view.

Reviews.Title: “Great as long as you don't expect The Bellagio”
Reviews.Author: steveskin1
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 4 night stay at Harrah's with my brother who was a Vegas Virgin. I heard of noise being an issue with an outdoor courtyard with live music, and asked for a quiet room. We were assigned room 2357 in the Carnival Tower. The safe was left shut by the previous guest, but someone came up about a half hour later to open it. We could see most of the Mirage and some of the parking deck and adjacent tower. The room was very clean on arrival and kept that way throughout the stay. The bed was very comfortable as well. The Midstrip location can't be beat. I've gambled and eaten at this property before, and as always, service was great. We hit the buffet at the end of breakfast one morning, and it left a little to be desired. There is the usual Vegas surcharges for the mini-bar, internet access and to use the spa. I consider myself a regular guy, and felt very comfortable here, unlike high end places such as The Venetian and Wynn. The only thing I didn't like was the noise level within the hotel. When a toilet flushed in the next room, it sounded like a 747 taking off. There's a lot of airport noise as well as street traffic. This being Vegas, some guests can be noisy when returning to their room late at night. After one night I used earplugs, and it helped make sleep easier. If you're looking for a nice pool, don't stay here because its very small and plain. In fact, it was still closed. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to almost everyone looking for a mid priced hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain Rooms - Great Location - Sweet Deal!”
Reviews.Author: nbk2
Reviews.Content: We booked through Expedia and stayed at Harrah's Las Vegas for 4 nights. The total room bill was $265. Check in was a breeze - and the clerk told us if the noise was too loud to let her know and we could move (we weren't too far from the live music that plays outside until 2 a.m.). Absolutely no problem with noise -- we could barely hear the music. Very quet room - our room was great -- recently updated (ask for an updated room) - flat screen tv (and a 2nd in the bathroom) - plenty of towels - comfy bed - an overall very nice room. Nothing especially fancy -- but we weren't in the room much anyway. Lots of fun young groups of people running around the area -- and lots of old people on scooters (dropping lots of $100 bills into slot machines) - and lots of all types of people for that matter. Wonderful location! Easy to walk to lots of other huge casinos/hotels. McDonald's, Chipotle, Subway, etc. all adjacent. We ate at the Cafe in the hotel and the food (we both had salads) was very tasty (but iced tea was over $3.50 a glass - that seems like a rip). It's one of the older hotels and doesn't have the spacious, open casino feel of some of the newer properties but if you're looking for a great location, nice lodging, and very competent service, we'd recommend you consider Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “7 Ladies Had A Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: 9009donna
Reviews.Content: Seven friends met at Harrahs and we all agreed that we felt safe and had great service at Harrahs. Every staff member is friendly! The location is perfect with easy walk to all Strip casinos. The service at the 24 hour cafe is slow but the food is good. We all love the easy-to-use rewards.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: jekiowa
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from Las Vegas after taking my father on a much needed vacation. My mother is in poor health and this has prevented my father from being able to travel for several years. After talking to several others about where to stay we were convinced that Harrah's was the best location and hotel for our vacation. We stayed 3 nights and all were good except for the last night. We left our room at 9:30 am and returned back at 10:15 pm only to find out that our shower had been torn apart and was laying all over the bathroom floor. We received no notice and were in shock to discover this. We contacted hotel staff and they informed us that they were unaware of this issue and wanted to relocate us to another room. By this time it was approaching 11pm, I requested that they return the shower to its working condition and that we would prefer not to move to another room as we had to catch a 6am shuttle to the airport. After waiting approx 30 minutes we were told that the only option was to move to another room in another tower. I requested to be refunded for the room for the night, the staff informed me that there was nothing that they could do as the room was booked through Expedia?????? Expedia did not tear apart our shower. We ended up moving to another room at 12:15am and somehow managed to catch our 6am shuttle. We would not recommend staying at Harrah's, unless comfort and cleanliness are of no importance.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel... Needs Some TLC”
Reviews.Author: TravelAdviceCA
Reviews.Content: Good hotel and a great price, but it's the details that makes a place go from good to great. It is that attention to detail that I think is missing here. The room was beautifully appointed (view notwithstanding.) Where they missed the mark was the ventilation fan on the wall was covered in lint. There were no indications of where the Internet connection was (I found the router on the back of the night table, no where near the table you would use for your laptop, and it involved some rather deft moves to connect the cable). The carpet in the hall needed to be re-stretched. The housekeepers kept on tapping on the door as they cleaned the hall carpets even though there was a "do not disturb" sign on the door. In the bathroom there were three sets of towels, for two queen-sized beds. And why do you put in nice big flat screens and keep analog cable and no button to adjust the aspect ratio? Do I really need to see everyone stretched wide? I couldn't get a WiFi signal. Internet access was paid and expensive. The nice points, there was separate shower and hand/facial soap. There was a nice ironing board and iron in the room. Beautiful flat screen TV, with a sleep button and a good selection of channels.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dmiller1974
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Las Vegas for New Year's. The first 3 nights, we stayed at a different hotel, the last 3 nights we stayed here. We frequent the Harrah's in Cherokee, NC as well, and were pleasantly surprised when we checked in that our 3 nights were comp'd. We were given a basic room, but were offered to upgrade to a more deluxe room that had been recently renovated with a "strip view", 2 flat screens, and a pillow-top mattress for a small amount. The view wasn't fabulous, but we could see the strip and had a small balcony. Other than the nicer mattress, I'm not sure it was worth the upgrade, but for $15, why not? The service in the casino was excellent. The dealers were all extremely friendly and and the girls bringing drinks around were quick and had great memories. The buffet was quite good, not one of best in town, but certainly not the worst. The Cafe' was good as well. The entertainment at The Improv was very, very good and reasonably priced. The hotel/casino has a great location on the strip...at least for my husband and I, it was great. I plan on staying at Harrah's the next time we visit Las Vegas and I'd recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jakesmema
Reviews.Content: I have read some not so good reviews of Harrahs on this site, but I have nothing but good to say about it. Our check in was fast & friendly. I had a few comps, which gave us a room for $40 a night. We were in the Carnaval tower, and the room was beautiful. I have seen some reviews where they said sthe room was small...I didn't think so..it wasn't huge, but plenty big. We did not have a frig, so I didn't have the problems with it that I have seen others rant about. It was quiet, clean, newer furnishing, etc. 3 nice pillows, plus a rolled one. IF I had any negative to say, it would be the lighting. There was only a lamp by the table, and one on the nightstand between the beds. My husband likes to read, and you couldn't very well read in bed. The lighting in the bathroom, was tasteful, but its was sconce lighting on each side of the mirror. The bulbs were lower wattage, and it was really bad for putting on makeup. I used a hand mirror and went near the window, so put on my makeup...but like I said..it wasn't the end of the world. Nice big bath & plushy towels. The casino was busy all the time...one of the few in town that was. I didn't win anything big, but did get to play some. I saw a lot of big winners though. I was surprised.at the number of winners I saw...big winners. I would definitely stay here again. It is convenient. Mcdonalds is right next door, and so is Casino Royale where beer & margaritas are $1 all day, every day. Can't beat that.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: Phil1978
Reviews.Content: I'm really not sure how anyone can complain about this hotel? Yes it's not one of the newest hotels or themed hotels, but stick this Hotel anywhere else in the world and you will not be disapointed! You also won't be paying £35 per night! Rooms - HUGE! CLEAN and Well Done out. Bathroom - Faultless - massive and clean Maid Service was EXCELLENT and Staff in generally were VERY friendly!!! Can't fault the place!

Reviews.Title: “A reservation is not necessarily what you think it is...”
Reviews.Author: Lolaroco
Reviews.Content: For business purposes I travel to Las Vegas 2-3 times per year. We do not usually stay at this hotel. This year upon arrival at midnight after a five hour flight, we were informed they did not have our reserved rooms available. Apparently they will only confirm a reservation but not the actual room type. What does that even mean? Warning: if you are traveling with others and planning on sharing a room-things may be cozy as our two queen bed request was subbed with a King only. After going back and forth with their "oh well deal with it" attitude we finally were able to speak to a supervisor who was able to find rooms albeit 2 hours later. Needless to say our business day was less than superior with the lack of sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: ThisMom
Reviews.Content: Visited Vegas for the second time in 10 months. Recieved free room offers from Harrah's and decided to give it a try...who wouldn't for free rooms right on the strip? Being the rooms were free, expected them to be pretty bad...but you're not in your room but to sleep...so who cares? However, the rooms we had were fine!! Very clean, great maid service and while the blower fan was loud, that is tolerable. Definately far better than I expected for free rooms in the Mardi Gras Tower. We were offered newly remodeled rooms, for $25 a night...but why pay $300 when you are getting free rooms? We were all very happy with our three rooms. The Deuling Piano Bar is an absolute blast! Don't miss it!!!!!!!!! What a great time we had there!! The buffet leaves A LOT to be desired. I and my husband were not impressed. Not at all. I can't speak of the others in our party, but I got the impression they too were not impressed. The food tasted old and often was barely warm. Yuck. We ate there only for convience. Toby Keith's Bar and Grill. Not for us. Way too loud. You cannot even speak to the person sitting next to you. Which brings up another issue...it was about 10 or 11 and we were hungry, but not starving. We were told by the hotel that the adjoining McDonalds was closed (it wasn't) but their hotel cafe is open 24 hrs. So we head to the cafe only to find it closed. So we had to go up to Toby Keiths..were they were serving cafe food. The menu was very limited at that time, and it was so incredibly loud it wasn't enjoyable at all. Drink service at this hotel was outstanding. The best we found. Machines were often tight but we all did win some money (which we promptly played back). Dealers were friendly too. Last time we played in Harrah's in 2009 it seemed incredibly LOUD..this time the casino area had great music playing at a comfortable level and has a lot of that old Vegas glitz still. All in all...a great time and a great value! Would certainly recommend this hotel and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: 2travelnutsview
Reviews.Content: Read some bad reviews of Harrahs. Was a little worried before arrival. Upgraded to deluxe room in Mardi Gras tower. Room was clean, roomy had plenty of storage for clothes. TV in bathroom was good for those times(didn't need a book to read). I enjoyed their casino. It's laid out better than lots of them. Position on the strip was great almost anything you want to see was within walking distance. The staff at harrahs was always friendly (from the registration, waiters, cocktail waitresses and maids). Everytime I was ready for a drink ,it seemed they knew it and was there to take order (some even knew when we wanted drinks and just brought them). Our last trip to Vegas we stayed at PH. We were so much happier with everything at Harrahs. Thanks Harrahs for showing that the old Vegas charm is still alive somewhere. PS if you eat breakfast at the coffe shop only order one. My wife ordered blueberry pancakes, they were huge, enough to feed 3 or 4 people. I ordered ham and eggs and the piece of ham covered the whole plate with 3 eggs, hashbrowns and toast. no wonder there was always a line to get in there.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: littlefinnie
Reviews.Content: Hotel was comfortable, clean and basic with a great location. If you like view of strip, coffee maker and fridge I would recommend booking the upper grade room. The carnival and piano bars are the best for fun but not cheep to drink. We had great service from front desk to housekeeping (thanks again Connie for the great personality). Staff very friendly with one exception at the Cafe, one hostess (Ester) could not even acknowledge us with a look, must have had a very bad day or night. Nice to have monorail stop at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: RalphJ2
Reviews.Content: Nice view amazing service over all a EXCELLENT Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Divorce Celebration...lol”
Reviews.Author: CandisM
Reviews.Content: Room was nice not bad for a hotel...Not in the room much anyway so it was a good safe place to pass out!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Melissalynn19
Reviews.Content: Harrah's provides a very fun atmosphere right in the heart of Vegas. You can have an awesome night of gambling, shows, and good food without even leaving the hotel. The rooms are very comfortable and they provide all the amenities you could ask for. Great for the money. One of the best choices on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place”
Reviews.Author: Jason500
Reviews.Content: Been to a Harrah's in Atlantic City, so choice this one. Hotel was good, fresh linen was waiting each day with the rooms clean. Hotel is right in the middle of the strip, so easy to get to anything from there.

Reviews.Title: “My room was robbed at Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: IPAngel1
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Harrah's for over a week around the time of the superbowl. In the final night of my stay, while I slept and my roomate played poker downstairs, a perpetrator entered my room and stole my wallet, pants, and all of my cash. I was never determined how anyone got in to my room since there are no security cameras in any of the Hotel's hallways to monitor such activity. Harrah's claims that it was my responsibility to use the night latch to keep intruders out of my room and are unwilling to make any amends to rectify this situation. They've referred my case to a third party insurance company, but this company has already sent me a letter stating that Harrah's provided a safe and secure gaming environment and that my claim will be closed if they don't hear from me. They have since ignored my emails and disputes. I would not recommend that anyone stay at Harrah's while visiting Las Vegas. If you have any other options, please choose an alternate location. If you have no choice but to stay at Harrah's, make sure to lock the door and deadbolt and nightlatch when you go to bed at night. DO NOT count on Harrah's to protect you like they protect their casino.

Reviews.Title: “Star Trek Con TripI”
Reviews.Author: DavidW29
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrah's instead of the Hilton for the big Star Trek Convention. It is on the monorail, so it is easy to get to and from the hotel. A lot cheaper and just as nice of rooms in my opinion, and better food. It also allows you to visit the strip easily, as it is right across from the Forum shops entrance, and near Mirage, Treasure Island, Bellagio, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: meegiec
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights. Bathrooms were gianormous, beds were comfy. Felt slightly like a rabbit warren. Rooms a little dated, no view from my room. However when in Vegas you rarely spend time in your room, so this served its purpose and was cheap enough. Great location - walking distance to The Fashion Show, opposite Mirage, next to Imperial Palace. McDonalds adjacent, buffet reasonale price and Starbucks on site.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK, 1X bad cocktail server”
Reviews.Author: shelliscott7
Reviews.Content: Had a very bad experience with a cocktail waitress named Joy while playing penny slots, the Beverage Manager actually told us she's already in the disciplinary action, totally rude, Manager agreed and didn't offer any comps to make up for her, other than that, had a great time, the rest of the staff was awesome, minus the no coffee pot in the room.

Reviews.Title: “great quality”
Reviews.Author: AmberNichelle
Reviews.Content: the room was beautiful and had a great view. Beds were compfortable and clean. our room smelled funny but room next door was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: theresa1970
Reviews.Content: We just got back yesterday from our trip, and Harrah's is in need of a update. First of all tube televisions are out.The television was very fuzzy. Our view was of a roof which always seems to be a problem when you get a comped room. The rug was dirty with several visable stains. My socks were black after walking around for a short time. As far as the casino it was a fun envirnment with a lot of choices of games. The casino floor always seemed packed. I did enjoy gambling here although I lost it was still entertaining. I did not eat at any resturants here. Overall there are better options for your stay in vegas, but the casino I would recommend. The cocktail waitresses were so friendly. I always had a drink with great service. I also visited the spa for ten dollars after 5:00 and enjoyed the hour I spent there.

Reviews.Title: “An average stay”
Reviews.Author: JohnR61
Reviews.Content: Harrah's caters to the mid-westerner. It is a nice property though definately one of the eye-popping ones on the strip built in the last decade or so. The room in the Mardi Gras Tower was recently redone and nicely appointed though a little small. One complaint - a serious lack of drawers (ended up with clothes in the night stand). On a positive note, evry room had a working refrigerator. Tha gambling staff is friendly and laid back. They are not overly impressed with there power and while they enforce the table rules, they don't go nuts if you touch your blackjack cards with two hands or share your undercards with the table at Let it Ride. The location near the middle of the strip and directly across the street from Caesar's is nice. also a plus is that your casino slot card is good at all Harrah's properties (Caesar's, Paris, Bally's, etc.). Overall, a comfortable place to stay and while ther are nicer places, there are also a bunch that are a lot worse.

Reviews.Title: “will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Rhondafromsask
Reviews.Content: clean and nice. centrally located, will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Noise, Noise, and more Noise!”
Reviews.Author: G_G_Gator
Reviews.Content: The Noise from the Carnival Court was endless. There was the pounding base from the bar, and the screaming female at the motorcycle ride (she didn't really need a microphone). It continued till the early hours of the morning. When I complained I was told that people pay $30.00 extra for those rooms. Believe me, I did not pay extra for the experience. It just reinforces the fact that all they see is your wallet, forget that you are their guest. Then there was the guy spreading plastic wrap on the hall floor in the morning, I thought someone was trying to flush a cat down the toilet!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Imua50
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful experience in a long time at a Resort we nearly scratched from our list of favorites. We were assigned a beautiful Jr. suite (this was Valentine's Day Weekend) with the Strip view. The room was clean and had a 32" flat screen TV. There also was a coffee pot. Housekeeping did a good job each day. The gaming was better this time around then on our last four trips. The buffet was our choice to have our meals and it was great. Beverage service on the gaming floor was plentiful. Everyone on the Harrah's staff that we came in contact with was very pleasant and helpful. The Valet service is probably the best in Vegas, very fast and very helpful. Harrah's is the only Casino that has a Total Rewards card that you can use your players Comp points to purchase things like gifts, foods at and of their restaurants and buffets without going through a Host. Harrah's rewards their players right now when you need it. I recommend signing up for their Player's Total Rewards card where you can use it at all of their properties they own in the United States and abroad. Their are so many rewards they give to there players that you may be the little guy that can enjoy life a little better without being a High Roller. Remember, you are the customer and they love you for that. Harrah's is always looking forward to seeing you again. Don't forget they have good music out in the outside court, it's free.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's in 2007”
Reviews.Author: peach423
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, rates reasonable, restaurants very good...loved the Twins Dueling Piano Show!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: msdebagain
Reviews.Content: My 16 yr old daughter and I stayed at Harrahs for 5 days. We were in the Carnaval Tower. The view wasnt too bad considering our window was right over a pipe that let steam out. But who comes to Vegas for a view from the room? The beds were comfortable, however the bathroom curtain was musty smelling. No big deal. Everything was spotless. The casino really doesnt have that many machines to play considering the size of the hotel. Didnt hear too many people shouting when they won a jackpot. The machines were tight. We were going to eat in the Toby Keith restaurant, but it was a bit out of our price range, as was the buffet. No big deal, McD's was right next door. the employees were all wonderful, helpful, and polite. the room, which was 32 dollars a night, was a steal! we'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: kak032
Reviews.Content: Dirty. I got an upgraded room and it was filthy, the phone did not work, the minibar was not working, one television was not working. I requested nonsmoking and got a smoking room. We had to leave the windows open. Housekeeping had to be called to bring coffee, even though they saw that we had used the one in the room when we arrived. I told the person at the desk and they offered nothing. NEVER AGAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs”
Reviews.Author: skweki
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the stay great location. Had lots of entertainment rite outside and was decorated to fit the LV theme.

Reviews.Title: “Always the best”
Reviews.Author: tahoewesternIowa
Reviews.Content: Location is the best for gambling on strip. Room was kept very clean, super comfortable king bed. Stayed in Carnival Tower, should have someone checking and watching the elevator scene. Husband went down for coffee about 6 am before checkout and getting on elevator to go back to room with coffee, a man was in elevator area & followed my husband into elevator, approached husband for money. When husband went to get off elevator, the man followed briefly, but guess after finding out husband wouldn't give him money, the man got back on elevator. My husband said he felt he would have to have a fight to get rid of the man. We were concerned if it would've been me alone in the same position, i probably would've had my purse stolen & could've even been knocked down. Being Diamond card holders we especially like the benefits Harrahs give to us. Very good Diamond lounge and appreciated the Diamond business center in the checkin area printing our boarding passes, that was great. All around, a good trip, but didn't bring any extra money along home. Felt their slots were about average to other casinos we played at. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's is the best!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: VikingfanMpls_Mn
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth time to Harrah's this year. The rooms are great, the service is great, never waited for anything. Carnaval Court is a blast!! Bartenders Jayme & Flippy are incredible. Had a fantastic time, every time. Great location, center strip, perfect. I would never stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay..”
Reviews.Author: ShannonR3
Reviews.Content: because it puts you near all the big hotels on the Strip-Bellagio, Paris, Venetian, Mirage, Caeser's. Room was spacious and clean-good bars and street fun in the courtyard. All in all, had a good time

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ggmon76
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for all the strip casinos and hotels, free shuttle into downtown, friendly service, massive rooms with comfortable beds. We loved this hotel, we had to go into a smoking room on the first night as there were no non- smoking rooms left (we had booked non-smoking) the smell of smoke was overpowering, i woke up thinking the hotel was on fire!! they moved us early the next day but we should have stood our ground and insisted on non smoking as i heard someone else refuse later that evening and they got upgraded. We got the cheap rooms facing the hills and not the strip - you can see the runway and the view is rubbish but it was so quiet. Other than that you would be hard pushed to find a better hotel for the money. We had booked stratosphere but after reading some really bad reviews we moved the booking here - so pleased we did as we went to look at Stratosphere and it was a hole!! Harrahs made our 3 nights in Vegas a joy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: freebirdVT
Reviews.Content: Harrah's was one of the better deals on the strip. The room was reasonably priced, the location was great, it was clean and the beds were comfortable. Checkin was effortless and the staff was great. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great, recommend the upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: RVer1
Reviews.Content: The location is great! Easy walk to Venetian (hit the Mex place for happy hour margaritas/snacks) and right across the street from Caesar's forum shops. Did take a cab from Caesar's to Luxor (4 people, $5 + $2 tip=worth it with all the construction, etc.) Then, hopped the mororail out to Mandalay Bay. Harrah's casino is just okay--we spent more time at the Flamingo where the drinks were steady and our luck was better! (Harrah's could definitely have better floor service for beverages.) Toby's bar was expensive and the bartender was rude/arrogant, but the cover band was pretty good. The outdoor bar (not owned by Harrah's I don't think) was happening, the bartenders were entertaining, it was pricey, and the band we thought was so very awesome turned out to be piping in the "real" band and lip syncing! We felt silly when we finally figured that one out at least an hour into it....even a bit "betrayed" :)! The Asian restaurant was delicious and the service was great. We ordered room service once and it was fast, plentiful, and tasted good. The diner type restaurant was good for breakfast...easily split the entrees for a very satisfying breakfast and more economical meal. We did NOT enjoy our "Thanksgiving Special Dinner"...turkey was terrible! We did pay $50 more a night to ungrade to a suite--absolutely NO regrets! The suite was large, had a beautiful view of the Rio/mountains from one window, and the "happenings" on the street below from another. With the bedroom separate, I heard very little from the hallway and slept really well--the covers could have been a lot (or even a little!) plusher...very thin! I have to say: Read the fine print on the "mini-bar!" If you pick something up to take a look at what it is and then put it back, you may have just bought it! (Had to call down to housekeeping and the front desk to check that there wasn't a charge--I was in my parent's suite and said "What is this? We don't have one of these!" It was an "Intimacy Kit"! We got a good laugh, but they didn't want the charge on their bill all the same!) Also, it was strange that we had a refrigerator and sink, but no microwave--I guess they want you to get out and eat all meals and not keep leftovers (kept my salad from our room service and it froze...). All and all, Harrah's is in a wonderful location, has decent suites with seperate spa tub and "living" area, okay service.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay! Mid-strip, love hotel piano bar and Carnaval Court.”
Reviews.Author: Tammi71
Reviews.Content: Check-in was a breeze - had the most pleasant gal from Ethiopia wait on us. We stayed in the MardiGras tower and had a great view of the strip. Our room on the 10th floor was clean, comfortable and updated and it was quiet. There is also a coupon book issued at check-in that is worth looking through. The restaurant downstairs has a $9.99 steak and shrimp special in the evenings that was surprisingly good. We had the buffet one night at the hotel - arrive early to avoid the lines. It was EXCELLENT food and service-used the coupon from check-in. There is a tram stop at Harrah's, as well as free shuttles to a few different places like the Rio - love the free show in the sky. Additionally Harrah's is well situated mid-strip and many budget conscious amenities such as Walgreens, McDonald's, Burger King and Chipotle are within close walking distance - 5 to 10 minute walk. There are also some awesome cuisine nearby! We had plans to go to some of the "hot" nightclubs, but after the first night we spent singing karaoke with Frank Sinatra in the Piano Bar and then staying to watch the Dueling Pianos, which is cover free - we changed our minds. We also enjoyed the bands at Carnaval Court - right outside the door of Harrah's - and the bar staff's cool show - think the movie "Cockitail" with fire throwing added in. It also had no cover charge. I don't think we could have had any more fun anywhere else! We also got tickets to be contestants on the tv game show "Let's Make A Deal" filmed at the Tropicana. Tickets are free through CBS.com, but they give more tickets awan than there are seats, so the line to get in is first come first serve. Arrive early and wear a fabulous shiny costume (or buy one at their shop). It films Thursday through Sunday and we went on Thursday, their busiest day and had to come back to the second show that day. Next time I will plan for Friday, Saturday or Sunday! Some of the comments on here scared me about this hotel, but we had an excellent experience! And the price was GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel and Lucky Casino”
Reviews.Author: brandychapman09
Reviews.Content: The hotel is extremely nice...rooms were spacious with great views. (Even had flat screens in the baths). We all had great luck in the Casino there too!

Reviews.Title: “Go To Vages & Have Fun! Just Bring Enough Money!”
Reviews.Author: JamesM40
Reviews.Content: To start, I went to Vegas in 2001. It only had '07 - '10 to choose from. But I went there with my ma & my grandma and we stayed at Harrah's. We were only there for a couple days, but I had a ball! I even came won some money & came home a couple hundred $$$'s ahead! I won most of that money at casino that looks like a pyramid. I forget its nameb ut that's where I won most of the money. Another thing I did that was so much fun was that I went up the Eiffel Tower. Now THAT was cool!!! And I went up a little bit before sunset & stayed up there til well after dark. The water shows in the pond across the stareet at the Belagio were awesome! Definitely something I reccomend to do in Las Vegas. So next time yopu go there, go up the Tower. Naturally, it's in the Paris casino. But go up just before sunset and stay til after dark. The water shows are very cool! Have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Central but the 'powers that be' inflexible.”
Reviews.Author: Thebigdippers
Reviews.Content: Booked this in Feb 09 for 2 nights in Aug. I was booking a month long trip with a lot of hotels and this was my only mistake, I should have booked just one night, but because I'd booked a special deal thru a broker there was no way of cancelling the extra night even tho the hotel would have sold (and probably did) the room again. We told them about the mistake by the beginning of March too! No problems with the checking in, usual long queue, but we were expecting that. Our room was ok, view towards the strip. I really disliked the bathroom, hardly any lighting was working, so you showered in semi-darkness (the shower curtain was double thickness so even less light came through! The policy of not letting you use the fridge for your own use was really mean, we wanted to put a bottle of water in there, but we would've been fined if we did! If you used the casino, of course the drinks are complimentary, but try buying a bottle of water from the hotel shop - $4 for half a litre! Outside we picked one up for a buck!
