Pool was fun, strange to be on the 2nd floor and feel the metro train rumbling under you! The Range Steakhouse - one of the many places to eat in the hotel was terrifically expensive, but fabulous food with top notch service. Have to tell you that there was at least one crupier who needed to take a break! I've never known anyone in the service industry to be so grumpy! We'd never played roulette before, he was so rude that we left and went to play computer roulette, the machines don't shout at you! All in all was ok for the night, but I was glad we were only there for one night!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Staff and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveller955
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel, Staff were very helpful, good selection of restaurants and good standard of rooms

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs needs attention”
Reviews.Author: Chip46wis
Reviews.Content: Our 8th trip to Las vegas and we stayed at Harrahs for a second time.The hotel is really showing its age,very dated interior and many unacceptable situations that occured make me have to write this for others.We had no power in the room for 7 hours the first night and the front desk said we had been notified-we were not,my wife uses a breathing apperatus to help her at night and it was a unpleasant situation.The next morning I went to the lobby early only to have the fire warning lights and sirens going off with a announcer saying they were unsure of what was going on,I didnt know if I should take the elevator to the 25th floor where my wife was or use the steps when they announced we THINK we have it as a false alarm. The 3rd night we tried to get the steak and egg special for $6.95 after 12:00 midnight we were seated and sat for 15 minutes when I asked on of the busboys if there was a waiter available,of course he didnt speak english,as he walked away I understood his spanish as [--] the rich whities as he spoke to his coworkers.We spoke to the head waiter as we left and she said you are just too impatient,there was only 8 other people in the place,it was now 26 minutes with no service.The manager the next day said he doubted MY story. The slot machines are dated,most several years old along with well worn carpet and chairs that were loose and tore. There are so many NICE places to stay on the strip for the same money ,we will NEVER stay at Harrahs again as I sent them a letter explaining all these situations and they did not respond even after a second registered letter was sent and they received it Las vegas is hurting for business everywhere and this is unacceptable management by Harrahs.I shouldnt but will mention the fact I was hit on by a prostitute in the casino and twice right at the doorway towards casino royale. NEVER AGAIN HARRAHS!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Duct tape on the carpet”
Reviews.Author: TravelingShepherd
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Carnival tower (which I understand is older) and the room is just tired. It's old, worn and in fact, so worn that there was duct tape (red on the brown carpet) holding the carpet down. The bedding was okay, pillows were terrible - hard as a rock. I woke up with a neck ache and my head hurt. The casino is so smoky compared to the newer hotels with higher ceilings.

Reviews.Title: “Room Party Policy "BEWARE"”
Reviews.Author: JustKeepMoving57
Reviews.Content: The room " non-smoking" was well appointed, and my sister & I were excited about our weekend get-a-way. The employees from valet on up were freindly and helpful, the Starbucks at the bottom of our elevator was a plus for that early morning coffee run. Than 3:00 a.m. we were awakend by the smell of marijuana and sounds of people leaving a party next door. Security was called and 5 officers arrived, the smoke was so heavy when the door opened the officers were chocking, id's were taken and they were given a warning to keep it down. Thats it!!! I understand warnings about keeping the noise down but illegal drug use, give me a break. The night sift manager was called at our request and he offered to move us, we were checking out in less than 8 hrs. If drugs are your thing Harrah's may just be what your looking for. If like us you want to unwind and feel like the mangement cares about your well being this isn't the place for you. In Vegas the option's are limitless. Stay some place else.

Reviews.Title: “Much better the 2nd time around”
Reviews.Author: dexterdog18
Reviews.Content: Returned to Vegas in January of 2010 and decided to give Harrahs another try (the first one wasn't the most memorable) and this time we were much happier indeed. Our Deluxe room met our expectations, was very clean & quiet. The majority of our days booked were comped and we love its locations so this wasn't too hard to accept. The room was equipped with a coffee machine which was nice but the fridge is nothing but a pain and a ripoff. Do not open and try to put anything you bought inside it as you will be charged. I just wish they'd leave the thing empty for your use like they do at the Flamingo. Personally we can't comment too much on the casino as we like to play elsewhere for the most part. I do find that they have too many dollar slot machines as I prefer the quarter games (when I'm willing to throw away a couple bucks!) We played in their poker room but find the atmosphere dry & stale. The dealers seem to be rather unhappy for some reason, they don't talk nor smile - not even when you tip them! We never found any table games under 10 dollars so again we took our money elsewhere to try our luck. They have this litttle spot tucked in between the poker room and the sports book where you can get some grub. The sandwiches there are amazing, made to order and mmm mmm good. Another night we tried Toby Keiths bar & grill and enjoyed our selections - again no complaints. We opted one morning to have breakfast in the cafe, personally I found this a little overpriced as there are many other places we could have gone but stayed there due to its convenience. The buffet was pretty good but if we didn't have comps to use I'm not sure we would have dined there. Being that they had tons of food out and that they weren't overly busy made me wonder what they did with the food at the end of the night......things that make you go hmmmmm. How many different dishes can you make with leftover pasta night after night?? We made use of the gym and spa which was a nice break. It was nothing fancy but had all the ammenities we required. We went from 4 - 7 and it only cost us $5.00 being we hold Platinum players cards - sweet! The staff in the spa are extremely friendly and constantly asked if we needed anything - thank you. Overall this was a great trip and a very good Harrahs experience. We visit Vegas about 3 times a year and for sure would consider staying at this hotel again. You can't beat its location on the strip, it puts you right in the heart of it all.

Reviews.Title: “Good value on the strip”
Reviews.Author: PATHRCO7
Reviews.Content: I stayed @ Harrah's for (5) nights in early January, 2010 while working a trade show. It's a very dated hotel and the rooms are very small. However, their pricing is very affordable when compared to surrounding hotels. One nice touch----they have coffee pots in the rooms! I don't remember the last time I had a coffee pot in my room at any Las Vegas hotel. They want you to splurge for the $8 cup of coffee @ Starbucks. In general, the place is clean. Dining at their cafe for breakfast was O.K. at best. Overpriced and slow every single day. But, if you are looking for a convenient hotel on the strip, you could do a lot worse than Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “harrah's”
Reviews.Author: bobbyg56
Reviews.Content: had a blast. great service, good location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Texas1983
Reviews.Content: I have been to Las Vegas 12 times in the past 10 years. I stay at a different hotel every time(Imperial Palace, Paris, Wynn, Monte Carlo, etc..). This trip I was on a budget, so I chose to stay at Harrah's (I am a Total Rewards Member). It is centrally located on the strip and just a hop, skip, or monorail ride to where ever you want to be. The staff was friendly. The clerk even helped me with a name issue (Harrah's Total Rewards card that I booked the room in was under my previous last name & did not have any old ID on me), got me checked in and showed me where the Total rewards desk was to update my account. A bit of an older crowd. Casino quieted down around 10pm, which was great for us. The Pai Gow Poker dealers were great! Great food, good price, definately recommend staying here. Also love the buffet, Carnival court and Ghiradelli's ice cream parlor that is right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised; Loved Toby Keith's!”
Reviews.Author: glanzerr
Reviews.Content: In January 2010 I traveled with colleagues to Las Vegas for CES and stayed at Harrah's. As our company's travel planner, I really pushed to stay here because of Toby Keith's I Love This Bar & Grill being on the second floor of Harrah's, and as a big fan of country music, I figured for sure I'd hit up the bar every night after the show. I barely even took into consideration the quality of rooms when booking. I must say that Harrah's really surprised me with their outstanding quality of reasonably priced rooms. The beds were super soft (maybe too soft even), the bathroom was spacious, and there were more mirrors than anyone could possibly need. The TV was fairly old and the toilet sometimes didn't stop running, but other than that no complaints. The Flavors buffet was great for breakfast, though I can honestly say I've never seen a breakfast buffet with cotton candy before. The Harrah's Cafe was only average. Their late-night $5.99 steak & eggs combo was a good deal but the steak was pretty gristly. And of course, I can't say enough about the Toby Keith bar on the second floor. I spent hundreds of dollars there on specialty drinks and food. The live band played virtually every night I was there and they were exceptionally good, playing only well-known country and rock songs. I will push for Harrah's every time my company travels to Las Vegas. Decent rates, above-average rooms, excellent amenities, and great location on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Girl's Weekend”
Reviews.Author: sunup1952
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located so we could see a lot of the city. The food at the buffet was very good. Fun gambling on the slots!

Reviews.Title: “A lot of little issues add up to my disappointment with this property”
Reviews.Author: TokyoBob1975
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 6 to 10 January for trade show. Do not drink, gamble, shop or spend money on shows. All my comments are based on a person who would spend 10 to 12 hours/day in their Las Vegas hotel room. At 4:00pm, my 11 co-workers and I checked in. Actually, my 11 co-workers checked in and my room was "not ready". They did have another room available for an extra $25/night. Was already paying $118/night. Weird that 4 co-workers standing behind me and 7 co-workers in front of me got their rooms without having to upgrade. It would be understandable if I were last in line. Did not get to check in until 5:45pm. No apology or offer of anything to compensate me. Set the clock radio to a specific radio station. 24 hours later when I verified the station, it had been changed to the opposite end of the dial. Assume the housekeeping staff changed it while they cleaned the room. Should not do that during my stay--after check out and between guests is OK. First night, I had to spend 20 minutes with tech support to get in-room Internet connection ($11.95/day) to work. Nothing wrong with my laptop, they were just "working on the server". Third night, same issue and had to waste another 15 minutes even with my service ticket from first call. On third night at about 10pm, I heard what I thought was somebody running up and down the hall. Thought it was odd that the sound was stationary, then I realized it was the room next to mine. The headboard was banging against the shared wall. The woman moaning leads me to believe my neighbors were not "running". Water pik shower head with 6 settings was stuck on 1 setting. The refrigerator had so many disclaimers and warnings about automatic charges for any mini bar items, I did not even open it. It looked really tacky. The iron was connected to the ironing board by a wire cord for security which made ironig difficult. 27" tube TV speakers are worn out, and entire TV shold be replaced. The elevators were extremely shop worn. Push button for a floor and it would not light up. One of largest trade shows of the year was being held at Las Vegas Convention Center, yet at time of check-in, front desk had no details about shuttle bus pick-ups. This is very common for large hotels to have available for trade show attendees. This is the "biggest name" hotels I have ever stayed at during 9 previous stays, and I was really disappointed. Good news is that the hotel is in the middle of the Strip. There is a monorail stop within walking distance of hotel. If and when I have to spend my own money on a Las Vegas hotel, it will not be with Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “great!”
Reviews.Author: sarahkcraig2010
Reviews.Content: Check in was fast, room was great. Only problem, no fan in the bathroom... got steamy when showered!!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely poor in everything”
Reviews.Author: pjmberry
Reviews.Content: Stayed January 3rd - 7th. Booked a "Deluxe room", advertised as upgraded with Strip View. Nasty room, in Mardi Gras Tower (M524) on 5th floor with view of air conditioning and kitchen extractors, next to elevator/lift shaft (remember Vegas is a 24 hour city, and therefore so are the lifts) and so 24 hr noise. Given Styrofoam cups for coffee (very Super 8 style). Reception staff not interested in room change. PLEASE DO NOT STAY HERE. Other places are better. This hotel chain (and they own 7 or 8 in Las Vegas) needs to look seriously at it's customer service, so check out hotels out of this chain first.

Reviews.Title: “Place to avoid.”
Reviews.Author: R0ger444
Reviews.Content: Stayed there Dec 10-16. Was offered an upgrade to a luxury room for $10 a night. Did not get a luxury room. Got the same mediocre quality room at a higher floor level. The so-called luxury room also did not include any coffee pot in room or comfortable chair (recliner). While location is nice, their false advertising about luxury rooms and people you have to deal with makes this a place you want to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Most Horrible Vegas Experience”
Reviews.Author: Frustrated10
Reviews.Content: I will never go back to this hotel even if it's for free! My family booked and stayed there from 12/27/09 - 12/29/09, yeah it's a good deal for the price but other 4 stars hotels have competitive price too and i could have had a better service than this crappy old place. We arrived there at about 3pm since that is the check in time, did not get to the counter until 3:45pm because of the loooong line. When we finally get to the receptionist she informed us that our room will not be available until 6pm! What a nightmare and did not even bother to apologize for the inconvinience, as if it's a normal situation. Finally get our keys at about 5pm - better than 6 but it's still 2 hrs late for supposed to be 3pm normal check in time. I finally got all my bags and happy to finally get some rest after driving 300miles just to get to vegas but when i entered my room guess what they have not even clean it! The receptionist gave me a key to a room that has not even cleaned yet! Soooo frustrating! I have to take my bags to my sisters room then we head out for dinner thinking that when i come back it will be cleaned but still after 1.5 hours went back to still uncleaned room. I went down frustrated but still calm to talk to the manager (Chris) he spoke to me and i explained the situation and guess what ?he did not apologize either and instead tried to give me another room that is far away from my family. I told him i do not want to move, just send a person to clean the room as soon as possible - his reply was he cannot do anything about having someone right away, but he took all information and told me that he already sent information to room service. It is now 9pm and still no cleaning crew. Have to call again the front desk manager and this time i spoke to a girl (forgot her name) and explained to her again the problem. She checked and called room service just to find out that cleaning person went to a wrong tower and cleaned the room 1023 there! This time she apologize and told me she will have room service get to my room right away. In short i did not get my room until 10pm, exhausted, frustrated and extreemely UPSET! That hotel should have refunded my one day because of inconvinience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Great Price - No Resort Fees!”
Reviews.Author: picabo972
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze on a Friday night at 11pm. No wait and the clerk was very friendly. Room was nice and clean and the only thing I saw missing was a coffee pot. I read in another post about the water from the shower covering the bathroom floor and the same thing happened to us and I can assure you we both put the liner in the tub. It wasn't a big issue though as we just threw a towel down on the floor and went to gamble. We didn't do well at the casino but hey it's Vegas and I expect to lose. The biggest plus was that I never had to wait on an elevator to get to/from my room. The onsite Starbucks was great. The cafe served huge portions although a little pricey except for the midnight to 6am steak and eggs breakfast special. YUM! Flavors buffet was sufficient but also a little pricey in my opinion. We did take advantage of the free shuttle to the Rio and then took a cab over to the Palms. A Harrah's employee told us to do that to save some money due to the traffic on the Strip. It probably saved a few bucks but next time I'll just go ahead and cab it because it took about 20 extra minutes. One evening the alarm clock in the room next to us was going off and I called the front desk to have them shut it off. They were polite and took care of it within five minutes. Overall, we had a great stay and will be back next month. I would definitely stay at Harrah's again.

Reviews.Title: “Less than Expected Quality for the Money”
Reviews.Author: madelyn300
Reviews.Content: We paid $15 a night extra for an upgraded room, but quality was less than expected. We were told the room was "RECENTLY UPGRADED". That must have included ONLY new carpeting, pillows and bed spread because nothing else was new, so not sure WHAT they meant by "recent". The upgrade only included "feather pillows, TV in bathroom, but no remote to it, a four-cup coffee pot and a king-size bed that we kept rolling off the side of. WOW! HOW NICE! Could they SPARE it? No fridge usage without paying for it, no microwaves, no free internet, no anything that even the cheapest hotels in the USA offer! The walls are paper-thin, clanging noises in the walls all night long, no coffee cups after maid service without asking for them and lots of dust all over the room. Oh, I don't want to forget to mention the PLUGGED UP BATH TUB DRAIN! WHAT was the maid using to clean the bathtub if she never noticed the water backing up immediately upon turning on the water faucet in the bathtub??? YUK! Staff was argumentative when confronted about the payment for an upgraded room that was in need of repair, In all fairness, they did send someone up to fix the drains, and did compensate us for one night of upgrade cost, but only because we asked for it outright. The smoke-filled casino was an issue for us, both non-smokers. It's not something one can get away from and makes breathing difficult most of the time, not to mention sore throats, stinging eyes, etc. Harrah's buffet restaurant, Flavors, was just ok in flavor, huge quantities of food and selection was good, but Flavors was not especially flavorful, just ok for the money; two kids under 10 and four adults...nearly $100 plus a tip. WHEW! Annoying time-share promoters, pool "closed for the season", but not advertised so online, nothing here for the kids at all. Parking was convenient at nearly all the hotels, this one included, where one could park without paying for it. IF you happen to be winning, you MIGHT get a drink offer, but otherwise, forget it! AND, if you happen to be winning, the waitress DOES expect a BIG tip and makes that VERY clear! For what we put into their machines, they should be paying US to drink!

Reviews.Title: “good deal if you can get it comped and don't mind cold showers”
Reviews.Author: illinicheme
Reviews.Content: My husband and I frequently travel to Las Vegas (2-3 times per year) and have stayed at many of the strip hotels. We choose Harrah's for our most recent trip because my husband managed to get five nights for $80 thanks to three comped nights. Overall, the hotel room was decent with the standard amenities. The bed was comfortable, with a slightly soft mattress and feather pillows. The room was much better than places like the Sahara and Excaliber, about equal to a room in the Luxor pyramid, slightly less nice than the Monte Carlo, and couldn't touch the Mandalay Bay with a 30-foot pole. The only drawback to the stay was the shower. The water pressure was not great, and the only time we got truly hot water was during a shower taken at 7pm. The five mornings when we tried to shower at times ranging from 8:30 to 10:30am resulted in barely warm water at the best and ice cold water at the worst. Overall the shower was a minor gripe because we paid so little for the room. If we had paid more, I would have been much angrier.

Reviews.Title: “Smoking rooms and non smoking rooms are not equal!”
Reviews.Author: Pudlow
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at Harrah's, we were very disappointed when we arrived to find the non-smoking connecting rooms we booked prior to our trip were not available. We we offered smoking rooms as an alternative. Harrah's considered this an equal trade. (While talking to the manager other patrons were being helped around us and all having the same problem, no more non smoking rooms) We were offered for an additional fee remodeled non smoking rooms, which we reluctantly took over the smoking ones. I cant believe that in this day Harrah's isn't able to count the number of non smoking reservations they get and quit taking them when they run out of these rooms. I wont be returning because the manager said they can never guarantee a non smoking room, and I am not willing to stay in a smoking room.

Reviews.Title: “no hurrahs for harrahs”
Reviews.Author: buonasera23
Reviews.Content: we checked in on tuesday and check-in was very fast although the girl was not very friendly as I tried to make conversation with her. The room was ok, window was small, overlooking the outdated pool but no biggie since I wasnt going swimming anyway. Bed,linens and pillows were very comfortable. Bathroom was good but the shower had a poor design and after i showered there was water all over the bathroom floor and into the entryway. I called front desk and asked for either housekeeping or maintenance to help with the spill. I will say that the response was very quick and someone knocked on the door in less than 5 minutes. When he entered he had the nerve to tell me it was MY FAULT. Even if it was,which I dont believe it was, a maintenance man should never tell a guest that they were wrong. He tried to tell me that I didnt have the shower curtain inside the tub, that he had worked there for 12 years and had seen this many many times. Well hello, youve seen it many times because of the design flaw,not the mistake of the guest. You see the tub has at the back of it a flat spot of about 18 to 24 inches at the height of the tub top. Dead space,why they have it I dont know. Perhaps to sit down? Any way I had booked two nights and we decided on the second night to stay for another night. I went to the Front desk and asked for another night. She told me I could stay but the price was double that of what i had paid. I told her that I had an email that I originally used for the reservation,that i had saved and could still get that original rate. She told me not so nicely,but not rudely to go ahead. I asked why if I was already a guest she couldnt just give me that rate for one more night,but said she couldnt. I then told her that I probably would go on the internet and book elsewhere. She then told me that this was a three star hotel and I probably would not get a rate like that. I booked elsewhere and the rest of our trip was very enjoyable. (I stayed at the Flamingo perhaps not a three star but room was ok, view was great with the great wall to wall floor to ceiling window. And all of the staff was very friendly. I know harrahs owns flamingo but the staff was much nicer at flamingo. Also ate at the buffet at harrahs(Flavors) it was just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Won my money back @ Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: ShamairB
Reviews.Content: Loved playing the slots here bc I won. The drinks kept coming. Acually all of us won money on the slots here. just know when to quit bc you can lose it there too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - cheaper than others - just what I wanted”
Reviews.Author: Aussie8888
Reviews.Content: Harrahs is not your high class Vegas Hotel, however this is the first time I stayed there. Coming from Sydney I have been to Vegas 6 times and was very happy with the stay. The location was perfect, room spacious and clean and staff were friendly. I cannot say anything bad and it is cheaper than most.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Engineering & Customer Service needs a RE-LOOKoerm b”
Reviews.Author: jetswin
Reviews.Content: Arrived to find Safe locked called Housekeeping said engineering would be right up. Asked to wait for them in room. Called and went to see Manager on Duty after they did not arrive, Manager said it was out of his hands.Bottom Line went waited 3 1/2 hours then left called in the morning and the lady oin Housekeeping replied "Oh No they still have not been there". I really question ther Customer Service. Question who has the power in my world Customer Service brings them back. I guess they want us to visit Mirage Hotels

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, just a few complaints”
Reviews.Author: wy0c0wb0y
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's from Dec. 10-14 2009. This was a combination "delayed 10th anniversary/sons 17th birthday/need to get away fr a few days" trip to Vegas, timed to coincide with the National Finals Rodeo. I had originally booked us at The Orleans (based upon reviews on TA), but switched over to Harrah's because of friends who were meeting us who had booked through one of the gambling packages which required them to stay at Harrah's. I booked online, and decided to "splurge" a little for one of the newer, upgraded rooms in the Mardi gras tower. When we checked in (about 6:00 in the evening) and got to the room, we immediately knew that the room they had given us wasn't gonna work. The music coming up from the street (the Strip) was so loud in rattled the walls. Called the front desk, was told the music quit at about 2 a.m., but they moved us across the hall with no problems and it was fine----couldn't hear a thing. The rooms are nice, clean, expansive as regular hotel rooms go, and the beds were really comfortable. So, all in all, I'm pleased at this point. Now, the few negative points. First, our nice, luxurious 40 something inch flat screen TV quit after the first night. When I discovered this (Friday evening) I called down, and a maintenance man came right up. After poking and prodding, he decided he couldn't fix it, so he told me to "take it up with the front desk". Upon calling down, we were told the only thing they could do was move us to another room. Now, I don't know how everybody else does it, but my wife is one of those who has to unpack her entire suitcase and put everything in drawers as soon as she get into a room, especially if were going to be there for a few days. When I relayed that the only way we could get a TV was to pack everything up and move to another room, she reached for her book, so I had the answer to that question. In that it was late on Friday afternoon/evening, decided to just live without it and maybe something could be done the next day (Saturday). After being out of the room most of the day Saturday, we came back to the room and found that someone had been in messing with the TV again, but still no working TV. Message lights blinking, call down and get told "We cant fix your TV, if you want we can move you to another room". We're tired, kinda cranky, and just want to relax, so moving to another room wasn't going to work for any of us. Here's my question. If they can move us to another empty room which (apparently) has a working TV, why couldn't they simply bring a TV from one of those rooms and replace the one in our room? While it meant a little more work for the hotel, it wold have been a greta thing for us. I suggested this ot the desk, they said they would look into it and get back to us, never heard from them again. SO, consequently, 3 of the 4 nights we were there, "sans TV". As I said, no big deal, but they do advertise and sell these new, upgraded rooms with having these new, big, flat screen TV's (which I assume means they think they can charge more for them), so it would have been nice if they could have gotten us one. Or at least adjusted our bill to reflect the lack of this amenity, which didn't happen either. On to the next complaint. Remember I said I had booked my room online, and paid more to get the "upgraded" Mardi gras tower room? and remember I said that the reason we were at Harrahs at all was because our friends had booked one off those cheap, "fly and stay" Vegas deals which (usually) means you stay in one of the less expensive, lower quality rooms, right? Guess who was 2 doors down from our "Upgraded, pay us more but you get more (like big screen TV's) " room? Yep, our "going to Vegas on the cheap because were not gonna be in the room long anyhow" friends!! WTF!!!! I asked him if he upgraded, answer back, "Nope, this is the room they gave us". Only difference between theirs and ours was that they paid $40.00 a night less, and had a working, 40 something inch flat screen TV! Final complaint. Gawd I hate these "charge extra for internet" hotels. Even when I am gone for vacation, I have to stay connected to the office back at home, and at Harrahs the only way you do that is pay $12 a day. Come on, that ought to be part of standard service now, it is (almost) 2010. Welcome to 21st, age of the internet, century, Harrah's!! Anyhow, we did have a good time, the hotel staff are friendly and really accommodating, the rooms are more than adequate, and it is well located. Not saying I wouldn't stay there again, or that I wouldn't recommend this to someone, but I'd have to think about it real hard before I did. I'm giving it a thumbs up because the positives slightly outweighed the negatives, but its a real slim margin-----

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent price, excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: mrsstewart09
Reviews.Content: First off, I need to say the location of Harrah's is one of the best things about the place. RIGHT in the center of the Strip, with easy access to everything. I had read reviews about Harrah's and wasn't too confident going in, but my husband and I were pleasantlly suprised. The hotel lobby/casino part itself is really nothing to write home about, but the room was very comfortable and spacious, and had little amenities it's sister hotel next door (The Flamingo) doesn't, like a mini-fridge! Parking, check-in, and the walk to the hotel room were easy and uneventful. We did not get the King room we requested, but on well, that has happened to us in Vegas more than one time (and we're always there within an hour of check-in time everywhere, so I can't understand why that always happens to us). When we got to our room we were planning on just throwing our stuff in and running back out, but we spent a little extra time checking out the room because we were impressed at how comfortable it was. The bed was GREAT, very comfortable. Eventhough it was a Queen it felt bigger, seriously. When you exit the casino you enter a little courtyard area with shopping kiosks and little places to eat, so that's neat. It's situated right between the Imperial Palace and Harrah's and is crowded because pretty much everyone has to walk through it on their way down/up the Strip. There is also an area set up to eat/drink and watch some live entertainment, which was cool. We stood around for a bit and watched a 70's cover band sing and have some fun with an audience member on stage. They have a pool, but it's nothing to write home about either. It was November when we went, so using the pool was not an option for us, so I cannot attest for the pool "ambiance" or anything like that. If you want to see an awesome pool, go next door to it's sister property, the Flamingo! Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for your average 3-star hotel experience. The staff members we encountered were all pleasant and friendly, but don't expect to be pampered or treated like royalty either, because frankly I doubt the employees at Harrah's get paid enough to do that.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: greenridersfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed At Harrah's Nov/27 to Dec 4. This was our second stay (stayed last year in the same time frame) and just as enjoyable. Our room was in the Carnival Tower 25th flr, basic but very clean. The beds and the bedding were very,very comfortable. All the staff from check-in to housekeeping were very helpful and accommodating. In particular special thanks to "Cassie" at the front desk who followed up on our room request and made our stay that much more enjoyable. We ate at the Pepper Rose deli one night (very good food and reasonably priced). We had the lunch buffet one day and thought the food was very fresh and tasty. The desserts were also excellent especially the lemon merenge pie, the best I've ever had!! We would recommend Harrah's and will be staying there again. Also the location is simply the best!

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs- Very nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: ljkdhall
Reviews.Content: Week long business trip to Las Vegas. Trying to save my company a little money, so booked at Harrah's (meeting was at the Ventian, which is essentially next door, but much more expensive). Stayed in the Carnaval tower (their spelling, not mine!). Check-in: Went quickly, clerk was pleasant and helpful. Didn't ask for an upgrade, and wasn't offered one. No problem. Room: Clean, comfortable, had obviously been remodeled/upgraded fairly recently. Was very clean, beds very comfortable, TV was plain, but worked fine. Bathroom was very clean. Elevators to room (21st floor) were commendably quick and reliable. Room was on the 'backside" of the strip, so view was of parking garage 15 stories below, and out over the expanse of Vegas and of towards the mountains. Strip view would have been nice, but the view we had was actually quite fine. As a bonus, I rented a car, parked it on the garage roof, could keep an eye on it very easily, just in case. Casino: There are nicer casinos nearby, but, really, it was OK. Drink service prompt and friendly, easy to find your way around the casino, and to your room elevator. (most Vegas casino floors are very confusing, and easy to get lost/disoriented in, at least for me) Other amenities: Well, except for the Mac King comedy/magic show (which was Great!), didn't really take advantage of any of the casino food/health club ,etc, as most meals were provided as part of my business meeting. But, if you want to save money or are in a hurry, there is a McDonalds and a Denny's right to the North of the building, as well as a Subway in the Casino Royal Next door. Other thoughts: Right on the center strip, convenient to just about everything the strip has to offer. Maid service was some of the nicest and most responsive of any I have ever had in Vegas. Stayed at the Flamingo last time in Vegas, and that was OK, too. But, Harrah's is better. Rooms are nicer and newer, service is better, and Casino floor is less confusing. And, if you like the ambiance of the Flamingo, or somewhere else, the other casinos are all close-by. I recommend Harrah's highly.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel,over priced resturants”
Reviews.Author: rlgood
Reviews.Content: My wife and I staied at Harrah's from11/29/09 to 12/2/09. While the hotel was a good deal ; housekeeping was very lax in doing thier job.Left our room at 8am returned at 4:30 and the room was not cleaned.Had to call housekeeping to then our room get the room cleaned. Went to Harrah's Cafe for breakfast the cost was almost as much as our room. We also tried the buffet for breakfast which cost more then our room. would tell anyone that stay's on the strip at A Harrah's property to go off the strip to eat

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great room - disappointed with service!”
Reviews.Author: HampshireJetset
Reviews.Content: Harrah's has a great location and I have no complaints about the room we had on the10th floor of the MardiGras tower. However, we were treated like criminals for daring to charge $3.50 for a bottle of water from the mini-bar to our room in the middle of the night. Also suprised that there was no Wi-fi in the hotel. We found one of the male concierge staff to be most unhelpful - almost revelling in giving us mis-information and this happened twice with the same member of staff with our requests concerning tours and airport shuttles. Oh and we found the constant harrassment (6-7 times a day) by Wyndham timeshare sales people to be quite tedious. The most helpful person we met was the guy from Hertz car-hire! Would I stay there again - not sure?!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mofunntx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Thanksgiving holidays. Check in was a breeze and the rooms were comfortable. We had a deluxe room in the Madi Gras Tower facing the pool. We could hear the band that played near the pool area but they finished by midnight. Also, could hear elevators humming I'm assuming from another tower because we were not near them. The ac/heat would never shut off when the temp was reached...or maybe we didn't know how to use it. Overall, a very good value for the price. If I was traveling with my spouse we would not stay there as there are many other nicer hotels/casinos. One negative is that they don't have a business center where you can print your boarding pass. You had to pay a min. of $6 to access the internet and print it. This I think is absolutely ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously? Rude staff, dumpy rooms - don't bother”
Reviews.Author: rubygirl217
Reviews.Content: 1st trip to Las Vegas, stayed at Harrahs. I gamble enough in Atlantic City and New Orleans that my room in Vegas was comped. I checked in, went to my room and discovered the only view was that of some dirty pipes and a brick wall. I went to the desk and asked to have my room changed. I was told by the desk clerk that I had already been upgraded to a junior suite (news to me) and there was nothing available. She then coughed all over my paperwork and handed it back to me. I checked in on Monday afternoon and left Thursday. Didn't spend one dime in their hotel/casino - went to the Bellagio and spent tons of money - their service was impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: misspixie62
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Las Vegas for my husband and me. We are from Australia and we came for the SEMA & APEX trade show. So we booked our accommodation through SEMA. It was to my surprise that after booking the accomm. that I saw all these negative comments about Harrah's. What have I done? But we were pleasantly surprise that 1. No waiting time for booking in, 2. our room was ready 3. The room was clean and comfortable 4. The location was excellent close to the everything we wanted to see this end of town. 5.Next door was Dennys Restaurant -good value, McDonalds there too. 6. Cheep beer at the Casino Royal (next door). We had a meal at the Cafe downstairs that was good. We were never in the room during the day and only came back to sleep at night. Bed was comfortable. We really had a good time there and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LHHampton
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Harrah's and was very pleased. Our room was located in the Carnival Tower facing the Mirage and we could see the valcano show at night from our room. At first we were not pleased that our room did not have a direct view of Las Vegas Blvd. but we quickly adapted and loved our view. The beds were incredibly comfortable, very clean room with new carpet, and housekeeping did a great job during our stay. Here's a bonus if you're a smoker - the bottom window in the room actually opens out and the room does not smell of smoke. Being a smoker, it was a great bonus not to be surrounded by my own cigarette smoke. The casino was packed 24/7 and the craps tables were always full. Great location - within walking distance of everything, Star Bucks inside, nice gift shops, fast food places next door, the buffet left a little to be desired taste wise but the Chinese restaurant inside was excellent. Maybe not as upscale as many of the newer casino hotels but we would definitely go back. It was the most comfortable place we've ever stayed and they honored our comps without question. If you're looking for an excellent sandwich, walk across the street to the Mirage and eat at the Carnagie Deli , only a few steps away from Harrah's. Loved it! Had a great visit at Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed many times at Harrahs, disappointed this time.”
Reviews.Author: PegCoSprings
Reviews.Content: We have always stayed in the Carnival Tower, average rooms with views of the cooling/heating systems. Was talked into Mardi Gras Tower room upgrade, still same view of the metal contraptions, and were told we would have view of the strip. To compare the rooms with average vs average. I wouldnt pay extra for the TV cause you usually dont stay in your room to watch it. Coffee Service??? the pot was there, but no coffee. Just wasnt happy with this stay.

Reviews.Title: “great overall”
Reviews.Author: vivageorgia2
Reviews.Content: We always stay in Harrah's when in Vegas, love everything about it - the location. food, rooms and service. One down side is a shuttle service to Rio. Lat Sunday my mom and I had to spend over an HOUR waiting for the shuttle to come, and it was freezing cold! Had we known, we would definitely take a cab, but the driver told us that the next shuttle is on its way, but as it turned out he simply lied to all of us. People were very angry about that , and they were right. I think the management has to do something about it to keep a good reputation of this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: jaqs21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrahs for 4 days and had a great time!! The hotel has a deliciousbuffet (flavors) as well Toby Keiths Country and Western Bar which was alot of fun. Would skip the cafe - food was pretty terrible. Rooms are clean and spacious, bathrooms were big. Great Value for strip location and whilst Harrahs doesnt have an "attraction" it is within walking distance of most of the hotels with attractions. Would definately stay again. Only down side was had to pay for internet and the walls were pretty thin!

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Vegas was awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: Crizzy09
Reviews.Content: We had a blast in Las Vegas and stayed at Harrah's. Let me say first, the food, was incredible... every restaraunt... We loved Flavors and Mings Table the best. We tried a couple of other places to eat outside of Harrahs, but it was not as good. The staff are awesome... There are 2 dealers that stood out and were so friendly and fun... they were Carlos and Jonna.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected--great location!”
Reviews.Author: greenseahorse
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrah's Las Vegas 10/28/09-11/3/09 with 5 of 6 nights comped. No line at check in upon arrival at 4pm on a Wednesday. Check in hostess very friendly and helpful, but would not upgrade room without and additonal fee per night--not worth it. We were given a non-smoking two bed room next to our traveling companions--these requests were honored with no problems. Our room was in the Mardi Gras Tower, but was not one of the newly refurbished rooms. Room was very small, but clean. I appreciate the fact that the hotel has gotten rid of the traditonal bedspread in favor of a down blanket with duvet-like sheets--you at least feel it is clean. Our view was of the Mirage Volcano....and the rooftop below with air conditoners. Would not advise paying extra for a "view". Housekeeping did skip our room the first day. We had to call for extra towels. They were brought to us promptly. After that, housekeeping did a very good job. We left a tip in the envelope every night and the housekeeper actually thanked me for the money--a very polite first for me! Casino was enjoyable, but not my favorite. Did ok on the slots here, was happy to play the five dollar let it ride table for a while. Tried out the Flavors Buffet for breakfast one morning and it was suprisingly good. Went for a late night snack at the 24 hour restaurant and was incredibly displeased with the length of time it took to get a bowl of soup--30 minutes! Waiter did not apologize for the delay...just stated "when I get it, you get it". Poor customer service. Location could not be beat. I have stayed at 6 other strip hotels over the years and loved the fact that I could be out of my room, through the casino, and out on the strip in under five minutes. Mirage was directly across the street and this was one of the few spots that you can actually cross Las Vegas Blvd. on the street level. I would not chose this hotel as a first choice and it is not luxurious by any means. It was a very convenient, economical, and clean spot for a base of operations. In room safe was free and easy to use, felt safe in room. Hallways were not too loud. I would chose to stay again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Room Nice - Resturants awful”
Reviews.Author: mwbjab
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrah's for the first time with some friends for the Big Smoke Cigar convention at the Venetian. Have been to Vegas a few times before but not Harrahs Las Vegas hotel. Harrah's has a great location on the strip. My room was on the 29th floor of the Carnival Tower with Strip view. Very nice room and could see the Mirage volcano, etc. Room was very nice and bed comfortable. Excellent value in terms of room quality and price. Easy check in, no problems with room service. Elevators mored fast. The casino itself is just okay. More happening next door at the Imperial Palace or for a better place the Mirage across the street. The Toby Keith Bar ( had good live music and no cover which was nice. Good night life at this place for all ages. Bar drinks were reasonably priced for vegas. We were really disappointed with the Cafe at Harrahs. Most hotels/casinos have a staple resturant for all meals 24 hours and moderately priced. I had breakfast and lunch at the Cafe a few times. Each time the food was awful and the service was very slow. I mean over 30 minutes to get your breakfast after you have ordered, takes 15 minutes to get to order. Definte impression that this organization really does not care about the quality this resturant is delivering. Servers were pleasant, but hostesses and managers could care less. Bad food, Bad Service. But still Vegas prices. I walked acrossed the street and had breakfast at the Mirage at their deli location. Much better quality and service. Recommend Harrahs managment improve the Cafe Harrahs. Customers will pay for good food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Fooled me once, Shame on You”
Reviews.Author: HarrahsSevenStar
Reviews.Content: Fooled me once, shame on you. I won't be fooled again. I'm a seven star player for 2 years now. If you have heard we are treated special, don't believe it and waste your time and money. So you think you are treated bad when you are a Diamond Player, just imagine how bad it is when you are ignored as a 7star. Staff here are rude, angry that you inconvience them with any question. Computer System broke down for 3 -4 hours, do you think they would credit you with they play, no way. I think the forgot about loyalty. I don't have to stay or play here anymore. I've learned my lesson and will be staying at an MGM property. They treat you like a VIP every time, not just your annual trip. Adios

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Toby Keiths Bar is the best part of Harrahs”
Reviews.Author: bigguyChilliwackBc
Reviews.Content: We went for a getaway from reality and thats exactly what we got. We booked thru Allegiant Air and when we got there we upgraded the room which was definately worth it. Carnival Court is a great place for a drink and the flair bartenders are extremely entertaining. THe Piano bar is a blast. Every night has a different crowd but the more the crowd gives the more the players give. We spent a lot of time at Tobys bar. Leo is an awesome bartender. I have never had such great drinks. Order the mason jar drinks. He put the vodka bottle upside down in my cup and then ran around the bar twice till the jar was 3/4 full of vodka. It was awesome. The house band was great. Harrahs is getting a little old but for the price is still a good base for your vegas fun.

Reviews.Title: “Fun casino and great customer service”
Reviews.Author: TXTed
Reviews.Content: DH and I stayed at Harrahs October 28 through November 2 in a classic room, sixth floor, no view, but we do not spend much time in the room anyways. Room was very clean - housekeeping was wonderful leaving plenty of clean towels upon request. The casino was fun, lots of variety of penny slots, drink service was good once the cw found us, the dueling pianos bar was lively. Enjoyed the Flavors buffet for breakfast one morning - food was fresh and hot - waitress was pleasant and kept our coffee cups full. Every Harrahs' employee (check in, cashiers, housekeeping, security , valet, waitresses) we came into contact with was polite, helpful, and thanked us for visiting Harrahs. And of course the location is a real winner!

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: QIndy
Reviews.Content: To start with they had our resorvation's for the day before our check-in and informed us we were cancelled as a no show but would see what they could do. The next day when I went to take a shower the shower handle kept slipping up to hot, THANK GOD I checked before stepping in or I would have been burned and then the water did not shut off & dripped & dripped,when I called (4am) to inform them they asked if I wanted someone to come & look at it...DUH....YES!!!! On our return to our room (10hrs after my call) NO ONE had come to fix the problem so I called again & someone came to look at it & informed us HE knew of this problem from a previous complaint, but could not fix the problem without drilling the shower handle. No One called to find out if our problem had been resolved or to change our room with a working shower, So instead of a nice shower with my husband he held the handle from outside the shower to make sure I did not get burned. WHAT A VEGAS EXPERIENCE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again....”
Reviews.Author: tucsonkim
Reviews.Content: I have always been loyal to Harrahs no matter what other people said. After this last trip..... never again! I booked a complimentary Deluxe Executive Suite (that i've stayed in before) only to find that there was no way they were going to let me check into that room. I was given several different excuses - mostly to the effect of, you're not important enough to get into one of these suites. The funny thing is.....I have DIAMOND status there! Go figure! I guess Harrahs doesn't want to keep their most loyal customers happy. They were going to put me in one of their basic rooms and i was literally in tears before they put me into a mini suite, which happened to be a shoebox with awful furnishings and a large bathroom. I had to go back down and once again, BEG for a nicer room( which ended up being an oversized basic room). I have never been treated this way before at any property in Las vegas. On the other hand - my mom who had a basic room at ceasars palace booked was upgraded no questions asked to a mini suite with two bathrooms, a huge jacuzzi and a dual headed shower. I will never stay at harrah's Las Vegas again.... you have just lost my loyalty!

Reviews.Title: “One Huge Relaxing Week Of Vacation”
Reviews.Author: teelow
Reviews.Content: This is our fourth trip to Vegas and this time we stayed at Harrah's. What a relaxing, comfortable and exciting location. We both needed a getaway and Vegas is the spot. We are not big gamblers, but we do enjoy comfortable guest rooms and we really enjoyed ours at Harrah's. (See Picture) Nothing fancy, did not asked for anything large, and we had plenty of room for whatever. Great hospitality from everyone, good food and great service and great golf at Angel Park.

Reviews.Title: “mediocre”
Reviews.Author: JWU_CRP
Reviews.Content: stayed for one night. booked the room through harrah's website, $39, weekday. i was assigned to a room with cooling tower view. room is tiny, but clean. some parts are loose in the room. $39 per night on strip, what can you complain.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's = Good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: stuart174
Reviews.Content: Not the nicest hotel on the Strip but does the job. Room was basic but clean. Housekeeping was prompt and efficient. Been there twice now and never had a problem bar the awful Penazzi experience. Great location and monorail is added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATIONS, GREAT CASINO/HOTEL ACCOMMODATIONS!!!”
Reviews.Author: dmbisone
Reviews.Content: Awesome, awesome, awesome! The staff was really friendly, we got a great rate on the room, and the location of the casino on the strip is PERFECTION! No matter what you're looking for, this casino has it! Nightclubs like Pure are across the street and shops are just a few steps outside! Right next to Paris, Flamingo, Ceasers, and Mirage. Tables are always open and the dealers are super friendly. Can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price - will always go back”
Reviews.Author: Cdn77
Reviews.Content: Harrah's is right in the middle of the strip, you can't get any more central than this. The price can't be beat. The check in and check out went smoothly. The shuttle to the Rio is right at the front door. The rooms are very nice and spacious. No noise at all from the Carnival outdoor bar. The pool looks nice, though it is small and I didn't spend any time at it. Housekeeping was always very well done. There is a Star Bucks right in the lobby - perfect place to grab a Vivanno smoothie or your morning coffee. The buffet is really good here as well. I will go back to Vegas again and again, I love it. And I will always look to Harrah's for a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “HARRAHS OFFER LONG LINE UPS & OVERCHARGE ON TELEPHONES”
Reviews.Author: canadiantraveller075
Reviews.Content: I suggest the RIO! Tons better than the 4 days I had to suffer at Harrah's last week. I checked in as a Diamond member only because my client had processed my reservation with this upgrade. God forbid you check in at the normal line up. People were waiting for over an hour - unforgivably bad service as they know how many check ins they get - massively understaffed. No other hotel I know of outside of Las Vegas charges you a per minute usage even when you are making a 1-800 local phone call! The Diamong Club they offer is a joke, the food cheap, nasty and smoke everywhere. My initial suite a/c system sounded like a loud vacuum cleaner. Last but not least every guestroom iron is locked down to the ironing boad - insulting and renders the ironing board unusable.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's Accomdation Surprised Us”
Reviews.Author: TopekaDucky
Reviews.Content: Based on others comments about the size of the hotel rooms when I read the TA Vegas forum, I was kind of nervous about staying at Harrah's since my spouse is almost 6'5" so not a small guy. We both were glad when we finally checked in and saw our room, because it was not only fine but better than we expected. We were assigned a room in the Carnival Tower (happens to be the farthest from the Carnival Court noise which seems odd, but just so you know that little fact...and it was a very quiet room that also exceeded our expectations)! The bathroom was large with a shiney marble floor and large countertop with a sink that offered more than enough room for us. We had requested a King/Non-smoking room and were fortunate to get that, and there was also a table with 2 chairs by the window and also a small couch so plenty of seating space. Our room overlooked the McDonalds and little food court right outside the north entrance of the Harrah's casino and also a view of the Mirage volcano. Housekeeping did a great job, and we were pleased at check-in with the service we received and also didn't have a long wait to check-in even though it was around 3:30PM on a Saturday. We will definately stay at Harrah's again since one of the reasons we chose the hotel was the central location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Monorial Stop, Don't Gamble Here!”
Reviews.Author: Gamxiated
Reviews.Content: I celebrated my birthday a few months ago in Las Vegas and stayed at the Harrah's hotel on the strip. My friend's parent provided us with a free stay, which was one of the best gift ever! Harrah's owns hotel/casino across the U.S., and many in Las Vegas such as Ceasar's Palace, Flamingo, and Paris Las Vegas. The Harrah's hotel is in a fabolous location on the strip next to the Venetian and across the street from the Forum Shops at Ceasars. Harrah's offers two towers and the one we stayed was nearer to the Strip. However, the room we stayed in had a view of the back of the strip overlooking the parking garage for the Venetian. Our room was comfortable and clean, which is all you need in Las Vegas, a place to sleep. We were able to fit up to five people in the room with two double beds. The bathroom and linens were clean. There were now rowdy people in the hallways so the sleeping quarters were very quiet. I didn't personally try the buffet, but my friends ate the breakfast buffet and said it was amazing. However, if you come into Las Vegas late at night do not take the $5.99 steak and eggs offer. My friends and I was not too happy after eating it at the small restaurant downstairs at Harrah's. The monorail stops in the back of the hotel near a bridge the connects both Harrah's and Imperial Palace next door. This monorail can take as far north as the Sahara hotel and down to the last stop at the MGM Grand hotel. My take in the monorail is that a day pass was a waste since we walked on the strip most of the time. If you are in a group, I would suggest riding the cab instead of paying for the monorail. We literally only used the day pass for one ride to the MGM and walked to strip back to Harrah's. I had fun gambling, but lost most of it at Harrah's. The issue I had with the casino in this hotel was that it felt stuffy and enjoyed to more open space the Venetian and New York New York offered to gamblers. I have checked the Mirage and Treasurer Island and remembered it being kind of dark in the casino floor. However, there is this hole in the wall casino next to Harrah's that my friend won big and the minimum bets are smaller than the hotel casinos. I would reccomend Harrah to other travelers because you can't beat the location where it is walkable up and down the strip and nearby major shopping at the Venetian, Forum, Wynn, and Fashion Show Mall. There is a monorail stop in the back of the hotel to take you up and down the hotels on the strip. The rooms are clean, well maintained, and comfortable. Good Luck at the Casino and BON VOYAGE!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: Adir0ndack
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference recently. The 'deluxe' room is misleading. They need to update their rooms. However, staff is very nice and accommodating. Changed my room with no questions asked when I was dissatified with the first one. I was first given a room on the 6th floor then moved much higher. I think the higher floors are a little better. Don't know how they stay competitive with all the other beautiful choices in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel just okay...not planning on ever staying again.”
Reviews.Author: MaryL31
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 5:00pm...I had booked a Classic room (cheapest category) with a Queen bed...of course, the only one available was at the very end of the hall, away from the elevators. Not a strip view...I got to look out at 2 parking garages. The room was spotless...that was much appreciated. I can never understand why the Total Rewards desk is not open in the evening (have stayed at The Rio recently, and it was the same there). No kiosks available to check/get comps. This was annoying, as I was in town for a 3-day all-day seminar at The Venetian, and did not get back to Harrah's until after TW desk was closed. Drink service almost non-existant, and slots were horribly tight, not just to me, but did not see anyone else hitting much of anything. I feel no need to stay here again...ever. Nothing to make me want to go back.

Reviews.Title: “very nice, what more would you want ??”
Reviews.Author: valleyguy38548
Reviews.Content: This is a big, clean hotel at a fair price.. Parking is free and location is central.. Right on the strip in the middle of the action...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Dont pay for upgraded rooms”
Reviews.Author: CEtravelrs
Reviews.Content: HOTEL -Harrahs location is perfect but the hotel has many problems.We arrived at the hotel at 11am and were told that 1 of the 3 rooms were ready. So I explained that we were told that we would have our rooms ready when we arrived at 11am. We were told to come back at 1 and our rooms would be ready, we returned at 1 and no rooms were ready, so I requested that we take the one room that was ready earlier and they told us that now there are no rooms ready. We were finally given our rooms at 415 and they still weren't together like we had requested. The front desk personnel were extremely hard to work with. The rooms that face Carnival Court are loud and you can't sleep until 3 or 4 in the morning. We were on the 9th floor and it felt like we were in the bar. We paid 15 dollars a night for a room upgrade and it was not worth it. The rooms were still outdated and we were told that we had a balcony, the balcony was 2 foot wide and 1 foot deep, only one person could fit on it. So I could wrap up the hotel by saying great location but horrible rooms. CASINO- The casino was nice, a bit outdated like everything else, they had all the games like everywhere else and slots as well. I played mostly black jack and the dealers were nice. RESTAURANT- Buffet was OK food was average nothing to write home about. Toby Keith restaurant was good, service was a bit slow but the wings were great. Dueling Pianos bar was fun, good drinks reasonably priced. SPA-My wife got her nails done at the spa. Like the hotel and casino, the spa was nothing spectacular but the service was good and so were the prices. Harrahs is an ok hotel with ok rooms and an ok casino. Harrahs has many other Vegas properties and I will be staying at one of those my next Vegas trip and not this one.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as one hopes, not as bad as ...”
Reviews.Author: qtrolazyg
Reviews.Content: I agree with several of the reviews. The rooms are dated, but clean. For the weekend fare, I feel like I'm overcharged for my room - with its view of the rooftop machinery. For the gambling crowd who don't spend a lot of time in their room, this might be good. For the business traveler, non-gambler, it's not so great. My room seems dark, worn, and cramped. The noise from the hall and other rooms is quite noticable. The staff does keep the room clean. Since I'm on an extended stay, that is a plus in this corner of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's has a great location/value on the Las Vegas strip.”
Reviews.Author: manymileslady
Reviews.Content: We booked a package (hotel and air fare combined) thru Expedia -- for this second trip to Las Vegas (last trip there was 11/2003). Excellent price, nice coupon book as promised, very comfortable room (although we ended up with 2 queens instead of a king as requested (we said no to a $25 a night upgraded room from the classic we originally booked). Stayed in Carnval tower 2606--very clean, quiet as promised, large marble bathroom, and comfortable beds, & close to the elevator. Pool/hot tub area closed at 5pm (beginning 10/1/09) but was a nice afternoon distraction. We especially enjoyed the 24 hour McDonald's right next door (because Harrah's has no coffee makers in the room) and the $1 marguaritas @ Casino Royale next to McDonald's. Harrah's is an older hotel, but very nice if you don't need super fancy. We also enjoyed the free shuttle to Rio (although we were disappointed that Show in the Sky was on vacation the week of our trip). Harrah's is also a monorail stop and catching the "Deuce bus" is very convenient from Harrah's, although we walked to alot of the other hotels/casino's on the strip. Plan on using your cell phone, so that you don't have to leave a credit card on file at the front desk. Flavors buffet is good (especially with the $5 off coupon per person in our booklet received at check-in).

Reviews.Title: “Location Great, Service Not So Great!”
Reviews.Author: muknikki
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Harrah's before and it is a great location. However, this trip the customer service was terrible. We checked in on a Sunday at 11:30am. My husband and I were traveling with 2 other couples. When we checked in our room was not ready. However, one of the couples's rooms was ready. The 2nd couple's room was not ready as well. We all requested King Rooms. But when the 2nd couple went to check on the status of their room an hour later, their room was ready. When I checked an hour later, our room was not ready. We continued to check every hour, only to be told that our room was not ready. No one ever offerred to search for a different King room for us. They only kept offering a room with 2 doubles, which we did not want. At 4m, which is supposed to be check-in time, when we checked on the status of our room, we were told it was not ready. My husband asked to speak to a manager, and we were told check in is from 4 pm - 6pm, and a manager would not even speak to us until after 6pm. The clerk was very rude to him. Finally at 5:55pm, our room was ready, 6 1/2 hours after we arrived. Once we got into the room we discovered that the light was out in the entrance area of our room. Also our deadbolt did not work. We notified the hotel every day that we were there, and they never fixed either problem. Overall, we were very disappointed in the hotel this trip. We love being in Vegas, but we will not be staying at Harrah's again!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK for the price, other than that we probably will not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: xwelovebuckyx
Reviews.Content: Overall it was okay for the 39 dollars we spent. However the gambling was not good, the food at their cafe was definitely not worth the price (club sandwich and chili bowl for 30!!) and the buffet was so-so. We have eaten better for half the price. Also, the concierge needs a lesson in customer service. We were very disappointed that they would keep people like that on staff. The only thing we enjoyed was the fact that it was connected to Imperial Palace and the location near the center strip.

Reviews.Title: “Honest and Straight Forward Review”
Reviews.Author: j1powel1
Reviews.Content: The Good: For the location on the strip Harrah's and Imperial Palace (connected) have unbeatable prices for rooms, if thats all you are looking for. There is a monorail station right above the lobby, which was wonderful (the stations at MGM and Bally's were LONG walks from the road). All rooms we saw were very clean and tidy, and housekeeping did a good job. The front desk was quick and efficient, getting through long check in lines faster than other hotels we have stayed at. The Carnival Court bar was loads of fun, with bartenders doing bottle tricks and live music (also outdoor blackjack tables), and the Poker Room was nice. The Bad: We were booked into a regular room, so we paid a $35 a night upgrade to a "minisuite". Apparently "minisuite" means that the room has 2 phones and a coffee maker in the bathroom, but is otherwise EXACTLY like a regular room! Don't bother paying to upgrade!  We found all of the food choices lacking, even the "newly remodeled buffet", however that was easily remedied with the short walk across the street to the Mirage, which had great food. The Harrah's Sunday breakfast buffet changed over to lunch at 9:45 am, since when is that lunch time?? The pool in a word: Terrible. The actual pool is tiny and freezing, so don't bother trying to swim. How could a pool in the desert be cold? Because its completely in the shade ALL DAY. If you want to catch sun you have to walk up stairs from the pool and sit on the "sun deck", or as normal people refer to it as: the roof. The most annoying thing by far was the room temperature. They use energy efficient motion detectors on the thermostat, so the AC doesn't kick on if you're not in the room. Unfortunately the wall the unit was mounted on is angled away from the bed, so when you are sleeping the AC never kicks on! Two nights we had to get up in the middle of the night and dance around the other side of the room to get the temperature to a reasonable level. For young people that have never been to Vegas, think twice about Harrah's, or anywhere on the North Strip for that matter. Our group of just under 30's was easily the minority, and the same looked true for all of the surrounding properties besides The Mirage. As an example, we sat down for drinks at the piano bar during karaoke hour, just as "High Ho Silver, Away" started being sung. No thanks. Young people would have much more fun in the South Strip area of Excalibur and MGM, or the insane club scene over at The Palms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: speedwalkermach10
Reviews.Content: Great Place to stay on the Strip. I've stayed on the Southside of the strip before, but wanted a more central location. Staff was friendly and were very willing to accomodate requests. Rooms were clean and roomy. One minor drawback is that even though a fridge is in the room, you were not allowed to use it, as it was only for their merchandise only. Another note to mention is that drink services on the gaming floor was hard to find. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “no problems at harrahs”
Reviews.Author: rowdyHome
Reviews.Content: having just completed our third stay at harrahs,I can say that we are glad that we ignore all the negative reviews. have yet to have any problems with service, staff or the rooms. However, the pool area could use some improvement.

Reviews.Title: “very happy with stay very accesible for disabled”
Reviews.Author: doriek
Reviews.Content: Very happy with check in. Staff could not have been more helpful. Was able to get a room for people with disabilties, very easy to get around, bathroom was huge. Elevators were easy to get to and took you where you needed to go. Have stayed at RIO before but this was much more central. I cant tell you how impressed I was with the gentlemen that checked us in. He treated me like I was a family member when there was an unclear issue over the reservation. He went over and above what I felt was the travel agency fault. The casino was very easy to get around. Restraunts were perfect with nice people working there.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: travelmusicsport
Reviews.Content: Price. Location. Casino. Monorail. This hotel was a great value and I was very pleased. We were upgraded to a "volcano view" room. The same room at The Mirage would have been at least double.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: diva516
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's in Las Vegas the past 3 nights. Our room was comped which was great. We stayed in the Carnaval tower. The room was very clean and comfortable. The staff at the Hotel were all very nice and pleasant. The only down side is at the resturants we had to wait what we thought was too long to get recognized by a wait person to even get coffee. Three times we had to ask someone to get us water or coffee. It was nice to be able to sit and eat and still play some Keno and be able to watch the board, This was our first trip to Vegas as we usually go to Atlantic City. We are already planning on visiting Vegas next year and will stay again at Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: JustMeTexas
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical at staying at this older hotel but since it was free I wasn't going to complain. I have to say I was pleasently surprised. The rooms were nice and the hotel staff was very pleasant. My only two concerns were the casino is much "smokier" than the other casinos we gambled in and the pool area cannot compare to the other pools at the new hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are wonderful...if you get one that has been remodeled”
Reviews.Author: juliewads
Reviews.Content: The pool and fitness center are pathetic! The rooms are nice if you stay in one that has been redone, the old ones are in bad shape!

Reviews.Title: “Geriatric Center Of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: LiamBuckley
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 10 nights due to my employers participation in a trade show and the company selected Harrahs for us to stay in as it was the cheapest offered through the convention booking service. Having been to Vegas before I knew Harrahs is at the bottom end of the food chain so my expectations were dismal prior to arrival but it was not as dire an experience as I had braced myself for. There are 2 towers of rooms at Harrahs. The Mardis Gras and the Carnaval. On arrival at 5PM we were informed our room was not ready - this seems to be a common theme for this hotel based on other reviews. After dinner and some lounging around we finally got our room at 7.30PM - not a good start and the front desk staff were rather indifferent to their customers first impressions. The room was in the Mardis Gras Tower and was small, dark, depressing and had a connecting door to the room next door that was occupied. The bathroom was also small and dark. After 3 nights in this room we moved to the Carnaval tower after being peristant in our complints of noise. I would equate the Mardi Gras tower room to a Motel 6 style room. The Carnaval tower has beeen somewhat refurbished and the room was slightly larger. Bathroom, lighting etc was similar to the previous room. TV's are from the 1980's with poor channel choice and picture quality. The room was only marginally quieter. You can hear your neighbours activities quite easily, toilets flush with an immense "woosh", doors slam easily and if it is a room within 20 yards of yours it is akin to a gun shot if the person is inconsiderate (and let's face it most people are). So in the 10 nights we did not get one uninterrupted nights sleep. I would equate these rooms to an older Hampton Inn. Internet is charged and is not exactly lighning fast. We ate dinner in the oyster bar (mediocre food) once and had breakfast in the cafe. Breakfast quality was reasonable but not cheap - average $20/head (including tax and tip) for a fairly basic offering. There is ALWAYS a wait for a table for breakfast yet the restaurant was always half empty - strange. Valet parking is fairly efficient but you naviagte ridiculous speed bumps to get in and enter through a smelly back part of the hotel. The other guests in this hotel were mainly elderly and obviously on a strict budget. Walkers, riding carts etc were common and the vast majority of them smoked. The smell of cigarette smoke permeates this building and everything in it - nasty. The casino has low ceilings, feels cramped and slots/tables are almost shoe horned in next to one another. If you don't smoke you soon will be in this casino - again nasty. Our room service was reasonabley prompt and the room was fairly clean, carpets did feel a little nasty though. Shower water escapes the tub easily and volume is low. There is a safe in the room and we used it or anything valuable. Basically this is a bottom feeder hotel and casino and is only saved by it's location and an apparantly loyal but aging clientel. If you are over 50, on a budget, smoke 40 a day and have the dress sense of Archie Bunker - this is the place for you. If not don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Adults”
Reviews.Author: Vacation5455
Reviews.Content: We've always stayed at the Excalibur but decided on a different part of the strip this time. Harrah's has a great location on the strip - close to everything. The hotel itself is layed out great. You don't have to walk for miles to get to the rooms or the show venues. And the choice of slots is fantatic. Our room was exceptionaly clean - and had a very nice scent to it. First time I've enjoyed the smell of a hotel room!. We'll be staying here from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Not too shabby - great service!”
Reviews.Author: khamstra
Reviews.Content: While I'm finally getting around to writing this review, I really enjoyed our stay at Harrah's. We got an upgraded suite when we checked in via the airport and were impressed with how big our room was! Additionally, we got room service one night and it was pretty good - I was constantly surprised with the level of service. I love how Harrah's is connected to the Paris too - where my parents stayed - so it was nice being able to easily walk over to their room and meet up with them, etc.

Reviews.Title: “It's my favourite....what can I say!”
Reviews.Author: marcnshirl
Reviews.Content: I just enjoyed my 3rd trip to Harrah's Las Vegas. I had a 5 night stay from the 26th Sept until the 1st October. Check in was for the 1st time ever dismal. 3 agents working on a Saturday afternoon, is almost inexcusable.....however, after a 45min wait, I was served by one of Harrah's friendly staff....and all was forgiven. I was given a room in the Mardi Gras tower. Standard un renovated room.....and it was fine. This is a 3 star hotel and I know what to expect, so no disappointments or surprises. The rooms are around 350sq/ft.....which to me as a solo traveller is ample. The furnishings are of sound quality and the bed was very comfortable. The linens were not scratchy and the towels were fluffy and clean. The bathroom though small was spotlessly clean. The television was the old crt type and the stations were limited. The thing I love about staying at Harrah's....and the reason I chose it over Caesars or Paris, even on a comped stay, are the staff! Just fantastic. I love how the staff are willing to help and are friendly. The poker room staff are brilliant and run a top quality show.
