The tournaments are fun, and the new deep stack tourneys are incredible value for money. The cocktail waitresses at Harrah's are honestly apreciative of a tip, remember your drink and it's always service with a smile. Harrah's location is pretty hard to beat, slap bang in the middle of all the action. Carnival Court is a blast that slowly kicks off after lunch and parties until the weeeee hours of the morning. The restaurants are reasonably priced, the atmosphere is fun, the staff are friendly, the customers all seem to be repeat stayers, the buffet is yummy, the rooms are comfortable, there is Starbucks, the location is unbeatable....there are just so many things to like about Harrah's.... if they were ever having a bad day....it's pretty easy for them to be forgiven....like when I checked in. Would I stay at Harrah's again?...You bet! Would I recommend it to friends, family and fellow travellers?...Yes, if they were looking for a brilliant location at a reasonable price with friendly staff. Is it a luxury hotel...No, but it doesn't pretend to be. Harrah's is a middle of the road place, for middle of the road type of people who like good value for money and a nice comfortable, not flashy place to rest their head. cheers shirl'

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased!”
Reviews.Author: Sadiegirl6
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10/3/09-10/6/09. This hotel is all about conveniences. It is in a great location on the strip. There is plenty of food options in the hotel and in its surrounding outside that are affordable. It is easy to walk to other properties from the hotel; that are also Total Rewards points. I was traveling with seven others who all felt very much the same and no one had any bad experiences. Our group stayed in both Mardi Gras and Carvanal Towers. The rooms were very clean, the beds were comfortable, but our alarm clock did not work. We stayed in a standard room and the decor was slightly modernized but needed TV upgrades, etc. The housekeeping staff was friendly, they did not knock on your door at 9:00 am wanting to clean them and did a nice job when they were through. The bartenders were cool and talkactive and the drinks were reasonable. Carnival Court is constant action, the bartenders put on a show. There are different bands playing throughout the day, dancefloor, $3-$5 drink specials. If you wanted to drink in your room, the hotel had two mini convenience stores that you could get alchohol, mixers, beer, cigarettes and gifts. If what you are a looking for is a good, solid hotel that can basically accomodate most types of Las Vegas travelers and wallets, then stay at Harrah's. It is not a value motel, but it is also not a posh resort. If you you are looking for a more standout, upscale experience, then you would not like Harrah's. My only real complaints were that I had to pay $10 to use the gym, no free wi fi and I did not like talking to their Reservation agents (not at the hotel - over the phone). They weren't very friendly, they sounded annoyed with me for only asking simple questions. I booked the reservation through Expedia and needed to make special requests for the room and they really wouldn't work with me. The reservations they had on file, weren't what was stated on my Expedia reservation. Expedia had to call them and get things corrected, twice. The booking part of the trip was a pain. Outside of that, this hotel completely suited my needs and we enjoyed staying there. I'd choose there again but would book direct with them, they seemed more helpful if you did.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's Was "OK"”
Reviews.Author: Wiley12
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at Harrah’s about 10 years ago when groups of guys would go from college to Vegas for a weekend. Harrah’s was cheap and in a good location. Plus, we were college guys, what did we care how the rooms looked or how the service was. Well, 10 years later and not much has really changed about the hotel. I stayed there as part of a wedding so I did not have a say in the matter. Going into the stay I pretty much knew what to expect from previous experiences, reading reviews, and looking at pictures. This is one of those situations where you have expectations of what your hotel experience was going to be. I will admit that my expectations were a little lower than what my experience was so that was a bonus. Pros: - renovated rooms, to a point. New color scheme of linens and updated bathroom look. - great location on the strip - good Starbucks locations - very friendly dealers and valet and bellmen - super sized Wheel of Fortune wheel - a craps table in the sportsbook ($5) Cons: - very outdated tv’s in the room - unfriendly front desk - very loud doors that close with a loud THUD - could not keep the water in the shower to save my life - uncomfortable pillows - strong smell of smoke - not many good views - ridiculous sized speed bumps Overall, not a place that I would choose to stay but would not be overly disappointed if I end up in a situation again where I do not have a choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: b1941
Reviews.Content: Booked with Harrah's for several days beginning on September 28, 2009. No problem with checking in as the personnel were very friendly. We had free rooms but upgraded to one of the new renovated rooms (they have coffee pots) on the 15th floor overlooking the strip. Everyone seemed very friendly, helpful and I never felt unsafe in going back and forth to our room by myself. This makes about the fourth time we have stayed here because it is centrally located on the strip. Casino seemed to be full all the time we were there. Will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs was OK.”
Reviews.Author: Gigibeanz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrahs from 9-27 to 10-01, Room was located in Mardi-Gras tower #745,no view what so-ever overlooked roof and other side of hotel. AC unit in room was warm,maid service was good,and most hotel staff was good, The hotel could use a major make-over,this hotel is not like the gorgeous one in Atlantic City, The hotel is in a real prime spot on the strip. In my opinion, Harrahs was OK. I had the rooms comped and was with a buddy so we overlooked many small things but if I was with my wife she would not have been happy.

Reviews.Title: “try it you'll love it too”
Reviews.Author: hank1to
Reviews.Content: I read some of the reviews and I was a little leary of booking here. The line at the front desk moved very quickly, and we were in our room in about 20 minuets. Before noon, as we were early. I had asked for a mini fridge and they were there in 15 minuets, also someone locked the safe and housekeeping was right on it, 5 minuets. The room was on the 15th floor and at the end of the hall, which we asked for..it was very Quiet all week. Housekeeping service was great every day, rest of the hotel staff were friendly and attentive. Dealers were fun as well, We ate a few meals in the cafe and were happy with them as well. I don't know what all the griping is about, we had a great stay and we will be coming back for a second one for sure. Didn't make any money, but didn't loose my shirt. Thanks!!! Harrahs, for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Gambling - Great table service”
Reviews.Author: GibboCat
Reviews.Content: We did not stay at Harrah's - we were at the Mirage, however we spent many hours gambling in Harrah's. Great table survice particularly from CAROL who served the rapid roulette table - she is the best! Friendly feeling overall in this casino. Big thanks to Carol, you kept us at the table for many hours and the drinks were great. Can the management of Harrah's forward our thanks and reward her for outstanding performance. Thanks from the four Brits on the p*ss!

Reviews.Title: “casino great, service awful”
Reviews.Author: finsman45
Reviews.Content: multiple trips (harrahs twice), love the casino, all dealers are exceptionally pleasant and we had a ball. the servers (not all) were as rude as i had ever experienced. Tried to get change from one ( to give her a tip) and was told that was my problem. An old bartender in the sportsbook made my drink wrong and when i brought it back, he said GET THE HINT. Planning another march trip and not sure what to do

Reviews.Title: “Avoid rooms facing the Carnaval Court”
Reviews.Author: cmstengel
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our annual trip to Vegas and decided to stay at Harrah's for the first time since we always end up having so much fun there. It is definitely one of the "happening" casinos - lots going on all the time. The location has to be about the best - you can walk almost anywhere you want to go and there are lots of choices for food from restaurants to fast food. There are 2 Starbucks in the hotel which I loved. We were in one of the newly remodeled rooms in the Mardi Gras tower - rooms were pretty nice, beds were wonderful - like sleeping on a big marshmallow. The only drawback was that our room faced the Carnaval Court and that party never seems to stop. We heard loud voices and music until 4 in the morning every night. If you are drunk enough to pass out it is okay - otherwise don't plan on having any peace and quiet. The hallways are also very loud - there was a pretty big gap in the door all the way around where the light comes in. Maybe that helps contribute to the loud noise level. We mentioned to the clerk when we checked out that we loved the rooms but didn't like all the noise and she pretty much said that our room was comped so quit complaining. Whatever - doubt we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: vegasregularsandyut
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Harrah's many times and have always been very satisfied with rooms. Yes, color sceme could be up graded and LCD TV'S. Have always been clean. Enjoy having coffee pot in room, great plus to the expensive hotels which you do not get so you have to go downstairs and pay fortune for cup of coffee. I have always had check-in and out personnel to be very nice. I'm fortunate to always having comp rooms and quite frequently automatically upgraded to a mini king suite. You can't compare amenities of this mid priced hotel to very expensive hotels. Has great mix of slot machines and great location to strip and monorail.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: Cory1972
Reviews.Content: Do Not Stay Here. Staff is terribly rude, rooms are small and ugly, pool is very small. Had to have the door between my room and the room next door fixed because they didn't lock. The tub would not drain when taking a shower, never did get that fixed. They charged us $5.00 for opening the frigerator, which I found out later by my Wife that there was nothing even in it. No coffee pot in the room and no free Wi-Fi. This is in my opinon the worst hotel on the strip and I have stayed at four of them so far. The staff alone is reason enough not to stay. I actually had a manager that didn't even acknowledge me while at the information desk and the old lady at the information desk was so rude and seemed to not even care about the issues I had. I can not believe the experience I had at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs Las Vegas was FUN!”
Reviews.Author: SOJOgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed and Harrahs Las Vegas for 4 nts for a convention. We stayed in the new updated Mardi Gra tower. The rooms were nice. The bed was very comfortable. I slept like a baby. Usually in a hotel I am up all night uncomfortable... not here. Although if asked again I might not choose a room on a low floor overlooking the pool like we had... It was a little loud when the band was playing. Also, having such a low floor(4th) made me feel as if we were at the pool when I looked out. But we were on the floor with the SPA. I had a massage, facial and a manicure. It was a great experience. I have been to many spas. The technicians for my services were top notch. Unfortunately the relaxation area with the HOT tub could have been updated.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Stay”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelduo
Reviews.Content: Our room was updated with flat screens in bedroom and bathroom. Service was excellent. Location is the best on the strip, no need for taxi's . Overall had a wonderful stay & will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Food and LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: Like-Clean-Rooms
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights at Harrahs Las Vegas - Rooms were clean and nicely decorated - housekeeping service was efficient and timely - food was good - and can't beat the location - center Strip!

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's security supervisor out of control and should be arrested”
Reviews.Author: VegasSucks
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights with wife, 25 yr old son, and 21 yr old daughter. Toilet leaked in one room. Noisy hallways made it hard to sleep. Rooms would get hot at night. My son had too much to drink one afternoon and was a little wobbly. The security would not let me take him to his room. He was not the least bit violent or being verbally offensive. Security supervisor Keith Smith created a situation where there was none. I was physical abused and verbally threatened by this "man". Please avoid all Harrah's casinos.

Reviews.Title: “great value!”
Reviews.Author: jjacks70
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Harrah's for the first time and was pleasantly surprised! I got the 3 nights comped on my Total Rewards card, and I hadn't even played that much. Then I got a petite suite as my comped room, which I was shocked to get. The room was very nice. It was clean and the bed was very comfortable. My boyfriend also has many comped nights to choose from since he got his Total Rewards card there and we are planning another trip later this year. I thought about staying in another Harrah's owed hotel instead, but I've decided that the location and the casino itself is worth staying here again. We did ok on the slots, probably broke even, which is a win to me. We looked at the pool, which just seemed ok. The buffet had a pretty good breakfast. It is a nice comfortable place to stay. We had a coffee maker since we were in the suite, which I'm grateful for, but the regular rooms don't have coffee makers. This will be dissapointing if we get a regular room next time. Overall, you can't beat the value and location of Harah's, and I've stayed at many of the hotels on the strip! It is a fun place!

Reviews.Title: “Shweaty Harrahs”
Reviews.Author: Andreroux
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel, the most disgusting service i have ever received in my life, The rooms are small the showers in the bath, the food is very average. Rather stay at Planet hollywood a fraction cheaper however the value is tremendous. The pool at Harrahs is a joke guys beware of this hotel, i would say the worst hotel in Vegas. I would rather stay in Arizona in a tent at the bottom of the canyon than Harrahs. A def no-go STAY AWAY!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Alright stay”
Reviews.Author: ausytraveller
Reviews.Content: Even though there were mixed reviews for this hotel I booked it because it was on special 40 dollars a night AUS, so i couldn't really go wrong as it was located in the middle of the strip. Although everything is close by, because Las Vegas is so hot it is difficult to walk long periods of time. It is situated near the monorail which is a big plus. The check in was slow because the staff was busy chit chatting to the guests before me. Also the concierge was not at all pleasant or helpful maybe because it was busy. i asked the concierge to confirm my transport to the airport and would not do it and told me to use the payphone. The rooms were adequate, had a safe, and the appropriate amenities, I was at the carnaval tower. However, I could hear every noise made to mankind. Could not sleep well but got earplugs. The buffet was really good, had fairy floss,crab legs, chocolate fondue, really nice for 24 US. Overall it was a good stay for the price compared to other hotels I visited like Circus Circus or stratosphere. If it was any expensive I would not book it.

Reviews.Title: “I Love Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: CincinnatiVegasgal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's for 7 days 5 of which were comp. The rooms were great, the beds were so comfortable and the location is wonderful. I rented a car and we only drove it a couple of days. You can walk to everything. The staff was great . I will stay at Harrah's from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the Negative Reviews. Harrah's is the BOMB!!”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii96744
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 5 night stay at the Harrah's. The Hotel staff makes this hotel. From the front desk to the cleaning people - all were friendly, and extremely helpful. As a blackjack player, I must say Harrah's has the funniest, friendliest dealers on the strip (and believe me, I've played everywhere!) Donnie, Gary, Judy, Lyle, you all ROCK!! The rooms are clean, beds comfortable. The water pressure in the showers could be stronger. Room service and house keeping superfast. Yes, we ate there too. The buffet is huge! The Range steakhouse is spectacular - biggest lobster I've had in years. My husband was especially fond of the wee morning steak and egss deal at the Cafe for $5.99. I could go on and on. We will definitely stay at the Harrah's on our next visit to Vegas!! Mahalo!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay #2, probably not a 3rd”
Reviews.Author: winstonSaskatchewan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at Harrah's, we had booked a package with Westjet vacations to stay at Harrahs with accomodations in a deluxe room. As we had travelled last year to Harrahs with Westjet vacations also in a deluxe room we new what we were to get. Upon checking in the rude clerk told us that we only had confirmation for a classic room, even though all of our documents, hotel voucher and receipt clearly showed that we had paid for a deluxe room, she insisted that it should have been only a classic, well upon going over this again with her, she finally went to her manager who said that as a favour they would upgrade us to a deluxe room, excuse me, a favour, this is the room we had paid for. I am sorry but we travel to Vegas 2 to 3 times a year, and we will never stay at Harrahs again because of this. As we have stayed at Harrahs we chose the deluxe room, because of the slightly upgraded room with comfy beds, the room is very small and the pool virtually useless, but the location is good, that is about all Harrahs has going for it. Next time I would actually rather stay at the Imperial, we have stayed here in the past for a cheap room, and hey they at least treat you with respect. Didn't let this ruin our vacation, had a great time in Vegas as always.

Reviews.Title: “Patio - what patio?”
Reviews.Author: Esqbaby
Reviews.Content: We got a cheap rate through Expedia - and when checking in asked if they had upgrades. We were told by a very rude woman that for $25 extra a night we could go to Mardi Gras building that had a patio and better beds. It was the world's smaller "patio" - more like a Juliet balcony - with pigeon crap all over it. The pool was lame, room service people were great. Would most likely NOT stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It ain't the Wynn”
Reviews.Author: Califblondy
Reviews.Content: This is place is old and fun (kind of like me). If you want fancy haul it on over to the Wynn. You don't always get what you pay for in Vegas and if the room is free or cheap, who cares? The Harrah's Total Rewards card gives lots of good comps and I'd rather stay for free at Harrah's or Imperial Palace than pay a fortune for down pillows on the bed. Harrah's is in a great location on the strip, Toby Keith's bar is fun, and the food is good in the cafe too. I'm staying at Harrahs again next month.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable-priced Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Volier
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrahs from 8/17 to 8/22. We had purchased roundtrip shuttle services so they dropped us off at Harrahs about 10:30am. We waited about 5 minutes in the check-in line; however, our room was not ready. Was told guests ocuppying had not checked out. So we left our luggage with luggage services and check out the areas. At about 1:30pm, we checked back in to see if our room was ready - it wasn't. They had another room in the Carnival Tower that was 2 queen beds that were available so we took it since we wanted to check-in and put our stuff away; besides, the King bed wasn't important (this is what we had reserved). Ours was a non-smoking room on the 7th floor. I thought the room was decent given the price we paid. Everything worked - we had no problem with it. We spent most of our time out and about so the only time we were in the room was to sleep. As most say - you get what you pay for. There was some noise (like a woodpecker pecking) but when we called the front desk we were told that it was due to construction and that we shouldn't hear it during bedtime. True to their words. Our room was a reasonale walk to the casino floor. We thought the location was a good place on the strip. We checked out all of the hotels on the strip during our stay. Looking back, I didn't think the Harrahs was smokier (meaning a lot of smoke floating around) than most. I think what it was is that it has a heavy smoke smell due to poor ventilation, perhaps? Outside of that it is the same as most other hotels. We thought their buffet was OK - we had coupons so that helped with cost. We at their Cafe' restaurtant and I thought for the price we had paid for 2 breakfast entrees - we would've found more value at the buffet but couldn't go there because it was after breakfast hours and we wanted breakfast. We also ate at Ming's Table - didn't like it so much. They have express check-out service via using menu on the TV. Based on others' reviews of the long lines, we took advantage of this feature and used the Express check-out. We didn't use any services while we stayed there nor touch the bar fridge so our account was '0' which made the Express check-out much easier. We then left our luggage with luggage services and kill 2 hours inside the casino until our shuttle pick-up services arrived. For the most part, we were comfortable with our stay at Harrahs.

Reviews.Title: “The Harrah's Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: humbah222
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, the rooms were big and the price was right. The checkin staff were among the friendliest I have ever come across in my travels. The only criticism I have is that the restaurant food was terribly expensive and not quality for what I paid. Also the information desk kept giving me wrong information, the cleaners knew more then the info desk did! All in all a hotel I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location dead cheap rates, Katherine at front desk is a marvel!”
Reviews.Author: Mkspangenberg
Reviews.Content: Ok so Vegas is Vegas. I go all the time and to be honest it is not one of my most fav places to go but i wanted to see the Phantom Show at the Venetian Hotel. We paid the extra expensive full price to be in the front row so my friends stipulated the hotel had to be cheap. This was a gem find. Less than 5 minute walk, the room was huge, and almost free. The rate was so ridiculously low and to boot I had a coupon on top of that. All was well with the stay. The lines to check in at any Vegas hotel is always long.You have to just expect that. Every time I go I wait in line and I have stayed at the very fancy and expensive ones too so I won't hold that against a hotel. It really wasn't that bad 10 minutes max and it was worth the wait because the girl who helped us was a gem and even gave us a free fridge! I found the casino was not as smokey as the other places in town ( liked that) and I loved the little bar they have out back with the 70's band. That was a hoot load of fun! You really can't beat the location and rates. I do have one complaint though. I left my power cord in the room and called right away. All of my calls have not been returned. This I find very dissapointing. Even if they did not find it( Even though I know it was there when I left so the maid stole it I am guessing) I would have appreciated at least a call back. I( rude but so Vegas) I even offered to have it shipped on my dime.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Everything!”
Reviews.Author: RobertRedin
Reviews.Content: Wow... I just can't believe that the rooms are so reasonable for a hotel casino right in the middle of everything. The staff is so friendly and very good service. Carnival Court and the Flair Bartenders are so entertaining I can't stop telling people about it, I have never had that much fun watching a bartender make my drink before, a definate must. I have stayed at other hotel casino's before when visiting Las Vegas, Now Harrah's is my home away from home. The only BAD THING IS my stay there is never long enogh.

Reviews.Title: “Great first stay - and I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: royski69
Reviews.Content: I chose Harrahs for my latest trip because I had been wanting to try it, and I received 4 nights comped in a "Deluxe" (renovated) room. I arrived Thursday evening around 8:00 pm with no one in the line to check-in. The check-in clerk was unable to give me the "Deluxe" room type because the smoking rooms in this category are only on the 3rd floor, with no view--and I always like a high-floor with a view! So I accepted a regular room on the 25th floor of the Carnival tower with a nice view of the Mirage and the exploding volcano! I got my view! The room was decently furnished and had everything I needed for my stay. The weird thing (that I had previously heard from other reviewers) is that the HVAC system is motion-activated. When you are not in the room, it doesn't cool down. It begins when you enter the room, but because of this setup, it never seemed to get as cool as I wanted it. The location is perfect! Right on the strip, with easy access to Imperial Palace, Flamingo, Caesars, Mirage, Treasure Island and the Venetian. The monorail is steps from the back of the property. Also, shuttles to various off-strip properties are in back by the valet/shuttle area. Very convenient! I used the spa 2 different days, and went after 4:00 pm when the price drops from $25 per day to only $10. I also sat out at the pool 2 days, although the pool deck is very small and doesn't accommodate a lot of chairs, so I had to sit up at the "over-flow" area. This wasn't too bad, although I would have rather have sat with a view of the pool. Very frequent drink service, though! I only ate at one restaurant, which was the Flavors buffet for breakfast one morning. Good food, and I was able to use a $5 off coupon that they hand out in the Carnival Court area. I also got coffee each morning at one of the 2 Starbucks coffee locations right outside the Carnival elevators, or at the 24-hour McDonalds right next door to Harrahs on the strip. Gambling was not real kind to me until just before I left when I hit for $450 on a .25 cent machine. But I still enjoyed the selection of slot machines and video poker machines (I do not play table games). I didn't put a lot of points on my Total Rewards account during my stay, but I was glad that my room was free and didn't need to play for the comps (well, I guess I previously had done that!!!). I hope to stay at this property again, although I enjoy staying at different properties every time I go to Vegas. But if this is within your price range, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great First Time Experience”
Reviews.Author: sholove99
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas. Stayed at Harrah's Augsut 20th-26th for my 25th birthday. Check In is at 4:00 pm but we were allowed to check in early (11:00 am). Check in was rather smooth. Harrah's was cool. The rooms were clean, beds comfortable, the pillows were even better . The only complaint that i have is that the bathtub did not drain properly. It was like taking a shower and bath at the same time some days of the trip. In the early part of the morning the water was cold sometimes especially on the weekend. We ate at the Flavors buffet in the hotel which was okay. It was better for breakfast than dinner. The crab legs at dinner were fantastic. Harrah's is located at the center of he strip. The slots were okay there. The hotel was fun, there is a very live atmospehere, there was karoke inside and party outside not too much to disturb you in your room. Harrah's is directly located near the monorial( which is pretty pricey its better to take a $ 7 bus trip over a $13 monorial trip). If you want to gamble at a reasonable rate go old vegas, the freemont experience was great. We spent alot of our time at O'Sheas and Bills Gambling Hall. The are right down the street from Harrah's and also accept the total rewards card.Overall, Harrah's was a good experience. I would definitetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent trip!!!”
Reviews.Author: CenValTravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's Monday 8/17 through Thursday 8/20 and had an excellent time. Check-in time from arrival at Valet Parking until we were on the Casino floor - 30 minutes. Room was ready, very nice and quiet all during our stay. Staff has always been great! We wouldn't stay anywhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience...And I hadn't even made it past check-in”
Reviews.Author: SeacoastNHJasmine
Reviews.Content: We had a confirmed reservation with Harrah's in Aug '09. To make a long story short, Harrah's was not accepting our reservation at check-in. We were stranded in Vegas, 2,000 miles from home and after HOURS of trying to get into a room to relax and start our vacation I called the MIRAGE across the street and they got us in. Within 10 minutes we were poolside and spending our money at MIRAGE. I should have known better not to stray from a hotel as nice as the MIRAGE...we even tacked on one more night there.

Reviews.Title: “Brief and Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: CanadianBoys
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one (1) night before a stay in another hotel we had booked. This was our first stay ay Harrahs LV Casino and Hotel and we really liked the room and service. The room was very clean. We had a downtown and north strip view on a high floor. The room was a premium room, bright and clean as were the hallways and other parts of the hotel we walked about. We have played the casino previously and we enjoyed our time once again. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Multiple visitor to Harrahs Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: St_LouisBrenton
Reviews.Content: We stay at Harrahs Las Vegas twice a year. Perhaps we have been very lucky, but we have never encountered the negative things reviewers have written about this hotel. The casino and hotel are clean, easy to navigate, and the hotel and casino staff are cordial. Carnival court with Wonderboogie and the piano bar provide great, free entertainment as well. It's not a 7 star luxury hotel, but I don't think it claims to be. Harrahs Las Vegas will continue to be our casino/hotel of choice when visiting Las Vegas. I recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable stay”
Reviews.Author: travelchick66
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Harrah's Las Vegas from August 16 - 20. I was quite scared to stay here after reading some of the reviews. I had booked the trip through WestJet Vacations. When we arrived there were two couples in line ahead of us, two clerks helping them. We only had to wait about 5 minutes or so to be served. It could have been the time we arrived (8:30 at night). The check in process was quick. I had asked for a King size bed, and shockingly enough they did not have any. I was then asked if I wanted to upgrade (I said "no" immediately) or we could come back in the morning and see if there was a King bed room available. We had decided we would take the room with two queen size beds. Since I had paid for all the taxes etc., unless we were going to charge things to the room, I did not have to leave a deposit or a credit card. We said we would not be charging anything to the room. We were directed to the Mardi Gras Tower. We were on the 16th floor. For the 5 days we were there we never had to wait for an elevator, and mostly we were alone in the elevator. The room was fairly decent. It looked like it may have been updated within the last year or two. We very rarely heard any noise in the room, except if someone used the bathroom, then you could hear the water/toilet. Check out was very simple. We used the in room tv check out, the keys were left in the room. Which worked out really well, as the line for check out was very very long. We ate in the Cafe three times, the service was OK but it was expensive. And you can't beat the location. Right in the middle of the strip. Overall we were happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Robbed Blind”
Reviews.Author: althurman1
Reviews.Content: Robbed Blind ‎ - althurman1‎ - Today The hotel was in aged and average condition Hotel staff very min able at best upon check out I found the had charged my account $150.00 for what they called a comp upgrade anybody staying in this hotel needs to be careful .. Don't expect the kind of amenities or service you would hope fore in a upscale hotel .I will never stay in this shack again given the choices in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “First time at Harrah's and it was just OK”
Reviews.Author: Susieq1047
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrah's for the first time during a recent trip where I divided the time between Mirage and Harrah's. I have always wanted to stay there. (Never go to a lesser hotel directly after an awesome one FYI...lol) I was staying on a comp but still had to come up with 100.00 per night for "incidentals" which I think is ridiculous on a comp but whatever...it just made things get started wrong... The walk to the room was quick and easy. We were in the Mardi Gras tower. I like the Harrah's breakfast buffet and did like the fact that my players card was also a line pass so we did not have a long wait. But with that being said..we already knew we liked it . Might not have chosen it if I was judging it by the front desk folks. The room was small and worn and cramped feeling. It was clean enough but just seemed a little dank or something. It was supposed to be an upgraded room but I really don't know. It seemed a little dumpy to be the upgraded version? I know , I know, you hardly see your room...but I want a place to put my stuff! No closet just a Chiffarobe. Most storage space was taken up by the refrigerators of over priced goodies. Had to lay my phone on the floor by the outlet to charge! The casino folks were friendly. The casino itsef was a little and a bit widy curvey and tight old but I enjoyed it. The walk to access tbe strip was simple except for when you were going thru all the vendors. The Valet parking was a little slow and getting into the valet parking from the strip is a Full On Nightmare... Like I said the place is okay but I won't go back and stay there. I will find another Harrah's property. I actually like IP much better as far as the room is concerned.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond Players avoid this property.”
Reviews.Author: Randall0987
Reviews.Content: I reserved a Deluxe Executive Suite on a comp offer on the website and when I arrived I had to practically beg for what turned out to be an oversized,rundown Classic room! Outside of being larger than the very small standard room it was terrible. Harrahs seems to take pride in offending their best customers! Diamond Players stay away from this property!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Harrah's I remember”
Reviews.Author: AcRsp
Reviews.Content: We stayed there Sunday through Friday and it was horrible. Our room wasn't ready until almost 5 we got there at 10 am. I complained and got no response. Would never stay there ever again

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed My Stay”
Reviews.Author: mswhite810
Reviews.Content: Went to Las Vegas for my bithday weekend. The hotel room was very comfortable. The room was very clean. We had a leak in the tolet when I called maintenance they arrived to my room within 5 mins. I arrived early and even though check-in is not until 4 pm, I was able to check-in around 11:00 am. Check-in was a very easy and fast process. This was my first visit to Las Vegas and Harrah's and I will recommend them. I really enjoyed my stay at Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, excellent”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveller305
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harrahs for 5 nights in July 2009. Excellent location at centre of the strip within short walking distance to other major hotels and attractions. We paid next to nothing to stay here ($16 a night per person). I was overwhelmed by the welcome by the concierge and frontdesk staff on our arrival. This was not my first visit to Las Vegas, but this by far was the best hotel on the strip. We were 4 adults sharing a room and there was sufficient space for us all including 7 suitcases! We also spent a lot of time at the pool area during the day and we found that there were sufficient sunbeds and the staff at the pool bar were also welcoming and accomodating. I don't have a negative comment for this hotel an excellent stay was had by all.

Reviews.Title: “Paid for a view room, didn't get it, no refund”
Reviews.Author: GD2004
Reviews.Content: So the hotel has some rooms that are older, a little worn out. like this one. Okay. I paid in that category. I also paid for a "ROOM WITH A VIEW OF THE STRIP" per their website. I got a room with a view of a parking garage and a partial view of the tops of a few buildings. And was charged the rate for a full view room. And upon complaint was told, well, you had a kinda sorta partial view so that's good enough for you, and worth the additional $20 you paid for our kind of older, worn out room that SUPPOSEDLY HAD A VIEW OF THE STRIP. There are a million hotels in Vegas, most of them with better deals that $69 on a weeknight for an old room WITHOUT THE VIEW THIS PRICE CLASS ADVERTISED ON THE WEB. There are a million hotels in Vegas, ALMOST ALL of them with better customer service than this. Hmmm... why do you think Harrah's almost ALWAYS has available rooms? Hmmmm....did it ever occur to you that one of the people staying in one of your rooms might be a travel writer? Hmmmm...

Reviews.Title: “Good Time with only Two Complaints”
Reviews.Author: crmo2
Reviews.Content: I arrived at Harrah's on Sunday, August 2nd and departed on Thursday, August 6th. I always stay there. On the plus side: 1. Great location in the center of the strip, within walking distance to many casinos and places to eat. 2. Good service staff. beverage servers, slot attendents, check in /check out(except one) and housekeeping. 3. In house attractions: Legends in Concert show, Dueling Piano Bar, Rita Rudner show and Mac King Show. Out side: Carnival Court. 4. Free shuttle service to other Harrah's properties. 5. Monorail access. 6. Quietness of room. 7. Variety of slots. (Didn't win much but no one does anymore.) 8. Variey of places to eat. I utilized Flavor's buffet. 9. Security personnel. 10. Elevators, never had to wait more than a couple of minutes. Minus: 2 exceptions that I experienced. 1. Upon checking in, the card key wouldn't function. I believe that the locking mechanism had become demagnetized. Had to go up and down in the elevator to the lobby check in 3 times due to this and was given a suite for my inconvience. 2. I am a Diamond Card holder and was supposed to receive priority service when checking out. This did not occur and had to go to the end of the line of the regular line. I have written Harrah's regarding this..Like I will receive a favorable response? In summary, I enjoyed my stay there and will choose this property again when revisiting Las Vegas, probably in October.

Reviews.Title: “We love Harrah's!”
Reviews.Author: tar4963
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Harrah's and everything was great - the room was very comfortable. No waiting at the check-in and our room was ready when we arrived. They gave us a bunch of coupons which was nice - I recommend the Mac King Comedy Show and Legends in Concert - they were both great. Harrah's is in a great location - all the "main" casinos are in walking distance. We always stay at Harrah's in Atlantic City and this was our first time at Harrah's in Vegas and we will go back again. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: scoprion98
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrahs on July 28, 2009 - August 4, 2009 in Mardi Gras Tower Room 1514 which is a deluxe room. We asked for an upgrade to a Deluxe Suite but they wanted $75 per night and we would have to move to another room on the weekend so it wasn't worth it. The room is really small. I think it's good for one person. You cannot share the bathroom because the mirror is made for a single person. Also, the TV in the bathroom is good if you are sitting on the toilet. I didn't use it. I thought when people mentioned the TV in the bathroom, it was the kind that is IN the mirror but I was wrong. The tub was dirty so we asked housekeeping to clean it again. The tub and sink would not drain properly so we asked maintenance to fix it three days in a roll before it finally worked properly. Maintenance were nice and showed up quickly but I want things fixed the first time around. Housekeeping should have noticed when she was cleaning which gives you an idea of how well they clean...This room had a view of the Mirage Volcano and you can hear the music even with the balcony door was closed. It didn't bother us because we weren't sleeping during that time. The room was pretty quiet although you can hear the toilet flushing next door. The side table moved in circles but the granite is not secured so just be careful. The location is awesome. There's a McDonald's next door for cheap quick eats. We ate at Mings Table and the Cafe at Harrahs which are both mediocre food. I'd rather go eat at other places and highly recommend Mesa Grill at Caesars and San Marco at Venetian. We took the monorail and walked everywhere. Cabs were readily available and there is a free shuttle to the Rio. Going there is usually not a problem but you may have a wait coming back unless you're a Seven Stars, Diamond or Platinum player. Spa at Harrahs was okay. Facility is very mediocre and massage was okay. Definitely go to Caesars - awesome facilities and my massage and facial were also awesome. All the properties are running summer specials so they're at excellent prices. Also had a manicure at the Riviera which was decent. Pool at Harrahs was okay. There's a place on the right side with misters so you can stay cool. There's also a sundeck upstairs on the left hand side. However, Caesars pool was much nicer even though there was construction around, the noise wasn't that bothersome. Casino is small and there wasn't a lot of choices. I lost several thousand and I felt like they didn't care or pay that much attention to rate me. I only had $26 in comps. I felt Caesars was much nicer and took care of me. Ballys was okay. Even though my room was comped based on my previous play, I don't think I would stay there again. My boyfriend said he would stay again but he wasn't in the room that much. I think if you have never stayed in Vegas and don't need a high class place, this is a good place for you. Next time, I think I'll try Caesars.

Reviews.Title: “I had a great time at Harrah's!”
Reviews.Author: Nautee
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with Harrah's service. I'm not a high roller just a gal on vacation and was greeted every morning in the halls by housekeeping. My room was small but clean and that's all that matters to us. The casino staff was helpful as well as the front desk. I had booked a king but only queens were available when we checked in. Pool area is smaller than the big resorts but seems to make sure that its being used only by hotel guest. Nice little outdoor bar for adult beverages while taking a cool dip. I will be staying at Harrah's again in the fall.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Stay July 31th thru Aug 3rd”
Reviews.Author: RetiredIBEW
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the newly remodeled deluxe rooms on the 14th floor. The room was clean with a lot of nice features. The large flat panel TV had good reception and the smaller one in bath also had good reception. The room was quite when sliding glass door was closed. The bed was very comfortable with extra pillows for setting up in bed. The buffet is about $5.00 over priced, but good quality. The drink service is very quick even when you are not playing the machines. The dueling pianos are a very good act, both the twins and the two guys. The outside bands are very lively. Great location on the strip, easy parking very friendly staff. This is our 2nd trip to Harrah’s; we usually stay next door at Imperial Palace. The quality is better at Harrahs but costs more. I would recommend Harrahs to anybody looking for nice clean casino in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “good deal”
Reviews.Author: momof7pa
Reviews.Content: i would stay here again in a heartbeat. it is located right in the middle of the strip. some of the newer hotels may be fancier but are at one of the strip or the other. i don't know about you but i don't go on vacation to sit in my room. this hotel is very clean and the staff was very helpful. the breakfast buffet was very good. all in all i would recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs Las Vegas July 19 -24, 2009”
Reviews.Author: Ktgirl
Reviews.Content: We are in our mid 50's and have stayed at Harrahs twice before. We always enjoy the friendly staff and casino also the short distance from your rooom to the strip. I had a comped room this time and did not ask for an upgrade or view. We were on the 6th floor of the Mardi Gras Tower. Very quiet and a short distance from the elevator. Beds had good linen and were very comfortable. I spent one day at the pool. Quiet and relaxing, no loud music that day anyway. An older crowd. A few young people but no kids. I ordered lunch there..food was good and reasonably priced. Drink service was good also. There were cabanas but none were in use that day. Drink service was good in the casino anytime of the day or night. Overall a good midpriced hotel right in the centre of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Be Prepared for a "dirtier" Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ButterBeanie
Reviews.Content: The cheap hotel prices and airfares recently offered on various travel websites lured us to Las Vegas for the week of the 4th of July. For airfare and hotel for 5 days and 4 nights, we paid $375.00 a piece. Great price, you bet. We stayed at Harrah’s which was okay. Again, keep the price in mind. As many have noted, the casino is very smoky and the decor looks old and washed out. It is listed as a 4 star hotel but I would say more like 3 at best. There were two things that I really noticed about this trip to Vegas. The first was that no one was winning anything, except at the craps table where the odds are best. No noisy, squealing slots, no excited Black jack players, no nothing. The bottom line, casinos are hurting and they need to make up for their lost revenue somehow. Gone are the days of inexpensive food as well. The second things I noticed was how trashy everything was, the streets, the hotels, the kiosks and even the people. Again, keep in mind the cheap prices and I think you can understand what I mean. Men standing outside of casinos giving out very graphic escort cards didn’t help much. I felt sorry for the people with young children. Bottom line, if you are going to take advantage of the cheap prices, makes the decision to spend a bit more and stay at a nice hotel such as the Wynn, Venetian or Bellagio. Once you realize that you don’t want to not be walking the strip viewing all the trash, you will be glad you have a nice place to go to.

Reviews.Title: “Only negative on an otherwise positive trip !”
Reviews.Author: tacoOhio
Reviews.Content: After booking 6 month's in advance i was asked to take a smoking room to have a room close to friends. It stunk, so i called the front desk to see if i could change and i waited on hold for 20 minutes with no answer. so i went to front desk and waited in line another half hour only to be told no empty rooms.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel perfect location”
Reviews.Author: wenderek
Reviews.Content: was very worried no one in england had heard of this hotel but we had the best time the room was clean and very comfortable the staff were friendly and hotel was so clean . the hotel was in the best location right in the middle of the strip ,your room has no fridge but if you tell them you need a fridge for medicines you get one free of charge. was extremely happy and cant find any faults with this hotel will go back to this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Not such a good deal”
Reviews.Author: califmom78
Reviews.Content: After at least 4 yrs. of being a high roller at Harrahs, staying there about 18 times a year we are ready to go else where. Since the new owners took over it has been going down hill fast. Everywhere you look they are making cuts. From rasing the prices for food, not giving you bottle water at the cafe or buffet, no place mats and when servered a drink in the casino they will only give you a napkin if you ask for it to all of the other cut back they are making. All of this in the name of saving money. The front line employees are still great and you won't find any better anywhere but even they can not make up for the cheapskates that now run Harrahs. I understand that Harrahs is cutting back but they are not maintaining any kind of good customer service becasue of the lack of personnel. If you're in the main part of the casino during the peak hours security is okay, but if you are staying in the hotel there is no security to prevent any drunk or thief from following you onto the elevator, which has happend to me. The call girls have even figured out that they can now do business there. My husband was approched by a call girl on Sunday at 8 AM and a couple of other people told me that the same thing had happened to their husbands, boyfriends or sons. Harrahs was a classie, safe place to stay but not any more. Now I would compare it to being only a step up from Whisky Pete's at Stateline. For the overall cost it is not worth it any more.

Reviews.Title: “best place in vegas”
Reviews.Author: greatOntaio
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about how great all the staff are from the first day the room we had requested to the day we were to leave on the last day i became very ill they called EMS their own medical people i was put in the hospital they made sure my daughter had our room for as long as we needed at the lowest rate i think they could go plus a free nite they where so kind the food there was awsome other then getting ill look forward to going back had agood time. S.Spence

Reviews.Title: “Best Bed”
Reviews.Author: MastaFace
Reviews.Content: Of all the hotels we have stayed in on the Strip, Harrah's had THE most comfortable bed. After a long day af walking and gambling it took 2 seconds to fall asleep. What a delight to wake up in a few hours, fully rested and not achy at all. The room was a bit small and the overall hotel was not the best but not dumpy either. That bed made up for any shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “Heads, it's nice. Tails, not so nice.”
Reviews.Author: gottamove34
Reviews.Content: I may have put down an overall rating of 3 but it's more like 2.5. First off, I truly dislike the current practice of offering a low rate at the time of the reservation only to fly in and find out there's a large deposit required in order to check-in. Whatever happened to, "we just need a credit card for incidentals." This draws my ire and a considerably lower rating. The best part of my stay had to be the location, parking, and housekeeping. Harrah's is on the central strip, offers decent parking, and housekeeping was very kind and consistent. If it weren't for the housekeeping, I probably would've checked out early and stayed elsewhere. The worst part of my stay involved check-in (second worst ever) and the old television in my room. I think I was in one of the rooms that still needed a TV upgrade. Some things remain a constant. Range Steakhouse was fantastic, the gift shops I find very friendly, and it remains a terrific base location for the strip (as if it were gonna move anytime soon.) ;) I've stayed at Harrah's before so I know what it's like to have things nice and not as nice. All-in-all this is what I consider the Strip's average casino. Great location with a few random surprises.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back to Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: gracie123Voorhees
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with this hotel. It started with us waiting almost 45 minutes to check in. That's just crazy. Although once we got up to the desk, the woman was pleasant enough. The hotel and casino needs to be updated. And the pool was the worse! There was ring of dirt around the rim of the pool. And there are no trees or cover of any kind. It was like swimming on the streets of New York City. I almost got a 2nd degree burn when I touched the metal railing of the hot tub. If you go the Vegas to relax at the pool, find another hotel. The room was ok but no real amenities because I got what I paid for, a standard room. Nothing horrible but nothing special, either. When we got home, we found that our iPOD docking station was missing from our computer bag. We put the computer itself in the safe, but not the docking station. It was definitely taken during our stay at Harrah's. All things considered, I would not go back to Harrah's Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall but showing signs of the Vegas economic depression”
Reviews.Author: MizunguhowRU?
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at Harrahs at an excellent rate of 42.00 a night. Nice clean room and pleasant enough atmosphere.. Services were hampered by the obvious cutbacks in staff. Check in only had two staff and I had to queue for over an hour despite it not being a peak time. I arrived late at night after a 12 hour drive and after the check in ordeal ordered room service. It took 2 hours to arrive and the harried but none the less pleasant server told me he was working alone. Its really sad to see the staff who are obviously depressed and worried but still trying to paste on a smile and be professional. The in room internet was free YAY! but not working for two of the four days...Those things notwithstanding this is still a good choice with its mid strip location, older furnishings but still very comfortable rooms, and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great 2 Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: kornkd02
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Harrah's Las Vegas to say the least it was a very good one! The deluxe room was a great value at just 69/night (The one flaw was the Band at the Carnival Bar played until 3am). The service was great, and everyone was very friendly. Added with the prime location on the strip made for a great birthday weekend with the wife. I would highly recommend Harrah's to anyone and I will be going back next time I'm back in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “My last trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: DallasKaait
Reviews.Content: I traveled with friends to Vegas from July 3rd to July 7th. I had not been there for about 3 or 4 years. This time we stayed at Harrahs on the strip. Harrahs is in a great location. Right in the center of all of the action. If you don't want to rent a car, it is a perfect location since it is within walking distance to the Flamingo, Ballys, Cesars, Imperial Palace, MGM Grand and Paris. We got an upgraded room at check-in. We asked for a fridge for my friends medication, which they said was no problem and would deliver it to the room promptly. Check in time ( line) took about 50 minutes. The room was nice and clean. Very comfortable beds! However, the fridge did not arrive after waiting approx. an hour so my friend took her meds and put them in the "mini bar fridge" and we went on downstairs to gamble. When we got back that evening, the fridge still had not been delivered. We called the front desk and she told us it would be delivered in a few minutes. Again after waiting an hour we decided to go to bed. At noon the next day, stilll no fridge. We called again and finally after about 30 minutes the fridge was delivered. My friend changed her medications from the mini bar to the regular fridge. Harrah's machines need to be upgraded. They still have the same old machines from 10 years ago. They had very few new machines. The machines did not pay off for us. The machines at our local Indian casinos are so much better and newer and they actually pay off! Be prepared to pay for every convience at Harrahs. They charge 4.99 at their ATM's for money or balance inquiries. They charge 3.85 for a glass of tea. An 8 ounce bottle of water is 3.95. 12.00 for a sandwich. An extra 2.00 to get anything to go from their resturants. It cost 5.00 to use their internet to try an access our boarding passes. The internet never did work for us after putting in 10.00. Some drunk on the second floor came out of the Toby Keith's bar and decided to hit me HARD on my butt while I was trying to get the internet access to work. He thought it was halarious. It has been 3 days and I still have a hand sized bruise on my butt. If I had not been so stunned by his actions, I would have immediately called security. Instead, I waited for about 5 minutes and called them when I got back into my room. I asked the front desk to put the 10.00 back on our tab since the internet never would work. They said they had nothing to do with that and I had to call the internet provider to get a refund. I told them about the man hitting me, they connected me with security, who told me I should have called them from the location it happened. Silly me, I thought they had security cameras everywhere. Oh well, live and learn. We had a nice dinner for four at the Outback Steakhouse. Steak and lobster tail for each of us , 3 teas and a water with tip was 176.00 We paid 60.00 per person at the Rio for the seafood dinner and I would not recommend it for the price. Over the course of 4 days, using our Harrahs cards and playing at their sister casino's we only recieved 41.00 in comps. But the biggest surprise of all was at check out. They charged us 50.00 for using the mini bar for my friends medications. Apparently, if you use their in room fridge for anything personal they charge 50.00. NO EXCEPTIONS!! I am guessing that is why it took 2 days to get the fridge delivered to our room. I guess when the economy is bad and people are not spending as much money gambling they feel they have to rob them any way they can to make up the bottom line. Anyway, that was my last trip to Vegas. I will drive the 30 miles to the Indian casinos where they have great comps, all of the newest machines that actually pay off and treat me with respect. Over the years I have been to Vegas probably 20 times. I have stayed in the some of the least expensive to the most expensive hotels. I have found the best way to do Vegas is to rent a condo, and rent a car. That way you have all of the comforts of home and a car to go anywhere you want to go, anytime you want to go. The condos are usually about 150 to 250 for a week and the car is about the same. The condo will usually sleeps at least 4 and has washer and dryers, dishes, cooking utensils, outdoor grills, complete kitchens, a jaccuzi in the condo and a pool outdoors.

Reviews.Title: “Best location,Best Deal,Best buffet,Love the outdoor carnival theme !!!”
Reviews.Author: scenicrentals
Reviews.Content: We had the best time ever , great deal and room was very nice good size and away from noise .Great selection of economical food and stores One minor complaint staff at other harrah's have been much more attentive but for price don't mind if they don't look up when they talk to you . Will definitely be back !!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: lwdlcds00
Reviews.Content: Me and my mom and my two boys stayed here while visiting family that lives in Vegas. Everyone was great and very nice even to the boys. Would definitly stay here again, great location and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Surprise”
Reviews.Author: dedhedinwv
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Harrah's for our vacation. After reading the reviews I was scared to death because a lot of them were negative. Harrah's was totally awesome. I was stunned. The room was neat and tidy, roomservice was excellent, and my husband upgraded our room to a "view", because it was my first Vegas trip. It was a perfect view. I could see the full volcano erupt at the Mirage. It was perfect. I did learn a few things as a first time Vegas visitor and expecting the worst. I feel obligated to share. 1. There were lots of negative reviews about the "smokey" smell of the hotel/casino. HELLO! The hotel was built in 1972, people were smoking EVERYWHERE (you couldn't escape it). Have some freaking sense people! Smokers are going to smoke hence a "smokey" smell. I think a lot of the reviews were dramatized. My husband is allergic to tobacco smoke, he did not have one allergy attack. It wasn't that bad at all. 2. There were lots of negative reviews about "upgrades with a view". OK, I personally think that when people hear "a view" they think of the movies where you can see the whole strip. That ain't gonna happen at Harrah's, youre in the middle of the strip. The views are great but don't set yourself up for disapointment. 3. There were lots of complaints about the rooms, plugs, and things of that nature. What I don't understand is, why would you go on vacation to Vegas and sit in your hotel room and play on your laptop, text on your phone, and watch TV. That is a waste. The rooms are totally efficient to those who go to Vegas to play. If you have other intentions this is not the hotel for you. Only bad side of the room, no in house coffee pot. That sucked. There where a few other things that I wish I had a warning about. Here's the tips for first time Vegas vacationers. 1. Plan extra cash for food, we sooooo underbudgeted meals. It's not cheap to eat in Vegas no matter what people tell you. 2. There are people handing out "dirty" business cards everywhere. A teenage boys dream! These cards end up scattered all over the ground and can be easy to slip on. 3. Don't get obliterated drunk in Vegas. C'mon people, it's ok to drink but know when to say when. I thank God I have a big heart, I helped quite a few girls find their hotel rooms when they could barely walk. One girl was in the wrong hotel. Not good people. I personally think Vegas is not for families, but who am I to judge? I did have a personal problem with people with babies in their strollers, walking around at 1 AM. I do think that's way inappropiate. Please people, Vegas is great and I wish I would of had my little boy with me to see LOVE, the Volcano, and the Bellagio fountains. But as a parent, I know he can wait a while to see that stuff, plus I video taped it for him. Overall Vegas is an adult town, not recommended for small children. MY OPINION ONLY! Last tip: Check on Toby Keith's Bar and Grill. Good food, great service. A real hardworking and sweet serving staff.

Reviews.Title: “Check-out surprise ruined my stay.”
Reviews.Author: Habs93
Reviews.Content: I booked a classic room, but upon arriving I decided to pay $15 more a night for a newly remodeled room in the Mardi Gras tower, after my $20 sandwich trick failed to score me a free upgrade. The room was nice, and it included an LCD tv. The bed was really nice, and they provided plenty of pillows, and a duvet, I believe. The view was kinda stank, but none of the Harrah's rooms offer a really good view of the Strip. The bathroom was also nice. Granite counter, nice tiles, a nice big mirror and a shower that provided plenty of pressure and hot water. But, my stay was ruined upon checking out. I left a cash deposit, so I had to visit the front desk before checking out. I was informed that I owed $60 in long distance charges. I asked how this could be, as I only used the phone 4 times, for a total of 10 to 12 minutes. The clerk told me there was a $11 fee just for connecting. WTF? How do they justify this? They can't! They only charge the ridiculous fee to fleece unsuspecting guests. Very greasy!

Reviews.Title: “When I go to Vegas again I will not stay at Harrahs!”
Reviews.Author: newjerseyirene
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 6/27/09 until 7/2/09 and paid extra to have our room upgraded. The room could have used a refrigerator and coffee pot. We stay at Harrahs in Atlantic City all the time and the new tower there is beautiful. I can't imagine what the room would have looked like if we didn't have to pay for the upgrade. The shows were good - comedy at the Improv and the Legends concert. The cocktail waitresses were nasty. We had booked a tour to the Hoover Dam and at the desk where we purchased the tickets we were never told since it was a Sunday there would be horrible traffice due to people going home to Arizona and California. The tour guide informed us of this but it was already too late we had purchased our tickets. The woman at the desk should inform customers when they are purchasing tickets. We were lucky because we did not have plans for that evening otherwise we would have been late returning back to the hotel. Once on the bus the air conditioning was hardly working and everyone was complaining since the it was 107 outside. The tour guide was great but the company shouldn't have sent the bus out - and this was booked by Harrahs. The pool is horrible compared to other pools in the area. Also,played slots for 5 days and couldn't win anything. We went across the street to the Mirage and we won!!! A few days into the trip my husband got ill so I called my own doctor for a prescription. When I asked the information desk where the closest pharmacy she told me there was one near the MGM. Had to take a cab there only to find out from the valet that there was one right near the Venetian - next hotel near Harrahs. They should be more informed. So next trip I will not stay here - maybe will try a sister hotel. I still love Harrahs in Atlantic City much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great time”
Reviews.Author: tannn257
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 5 night stay. I read a lot of reviews and thought that it was going to be a nightmare getting the correct room that I had booked. I had a room comped at Ceasers but then as I was watching the sight they had the executive suite at Harrahs available comped for all nights. So I switched my reservations because I was taking my son for the first time to Vegas and he is 25. I thought the suite would be better because it has a separate bedroom. Also Harrahs right in the middle of it all. When we arrived at the hotel I was prepared for an argument but when I checked in they didn’t even ask any questions and gave me the keys to the suite. What a room this was. There was a huge bedroom, huge bathroom with Jacuzzi with a separate shower area and a living room. The living room had a fold out couch for my son. No view but I never ask for a view. If I want a view then I would take the helicopter ride over Vegas. The maid service was great. We left notes and when we returned we had everything we asked for. Absolutely no complaints with the staff, they were all very helpful but I also didn’t have a lot of questions for them being I have been there in the past. Check out was a breeze. Check out early am and use the bell service for your luggage, there are no lines. The pool wasn’t the greatest but I only was there in the morning reading the paper. Things were great. We are going back in a few months and my son wants to stay at Harrah again. The weather was in the 100’s but if you take the monorail then that helps you get out from the heat. The best part of the trip was I won 3 jackpots, 2 at Harrahs and 1 at Bills. I have stayed at alot of Harrahs resorts in Vegas and AC and have never had a problem in Vegas, only AC.

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs enjoy life”
Reviews.Author: RoyLichfield
Reviews.Content: Overall very good and an enjoyable experience. Check in was ok but was made to give a credit card deposit of $200 even though I paid in advance, the way they refunded it meant I now have an oustanding CC bill beware if travelling from outside the US as you will lose out. The room on the 27th floor of the Mardi Gras tower was everything i wanted spacious nice bed and bathroom which was fine. the view was not the greatest but having been to vegas many times before hardly bothered me. The facilities at the hotel are fine, try the spa the facilities are good nice gym sauna stream room etc. the pool is fine , I am not one for lying by the pool bou swim and the poo was good first thing in the morning to swim in The buffet is the best I have eaten at in veas in a long time, the cafe was ok and I never tried the rest. I enjoyed gambling in there , but would prefer no smoking (when will they finally ban it) as it can get quite smokey in there. Location is superb no buses or expensive taxis to catch you can walk everywhere from here on the strip. I would definetely stop here again

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: MOM52mom
Reviews.Content: First night, no hot water, not even warm, they moved us next day, but because the room was not ready, they had to take our luggage to bell station (another tip), we were told to come back around 4, not to stand in line, just walk up and ask for key. I did this, only to be screamed at by one of the front desk clerks, who had no business working with the public, which embarrased me and actually made me cry, because I was sick, running 103, the manager tried to make me happy by giving me a $30 room service credit, which at check out they tried to charge me. The next 6 nights were in a room that the AC sucked and would not go below 78, but the front desk people are the main problem, they are rude and I would never, never go back. Harrah's your hotel is really going down hill.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NashvilleTNGuy
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed in room 722 of the Carnival Tower June 25-27, 2009. The Good: Location! This hotel is center strip. Easy walk to other properties and there is a "food court" right outside of the door. We did not eat there. There is a Starbucks right off of the elevators too. Room was fine for 3 guys. It is a little small but we didn't have much with us. Room was clean and has a safe. Harrahs is willing to work with you on price to get you in the door too. The Bad: Self parking garage is confusing to enter. Table limits were $10 even on slow mornings. Casino Royal is right next door with lower limits. View from this room was of the parking garage. No big deal.

Reviews.Title: “great locaton”
Reviews.Author: snowball22
Reviews.Content: I would like to start by saying the rooms were very clean and spacious and the bed was very comfortable. That was the best part of the stay. I would suggest that they put a coffee pot and a small refigerator in the rooms. It would have been nice to be able to make a cup of coffee when you wake up. The negetive part was when we made the reservations I was not told that the hotel asks for a credit card and then charges that card $100.00 per night that you stay, even if your room is comp. You can imagine my surprise when they wanted to charge me $600.00 without telling me. Most hotels will take your card and hold it with out a charge until you check out. I would highly suggest that the reservation people explain this policy when the reservation made.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel..pool..just ok..”
Reviews.Author: kittypaws30
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Harrah's from May 4th- 9th..Upon checking in @ 11:30 a.m. our room was ready, we had a room on the 15 floor in the Mardi Gras tower..rooms were nice, nothing to complain or rave about...but when in Vegas..no need for a big fancy room. I was not impressed with the Casino. the layout did not make me want to gamble there..We liked the casinos on Freemont Street..much more variety, and the waitresses were always around!! Harrah's is right in the middle of everything, we went to the Revolution club at the Mirage..so wearing my heels wasn't a big deal because of the short walk. The pool was ok, smaller than alot of other Vegas pools, but we were able to find two pool chairs..and were out there till the closing time of 6..drinks were 10 bucks a piece for a daquiri, which I guess is reasonable..overall we are staying again in the end of August so I guess they got us to come back.. ( no problems with smoke in the room and we are non-smokers..

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!! Never again”
Reviews.Author: angryTexas
Reviews.Content: My stay at Harrah's was from June 18-22. Once we arrived, I expected to at least be greeted kindly, but instead, I was greeted by a very grumpy woman who only appeared to be anxious to clock out. We were offered to pay $10 more for a room with a view, to which we agreed to do. Needless to say, once we walked in the room, it was old, it smelled bad, and the view was overlooking the air conditioners. I called the front desk to be moved to a renovated room, which she agreed to move us, however, since it was still an "upgrade", we still needed to pay $46. My girlfriend checked in that same evening and was given the same room for no extra charge. The staff insisted that it was still an upgrade and the charges needed to apply. No one was flexible to give me a reasonable explanation on the charges. I can tell you that this was the last time I will step foot in that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: FrankOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: They say the first person you meet sets the tone for the remainder of your stay and I never knew how true that is. I recently checked in at Harrah's while on a get-away trip with friends. When I got to the desk the girl was the most rude person I've experienced in a long while. McDonald's drive-thru staff have better customer service skills. I looked at the other checking in guests and they all seemed to be equally as miserable but the one I had won the prize. Since she couldn't handle the check in, 'Alame' didn't get anything right with the rooms. During the process with her perceived problems she went to a supervisor for assistance who seemed to just as unhappy with his job as she was. So, the check-in was terrible, the rooms were not right, and the rudeness of this person set the tone for the rest of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: udanim1
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas and my in-laws whom we traveled with love Harah's so that is where we stayed. The price was definitely reasonable, the room was clean and the pool was basic but totally satisfying. However I did have issues trying to get clean towels delivered to the room. I did tell management and they credited our room a small amount for our inconvenience. I thought the pillows were nice but the bed seemed a little hard for my tastes. If I were to go back to Vegas, I would definitely pay a little more and stay at the Venetian, Wynn or Mirage. The casino was ok but not as nice as some of the other hotels. I was upset that in order to use the fitness center, you had to pay a daily fee. As much as we were spending eating there and in the casino (not to mention paying for the room itself), this seems like a no-brainer in order to not annoy your guests. The hotel was in a great location in the center of the many other casinos which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “In Vegas you only need a bed”
Reviews.Author: CWVirginian
Reviews.Content: Harrah's is good enough because you'll be so drunk you won't care that it's only a three star hotel! The rooms are clean and you might get a room with a view if you ask, but who cares, it's Las Vegas! Go have a drink at a Blackjack tables and forget about your issues with the hotel. Do eat at the Penazzi restaurant rather than "Flavors".

Reviews.Title: “Hotel - good value for the money ; Casino - run down & dingy”
Reviews.Author: Twobings
Reviews.Content: Harrah's offers a reasonably priced hotel for such a great location. It is across the street from Mirage & Caesar's Palace. We upgraded to a room in the Mardi Gras Tower from the Carnival Tower after finding our original room smelled like smoke even though it was a non-smoking room. We were told all the rooms in the Mardi Gras Tower have been recently refurbished/updated. If the view from your window is important to you, stay away from Room #506 and other even #'s rooms around it and the floors below it as it faces the heating/air conditioning units. The room was well appointed & spacious. We could not hear hallway noise but we could hear our neighbors very well through the connecting suite door. If you like your room kept cool, keep the air conditioning set at the lowest temperature. We think the a/c might be motion activated since we found it became cooler the longer we were back in the room as if it wasn't on all day long. We pulled the curtains closed to try to keep the room cool but the maid service pulled them wide open every day after cleaning the room. The ammenities bar is set up with some kind of monitoring system that will charge you for just removing the item from its spot so if you do not want what you see, don't even move it! Bathroom was spacious and clean. Towels very clean. Shower pressure not so good but adequate. Flat panel television in the bathroom was a nice touch. Bed was very comfortable and sheets & blanket were very clean. Onto the casino. Unfortunately, NOTHING influenced me to gamble here. The casino is very dingy & outdated. I was surprised that Harrah's has let it go so much since it also owns so many upscale casinos on the strip. The slots are boring & the tables mundane. I'm not sure what the theme of this hotel is as it's trying to be many things for many people at the same time. I would suggest they hire someone to clean the glass doors of the main entrance every 30 minutes as they are full of greasy handprints all the time. Nothing is inviting to the outside passerby to stop by & gamble. Skip the restaurants especially the cheap steak & eggs late night dinner. Go to Denny's for breakfast a few steps down the street. You'll save a ton of $$. I'm predicting that this casino will be the next one to be imploded because the cost to update & refurbish it will be more than to just start over. If I had to stay here again, I probably would for the reasonable cost, the location & clean/comfortable rooms. Hope you enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “No where better....”
Reviews.Author: Lynneth10
Reviews.Content: We booked two adjoining rooms one for my handicapped husband and I and one for my 83 year old Mother who has health issues. We needed to keep her close as she takes needles for diabetes. We arrived late at around midnight on March 22nd and there were no adjoining rooms available. Our clerk discussed something with his manager and we were put in a two bedroom, three bathroom suite adjoining overnight and my Mother woke up on her 84th birthday in luxury as she deserved. They let us stay there until 1 or 2 pm and Susan Hayward (I believe was her name) on the phones constantly reassured us there would be an adjoining room available. Within an hour we were settled in a great room adjoining my Mother and we thoroughly enjoyed our trip and the first class service we received everywhere in Harrah's. We will be returning. Way to go Staff!!!! Lynne Kowalchuk - Winnipeg, Canada
