Reviews.Title: “so'so stay at Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: prdtpc
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend I and stood at Harrah’s from June 7th till the 11th for a quick getaway and some fun in the sun. At Harrah's you get pretty much what you pay for an average hotel at a very good price 40 US a night. There are some pretty good things about staying at Harrah’s for one the location is amazing, Harrah’s is pretty much center strip so if you want to go on the gondolas in the venetian or see the fountains of the Bellagio it’s all a short walk or a monorail stop away. Secondly contrarily to what people say I felt the prices at the restaurants were pretty reasonable. We ate at Toby’s on two occasions and our meals as well as our drinks came out to 35 dollars or less on both occasions, “12 dollars for two pitchers of beers is a great deal for all you drinkers out there” Check in was a breeze we arrived at 10am and our room was ready for us and we got free coupons to see Mac king “with purchase of drink at show”. The rooms are pretty small true but you’re in Vegas there is no need to stay in the room for long periods of time. Now for the bad, the pool is terrible. They are definitely going to have to close the pool soon and change the lining on the floor it’s lumpy and falling apart and to top it off the pool area is extremely dirty. We stayed there for four nights and went to the pool every day to tan and there was a bloody bandage right next to the steps of the pool from the day we checked in till the day we left. Also we went to use the Jacuzzi at nine thirty am one day only to find that there were cups and beer bottles still laying around it from the night before pretty gross. The room we were staying in seemed to lack any plugs so if you wanted to charge your cell phone you would have to either unplug something or charge it in the bathroom. For all those who have already booked a room at Harrah’s beware check your credit card statements while you are there. Harrah’s ask for a deposit when checking for room service and incidentals the receptionist will say you can either give her two hundred dollars in cash for this or your credit card will be charged one hundred dollars a day on incidentals, which the hotel will hold until you check out. Needless to say we gave them cash only to find out two days later that they were taking money out of my card anyway, I had to go downstairs and speak to a supervisor twice before they fixed this needless to say it was a big headache. Overall the hotel is average I would say above average if it weren’t for the terrible pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: CanadianRockies
Reviews.Content: No coffee pot in room, would have been nice, (stayed last time a Planet Hollywood, same thing no coffee pot), would be nice if one was provided. Left time for cleaning lady, but had to keep asking for her to leave conditioner, if didn't would replace used one. Cocktail waitresses seems in all of the casinos, were very rare, but noticed that at the tables there was always one there, machine players spend just as much as table players would have been nice to see more cocktail waitresses. Overall the hotel reception was very helpfull with our questions we had.

Reviews.Title: “Below Expectations”
Reviews.Author: moneygirl55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Harrah's for 6 nights from June 9th thru the 15th. We stayed in the Mardi Gras Tower, which was clean but very small. Upon arrival we updated to a newly-remodeled room, flat panel TV, nice bedding and a safe. We got a view of the air conditioning unit and a brick wall. I was really surprised to see that there was no dresser space, and the only drawers in the room for storage was the two bed-side night stands and a tiny set of drawers in the closet. The bathroom was nice, and there is a flat panel TV in there, but who needs that ammenity in Vegas? You were in the bathroom no longer that you needed to be, due to the loud noise that the vents made when you turned on the bathroom lights. This was our 5th trip to Vegas in 4 years. We love the city and have been to some really nice hotels. We will definately not be staying at the Harrah's in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: SuzyQz_9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here June 9-13th. This hotel is average at best. Stayed in the Mardi Gras tower on 14th floor. Very clean, but very small. Bare bones.. This hotel was extremely crowded and noisy too. The carnival court offers nothing but LOUD music. Found it miserable to even sit out there and sadly that is the only place you can sit outside other than the pool area which is not even good enough to call BLAH. I could have picked Flamingo for the same price. Having seen Flamingo I can tell you I made a huge mistake.. The ONLY good thing about this hotel is the location. It's in the middle of everything. If you just want a place to lay your head, this would be an ok choice.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: SANANTONIOLADY
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my stay...June 10th thru 13th. Upon checking at 8:OO p.m. we were conventially told our rooms weren't ready !!! Then they offered to upgrade our room for an addtl. $10 per night.....THEY should have upgraded us at NO CHARGE...! They stated we would have balconies,etc....WE HAD A BALCONY view of a horrendous building...SOME VIEW...!!!Walls in room are paper thin. Heard "carnal" noises from the room next door. They need to upgrade the ventilation system in the casino area....!!! Horrible issue's with smoke. When we went to the Venetian is was totally diff.--NO SMOKE issues there..... I will say the piano bar was fun....THE LOCATION is very convenient though......!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Pantherpower12
Reviews.Content: This was my WORST experience in regards to as Harrahs property! Was offered a COMPED Premium Executive Suite but when I got to the hotel was told this was not available, and was told I would be given a premium room. This was unexceptable and eventually after a half hour of complaining and dealing with hotel managers was given the suite. Suite was OK but by now I was very frustrated. Ate at Toby Keiths Bar and Grill and was VERY disappointed, way overpriced and not that great! Cafe was also not very good and very overpriced for a cafe. The topper was when I got home I noticed a $98.10 charge on my credit card for a room I didn't stay in, and to this day they will not refund my money. I'm in the process of getting the money back and will pursue it until it's refunded. I will NEVER stay at this or any other Harrahs property ever again and that's unfortunate becuase we stay at the HArrahs in Reno and have always been treated good, this Harrahs was a HUGE disappointment!!!!!!! I would never recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Better than some, but many are better”
Reviews.Author: Bigbeef56
Reviews.Content: This place has some sort of generic feel to it. Nothing sexy or exciting about it. The pool at my gym is actually bigger than this hotel's. The Carnival Court was cool and the food was decent but pricey at a few of the restaurants we visited. The machines were tight. It's a clean hotel and the employees seemed very eager to please but it just dosen't have the "POP" that a place in the middle of the strip should have.

Reviews.Title: “Much, Much Nicer Than I Had Anticipated”
Reviews.Author: vegasvarment
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at Harrahs and I booked 1 night (just in case I didn't like it) at a rate of $39 for their cheapest room. And cheap was what I had expected. The only thing that was bothersome to me was the wait at check in. There must have been 20 of us in line and there were only 2 reservation clerks. Each person being checked in took at least 10 to 15 minutes each but I don't blame this on the clerks but the stupid people who have to ask a hundred questions! Finally, someone from the Diamond desk came out and took 5 of us to their desk. It didn't really save time but you can tell Diamond members receive special care. I asked for a room away from Carnival Court bar and I received a room in the Carnival Court Tower. Very, very nice room with new furnishings except for the TV. My first room that had a mini bar but of course I didn't dare use it. There were 2 queen beds with no bed spreads on them for which I am glad of. The bathroom was very large and nicely appointed with nice toiletries. The tiling looked to be new. The one thing I was very impressed with was the way the room doors close. They close quietly not with a banging sound. Excellent invention! I was very pleased with the room overall and would stay there again in a heart beat. As far as the casino goes, I played some slots for quite a long time on very little money. The drink service was excellent. The CW made her rounds quite often for which of course I tipped her accordingly. Next time I will stay more than 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing? NOT!”
Reviews.Author: balmoralcastle
Reviews.Content: Usually we receive excellent service which is why we choose Harrahs. Unfortunately this time, after a great day on the strip, we had dissappointing, unattentive waitress at Toby Keiths Bar and Grill. Then later when looking forward to a hot bath , the water was tepid at best and the cold water would not shut completely off. When resorting to a shower instead- to add insult to injury- the tub would not drain!! We had to use the trash can to bail the water out. Being naked and unpacked, it was a little too late in the evening to ask to change rooms. Upon check out the next morning, I brought up my inconvenience to the desk clerk, whose only response was- oh sorry, I'll put in a work order. So sad :(

Reviews.Title: “Call and confrim your room choce and reservation”
Reviews.Author: susan2137
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday from a 3 day stay at Harrah's. Although the staff was nice, the actual stay was a bit of a let down. We had booked a stay with our reward points for a deluxe executive suite, upon check in we were told those rooms really aren't available for comps, but they would upgrade us to a mini suite....UPGRADE. that was a DOWNGRADE from what we had booked in April. I realize this is a comp room, but we all know we pay to get these comps, and when one is offered, booked and confirmed it should be awarded. The only reason we booked this room was because of the offer, I would have much preferred to stay at Paris..even though the do try to upsell rooms as well, but at a much nicer property. I feel if they have a problem with internet bookings they should not make us pay for the mistake, or at least have notified us of the room change prior to check in, so we could have made alternate plans. With a qucik rundown, the rooms were clean, bathrooms a bit dingy. The pool area really needs to be upgraded. The chairs are old, stained and are falling apart. I do see why they don't put much of the pool area on a virtual tour. Location is very central and easy acess to monorail. As the title states, just be sure if you have booked a room type you really want, I would call the hotel directly to confirm thaty your selection will be available upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was absolutely AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: AATrip88
Reviews.Content: I am pretty much the most irresponsible person on the planet. I must say, of any place I have ever been to, Harrah's staff takes care of its people like no other!!! On my last night, I had left my purse at a table with all of my chips, camera, and a voucher with it. When I realized I left it, I of course flipped out and was very worried! To make it worse, we were leaving for the plane soon and I needed to have that ID!!! So, my friends called the security who must have put out some sort of word it was missing....as I'm walking around, some man came up and found ME to tell me he had my purse at this table. I was so relieved and excited to find it; I couldn't believe they took care of my things when I left it behind! I also did not clean out my safe (again, irresponsible!) before leaving. When I arrived at home, I called Harrah's and they had security and hardware get into my safe and even sent my belongings back to me free of charge and safely without charges on my credit cards!!! Not to mention the bartenders at the downstairs bar were some of the nicest guys I met!! All of Harrah's staff are amazing people who have kind hearts and honest minds and I would come see them again anytime. Thank you staff!!!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you plan on spending no time in the room or at the pool.”
Reviews.Author: myboxerrocks
Reviews.Content: I would like to tell you about my weekend stay at your Harrah’s Las Vegas Casino. This past weekend (May 30-June 2) my boyfriend and I flew out to Las Vegas with a couple of friends for a long weekend vacation. When arriving in Las Vegas we came right to Harrah’s and were able to check right in. I mentioned to the lady that checked us in that we had a Premium room booked, and showed her my reservation confirmation page. She then told us that were in a Luxury room, and we thought, all the better. She told us we were going to have a view of the strip and would be able to see the Mirage Volcano erupt at night out of our ceiling to floor window. Who wouldn’t want that, right? So after we finish checking in we head up to our room, located in the Mardi gras tower on the 16th floor, and come to find out that our room isn’t so luxurious to say the least. First, the television would not work, so we had to call maintenance to come and fix the television. It was unplugged. Second, our air conditioner would not run for longer than 5 minutes, and then in order to turn it back on, we had to keep on getting up and walking past the sensor on the thermostat. Again we had to call maintenance to come to our room to fix the thermostat, so the air would constantly stay on. Our room still did not remain cold. Third, whenever my boyfriend or I would shower, the water from the shower would leak out all over the bathroom floor. So we ended up having to leave both the shower curtain and the curtain liner in the tub to reduce the water that was on the floor. Regardless, there would still be water on the floor. Also, I was not happy with the pool. It was impossible to get chairs to lie out on, or even a table to have lunch at. Once we were able to get a high top table, close to the bar, it was even harder to get a waitress to be waited on. Once we were able to track down a waitress to order drinks and food, the service time wasn’t too bad, although the food wasn’t all that appealing. I ordered a grilled chicken caesar wrap, and the lettuce was green with brown edges, and came out soggy. My friend ordered a cheeseburger with no tomato or onion, and both tomato and onion came out on the burger. Once lunch was over, we decided to go into the pool, next thing we know, they are setting up a volleyball net, that takes up the entire width of the pool, and is placed right in the center. So once in the pool, the volleyball game starts and my friend ends up getting hit in the head by the ball. So because of that we decided to get out of the pool, since there really wasn’t anywhere you could go in the pool that was safe from the volleyball game. I was not too pleased with the pool, and spent the rest of my pool time at Caesar’s for the duration of the vacation. I am rather disappointed in the room that we ended up in and the pool, and because of that would probably not stay at Harrah’s again when I come out to Last Vegas. Regardless of the room that we did stay in, the casino, the restaurants and the bars were fun and good places to hang out.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and clean, good value”
Reviews.Author: wiscjudy2001
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with maid service and food options offered. I did not like the wardrobe offered for clothing storage, only three small drawers with hanging area. Room had a safe which i really liked along with comfortable beds and three pillows to bed. I asked for king , wasn't available but was given 2 queens which was ok. i earned enough reward points to secure a "mini suite" for trip this October. I saw the Terry Fator show which was outstanding, i reccommend it highly, well worth the time and money. I liked that Harrahs was in the middle of the strip which was located close to everything. I went up to Toby Keiths bar and grill and was disappontedd that the music offered was not "western style" but some very loud, noisey rock and roll..however great b urgers!!!

Reviews.Title: “avoid this place like the plague”
Reviews.Author: procardtosser21
Reviews.Content: We are long-time members of theTotal Rewards club and just returned from a 4 day stay at Harrahs Las Vegas. We had every conceivable issue possible come up during our stay. One of our rooms was not ready upon arrivalat 4:30pm and we were told it would possibly be 6:00pm before we could check in. We were told OUR room was available, but our second room for my son and his wife was not. We were told to come back in an hour and check the status. Still not available. We asked to give the kids our room and we would take another room as an upgrade. This room was ready for checkin, but was not what I would term a "mini suite". We asked the front desk to make sure that the credit cards on each room were correct. We were assured that our card was on our room and my sons card was on their room. Upon our return, my son got his credit card bill and had been charged for BOTH rooms. We also had issues with poor/rude service from the box office staff. When I registered my complaints via email upon our return, I received a "polite" response basically telling us, "Gee, thats too bad", I asked to be refunded our upgrade charge, to no avail. They DID fix the credit card snafu, but that was after several phone calls and eventually speaking to a customer service supervisor. These people just don't seem to care anymore. I also ate breakfast at the cafe, which was mediocre at best and after I paid, I found out from another customer that if I'd showed my players card I would have received a discount on my meal. NO ONE offered to tell me this when I paid that morning. On one of my calls regarding the credit card mixup, I'd asked to speak to "Mary" whom I'd spoken to the previous day. I was told "I don't know who that is." I finally asked to be connected to that dept and they could find her, I was rudely put on hold without comment. The words "customer SERVICE" is evidently non-existant here. I will NOT stay there again, nor would I recommend this hotel to ANYONE. Just as a footnote, I work in the casino industry in WA. state and am on the customer service focus group in the casino where I work.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Candycane30
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Harrah's. We have stayed at the Mandalay Bay the previous year and I really liked Harrah's. The people and staff were very helpful. I had no complaints on my room I loved it. The beds were very comfortable and it was always clean and stocked when we returned. I love it and the Carnival Court was the best. I will stay there again when I go back. I would recommend staying at Harrah's to anyone. It is a good location too because it's in the center of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Give Harrahs a chance!”
Reviews.Author: monica4851
Reviews.Content: I came to Las Vegas for a conference and needed a place to stay. Through my Harrahs New Orleans Total Rewards card, I was able to get three nights comped at Harrahs Las Vegas. After reading all the reviews, I was concerned about the condition the hotel and my room was going to be in. I have to say, I was pleasently surprised. I arrived to check in at 10:30am, and was able to go to my room immedietly. The lobby of the hotel is nice, there were 8 or 9 people behind the desk and I hardly had to wait in line to check in. The lady at the desk was extremly pleasent and helpful. I didnt want to put my incenditials on my credit card and only had to put down a $100 cash deposit. (the website says $200). I was given a room on the 15th floor in the Mardi Gras tower. It was a non smoking king deluxe room. The room was clean and nicer than I expected after reading the reviews. I didnt have a view (just the top another building and part of the Imperial Palace hotel) but for free, I cant complain. The mardi gras tower brings you right down to the casino floor. I didnt have much luck at the casino and they didnt seem to have many newer games, but the buffet was really good. Harrahs is in an amazing location, right in the middle of all the major casinos. I visited the pool, which wasnt anything special. During the summer you have to get out there early to lay claim to a chair. I would definetly stay here again and reccomend this hotel. It is not a 5 star facility, but it was clean and convient!

Reviews.Title: “"We felt ripped off"”
Reviews.Author: francesstrait
Reviews.Content: We booked a Drink and Play package from your website but when we took our coupons from your hotel to the Toby Keiths Bar and Grill, the bartender did not know what we were talking about and gave us a receipt as if we were being charged for the drinks. He took the coupon and attached it, and my husband crossed out the 12.00 charge and wrote "Coupon". When we went to check out, they tried to charge us for the drinks. We were given coupons at the front desk when we checked in and did not even use the others since we are not drinkers. The clerk read us our bill and stated we owed for a phone call and the two beers. She paused and we told her we had the Stay and Play package and we would like them to look it up. They insisted we owed and we asked to speak to a manager. They left us standing at the check out counter for more than 15 minutes. The manager did not come out but the clerk again came and told us that they would comp us for the beers, but that we had also had dinner there. This was not read to us the first time around and we did no such thing!! We requested to see the signature on the dinner bill but they could not produce it since they were closed in the accounting dept. When she read us the bill the first time through, there was no dinner listed. They threatened to call security because we still wanted to speak to a manager. After a good 1/2 hour of arguing, the clerk said they would not charge us unless the signatures matched, and we would have to wait to see if it was on our Visa bill. We left before they could add more false charges. I have received my Visa bill for the Package and it was 160.00 and change. I guess I will have to wait for the next bill to see if I was charged anything else above the phone call that I made. I have confirmation of the package I purchased and all paperwork. I am very disappointed in your service and the attitude of your staff which accused us of lying but were unable to look up your own website and find what I had purchased. I will never stay at any of your hotels again and will not recommend you to my family and friends. Up until this incident, we were having a good time and felt upset that such a nice vacation was ruined by the failure of your staff to keep things straight. Frances Strait

Reviews.Title: “perhaps better choices elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: bethelandi
Reviews.Content: The lobby was quite loud, and of course all the machines contributed to the noise. The rooms were fine and halls weren't too loud. However, going from our room to get out of the building, meant walking through noise and smoke. We noticed other hotels in the area seemed to have different ventilation systems and ways to reduce noise.

Reviews.Title: “Last time we stay there!”
Reviews.Author: wdbennett
Reviews.Content: This is the second time a group of us have stayed at Harrah's, the first time was just okay. The rooms we orderded the first time were not availbe when we got there both time! They only "pre book" - I guess it does not mean you will get a room??? After an hour of fighting withthe manager we got what we ordered and the night began. Carnival court is one of the best bars on the strip, great times there, and one of the only places to find $5 blackjack tables. Flavors buffett is great as well, Anything you could possibly want - including cotton candy! My biggest problem was the pool! It was over 100 everyday, and very limited pool space. If you were not lined up at the pool when it opened at 9am, you will not get a free chair. And when I say free - i mean bring your wallet! $250 for a cabana, $150 for a bed, and $20 for a chair. They do have an upper deck that you can not see the pool from for free. We crashed the pool at the mirage one day - not even a comparrison. We did get a good deal here but I am not sure if it was worth it! Oh well, we'll know for next time!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed, just average”
Reviews.Author: Sterkijker
Reviews.Content: I was not impressed with Harrahs. To me it was just an average hotel. I'm not saying it was bad or had a bad experience but there was nothing exciting about it or anything that I can describe as excellent or well worth our while. I did get irritated with the fact that they took out a $50 deposit from my account for the mini-bar in our room. I told the desk person that we NEVER use the mini-bar in our hotel rooms no matter where we are. However, she pointed out that it's hotel policy to take a $50 deposit from each customer. I asked her when it would be returned back to my account. She said it can take up to two weeks. Two weeks ?? Luckily and all fairness to the hotel, I received my deposit back within two days after we checked out. However, the check-in line wasn't that long but we had to wait forever since there were only two people working the counter. The rooms were okay but no coffee pot, no micro (in short no frills). For being just an average run of the mill Vegas hotel in my opinion they charge too much. For a good point however, I had lost my credit card somewhere on the casino floor and I was extremely nervous. When I came back down from my room a policeman happened to be standing chatting to someone and I asked him where is the hotel Lost and Found. He was an extremely nice and calm man and asked me what I lost, where and when and told me to come with him. We went through a maze of doors down into the basement where there were all sorts of offices and locker rooms for hotel employees. When we got to the Lost and Found he looked and within a few seconds was able to locate my lost credit card. I was shocked and pleasantly surprised. There are still nice and honest people left in this world. I had to sign some papers, show ID and then I got my credit card back. That was the NICE thing that happened to me in Harrahs.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel very clean, beds really comfortable, buffet was fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: PartridgeFamily09
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harras for 3 nights and was very pleased. The roulette tables were lots of fun, dealers made it worth playing. Toby Keith's restaurant had an excellent spinach/strawberry salad. Breakfast buffet was fabulous. The beds were very comfortable with feather pillows, brought back memories of my childhood. Pool area was small and lounges all taken by 9:30am. Need more lounges and maybe a bigger pool if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: Majong
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying here. We usually stay at Flamingo. We went with another family for their 30th Anniversary. We really liked the room. We had 4 rooms and everyroom was great. Two were in the Carnival Tower and two in the Mardi Gras. The one room in the Mardi Gras looked over the pool so if you opened the patio door you could hear the band playing. As long as the door was closed you never heard a thing. This room had 2 TV's, one in the bathroom. Our room in the Mardi Gras tower looked over the strip but also looked over vents on the roof. The rooms in the Carnival Tower had better views. The only thing I disliked about Harrah's was the smoky casino. Very, very smoky. The slot machines were very tight too. I heard that all slot machines in Vegas were like this anymore. We really like the buffet at Harrah's. We went twice for breakfast and once for supper. We also went to Toby Keith's for lunch one day and one night for supper. Very good also. We went and saw Jersey Boys this time. Great show. Highly recommended! Saw Mac King one afternoon. Had free tickets but would pay to see him. Good afternoon show. Would stay at Harrah's again because of location and price (had comped rooms), but hopefully one of these days smoking is not allowed in Casino's just like in Restaurants. Maids did a great job cleaning rooms every day . Usually cleaned by noon and replenished shampoos etc. with lots of bottles.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and poor view”
Reviews.Author: cjlagnaa
Reviews.Content: I had booked a weeks stay at Harrah's 6 months in advance and requested a quiet room with a good view of the strip. Some view! We had and angle view of the hotel wall with the carnival court below. Not very quiet! . The hotel is located in a great spot n the center of the strip. Food was good and the lines were short for the diamond / 7star player. Staff were not as friendly as they were at other harrahs owned properties. Overall stay on a scale of 1 - 10...was 5. Needs some improvement with the staffing.....Flamingo was 100% better.....

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: eeyoregon
Reviews.Content: My 60 something Mom and I spent 3 nights at Harrah's Las Vegas in a deluxe 2 queen room. Our room was comped so I can not assess value vs. nightly rate. Budget cuts have greatly reduced the staffing. When we arrived at 5:00pm on Thursday to check-in we encountered a line of 30 people and only 2 desk clerks. Check-in took well over an hour. Another budget cut = no more free bungee cords for your players cards...you have to buy them in the gift shop! Luckily I had my own. Our room was very nice and we were offered a choice of view: Caesar's Palace or the Volcano at Mirage. We chose the Mirage view. Our 2 queen room was very nice and newly updated with marble floors in the entry and bath. We encountered a problem with 1st night with our room. It was directly above the loading dock which is used by Harrah's and McDonald's. Even with foam ear plugs we could hear the non-stop back up beepers on the hundreds of trucks. It went on all night and we slept very, very little. We asked to move to a quieter room and happily took a view of the top of the parking garage and mountains = no beeping trucks! We dined at the buffet and the cafe twice and all meals were excellent!! We also ate at the buffet at one of their other properties, The Flamingo and it was outstanding, especially if you love seafood! They had some of the best crab I have ever eaten and crepes station that was heavenly! My mom and I both enjoy the slot machines. We found the ventilation to be excellent in the casino and the beverage girls were some of the best I have ever seen. We never had to wait for a drink. We never made it to the pool as it was only in the 60's during our stay. We would 100% stay there again. I highly recommend joining the Total Rewards players club (free) if you gamble at all. You earn credits with every bet or purchase. These credits or comps can be used at any dining venue, gift shop, shows, etc. All of our food was comped. Location: Harrah's has an excellent location on the strip. It is directly across the street from Caesar's Palace and Mirage and is just s short walk to the Paris and Bellagio and the Venetian is right next door. It is also one of the stops on the monorail or you can pay $7.00 for a 24 hour pass on the Deuce which runs the strip and goes to old downtown. If you take a taxi from the airport DO NOT let them take you on the freeway or down the strip. Tell your driver you want the back road, fast route to Harrah's and you will get there for about $12.00.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: donnaarmour
Reviews.Content: the location was great-middle of the strip-clean rooms. hoover dam-wow timeshares to pushy. toby keit's i love this bar best ever. Elvis was there. our vacation was great because of the staff being so helpful. the men in suits are wonderful. you can win at the slots after someone explains how to play them.we will be back to see you soon.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: blr5365
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I got a great deal at Harrahs. 4 nights for only 210 including taxes! So all we were hoping for was a clean room but our expectations were exceeded. We got there around 10 a.m. Vegas time and were able to get into our room only an hour later. That was fine with us because check-in isn't even until 3 anyway so we weren't even expecting to get in that soon.The woman working at the front desk was extremely helpful. She gave us suggestions on where to go and encouraged us to sign up for the Total Rewards which gave us free slot play and coupons. The entire staff was extremely helpful and courteous. The room, which was just a standard room, was very spacious with a marble entrance, pretty decor, marble bathroom and very clean. Plenty of towels each day!! The bed was a little stiff but nothing to get upset over. It was a great experience in a CENTRAL location on the strip. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone. I wouldn't even splurge with the deluxe rooms because they are on the noisy side where Carnaval Court is. Carnaval Court was really awesome by the way, check it out!!! Live bands during the day turns night club at night. The pool is mediocre but the volleyball net they put up is really fun!!! Just bring your own alcohol. The pool had the most expensive alcohol I saw the entire time in vegas. Some tips: Check out the free volcano show at the mirage, siren show at treasure island, fountains at bellagio, tigers at mirage, sky inside of caesars, lions AT MGM, circus acts at circus circus, show in the sky at RIO.... ALL FREE!!!!!!!! Get deuce tickets!! MUCH cheaper than taxi and goes up and down the strip plus downtown where all the CHEAP gambling is. By the way make sure you check out downtown even if you don't like gambling. They have the free light show on Fremont with drag queens performing live music.... def the "vegas vibe" downtown. Slots A Fun: $2 dollar blackjack and .50 roulette. Also, those big drinks you see everyone walking around with on the strip that are $20 dollars? They are only $8.00 at Slots a fun and you get 4 shots. .99 hot dogs! You will just have to get past the smell of this place... not that pleasant. Fun though!!! If you want your money's worth in alcohol go to margitaville for a margarita!! It's two hotels down from Harrah's and they pour a STIFF drink. For a good burger, Stripburger is the best. Might be the best burger I've ever had :P Don't by nightclub passes before going or wait before you are in line. They give em out free everywhere on the strip!! Usually VIP too :)

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, slow check in, tight, tight slots and lots of smoke”
Reviews.Author: ChickenGurl
Reviews.Content: We booked Harrah's due to the excellent Expedia price of $55 per night with a $30.00 resort credit. I checked in while my husband waited in the rental car. After 30 minutes he came in to check on me. I waited in line for almost 45 minutes to check in, with only about 20 other customers. There were 3 people checking in guests and one kept going over to what we in line were calling the 'highrollers' check in. Some special gambling card or something. So after 50 minutes I finally got checked in and got our room keys. We stayed at the very end of the hall which was nice. It was quiet in the hallway but the room was a different story. The room was up to date and tastefully remodeled. HOWEVER you could hear EVERYTHING from the upstairs room and the 2 rooms on either side of us. This includes~ah~ the bathroom. Not the revele I want to wake up to! Our room gal cleaned that room SPOTLESS every day and in fact it was on par with the Westin in Vegas as far as cleanliness goes! I was impressed by the house keeping staff. Only complaint: we re-hung our towels so they would not be removed and laundered on a daily basis, but our room lady removed them and laundered them every day. Harrah's had a card out about helping conserve water. Well we tried. The main 24 hour cafe was a good value and we had the $7.99 steak and shrimp a couple nights. It was ok/fine. Good service in the cafe. Starbucks was great and so was the sundry store. I used my $30.00 credit at Starbucks and at the sundry store. The casino was fairly busy but VERY VERY smoky. Lots of the people there were older than us and were smokers. It was unbearable at times. Harrah's needs to invest some $$ and upgrade their ventilation system if they want the non-smoking crowd to stay/play there! This is why we've almost always stayed at the Paris or Westin Causarina when in Vegas. The Westin is a non-smoking property and the Paris has great ventilation! The slots were very tight and I did not see many winners and myself was not a winner of anything. Usually I manage to break even at the least. Not this time. The hotel was ok for the value and the highpoints of our stay was the $30 resort credit and the good 'rewards' card program that is used at Harrah's and her sister properties. I racked up enough points for a $10 to spend in resort credits! I used a the buffet at the Paris and Starbucks in Harrah's. Overall $55 bucks for a very clean but noisy room and a smoky casino it was a good deal. We tried cheap and it was ok, but not what we wanted. ATTN: Paris/Westin, get ready we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location!”
Reviews.Author: bobcav
Reviews.Content: We arrived on april 16th at 9 pm for check-in. There was no one in line so it was fast. We were three women staying in a room with 2 double beds, so we also asked for a cot. This was brought up to us within 5 minutes of arriving. The cot was basically like a single bed. All the beds were comfortable. The sheets didn't fit like all the other reviews say, but it's because they were too big. It was no big deal. Our room was large but unfortunately overlooked the employees parking lot and a garbage can down below, but who cares, we weren't there to hang out in our room. It was quiet except in the morning when we heard the garbage truck, but that was fine because we wanted to wake up anyways. We never heard any of our neighbours. The maids cleaned it very well every day. My only complaint about the room was that the bathroom fan didn't work and the hotel doesn't offer a service where they will save water by not washing your towels as long as you hang them up. It felt like a waste to have new towels every single day, but then again, the whole of Las Vegas seems like an environmental nightmare! So rooms were nice, check-in was fine. Check out took longer as everyone was lining up to check out at the same time. The clerks were very friendly and helpful. They booked us a trip to see the Grand Canyon. The casino has a lower ceiling that most casinos but also seemed brighter then most casinos. We didn't do much gambling anyways. We heard that if we gambled we could get a free drink, so we tried the penny slots for a few minutes but no free drinks! The only place we ate inside the hotel was the Chinese restaurant called Mings Table, which was very good. There is a Starbucks just below the elevator where we had coffee in the morning, but of course Starbucks are everywhere in Las Vegas, expensive and long lineups. Compared to other hotels that we looked in, Harrahs had less cheap restaurants (no fastfood or Subway) and not as many stores, which I liked because it got us out of the hotel. The best thing is the location. We are right across from the Mirage, which we ate in two nights(great restaurants), 5 minute from Treasure Island, The Wynn and some shopping on one side, and then 2 minutes from the Caesers Palace Forum shops and then less than a 15 minute (great) walk to Paris Las Vegas on the other side, passing the Flamingo and other places. Some people say that it needs to be updated, and one of my party thought that as well. The theme seems to be New Orleans Carnivale (which is creepy anyways if you ask me with all those masks) but I barely noticed that. It is newer than most hotels you will see on a typical road trip through North America, it's just that in Las Vegas everything has to always be so new to keep up with the Jones (ie-the other hotels) Also the Monorail is attached to Harrahs. All in all I really liked this place and would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, Fav Poker Room”
Reviews.Author: KeltonSC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Harrah's from April 5-10 for our anniversary trip. We had a great time at Harrah's. The location is the best! Right in the heart of the strip. It was an easy walk to our favorite hotels and casinos. We booked a deluxe room for only $39/night which is a steal. I think we might have been upgraded because we had a safe in the room; I was told the deluxe does not. No strip view but it was fine. The room was very clean, no complaints. We loved the casino and poker room. Our main reason for coming to Vegas was for poker and Harrah's did not dissapoint. We spent the majority of our poker time at Harrah's. They have a great deep stack tournament with an awesome structure. The staff and dealers were great; very friendly. The CWs were great in the whole casino but especially in the poker room. The casino itself is very big and we had a great time there. As food goes we ate at Toby Keiths (A- very good but the restaurant was kind of chilly. Good sweet tea, medium priced about $35 pre-tip for 2) Room service (C+ it was ok nothing special kind of overpriced for the quality. Same food as in the cafe.) The Range was excellent (A+, beautiful view overlooking the forum shops, excellent service. The meal was great, the steaks very tender, cooked perfectly and the sides were awesome. Also tried the spa for a nice massage. They were doing some remodeling in the lobby area but you couldn't hear any noise so it wasn't bad. They had some good specials going and the price was well worth it. Nothing very fancy but it did the job. The pool was a nice area to lay out and have some drinks. The bartenders were very good and quick. The pool isn't very lush or tropical; it is on the small side. I had a good time by the pool but it would have been better if it was bigger. Carnival Court is an awesome place to party. Best bartenders in town! Overall, I loved Harrah's. We would stay again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location. Great Hotel. Best Gambling!”
Reviews.Author: LCFTAK
Reviews.Content: I dont even know where to start on how wonderful this hotel is. We have stayed at Harrahs now three times and our experience keeps getting better. We stayed for five nights in one of the Premium rooms in the Mardi Gras Tower for free with our Total Rewards card. The room has a luxurious pillow top bed, a flat screen TV in the bedroom and the bathroom. Everything was glistening clean. We had a little balcony that overlooked the pool which made for some fun people watching. The location of this hotel is perfect in the center of the strip. The Venetian, Wynn, Treasure Island, The Mirage, Ceasars, Bellagio, Paris Paris,Flamingo are all within easy walking distance. This hotel is connected to the monorail so if you want to go down to the south strip (MGM, NY NY, LUXOR) or the North Strip (Circus, Stratoshphere, Riviera) it is a very quick and inexpensive ride. In my opinion this is the best Casino is Las Vegas! They have different games than most of the other casinos. This casino is always lively and in the front their are some open doors so you can actually see outside. Right outside the door there is a big open bar and concert area that fun and always has a good band playing. And in the casino there is a lounge bar that has nightly piano acts that are fun to watch and free. The only thing that I can possibly think of that might be considered a draw back is the pool. Harrahs pool is just a standard rectangle olympic size pool with some lounge chairs around it. While this pool would be fine anywhere else it is not up to par with most of the other pools on the strip. The only restaurant we have ate at was the Cafe at Harrahs. The food was very good but a little expensive. But nothing more than anywhere else. All in all this is a great hotel for a great value in the perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “sheets & towels---ouch!!”
Reviews.Author: maxwell57
Reviews.Content: Location of Harrahs is great-in the middle of the strip. Our room was in the Mardi Gras Tower-15th floor. Overall, the room was fine; nothing over the top. COMPLAINT--the towels and sheets. Oh my gosh! The were absolutely the worse I've ever experienced. What sorta deal did they get on these? The towels were so rough; I hated to dry off after a shower or even when I washed my hands. The sheets were very scratchy, not soft at all. They must of received a similar deal on the sheets as they did on the towels. Really really bad. We received a good price on the room thru a friend who does alot of gambling there. Will I stay there again even if I get a good price on the room? NO

Reviews.Title: “Only do it for the price”
Reviews.Author: ellieca
Reviews.Content: We paid $40 per night for two nights, and for that price it was ok. This hotel has definitely slipped in the past few years. I used to consider it just a tier under the top group, but now it is decidedly several tiers below, in my opinion. However, the location is great. For us, this was an "extra" trip, planned almost the last minute and just weeks before a special cruise. We went to be with friends coming from Chicago who were staying at the Venetian. To save money, this was a good choice, just a block from them. However, I doubt that I would stay at Harrah's again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer Service I have ever experienced!”
Reviews.Author: crazyminnie
Reviews.Content: I have been in Customer Service for over 20 years and all the places I have been I never witnessed the attitudes I have with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fun place”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyer2010
Reviews.Content: recently stayed at harrahs for 3 nights, the room was nice, the bed was very comfortable, check in and out was great and fast.. We had fun at the carnival bar there, it is outside, alot of party people and great drinks. Joel at the pool bar made really great drinks. Oyster bar was wonderful. Did not win a cent there!

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied at Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: mhstar75
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the 12th floor of the Mardi Gras Tower for four nights on a promotion - one night was free. It is the older tower but you'd hardly know. My room was excellent - very comfortable bed, nice furniture, bathroom was flawless (shower pressure was strong), the housekeeping was efficient and the staff are helpful and friendly. Harrah's location is excellent - mid strip across from Caesar's Palace. The only minor complaints I have is that it gets very noisy late at night because of the Carnival outside. But the air conditioner more less drowned out the noise so it was no problem. Also, the swimming pool is only 5 feet deep but I still enjoyed it - it was heated. I would definitely stay at Harrah's again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price!”
Reviews.Author: jkskristine
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying at Harrah's. We stayed in the basic (non-upgraded) room in Carnaval tower facing the street. I thought the room was very nice for what we spent! You can tell they have done some improvements and it was very clean. The casino is what you'd expect from an older casino on the strip - basic, low ceilings, but clean. It is smokey...but it's Vegas, what do you expect? The location is great - across the street from Caesar's and a short walk (in Vegas terms) to Bellagio and Venetian. We spent most of our time at Harrah's or in Flamingo -- looser slots :)! My only complaint is that the restaurants are $$ like any other hotel on the strip. But yea for us, there's a Chipotle, pizza place and McDonald's next door for a quick bite. We'd stay again, no problem.

Reviews.Title: “FUN, FUN, FUN”
Reviews.Author: TaDaInZach
Reviews.Content: I've been traveling to Vegas 2 or 3 times a year for the past 10 years and Harrah's is my favorite place to stay. If you can get a remodeled room, you won't be disappointed. Request a room that doesn't overlook the courtyard area to avoid getting noise from the bands playing below. Other than that, Harrah's is a great place to stay and a great place to play. Their staff is the friendliest group of people you will ever come across. I'll be back in May and had options to stay for free at other area hotels but nothing beats the atmosphere that you will get as soon as you walk in the doors of Harrah's. And if you gamble, do so at any of Harrah's locations, as they offer the best comps for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Get your Total Rewards Card”
Reviews.Author: iTravel16
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Harrahs - Las Vegas March 22-26. With the total rewards card the entire hotel stay cost $65 (including tax). We save over $400 using the card. We had a pool view. The room was clean and best of all there was a flat screen TV in the bathroom. Harrahs is located right in the middle of the strip so it's very convienant to get where you need to be in a short time. Flavors, the buffett on the ground floor, is amazing and not too expensive (get your hands on 2 for 1 coupons). The only thing that bothered us was that at every entrance/exit there are people from Wyndham trying to sell time share. The most annoying part is that they try to get you right after you check in (who wants to deal with that). But, if you hold your ground and say NO they wont bother you anymore. When we go back to Vegas, we will definately be staying at the Harrahs. A couple pieces of advice about Vegas that nobody gave me. 1. bring chapstick - it gets windy sometimes 2.bring sunglasses - sounds obvious but we weren't the only ones who forgot 3.bring hand lotion - you'll need it with the extremely dry desert air 4.get a DUECE bus pass - it's cheap and runs 24 hrs from the south end of the strip to Fremont Ave. $3 one way, $7 for 24-hour pass, $15 for 3 day pass. Plenty of stops. 5. COUPONS COUPONS COUPONS - magazines in hotel lobby have tons of coupons. use them - you will save lots of money. 6. check out the Neon Musuem - http://www.neonmuseum.org/ 7. go to a CVS or other small store to get your alcohol. 12 oz bottle of miller light cost $3.50 at hotels and bars. I got a 24 oz can of miller light for $1.79 at the CVS. and yes, you are allowed to walk the streets drinking alcohol. 8.check out the haunted vegas tour - http://www.hauntedvegastours.com/

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Seetraveler
Reviews.Content: Great location in the middle of the strip. Would never have thought of staying at this spot, but with the low price I got for the hotel - it was worth it!! They have Sbarro's in their basement, connected to Paris Las Vegas and across Caesar's. Rooms are very spacious (double and queen rooms). We didn't get a good view of the strip, but the price and upgrade I couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy noisy noisy”
Reviews.Author: bfson
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in 2 different rooms in the Mardis Gras Tower. The key point is that this is an older building (although redecorated nicely) the original construction was lacking in sound insulation. It still is. The remodel did not improve this problem according to one of the managers I talked to. You can hear normal conversation in the adjoining room. This problem is exacerbated by the high power flush toilets that have been installed. If anyone above you, below you or on either side of you flushes, you hear it even in the bedroom. I could hear it even through ear plugs. Bottom line: nice room, nice staff, but too noisy for me. We will go elsewhere in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good. Some bad - Would try it again”
Reviews.Author: gardengirl102
Reviews.Content: Travelled here with my baseball team - 10 of us. Here are some observances: First let me qualify this by saying that, upon arrival, our rooms were taken so we were 'upgraded' for ONE night to pretty nice suites. Except for me and my roomies who moved up to floor 23 in the Mardi Gras Tower - we got SWEET 'SUITE'. 2 bedrooms, 3 beds, THREE baths, FIVE sinks, bar, 3 TV's - moving from there is going to be a bit of downer....now back to reality. REALITY: Rooms: Fairly small. Clean. Very comfy beds. No music stations on TV? Unusable fridges. Best: beds Worst: Mini bar/Fridges. ** These fridges have about 4 bottles of water in them yet YOU CAN"T USE THEM. I threw some pop in there when we arrived and i would have been charged for using the mini bar based on 'weight' - be careful - it looks like a fridge but it is a 'phony money-making fridge'. Don't use it! Harrah's -'You make a lot of money - let us use the fridges - you are paying for the hydro anyways!' Food: We ate one breakfast and one dinner at Flavors. It is buffet only. The food was good and there were lots of choices. it was convenient to just get in there and eat without having to wait - especially with the large group we had. We also had one lunch at the other restaurant - can't remember the name (not Ming's). The food was plentiful and good - but there is usually a line-up to get in. Also they advertised a lunch special - but once we were seated we were told it was not available on the weekend. The sign advertising the special made NO mention of this - a bit of false advertising? Gaming tables: Minimum bet required a bit too high for newcomers like us. Piano Bar and Toby Keith's bar - both fun. Pool: Nothing fancy -had lots of chairs, outdoor bar and towels. We enjoyed it. Checkout: LONG lineups. Internet charges to our rooms even though no one brought a laptop - watch your charges closely. Took us 40 minutes. Location: Great - centrally located - easy to use the bus or the rail system that comes through the back of the hotel. Price: Very good - Came in a package deal. This was my first trip to Vegas - so I have nothing to compare it to. We all felt comfortable here - it was not too big. I would recommend it - but would probably try to stay elsewhere next time - just to try something different.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again Better Places to Stay”
Reviews.Author: luggageinhand
Reviews.Content: I had a luxury view room and there was nothing luxury about it. Room #2637 Had a view of the Mirage volcano but the windows were so dirty you couldn't see out of them. The TV was old and cut off any news going across the bottom of the screen like CNN, the phone only worked if you held it just right, had so much static it was almost unusable, and the carpet was just gross. Wore slippers and never let my feet touch the carpet. With all the nice places to stay center strip I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed compared to other casinos”
Reviews.Author: aliceinde
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's for 4 nights. This was our first trip to Vegas. We were in the Carnival Tower on the 25th floor. Overall the hotel is nice and the rooms are sufficient and clean. I don't like the fact that the refrigerator can't be used ($50 fee if you use it) and there is no coffee pot to use in the room either. The bed wasn't very comfortable either. We had asked for a king but they only had a room with 2 queens available. The view from our room, however, was beautiful! We did not face the blvd. but we had a nice view of Vegas and the mountains in the background. After touring some of the other hotel casino's, I thought Harrah's was rather plain. Some of the other casino's were much nicer and had more room to move around and high ceiings, etc. We ate in the Cafe, Toby Keith's bar and also the buffet. The Cafe was just O.K. and the buffet for breakfast was great. The dinner buffet was just O.K. but did have quiet a lot to choose from, most of which I did not eat. The dessets were the best part of the buffet. The Toby Keith's was rocking at night and we had a blast. They had a good band two of the nights we were there. The other nights it was a D.J. They played a lot of country line dances towards the end of the night which I love. The waiters put on a show with the juggling of the bottles, etc. The mason jar is the way to go for $15. They make it count too! Overall it was O.K. but would probably choose a different hotel if we ever venture back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Such a rip off”
Reviews.Author: Sallilou
Reviews.Content: Made my reservations on line using the Total Rewards site and selected and offer code to for the Spring Fever Invitational. A list of hotels came up with the code so I selected the one I wanted to stay at. Now I am told I can't participate in the tournament because I didn't stay at Imperial Palace. I had called Imperial Palace and Harrah's Las Vegas back in February to see if I needed to stay at a specific location, both places told me it didn't matter which Harrah's location I stayed at for the promotion. Of course now I am told that is not the case. What a wasted trip for incompetent Harrah's staff and information!

Reviews.Title: “Builders Home show”
Reviews.Author: unluckyRochestermi
Reviews.Content: Our room was broken into, money credit card , video camera, ipod, and prada glasses were all stolen while we were alseep. Made out police reports, and security from hotel, and they have dismissed this case like we were the criminals. We have never asked for anything except to get the room comp, they were rude to us, and never kept us informed. We have tried getting in touch with the risk management that was taken care of this case to get questions answered, and they told us they couldn't talk to us. Not one person , manager or costumer service had even inquired about how we were doing. I have been a devoted costumer, for over 20 years, and this is the reward. People be careful, there are no security cameras in the hallways to protect you, only where they casino is protected, and that would be in the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I could have expected!”
Reviews.Author: muchuckles
Reviews.Content: Harrah's was so much better than I could have expected and I will absolutely stay here again! My boyfriend and I went to Las Vegas for his birthday and had a great time at this property. When we checked in, we asked for a room on a high floor and with a view and we were placed in a room with a full, unobstructed view of the mountains. I really can't say enough about how great this property is and I stay at about 8-10 hotels per year. I highly recommend Harrah's Las Vegas (the location is great too!)

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, great slots”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaJansue
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were planning our second trip to Vegas. Having received several offers in the mail after our first, we decided to see what Harrahs had to offer. We were given a double room for $200 for an entire week. We were pleasantly surprised to find that we were permitted to check in 6 hours earlier than specified and found the front desk staff helpful and accommodating. We were given a room on the 26th floor of the Carnival Tower with a view of Caesar's, the Rio, and the pool. The room was clean,the bathroom also had a bathtub, which our last hotel didn't have, two closets and a nice sitting area near the window. We purchased a cheap coffee maker at Walgreens so we could have coffee and Baileys in the mornings, rather than having to get dressed and go downstairs to get coffee (our only complaint). There was a bit of noise at night from the outdoor bar downstairs, but we weren't really concerned about getting our eight hours of sleep every night. The food in the cafe was good, as was the buffet. Toby Keiths was excellent (be careful of their special drinks - mine had 6 oz of alcohol...yum...The waitress gave me a "to go" cup because I couldn't drink it all with my dinner). Using our Total Rewards points, we got two free meals each, several souveniers from the gift shop, and a further discount on the room. There was a great variety of slots, more than in Caesar's for example, and we spent a lot of time in the casino. We ended up winning $400-$500 pots on quarter slots many times each, and went home with almost everyting we took. The location is great, and the Monorail access saved our feet many miles of walking. Overall, we were very happy with Harrahs, and would stay there again. Sue from Alberta

Reviews.Title: “Total Rewards "Harrahs"”
Reviews.Author: GDSROCK
Reviews.Content: Back on jan.14-17th a friend and myself stayed at Harrahs for a mid-winter guys only getaway. Overall the hotel is very nice and has a great location being right across the road from Caesars Palace and in the middle of the strip. We stayed here mainly for the price. Free, through my Total Rewards players card. But I would stay here again even if I had to pay for it. We were in a remodled deluxe room with 2 queen beds and it was very nice, clean and modern with a limited view of the strip. The buffet is one of my favorites and have been there several times before this trip. Great food and price is around $15-20 depending on when you dined. Price is inline with about every other hotel on strip. Not cheap anymore like old days! The only other place in Harrahs we ate was the 24 hr. cafe. They have good food anytime and the pizza pie is great after a night of drinking some beers! For entertainment we went to Toby Keith's bar. Even though I hate hillbilly music it was a good time with a good crowd and not bad drink prices. Also went to the dueling piano bar and watched the twin girls. Very entertaining! We also hit a country bar called Stoney's Rock N Country down by the Southpointe hotel. Again, not a country fan but wanted to go to a club for people of any age group and are not many of those left. (normally go to Polyesther's in Stratosphere, but was closed for remodeling). So we found this place with a $10 cover and a $20 all the draft beer you drink deal till 4am! It was like an old Gilly's, huge with the mechanical bull and giant dance floor with giant video screens everywhere. They also played some rock music also. Would really recomend if you like country music. The casino area of Harrahs is spread out and alot like any other casino. Harrahs is not the best on the strip but it is everything you would want or need unless you want to overpay on the high dollar snobby themed hotels. As far as Vegas in general. I have been going there for over 25 years now and it has changed so much in that time. Not always for the better. The prices on everything(shows,food,drinks,rooms,) are inflated and it is almost getting to overbuilt and congested. Almost too much anymore. With this bad economy they should maybe think about going back to the way they used to do business. We were there wed-sat. and it was really dead until the weekend. Maybe that should tell them something. Overall I still love Vegas and Harrahs was a great place to spend a few days just to get away from it all! Harrahs was a Total Reward!

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel stuck in the 1980's”
Reviews.Author: MrSilva
Reviews.Content: My wife and I don't have very high expectations for our vacations. We usually consider them to be a base of operations. One expectation we have though is that the hotel room has spare electric outlets for our various chargers and laptop. We had to unplug the lamp and/or clock to plug things in. Compounding the situation, the LAN outlet was across the room. The room overall was adequate. The shower was very dark and there wasn't a comfortable chair to sit in. As for the rest of the hotel, it pales in comparison to other hotels nearby. The whole place is in desperate need of updating, modernization, and a thorough scrubbing. It just feels like an old hotel. Saving graces of this place are the Piano Bar and the Mac King comedy show. Both were a lot of fun and great diversions. I understand the priority is keeping us in the casino but they can make more of an effort to make the rooms friendlier to modern travelers and a little more comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Top 10 Reasons Not to Stay at Harrahs”
Reviews.Author: GBPackers-Lover
Reviews.Content: 10. Long Check-in Lines - We arrived at the hotel around 9:00 pm. There were five people in front of us and it took 35 minutes to check in. We were astonished that only two people were behind the counter. 9. Dated - Outside of "Toby Keith's I Love This Bar and Grill," everything in the hotel is outdated: the rooms, casino, restaurants, etc. 8. Timeshare Salesmen - Harrah's places these salesmen right beside the elevators. This means every time you go to and from your room, you get heckled by them. They are rude, obnoxious, and treat you with sarcasm as if they are doing us the favor by heckling us. 7. Old People - It feels as if 80% of the people at the hotel are over the age of 60. Everywhere you look there are old people, many of whom smell. 6. Cheap Slots - I realize the economy has not been friendly to Vegas, but that doesn't mean you must make all the slots stingy. Don't bother playing at Harrah's, I would go over to Wynn or MGM Grand. You'll get more bang for your buck. 5. Slow elevators - It took longer to get to the sixth floor of Harrah's than it does the 20th floor at The Mirage. Let's speed it up Harrahs! 4. Pool - Where did they get this pool setup, Motel 6? 3. The Room - Tube TV, rock hard mattress, small shower, no view. 2. Fashion - Ladies, black shorts with black tennis shoes with white socks with a baseball cap does not look good. It's Vegas, not West Virginia! 1. Price, Price, Price - For the same price, you can stay at Treasure Island, Flamingo, Bally's, MGM Grand, Excalibur, and Luxor: all of which are far better. We paid $39.99 for this room, and if I had to do it over again, I would have stayed somewhere else. Unless your over the age of 60 and smell funny and wear black shoes with black shorts with white socks and a baseball cap, avoid Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere with crappy food”
Reviews.Author: JennyRT23
Reviews.Content: The place is full of great people and extra friendly staff. DO NOT waste your time or money at Oyster Bar at Panazzi. The service and food was awful and it will cost you a pretty penny. I would stay again at this hotel based solely on the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Flippy”
Reviews.Author: LoveBug96
Reviews.Content: I didn't actually stay at Harrahs, but when I come back to VEGAS I am totally staying here!! Not only was everything about Harrahs AWESOME, but the deal maker was TIM "FLIPPY" MORRIS he is AWESOME!! The flairing that he can do and the attentivness he gives the customers is beyond AWESOME!! So Harrahs we will see you soon!! And if you are going to be staying at Harrahs (or just going to VEGAS period) you have to go to the carnival court and spend all your money there, you will NOT be disappointed!!!

Reviews.Title: “flavors, the buffet, was great”
Reviews.Author: joephine13
Reviews.Content: This stay (4 days) was comped from AC play. The room was just great. Beds were very comfy.Loved the buffet and Starbucks. Machines could have been a lot looser. We weren't in the room much 9th floor too low for any, view should have requested higher. Denny breakfast, nearby, was plenty

Reviews.Title: “decent room, no drawers, ? upgrade”
Reviews.Author: racegirl2002
Reviews.Content: we were there on special pricing through the Total Rewards Club, they talked us into a room upgrade, if the room we got was an upgrade i would be worried what the other room was like. It did indeed look newly decorated, but nothing out of the ordinary that you would expect in Vegas. Oh, there was a TV in the bathroom, maybe that was the upgrade. Anyway, I was not impressed so dont let them talk you into an upgrade for an addt'l fee.

Reviews.Title: “Ok But not the best”
Reviews.Author: Redskin80
Reviews.Content: Checked in On Tuesday about 4:30 pm, two couples with rooms reserved for 8 months. Both had reserved rooms with King Beds, gee they have none, both have to take two queens. Ate at Toby Keith's :Love this Bar and Grill". Food and servcie were both great, Breakfast at the Buffet here was bad. Food was not kep to tempature and the service was very slow. Bad for 30.00 for two. The spa was good we both had Masasges's on Tuesday needed a breal from the long drive into Vegas. They have a nice area to wait and you can use the work out area for the day with the purchase of the massage. Price was reasonable. The rooms are clean but they are dated. We could hear everything that went on on the rooms on each side of us. Was pretty quiet during the week, but once Friday night hit that was the end of it. They did not clean up the rooms until late in the day, and did not have anything that you could put on the door requesting service sooner, so this was hit or miss. Our room was vacant frm 9-3 on Thursday and was not cleaned when we returned so we did not get service for that night. The hotel sits in the middle of the strip which is helpful and has access to the Monorail, so that is also helpful.

Reviews.Title: “It was great”
Reviews.Author: mwill29
Reviews.Content: I read alot of reviews downing Harrahs. This was my first trip to Vegas and was comped here. Well the premium, king, smoking room in Mardi Gras Tower was really nice. Clean and comfortable was what I needed and got. The view was horrible but who cares. All in all it was wonderful and will not hesttate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You probably can find a better hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cornell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 5 nights at Harrah's in mid February. I had never been to Vegas and he had a conference at the hotel so we stayed there. While I did appreciate the great location mid-strip, in this economy, it's more than possible to find a good location (Mirage, Caesars) AND a better quality hotel. We had a standard size room which was quite large but very dated. The bed was very comfortable but the shower leaked, wasn't hot enough and the water pressure was non existant. After wandering through some of the other hotels, I would have preferred one with more bars and places to just sit and hang out to watch the crowd. Harrah's must have once been the place to be in it's time, but that time has past. It could use a facelift. I did go to the Oyster bar twice for delicious Oysters. Yum!!

Reviews.Title: “Premium no”
Reviews.Author: conle28
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Harrahs every time we go to Vegas. This was our 6th trip. The location is great. We were comped a premium room this time,on the 4th floor. First time staying in this tower. Itwas very noisy from the bands playing on Carnival court. The only difference I noticed between the deluxe and the premium rooms were marble shower and a tv in the bathroom, plasma tv in the bedroom. The bathrrom was smaller in the premium, we had no view. I will opt for the deluxe from now on. Service is friendly. I was sick the first 2 days being there. Called down and they let me borrow a humidifier. Brought it quickly. It really helped. Food prices our quite high, but what isn't in Vegas? Buffet at breakfast wasn't what it used to be. Not worth $16. The wait staff in the casino are very friendly with alot of familiar faces. Must be a good place to work, they have been there along time.

Reviews.Title: “Pillow Top Mattress!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mp3diva
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrah's 2/20-2/23/09 in the Mardi Gras Tower 1407. My room was really nice & comfortable. The bed is fabulous, as soon as I sat on it, I didn't want to get up. Took a nap. The flat screen in the bathroom was nice to watch while getting dressed. We were on the side were the carnival club plays. It was not all that loud. You could hear it with the door closed, but is very muffled. Before going out, my party meet in my room, we opened the door and had a mini party in the room. Harrah's has the best comps in vegas. If you don't have a total rewards card, you need to get one. Our room stay was comped for three nights. During our stay we ordered room service twice, about $30 aa pop and that was comped on check out. The room service is from the Cafe downstairs, so the room was not that bad. My husband won $350 on the penny slots, that was a plus! The weather was great, it was about 70 during the day. At night you need a thin jacket. But, aynthing is better than the 300 degrees in the summer. Will never go to Vegas again in the summer, February was great. There wasn't a big crowd and you weren't pissed if you had to go outside for longer than 5 minutes. In September of 08' I stayed at Imperial Palace, so the upgrade to Harrah's was really nice. The stay at IP was wasn't that bad, I had an upgraded suite, but Harah's is much nicer. The bar tender in the Piano Bar at about 5pm on Saturday was not all that friendly and I paid for my drinks!! Whatever!!! Was there to celebrate a cousins bday, who had a compd room @ Bally's, room was huge!!! But furniture was old. The bartender lady out of the carnival court is off the hook!!! You can get any drink you want $25, she was doing all kinds of tricks with the bottles, she earned her $5 tip!! I don't really gamble, at the most maybe $100. I family friend lost about $2k, that is really sad! In this hard economy, we need to make better choices. There are so many other things to do in Vegas, not just gambling. Live outside the box!!!Have Fun!!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT room, and locale, well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: KevinNan
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine chose Harrah's because of the location and the comp rewards. This was my first stay at Harrah's. Others being at Luxor and the Monte Carlo. We checked in around noonish and we were given our rooms immediately. We didn't even have to wait till 4, their check in time. We booked the standard room and our room was on the 4th floor. The price was very affordable and I think the room was well worth it. Our view of the room were the parking garages of Imperial Palace I think.. Not too shabby, we didn't stay in our room much of the time anyway. The bathroom was VERY spacious. I loved it. The beds were nice and very comfy. The casino itself was VERY VERY smokey. It was spacious aswell. The blackjack dealer were very nice and would help ya alittle in the game too! This casino connects to Imperial Palace and the monorail. If you were to walk outside, go next door to Casino Royale and try there 1dollar margaritas. Very good. I had great luck at their Wheel of Fortune. The buffet at FLAVORS was nice but I do think it was overpriced. Lots of Variety of food, but if you're not in it for the food. Try their cafe, I think it's cheaper there. The pool weren't all that great. It reminded me of the pool at my apartment. Try there finger burgers! Dlicious! Over and All. I would mos def. stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bn9900
Reviews.Content: My wife and I choose Harrahs for its central location on the strip. We arrived at 1 pm and was offered a 6th floor room facing the outdoor cafe/bar area. We were advised that the music could be quite noisy. We opted for another room and was told that there were none ready and that we were welcome to wait, and to check back in a little while. We did and was told that we would have to wait until 4pm (regular check in time) when we asked for early check in. Other than this issue at the beginning we had a very nice stay and every one was very nice. We did have an issue with a handle breaking off the closet door, and when I called the front desk, they told me they would send someone up and they never did the entire stay, If you are allergic to cigarette smoke be prepared that even the non smoking rooms have a slight stench due to ventalation or the smell sticking to the clothes. The Flavors Buffet was wonderful, if you think that $20 dollars per person is expensive for a buffet dinner ($15 for breakfast $16 for lunch) I highly recommend that you try it anyway, we thought the same, but after we tried it, and even just saw the verity of dishes, we realized it was worth it. The Cafe was a little over priced, and would recommend the Buffet. Take the bus if planning to travel up and down the strip, my wife and I walked from Harrah's to New York New York and our legs are killing us. The Duce $3 OW and $7 RT.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: jpress
Reviews.Content: This was an average hotel and casino. Rooms were nondescript, average hotel rooms with a small self-programable safe. The casino was a bit aged and average with a theater featuring Rita Rudner upstairs. Harrah's had comp'ed our rooms due to our play in Shreveport/Bossier City so when we came to Vegas to watch our daughter play in a volleyball tournament, we stayed at their Harrah's location. Never spending the night in one of their facilities, we did not know what to expect. We were not dissappointed but were not wow'ed,either. The staff was very friendly and the dealers all had wonderful personalities. We only had breakfast in The Cafe, which was good and was also comp'ed at check-out, and service was excellent. The hotel/casino is located across the street from the Mirage, next to the Flamingo, attached by walkway to the Imperial and within walking distance to many other places on the strip. The traffic is a mess most of the time. One negative that I'm going to mention because I've never experienced anything like this in my entire life....There is a card in the bathroom that states "Throw your dirty towels on the floor and we'll leave you clean ones." We've all seen the sign before...no problem. We left our dirty towels hanging over the shower. Just 2 of us, but I used a 3rd towel when I washed my hair. When we came in that night, our towels were gone and new towels were folded and back on the rack. After my shower, I pulled down a towel to dry off. And, surprise*surprise, there was my makeup (I hope it was my makeup!) on the towel I was drying off with! O-k, interesting. I looked at the rack and there were 4 towels. How were we (or anyone else) to know which one was my towel, my husbands, the towel for my hair...or the clean towel?...how would they know when we checked out? Would they wash them all? How would that save water? Were we using someone elses dirty towels? If we left our 2 dirty towels on the floor, would my dirty hair towel remain on the shelf folded for the next people since I didn't know which one it was to take down and throw on the floor??? Maybe I'm obsessing but I don't like thinking I (or anyone else) is using dirty towels..... Just FYI.... :( I honestly don't know what the price of rooms here are so I can't tell you if this is a good deal or not. It is not flashy or new but it is not old and run down either. The room is decent, the water was always hot, the food and service is good, the casino dealers are personable (which is a big plus... if they're going to take your money, you might as well have fun!!!!) and it's close to other places if you're the type to wander to other casinos. And yes, there is a Starbucks in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel - YES, Buffet - NO”
Reviews.Author: PirateChik
