Reviews.Content: I am a Total Rewards card holder at Harrahs and chose to stay there over Valentine's weekend because they gave me a good rate. The hotel itself is very nice - clean, modern, great location on the strip. This hotel is one of the monorail stops and that makes it much easier to get around to other casinos. The bed was comfy (and I am like the princess and the pea!- so that says a lot!) Lots of hot water in the shower, housekeeping was great. Here are the downfalls: the casino seems much more smokey then others we visited, no coffeemaker or mini fridge in room, and the buffet.......ugh. We had both a dinner and breakfast buffet while we were there. Considering the number of people flowing through the buffet you would think the food would be hot, but almost everything I chose, was luke warm at best (and the OJ at breakfast was not cold either). The food just wasn't very special or appetizing. They did have some nice desserts, though. There are many other places to eat on the strip and we found the dinner buffet at the Venetian was better (except in the dessert area).

Reviews.Title: “Beware of verbal voucher/comps”
Reviews.Author: willieturner
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at Harrahs thru Last Minute Travel and got a good rate (better than any other I could find for this hotel on the web at the time) of 94.95. Stayed on a Friday night on MLK weekend. Great location. Room itself was ok, not a Marriott but a level below. Young partiers next door were really really really loud but finally left at 11:30 PM probably to go to the clubs. When I checked in, I was told by the clerk/reservationist who checked me in that I was entitled to a a "freebie or coupon or a voucher" something like that , where I can use any service within the hotel gift shops, restaurants, etc for up to $30 and I would be credited for it. I asked the clerk if he could give me a coupon or card to use for this. He assured me - all I would have to do is charge the service to the room, and when I checked out, they would deduct up to $30 of the charge from my final bill for the room. So the next morning, I went to the coffee shop and had a breakfast that totaled $17.50. Actually I really did not have much for breakfast, the coffee shop is not cheap. But I was getting this free, right? Well after the meal which I charged to my room, I quickly went back to my room and as I travel light, I was checking out within 5 minutes of leaving the coffee shop. When I dropped off my room key, the clerk told me I did not have any charges. Since I had pretty much just left the coffee shop, I told the clerk that I just had a meal that he probably would not see on his display, but it was charged to the room and was less than the $30 credit. I said that I wanted to double check with you that I would not be charged this amount on my credit card. He said that I wouldn't. Believe me, I would not have eaten breakfast at this hotel if I knew it wasn't free. I just got my credit card statement and they did charge me for it. I called the hotel and talked to the billing clerk and she said her manager told her to tell me that they can't refund my card, and that I would have to call Last Minute Travel to take care of this. This made no sense, but I did call Last Minute Travel, and they said that there is nothing they can do since they did not offer this comp/credit. Bottom line here, if you are offered this kind of extra or freebie, get it in writing or get a coupon, and if they won't do that, go up the ladder to hotel management if necessary. I will not stay at this hotel again. This is bad customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out!”
Reviews.Author: mab06d
Reviews.Content: WATCH OUT!! $100 deposit per night required at check in. or $200 cash to be refunded upon check out. no where does it state this flaw. Make sure you have the extra money when booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb - Tremendous Hotel, Location”
Reviews.Author: Helsj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's from the 24th Jan 09 - 29th Jan 09, didn't know what to expect especially with reading the reviews of this hotel on various forums. From the moment we arrived at the hotel we were very pleased, the rooms were superb the location excellent we couldn't fault a thing, the staff were very friendly and helpful. The location of Harrah's is superb (very central) and with going in the other hotels along the strip we definitely picked the right hotel. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who was going to Las Vegas, one of the best on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: TravelerGlendale_AZ
Reviews.Content: Long time Las Vegas traveler and very disappointed with Harrah’s. Booked 3 remodeled Premium rooms for a 5 night family reunion. All three rooms were dirty, bathrooms had mold, and the view was horrible. Hallway carpets were torn and walls desperately in need of paint and repair. Arrived by 4pm but did not get any of the room types requested when booked through Travelocity. Overheard some Casino employees stating Travelocity bookings get what they get. Requested 2 smoking rooms, one with King and one with 2 Queens, and a non-smoking with King. Got 3 non-smoking rooms with 2 Queen beds instead. Was told at check-in shouldn't be a problem to get the rooms requested the next day. Next morning wasted 2 hours trying to change Premium rooms. Even after complaining about the filthy rooms, they were unable to provide the room types booked, and there was no offer of compensation for the filth. Decided to pay $600 to upgrade to 3 Jr. Suites. Still couldn't get any smoking rooms. The hotel confirmed all 3 suites would be ready by 4pm, but when we went to change rooms, only 2 suites were available. Talked to the Manager, but was only able to get an 11th floor Premium non-smoking room for a smoker. It was better than looking at rooftop air handlers, but had to listen to jackhammers during the day at the pool and loud music until 2am from the outdoor bar at night. The 2 Jr. Suites were nice and clean. If you like cold showers these rooms are for you. Bath water was hot, but when you turn on the shower the water turns cold. The suites were on different floors but the water issue was the same in both suites. Gamble at Harrah’s, don't stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: SVEND
Reviews.Content: My husand and I stayed at Harrah's for the first time from 1/24/09 - 1/27/09. Since our rooms were comped we did not expect much, but were pleasantly surprised with our accommodations. Our room was on the 26th floor of the Carnival Tower with a dead-on view of the Mirage volcano, partial view of the strip and beautiful views of the mountains. Room was clean and comfortable. The only thing it lacked was a real closet. The room had an amoire type of closet which is part of the wall unit in the room. Good thing we were only there for 4 days otherwise the small closet could have been an issue. We ate at the oyster bar within the hotel which was very good. Best oysters we had in a long time! Room service was very fast and efficient. All the bartenders within the hotel seem to pour a very strong drink! Bar outside in the Carnival Court area was a lot of fun, especially at happy hour. All the bartenders were very entertaining. Starbucks is located in main lobby area (open 24 hours) also on the second floor next to Tobby Keiths Bar (opens at 7:00 a.m.) Make sure you go to the one on the second floor. There was never anyone there. We never had to wait! It cost us five dollars to print our boarding passes at the business center which is located on the second floor next to the meeting rooms. People who ran center were very nice and a pleasure to talk to. Rented a car from Hertz for the day. They are located right by the registration desk. Clerk was pleasant, fast, efficient and didn't push the rental insurance. We took a ride to Red Rock Canyon which was about 20 miles from the strip. It was beautiful and worth the trip. Also stopped at the Red Rock Casino. Fabulous hotel with nice casino and great restaurants. Went to Peppermills for a great breakfast. Portions were huge, food really good and place was very Vegas. Had (very expensive) drinks at the Mixx Lounge at the top of Mandalay Bay Hotel. It is worth going just for one drink to check out their bathrooms. View from their bathrooms were unbelieveable! The only thing that was a little annoying was the time share people that worked the main floor, front door entrance and second floor. Just pleasantly decline and keep walking. We did enjoy staying at Harrah's and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations”
Reviews.Author: PierreBathurst
Reviews.Content: Stayed from Jan 18th to jan 24th. Although I was attending the IBS trade show, my wife and I spent time enjoying Las Vegas. Reception desk fast service. Took luxury room which is just slightly more expensive than the deluxe room. Stayed in the Mardi Gras section, room 1254 which overlooked Mirage and Ceaser's Palace. Room very nice with nice view. Bear in mind that not all rooms have a view. Very well located on the middle of the strip, easy access to the Monorail. I've been going to Vegas yearly and this was my 1st time at Harrah's, and would definitely recommend it. If I can be of any help, do not hesitate to contact me coteduf@nbnet.nb.ca Pierre from Bathurst NB.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Unbelievably Comfy Bed”
Reviews.Author: midwest_familyof5
Reviews.Content: Check in on Sunday afternoon took only 5 minutes. Registration desk was sure to inform me that if I opted for a room overlooking Carnaval Court the band could be heard until midnight. Used my comps for 4 night in the Mardi Gras towers. The room had a balcony form which I could partially see the fountains from Bellagio. A couple of floors higher than the one I was on(9) would have been perfect but I was not real concerned about the view at check in so did not bother to ask. Room was both roomy and spotless. Maid service was great even after I broke a glass at 2 am they were there immediately to clean it. Ate at the Cafe a couple of times around 1 am. Place was pretty much deserted but still had to wait 10 minutes for a table which I found odd. Food was good and reasonable for Vegas. Ate the buffet for breakfast once it was delicious. Some of the best fruit ever. Entire staff was very helpful . Slot service came within 3 minutes of the light being turned on. The shuttle to and from Rio actually ran every 15 minutes instead of 30 so not much waiting around. Best part of stay was the amazingly comfortable bed and pillows. I honestly have never been that comfortable and relaxed in my life!!

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: CamaroNC94
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Vegas. Harrahs offered me two free nights in a deluxe room from using my Total Rewards card on the first trip (do sign up, they really do give you comps!). We stayed the first two nights at Imperial Palace and then moved next door to Harrahs. Changing hotels was no problem at all, just walked with our luggage next door around 11am. There was a pretty long line due to everyone checking out at that time but that was to be expected. Staff was not too friendly but not overly rude either. We were just happy to be able to check-in right away and not have to check our luggage at the bell desk(which is outside if you are looking for it). Asked for a strip view but staff said we would have to wait longer to get that so settled for a room on the 15th floor in the Mardi Gras tower. We had no view what so ever but the window was huge, it went from floor to ceiling and if you had something good to look at then it would have been nice. The room was on the small side but clean. We had two queen beds, a small table and chairs, the huge wooden cabinet that held a small tv and on one side had the ironing board and the other a small closet. The room also had a mini bar but don't touch anything unless you want to pay because its motion sensored. The bathroom was also small. The shower would not turn off each day and housekeeping had to come fix it. The sink wouldn't drain after washing your hands. The room layout was just very cramped. It was tight for two people, there is no way that I would suggest trying this room with 3 or 4 people. There are metal srips every few feet in the hallway and the housekeepers are constantly running over them with their cleaning carts and its very annoying when you are trying to sleep. They do not try and come in your room when you have the do not disturb sign up but you know they are out there! The elevators run fast and smoothly. They have seperate ones for the lower number and the higher number floors. The casino is fun, easy to find your way around. Did not see the pool since it was January. Did eat at the Flavors Buffet, thought it was pretty good. You will definitely find enough to eat, they even have sushi on the lunch buffet. Also ate at Harrahs Cafe, I think it was called. It was okay, good place to stop when you are in a hurry to move on to gambling. Did not have very much luck in the casino, mostly played in other ones. Warning on the Mac King Comdey Show...when you check in they will give you a complementary two free tickets coupon. It says that you only have to buy one drink per person for $9.99. Well the day we went Mac King wasn't there, they told us Dave Williamson would be taking his place and the total per ticket comes to about $14 a person once you add in the entertainment and beverage tax. So you get one drink during the show for that price. The show itself was okay. It was about 45 mins long. But you're in Vegas....have fun and enjoy yourself. I would have to say that my stay at IP was better than Harrahs, believe it or not! But I can't complain my nights here were free! Harrahs is a nice clean hotel which is in an excellant location so just use the room for catching some Zzzzz's! Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Vegas first timers”
Reviews.Author: PaJean
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to las Vegas, we picked Harrah's due to price and central location. We had a luxury room on the 18 th floor of the Mardi Gras Tower. Having a view of the the strip was important to us and Harrrah's was able to provide a room with a great view to us. The room was clean, service was excellent. The bell captains and valet service was friendly and provided valuable tips on transportation. We did use room service for breakfast and was pleased. The service was quick and food hot but beaware there is a service charge. Too bad Harrah's could not offer free room service. The buffet was average . The Cafe and Toby's restaurant's food and service was above average. The negative review is the casino itself. It is runned down. The slots are old, the chairs are stained which makes it uncomfortable to sit on. We chose to stand many times. There are not enough restrooms on the casino floor. We used the concierge service in Harrah's to book two tours. That service was below average. We left a message on the answering machine to have the person call us to book our tours and never recieved a return call. I recalled left a message , waited two hours and then recalled and got a live person on the phone. When I tried to put the charge on my room bill , the person said I could not because they are not connected to the hotel service. I could definelty tell, since this service was below average. The tour to Hoover dam was average but the tour guide for the Red Rock canyon was not very articulate and not able to give a well presented guided tour. Both tour guides were pleasant. All in all , We enjoyed our stay and the location of Harrah's is a very postive feature.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, good”
Reviews.Author: rondreizer
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights in harrah's during the CES and AVN convention. The hotel has an excellent location for a good price. I booked a deluxe strip view in the carnival tower. There wasn't much of a strip view, but for the good online deal i made it was ok. The room is clean with a seat for two and a small desk with a good internet connection (plug in the cable, cost 14 dollar a day). The room was quiet, the room was clean, the bed was very good and housekeeping allright. But the other hotels like Caesar and Treasure Island aren't that far away from this hotel and the center strip as i expected. It is a good hotel if you are not often on the room and are here for business. For a romantic getaway i should choose something more expensive for the Las Vegas glamour experience and extra bling bling. And offcourse for a good swimming pool, in december don't bother for a hotel without swimming pool, or it must be inside. It was what i expected and a good deal when you're not looking to stay at a hotel with something extra to experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: WYSIWYG
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Harrah's Las Vegas during CES 2009 (Jan 8-12). Booked a Premium room. Check-in around 11:30am was fast and very friendly. I asked for a no smoking room facing away from the Carnival court and was offered just that. The room ended up being a 2 Queen bed room on the 12th floor facing the strip (view of TI/Mirage and its volcano). The room was wonderful. A 32" LCD TV in the bedroom and another 15" LCD in the bathroom. The beds were confortable and had crisp white linens. There was a minibar in the room and ample storage in the closet (inside the built-in cabinet). AC was quiet, but I ended up turning it OFF as it was cool anyhow and I prefer to open the window (to a small balcony) for fresh air. I had an issue with the TV (Stations were not programmed) and within 45 mins of calling housekeeping, a technician came up and fixed right away and showed me how to reset in case it did it again (it did). A bit later, the very nice maid knocked on the door to ensure everything was alright. Daily housekeeping was perfect. Lots of towels, soaps and other toileteries changed as used. The room was quiet, but I could barely hear my next door neighbour through the connecting door. Luckily, most people around that time were single professionals going to CES, so it was not an issue at all. There was no smell of any smoke at all in the room or hallways. Ate 3 times at the buffet and it was alright. Good choice for breakfast with all the usuals (including made to order eggs). Keep an eye in the Carnival court for a girl handing out $5 off coupons valid anytime. Casino itself was OK, but I mostly played at Bally's or Paris as the table minimums were $5 there, compared to $10 at Harrah's. On my last day (Monday), many sections of the casino slots where closed off for renovations. Not sure how long it was going to last for. Overall a great stay. I had absolutely nohing to complain about. Everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “harrahs”
Reviews.Author: angelajean102
Reviews.Content: Front check in was quick and efficient. Staff member a bit reserved, bordering on cold,but professional. She unfroze a bit by the time we finished with our questions. Room was clean, very nicely decorated, well organized, and roomy for two people. The room had everything needed with extras. The only thing we would have liked stocked was in room coffee and coffee maker. The housecleaning staff was considerate never ignoring the Do Not Disturb sign. The cleaning and re-stocking of the room was always done properly and in a timely manner. The cleaning staff was freindly. Our room was in the back tower which was perfect for avoiding noise and crowds. From the tower it is a short walk through the casino to the strip. My mother is very allergic to cigarrette smoke but she was not bothered by the smoke when walking through the casino. I am not aware if this is due to the air filtering system or the decreased number of gamblers when we were there. The front desk staff was very helpful and eager to help when approached with questions. One of the in house restaurants we walked past each day had a reasonably priced steak and shrimp special on each day. There is a McDonalds and Denny's restaurant very close to the casino doors twhich open onto the strip. The in house theatre where we saw Rita Rudner's performance was excellent. The theatre is suprisingly smaller than you would expect and the performer can easily be seen from any seating area. The seats were comfortable and the design of the space makes you feel as if you are one of a few special guests invited to a private performance. The alcohol was reasonably priced and theatre staff was freindly and accomodating. The casino staff , cleaners and security, were also freindly and accomodating when asked questions. They never hurried you or acted as if they had better things to do. The check out was fast and efficient. The staff member was once again freindly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Drool
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a West Jet Vacation Package. The room was very nice. We had a King Size bed - very comfortable. The Italian restaurant in the hotel was excellent. They had a $20 special including an entree, salad, bread and glass of wine. It was very good and more than I could eat. The people at the registration desk were very friendly and helpful. They were always willing to take the time to give us directions or answer questions. I am embarassed to say that I forgot to check the closet before we checked out and didn't realize until we got home that I had left 5 or 6 articles of clothing. I quickly called the hotel, they put me thru to lost and found and they had all of my stuff saved in a bag for me. I was able to have a relative pick my clothes up for me. I was very impressed by the honesty of the hotel. I have left stuff in other hotels never to be seen again. I was also impressed by how easy they made it for me to resolve my problem, they were very co-operative. The only negative I can possibly think of (and this is all over Vegas not just limited to this hotel) is the ever present Time Share people. I just got so I would shake my head and glare at them when they would start to aproach. I really hate feeling like I have to do that because I hate having to be rude to people but otherwise I would be sucked into one presentation after another.

Reviews.Title: “great location for price”
Reviews.Author: Brit_Abroad3
Reviews.Content: We chose Harrah's based upon a recommendation from a work colleague due to it being centrally located and cheap. We were very happy with the hotel accommodation and the staff were very pleasant and helpful. Given that we were never in the room, we decided not to upgrade and stayed in a standard room in the Carnaval Tower even though we knew it hadn't been rennovated. Our room was in very good condition (Rm 2934) and even though slightly dated compared to more modern hotels, was more than adequate for our needs and was only $40 a night. Why pay a fortune for a bed and a shower in somewhere like the Venetian when you can get a good clean simple room at Harrah's with just as good a location and then spend the difference on enjoying yourselves with the luxuries in life. We can't comment on the food etc in the hotel as we didn't eat there (we ate in The Bellagio etc spending the money we had saved!) A really good central location, friendly staff and comfy rooms at a really good price. Would definitely recommend to family/friends. Just watch out for the slightly thin walls - the people in the empty adjoining room who had obviously checked out the day before had forgotten to cancel their early morning alarm. Security quickly turned the alarm clock off after we called reception and explained.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, with reasonable priced upgrades”
Reviews.Author: ez-n-frank
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth trip to Vegas and we wanted somewhere a bit more central and a little more "old Vegas" so we picked Harrahs. On arrival we were offered an upgrade to a Junior suite for $50 a night or $75 for a top floor Exec Suite with Jacuzzi and view of the Mirage volcano. As it was Xmas and we were there for 6 nights we opted for the Exec suite. Check in was fairly quick and the staff were friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is very central and within walking distance of pretty much everything on the strip. If you have tired feet there is also a monorail station at the back of the hotel. Some think the immediate area is a little "off" but apart from the McDonalds next door which does attract some undesirables (both prostitutes and lots of the flicky flicky men when we went) it's absolutely fine at any time of day. In the room we had a living room with a small coffee making/drinks station, a large bedroom with a king bed and a bathroom with jacuzzi, two sinks and a seperate shower. The living room had a sofa and a TV and a dining table and chairs. There was also a small bar type thing in the corner for coffee and with a min bar. The window had view over the strip looking towards the Mirage and the mountains. The bedroom had a large king bed with a big wardrobe, a safe and an iron. There was also a double corner window with views over the Mirage and up the strip towards the Venetian. We could watch the Volcano from our room. The bathroom had a jacuzzi bath big enough for two, a sink each with their own Gilchrist and Soames tolietries and a seperate toilet and shower. Overall I was very impressed with Harrah's. I was a little sceptical of Harrahs as it's less well known but i had nothing to fear. I'm not sure what the standard room is like but in my opinion I think I would prefer to pay for an Exec Suite here for roughly the same price as a standard room in some of the 4 star hotels. Aside from the room the hotel is just like many of the other casinos. The breakfast buffet is fairly average, but we only had it once as there were big queues and it's not really my thing anyway. We also went to the "Toby Keiths - I love this bar and Grill" in the hotel which was good, but a bit too TGI's for my liking. They bring your drink in a big jar which just seems wrong. Good value but i had a chronic headache when we went so I don't actually remember too much of this. Overall a great hotel which I would not hesitate to stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs Mardi Gras Tower”
Reviews.Author: teachrsue
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 2 nights at Harrahs. I booked through the hotel website using comps. This was a solo trip and I was at Four Queens DT before checking into my room on the strip. The room was a "premier" room in which I understood to be a remodeled room in the Mardis Gras Tower. I checked in at 2:00 PM on a Sunday and requested a quiet room away from Carnaval Court. This tower is the older tower with balconies. I had stayed there several years ago and found the room at that time a bit worn. I was pleasantly surprised upon entering the room. The entire room and furnishings had been redone. Nice big pillow top mattress, duvet and plenty of pillows. Flat screen TV in room and small one in bath mounted to the wall. Very clean room, small balcony, nice water pressure in the shower. The rooms are small but perfect for a single traveler and would not be bad for a couple. My room overlooked the AC vents but could see a little of the Venetian. I don't mind the AC/heat noise as it helps me sleep! I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again on a good offer. The staff was friendly, room was comfortable and perfect for my stay. Overall I was very impressed with my room

Reviews.Title: “All around good experience”
Reviews.Author: matt4633
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at Harrah's earlier this month and was very happy with the experience. After staging my own personal reenactment of the movie Planes, Trains and Automobiles, which included numerous flight delays, an all out sprint across O'Hare to make a connecting flight and a rental car that wasn't there...I finally arrived (many hours late) at 2am, tired and slightly cranky. Upon check-in, the employees at the front desk were wonderful, going beyond polite and courteous to make me feel genuinely welcome. I headed to my room (Carnavale Tower - Rm 518), which was spacious and clean. The view wasn't much to speak of, but hey, not everything can overlook the Strip (I think views are overrated, the only time I actually noticed my view was when I first arrived and checked to see what kind of view I had). The bathroom was giant, beds comfortable and above all, everything was clean. After dropping off my bags in the room, I headed down to check out the casino. It was 2:30am on a Wed. but there were still a decent amount of gaming options available, cocktail service was quick and I happy with the selection of higher end beers. I ended up only eating one meal on the premises, a lunch at Ming's Table, which was reasonably priced (for Vegas) with large portions and good food. On a previous trip I visited the steakhouse (The Range), which was excellent. There are a number of other options available for all pallets and all budgets. If you're interested in venturing out into Vegas, Harrah's is centrally located, within walking distance of dozens of other casinos, shops and restaurants. I like to casino hop, so this was perfect for me. If you're cheap like me and want to play $5 blackjack, you can head next door to Casino Royale or O'Shea's (there were some $5 tables at Harrah's but only on weekday morning/afternoons), or if you want a higher end experience you can cross the street to the Mirage or TI. I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to my friends & family.

Reviews.Title: “If you have a conference at the Venetian stay here for 1/2 the price.”
Reviews.Author: echolake
Reviews.Content: When I'm in Vegas on business I'm only in the room to sleep and shower... and it seems silly to pay two or three hundred a night for a hotel room. The rooms at the Venetian are great, but if you want to save a some cash you can book a room next door at Harrah's for half that or less. The rooms are nice, just not as plush as some of the more expensive hotels on the strip. Harrah's also has a great location. I've stayed here 5 times in the past two years - and every stay was the same - no hassles, room as expected.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Fair Hotel”
Reviews.Author: polarbear123
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrah's while attending a wedding at the Wynn. The hotel was fair. I have stayed at Mirage, TI, and Excalibur in the past and this was better than Excalibur but not up to par with Mirage or TI. The location is midstrip so it was perfect for getting around. The casino was big and had plenty of games to choose from. It was busy but not overly crowded. Don't miss the dueling piano bar. It was a good way to spend some time not gambling. My only gripe is that I had booked all 3 nights at once. As the date got closer some of the days prices went down and some went up. When I called to have it adjusted they told me they could only give me a new total price (ups and downs included) not just change one night. To remedy this I asked if I could cancel one of the nights (the one that had gotten cheaper) and rebook it at the new rate. This seemed to work fine. By the end I had 3 confirmation numbers, but they accomodated well and we had the same room the whole stay. Harrah's was an average hotel with a nice casino. But if you want a view you will need to pay for it. We looked at roofs and alleys. I may splurge a little next time for a better one.

Reviews.Title: “generally good”
Reviews.Author: maverick1507
Reviews.Content: Generally good experience but CONSTANTLY accosted at entrances by people selling time shares and/or condos. It started as soon as we checked in (first booth was right next to registration) and continued constantly as we entered and existed the property. All I could do to not swear or flip them off after 3rd day! Housekeeping is not very alert - toilet "rattled" everytime we sat on it, apparently something was loose. Should have been caught every time it was cleaned, assuming it was cleaned. Good choices of machines in casino, almost no tables less than $25 for blackjack. Excellent location, close to many other casinos we wanted to visit and has Sam's Town and Rio shuttles.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: Rizingsun03
Reviews.Content: I booked a trip for my fiancé for his 25th birth day; we stay at Harrah's Las Vega's. My main reason for booking this trip was because I had an amazing discount on rooms from playing at Harrah's in Atlantic City. We were a little worried that this casino was geared towards an older audience but we couldn’t pass up the deal. When we first arrived they did not have the type of room that I requested (upgraded and view of the strip). We stayed in one of the older rooms for the first night. We had no problem switching our room the next morning. We were upgraded to a newly renovated room and were given a $30 meal voucher for the inconvenience. Our new room was very nice and had a great view of the strip as well as the mountains. I will say that I feel the casino floor was a little smaller then some of the other casinos we visited. Our dinning options were limited and there is no real upscale bar or club. Since it is Vegas we had no problems catching a cab and going over to the Palms or other casino's that had some of the hottest night life around. While staying there we also saw the Price is Right show and received free tickets at check in for the Classic Auto Car Show. I would definitely come back to Vegas, it was one of the best vacations I've had! I would consider staying at Harrah’s again if we were given another discount but the Harrah’s in Atlantic City completely beats the quality, night life, and eating places. What can you say in a Jersey girl that is very fortunate to have Atlantic City in our state.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION- good idea”
Reviews.Author: wildflowerb
Reviews.Content: Another review for Vegas from me. I love this town and love to check out the hotels. I stay in a lot of hotels. If a hotel is fab I rave about it. if it isn't that great, I still try to find some positives and prefer not to slate the property. Harrah's is a good strip hotel in a great location I stayed here as it was comped to me for my play in July of this year. I love the gaming facility here. It is one of the few casinos that has a $5 stud table. I stayed in the Mardi Gras tower in one of the newly done up rooms. Pleasant and comfortable with 2 plasmas (one in the bathroom - wish it was stuck on the opposite wall so I could watch more comfortably from the bath!). Big king bed with lovely linen ( huge fan of crisp white linen). My room was in the "quieter" section of the hotel but faced over the massive air conditioning system ( not noisy to me)- but also had a bit of a strip view ( not really but could see treasure island and the bell tower from the venetian and also the Mirage). I think this was better than being above the live music. And I was given the option at check in. Room service was good. With prompt and friendly service. Check in excellent with the room ready early. One always has to be prepared for the fact that in Vegas rooms may not be ready until late afternoon and that there are often long check in lines (these move fast). No check in line for me at about the 1.00pm mark at Harrahs on a Sunday. I would be staying here again if I could and would recommend this hotel to others. I think it is better than the Flamingo and miles better than the Imperial Palace. However, it still suits a modest budget for a strip hotel in a top location. If you can't afford one of the premium hotels, give this one a go. I don't think it would disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: beginnertravel
Reviews.Content: Pros: - clean rooms - great bands at carnival bar in courtyard - great location - everyone very friendly - gave our group adjoining rooms with no problems Cons: - in the 1 bathroom, the sink smelt of sewage and bathtub faucet leaked - in the other bathroom, the light flashed like strobe light and nobody came to fix it - buffet expensive and not that great, however there was a large variety of food. - no complementary coffee in the AM, had to buy from expensive Starbucks Besides the minor problems in the bathrooms, I would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Problems abound”
Reviews.Author: Crewman7
Reviews.Content: Look, I love the attitude of the dealers at Harrahs. They're the nicest ones in a very mean town. My problems stem from the lack of things to do if you don't gamble. People keep saying the shows. But what if you don't want to go to 'shows'? There's nothing else to do at Harrah's or any casino. It's just slot machines and blackjack. There's nothing 'thrilling' about losing your hard-earned money. Nothing. And I agree with the 'smoker' comment - my throat was sore after just 15 minutes in the casino. After all is said and done, if I'm going to lose money I'd rather give it to the poor and unfortunate.

Reviews.Title: “great location on the strip”
Reviews.Author: mmeoww
Reviews.Content: We went on a promo trip through a time share we own. We attended the 2 hour overview presentation with the strangest time share salesperson we have ever met - very low key and personal. After the tour of the Grand Desert property it came down to "do you see yourselves doing this or not?" and when we said no it was a very simple okay, let me show you to my manager and we'll get you on your way with your gifts - that amounted to $100 cash (supposedly gaming chips but they gave us cash) and 2 Rio buffets, valued at $51 when we redeemed them. We felt that we made out like bandits. Nothing wrong with time share, but can be an ordeal to talk to a salesperson - not this time! As far as Harrah's - I was very disappointed by how smoky and unpleasant the casino, especially in comparison to some of the other casinos. Even the older ones, like the Mirage, were easier to take. Obviously, people like to smoke when they gamble but not all facilities are set up to clear this out as well as others. However, we loved how convenient this hotel was to the rest of the strip - whether it was the other Harrah's owned properties like the Imperial Palace, Flamingo, Paris, Bally's or the Rio (shuttle runs between the properties) or the others like the Mirage, TI, Wynn, Venetian, Cesears Palace and the Planet Hollywood - a lot has changed since we were last in Vegas and we loved the central location. Plus, having the monorail at the back of the hotel (not too long a hike, like it is some other resorts) made it easy to get to Hooters & MGM on the south end of the Strip and the Hilton and even up to the Sahara on the north end. Be sure to check out the Deuce for transportation up & down the strip and to Fremont street/downtown - for $5 a 24-hour pass was an even better deal than the monorail with a further reach for explorers. Our room was very comfortable, even though it was only on the 5th floor of the Carnival tower - which meant NO view and some thumping and other sounds from the music on Sunday night late into the night, but not so noticeable Monday & Tuesday night of our stay. We were surprised to find it so clean and pleasant after reading some of the other reviews - this was a room that the desk clerk informed us had not yet been renovated so we had low expectations. But all turned out well and we were quite happy, the room was quite spacious and met our needs. I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone considering a lower priced option right on the strip - you will find the time share folk everywhere up & down the strip, just get comfortable with saying no, really, no - unless you want the freebies they are offering and are willing to play the game. Las Vegas is a crazy amazing destination!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: flgal65
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate on the hotel so we thought we'd give it a try for our first trip to Las Vegas. Check in was smooth; lady at the desk explained nearly everything and answered all of our questions. Room was nice. We were in the older Carnival Tower, but the room was just fine on the 29th floor. Great view of the Rio Hotel and the red rocks/mountains of Nevada. Room was spacious, bathroom large, stocked daily, and clean. Beds soft (a bit soft for me, but still nice after a long day of walking), soft sheets and pillows too. Room came with a coffee maker (had heard some Vegas hotels don't offer this) so that was nice. Had room service deliver breakfast our first morning there; good food, not overly-priced, delivered rather quickly. Casino was smokey, but so is all of Vegas. Had to walk through it to get outside to the stip, so no way to avoid it. The TimeShare snipers were a bit annoying, but a simple "no thank you" with a smile made them go away. Gift shop carried just about anything you needed but items were WAY overpriced in my opinion. Checkout went smoothly and we caught the airport limo with no problems whatsoever. Overall, for the price and location (right in the middle of everything) would stay here again if we visit Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay - with a few caveats”
Reviews.Author: ral338
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights in early November. The overall stay was good. Check-in on Sunday afternoon was pretty quick. The staff was very polite. The room was fine, large although the armoire (which includes the TV) takes up significant space. I was in the Carnival Tower, and while the room was on the Strip side, it was only on the 5th floor so there wasn't a real view. A friend was in the Mardi Gras Tower on the 11th floor - he had a better view, but still not that great . As long as you don't expect much of a view there won't be a problem. I found the room comfortable - there isn't much to say. It was quiet - I didn't hear much activity from the adjoining rooms. Bathroom was large and the shower/water pressure and temperature were good; plenty of hot water in the morning when many people are showering. I had breakfast at the buffet one morning, and it was good. I had two problems here. First is that at night I could hear the rock band playing at the hotel bar that adjoins the strip. It wasn't loud, but could be heard - it might annoy sensitive people. It stopped about 12:30 to 1 am. This will only affect some rooms, and if you are on the other side of the Carnival tower or in the Mardi Gras I don't think you will hear it. Second was that the housekeeping did not replace the washcloths as they took them to be laundered. On the last day this left me with none, which I consider atrocious. When I called in the evening to get some (when I noticed) they didn't bring them up. But a second call the next morning was quickly taken care of. At checkout I was told that the laundry company that serves all the hotels didn't deliver to anyone. Even if that were true, the staff should know not to take the old ones if they have no fresh washcloths to leave. This was probably a one time issue and wouldn't stop me from returning. But it was an area that needs improvement. (I left a smaller gratuity, and a note, so the housekeeper will hopefully know better if it happens again.) Overall I consider Harrah's a very satisfactory hotel and would return. It has a good location on the Strip, and easy access to the monorail. It's not as fancy as some others, but is much more affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Puddycat902
Reviews.Content: Just returned tonight from a four day/three night stay at Harrah's. First impressions were not overly positive....driving up to the check in/registraion area goes around some unsightly parts of the building and is not impressive. The lobby area is just OK. One of the first things you notice is the amount of cigarette smoke/smell that is in the casino. We couldn't get away from it even in the buffet (Flavors) area. We asked to change our seat to a more interior one away from the machines. Also the ceilings are rather low...maybe this makes the smell worse. My eyes burned after a few hours in the casino and I developed a cough the following day. Why can't Vegas follow Atlantic City and ban smoking?? On the positive side....our room was clean and pleasant. The beds were comfortable and the linens nice. We stayed in the Mardi Gras tower. I liked that the walk onto the strip was not very long. Last year I stayed at Bally's and it took forever to get from our room onto the strip (needed moving walkways and escalators..it was exhausting to get to the street). The hotels' location is really good. It is centrally located. The Flavor's buffet is more than adequate. We liked the breakfast buffet especially. Of course it's not the Bellagio buffet which is top notch and a must... Whatever you do, do NOT go to the Flamingo buffet. It is horrible. Overall, we did enjoy our stay at Harrah's and would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned from Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: xplq
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at Harrah's Oct. 31 thru Nov.3. We found the hotel to be very pleasant. It is not the Ritz, but has well appointed rooms that are spacious and clean. The beds are extremely comfortable with nice quality linens. Although we were on the go for most of our stay, everybody that we had contact with that was working in the hotel were extremely friendly and accomodating. They always asked if everything was OK and if we were enjoying our stay. We only ate at the hotel twice, but found both to be very good, also with good service. The location is what makes Harrah's attractive. It is ideally located so that you can easily access the strip and visit other hotels in the immediate vicinity. We would definitely return. It is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend this hotel or casino”
Reviews.Author: NoDumbPeople
Reviews.Content: The problem with Harrah's is the smokey casino. Almost everyone smokes. Everywhere. And to get to your room? You must go through the casino. It's unbelievable. Remember: 2 hours in a casino equals 6 months of second-hand smoke exposure. To risk your lungs to that smoke is a very bad health risk. Also, you have these illegal immigrants right outside Harrah's door trying to solicit everyone for call girls. They actually cut me with one of their cards - and they grinned sheepishly. If you must go to Las Vegas (and I can't think of any reason other than to gamble and 98% of all gamblers lose their money according to study after study), you should stay off the strip. Visit the Hoover dam if you must, but I would stay clear away from the casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: KDRaknm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Harrah's 10/23-26/08 and had a lovely time. Check-in was easy - we were fortunate to come at a time when it wasn't so busy, because there were 6 people helping those checking out and only 2 helping those checking in (haven't people heard of the check-out service on the TV in their room???). We arrived around 9 AM and were given a room right away on the 5th floor of the Carnaval Tower. The check-in clerk did warn us about the mini-bar in the room. Apparently, they've had problems with people being charged just because they had set something on top of the mini-bar (the computer sensors were ultra-sensitive). Good thing she told us because it certainly looks like you should be able to put things on top of it. Other than that, the room was fine. It was a bit dark - there are only 2 lights in the room. Some people do like to read in the evening! The room had obviously been remodeled recently, because everything looks clean and new. We normally stay at Treasure Island but moved over to Harrah's because the price was so much better. I'd go back after this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Skippy_in_Colorado
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Harrah's and this is my opinion of what it's like, take it for what it's worth. We checked in quickly and professionally, stay on the the 23rd floor of the carnival tower. Ordinary room, we where not offered an upgrade to the Mardi Gras tower, we would probably have taken it, but no matter. The room was average, somewhat dated and probably due to a remodel in the next few years to keep the hotel competitive. The only really thing I notice is the cabinet the TV sits in is rather obtrusive when the doors are open, if you get up in the middle of the night , be warned. The common areas where similar to the room, nothing that set them off either positive or negitive but dated and need of minor repairs. We ate at the 'The Cafe" for breakfast one day, not really all that great, watery eggs, way too large of portions of mediocre food and a touch over priced for breakast fare. The casino is nice, but I think they all look the same, the wife is the gambler of the family, she didn't get rich but broke even for 4 days, I guess that would be winning. The best part of this hotel is the location, close to everything from the airport, monorail and other strip features. Overall, we enjoyed our stay, like I said nothing to really exceptional or negitive, your average strip hotel in this price range. One thing of note for new Vegas travelers, I have been going to Las Vegas for the past 15 years and I noticed this time in particular that the price of things is starting to climb more then usual, I bought a beer at one of the Luxor casino bars, $8, at Harrah's $6 was about the average and most meals seemed 30 to 50% higher then other vacation spots. Not being much of gambler this may be my last trip, other places in the country aren't quite this expensive, old vegas seems to be dying. That's all I know, I hope it helps. Skippy in Colorado

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but very noisy!”
Reviews.Author: wrightwright
Reviews.Content: Checking in was good. They didn't have the room that we booked. They were going to give us 2 beds instead of 1 king. We asked if we could be upgraded and we got the premium room in the mardi gras tower for a charge of $25 per night. The room was very nice, it looked like it was recently remodeled. Our room looked onto the pool. They warned us that there would be some noise from the carnival court but it wasn't that bad. The only thing that was not good was the walls are very thin and we could hear people talking in the next room and the toilets flushing. In Vegas that is all the time it doesn't matter what time it is.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place To Eat”
Reviews.Author: Emo56
Reviews.Content: Go to the Oyster Bar At Pennazzi, It's the best secret on the strip Great Seafood . Ask for Rumundo He will cook a very special meal for you . I can't say enough about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Gambler Beware!”
Reviews.Author: HOOPCRITIC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed Oct 9th through the 12th. We intially requested a deluxe room in the Mardi Gras tower but switched to carnival tower because of a power outage scheduled during the night (2-5). We upgraded to Junior suite and I highly recommend it. Largest hotel room we have ever stayed in, and it does make for a more relaxing stay. Overall stay at Harrahs is perfect because of the location. I agree with the others that drink service is abundance and the hotel is nice. Now the bad news. The old Vegas is GONE. I spent 3 full days gambling (Blackjack, slots) at several casinos and all I can tell you is check your luck at the door because these casinos have changed and made it much, much harder for you to have an edge over them. Three years ago I came and consistenly fared well at Binions, Harrahs, Flamingo, MGM, Ballys. Most all of these casinos now deal 6 decks. You can get a 1 or 2 deck but with payout and rule changes. Blackjack now only pays 6/5 on the low decks(1-2) and you CANNOT double down after splitting( some casinos have exceptions-for now). At first, I thought I was just having bad luck but as the days followed and I watched other people, I noticed noone I saw winning at either slots or tables( and I looked at alot of tables). I was actually impressed by this- alot of people losing so consistenly...everywhere, not just Harrahs. Friday night, I deceided to go outside of Harrahs properties( pretty much all of the surrounding properties) and see if this is a growing trend and unfortunatley it was. So dont bring much to lose and try to do more touring than gambling.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was okay, location was great”
Reviews.Author: norwayvalleygirl
Reviews.Content: The location was great but the hotel itself was so-so. The room cleaning was not up to par with other hotels. A dirty wine glass was left in our room for two days, so I put it in the hallway where it stayed for another two days. They replaced a dirty water glass with a clean one, but didn't take the dirty one. The view from our room left alot to be desired. If looking at air conditioning units is your thing, stay here. The air conditioning is motion sensored by the door, which was horrible in 110 degree heat. When we walked into our room, it was 79 degrees. Not a cool temperature for when you have been walking outside. The cafe in the hotel was overpriced, understaffed, and, the food was bland. The buffet was good with a variety of different foods. The casino slots were very tight, but the beverage service was frequent and abundant! The pool area was great because it had little water sprayers to cool you off in the hot Vegas sun. Would I stay here again? I would for the location on the strip but not for the service.

Reviews.Title: “good stay at Harrahs”
Reviews.Author: TheLoneTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrahs 9/28-10/2, 2008. Staff was very nice, room was good, bed was comfortable. My only criticism of the room would be to add an exhaust fan and maybe some brighter lighting to the bathroom, and maybe put coffeemakers in the rooms. Other than that it was a really good stay. Mac King show at the Harrahs Showroom was funny, a really good show. Monorail station at Harrahs was very convenient. The Cafe was good and the buffett also (got discount buffett tickets at Tix4tonight---also good place to get discount show tickets). Overall a positive experience and would recommend Harrahs to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Lulu59
Reviews.Content: I just returned from staying three days at this hotel. Check in was effortless and the hotel staff service was pleasant each time I had to deal with them. Our room was very clean with two very comfortable queen size beds with nice crip linens. The rooms are also very spacious and include a table with two chairs as well as a fully stocked mini bar. The bathroom was also very large and comfortable. We ordered room service twice and both times the service and the food were great. We dined at Flavors, the buffett restaurant in the hotel, and were pleasantly surprised. You get a lot for your money and other than the Mexican dishes that appeared extremely dry and unappealing, it was a great experience. The best feature of this hotel and casino in my opinion is the location. They are situated right on the strip, steps away from the best hotels, including the Venetian, Ceasars and the Bellagio. I recomend staying here as you get a lot for your money.

Reviews.Title: “So,So”
Reviews.Author: KatGilbert
Reviews.Content: The location is great. Our bed was comfortable and room clean. Our biggest complaint was that our room was very noisy. We could hear the people talking in the room next to us like they were in our room. (They weren't even talking loud ) and we could hear them use their bathroom. It kind of reminded us of a Super 8. We certainly hope to find something quieter next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, location and affordable”
Reviews.Author: JCJSouthCarolina
Reviews.Content: Have been to LV many times and stayed many places. I will stay at Harrah's next time. The staff in every area are exceptionally nice and friendly. The food in the cafe is very good, reasonable and the portions are plentiful. My sister and I are senior citizens and felt very safe at all times in all areas.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: kathyktemperance
Reviews.Content: We took our family to Las Vegas for my son's 21st birthday on Sept. 12th for 4 nights. Got to the hotel about 10:00 pm on a Friday night and walked right up to the counter. We always stay at Harrah's in the Mardi Gras tower facing the pool. However, this time they told us those rooms would be $25 more per night. That was the first time this happened. The only king room available was a handicapped room in the carnival tower, so we took it. It had a good view of the mirage volcano (it was under repair, so it wasn't working). Rooms were clean and comfortable beds. All the others in our party opted for 2 queens (they wanted kings) as these rooms were ready. I just don't understand how rooms aren't ready at 10:00 at night, when they know you're coming. Anyway, spent most of our days at the pool. Some people don't like the pool here, but all you need to do is get wet. We had a great time! Great bartenders at the pool bar! Went to the Carnival Court the first night and had a ball. Also went to Margaritaville, and also had a great time. Gambling was pretty good to us. Came across some wonderful dealers. They were very pleasant. Didn't come home broke! Our whole party ate at Toby Keith's. Dinner was good, but slow. Had breakfast at the buffett, which was also good. My son, who is a mountain biker, went on a 4 hour biking trip to red rock canyon. He said it was harder then he thought it would be, when riding up hill. Also, the weather was fantastic! Not a cloud in the sky and in the upper 90's. Can't wait to go back, probably in the spring.

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs Carnival Tower”
Reviews.Author: danbot32162
Reviews.Content: Another wonderful stay at Harrahs Las Vegas. This time in the Carnaval tower in room 1827. Very nice clean room. King bed was n/a so I was given a room with 2 queen beds. Table with two chairs was helpful. Closet , tv, and snack minibar are build in to the wall which left more floor space. Regular tv set had lots of cable channels available. Wall safe was handy. Bathroom has a very nice tub shower design ,full amenities, and full stock of towels. And coffee maker too - the hotel needs to wash the out carafe to remove built up residue on the top cap cover instead of just rinsing it out . Shower head had over 5 settings from heavy massage spray to gentle rain flow. Climate control was easy to use and kept the room at a comfortable level. Blackout drapes helped keep the hotels exterior flood lights out of the room. The window opened partially of course and the half view I had showed the dormant Mirage volcano (being ungraded), the TI (Treasure Island) at a distance, and to the right the Venetian. Over all room stay was great. Slot play at the casino was a different story. No wins this time on the Strip. But I did come out ahead at the Orleans ($1800 and $433) and at Fitzgeralds downtown ($900) Happy Gaming !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Central to the Strip--Comfortable and Clean”
Reviews.Author: DesertBound
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights September 8-12, 2008. We drove in and parking was fairly plentiful in Harrah's garage which was nice. Check-in was fast and easy. We were told when we reserved the room several months in advance that the luxury room we reserved would have a coffee maker but ours didn't, was kind of disappointed with that. It also promised a strip view...but we did not really have a strip view...well kind of a peekaboo view I guess but not at all what they indicated over the phone. There is a Starbucks located within Harrah's which is nice. Beds were pretty comfortable, room clean. Location of Harrah's is centrally located on the strip and close to many other casinos, and that is a definite plus. Never ever have luck gambling at Harrah's so we do tend to gamble our majority of time elsewhere but still gamble at Harrah's to earn some comps. The comp system at Harrah's is not good as other player clubs. Of all the hotels I've stayed at on the strip over the years, Harrah's is not my favorite in terms of nicest room I've stayed in. However, it is my favorite hotel for it's location on the strip!! I would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing room”
Reviews.Author: LondonCat76
Reviews.Content: The room we booked was described as a "recently refurbished room, with a Harrahs bed and plasma tv". On checking in we were told that the room we had reserved was not available. When we told the person on the desk that we had paid for that specific type of room we were told that they didn't guarantee rooms! The only room that was available was a smoking room which as both of us are non-smokers was not ideal. The only option was to wait a couple of hours for another room to become available. Having travelled all the way from the UK we took the smoking room. The room was awful. The smell of smoke hit us as soon as we walked in the room and the smell was so intense. The decor and curtains had even turned yellow! We had an awful nights sleep as even the pillows smelled of smoke. The shower also was broken and hanging off the stand it was on. After complaining the next morning we were offered a non-smoking room but still not the one we had originally booked. We still had no apology from anyone and had to wait until 6pm to change rooms and move our suitcases ourselves!! The room was a slight improvement, however it was very noisy and we felt like the people in the next room were actually in our room! On checking out we mentioned the room situation again and were told that the room we originally booked had been taken out for a convention. We were then offered a free breakfast but this was completely pointless as we had to make our way to the airport! Apart from this the hotel is in a good location on the strip. I wouldn't stay here again though!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: LovesToTravel018
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Harrah's in Las Vegas from September 4th through September 8th with my husband. The property is great! Location: The location of this property is central to everything you need! Front Desk: The front desk help went very smoothly. The first day that we checked in, our room that we wanted was unavailable (King/Non Smoking), so we got upgraded to a suite for the first night! It was nice to have that luxury for our first stay in Vegas! The beds at Harrah's are extremely extremely comfortable. The rooms were very clean, and we really have no complaints. The vanity in the bathroom could be a little bigger, but other than than that, things were great! Gambling and Drinking: Gambling really sucks you in at this place! What do you expect? It's a casino! As long as you gamble, you get free drinks. Tip your waiters and bartenders! Piano Bar: The piano bar inside the hotel was great and very entertaining. There is no cover to get in, and you can charge your drinks right to the room. Buffet: The buffet was ok, nothing really special. I think it was $22 for adults. If you want a really really good buffet, go to the Wynn, it's about $10 more than Harrah's, but it is well well worth it. All in all, a great hotel and great stay! There is a McDonalds and Denny's very closeby for late night snacks...or afternoon snacks! Wear good walking shoes!!!!!!! The first day I wore flip flops and my feet were hurting for two days!

Reviews.Title: “a safe bet”
Reviews.Author: gorillagirl
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for one night, a saturday, in july. we picked harrah's because of it's great location on the strip. it's right in the center of the strip right next to some of the best hotels. the check in was easy...the guy at the counter that helped us was very friendly and was able to check us in early...the room itself was great. it was roomy with a clean bathroom. the casinos never looked too crowded...we spent a good portion of our day at the pool. the pool is way too small! we had to really search for a couple chairs and then wait for a corner to clear up in the water. there was always a server running around getting drinks, so you dont even have to get out of the pool! yay! we also ate at their buffet...it was just ok. nothing special. their mimosas are blah at best. if you are looking for a somewhat cheap room in a perfect location, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's Not too bad..”
Reviews.Author: buckeyelvr
Reviews.Content: I was comped a 6 night stay at harrahs las vegas, I figured Free so why not give it a shot. If you are looking for good comps, do not gamble here! The comps were horrible $50 dollar a hand blackjack got me virtually no comps at all. I went next door to Imperial and bet the same amount and had about 20 comp dollars within two hours of play. The drink service was either really good, or really bad. There was no in between, you either had one after another, or you had to wait a half hour. All blackjack pays 6 to 5 instead of 3 to 2. (yes that counts 6 deck shoe games) Its horrible that harrahs has gone to this, they make enough money already on gambling but now they are ripping you off on payouts too, sad. They had no $5 dollar crap games even during the week i.e Monday at 1pm. The buffet was average at best, all the standard food, but nothing too special. The crab legs are already cut in half so the meat is really dry and unedible unless drenched in artery clogging butter. For 20 bucks you can find something better. On to the room. Booked luxury room with a strip view, instead got a mini suite overlooking the pool. The room was very loud from the music at carnival court, earplugs did the trick and it wasnt an issue. We werent getting back to the room until 3 sometimes 4 am so there wasnt too much of a hassle with loud music. Tv in bathrom was great, mini bar, expensive as hell, but worth it when you need that 3 dollar bottle of water to wash away a long night of drinking. The room was clean, the only complaint was we didnt get our room cleaned after the 2nd night. We called housekeeping and they said I had called and turned off the room cleaning, which was not true. We called down 3 times and finally we got so frustrated we threw the old towels and garbage into the hallway (after housekeeping told us to) they came and quickly picked it up and restocked us. Overall it was a great free stay...next time I think I will try a different Harrahs property as they are all normally comped or realy cheap. I would stay here again for free!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant holiday”
Reviews.Author: miss-giggles27
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at harrah's. we stayed for a week. We went to see the Improv comedy show which was really good and we also saw the Mac King comedy magic show which was really funny. The staff at the hotel were really helpful and polite. We tried the flavours breakfast buffet, they had everything you could think of. Harrah's is in a great location right in the middle of the strip and the monorail is at the hotel which is really handy to get around the strip. Our room was lovely, clean and a brilliant view of the strip. from Alun and Sarah. Wales UK

Reviews.Title: “Location Great/ ac in room not good”
Reviews.Author: RayNacogdoches_Texas
Reviews.Content: I love the location but was very unhappy with room and service. We got to checkin and the clerk gave me a standard room. I told her i paid for a premium and that is what i wanted. She informed me they did not have premium rooms available because of renovations. I told her that i wanted a refund. Then she comes back and said she located one. What a suprise. It appears to me that Harrah's does this quite often unless they are called on it. Secondly the ac never cooled the room. When you leave your room the ac cuts off because it is set up on a motion sensor. So be prepared to come back to a very hot room everytime you leave. I will not stay at Harrah's again. When im in Vegas i want to come back to a cold room to nap after being out in the hot sun. I travel alot and i usually take things in tride. I don't feel like tis asking to much to have deceit air. As the other post said watch out for timeshare's all over this property.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's is fine--just avoid the timeshare spiel”
Reviews.Author: maggiesmomColumbus
Reviews.Content: Usually stay at Harrah's when in Vegas because of the price. It is nice, although I know some of the hotels on the strip are a lot fancier. Our room was clean and everything else was fine. However, whatever you do avoid the Wyndham Hotel spiel if anyone offers it to you at the front desk. RUN! We were offered free tickets to "Legends in Concert" and a free buffet at the Imperial and decided to do it spur of the moment. Boy, were we sorry. They told us it would last two hours and it ended up being 4 hours. Even dragged us over to the Wyndham Resort. We felt trapped. They try to sell you a time share and tell you it is no pressure, all the while twisting your arm. My husband finally lied and said he had a conference call from China. I even believed him, as sometimes he does. He said it's the only way he could think to get away, ha ha. The buffet at the Imperial was not that good, although we did have a good time at Legends. We worked hard for those tickets! Never again. Other than that, the hotel is fine. Just avoid Wyndham if you are offered anything. YUK!

Reviews.Title: “Everything I thought it would be and more!!!”
Reviews.Author: vacationlover06
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Harrah's from August 17 to the 22nd. We booked our room right off of the Harrah's website for 49.00/per night. My girlfirend and I went with another couple, and the desk clerk made sure we were right across the hall from the other couple. The room was great, except the bathroom door didnt close completely close all the way. Toby Keiths has some great food. My gf loved the "freedom fries". Lunch is a good time to go there if you dont like country music. Later at night, they blast the country music. The gambling at Harrah's and at other hotels on the strip can be expensive. There is no blackjack for less than 10.00 per hand. So if you are unlucky, it's easy to lose cash fast. You can play cheaper table games on Fremont street. Right next to Harrah's is Casino Royale. CR has 1.00 beer and margaritas. Skip the beer, cuz it tastes horrible. My gf won money on the big wheel of fortune game. Take the Monorail to the other hotels. Do not take the Deuce!!! The Deuce is always packed cuz it's so cheap. The monorail costs more but u get to the other hotels sooo much faster. So take the monorail and you'll see so much more. The airconditioning is on sensors. We didnt have a problem, except one night i woke up sweating <probably cuz i hadnt moved for a couple hours>. Overall, I had a great time. I would for sure stay at Harrah's again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: hockeymom705
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night 6 day stay at Harrah's in Las Vegas. We chose this hotel for price and location and were very happy with our choice. The hotel is centrally located on the strip - a walk either direction takes you to the more fancier hotels, but Harrah's was the most fun!! The Kareoke bar and duelling pianos were always entertaining. We gambled a little at each hotel and did not win a whole lot anywhere but did not loose our shirt either. We were in the Carnaval Tower, 5th floor, no view, but a very nice room, king bed and everything you needed for a comfortable stay. The pool was average, but was so hot that we didnt spend too much time down there except for an early morning swim. We would definately stay at Harrah's again, and would most definately recommend it to friends and family for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Always had a good experience”
Reviews.Author: cindyloowhoo
Reviews.Content: We have being staying at the Harrah's properties for the past 10 years, mostly at Harrahs. We have never had a bad experience at this hotel and usually have our rooms comped. The friendliness of the staff out weighs the slightly older feel of the hotel. The comps don't seem to be as good as they used to, rarely offered a free weekend night. The Venetian just sent us an offer for 3 free nights and most weekends are included. We will be going in Sept, and thinking this is going to be so much nicer than the other hotels , I will write a review when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: vegasgrandpa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrah's 8/15 to 8/18. First time there and I anjoyed my visit. Other reviews have noted the outstanding customer service at this hotel and I agree. Everyone I encountered during my stay were pleasant and helpful. Room ok and clean. Room service so-so. Flavors buffet above average. I would recommend this hotel for those looking for an affordable, centrally located hotel. Casino was fun.

Reviews.Title: “C+”
Reviews.Author: capdeblu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Harrah's in June 2008 for five nights. The hispanic hotel desk clerk was excellent. She gave me a choice of rooms. A room with a view and possible noise from a live band or a room in the back with no view but quiet. I choose the room with no view. It was very nice and updated. BUT...It was HOT. Whenever I left the room the A/C automatically shut OFF. It was 107 degrees one day. I came back to the room and the temp. was 80 degrees. It took until 6 am for the room to cool off before the temp reached 70 degrees. Sleep was next to impossible. I spent about 1000$ at the slots in Harrahs. I didnt even get play money. The drink service was excellent though. The buffet was ok. But nothing special. The sandwich shop near the poker room is pretty good and filling.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay At Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: ATL18
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's from 8/17/08 through 8/21/08. After reading some of the reviews we were skeptical but after arriving we wondered what the bad reviews were for. We've been to vegas for the last 4 years this was our first stay at Harrah's and also the first year we arrived and didn't have to wait for our room to be ready. Check in was at 4 and we arrived about 30 minutes early but still the room was ready. We stayed in the Mardi Gras tower in a newly rennovated room. The room was kind of small but still very nice and clean. Everyone working at this hotel that we came in contact with was extremely helpful and friendly. Housekeeping was excellent. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a rebirth”
Reviews.Author: wedgeclose
Reviews.Content: Even though I was comped my rooms for 4 days at Harrahs I was really dissatisfied with the condition of the hotel. It is really run down. To say that the casino is smokey would by a gross understatement! I was a smoker and can tolerate some...but this place reeked of stale smoke....you couldn't stay there for more than 5 minutes without smelling like an old bar. We checked in late on a Saturday nite...despite a guarantee of a luxury room....(which according to their website has a view of the strip)...we were assigned a handicapped room that was seriously in need of a makeover. The bathroom featured a hand held shower head with a drain in the middle of the bathroom floor...not very sanitary at best. I stayed with it due to the hour and went down the next morning for a new room. We were assigned a luxury room on a renovated floor...which was somewhat better but no view of the strip....whatever........ The hotel has a great location.....but the atmosphere was choking...the food was just so so...it was run down.....stayed at the Flamingo the year before on the same kind of deal and had a GO Room which was great! The pool area was a joke.......It was a small pool with little or no atmosphere....compared to other hotel pools this was a 1 on a scale of 1-100. I would say if you are paying for a room at Harrahs...look elsewhere....if you are being comped by Harrahs properties.....look elsewhere....the place really needs a rest.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: caleggs_0423
Reviews.Content: My family visited from the east coast and we booked 2 rooms at Harrah's on-line about 3 months in advance. The prices were great and the rooms were way above average. They looked as though they'd been recently remodeled w/ updated bedding, etc. I have 3 complaints: 1) the loooong walk from elevator to our rooms (minor, I know) 2) the nasty breakfast at the cafe (instant, runny eggs.....disgusting & pricey!) 3) Rooms weren't ready when we got there and they weren't promised until between 4pm & 6pm. We had to check our bags with bellhop so couldn't use the pool or change our clothes....had 7pm show to attend too. Room was ready at 5:45pm....what a rush to get freshened up to get to show on time!!! All-in-all, stay was good and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great strip location”
Reviews.Author: PaddlingFan
Reviews.Content: Harrah's is a good hotel for the money with a terrific location center strip. The Carnival Court outdoor lounge is really fun and part of the reason we chose this hotel. We checked in to discover water leaking from the roof of our bathroom. When maintenance was slow to respond, we returned to the lobby with our bags and requested another room. We were cheerfully accomodated, but were not compensated in any way for the hassle. WARNING: Anticipate plumbing issues. While our replacement room had no leaks (at first), the toilet later began shooting water (with some force) from the water tank whenever flushed, soaking the shower curtain and floor. The problem was fixed, but two such issues in as many days and rooms was a bit much. Nice showers, but they don't drain well. You'll be standing in 5" of water by the time you're done. The Improv Comedy show is great and inexpensive as Vegas shows go. I'd highly recommend it. The pool area is clean, but it's just a pool. If you're looking for someplace with an upscale or unique swimming area, this isn't it. We never ate in any of the restaurants, but found the Starbucks in the lobby extremely slow. It's very difficult to get a cup of coffee in Vegas in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “Again a good stay at Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: OhioFranco
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Harrah's (July 29 to August 5, 2008). The room was clean and large, the room cleaning service was timely but unobtrusive. The Hotel facilities are generally good - with the exception of the Cafe with slow service and tired decor. Location of the Hotel is excellent - on the most vibrant part of the strip - I only wish there was a drugstore close ! Overall we were satisfied with our stay at Harrah's and plan to go back if we get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: susan58
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrah's for 4 nights Aug. 3-7. Beds very comfortable just wish the rooms were more sound proof. Very thin walls could hear noises all the time. Rooms clean and nice and water pressure in shower excellent. As for the casino, it's nice but machines very tight. In fact I thought all of Las Vegas was tight and very expensive! I will not be traveling to Vegas for a very long time. Food and drinks outrageously priced and as for the free drinks while gambling the coctail waitresses are far and few between these days unless you are a high roller which I am not. We were in Vegas 3 years ago and cannot believe how expensive it has gotten. All in all Harrahs is ok for the right price. Would I stay there again, yes if I could get a free trip because I do not want to pay for another trip to Vegas and than pay the high prices of food and drinks. Good luck to all who go, you will need it!
