Reviews.Title: “Loved Harrah's - will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: SeafoodLovers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a "quickie" 2 day mini vacation in Las Vegas July 28 thru 30th, booked it since Jan. 08 with Allegiant Air. Due to the bad economy we decided that 2 days was better than no days. Harrah's was the best priced package. After booking I started researching customer reviews, some good some very bad. Since we couldn't change our plans we said might as well see for ourselves. When we arrived the check in took all but 5 minutes, Carol was extremely nice and her customer service skills were outstanding. She upgraded us to a Junior Suite on the Carnival Tower. Room 802 was clean, big and cozy, the bed was exceptionally comfortable I wanted to take the mattress and pillows back to Texas, LOL. Don't expect a "view" from the room unless you like parking garages but who goes to Vegas for the "views". The Piano Bar is awesome.The slots were tight and we lost most of our money by the end of the stay but we had lots of fun. Wish we could of stayed longer. Drinks do not take long, staff if friendly. Check out took about 3 minutes. All I have to say about the negative reviews is that Harrah's is NOT the Wynn or Bellagio don't expect luxury but do expect a nice, safe and comfortable stay. We look forward to going back next Summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you want to feel insignificant”
Reviews.Author: jrengineer
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because the price was right, and so was the location (or so I thought), but this area of the Strip seems to have changed a lot over the last few years. It seems like EVERYTHING is catered to the high roller now, even in a mid-range casino like this. This is odd because 99% of the people I saw milling around looked no better or worse than me, playing nickel, quarter, and dollar slots just like me. These obviously weren't "whale" caliber people, yet even though I feel I fit in well there, I still felt like the casino and hotel couldn't have cared less about me. And EVERYTHING is ridiculously expensive. Don't look at the room service menu unless you want a hearty laugh. Five dollar bottles of wine going for FORTY dollars? Are you kidding me? Maybe I spent enough money at their casinos so they'll invite me back for free, and if so, I might take them up on it, but no way in heck will I ever pay to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Munroe110
Reviews.Content: We had a very comfortable stay at Harrahs from 18 to 22 July, during our first visit to Vegas. Reception was particularly friendly and courteous during our check-in of 4 rooms. We were upgraded to superior rooms on the higher floors, and found these to be wonderfully comfortable with fabulous beds, LCD TVs in the room and in the bathroom. Housekeeping always attended early in the day and did a great job. We ate at the buffet the first morning but weren't particularly impressed with the food (tho the service was great) so didn't return. Found the hotel to be in a great location, especially with being the middle Monorail stop, so transport to either end of the strip is a breeze. Bus stops were a short walk away outside the Venetian or Flamingo. The pool in no way compares to some others we saw, but it is adequate to cool off/lay in the sun. This hotel is nothing amazing but is a good solid stay and value for money. We moved on after 4 nights to the Mirage and to be honest I much preferred that for the slight increase in price.

Reviews.Title: “Good if it is free, but otherwise I will pass...”
Reviews.Author: jenjenboo
Reviews.Content: Received a free weekend at Harrah's, and came away with mixed feelings. We were given a newly remodeled room (which I can't imagine what the rooms look like that aren't remodeled as this wasn't exactly a glamorous room itself) on the 12th floor of the Mardi Gras Tower. Check-in was great, but that was because we didn't arrive until late at night. As soon as we walked into the room my first thought was that we had been given a room that someone else was staying in! This was due to the fact that a room service tray full of half-eaten food was sitting next to the bed. In addition, there was water bottles, a lei, and other miscellaneous items from a previous guest left on the nightstands, armoire, and work table. The bed was made and the bathroom was clean however. Called the front desk and was told there was not another room to move us to, so they told us to contact housekeeping. Once we got over the shock of walking into a room full of someone else's food and trash, I was able to survey the room itself. The view wasn't too bad -- could see Treasure Island pretty clear, and the room had an itsy bitsy balcony you could go out on. When I mean itsy I mean it is barely big enough for you to stand on, but it was nice to get some outside air. The room was pretty small compared to other Strip hotels I have been in, but nothing below average. Nice plasma TV in the bedroom and bathroom, typical bathroom amenities, water pressure was terrible though! Bed was super comfortable. No real complaints with the room other than housekeeping which based on our initial problem and the fact that we left the room one day and came back to find our room partially cleaned -- we assume housekeeping cleans rooms in stages, as the maid tried to return later on to finish the job (which apparently they forgot to do earlier.) As far as the hotel itself, there is truth to others saying that Wyndham reps are everywhere -- I wish hotels would ban this it is so irritating, so expect to be pushed by sales reps often when walking around. The 24-hour cafe was not that great -- they serve breakfast 24/7 except oatmeal which we tried to order and were told 'because it is so late we don't have oatmeal' -- go figure...food was just so/so. Pool is definitely not much to write home about, plain pool (maybe olympic-sized couldn't tell), with a small bar/cafe. I wasn't lucky at all in the casino but it is fairly good sized. Ate at Toby Keith's I Love This Bar and Grill for the second time...food there is good, but you should expect the wait-staff to be nothing more than eye-candy and you won't be dissapointed. Prices are pretty steep. There are several shops in the hotel, and I was glad to see more than 1 stayed open late. I guess the problem with Harrah's is that their hotel is rather boring compared to others. Everything (casino, shops, restaurants) are just kind of standard....nothing great about the pool etc...basically I would stay there again if it was free, but would not dish out any money for the trip....have a much better time at Rio for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: phillynathan
Reviews.Content: Booked for a get-away last minute. Check-in was slow due to several rooms not being cleaned (5:00PM) but there was a long line apparently all day (Sunday). Desk personnel was very nice. First room assigned was not cleaned, had to go back down to lobby to get another room. Second room was clean and neat. Had to call for burned out bathroom bulbs and a defective outlet but both were fixed same day. Beds were comfortable - air is on light or motion sensors so it kept going off, made room somewhat warm. Casino is very easy to get to and around. Made travelling with a senior citizen easier. Monorail, Deuce Bus, and a trolley all leave from hotel to explore the town but can walk to a lot of local casino's. Housekeeping staff do a good job but are noisy in the morning if you want to sleep. Hall traffic carries into rooms. Had an adjoining room that didn't have much noise buffer between rooms. Overall, it was fine. Staff handled anything brought to their attention, casino floor staff, information desk, and lobby staff all very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for 1st time Vegas trip”
Reviews.Author: jennb2003
Reviews.Content: We decided to book Harrah's for our first trip to Vegas due to the affordable price and central location. I was not expecting too much in the way of luxury or service, but I was wonderfully mistaken. We checked in late on a Wednesday night (about 10pm), and the desk clerk told us they were down to the last non-smoking room, so she asked if we wanted that room or to upgrade to either A) a full-blown suite for 1 night with guaranteed downgrade back to the basic room the last 2 days of our trip, or B) a mini-suite for 2 nights with the possibility of the 3rd night also. We chose to go with the mini-suite and ended up getting to stay the 3rd night after all! I couldn't believe it- our first Vegas trip and we got complimentary upgrades to a wonderful mini-suite. The room itself was very nice. It was on a low floor in the Carnival tower and was very quiet and easily accessible. It looked like it was fairly recently renovated as compared to other parts of the hotel. It had marble bathroom counters, floors, and shower features. There was also a lovely floor-to-ceiling closet feature with pull out TV. Also a desk and small table near the window. The space was lovely and had lots of room to walk around in. The bed itself- wonderful! It was a down bed with down pillows. By far the MOST comfortable bed I have ever slept on, and perfect for crashing after a long day on the strip. I honestly almost regret not spending MORE time in the room as opposed to out seeing the sites and gambling. Could never hear the neighbors and the cleaning service was great and the room always looked lovely. it also had a wall-safe, which made it much easier to feel safe leaving things in the room instead of lugging them around the strip. As for the rest of Harrah's- the Cafe was alright. Nothing to special, but hit the spot at nearly midnight. Starbucks was typical- exactly what it should be. The piano bar was loads of fun, and we never even went in- just gambled right outside so we could double up on fun and sing-along while playing the slots. Customer service was AMAZING. Everyone at the desk was wonderful to us. Room staff was great. The cab service was good. No complaints all around. It was also nice that they have their own monorail stop- it made getting around the strip easier!

Reviews.Title: “Blood on the Toilet??”
Reviews.Author: cscmom
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Las Vegas before and thought that staying at a mid priced hotel was the best bet for us (we didn't plan on being in the room much anyway). Once we checked in and realized that our room had ZERO view of the strip and no King sized bed which we had requested we (including the couple we were travelling with) asked to be moved and were told that there were no more rooms available. We were NOT happy as this was our first trip without our kids and really wanted the luxury of staying in the same bed, not two doubles!! We complained quite a bit and eventually we got the beds with no view. Decided to let it rest at that. THEN, went to use the washroom and noticed that there was blood spattering all over the toilet tank (GROSS!!!!)!!!! I nearly died, I felt like germs were crawling all over me. Told the front desk and they gave us a $30 voucher to use anywhere in the hotel. Moved us again. Overall we had fun in Vegas but certainly went away from Harrah's with a less than favourable stay. Too bad as we are not that picky. Some things you just can't overlook.

Reviews.Title: “Great for an older hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelPort101
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Harrahs was great for the price. The room was newly upgraded and was your typical room size. As an older hotel you can hear your neighbors all hours of the night. Eating at the cafe is nothing to write home about and the service was much slow then expected. However, the buffet was very good with a nice selection of different types of food. Valet was fast and congenial but the bellman did not offer to assist with our bags to the car which I found very strange. All in all we had a great time. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great service & location!”
Reviews.Author: minnesnowtan
Reviews.Content: Great service and location at Harrahs. Came in early Sat morn & they gave us a room right away about 10am. Front desk very nice & all workers we encountered the same. Rooms very clean & better than expected considering an older hotel. View was of parking garage but no biggy since you are hardly in there. Only had Starbucks at hotel- so can’t comment on other restaurants. McDonalds, Pizza, Chipotle right next door for a quick bite. Pool is very small-that is the only negative. Sister stayed at Venentian- loved that hotel but its almost too big to just run up to your room- but it does have everything you need & the Canal Shoppes are great. The rooms are all suite & very spacious. Went to Kokomo Restaurant at the Mirage- or attempted too. Sat down but were totally ignored by waiter so just had wine & left. With prices like that they should be treating you better or atleast acknowledge you. So ended up at the Italian Rest there which was very good esp their bread with olive oil/balsamic/garlic dipping. Went to PF Changs off strip & had the best service ever. Also ate at PARIS at the Burger Place which was yummy & great service too. I would like to stay next time at Paris- good size & nice casino area & shops. Went to the top of the Eiffel Tower which was kinda scary going up on the elevator but great views of the strip. We had to come right down due to lightening storm approaching but they gave us vouchers. Saw Cirque du Soleil MYSTERE at Mirage which was better than I expected. Hard to explain – just something neat for all ages. I would go to another show like O or Ka the water ones. Great getaway in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: TheBuick
Reviews.Content: Had 4 nights comped during a 10-day stay in Las Vegas. Harrah's has an excellent location on the strip -- convenient for walking and riding monorail and catching the Deuce. Did not think a comped room would be as nice as it was. It was also very clean and the bed was very comfortable. The room was located in the Carnival Tower, high floor, not too far from elevators. Loved the atmosphere in the casino slots areas as well as the keno area. Didn't win but still had fun. "Flavors, The Buffet" was very good with very prompt seating. Breakfast at the "Cafe at Harrahs" was good; however seating is very very slow. All staff in casino and food areas were very customer focused. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: KID49
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights at Harrah's the 2nd week in July. Our checkin at 4 pm on Saturday was quick and the staff very pleasant. Our room in the Carnival Tower was clean and quiet - no view, but we can't complain because our room was comped. We tried Toby Keith's restaurant - it was ok, the breakfast buffet was good - dinner buffet was only o.k. The slot machines at Harrah's were very very tight - never saw anyone win anything over $400. My husband and I both hit jackpots at Imperial Palace and then I hit the big jackpot at MGM. Also, I had good luck on the slots at Paris, hitting a couple of times for $800 and $700. I recommend Harrah's for hotel room, other casinos for gambling. I would definitely stay at Harrah's again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for exploring the Strip”
Reviews.Author: JROB1975
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July 2007 for five nights. Harrah's was recommended to us by friends who live in Los Angeles, and who visit Las Vegas on a regular basis. It's perfect location in the centre of the Strip should in theory mean you'll be paying considerably more for a room per night, but unlike the majority of hotel casinos nearby like Bellagio, Caesar's Palace and The Venetian, you're not. A lot is made of star ratings for hotels in Vegas. Caesar's Palace is rated as 5+ star, and personally I'd say it was higher. Harrah's thought is accurately rated as 4 star. The hotel is clean and tidy. The rooms are ample in size and we heard no noise from any adjacent rooms throughout our stay. We had a king size bed, large CRT TV, adequate bathroom with hair dryer but the air con was set so you couldn't adjust it. Maid service was once a day. Our bed was made with fresh sheets, bins emptied, bathroom cleaned and towels replaced. Also included was a mini bar - WARNING : Don't under any circumstances be tempted to open it. The stuff inside costs a fortune and if removed (even if not used and subsequently replaced) is automatically billed to your room. The guys manning the check in and out desks were prompt and curteous. The interior decor of the casino was perfectly fine. Not as lavish as the other bigger casinos, but when in Vegas you'll probably find you'll move from one casino to another. During our stay we tried the hotel buffey. Fair price, good selection, the quality of the food was great and free refills of soft drinks - can't fault it. On the whole I would definately recommend this hotel if you are looking for a centrally located base of operations, arn't looking for too many frills and are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the price”
Reviews.Author: Sara_and_Paul
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the start of a touring holiday. We knew we'd be initially jet-lagged and then seeing the sights, so we wanted somewhere well-located, central to the Strip and at a reasonable price. This hotel ticked all the boxes. Although we were a little unimpressed with the slightly aging decor of Harrah's own casino, we spent most of our time getting lost in the others, so this didn't matter. The room was large, clean and quiet, and unlike our experience with another Las Vegas hotel, it wasn't a 20 minute walk from the car park to the hotel room. If you're not bothered about staying in a big name hotel, this hotel is in a really good location at the centre of the Strip, at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: KTbabe530
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE for the price, money and location you can get a better deal at Imperial Palace or even Casino Royale. We booked the pool package to get a cheaper rate and when I saw the pool, I wanted to die. The pool at my apartment complex is more fun. We arrived Friday night pretty late and we were starving, so decided to grab dinner at the cafe located near the Mardi Gras tower. The first two things I ordered on the menu the server told were horrible and to pick something else. My husband and I were both disappointed with our choices in the end. The next day I woke up to head downstairs to Starbucks, but the elevators on my side of the hotel were not working. The 5 minute walk and 20 minute wait at the other set of elevators almost made me want to take the 15 flights of stairs down. Finally returned to my room and got ready for the pool, the package included two free frozen drinks and pool bag. However, I never got my frozen drinks because with no power they could not blend anything. Saturday night around 10 pm I returned to my room and was greeted by a terribly RUDE security officer demanding to see my room key and my husbands, one key for the both of us was not sufficient proof we were staying at the room. We checked out Sunday morning around noon, returned home at 9pm and realized my husband had left a $100 polo shirt in the room. Called lost and found immediately and were told they would take a look and get back with us. I called back the following Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday with no response. My husband and I are frequent visitors Vegas, we go about 6 to 7 times a year and try new places each time, so I've stayed almost every where on the strip and have never been as disappointed and I have been with my stay at Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: tripayear1111
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed three nights and were very impressed with the friendly staff and extremely comfortable beds. The Oyster Bar has amazing food - we ate there three times! Had a great experience in the Spa. Loved the location to the more high end hotels and shopping. Misses - the pool area is very dated - and nothing special about it. The metal hand rails to get into and out of the pool were very dangerous - they got extrememly hot and it was nearly impossible to touch them when trying to get out. Otherwise - this is a good, economical bet.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: jecatudel
Reviews.Content: First of all, for context purposes, I am 26 and I went to Vegas with 3 of my guy friends who are all around the same age. We stayed 3 nights, and I have to say I really enjoyed staying this hotel. Our room was really nice-we actually were supposed to stay in a standard guest room, but at the airport check-in, I slipped $30 to the hotel clerk who upgraded us to a junior suite. The junior suites are really nice, clean, and spacious. The best thing about the hotel, though, was not the rooms (who goes to Las Vegas to stay in a room all day?), but the location and the nightlife. It is perfectly located in the middle of the strip, and the Mirage is literally less than a 2 minute walk once you get outside of the hotel (and remember the Mirage is connected to Treasure Island, which is a really good hotel too). Caesars Palace and the Paris are only a 5-7 minute walk, and I would say the Bellagio is only about a 10, maybe 15 minute walk at longest. All of these hotels have great casinos, which is the only downside of Harrah's (their casino isn't that big and is confusing to navigate). If you're into nightclubs, the surrounding hotels have good ones, and if you're into fine dining, Caesars and the Mirage have excellent restaurants. Furthermore, Harrah's also has a great buffet-it was only about 25 dollars for dinner, and the food and the selection was excellent. The best spot at Harrahs, without a doubt, is Carnival Court. It is a huge outside bar that features live music starting around noon or 1 each day that goes all night. The atmosphere is relaxed and laid back, the people are fun and friendly (which is not the case everywhere in Vegas), and the live music was awesome (even the performers in the afternoon were good). In short, for the price of the hotel, Harrah's is a great choice-if you care more about luxury, then it may not be for you. But if you're just going for a good time, this is hands down the best spot to be at.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SinCityAce79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harrahs hotel and resort for 5 nights. It was a great hotel at rock bottom prices. The service was excellent and timely. We are low rollers prefering $5 caps tables and 1-5 cent slots so this was the perfect place to stay. The location is north of Imperial palace and almost center strip. We ate at Toby Keith's I Love This Bar and had a great experience. The atmosphere was fun and electrifying. The cheeseburgers are the size of the plate and this is no exageration!! Toward the end of our stay we seen the Mac King show and thought it was a little cheesy but was very fun. The tickets were free but the catch was you had to buy at least one drink. Oh I almost forgot Carnival Court. They have live bands and Flair bartenders that do all kinds of tricks when they make your drinks. Don't pay the cover to get inside the court because you can view the band from the sides and take your free drink outside the casino and listen to the music. Overall this was the best stay I have had in Vegas yet. From Low Limit tables, location, and service to exciting entertainment, I give Harrahs 5 Stars for the money you pay to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: shrek61
Reviews.Content: Had a great 6 night stay. We arrived at 9am on a Saturday, I was just expecting to drop our bags and meet some friends. I had asked for the Carnival tower, King Smoking room. Nothing available, but if I took the Mardi Gras Tower I could get my room right then. The front desk clerk was very nice. She advised us that they are doing work on the 18th floor (we had the 17th), they did not start until after 8am, but if it is a bother at anytime comeback and they would change our rooms. I also had 2 reservations. This started out as a 4 night trip then added Saturday and Sunday with my deals with Total Rewards. The clerk set up the whole check in so I did not need to come down and redo the process on Monday. The room was very clean, the carpet was a little worn, but the bed was extremely comfortable. The only drawback for the room was the tub drained slow. I can not mark this off against them, since we chose not to call down and have it looked at while we were there. Everyone of the staff we came in contact with were friendly, alwys a smile and a hello. The best one was Bob the barkeep at Bill's bar. He is the best. We loved the great location. We walked to the mall, venitian and all other surrounding hotels. We only took out our car once when we visited the MGM to meet friends. I would recommend this to anyone. The price was also a great deal by using my Total Rewards number, paid $40 anight for the weeknight s.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location and Value (But I'd Like More Space and Cold Drinks)”
Reviews.Author: Aurielle
Reviews.Content: I stayed here just after Memorial Day for the bargain basement price of $59/night. Though the view from the window was pretty drab, the room was nice - recently remodeled with new bedding and a sleek marble bathroom. There was even a flat screen TV in the bathroom! The location is ideal: mid-strip with easy access to Treasure Island, Venetian, Imperial Palace, Mirage, and Caesar's. The tram stops in back of Harrah's, but walking is best for anything pretty close by. My biggest complaint was that there was no good way to keep drinks cold in the room. Putting your own beverages in the mini-fridge is forbidden, and there is a charge ($10 or $15 per day?) for them to bring you an extra mini-fridge for your own beverages. As I like to drink cold bottled water throughout the day, this was a real disappointment. My other complaint was room size. These rooms are pretty small. After having stayed at Bally's, these seem almost tiny. While I might stay here again, I might opt to return to Bally's where I can get double the room for about $20 more per night.

Reviews.Title: “I give Harrahs a ( b -)”
Reviews.Author: daisy91
Reviews.Content: Harrahs was convienient because #1 it is in the middle of the strip and #2 it had a monorail stop. The room were pretty nice nothing special just average. ( we even upgraded to a luxury room) There is no dressers, just a night stand with a few drawers and a closet to hang things.It was the strangest thing. If you are looking for an inexpensive stay then this would work for you. It is clean and convienient . Also the swimming pool is very very small. I dont think i would stay here again with as many choices as you have in vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: ladyann22
Reviews.Content: It is a nice place to stay in...A cheap price for that expensive place...are room is on the fornt of the mall there..which is really really nice for me hehehehe.. The Bathtub is ok so as the bed..but really?nothing especial..the staff is ok and polite to thier costumer and the casino is good too..they are one of the rare casino you can play and bet on 25cent.. All in all..its ok

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: buzzsolo1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my 50th birthday for 4 nights in June very good check in lady who accomodated all our wishes (in room safe etc) we were in the carnival tower room 1648 lifts just across from reception with a starbucks at the bottom . on entering the room yes it was dark but that was because the curtains were drawn to keep the sun out . the air con was fine cause lets not forget it was 110 degrees outside!! The beds and pillows were so comfy i wanted to take them home, bathroom was big and clean , powerfull shower and no probs with the drainage! (which some people seem to of had) thats enough about the room cause i was in vegas you only sleep in it !! Casino was large and unlike some i found no problem with the smoke (being a non smoker if i had of done i would have been out of their im sure) we ate at flavours buffet which had all the choices im sure you get at any other buffet (god the americans sure know how to feed you) we also ate at the the range steakhouse on my 50th we had a table looking over the strip which was excellent for 3 people it cost $200 in english money bout £100 not bad at all as we all had prime rib steaks chips,veg and 2 bottles of good red wine (they knew it was my birthday and brought out a chocolate cake with candles) very nice gesture. We also liked all the entertainment going on in the hotel very fun atmosphere for the young and old!! Great little casino next door Casino royale had a good few wins in their, cocktail waitress came round every 15/20 mins you only tip a $1 and for 2 g&t's and 1 brandy/coke (for 50p) i'm not complaining!! also saw phantom at the venetian WOW go if you can you will never forget it!! and also saw Legends in concert at the Imperial Palace great show for $30/40 at the moment they have Dusty springfield winner of the UK one and only get out quick at end of performance as all the stars will have their pic took with you . Check out was quick and easy (didnt get charged $5 for a toby keith bottle) and the luggage store was great as we had an afternoon flight back to the uk (Think virgin going down hill this was our 4 th visit to vegas and i can't remember service being that poor) but as they are the only direct flight people we dont have a choice. have stayed at sahara,excalibur and luxor and harrah's hotel for the location is def the best would stay here again on my next visit might sign up for comps next time may be they will give me a free room !! just for this review if you go here dont be put of by any bad reviews (you always get 1) have a great time in VEGAS enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel ,wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Irishairyfairy
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 6 night stay in Harrah's. We stayed on the 24th floor of Carnaval Tower where we had a partial view of the mirage. The whole stay was perfect, i have no complaints. The staff were lovely and helpful, the casino was great and had a lovely feel. The room was perfect, nice and cool and it was so clean. I would definitly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Servicable, comfortable, Vegasy”
Reviews.Author: jv332398
Reviews.Content: Harrah's in an affordable choice on the Las Vegas Strip. While I'm really not a fan of Vegas, I went for work. My room at Harrah's was comfortable and spacious and the service was impeccable. It was my first trip to Las Vegas, so maybe this is standard, but nothing was included in the room price. Wireless internet was $12 a day. Package handling was $6. Printing boarding passes was $5. It seems like they can make money of their casino and afford their guests a few more amenities. I'm not a gambler at all, but visitors have to walk through Harrah's casino to get to the Strip. It's one of the more loud and smokey casinos I visited. Harrah's has great access to the Monorail, which I found an excellent way to get around town.

Reviews.Title: “Too Much Time”
Reviews.Author: toagodunknown
Reviews.Content: What kind of person has enough time - in Vegas - to wait for the wash basin to empty and then write about how long it took? Perfectly enjoyable and acceptable stay. Never gonna set the world alight but .... great reception staff, good Piano Bar, decent but dated rooms and good pool. Plus a couple of Starbucks dotted around. Won a few dollars and had a blast. Try to find the good and enjoy. If you look for the worst you'll find it and miss your entire vacation. Still, at least you'll be able to write about it so well done!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: Lilidalla
Reviews.Content: Our three days/two nights at Harrah's were wonderful. We stayed in the Carnival Tower (29th floor) which offered a great view of The Strip as well as the mountains in the distance. The bed and linens were superb, and I appreciated the in-room cofffee maker. Yes, sink and tub drainage was somewhat slow, but that was a minor shortcoming. The casino provides a huge variety of gambling opportunities and the service attendants were prompt (and, I might add, we are not high rollers :). I also recommend Harrah's for its location; it's within easy walking distance to many of the other must-see casinos in Vegas, such as The Venetian, Bellagio, Caesars Palace, and Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: OutbackAussie
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days at Harrah's. Absolutely Fantastic. I booked through their website & got a great deal $64/night for a luxury room & great view of the strip. The casino was very good with plenty of slot machines.Its probably older than some of the newer hotels on the strip, but great value for money. Extremely clean & wonderful staff. Location is right in the middle of the strip & close to all the major hotels.Well worth a visit. All the restaurants had good meals & value for money, an excellent buffet.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel...Could use some work”
Reviews.Author: bmoregambler
Reviews.Content: Harrah's is definately not a luxury hotel, but still could use some work. Our room was TINY, but described on website as the luxury upgrade????????? The bathroom only had one sink and on our 2nd night there the tub wouldn't drain. I will say the maintenance staff works fast, we left our room for less than two hours and the tub was fixed. Maid service was good. SLOTS WERE SUPER TIGHT. We had a very bad experience with a room service clerk, she was extremely rude. We ordered an item from the menu one night with no problem...next day tried to order it again and was told by "RUDE CLERK??" we haven't had that on the menu for over two years as if we were lying!!! So your in-room menus havent been updated in 2 years??? My husband called back and he asked for the manager. She was not in but called us promptly the following day, she comped us a free dinner and sent a very nice card apologizing for the poor service we received. All in all its a nice place but could use some renovating, some areas look like they haven't been touched in years. Our room was in the Mardi Gras tower overlooking the pool, I have been told this is the newer/renovated tower...but be warned the music from the Carnival Court is loud and goes until 4am. Light sleepers stay away. I don't think I would stay here again, but would not tell others not to.

Reviews.Title: “Love it here!”
Reviews.Author: CubsGirl81
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas numerous other times, but this was my first time staying at Harrah's. I was not disappointed. The man at the check-in desk was very friendly and helpful, and when I requested 2 rooms that were connecting on a non-smoking floor, he granted my request AND our room was ready when we arrived at 9:30am! Being able to go into the room so early allowed us to just drop our luggage off and start our vacation! After all, who goes to Vegas to sit in the room? The rooms have very basic decoration, but are very clean. The beds and the pillows were outstanding, and I wished I could take the whole bed home with me! It was honestly the most comfortable hotel bed I've had in a while. One down side is there was no coffee pot in the room, although just a short trip down the elevator and there's a Starbucks right there. I'd much rather have Starbucks than hotel room coffee anyway. Overall, it was a very comfortable hotel right smack in the middle of the strip, and I'm sure I'll be staying there again. If you get any kind of reasonable price for this hotel, it is definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: lorelie21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrahs for 5 nights. The check in lady was so friendly and checked us in at 2.45pm even thought check in didn't start until 4pm. Our room wasn't ready as it was so early, but we dropped our bags off and went for something to eat. When the room was ready we headed to the 29th floor of the Carnaval Tower and were not disappointed. The room was large and clean and faced right onto the strip with an uninterrupted view of Caesar's Palace and the Mirage. We could only faintly hear the band below so we had no trouble sleeping. We had a problem with the sink in the bathroom, the plug wouldn't lift up so we were left with a sinkful of dirty water, this was fixed but the sink still drained quite slowly. Flavours buffet for breakfast was incredible, there was ice cream, doughnuts, yogurt, fruits, mexican food, pizza, eggs, bacon etc, etc more than you could ever want and it tasted great. On our last night we ordered room service which was speedy and delicious, and great to eat at the table in the window with such a great view of Vegas. Overall, we loved Harrah's and would definately recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Toby Keith Wayer Bottle Scam”
Reviews.Author: sheema
Reviews.Content: Room was fairly nice for the price. Upon checking out a $5.00 charge for "Room Service" was on the bill. Since we asked security to come up on check-in day (the same day as the charge) we assumed this was the problem and complained. Not so. Customer service informed me it was a charge for a Toby Keith water bottle which we neither drank nor took. Either the maids are stealing in this hotel or their billing department is behind (prior guest charge?) Either way I am fighting them over this. Tip: Request all crap you have no intention of using and that they could charge you for be removed from the room on check-in. Maybe if we make this extremely inconvenient, they will be more careful who they charge for what;.

Reviews.Title: “THE GOOD THE BAD AND THE UGLY OF HARRAH'S LAS VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: GiaGiaMarge
Reviews.Content: Six of us traveling together got comp rooms at Harrah's Las Vegas - two others had to pay full price. Upon checking in my husband requested poolside....I immediately told him that was a mistake because I have learned from others that those rooms can be very noisy. We took the room and since it was 3:30 in the morning when we went to bed the noise did not bother us. The next evening my husband said it wa so noise he could not sleep. So, we requested a change - they accommodated us and the room was nice and clean, but is was obvious that the first room was the updated/renovated room with two widescreen tv sets (one in the bathroom!). So - all I am saying is do not get a room poolside because there is a lounge right outside the pool that goes on all night with very loud music until four in the morning. This was our fault not Harrah's. The pool is very small and not a lot of space. But we were comparing this to Paris where we had stayed so many times before. Comparing apples to oranges. All in all the rooms were clean and had very nice bedding. The bathroom was very spacious. If all you want is a nice clean room to sleep for very little money than Harrah's is the place. If you are looking for upscale including the clientele than go to Paris. The casino itself is very small and very outdated.....and the machines did not pay at all.....not for any of us. The buffet was good.......Ming's was just okay. Don't miss the Range Steak House - it is excellent! To be continued.......

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: carrot79
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay at when in Vegas. Located in the heart of the city alongside all other major hotels, it offers shopping, restaurants and casinos only a short walk away. Or if you want, you can take the free shuttle service to other hotels and casinos further away. Staff was accomodating and nice, and the hotelroom was incredibly quiet and peaceful even though it was only on the 5th floor. The hotel was being kept clean all the time by the cleaning staff. The cafe served breakfast late, but somehow that visit left something to be desired. The buffet, on the other hand, was overwhelming with all its courses, so a little self-restraint is not a bad thing when eating there. The buffet's breakfast was also great.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Coat of Paint”
Reviews.Author: Scoutmm
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas for my daughter's college graduation. We booked her at the Flamingo and ourselves at Harrah's. First impression of the hotel is when you catch the elevator to your room in the Mardi Gras Tower. It was -yucky dirty and dark as though you ducked into a subway entrance. The button for the elevator has a halo of dirty paint around it-when you go into the elevator-it was not vacuumed-. (corners never )-and it was not dusted-so that the wood panelling in the elevator had dust all over it-. Hmm...I started to wonder...if they don't care enough to paint vacuum and dust what is the room like? The bathroom toilet was dirty-your imagination. Right then and there I wanted to call the lobby-but my husband didn't want to make a fuss and went in and cleaned it. The next day I went to the front desk and told them it was dirty and yucky and questioned if the $50 upgrade they had tried to get me to buy at check-in-was newer and cleaner-because I was so creeped out I was willing to pay more to feel better. She said to me that where I currently was staying was -"actually just renovated". She left it at that-no upgrade which I wasn't wrangling for-no option to buy into anything better. ...it was just bad housekeeping and nobody that managed the casino apparently cared or bothered to walk around and check our their hotel. The Flamingo where my daughter stayed-was great. I know both properties are owned by the same people-which is why I really can't understand why the quality and housekeeping can be so lax in one of their proporties and not the other.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it used to be”
Reviews.Author: HotSlotMama
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and daughter visited Las Vegas for my daughter's 21st birthday. I must admit we chose Harrahs because we had comped rooms and each time we visit Vegas we stay at the property. I must say, we were disappointed in everything from the housekeeping (did not sweep the floors the entire time we were there) to the casino. I have always liked the Harrah's properties but I do believe this one has slid down hill a bit. Each time I have visited the Las Vegas location, we have been given an upgraded room. Not this time. We had two standard rooms. The rooms were not clean and we had to asked the maid to sweep the floors. The sinks did not drain in either bathroom and the shower, even though the curtain was inside the tub, leaked all over the floor. I usually can win at least a little money while I'm there but not this time. The slots were really tight. In fact, I didn't see anyone win the entire time we were there and we played mostly at Harrahs. The pool was just OK (make sure you don't move the lounge chairs). The food was just OK. Best feature about the whole trip was Toby Keiths Bar and Grill. They have a great house band on the weekends. Whenever I go back to Vegas, I will choose a different hotel. The way we gamble, I'm sure we can get a room comped anywhere,

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: grobma
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on this site, my expectations were set on the low side for my stay at Harrah's (was attending a conference there so didn't have a choice of where to stay). I arrived early and found out that I had been placed in a newly renovated room. Unfortunately, the room wasn't ready yet - not their fault as I arrived 3 hours prior to check-in time. I was, however, offered a different room that was ready right away but the desk clerk advised me that the newly renovated rooms were very nice and she recommended I wait. I checked a couple of times over the next few hours and my room was finally ready exactly at check-in time. The room in the Mardi Gras tower was very nicely appointed but one of the smallest rooms I've ever had in Las Vegas. Nice big screen LCD TV, but no HD signal so the image was stretched. This is the second hotel I have stayed in recently where recent renovations included a large screen LCD TV but for some reason at the expense of drawer space. Nice granite top in the bathroom, great water pressure, and a smaller LCD TV mounted in the bathroom as well. Nice touch. The new bedding was very comfortable and the room was spotless each day. No working desk - just a cafe table with 2 chairs, but that's pretty much the norm in Vegas. Only problem with the room was that the internet jack was dead when I got to the room and I needed to get on-line quickly. First call to guest services resulted in being told that someone would be right up. Fifteen minutes later I called again and told them that I either needed someone immediately or they would have to switch my room as I needed to get on-line. Engineering was there in 5 minutes and corrected the problem on the spot. I was not facing Carnival Court but a colleague was. I stopped by his room and didn't even realize the band was playing until he opened the sliding door onto his mini-balcony and that's when I heard the music. He was on the 8th floor so either those who complained about hearing the music are either more sensitive to the noise than I, or the renovations addressed this issue as well. The thermostats do turn off during the day when you're not in the room, but then cool down pretty quickly once you enter. Obviously this has been an issue for some guests as there is a card in the room explaining that this does happen, and that the system somehow knows not to turn off at night when you're sleeping. I found this to be true - room temp while asleep was constant and comfortable. Flavors Buffet is great for breakfast, but as other reviews have pointed out go downhill for lunch and dinner in terms of selection and value for $$ paid. Range Steakhouse is a great space with a great atmosphere and service, but the food was only so-so. There are better steakhouses in town at the same price point. Carnival Court was a lot of fun, with two bands alternating and a great bar scene. The Piano Bar is also a lot of fun with Karaoke hosted by a Sinatra wanna-be from 6-9 and then dueling pianos the rest of the night. Great location center-strip and friendly, helpful staff. All-in-all a much better experience than I expected.

Reviews.Title: “you won't sleep well!”
Reviews.Author: coyotetomMichigan
Reviews.Content: I have been to LV approx. 15 times since 1990. I have stayed at 10 different properties and I would honestly go back to any of those properties EXCEPT HARRAHS! What I like: The obvious central strip location, easy access to fast elevators, check in check out, the view we had, and friendly staff. Rooms were clean, had a coffee maker. What I did not like: The Carnaval Tower walls are paper thin, I could hear adjacent quests have bowel movements (seriously), brush teeth, flush toilets, tv, conversations, all hallway activity, room alarms, doors slamming etc., etc., And, I am a veteran musician with limited hearing!!!! Of the 100's of hotels I have stayed at for business & personal travel I have been this was the worst I have experienced. One con out weighed all the pros, can't go back for that one reason as they cannot rectify this.......until I am completely deaf.

Reviews.Title: “perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: torreSpain
Reviews.Content: harrah's is in the right spot to enjoy vegas ,right in the heart of the strip close to the big named hotels and bars. room was good and clean but no view . best place to eat a breakfast or snack has to be denny's great food 24/7.

Reviews.Title: “harrah's just okay”
Reviews.Author: p8umpkinseed
Reviews.Content: the concierge was completely clueless. I asked him where I could purchase toiletriesat a place similar to a CVS; he was new in town and didn't know! The casinos are smoke-filled and it's hard to get a drink; too few waitresses. The room was okay -- it was clean but smelled faintly of stale cigarette smoke. Pillows are AWEFUL. Monday nites most shows are dark, but Rita Rudner was performing, so I thought I'd take in that show. She cancelled at the last minute! The food in the biffet is mediocre at best. The buffet at the Billagio was incredible; I think I'd stay there next time. Harrah's is just a tired and weary hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: lionsfan1971
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 free nights at Harrah's (4/29-5/03) in a double queen bed room. Upon check-in, I asked if we could get a free upgrade to a suite, while handing a $100 bill to the clerk. She promptly told me no and went on to explain that she could be fired if she gave suites away without management approval. Knowing I had lost the battle, I decided to just be happy with my 4 free nights!! The Good: 1) The room was clean and tidy and was large enough for 4 of us. The bathroom was clean and the shower had great water pressure and drained good as well!! 2) The Piano Bar is a good place to watch your favorite team play on several TV's. The downside is that drink prices double when the entertainers start playing! The Bad: 1) It seems the only time the drink servers ever came around was in the wee hours of the night, when the casino wasn't so busy, no matter if you tipped them or not. It seems this is one thing dying in Vegas nowadays. We learned to walk to Casino Royal next door and buy the $1 Michelob bottles when we wanted to quench our thirst. 2) Flavors Buffet, for $27 on a Friday night, there sure wasn't much of a choice. The crab legs are split open and then cooked, so the meat is dried out and fishy tasting, and has almost a gritty texture! Save your money and eat elswhere! All in all, I really enjoy staying at Harrahs. It seems most of the employees are friendly and out going, and you can't beat the location! I will be back, especially if they send me more free rooms!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location In the middle of the strip”
Reviews.Author: ProudToBeCanadian
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 3 nights at Harrahs. Our room was small, but nice. We never had to wait for an elevator. It is the perfect location in the middle of the strip. You can walk North one day and head South the next day. We never took the Monorail since everything is accessible by walking. We did hop on the Deuce for two dollars to check out Fremont Street one evening. The Flavour's breakfast buffet is fantastic. It's 15 dollars a person, but if you sign up for a rewards card you get a coupon book with a $5 discount for Flavour's. There is an assortment of danishes, breads, yogurts, mexican food, pizzas, crepes, fresh fruits... . Watch out for the timeshare sales people who approach you on the street. We were stopped by 9 people. We signed up for the 1 1/2 hour Wynham Resorts presentation. It actually took almost 3 1/2 hours. If your vacation time is limited, I suggest you stay away from these presentations. Ladies, hold on to your purses. While staying at Harrahs, a lady had her purse stolen in the casino around 8 or 9 in the morning when the streets weren't too busy yet. Overall, my husband and I had a great time in Vegas and would stay again at Harrahs.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: lloulou
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd time in Vegas. 2002 at the Flamingo, 2004 at Paris and this time at Harrah's, what a drop! Cheap place, cheap crowd, cheap food and cheap slot machine. If you are over 22 yrs old and well educated avoid this place. Don't know if it was the American Spring Break, still not a reason to see so many youngsters with beer bottle from morning to night. Carnival Court Bar, live and very loud music for party people. Fast check in, we arrived at 11am but the room was only ready at 4pm. Eventhough my daughter explained that she have a dinner meeting at 5, made no difference. We had to wait till 4 for our room. Renovated room # 605 Mardi Gras tower, room not well insulated, crying baby next door. Room and hall-way clean. Must see Freemont Street show and the Forum Shops at Caesars. Top 10; Venetian, Palazzo, Wynn, Bellagio, Caesars, Paris, MGM. Buffet at the Wynn the best one, Noodle at the Bellagio, fast service, we went before the show. "O" is magic. Will return to Vegas, will make an other choice where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's was Just fine”
Reviews.Author: Bubba_Who_Now
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Harrah's Vegas for a convention in April. I was at the hotel for 5 days. The hotel was just fine, nothing too exciting room wise. The check in people were hit or miss. The woman I got checked me right in and upgraded my room for no reason which was nice, but my co-worker got the shaft. He was told his room wasnt ready yet and he would have to wait. Luckily he wondered over to where I was checking in, about two stations away and when he told me he had to wait, my check in person asked for his info. She ended up checking him in right then. I dont know what the issue was with the first person. Other than that, we had no issues with the hotel, everything was just fine. The casino is just ok too. Really expensive drinks if you are not gambling, but its hard to want to sit at an empty table with $20 min for a "free" drink. I spent most of my gambling time at the casino's next door. I tried to watch a Red Sox game at the Sports Book, but the chairs are so uncomfortable you don't want to hang around. Of course the most comfortable seats are at the bar but you have to be playing video poker to sit....meh... I ate at the buffet the first day. Good selection and fine food. Nothing outstanding. It was Sunday when I arrived so the price was pushed up to $20 each opposed to the normal $16 because it was "Brunch". The deli (hidden between the Sports Book and the Poker Room) was the best food I had in the hotel and it was cheap too. One thing to note, the hotel as a deal with Pepsi, so if you need a Coke product you need to go to McDonald's next door. Overall nothing bad, nothing great. I'd stay there again if I had too.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: TravelinWahoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrah's with the family for Thanksgiving...by the way, Thanksgiving is a surprisingly crowded time to visit Vegas. I've been to Vegas 4 times, this was my first at Harrah's. I definitely was not impressed. Not my decor style...sorta '80's-looking carnival figures with other random art. The hotel didn't seem to have a cohesive design. My guest room looked out on to the top of another roof...not attractive. In fact, my in-laws' room looked out on to another roof, which had a dead bird lying on it. Lovely. Casino was small, relatively low ceilings. The breakfast place was decent. The Toby Keith bar was kinda cool. Seemed to be out of place at Harrah's. Location is definitely awesome, right across from Ceasar's Palace. I enjoyed TI: Treasure Island much much much more. It's worth the farther walk. Beautiful fun hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs-great central location”
Reviews.Author: angnkvn
Reviews.Content: My husband & I along with six other couples went to las vegas & stayed at Harrahs for the first time. This was our fourth trip to vegasWe all were very pleased with our room, the service, and most of all -the location. We were able to walk to many places including Caesars palace, the forum shops inside caesars, the fashion show mall, and many of the other casinos. Next door is Casino Royale-not a very nice or pretty casino but if you are looking for cheap beers, then this is the place. $1 michelob drafts & $1.50 bottled beer.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but could hear neighbors”
Reviews.Author: mauieric
Reviews.Content: I just returned today from a 5 night stay at Harrahs. I arrived Sunday 4/6/2008 and departed 4/11/2008. I arrived early between 11 and 12 noon and my room with a King sized bed in the Mardi Gras tower was not ready.( check in time was actually 4 pm). I was assigned a standard room in the Carnival tower on the 22th floor, which had a safe and a nice view of the mountains. The room was clean and had comfortable beds. I called room service three times while I was at the hotel and it was excellent. The Flavor buffet is wonderful for breakfast, I ate there once but did not eat any other meal there. The Cafe is open late and I had a philly cheese steak and potato salad at 3:30 am, it was excellent. I had problems trying to figure out how to set the alarm clock so I called housekeeping. A person came with a new clock with instructions and went over it with me. The only complaint I had was that I could hear the two ladies in the room next to me talking when they came back to the room and also in the morning when I woke up, I guess the rooms are not well insulated. I was lucky I was not next to a room with loud party goers. I will consider staying at the hotel again, but I will request an upgrade when I make my reservations and ask for a room that is quiet. I had a hot deal internet special of 4 nights for $69 and the 5th night $105. Over all it was a great deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's -- Old fashioned, smoky and NOT for business travel”
Reviews.Author: MCVCambridge_MA
Reviews.Content: Harrah's should remove itself from the list of "official" hotels for convention travel. I stayed there 2 nights last week during CTIA, and was very disappointed. I arrived at 3:00 a.m. local time on a Tuesday morning after flight delays from the East Coast. Check-in was stressful because the front desk person was reluctant to give me a non-smoking room, which had been reserved and guaranteed for me. The front desk person spoke to the manager, who did give me the non-smoking room. That was a relief but it took about 20 minutes when I was really tired out. One bright note about the hotel: the room itself was actually nice, clean and spacious. But Harrah's isn't an appropriate hotel for business travelers. You have to walk through a very smoky casino to get to the restaurants and to some of the elevators. Garish neon lights are everywhere. It was like staying in a bar with hotel rooms attached. The biggest bummer was that the pool was only open from 9:00 a.m.-5:00 p.m. Again, the hotel's just not for people who are traveling on business. You can smoke and gamble 24 hours a day at Harrah's-- but you can't get in the pool! Go figure! On a brighter note, one morning, we had breakfast at the Renaissance Hotel near the convention center-- and it was wonderful. The service was fantastic, food was great, and ambiance was truly relaxing. It was like an oasis in the insanity that is Las Vegas. Hopefully, I will stay in a hotel more like the Renaissance next time I have to go to Las Vegas for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “thankful for what I forgot in the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anduuuu
Reviews.Content: I would like to express you my gratitude in mailing me back what I forgot in the hotel in Vegas last time I've been there. The gentleman I talk with at the lost office has been very kind and I received what I forgot (sunglasses and pijama) in 4 days.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nurseteresa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrahs 3/24-27. All employees, except one reservation person, were very nice. She just seemed to want to argue about everything and there was nothing to argue with us about. She had argued with the 2 guests ahead of us while we listened. We went up, gave her our confirmaiton numbers. She looked in computer, sighed, and said here you go---ruined her day I guess. I stayed there with 4 co-workers for a Nurse Manager Conference. The rooms were nice, quiet, and clean. Cab driver had told us how dirty and unkept Harrahs' rooms were. We were pleasantly surprised. My room was comped and the other 2 rooms were $360 each for 3 nights. We ate at the buffet for supper one evening, not very good in our opinion. Some of the food seemed dried out, like it had been sitting too long. The Bananas Foster was wonderful. We also ate at the cafe. It took a while to get seated, empty tables everywhere, but the service, once we sat down, was good, as was the food. We all had the steak and shrimp special for $12.00. Good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: kc2gvx
Reviews.Content: Being a Total Rewards member, I get comp rooms at Harrah's properties. However, for paying guests, Harrah's is one of the most reasonable of the strip casino hotels in Vegas. The casino is loaded with popular games, the buffet is good, and the staff is friendly. Never had to wait for my drink to get empty with the cocktail waitresses. Most rooms overlook the eastern part of the city, or the service road, but who comes to the room to stare out the window? You can request a strip view, but might not be worth the price. The beds are comfortable and clean. Mini bar is a traditional rip off, and prohibits you from storing your own stuff. Good news is you can request a mini-fridge for free to be brought to your room. I was comped a king bed, strip view room for free, but when I checked in (early) I got 2 double beds, city view. It takes a lot for me to complain, so I just took the room and was happy. Bathroom was clean and functional, and the carpets and sheets were also clean. TV had many channels, and offered video check out. My largest complaint with this property is the AC system. It is on a sensor, which shuts off when you are NOT in the room, or sleeping. Thus, you often wake up in the night sweating, or return from a day of being in the DESERT SUN hot, only to find your room even hotter. I understand the need to save energy, but find somewhere else to cut back. Guests want their rooms comfortable. I think you can call the front desk, and if you get someone smart they can have an engineer put the thermostat on bypass, which gives total control back to you. I didn't try it, the weather was in the 50's at night this time, so I left the window open for cool, fresh air. Internet access is $11, but you should be on the casino floor anyway, not goofing off on Myspace. It is a long walk from the parking garage to the strip, but all the places are like this. Short walk to the room elevators, and the elevators moved fast.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: gqhva
Reviews.Content: As I have read in these reviews, Harrah's may be in the process of updating but you would never know it. My room was out of the 80's...good bed but everything else well dated. A/C did not work until they repaired it, mold in shower, waterstains on ceiling. Lobby area lacked any luster. For the money I spent, I certainly expected more from Harrah's. Look elsewhere if you can!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: jeffox
Reviews.Content: We got what looked like a recently renovated room. It was nice, the beds were comfortable, and there was plenty of room. The bathroom wasn't anything special, your typical shower/tub and vanity, but was plenty adequate for us. The elevators were quick and easy to locate. We didn't get to the pool, but we took a look at it one day and it didn't seem like anything specila, but would be a nice place to relax and swim. The location is excelent for North strip touring and we spent much of our time away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked Harrah's...”
Reviews.Author: katelinmariecole
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Harrah's in the beginning of March and eloped! We go to Harrah's in Atlantic City so we were able to get really great rates on our room. When we got to the check -in I explained to the representative that we were planning on getting married and any upgrades they could provide would be very much appreciated. She said that she couldn't really do anything but then the rep next her was going on and on about this great room that she was going to put this older couple into and the mini bar and complete renovations, view, etc. .... So our rep told us that she was able to find us a very nice(renovated) room in I think it's called the Mardi Gras tower....one is renovated and one is not. She was very nice about it. Our room was on the second to the top floor with a view of Treasure Island and the Venetian. We had a king size bed, flat screen plasma and a smaller flat screen plasma in the bathroom(which was very nice). It was clean and very nice. We ate at Flavors buffet at Harrah's one night and it was pretty good but we were both intoxicated so it's not a fair judgement. We also ate at their cafe which was ok....had bbq chicken pizza. Their sports book is fun and inviting....not as nice as some of the other ones but unpretentious. The bartenders are really funny and nice. The cocktail waitresses at Harrah's are attentive, quick and really nice...they always say "have a lucky time" and really sound sincere about it. We rented a hummer one day and when we were waiting outside the front entrance to be picked up, we spoke with an extremely friendly and lovely Harrah's employee who hung out with us for awhile when were waiting. There are two starbucks in the hotel.....In the early morning there is usually a wicked long line at the one on the main floor so I would reccomend the starbucks on the second floor across from Toby Keith's. We won some money on the "go nuts" slot machine and then lost it in the sportsbook. Overall, we had a fabulous time in Las Vegas and I would definitely stay at Harrah's again when we go back because our room was super nice, the staff was great & it is centrally located.....you can't get a better location....you are literally in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's - The Place To Be”
Reviews.Author: GOTTAGO37
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from 6 days in Vegas - my first time ever. We booked everything - flights, hotels, shuttle, shows - on line through Orbitz with a little trepidation, but were pleasantly surprised. Nearly everything went without a hitch - and who can control airplanes? Harrah's was wonderful. Central to everything, best buffet on the Strip, friendly waitresses, great table staff. They even coached us through our first attempt at craps. We will definitely make Harrah's our home base the next time we're in Vegas.The only problem was the flight AND airport staff at LAX. Nearly missed our connector to get home because no one would help us get from terminal 1 to terminal 2, plus had to go through security again. A great trip - and a wonderful place to visit. Thoroughly enjoyed walking and sightseeing the entire Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maggie7Columbus
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was nice for a Las Vegas hotel. Room was spacious, clean, and quiet. Not too glitzy. Casinos were boring and the cigarette smoke removal system extremelly poor. Check-in and check-out were quick and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: eagletrailer
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed at Harrah's Las Vegas 2-27 thru 3-1. This is an ok place but nothing to brag about. I rate it lower than Bally's or Mirage. Bed was comfortable, pillows lousy. Stayed on the 4th floor Canival Tower, motel 6 kind of room, though clean. Loud music from outside till 2:00 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but noisy!”
Reviews.Author: rocnrlr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Mardi Gras Tower on the top (15th) floor in a nicely-remodeled room with a comfy pillowtop king bed. There was a flat-screen TV in the bathroom!!! The only problem, which we had been warned aboout at check-in, was the Carnaval Bar directly below the tower, which was a bit noisy. But, I recommend this tower for its renovated rooms! The casino was dreary, with low ceilings. However, it's centrally located on the strip and within walking distance to many of the other casinos, and there's shuttle service to the Rio. We made two trips to Harrah's Oyster Bar, which is great. Try the Stone Pale Ale, a dozen oysters, and an order of the Peel n' Eat Shrimp! I highly recommend the Harrah's Mac King Comedy-Magic Show. You can get a free pass for two at the Reservation Desk (which doesn't include a one-drink min. - $12 each!) Great show! We'd definitely stay here again, as the room was clean and comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeoLion69
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at Harrah's and was very satisfied. First, it's difficult to complain much when you get a $50.00 per night rate plus $25.00 food & beverage credit! At that price I didn't expect much but now feel we received an excellent deal. I asked for a high floor room and was given a room on the 26th floor with a terrific view of the city. My traveling companion asked for adjoining rooms but the best the front desk clerk could do was put us directly across the hall from each other. No problem with that. The front desk clerk was very friendly and accomodating. Check-in was a breeze as was check-out. I do have to mention that housekeeping could be better in the room. There was very noticeable dust on the nightstand. I ran my finger across the clock radio hoping the housekeeper might notice the dust. That didn't happen and the dust was still there the next day after she cleaned the room. The shower could have been a bit cleaner, too, as there were remnants of shampoo or soap on the tub. As I said at the beginning of this review it's difficult to complain about a few small issues. The room in general was in very good condition. The window opened which I really appreciated. We ate breakfast in the buffet both mornings to use the food credit. Harrah's breakfast buffet food selection and quality was very good. The casino was very large and always busy. I didn't have much luck on the slots. Seemed a bit tight, but maybe I wasn't being blessed by Lady Luck this time. Finally, the location is excellent. Walking distance to several of the big hotels. All in all it was a very positive experience and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Harrah's or to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at Harrah's Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Maxxy0000
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Harrah's Las Vegas today. This is a wonderful hotel casino. They gave me an early check-in. The room was absolutely excellent. My room was in the Mardi Gras Tower. Everything worked in the room. TV, all lights, and remote control. The bed was very very comfortable, there was a free safe in the room and a bar. Everything met to my satisfaction. I was in a comped room, so of course the view was not spectacular, but it should not be as it was a complimentary room. The hotel room was quiet, great climate control and excellent housekeeping. Several restaurants are in the hotel and I really enjoyed Ming's Table. This is right at the Mardi Gras Tower and has fine Oriental cuisine. The property is right in the middle of Las Vegas Boulevard and easy to access other hotel casinos and the Monorail. I highly recommend Harrah's Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's Las Vegas Not Too Shabby”
Reviews.Author: MarilynJ6354
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have stayed at Harrahs in 15 years. Back then it was pretty dumpy but it seems they have upgraded somewhat, although I think the bathrooms need some attention. Unfortunately I was given a room with a view but dirty bathtub! They did, however, move me to a better room without the great view, but it had windows that open, which I liked. I have to say that I did have a comped room for the two nights I stayed and usually those are not the best but I was pleased. The staff was great and the location is excellent. Having stayed at the Flamingo most of the time in the last 5 years, I have to say I liked the updated Flamingo rooms the best, but they are no longer comping those rooms so I would say that the regular rooms are comparable to each other. I always rent a car so where I stay doesn't matter but if you don't want to rent a car or take a cab, these are the best two locations.

Reviews.Title: “Worth considering”
Reviews.Author: Dannyjay
Reviews.Content: Went with a buddy for 3 nights after superbowl weekend. Have stayed at several Vegas hotels with wife but never at Harrah's. Was skeptical but gave it a try as we didn't really care about the room so much and it was cheap, $59 for a strip view room. Was pleasantly surprised. Room wasn't very big but it was clean, seemed to be recently updated, had a window that opened, the beds were very comfortable with plenty of pillows and the bathroom had updated fixtures such as a shower massage and a power flush toilet. We were in the Carnivale tower and the strip view was partially blocked but we had full view of the Mirage volcano (which was down for repair) and Treasure Island. The location of Harrah's is one of the best on the strip. If you go out the front door of the casino there is a crosswalk that leads directly to Caesar's. Harrah's is right in the middle of a large complex of hotels and is on the monorail for easy access to other properties. Another good thing is that when you arrive (we came in a taxi) check in is right inside the door and the room elevators are just off the lobby, you don't have to drag your luggage through the casino. Check in was fast and easy for us and the room was ready when we arrived. We didn't get bothered by the time share people but if you are a male / female couple they will confront you which is pretty annoying. The drink service was ok if you play the tables and the service at the sports book was good. The sports book at Harrah's is good though my favorite is at Bellagio. We didn't eat at Harrah's so I can't comment on the food but there is a Starbucks just off the room elevators, which was nice. This was my first stay at Harrah's, based on this trip I would give it another try in the future. If your looking for a place to stay that isn't really fancy but has a great location and is a very good value Harrah's is worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Not That Bad”
Reviews.Author: Colo01
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at Harrahs .Wasn't sure what to expect. Room had been upgraded. Flat screen in main room and bathroom.Bed was above average, plenty of pillows. Overall a good room for the price $59.00 A night. The one thing that I didn't like was room Temp could be only adjusted down to 64 dregee's. If you like it cold this could be a issue. Also the outside band plays to 1:00 am every night. With the sliding door closed you could barely hear it. But if you go to bed early or a light sleeper this could be a issue. Restaurants were just avg. We had a car, drove south to the South Coast Casino for there $5.95 breakfast buffet. Casino was great even though I didn't win much Held steady most of the time. Plenty of cocktail waitress so the service was good both days. I would stay again, Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but by no means the worst”
Reviews.Author: TheScotAbroad
Reviews.Content: Check in was fast and efficient, rooms are clean and quite spacious if not luxurious. Didn't eat there so can't comment on restaurants. Casino was a fairly typical lower-end strip casino - smoky, tacky, disorienting and easy to lose both your money and your wits. If you are after a good value hotel on the strip the Harrahs is probably worth a look.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: luckyladymd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visit Las Vegas about twice a year. We have stayed at high end resorts like Caesars and the Wynn but we really like to stay at Harrahs. My husband and I can afford to stay in the upscale places, but we now confine our stay to Harrahs. Harrahs is number one in our book for customer service and that the very important to us. If you are looking for luxury, then Harrah is not it. But if you are looking for a place that treats you great and a good place to gamble, then Harrahs would be a good choice. The staff is wonderful to us. Our room has been great (we usually a given a suite) and the slots are looser than any of the casino that we visit on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Def Recommend”
Reviews.Author: mysidekick
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a non smoking room in the Carnaval tower. Bed was very comfortable. Room was spacious. It was cleaned every day. Bathroom was good. Massage shower was a nice touch. Internet in the room is about $12 for a day. We arrived at 8.30 pm so no queue for checking in. Also upon check out at 11am it took us no longer than 5 minutes. However when we arrived they put us in a smoking room in the Mardigras tower but the following morning we got new non smoking room in Carnaval tower. Not sure why they did this. Lady at desk said, they had no available non smoking room at time of check in. All in all, I will definitely be staying when I go back.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's Hotel & Casino Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Invention7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got home from Harrah's Las Vegas on January 24th. We were there for a week. We thought that other hotels in the area owned by Harrah's were nice also. Ceasars Palace was the most impressive looking. We stayed in the C tower on 27th floor at Harrahs. Very nice view of the Mirage and the fountain and volcano in front. We even got to see the volcano erupting one night. It was impressive. The room was satisfactory. Nothing wrong with it. Maybe it could have used a few more electrical outlets. The bathroom was good, the mattress and bedding were good. Maidservice was good. We were satisfied with Harrah's all in all. A few hints and suggestions we have are: If you can't walk long distances, don't try to go to other hotels, it looks close but it isn't. Just getting from Harrah's to Ceasars Palace across the street is a long walk. You can rent a mobility cart at Harrah's. (Just like the kind you see at the grocery store only much nicer, smaller and faster) The carts are rented outside the front desk, see the bell captain. If you keep it for like 6 days its $125.00. One day is $40.00, two is like $75.00. So the longer you keep it the price goes down per day. It goes about 20 MPH at top speed and also can be adjusted for whatever speed you want to go. You take it to your room at night and park it and plug it in. It holds a charge all day long. I took mine to 5 different casinos with no problem. (My hip was giving me a problem) There is a shuttle you can catch outside of Harrahs that will take you to the Rio Hotel. From the Rio you can get a shuttle to Ballys, Ceasars Palace, Paris, and maybe one other Harrah's owned hotel, I can't remember. They run every 15 min on Weekends and every 1/2 hour on weekdays. These shuttles are all free and you can take your mobility cart with you. They have a lift and they put it right in the back of the shuttle and they put you on the shuttle first while everyone else has to wait to board. (Makes you feel cared for ya know) The gambling was not good at any of the casinos for us. We played slots ($1.00, 50, 25, nickel and penny. The most we won was $400.00.) We found that all the casinos slots were tight. We gambled at Harrahs, Ballys, Ceasars Palace, Rio, Imperial Palace, and the Venetian. By the way the Venetian is the most impressive hotel we saw. (Of course we didn't see the rooms) When you get to Vegas, take your GPS with you. The cab drivers will take you the long way to your hotel. Whatever you do don't tell them its your first time to Vegas. If you are going to Harrahs tell them you want to go via Paradise Blvd. That is the most direct route. We paid $7.00 more to get to the hotel than we paid to go back to the airport, after we were advised to tell them to take Paradise. Our GPS was packed in a suitcase. At the hotel, if you tell them you need a refrigerator it will cost you $30.00 a day. If you tell them its medically necessary, it will be free.
