We took a cab a mile and a half away to Von's grocery store and got beer and bottled water and snacks and stuff. Bottled water is $2.25 at the hotels and beer is anywhere from $6.50 to 9.00 a bottle. Except if you are in the casino. We had a great time at the piano bar at Harrahs, they have Karoke also if you are into that. The Mac King I think that was his last name.comedy magic show was hilarious, we rec\ommend it. Harrah's gave us free tickets to the show, but you had to buy two drinks at a cost of $23.00. It was the cheapest show we saw, but the best. We also went to the Price is Right show at Bally's, it was a lot of fun. We saw the Blue Man Group show at the Venetian. Save your money unless you are in your 20's and love loud banging and strobe lights and toilet paper showered over your head. At $138.00 a ticket, we wanted a refund. The legends show with people imitating Elvis, Bette Midler, Ray Charles, etc. was also nice. You can get a discount equal to the sales tax in the shops owned by Harrahs if you are staying at Harrahs and you ask. I got a suede jacket at 10% off instead of the 8% tax because it was on a display. The plane ride was nice. The airport was not bad, security wasn't bad to get through. All in all except for losing thousands of dollars in the slots, we had a great time. By the way, the buffet at the Rio is a 1/4 mile long and is the best buffet we went to. The Oyster bar at Harrahs was the best also. Try the Broiled crab legs and the fried oysters. We were in heaven. the buffet at Harrahs was also nice.

Reviews.Title: “nothing to complain about”
Reviews.Author: pharmy1010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days over the Christmas holiday. Our oom was 619 Mardi Gras tower. Front desk gave us exactly what we asked for without the $20 trick--updated room with a safe and close to the elevators. The accomodations here were worth every penny, clean, not too worn, and relatively quiet. Like others have said, you can hear the outdoor bartenders from the room, but it was not overly obtrusive to us. We did not prefer to gamble in Harrahs, it was very smoky, I think due to the low ceilings. We really enjoyed Toby Keith's I love this bar--way too much good food for reasonable prices. You really could not ask for a better location, Imperial Palace, Casino Royale, O'Sheas, Mirage, TI, Venetian, and Caesar's were all less than 5 minutes walk. Later on our trip we stayed at Planet Hollywood, which was way more posh, but then again, we paid more than double the amount. Overall, we were quite satisfied with our stay in Harrahs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but security is extremely rude & very accusing”
Reviews.Author: trustee1
Reviews.Content: We went back to Vegas in December this time staying at Harrahs's , all went okay until my daughter (22) went to her room at 1:30 am one night. Problem is ste went to the room at 145 the night before. She had her room key to show to security which is required after 9 at night. Securuty stopped her asked her her name & room number, they then had an plan clothed officer ride the elevator up to her floor, even though they had seen her with the family for the past 4 nights. the jset is that since she was not with another invdividual they accuse her of being an professional escort. The head of security was called later he said that is there job. the Front desk was asked for a manager on duty and we were told there is no one on duty at night. We will not stay at Harrahs in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the road in the middle of the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: mikhel
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Harrah’s is undoubtedly the location. Well situated in the middle of the strip it’s convenient for just about everywhere. Check-in was problematic, our room was not ready at the time of arrival and we had to make two additional trips to the front desk and wait several hours before it was. The Staff were apologetic and friendly but the inconvenience spoiled our day and was an unimpressive introduction to the hotel. When we finally got it, our room was large, adequately furnished and unremarkable in almost every other way. The larger than average bathroom, well supplied with extra towels, soaps and bottles was the only real positive. Unfortunately, this is a hotel with a serious identity problem. If Harrah’s were a colour it would be beige. Surrounded by bigger and better hotels with well-defined themes and better facilities, Harrah’s just feels dated and out of place. We got a ridiculously good rate on our stay so were not particularly disappointed at the overall mediocrity of the hotel. Had we paid the additional $200 that others who’d booked later were charged we might not have been quite so forgiving. If you’re lucky enough to get a promotional rate and don’t consider your hotel to be a crucial part of your Vegas experience then Harrah’s is an acceptable place to stay. If you’re looking for style and creature comforts there are much better alternatives at a similar price. One final thought. I’ve visited Vegas many times and probably played in every casino on the strip at one time or another, never have I waited as long to see a cocktail waitress. You really could die of thirst if you decide to gamble here.

Reviews.Title: “MANY "issues" with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: montagcynan
Reviews.Content: PROS: #1. Excellent location of hotel on the strip. #2. Slots looser than some hotels on strip....at least on this trip. CONS: MAJOR ONES! #1. Comped so-called: "Luxury room w/ spectacular view of strip", which were reserved in early November... UNAVAILABLE!!!! ....due to overbooking; on a Wednesday in mid-winter! Supposed "upgrade" to premium room as a compromise was a complete farce. We were given an unacceptable remodelled "closet-sized" room ("premium" simply meaning a plasma tv vs. analog) with absolutely nothing to look at but another wing of hotel. Complaint results in complete attitude change of "cheery" check-in gal.... as well as a 3+ hour wait for decent sized room with limited view, but at least acceptable. #2. Casino needs a much-improved air ventilation for cigarette smoking. REALLY SMOKEY! If it bothers you, too...try Caesar's or the Rio! #3. Tried to dine at casino cafe for breakfast around 7AM on last day. No one in line; cafe less than 1/3 full ...and we are told we must wait until they clean a table. We left after 10 minutes..... CONCLUSION: Granted...our rooms were comped and we could have stayed for free at several other Harrah properties in Vegas, but we chose Harrah's Casino and Hotel due to the location. However, we feel that since we were INVITED to stay and promised a certain type of room, we should have at least received what we were promised. BUT...the biggest issue of all is the obvious sham they tried to pull on us regarding the supposed "upgrade". As a "seasoned" couple of players to other Vegas hotels, as well as Harrah's wonderful Grand Biloxi in Mississippi, this was a complete slap-in-the-face. Maybe the Harrahs' properties in Vegas should take a few lessons from their southern brothers in humbled post-Katrina Biloxi.

Reviews.Title: “would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: clarkjohnston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our trip through Vegas.com and couldn't be happier with our stay. We checked in around 9:30 am and only waited in line about 5 minutes. We were given a room (and explained to that it would over look the noisy Carnival Court) in the Mardi Gras tour or we could wait for a room on the quieter side. We went to bed one night around midnight and even though we could hear the music, it didn't keep us awake. We chose the room that was ready and it was great. Big flat screen tv in the room (one in the bathroom too) and nice comfy king size bed (room 1003.) There wasn't a big wait for elevators (we stayed from Sunday-Wednesday.) We played the nickel poker and didn't have too hard of a time getting free drinks (yummy daquiris!) Service was friendly. We did the timeshare thing to get free show tickets, two buffets at Caesars Palace and discounts on the Flavors buffet, but be prepared to say "no" many times. They are very persistant!!! We ate at Flavors everyday and it was great everytime (lots of choices and hot food.) The Starbucks is right in the hotel, but there is a McDonalds next door with surprisingly good coffee there too. We really enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to others too.l

Reviews.Title: “Fun Stay at Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: Tex4971
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights, Jan11 thru Jan14. Check in was smooth and fast. We were allowed to check in at 1:00 pm. There was a group ahead of us slowing things down and someone from the Platinum Club took us inside so we wouldnt have to wait. Got a remodeled, non smoking room on the 20th floor of the Carnaval Tower with a strip view. Very clean, quiet, comfortable mattress. Ate at Toby Keith's (2X), The Cafe and the sports book deli. Food was good and reasonably priced. Saw the Mac King show for the price of 2 drinks, very funny, highly recommend. Location was convenient to the other shows we saw- LOVE at Mirage(unbelievable), Gordie Brown at Venetian (hilarious) and Big Elvis (still great and FREE) The casino was lively, hug variety of slots. Every employee we encountered was friendly and helpful. Harrah's doesnt have the snobby atmosphere of the high priced hotels nearby. It was a fun trip at a very reasonable price, wouldnt hesitate to stay there on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat dated, but good location and decent value”
Reviews.Author: Wheezy_Dave
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for an over-the-top luxury experience like you'd get at Bellagio, Venetian or the Wynn, this isn't it. But if you want a reasonably priced room that's a short walk from those locations, Harrah's is a decent choice. Probably the best thing about Harrah's is its central-Strip location. Mirage and Caesar's are across the street, and a 15-minute walk will put you into the casinos at Bellagio or Venetian (or O'Shea's or Casino Royale if you'd prefer). If you're in town for a convention, Harrah's shares a monorail stop with Imperial Palace that's one stop away from the Convention Center (less than a 10-minute ride, and much faster than sitting in shuttle-bus traffic). The rooms are smallish to average-sized and there was some, but not much, noise from the hallways. Overall, they could use a good refresh, but you've probably stayed in worse.

Reviews.Title: “no more”
Reviews.Author: Karob1224
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's at the beginning of December 2007. After reading reviews on this site we were pretty sure we were making a good choice. When we got there, very tired from traveling, the room was not what we expected. The room was dimly lit and the bedspread was ratty looking. It also was a very small room. They tried to accomodate us with another lamp but all in all we were not happy and would not stay there again. Also the hotel was difficult to get around as far as finding the elevators to the floors.

Reviews.Title: “Ho-Hum”
Reviews.Author: j5980
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is very friendly. However, the room we received smelled really musty and like cigarettes (non-smoking room). The atmosphere reminded me of a Motel 6 or something you would find along the interstate. The bed and pillows were really hard, you could feel the springs in the mattress. The A/C system didn't work and kept my room at a "cozy" 76 degrees all night. This is proof you get what you pay for. Great price on the room, I paid $55 that night, I got what I paid for I guess. If you plan on visiting Harrah's, go for an upgraded room and maybe you won't have the problems I ran into.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Perficio
Reviews.Content: We managed to grab the Post-Thanksgiving Deal and stayed for USD 45 a night, so I guess for this price there is not much I could complain about, but if you were to have to pay alot more, you might wish to explore other options since there are many other hotels along the strip anyway. Check-in took a while even though there were not that many people and they had well over 10 counters opened. Got a room that looked out to the Imperial Place, so not much of a view to talk about either. Room size was adequate, but the lighting was terrible. Even with all available lights switched on, the room was so dim you should not attempt to read anything at all! The water pressure in the shower was also quite low and it will take you a while to get your shower done. We also found the bed to be too soft for our comfort, and it certainly does nothing to help stretch out your tired bones after a long day out walking The Strip. You should also beware the refrigerator, which clearly states that everything inside is monitored electronically and the second you remove any item, it will be charged to your account. Sadly, not the entire flooring of the room was carpeted, and even more unfortunate was the fact that Harrah's does not supply any in-room slippers. As such, in the middle of winter, should you wake up in the middle of the night and wish to visit the bathroom, be prepared for a freezing shock once your feet touches the floor. Location-wise, Harrah's offer a relatively good deal, though Imperial Place, The Venetian, Mirage, TI, Bally's, Paris, etc could all probably offer that. Moreover, the layout of Harrah's makes it rather difficult to get to the elevators to get to your room if you enter from The Strip as they make you walk through pretty much the entire casino floor and there are little directional signs to point you in the correct direction. However, if you are one of those who prefer to travel by the Monorail, the station is very conviniently located behind the hotel and you could easily exit the hotel on the 2nd floor and stroll under the covered walkway to the station. All-in-all, not much to rave about for an establishment whose reputation may be bigger than what it can deliver. Might return again if the deal is as good as the one I had. Otherwise, if I could afford abit more, I would most certainly prefer to try The Venetian next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good room”
Reviews.Author: VesperGirl
Reviews.Content: As many reviewers past, the location is good - very central on the strip, but a walk wherever you go since everything is larger than life there. A walk on the crowded sidewalks can take up to 40 minutes to the MGM from H's. The room was nice, standard double queen, since no more kings left, was fine with me. I had to switch room from 424 to 5-something because the piping in 424 was noisy.. like air in the pipes making weird noises, so just as i got in I switched, and the other room on the 5th floor, opposite wing, was fine. Clean and spacious. Thiswas my 3/4th visit to H's and never had any complaints, just fine for sleeping and showering!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: NFR_girl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harrah's from Dec 8 -12th and we had a Great time and had wonderful service. My sisters and I had taken our folks (who are both 70) to Vegas to attend the National Finals Rodeo, and I could not be happier with the service we recieved at Harrah's. At check in I told Nicole at the front desk that I had my parents with me and she was so accomodating and made sure they had the best room and were close to the evevator so they had less walking. Every staff person we came in contact with during our stay was so accomodating and friendly. Both of our rooms had great views. Mom and dad had a view of the volcano at the Mirage each night and we over looked the pool. We also enjoyed the Piano Bar. What a fun place don't miss this if you stay there. My only request would be that they put coffee pots in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “So-So”
Reviews.Author: FleetLady
Reviews.Content: Nothing to get excited about here. Check-in lady unhelpful [in the extreme] advised no other rooms available for our entire 7 night stay, so ended up ground level view of concrete strip & pipes & needing to have curtains closed 24/7. When electricity failed next day, lovely young male [of course] on reception moved us instantly & offered us vast choice of rooms. So the 1st woman lied, not impressive & so unnecessary We took 1 of the noisy rooms everyone knows about as had a view & higher floor Buffet incredibly expensive but food & selections made up for this. Starbucks a bonus Harrahs needs coffee machine in rooms, the flat screen tv in bathroom is great but we would have preferred in-room coffee Location good, but found carpark unnecessarily complicated to access. Housekeeping v good. Room size fine. Beds comfy. Have stayed in over 12 Vegas hotels over the years, have to say that so far SAHARA [ Oct 2007] wins~ amazing 27th flr room with view to die for; easy parking/access ; excellent buffets half the price of Harrahs & rooms only $35pn And far more character, to boot

Reviews.Title: “Great location and okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: ellis22922
Reviews.Content: Check in was great!!! Nice lady helped us. Check out was good too! The hotel was nice, but the bed and pillows were horrible. Stayed on the fourth floor, Carnival wing. Lady riding our airport bus back home, was on another wing, and her bed and pillows were fine??? No coffee maker in room and no refrigerator. They serve lots of food with meal, so it would be nice to have leftovers! Starbucks is main option for good coffee, and it was always crowded. However, go to the one on the second floor, and it is much faster! Tight slots and I never saw ANYONE win much. Piano bar music was entertaining. Only reason I would go back, if on another wing and I was comped again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay If You Plan To Play~ Prepare to Be Robbed!!!”
Reviews.Author: MsPeg1
Reviews.Content: Prepare to be Robbed!! The Hotel is nice and convienently located~ BUT, there is a slight problem with Harrah's Casino. It does NOT pay out anything! If you like feeling Robbed and feeling like a LOSER, then by all means gamble here. The slots have a 0% return. I've never seen anything like this. GO SOMEWHERE ELSE TO GAMBLE!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Sadie1975
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 days at Harrahs and loved it! We got there Friday evening and had to wait about 15 min to check in, but not too bad. They org. put us in the Mardi Gras Tower which had a view of the pool and partial of the Strip and I thought the other Tower would have a better view so we asked to be moved the next day to the other tower, which they did no problem. We ended up liking the Mardi Gras Tower better and asked to be moved BACK over (again they did NO problem). Mardi Gras was newer rooms, more comfortable beds, a little smaller rooms though which we didnt care, flat screen TV in the bedroom and another TV in the bathroom and a little mini balcony, which we LOVED opening our sliding glass door and standing outside and letting the cool air blow in. The other tower is older, the rooms are bigger and the view was more of the mountains and it did have that OLD feel and too much carpet fresh smell. When we checked in the desk person told us that Mardi Gras might be noisy cause we are overlooking the pool and the bands play until 2 or 3am, but there was never a band so this didnt bother us and we didnt even see construction anywhere, so that noise we didnt encounter either. The champagne breakfast buffet @ Harrahs was only OK, nothing great. Wouldnt eat at this one again. My husband and I walked around to all the other mega hotels and some smaller ones and it gets to a point where they pretty much are all the same. Depends on the "theme" you want. We thought Harrahas had the friendliest dealers and came around with the drinks more. We loved that this hotel wasnt SO huge that it took you 20-30 min to walk to the Strip. We could easily go from my husbands favorite poker table up to our room or out to the Strip in mere minutes! O'Sheas next Harrahs was a little cheaper table games, but we played poker there for 2 hours one night and not ONE waitress came around, needless to say we didnt go back there. Caesars, much the same we played slots for an hour or 1.5 hours and only saw ONE waitress. We def., thought drinks were going to be more plentiful then having to hunt someone down or pay ourselves!!! Food in general in Vegas is expensive, plan to spend a $100/day on food for 2 people and this was eating moderately and only twice a day. Overall we loved Harrahs for the location and the price, and would DEF stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “What I expected from Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: rosamondguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Harrah's Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas in December 2007. Harrah's is right in the heart of the Las Vegas Strip, right next to the Venetian Hotel and across the street from Caesar's Palace and the Mirage. You can't ask for a better location. Room - Very nice. Excellent condition. Had a good view of the Strip. Restaurants - Harrah's Cafe is very nice, and the food was excellent. Ming's Table is a chinese restaurant with very good food. The Range Steakhouse was also excellent, but it was way too expensive for me. Casino - Huge and adequate. Employees - Friendly. Noteworthy - Toby Keith's I Love This Bar and Grill. Best things about this hotel: Location. Monorail station. I was very happy with Harrah's, especially since I had the $45.00 per night rate. I give Harrah's 4 stars out of five.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Good Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: BigBobJoylove
Reviews.Content: Extremely affordable , great location , love the Casino , slots pay out regularly , nice keno lounge , comfy rooms and beds , cheerful staff although they do try room service a bit early so put the do not disturb sign up, good Starbucks near the Lifts , check-in was quick and painless , all in all a hidden gem. Tip ... go and see Mr Vegas , Wayne Newton , no reason - you just have to.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay if your not goin to be in the room!”
Reviews.Author: xodadasupreme
Reviews.Content: i enjoyed my stay here. The Mardi Gras Tower rooms were completely renovated with LG plasma/lcd tv's (in the bedroom and bathroom) and marble counter tops. The beds were comfortable and the location was perfect. The rooms were a little small but it wasn't too bad. I would not recommend this room if you plan to stay in the room the whole time! Overall... i enjoyed my stay and i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel -”
Reviews.Author: Bedbugg
Reviews.Content: Harrah's would not be my first choice of places to stay in Vegas, but since the three nights were comped I wasn't going to turn it down. Our room was located in the Carnival Tower rather than the newly renovated Mardi Gras Tower. The room was clean and without any problems. There were no stains on the carpet and the bathroom was very clean. The room had no odors, but the lighting was a bit dim. The beds are not the greatest. They are standard beds and in looking at the mattresses appeared to be either well kept or fairly new, neither had stains. These beds are not resort quality, but they will do after a long day walking and standing. The water spray on the shower was not the greatest and the pressure fluctuated quite a bit from toilet flushing or other users turning water on and off. The hotel provided the standard face soap, bath soap, combined shampoo and conditioner, body lotion and a shower cap. The room did have a free safe, a mini-bar with very over priced items, and a decent TV. Iron and ironing board included in the closet. The lower portion of the window does open for fresh air. The A/C-furnace does have a motion sensor that will shut off the power to the A/C-furnace when there is no movement detected in the room after a period of time. Our reservation was for a premium non-smoking room with a king sized bed. However, when we arrived at 4pm, the earliest you are supposed to be able to check-in, we were told that there were no non-smoking king rooms available in the premium section. We were given a choice of going to the Mardi Gras Tower to a king bed in a smoking room. We opted for 2 queen bed, non-smoking room in the Carnival Tower. The check-in clerk was very friendly and did say we could move the next day if we liked. She also said we would be getting a strip room view in the Carnival Tower. We were on the fifth floor. Our view was toward the strip looking out at a concrete wall with a very slight view of the very top of the Harrah's sign located out front of the hotel on the strip. So I guess you could say we had a "Strip" view. However, since our stay was not to hang out in the room, it really didn't matter. We did not eat at the hotel, but did gamble there. Understanding that you will always encounter smoke in a casino, I usually like to play were the hotel casinos have a good air exchange to minimize the smoke. In my opinion there was either little or no air exchange being maintained in the casino as it always seemed smoky. The staff in this hotel was very friendly and seemed to want to go out of their way to assist you. The parking garage is somewhat cramped, but we never failed to find a parking space up close to the hotel entrance. All in all we found this hotel to be adequate and the location can't be beat. You are so close to the Mirage, Venetian, Treasure Island, Flamingo and Caesars Palace. The Strip Tram is just a short walk to the back of the hotel and will take you to the MGM Grand or to the Sahara and all places in between. Just check for tram coupons in the magazines provided in the room for discounts on the tram rides. We did overhear other people checking in at rates of $250 for a Saturday and $200 for a Sunday night. That would be way too much to pay for these types of rooms. If you are going to pay those kinds of prices, stay at the Venetian or the Mirage.

Reviews.Title: “Great mid-week deal”
Reviews.Author: 4-ever-NY
Reviews.Content: Mon - Friday midweek stay at rock-bottom rates of $45 most of those nights. Stayed in newly renovated 14th floor room in Mardi Gras Tower -- gorgeous redo of room which I thought very spacious. Faced the pool as other posters have mentioned and also did hear the residual music from the outdoor bar but it seemed to subside at midnight (and I am a lousy sleeper so I would expect to be bothered!!!). Accommodation was a wonderful surprise and, though the rest of the hotel including the casino was exceedingly clean and cared-for, these areas do need updating. Ease of elevator service was good enough to be noticed since never had to wait for elevator to arrive as has often been the case in other hotels. Only issue I had was the coffee-shop type restaurant is waaaaaaay too small for a hotel of this size and lines for breakfast were unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: PODS1311
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Harrahs for the weekend of Dec 14-16, and we were very impressed with the hotel. It definatley exceeded our expectations. We arrived around 10 am Friday morning and had no wait checking in. We were provided a non-smoking room in the newly renovated tower which overlooked the pool. They warned us ahead of time that it would be loud till 2 am due to the Carnaval Court, that was fine with us. If you plan on going to bed before 2 am in Vegas, then I dont suggest even staying on the strip. The rooms were very clean, the beds were sooooooo comfortable and the bathroom even had a TV in it. ( my boyfriend loved that perk ) We requested a fridge for medical reasons and it arrived in our room only 5 minutes after us bringing our stuff up. It was nice that we didnt have to wait till 3pm to check in. The location is wonderful. I sayed at Flamingo in September and thought that location was good, well Harrahs is even better, short walk from many popular spots. Drink service was slow near the slots, seemed like the tables had better service, but that was the only downfall I seem to have noticed. We ate at Toby Keiths on Friday night, and enjoyed our food and beer very much. Service was a bit slow here as well. Took about 15 minutes just for a waitress to come and say she will be right with us. Other than drink service and very thin walls ( heard basically everything and I mean EVERYTHING from our neighbors ) we really enjoyed our stay here at Harrahs and would definatley do it again. Especially with the rooms comped, we excepted a much more average hotel, but were overall very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Danny_N_NC
Reviews.Content: We stayed Dec 3rd to Dec 7th. As everyone has said, the location was great, but we must have gotten the smallest room that I've ever stayed in anywhere. However, the bed was great and comfortable and it was big enough for the two of us not to get in each other's way. I also thought that the casino looked worn and the drinks were watered down. And we thought that the buffet was a little overpriced, but did get plenty of the $5 off coupons that they were handing out on the Carnival Court which helped out some. All in all, there wasn't anything wrong with the property, it just didn't WOW us, and with us having to pay full price, we probably won't stay here again. At least not for what we paid for 4 nights this time.

Reviews.Title: “Huge, Lots Of Walking To Get To Room”
Reviews.Author: LaurieSusan
Reviews.Content: Harrahs is an old property, but we were surprised to have a modern room with soft sheets and comfortable matteresses. Over all we were quite pleased. We were in 644 of a tower. This property has two towers and 900 rooms. There is lots of walking. We had a pleasant staff and enjoyed the magician show at the hotel. Maids pleasant. We had a 3rd person who they charged $30 per day for a roll a way. She said her bed was comfortable too. Window looked over the parking garage but could have been worse. Ate at the Cafe restaurant. Food expensive but well prepared and attractive. Casino was kept clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & value!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2585
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Vegas and last time we stayed at the Stratosphere so we wanted to be a bit closer towards the action this time. Harrah's was the best priced, centrally located hotel on the Strip. We arrived at Harrah's at 12:30am after a long flight to find out that there was no room for us in the basic room we booked. We got a free upgrade for the first night to a full-size suite. However, we had to get up at 10am the next morning in order to "check out" and check back in again to the room we originally booked. This was annoying since we just wanted to get some sleep! So, we stood in a ridiculously long check out line and got our new room. Well, after staying in a suite you just cannot go back to a regular room! The room just didn't have the same amenities and luxury that the suite did so we went back downstairs and upgraded and paid the difference. They probably upgrade in the hopes that other people will do this! The suite had 1.5 bathrooms, a king size bed, a living and dining room as well as a minibar. The bed was very comfortable with high quality linens. The bathrooms were well stocked with towels, shampoo, soaps, etc; Housekeeping was great and came everyday. The view was great, we faced the Mirage. The food at Harrah's was okay. We got room service late at night one night and it was a bit overpriced and of average quality. We frequented the McDonalds next door and the Starbucks in the lobby for breakfast! We didn't play too much in Harrah's because we found the slots to be very tight. Instead, we opted to use the free shuttle to the Rio and we also played at other casinos on the Strip. I didn't find their comps to be as good as some of the other casinos either. The pool area was average. We really had to wait around to get the chairs with the misters. They need more of those! The pool was very basic... it served it's purpose well in the heat! Also, there were always plenty of towels and waitresses offering drinks. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at Harrahs. We will stay there again if we can get another great price!

Reviews.Title: “awesome location!!”
Reviews.Author: loveyavegas
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at Harrah's late November. Received 2 free nights & paid for 2. Had a little trouble getting to hotel due to Gray Line Bus Shuttle sitting at airport waiting till the entire bus was filled before leaving. We were the first ones on the bus, waited a good 30 minutes & then of course (our luck) was the last one off the bus. Entire trip took over 60 minutes. Next time will probably pick different bus line. When we arrived at hotel, checkin was really quick (arrived Wed. night). Check in lady was very nice. We received what we requested, a room in Mardi Gras tower(which are newly renovated). The room was small but very clean. We were on 15th floor overlooking pool (which wasn't open & neither was hot tub) & overlooking Carnival Court. If you don't like loud music till 2 am, don't stay on this side. We didn't mind it. Were were rarely in the room at that time anyway. The beds were absolutely great. Lots of pillows & so comfy. We ate at Toby Keith's which was really good, the Buffet which was not worth the money & at their Rose deli which was very good. They have a piano bar that had karoke on some nights. That was fun. The actual casino was old looking & needs some improvements. Very watered down free drinks while playing. The casino was also very tight on slots, but we did ok on table games. The location is the best thing about it because it so centrally located. Overall would probably stay here again if receive free night again.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: zottDallas
Reviews.Content: I am a member of Total rewards and usually stay at Bally's but decided to give Harrah's a try. I really liked the central location and had a great time in the casino. I didn't get a renovated room, as they didn't have smoking rooms available. No concern, though. The room was showing a bit of age, nicks in the paint etc.. but overall it was fine. The bed was a little hard but I've heard the renovated rooms have new matresses. The staff was friendly, the comps are easy to use and they have a Starbuck's on site. I love the Total Rewards program! I always get two nights free and I always earn enough to cover the next day's breakfast. One sad note.. the airport check counter closed a few months ago. Overall, a great time...

Reviews.Title: “not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: erc
Reviews.Content: Booked 3 nights @ $49.00/night which is a great deal for a hotel on the strip. I had specifically requested a renovated room, king bed with a strip view away from Carnival court (pool side). At check-in we were given an older room on the 3rd floor with 2 queen beds on the noisy pool side. After some negotiating, we got a renovated room, strip view wth 2 queens as there were no king bed rooms available. The room was clean, nicely decorated and the beds/pillows/linens were very comfortable. The room had plasma tv's both in the sleeping area and bathroom. The view was great (room 1508). Only complaints: 1. We could hear all conversations/tv watching, etc in the next room. Luckily the people next door weren't in there room too often, or at the same time we were. 2. There was very little space for storage. We had to keep most of our items in our luggage...and we pack light! The mini bar takes up a huge amount of the cabinet.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: McGoo777
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's in Vegas for the first time, and it was great. we were there for sat thru wed, and had a great price. We arrived very early around 9am to the hotel and took a chance at getting a room early, the lady at the front desk was very nice, got us booked in and sent us over to someone who could pull some strings. The nest person to help us was great as well, she found us a great room with strip view, it was clean and smoke free. some people like to complain about little things, but everything was just fine. Had a great stay. They have a good Poker room with good management, dealers and tournaments. Great location, can;t beat it for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vacationgirl8
Reviews.Content: Everything about Harrahs was great!! The location, gambling, bars and entertainment. We really loved Carnival Court and all of the shopping around it. If you like country music the Toby Keith bar has great bands. The rooms are very spacious and service was great. I wouldn't stay anywhere else but here. For the price you are getting everything you need and more.

Reviews.Title: “Hooray for Harrahs”
Reviews.Author: Travity
Reviews.Content: Returned after a two night stay at Harrah's November 13-14, 2007. What the hotel lacks in ultra modern Vegas style, it makes up for in service, staff, and especially LOCATION!!! Love that it is across the street from The Forum Shops and Caesar's Palace - you can walk everywhere from here. In the middle of the action. We had a room on the 16th floor in the Mardi Gras Tower. The view was incredible looking out at Caesar's, Mirage, Treasure Island and beyond to the mountains. Spectacular. Could not have been better. The Mardi Gras Tower is nice because it is so close to being on the strip. Not a mega walk like so many hotels in Vegas these days. Granted, the room is small - okay for two, but I would not want to put more than that in it. But the amenities were nice. The maid service was excellent and room spotless. The staff could not have been any nicer. We were treated like high rollers. I would definitely return to Harrah's. If the price is right, don't hesitate. It is 10 to 1 better than Imperial Palace - so if you can get in that price range - definitely choose Harrah's over Imperial Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Mid-strip Hotel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: VENSIM
Reviews.Content: We recently enjoyed another great stay at Harrah's Las Vegas! Stayed here because of great deal thru Harrah's website and because of the fantastic location, which is right in the center of the strip. At check-in asked for a room in the renovated Madri Gras tower as suggested by other travelers. Only room available in that tower was on the side of the Carnival Court above the entertainment stage, and clerk warned it could be quite noisy at night until 2 am. She graciously said we could move the next day if it was not to our liking. The room was very nice though small. Beds were very comfortable and the plasma TV was great! Did not change rooms because our room (#421) was not noisy. It was very muted and did not bother us at all. This hotel is not really fancy but it is clean and comfortable. We really like its location on the strip and it is a great place to stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “ANOTHER GOOD STAY AT HARRAH'S”
Reviews.Author: lans98
Reviews.Content: Date Visited: - September 12-17, 2007 My stay at Harrah's was a very Good Girlfriend Trip. This was not my first stay, however it had been 3 years since my last stay. I found the rooms in the Mardi Gras Tower to be updated and very comfortable. The positives were: Rooms always cleaned very adequately, Check-in process very pleasant and efficient, all staff encountered from the Bell Captain, Front Desk, Restaurant, Boutiques, Rewards Station, Oyster Bar (my favorite-DELICIOUS), casino floor waitresses, housekeeping staff, Spa staff, (especially Louise, outside entertainment were FANTASTIC. My only complaint was the pool area which is in much need of updating, however since the Flamingo Las Vegas is in the same group with Harrah's we ended up going to their pool area which was GREAT once we found lounge chairs. The snacks at the pool were delicious. Needless to say we all were quite pleased with our five nights at Harrah's. If all services remain the same, I WILL BE BACK.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless at Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: merrit girl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's November 5 until the 9th. The package deal was throught Westjet. I had never stayed at Harrah's before so didn't know what to expect. Check in was not to bad but they lost our friends reservation so that took a while to sort it out. As I fiqured we got a room overlooking the roof of the casino pretty much a given. We went down in the morning and got switched to the Carnival tower on the 28 floor which was a improvement with a view of the City. It started to go bad on Wednesday morning when at six in the morning they started with either jack hammers or chipping hammers. It sounded like they were coming threw the floor. A call to the front desk resulted in denial and not very concerned. It again started at six the next day our friends and myself went to talk to the manager . He tried to be helpful offering us 30 dollars at first to go away and then upping it to fifty. Another hotel guest was in line also waiting to complain.He reassured us it would not start until 9 Friday morning. But right at six thirty it started again.Down we went again and he offered us 15 dollars to go away.Pretty bad.The hotel was very smokey and we were suppose to be on a non smoking floor and one morning there was a person standing outside the elevator smoking . The pluses were the rooms were nicely cleaned and the staff were very friendly.The the negatives out weighed the positives. I know the hotel is in the process of being sold so maybe that had an effect on things. In closing chose another hotel if you like to sleep in.They should have moved us to another room or a sister hotel.So beware of the reno's when you book this hotel. Also the pool had been closed the weather in Vegas was record breaking that week and when we asked the manager about why we were not told about the pool closure all he said was that it was posted on the internet.So no pool,smoky hotel and casino why would anyone want to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “LOUD renovations going on”
Reviews.Author: ChrisPA53
Reviews.Content: on check in our reservation had not been received. the staff were okay, finally got it straightened out and we were checked in to a room with no view what so ever - garage roof and the side of another building. we were moved the next day to a better room in the carnaval tower on the 28th floor with a great view of the city. the pool is closed for the season, a disappointment due to the record breaking temperatures while we were there. on Wednesday at 6:00 a.m. noises started from the floor above. the staff at the information desk new nothing about possible renovations and were not particularly helpful about it. she finally tracked down someone who confirmed my suspicions that renovations were taking place - nothing in the form of moving us or compensating us was offered. the next morning was even worse - a trip to see the manager on duty "Bryant" ended with us receiving a $50 voucher to use in the hotel, or a sister hotel but again no offer to move us or any indication this was going to continue for the remainder of our stay. Friday morning AGAIN at 6:00 (or shortly thereafter) the noise started - this isn't just an annoying bump in the night but full blown renovations with jack hammers, the screeching of nails being removed with pry bars, hammering, the works! another visit to the same manager resulted in a $15 voucher - because we had prepaid he said there was nothing they could do! the casino, although busy, is FULL of smoke and my clothing, myself and my friends all stunk because of it. They need to improve their venitlation significantly to change this. on the UP side, this hotel is well located, and the rooms are fairly nice. The cleaning staff were friendly and I liked that there was a security guard at the entrance to the elevators at night. I would not recommend staying here at least until the reno's are completed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: PennsylvaniaNancy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Harrah's Oct. 21 - 28, 2007. We've stayed at Harrah's properties in Atlantic City and Lake Tahoe, but never in Vegas. When we checked in (which was very fast....no line) we were given a junior suite. It was beautiful! HOWEVER, it was on the 3rd floor. When we looked out of the window (if you can call it that!) all we could see was a wall and some kind of pipes. In order to even see daylight, we had to look UP. It was like being in a cave! We slept there 1 night and I asked to be moved. (We had no idea that they were renovating to the extent that they are) Since they had no junior suites available, they just gave us a standard room on the 29th floor. I must say it was wonderful to be able to see outside, and to actually be able to tell where we were! So, getting past that, the beds at Harrah's are WONDERFUL! I'd love to have one that comfortable at home! The housekeeping staff did a GREAT job! The staff in the restaurant where we had our breakfast every morning was very nice. The location is perfect. You can easily walk to many other places. I'm sorry to say that we didn't get to eat at Toby Keith's restaurant, but it looked great! Two things that may be worth passing on are (1) the check-in desk that they say is at the airport by baggage claim is no longer in existance, and (2) Harrah's has a complimentary shuttle that will take you to any of the other Harrah properties (we didn't find this out until the day before we went home)........plus you can get a complimentary bus to Sam's Town (a great place to go). You just go out of the lobby doors and walk past valet and cross the driveway. We went over to Rio on the shuttle to check out their pool (since Harrah's was closed) . Las Vegas has changed so much since we were last there. It's much more crowded......just walking down the street was a challange at times. All in all, it was a pretty good time. I'm sure, when Harrah's gets all renovated, it will be a REALLY great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “They had to move us, but customer service was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoChris
Reviews.Content: We knew about the problems that Harrah's had been having before we went there, but were ensured we would have a room. When we checked in, we ended up having to move to Paris for one night, but would be able to check in the following morning. When asking if we would still have problems, they ensured us we would have priority check-in. Sure enough, when we returned the following morning, they not only accommodated us at 10:30 that morning, we we got a newly renovated room in the Mardi Gras tower. Room is on the small side, but very nice and clean. Could not hear anything in the hallway. Gave us extra towels as requested. Water pressure in shower was very good. There's even a TV in the bathroom!! Room had a safe and an iron, which are both plusses in my opinion. The sports book at Harrah's was probably my favorite on the strip. They have table games (blackjack, etc.) right inside the book, so you can gamble while watching the games. We only ate at the buffet, so I cannot account for the other restaurants. The buffet was really good for the price. A wide variety, and everything was good. I like how the casino was on the smaller side, so it was very easy to find your way around. The check-in staff was beyond nice, and I had absolutely no problems with them at all. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel in a town where you can do much much better”
Reviews.Author: fireballhill
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas has so many great, new, modern hotels there is really no good reason to get stuck in anything that doesn't measure up. This hotel clearly has fallen way, way behind the standards of modern Las Vegas and I just don't see any reason to stay here unless you are getting an incredible price and/or really need to be in this physical location (though there are better options nearby). It is on the Las Vegas monorail system, which is handy, and the hotel staff seems nice enough. For starters, this hotel has a tired physical plant that appears to date from the late 70's or early 80's. You're getting none of the excitement of modern Las Vegas, but you are getting the noise, smoke and jumble of a crowded, kitschy, inefficient casino and public spaces. I can't comment on the food because after checking in I spent as little time as possible in the hotel itself. I stayed in this hotel for a trade show. My room was unavailable due to construction (though I made the reservations 6 months in advance I wasn't notified until 48 hours before I left home to arrive here). I was put in another hotel for a night, then when I moved into Harrah's I had to wait in line for an hour to check in because they were still sending people away. They put me in a very grim room when I checked back in; and when I complained they finally moved me into a better room. The "better" room I got was a typical Vegas hotel room -- nice enough -- but suffered from extremely poor soundproofing. My first nite in the hotel I was awakened by the guests next door talking and watching tv (at normal volumes) until 3 in the morning...the next night I was awakened a 5:15 in the morning when a different set of guests rose early to catch a flight (which I knew since I could overhear every word they said). Wait, there's more: - horrible water pressure in the shower - bathroom sink doesn't drain - expensive, balky Internet service. I could go on, by why bother? There are so many great hotel options in Vegas you just shouldn't spend time thinking about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good for one night”
Reviews.Author: MacDave
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night in October. Hotel is close to everything. Room was of a high standard with good bedding, flatscreen tv in room and bathroom but I thought it was a little on the small side. I thought the outside noise was a bit too loud. Casino itself is a bit dingy and sad compared to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great - As usual”
Reviews.Author: realtor99
Reviews.Content: Arrived late Sunday afternoon, very short line at check in. The clerk who handled us was very pleasant. I asked her if she would give us a good room, she said "of course, she would try to get us a good view." When we arrived at the room, if only had a very limited view of the Mirage, but boy was the room fantastic. Absolutely huge, mini bar, large marble bathroom, coffee maker, very comfortable bed (except I wish the pillows were larger). Later when we were passing by check in again, this clerk had no one at her counter, so I went over and told her the room really had no view to speak of but that the room itself was great, more than we expected. She was surprised it had no view as her computer said it had a view of the Mirage. I told her it was a very limited view, and she offered to change our room for us, but we declined as we loved the room too much to move. The room was very quiet, never heard anything. It was cleaned very well each day as well. We did not order room service (however usually we do) so I do not know it that is still up to par. It always had been in the past. Check out was very quick as well. We always stay at Harrahs and it was quite a decision this time as now Harrahs owns so many prime properties in Vegas. When I called to make the reservations, even the man who helped me then was very pleasant and easy to deal with. I have come to the conclusion over the years that people treat you in the manner you are treating them. If you are pleasant to them, they will be in return. So all the people who fuss about everything, take note, you may get further if you act nice and pleasant and don't lay your misery on those who don't deserve it.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the deal for the location.”
Reviews.Author: BlondWidow
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Harrah's on our recent Vegas trip. (August 11 through August 18). Since we were staying for a week, I knew we had to be fairly budget conscious and I was thrilled when I happened upon a banner ad offering room rates for $59 a night for weeknights. It took me directly to Harrah's website where I quickly found a great deal for their center Strip location. Their site was easy to use, showed photos of the rooms, available dates, etc. They accepted a deposit and have a decent cancellation policy, so I figured if I found a better deal elsewhere, we had up until 72 hours prior to arrival to cancel the reservation and get a full refund. When we arrived at the airport, we headed straight over the the Harrah's check-in counter, which is awesome. You can check in right there and avoid lines at the hotels for any of Harrah's properties, except maybe Imperial Palace. It's generally quick and easy. We hit a little snag when trying to pay for the remainder of the week. I completely forgot about the security deposit required at check-in and, unfortunately, the credit card I had planned on using did not have enough credit limit left so, after some help from a patient employee, and a couple calls to American Express, we moved on with the process. It ended up being about a $1200 charge between the remainder of the balance due and the deposit, which we thought may be a little high. It turned out that the deposit was more than the cost of the room, but we were sort of over a barrel there. Anyway, we've always wanted to try that "tip the guy at the front desk for a better room" thing. And we did. And he gladly accepted and gave us a room that he said has a great Strip view. Let me start out by saying, I didn't have very high expectations of our room. Honestly, for $59 a night, I was only looking for a clean, comfortable place to sleep a few hours and shower and plan our day. Well, we got to the hotel, got up to our room and planned on waiting for the bellman to bring our luggage and then head out to find some poker. To my dismay, we walked into a room with a great view that was also a smoking room. Ick. When I originally booked, I specified non-smoking, but forgot to mention it to the guy at check-in, so that was my mistake. The bellman got there very quickly and we explained that we needed a non-smoking room and he called down to the front desk and then told us he was moving us to a room on a different floor with the same view. He was very helpful, speedy and friendly. The room we ended up in was pretty much what I expected, it was clean and not very large, but comfortable enough for the time we'd be spending in it. The only thing wrong was the bathtub had a slow drain, which later in the week turned out to be a clog that was cleared by housekeeping. We never even mentioned it as it wasn't that bad, just a bit slow. The view was great; we looked out at Mirage and got to watch the volcano from it. While at Harrah's we dined in their cafe restaurant where the food was pretty good. They had a decent selection, but we stuck mostly with sandwiches, etc. We ate lunch at Toby Keith's I Love This Bar once on a whim on the way to the monorail station at the back of Harrah's, and were truly impressed with the food. We'll probably eat there again. Generous portions and it was very tasty. We ordered room service and they sent up the wrong sandwich the first time and the second sandwich was still prepared incorrectly, so we called and they took it off the bill, but they came back up and demanded the first sandwich back. I guess they thought we were trying to pull a fast one or something. That person was really the only unpleasant one we encountered. I visited the pool almost everyday while my husband slept in, and while it was nothing special, it was cool and clean. It's located on the second floor, so you don't have to go traipsing through the casino to get to it. The drink service was pretty quick and they have a little shop (which I'm sure is common at pools in Vegas) for people like me who forgot the sunscreen. Most days there seemed to be plenty of chairs available, but I found it's best to get there early or you might have to wait a few minutes. Overall, I'd say Harrah's was a pretty good value. Their rooms are adequate for someone just looking for a place to keep their luggage, sleep, shower and make plans. Another plus for their location is the monorail station. You can get up and down the entire Strip using it and it's emissions-free! I would definitely stay at Harrah's again if I'm on a budget or a longer than usual trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location w/ great deals”
Reviews.Author: zdawgg24
Reviews.Content: this hotel was great for the price. it surely isnt a 5 star hotel but it was clean and had everything you could want in a casino in las vegas. the location was perfect. directly in the middle of the strip with the volcano of the mirage as our window view. go to harrahs.com and then hot deals to find the best price, but then call and make sure they have your reservation booked with the bed and smoking preference you want. the food was great and the buffet was exceptional. the only bad things about the hotel were the rooms didnt have any full length mirrors(my gf was not happy), at the front desk there is people trying to get you to attend some class and were very pushy, and last every dealer except one was very nice and this one was very rude even when i lost a couple of hundreds at the table. all in all the hotel was great and i will be back to the harrahs at some point

Reviews.Title: “Great choice on the strip”
Reviews.Author: TKitty
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a 6-night stay at Harrah's Las Vegas. We have stayed at the Monte Carlo, Mandalay Bay, Flamingo and Ballys in the past. I have to say that overall, for the price paid, this was our favorite hotel. What impressed us the most about Harrah's was how friendly and helpful the staff was throughout the hotel. From the moment we checked in to the time we left we never experienced a grumpy or indifferent employee. We stayed in an average room, and we certainly aren't high-rollers, but I felt like one all of the time. The room was cleaned promptly every morning and it even had a coffee pot! (I won't even go into how I dragged mine all the way from Wisconsin). We were in a room on the 19th floor, Carnival Tower, with a limited view of the strip. The room did a have a small bar/fridge that we purchased beer/pop from a couple of times. A bottle of beer was $5.00, which I feel is pretty reasonable when you are beat and don't feel like going out to get one. We did ask for a fridge for meds that I like to keep cold, which they brought and set up very quickly. We walked to a small store, right next to Battista's Hole in the Wall restaurant, a couple of times to buy beer, pop, and snacks. The elevators were quick and they had someone checking room keys at night. The pool was nothing fancy, as reported previously, but it was adequate for my needs. The thing I really liked about it was that I could be there quickly from the room, no wandering all over the the hotel to access it. There was a small bar and shop there which I never used. There are a number of restaurants to choose from, but other than going to the buffet for lunch one time we never used them. We had considered trying the Range Steakhouse, but ended up going to Morton's Steakhouse on Flamingo Road instead. (A great choice for a truly wonderful dinner). There were two Starbucks, one on the main level which was always very busy ,and one just up the escalators on the second floor which nobody seemed to notice so it was never busy. The casino was always active and the drink service was very good, especially early morning, which is my favorite time. We didn't win any money there but had a lot of fun playing the Goldfish and Quick Hit machines. We aren't table players so I can't comment on those. Actually, we lost money everywhere this time but even that didn't deter from a great trip. The only thing we would do different next time is to walk over to the Mirage to watch the football games, which my husband really likes to do. The sportsbook was very small and not too comfortable, so when we walked over to the Secret Garden we noticed the Mirage's was huge and very nice, but easy to get to from Harrah's. We didn't rent a car, we rarely do, and had an easy time using the Duece bus a lot. Maybe it was the time of year, September, but this was the first trip that using the Duece wasn't a huge pain in the you-know-what. The drivers were even friendly, maybe they are cleaning up their act?. In closing, we really liked Harrah's and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. Have fun if you go!

Reviews.Title: “simply the best”
Reviews.Author: piggin
Reviews.Content: have to say this is the best hotel i've stayed at in las vegas (if not the best USA hotel ), the decor and quality of the room and friendly helpful staff made it a very enjoyable stay (unlike mgm grand). the location almost in the centre of the strip makes it ideal with the great Toby Keith bar inside and the carnival courtyard just outside. if i ever travel back to vegas, this is where i'm heading!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: smartstart
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay at Harrah's. There were four of us and we had booked directly with the hotel online. We got in close to midnight on a Thursday and had requested two non-smoking connecting rooms. Hotel check in had a difficult time finding two rooms for us especially, in the same tower and close to each other. They reluctantly upgraded us to a two bedroom suite (normally used for higher rollers) for one night only and told us we had to be out of the room by 11AM. The next morning I called check in and requested 2 connecting, non-smoking rooms preferably, the renovated rooms. I guess plenty of people were checking out that day and they were able to accommodate us, but we had to wait until 2 PM until the rooms were cleaned and available. In the meantime, we had the bell desk retrieve and hold our luggage. The suite was quite spectacular. The bedrooms (1 King & 2 doubles) were connected by a spacious living room. Both bedrooms had good size bathrooms as well. The renovated rooms were nice as well especially, the flat screen TVs - One in the main room and the second in the bathroom. We did have to call the hotel to get the batteries changed on the remote and the lights in the bathroom reset. Both request were taken care of within 15 minutes. We had dinner and lunch at Flavor's buffet, which was standard. I would be wary of the Time Share People wandering the lobby. We were convinced to take a couple of hours out of the day to listen to what they had to offer in exchange for a free dinner (at Paris) and a couple of nights hotel stay. Well, it ended up being about 4 hours long and I would equate it to a similar experience of buying a car. You are only offered coffee, water, popcorn & banana muffins during the entire time. Once you are in there, it's difficult to walk out since they have you in a big room in the back . Had I known it was going to be like this, I would have passed. Other then that, I enjoyed my stay with Harrah's and would return.

Reviews.Title: “No Compliants”
Reviews.Author: travelinggurl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Carnival Tower with a view of the parking lot. Check in was easy and the rooms seemed fine. We asked for two double bed in a non smoking room. All non smoking were taken so we had a smoking floor. You could tell as it did smell like it, but not terrible. There is a set of 3 Wild Cherry $1 machines and I played on one for at least 2 hours and cashed out $300 to the good- woo hoo! We ate ate the Flavors Buffet one morning. Nothing to spectacular, but it did have a large variety on it. Overall good hotel with a great value (we had it for $45 a night),

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BudgetFrog
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel!!! From location right on the strip to standard of the room we were stoked! Got a brilliant deal from website - only $60 US/ night and asked upon booking for nicest room possible. Renovated room in Mardi Gras tower was lovely - best bed I have EVER slept on - SOOO comfortable and HUGE!!!! No veiw from room but werent in it long enough to care!!! Lovely clean room and bathroom. Staff helpful and friendly. Excellent that monorail stop is just outside door - pick up book of coupons BEFORE you buy your ticket and save! Coupon book at monorail station - good savings on lots of stuff. Recommend visit to Fremont St at night. Take monorail to Sahara then bus $1.25 to Fremont. Or share taxi if a few of you - dont walk though - its a long way (to walk) and not too safe apparently. But once on Fremont it is as light as the middle of the day because of all the lights and safe as. Eating and drinking down this end of Veags is DIRT cheap and yummy!!! Seriously - full meals for $4.99!!! and lots of cheap souvineer places here too. Must sees include view from Eiffel Tower at night and our absolute favourite was the Bellagio Fountains - impressive and FREE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best on the Strip - but a good value.”
Reviews.Author: sunsetlegend
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very nice - especially if you get into the newly remodeled rooms (flat screen tv's, comfy beds, etc.). make that request when making your reseravation and again upon check-in. it's inside the mardi gras tower. we got upgraded the first night to a suite, simple because we asked if they has anything else better avail. they were wiling to do it for one night! awesome. the gambling is okay. not alot of table games compared to some of the others, but there outdoor bar is great! Very fun, live music is spectacular and reasonable drink prices. the place is called Carnavale. You will get the best rates from Harrah's if you are a Total Rewards player. ask if they have a casino rate avail. we saved $35 a night simply because we were.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and The Bad About Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: Chattyaholic
Reviews.Content: I took my husband to Las Vegas for his 50th birthday. We flew out of Lansing, Michigan on Allegiant Air at 7:30 a.m. on Friday, September 14th and returned home at 6:30 a.m. on Monday the 17th. We stayed at Harrah's and I had made the reservation through the Allegiant airline as a package. Next time I would call the hotel directly, so I could make requests. The only requests I could make through the airline website when I booked was smoking or non, and 1 or 2 beds. We were able to check in about 9:00, and I asked about a newly renovated room but she said they would be noisy as the band below plays until 3:00 a.m. so we decided against that. I asked for a strip view but she had none available so that was disappointing. We had room #2854 in the Carnaval Tower with 2 queen beds and non-smoking. Nice room and the beds were extremely comfortable. We did have somewhat of a view, although not of the strip, but at least it wasn't the roofs of some other buildings. Nice to see the mountains in the distance. Unfortunately we had a connecting room. TRY TO AVOID THIS IF YOU DON'T WANT TO HEAR YOUR NEIGHBORS!! We never heard a sound from the opposite room, but the one with the connecting door you could hear every word they said and every sound they made. I use ear plugs at night so wasn't bothered, but my husband heard them. Also, the first night he heard what he thought to be a pimp and a "working girl" outside our room. He was "explaining" some things to her in great detail. Again, I had ear plugs in so heard nothing, thankfully. We didn't win anything in the casino. My husband thought the slots were pretty tight as usually you will win a few credits now and then, but these machines just took your money and didn't even say thank you. We went to Toby Keith's "I Love This Bar" a couple of times and enjoyed that, and both mornings we had the buffet breakfast for $14.99 each at Flavor's buffet. Very good selection of choices. They should have a restroom inside the restaurant though. You have to leave and go to the back wall on the casino to find one. Harrah's is one of the monorail stops and we took advantage of the $9 all day pass on Saturday and used the monorail several times to get from hotel to hotel. It was fun visiting different hotels and walking around. Most of them had something free to offer (volcano at the Mirage, fountain show at the Bellagio, etc.) and the lobbies were beautiful. If the price was right we would stay at Harrah's again, but NOT in a connecting room. And I would definitely want a view of the strip too.

Reviews.Title: “Busy fun location!”
Reviews.Author: ripsgirl032
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our stay from Sept. 11-15. When we arrived and checked in at the airport, we were told that there were no more king smoking rooms and that we would be upgraded to a suite for the first evening, but that we would have to change rooms in the morning. The suite was very beautiful #3155 in the Carnival Tower. We watched the volcano erupt from our room and it was just beautiful. We were told that we had to call to the front desk at 9 am - that is very early especially when you just got in town the night before. We were moved to #1126 in the Mardi Gras Tower - non-smoking but we were told that they would bring us ashtrays and would not be charged for smoking in our room. Very noisy room and we did not get our ashtrays for two days. I complained to the manager and was given a $50 credit to use towards our room. Hotel was very, very busy all the time and it was hard to find open machines. The machines were very tight with their winnings also. Carnival Court is my favorite place to visit during my stays in Vegas, I highly recommend going there for a drink. Josh is the best bartender there. Tip him well and he will do tricks for you!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: wambo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from Vegas and we stayed at Harrah's. It was the perfect hotel for the price for us. We did the check-in at the airport which was much better than standing in line at the hotel. It is in a great location, we asked for an upgraded room which was very nice and the bed was the most comfortable thing we ever slept in. Our room overlooked the pool and had flat screen T.V.'s in the bathroom and in the room but the 1st night we had a rowdy gruop next door which we could hear very well through the walls.. The bathroom was nice but a bit small. We enjoyed the pool for the little time we were out there but it was 104 degrees every day so you don't stay out too long. We ate at Toby Keith's and had the wings which I highly recommend. We also saw the Mac King show which was really funny and a nice break in the day ( he has 2 afternoon shows). The shuttle's are not worth the effort even though they're free. We would've waited an hour in the brutal heat for one to go to the Rio but we took a taxi instead and paid $15.00. All in all we had a very nice time and would go back but if you're looking for FANCY I would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location -- but not sound proof”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelersFour
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Las Vegas. We stayed two nights at the Paris Casino/Hotel (great room) before moving to Harrah's. The king-bed room we reserved was not available when we checked in so we took a room with two queens. We should have waited. The room was clean, but nothing special. We like to stay up late and sleep in, but we found this is not the hotel to do so! One morning voices from the next room woke us up. They were so loud/clear it sounded like they were standing at the foot of the bed! We could hear phones ring and toilets flush. We also found that the slots on the strip were very tight. Over four days, we never saw a machine pay off. We love Vegas so we still enjoyed ourselves, but will probably not stay at Harrah's again unless the rooms are free!

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs is the best!”
Reviews.Author: pattie62760
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at Harrahs aug.15-22 and it was FANTASTIC. We had a room in the Mardi Gras Tower overlooking the pool,and the room was outstanding. There was a flat screen tv and a small flat screen tv in the bathroom. Who would have ever thought a tv in the bathroom. The maid came in every morning and left whatever "extras" I requested.Everyone I came in contact with had a smile and a hello. This hotel is a prime location with shuttle pick ups for the Rio and Sams Town located in the rear. I have stayed at other Hotel's on the strip, this was my first stay at Harrahs and I will definitly stay there next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on strip but nothing fancy for hotel offerings”
Reviews.Author: Heidi S
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrahs for the price. September is convention month so there are no real "deals" to be found. Check in easy at 11pm on a Thursday however requested non-smoking room that was not available. Put us in smoking room for night and told us to check back the next day - nothing he could do (dissapointed). Room was in Mardi Gras tower (17th floor) but NOT renovated but not too bad smoky smell. Small view of strip but really how long are you in room for? Moved us next morning with a $30 voucher for restaurants for trouble. Newer room was much nicer - decor and beds. However, it was more noisy - glass not as thick and hallway noise much louder (could just be higher traffic?). Hotel staff generally ok. Conveniently located across from Forum shops, next to Venetian shops and not far from TI for show. Nice that it is a monorail stop. Not a huge hotel so easy to get from front to back. Ate at cafe - ok food - not overly reasonable. Ate at Buffet - really nice - $22.99 not a bad price for the quality of food and desserts. Did not gamble here but good selection of slots.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location”
Reviews.Author: TexCatBird
Reviews.Content: Extremely good location combined with large clean room in Carnival Tower made our Las Vegas trip a success. Stayed there 9/6/07 - 9/8/07 on the 6th floor with no view but we didn't care since we spent few waking hours there. Check in was a snap and free self-parking in covered garage were pluses. We paid $69 for the 1st night and $79 for the 2nd night on Internet Christmas in Summer package. Heard some whooping & hollering by some excited guests but didn't last long and hey...it's VEGAS. Paid $6 for a Bud Light at Toby Keith's bar which was more expensive than the mini-bar beer cost. Ate most meals elsewhere so cannot provide a review, except for breakfast which was enjoyed at the in-house Starbuck's. $5 per person all day Deuce bus pass was worth it. However, we were not overly impressed with the downtown light show. Bus stop was less than 1/2 block away. Overall we would recommend Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Julie123Lincoln_NE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's August 22-25. We arrived early in the morning and couldn't get a room yet, but the people that helped us both times for check in were very nice and helpful. We got in our room around 4:00 and it was a wonderful room. Loved everything about it esp. the t.v. in the bathroom. Everything was clean and the bed was the most comfortable I've slept in, loved the bedding too. Won a little in the casino (play only slots) and the drink service was great too. We've taken many trips to Vegas and stayed at different places each time. We have now decided Harrah's may be our only choice from now on, nice place to stay and a great location. We ate at the buffet almost every morning and the food was really good~looked forward to breakfast every day. We saw the comedian at O'Shea's while there~totally recommend this show too-it was very entertaining. I can't remember the guys name, but he was really funny! We rented a car for 2 of the days that we were in Vegas and I liked that, but with the monorail being right at Harrah's it's not something you'd need to do. Needless to say-we enjoyed our stay at Harrah's and look forward to a return trip soon!

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit, Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: 24fan
Reviews.Content: GF & I stayed at Harrah's 8/19 - 8/24, 2007 Arrival and checkin was smooth at 9:00 am. The desk clerk offered an upgrade to a Jr. Suite for $50 additional per day or a full suite for $100 additional per day. I declined and felt a standard room at our rate $45 per day was just fine. I asked for a renovated room and they accommodated. The clerk said the ONLY renovated rooms are in the Mardi Gras tower. So apparently Carnaval Tower is not renovated yet. Clerk asked if we wanted to be near the noise (Carnaval Court which is a fun bar between Harrah's and Imperial Palace) or away from the noise with a partial Strip View. We chose the strip view and had a view of Mirage and the Volcano, TI and part of the Venetian. The renovated room was great. Not overly large but all we needed was a bed and table. All new furniture and wall and floor coverings. Bathroom was big enough with a large enough counter for her stuff and mine. New flat screen TV in the room and a flat screen wall mounted TV in the bathroom. (ESPN while shaving every morning) Room had a new wall mounted safe and mini-bar. Didn’t use the mini-bar but the $5.00 per beer was no worse than what you would pay elsewhere in LV. Our room on our side of the hotel also had a little balcony. Doors opened and you could step outside. It was only about 18 inches or so deep but enough room to stand on and enjoy the view. Harrah's is mid-strip, across from Caeser's Palace, so very convenient to walk in either direction. Casino is very active and cocktail service was excellent during our stay. We ate one night at Toby Keith's I Love This Bar & Grill and enjoyed the food. BBQ chicken wings were great and a huge portion. There is a Starbucks across from TKs where we got coffee each morning and it is only a few steps from the pool. If you are contemplating Harrah’s be aware that the pool area is small. We never had a problem getting poolside chairs though they were mostly gone by 9:00 am. This was our second stay at Harrah’s and definitely would go back. Great location and good value

Reviews.Title: “First time at Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: NMIC
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at many places in Vegas through the years and Harrah's was great. Our room was in the Mardi Gras section and would compare to the room and bedding of the Golden Nugget downtown , just smaller. Bedding was top notch and room had a view of the strip. Location can't be beat, being right in the heart of the strip. Only cons: room was not hot but could have been a little cooler at night (it was 106 degrees outside) and there were absolutely no waitresses. Stayed in the casino the entire first day playing game tables or slots and was approached twice for cocktails. Harrah's had the least comp drinks offered of any casino we visited. But - would I stay there again? You bet! For me it's all about location, location, location and an extra compfy bed for the weary.

Reviews.Title: “Hooray for Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: Salsa6781
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that Harrah's was the best possible spot to stay on the strip for the price we paid (only $550 for 6 nights + round-trip airfare from Michigan!). Not only is it in the middle of the Las Vegas Strip, it's also a nice hotel. Very clean room and lobby. The employees were all very polite. It's only a 5 minute walk to the Venetian next door (make sure to eat at the Grand Luxe Cafe in the Venetian!). Pool was nice, nothing spectacular, but nice. There's also a hot tub and a little fountain with cold water to cool off from the Vegas heat. The Carnaval Court Bar is fun at night for a drink/dance.
