While the Harrah's is no Venetian or Bellagio, it's a great hotel with reasonable rates (besides, all we did we sleep and change in our room). If you want to save money and stay at a great location, stay at the Harrah's. Expect people to think you're staying at Paris when you say Harrah's :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for location and price”
Reviews.Author: 2infinity
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Harrah's for the first time this past week from Aug. 13th-17th. We had received offers through the Total Rewards program in the mail since using our player's card there May 2006, but those offers had expired by December 2006. So, my husband contacted Harrah's this past February and asked what kind of deal we could get, even if we couldn't get two mid-week nights free. They offered us the unbelieveable deal of $40 a night and we scooped it up! So the moral of the story is, it doesn't hurt to call the hotel for any unadvertised hot deals. Be sure to have your Total Rewards card number available if you have one. So, considering what we paid per night, understand that our expectations were quite simple. Upon check-in at 4 PM, we asked about getting a renovated room and were told none were left. The woman wasn't rude, just matter-of-fact about it. We didn't complain, but instead decided to check out the room to see if it was acceptable for what we'd paid. We were pleasantly surprised with our room. We stayed at 752 Carnaval Tower. It was a bit of a walk from the elevator and there wasn't a view (see photos) but we are healthy and don't much care about a view when we spend so little time in the room anyway. The hallways on our way to our room were pleasantly appointed, well-lit and the carpets very clean. And it was so quiet--surprising as the casino was hopping at all times we were there and we understood the hotel to be quite booked. No smoking allowed on this floor either, so the hallway was very fresh smelling. Our room was slightly smaller than a room we'd stayed in at the Aladdin a few years back but decently appointed. It appeared that the furniture was new (although older television with so-so reception and limited channels). The drapes and bedding appeared to be recently updated as well. The carpet was a bit older-looking but very clean. My feet were clean despite walking around on the carpet in my socks one morning. The entryway had a full-length mirror which I appreciated and the flooring there and in the smallish bathroom was marble. Appeared to be new. The bathroom had only one sink but was very clean and shower flowed well with good pressure that you can adjust (waterpik-type nozzle). No tv in this room--but again, I didn't expect to get the best room in the place at the rate we paid. And according to other reviews I've read, we could have gotten much worse. Nothing super-fancy, but pleasantly clean and comfortable. We couldn't hear any noises outside the room, despite our room overlooking the valet/parking garage area which was very busy at times. Speaking of comfortable, the bed was heavenly. I always rave about the Sheraton beds and that nothing can compare, but this room's king-size bed was absolutely wonderful!! Comforter and sheets were immaculate. Our only suggestion about this bed would be to provide larger pillows. These were the tiniest bed pillows I've ever seen. There were three, but I would suggest bringing your own comfy pillow if you are a pillow connoisseur as my husband is. (It didn't bother me after the first night.) Since I prefer to hang most of our clothing-- I ran out of hangers in our room's armoire. We contacted housekeeping and they promptly (within 15 minutes) arrived with an assortment of additional hangers. I was very happy with housekeeping service throughout our stay (we tipped $20 at beginning of vacation and another $10 at end of vacation). As for the rest of Harrah's...we mostly played the slots. We had fun on the Wheel of Fortune quarter slots but didn't win anything. A lady celebrating her 70th birthday there with her extended family did win big two slot machines away from me after only about 5 minutes of play. She won 10,000 credits or $2,500 on the Tabasco quarter slot machine--it's largest payout. It was very exciting to watch someone win and be so surprised/thrilled. I did get the feeling that there wouldn't be any other big winners that week in that section of Harrah's there--but who knows?? I am very nervous about the gaming tables, but since it was our third time in Vegas I felt compelled to at least make the attempt to learn how to play one of the card games. We visited the Party Pit section at Harrah's and sat down at an empty blackjack table with a friendly-looking dealer. My husband and I each purchased $100 in chips and got started. She was very helpful, explaining the basics of the game and I believe that it would have been a pleasant experience had she stayed. However, a few minutes into playing she left and was replaced by a fast-talking smooth kind of dealer who intimidated me. In hindsight, I realize I should have stood up and taken my chips elsewhere but I knew my husband was having fun learning how to play and I didn't want to wimp out. However, minutes later I was feeling overwhelmed and miserable. Every time I wanted to hit or stay he'd intimate that "the book" says to do otherwise and get me to go against my gut feeling (again, this was my fault I know), quickly ridding my of most of the chips. I ended up giving the last $20 chips to my husband which he lost as well a bit later. (He seemed pretty easy-going about it, not upset like me.) Did I have fun? Not really. Would I do it again?? Maybe. Next time I would be more confident to go with my gut feeling and to leave when I don't feel comfortable with the dealer or the table. So it was a good lesson, although a bit expensive. (I did win at penny slots twice during the week which made up for the loss--that helps a bit too!!) We purchased coffee at the Starbucks in Harrah's a few times. The cheese danish and croissants were fresh and tasty. Expect a line in the AM and expect to pay through the nose for your java. Not a big deal to us, as we'd saved so much on our room (and airfare). As for the Flavors buffet, we used our comp points that last morning for $8 of our meal and used a buy one/get one free coupon for the rest (received the coupon while out strolling one day). I believe we were at the lunch buffet ($16.99). Good selection of food. Nice carving section especially. I didn't feel poorly a few hours later as some other buffets in Vegas have done to me in the past. Show at Harrah's that we have enjoyed each of our three trips to Las Vegas is The Improv. A reasonably priced evening for sure. I believe it was about $70 for the two of us. All the comedians we've seen there have been very good, some outright side-splitting funny. We didn't take advantage of the Mac King show in the PM, which are the tickets we were offered free (except you'll each have to purchase a drink for $9.95). Heard that it's a family friendly funny show that's at 1 pM and 3PM. We were always busy at those times and didn't get a chance to go. Well, I hope that my review is helpful. I would stay at Harrah's again (especially for the rate we paid!) for it's lexcellent mid-strip location, "looser " slots and decent accommodations. We also saw Mystere, Danny Gans and Vinnie Favorito during our stay, all within a few minutes walking distance from our hotel. We also really enjoyed the Margaritaville just south of Harrah's and Flamingo's penny slots. (Another Total Rewards member casino). We dined at The Treasure Island Steakhouse restaurant the evening we saw Mystere, incredible food (at an incredibly high price) but our one splurge meal of our trip--very worth it. Only two minor complaints--a bit smoky in casino at slot machines at times (Flamingo's is an excellent alternative if you are very sensitive to that) and pillows very small.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved Harrah's!!!!”
Reviews.Author: vacationdreamer11
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Harrah's about 3 in the morning. It was a late flight, but we had prebooked. We were with one other couple checking in and they had told us that they were "SOLD OUT!" I couldnt believe it!! BUT, they had to place us in a room because we had pre-paid. SO, they gave us the Presidental Suite. I thought that was very nice of them. They also gave us 2 thirty dollar vouchers to use anywhere in the hotel restaurants, shops, casino.... They also gave us some free coupons for the Mac King comedy show. ( that was really funny) We loved our hotel room, Everything was very clean, organized, and up to date. It was almost like it was brand new. We would suggest Harrahs to anyone. It's a little less expensive than some of the other hotels right near by, plus it is so close to everything. We also enjoyed the buffetts. The food was excellent! I would stay here again, no questions. Have fun and good Luck!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: We4travelers
Reviews.Content: My husband & I recently returned from a stay at Harrah's. We chose the hotel based upon the location of the hotel and were very happy with our choice! Check-in was quick. Our room in the Mardi Gras Tower was recently remodeled and was very nice. Although the balcony overlooked both the pool and the Carnival Court, we were not at all bothered by the music that played late into the evening - the patio door blocked most of the noise and I enjoyed listening to the music from up in the room. The air conditioning was on a sensor so did shut off when there was no movement (at night too) but we just turned it way down when we went out for the evening and it stayed cool enough all night. The location of this hotel can't be beat - it's right in the heart of the strip. It's easy to walk to almost all of the hotels which was great as the Deuce buses get caught up in traffic most evenings and can run very slow. We travel to Las Vegas a couple of times a year and have decided to make Harrah's our hotel of choice for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Fair Price......Fun!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ping Golf
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrah's July 20-24th. Was put in room 619 in the old tower. The room had recently be renovated with new furnishings, Flat Panel TV (room and bathroom). Overlooked the pool which is on the small side which was always full of people. The bathrooms are on the small side. Others have complained about the noise. The noise did not come from the walls but rather from the doors. The gap in the doors allowed light to come through, so you did hear people in the hallways.....but hey, after a few cocktails during the evening, I never heard the noise at night! :-) The Dueling Piano Bar is a blast, spent many hours here......The outdoor patio bar with live band was fun. Watching people, having a cold drink, participating in the fun made this bar a whole lot of fun. The food choices are average with what you can find in some of the smaller/older vegas hotels. It's sufficent, however if you want to get dressed up and go out for a nice dinner, I would surely go elsewhere. Would I stay here again? Yes, without question.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Donna_&_David
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 7 nights 12th July-19th July at Harrah's and it was just wonderful. We stayed in the Mardi Gras Tower on the 9th floor with a room overlooking the pool. The room was lovely with tv in bedroom and bathroom (not that you needed it, but was an added extra). The room was kept very clean and there were plenty of clean towels and toiletries. Location is FANTASTIC, right in the middle of strip, across the road from Caesars Palace and with all the major hotels on your doorstep. The best buffet dinner we had was at the RIO, think it was $24. It was the biggest buffet I had ever seen. Hotel has free shuttle to several hotels, including the RIO. People complain on their reviews about not getting a sun lounger. If your up early enough 9am, you will definately get one. But the beds were becoming vacant quite often as the weather was way too hot to sunbath. That was my only moan about the entire trip, the hot weather. Would I stay at Harrah's again. MOST DEFINATELY. We have stayed at MGM before which is way more superior than Harrah's but then you pay the price for it. The thing is, you can't please everyone. There is also an airport shuttle to and from the hotel for $6.00. If you miss it a taxi costs around $15-$20. TIP: When you go to check in ask nicely if there is any free room upgrades. We did and got one so its worth asking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel on the Strip at a Moderate Price”
Reviews.Author: llg328i
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon. Requested a strip view room in the new Carnival Tower at check in. Room was large and CLEAN. Harrah's is located in a great spot on the strip - close walk to Ceasar's, Mirage, and the Venetian. Great Piano Bar- very entertaining. Also, be sure to stop in and see the bartenders at Toby Keith's I Love this Bar- they are great and the food there is AMAZING- also not pricey. I thought the buffet was a little overpriced at breakfast- but just walk next door to Imperial Palace and get a great breakfast for $8.99- best darn omelette station I've ever had! If you want to gamble- I wouldn't do it at Harrah's, nothing paid well there- including the tables. Otherwise- its a great place to stay especially for the money you save!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Great Location”
Reviews.Author: waakas
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the rooms. The rooms were very clean and remodeled. I liked that they had a plasma tv in bedroom and a small flat screen tv in the bathroom, very classy. I do have one complaint though the swimming pool is older and their were not very many lounge chairs available that were free. We had to rent a couple of chairs because that was all they had available! Overall our stay was very nice and it was the first time that we have stayed on the strip! Very convenient to all the casinos on the strip loved that

Reviews.Title: “ghetto room”
Reviews.Author: reefmermaid2b
Reviews.Content: On Saturday July 14 my husband and I stayed in room C1818. We were extremely disappointed and displeased to find the room was very worn out. The carpet was tattered and unraveled. There was a 2" hole in the bathroom door, and the exit door has holes from where the security latch appeared to have been pulled out of the door & door jam. The price we paid was ridiculous for such a shabby, shoddy accommodation. We checked in about 2:00PM and rushed off to our sons wedding. When we finally got in the room for the first time at 11:00PM where we found the toilet was plugged. The maintenance man was prompt, but the situation and our stay was very unpleasant. Please advise me on how to email the photos I took of the carpet and the holes in the doors you can see for yourself. It’s unfortunate that the inferior, poor, substandard room marred the memory of such a happy wedding day. I will be sure to tell everyone I know about our bad experience at Harrah’s.

Reviews.Title: “Party Place!!”
Reviews.Author: cory_sarles
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during Spring Break 2007. What a blast! My husband and I love to travel to Las Vegas....but have never had such a great time. Harrahs was awesome. We got one of the newly remodelded rooms....(ask at check in) and it was very nice. The bathroom was a little small. But the room overall was nice and clean. The hotel is very centrally located to everything on the strip. We loved the Outside Carnival Bar where you can sit and relax and drink beer and watch people. The Dueling Piano Bar is the best place to hang out on a Sunday night in Las Vegas. Show up around 10pm and you will stay until the wee hours. It is always a great show. I would definitely stay at Harrahs again.....its a good place for people looking for a party central place to stay and play.

Reviews.Title: “girls week at Harrahs”
Reviews.Author: AbraSiouxFalls_SD
Reviews.Content: Rooms at Harrah's were very nice... we stayed in the Mardi Gras tower, which is the older tower, but our rooms were renovated with nice flat screen tvs- even 1 in the bathroom. They allowed us to check in early and got all our rooms on the same floor and close by. We had a huge group of girls, so we tended to get a little loud at times and we were warned by security several times, which was upsetting because it is Las Vegas- the city that never sleeps. Most of the dealers in the casino were very helpful to a group of girls who were mostly first time gamblers. they helped explain rules and etiquette in a friendly, not intmidating manner. One dealer, who was at the Roulette table was very friendly and was our favorite one... his name was Mark or Marcus, not sure. Our favorite part, where we spent most of our time, was at the pool. Even though it's not a huge party scene, it is a nice pool with very nice lifeguards. Even the food and drink service at the pool was quick and very tasty. Derek the lifeguard was very friendly and helpful. He was always getting us dry towels, or whatever else we needed to enjoy our pool experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel for a low price”
Reviews.Author: sta129
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and centrally located on the srtip. If you are looking for a room at a reasonable price (we paid $260 for 3 nights Wed-Th-Fri) this is the place. The monorail stops at the hotel, which is a plus. If you are looking for a resort, this is not for you. The pool was nothing special. No landscaping, just cement and a couple of cabannas and trees. If you are looking to relax poolside, this is not the place. The only other drawback is the hotel is located next to a bar that plays LOUD music at night. Bring a sound machine! There is no real conceirge, just a box office. The woman at the desk did not know anything. Don't count on the hotel to recommend a reputable tour company. The casino staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Value, but Just OK”
Reviews.Author: flyingjay99
Reviews.Content: Harrahs was a good value, but only so-so as a hotel. The rooms were not so nice and the casino was less than exciting. A good place to stay for a good value and then go out to the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: VizziOne
Reviews.Content: Must book with the hotel web site under HOT DEALS! This saved me about 30% . HOT DEALS changes every day be ready to act with the right price.Stay Here eat everywere else.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice”
Reviews.Author: puokgirl
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a graduation/birthday trip to Vegas. We picked Harrah's because they offered $25 food/beverage certificate, 2-for-1 entry to their comedy show, and free admission to the spa. We also chose this hotel because of its center-strip location, and easy access to the monorail. Check-in was super smooth and easy. We were able to choose between two rooms in the Carnival tower, so I said "whichever is nicer". We ended up in room 644. It didn't have a view of the strip, but it was very clean (no mold or other funk) with plenty of towels. The only thing it was lacking was a fridge, but that wasn't a major problem for us. After 9PM you can only use one set of elevators, and you must show your key card to the security guard. The first night it was a little annoying because I didn't know where the proper elevators were, but after that it was OK. I appreciated this extra security feature. We didn't get to use the pool because our days were completely packed. By the time we got back to the hotel the pool was closed. Later we found out that it closed at 7PM every day. I thought it was a little weird that it closed so early, but since I didn't have time to use it, it ended up not being an issue. Checkout was a breeze as well. All room charges were fully explained and all of the people I talked to were extremely polite. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to just about anyone because of its location, the cleanliness of my room, and the professionalism of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: roberts1892
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at Harrah's from 10th-17th June. Location can't be beat right opposite Caesars and near Mirage, TI, Venetian etc. Asked for one of the renovated rooms overlooking the pool (1231) and very helpful check-in lady obliged. Room very clean with safe and 32 inch LCD tv. No problems with noise and by booking direct we pid less than $700 for the week. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Locaion and Best hotel”
Reviews.Author: tata3401
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Harrah's on June 6th for our first trip to vegas. And we were surprised by the location. It's right in the middle of the street. All actions are barly mintues away. We got the room for just $55/night from hotel website directly. Check in was quick. And when we went to room, room was bit small compare to other hotel but was very good and clean. 30" plasma TV was ceter of attrection in the room. Casino in the hotel was very big and great after midnight play as we don't have worry about walking on the street after dark. We played to other casino till 11.30pm and then walked to hotel to play for another couple of hours. As this was my first trip, I read the forum and people's warning not to walk alone in the dark on the vegas street but honestly, we were on the strip and I never felt danger walking even at 3am as it is like a day traffic at hat time even on wednesday. Well, we play safe. And always come to hotel casino after before midnight. Next morning, we had a issue with room. No hot water in the shower or any tab. So I was little disappointed. I called the room maintenance. But guy showed up after almost 45 mintues. By the time, I already took my shower with almost cold water. When we checked out, lady asked me about my stay experience and I told her, it was not that great just ok. And she asked my why just ok? I told her my shower experience. And totally surprise, when she gave me my final bill, she gave me whole room credit. Which is totally surprised as I never asked for one or intented one in our coversation. Great respect for customers. Well, it is the best location hotel under $70 per night if you get it. Free valet car parking, free drinks when you play and big casino. You can't go wrong if you get the room under $60. More than that I would go with other as I have seen deal for $80 for Monte Carlo. But at this price, it is definetly come back experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisy...”
Reviews.Author: love2traveltogether
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrahs from June 9th-June 11th. The location of the hotel is great, very centrally located. The rooms are very nice, updated and clean. The Cafe restaurant is great for breakfast. However, the walls seem to be made out of paper because we were kept up all night with noise in the hallway, noise from the rooms above and to the sides of us. It was extremely frustrating to be woken up all night long. We have been to Vegas numerous times and this is the first hotel that we do not plan to revisit. If you plan to be up all night, then Harrahs is a good place to stay but if you need to get any amount of sleep then try elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel! Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Huskies04
Reviews.Content: The place is very, very average by Vegas standards. It is in a great location though.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's-Great Location, a little beat-up--Brace yourself for NOISE!”
Reviews.Author: jaynsummer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrah's on 5/31-6/2/07. Room was wonderful, a little above average than most. AWESOME location--direclty across the street from Ceasar's Palace and the Forum Shops. What KILLED this place for me was that at 1:00 a.m. EVERY NIGHT, an outdoor nightclub started booming and carrying on. I was on the 11th floor, and you could hear the lyrics and the bass noise was felt in our pillows. It kept us up for hours both nights, despite our complaining, the front desk told us that "it was a nightly occurance" and in the Mardi Gras tower, we're we were staying, it was normal AND THAT THEY TRY TO BOOK YOUNGER FOLKS in that tower, and they don't seem to mind". We're in our late 30s, and would NEVER EVER stay here again due to the noise. BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location!”
Reviews.Author: Tamone1
Reviews.Content: We've been to Vegas several times now and have chosen a different hotel on each occasion, this time it was Harrah's. First and foremost, the location of this hotel on the 'strip' is prime! The hotel itself isn't the best but we had really nothing to complain about except for the lighting in the bathroom. For the price we paid it was indeed a good deal. Room was clean, bed was extremely comfortable, room safe, fridge stocked with stuff (but don't dare buy any....too expensive). As mentioned our only complaint was the lighting in the bathroom, it was minimal and made getting ready a challenge. Thank god I don't really wear makeup since I couldn't see to apply it if I did! Staff were courteous and offered us the possible opportunity to switch rooms should we feel necessary (our room was intended for handicapped patrons). Casino offers a variety of table games & slot machines. Daily poker tournaments if that's your game but bring a sweater since the room is cold!! We cannot comment on the restaurants available within Harrah's since we chose to eat elsewhere so we'll leave that risk up to you to find out. Pool is very basic and plain but serves the purpose of getting refreshed and taking a break from the Vegas heat! Overall we were quite happy and indeed would return if the price is right. One thing we would also like to pass along, if you are planning to take in a show or two look into buying tickets at 'Tix4tonight' as they offer a variety of shows at a discounted price. On closing I must ask, why is it that what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas.....why didn't the nasty cold I picked up stay there too!!

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat.”
Reviews.Author: BrokenAlice
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrah's for the first time May 16-18th, 2007. The location can't be beat thanks to the proximity to neighboring properties, easy access to bus stops and the monorail to go everywhere else. I was given room 2252 in the Carnival tower and was able to have the room keys before 11am. The front desk manager was also kind enough to grant a request for a late check out at 1pm. The room had a wall-safe and coffee maker. Bed was comfortable and never had a problem with the air conditioning - plesant at all times of day/night. The view was of the rear of the property facing IP. Not very pretty during the day but the night-time view was nice. My only complaint would be that it felt very, very far from the elevator and ice/snack/soda machine room. It was down a very long hallway and around a corner. After a long day of walking the Strip it feels like walking another city block to get to the room. I will make it a point to ask for a room closer to the elevator next time. Casino was fun but a little confusing to navigate at times. Even though it's a small casino by compairson to other mega resorts, it's easy to get lost among all those slot machines trying to find the Strip exits. Beverage service was mediochre. I had the best service when playing near the "Party Pit". Other times the waitresses were few and far between. You can get $5 off coupons for the buffet all over the place. I had the buffet for breakfast and it was standard. I didn't eat at any of their other facilities, but I've heard good things. I also did not use the pool. All in all I was very pleased and I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay At Harrah's!!”
Reviews.Author: StephM520
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Harrah's Hotel and Casino from May 18 - May 22 for our Anniversary, and we are sure happy that we did. The hotel is in a great location. They are in the process of renovating the rooms, and we were luck enough to get put in a newly renovated room. The rooms were spacious and had two plasma screen TV's. One was in the bathroom, which my husband loved!! Check in was really smooth and the staff was great. There were quite a few restaurants to chose from and they were all really good as well. We really liked Flavors Buffet because they had so many things to choose from. I would highly recommend staying at Harrah's and we plan on staying there the next time we visit Las Vegas. On top of everything, I won for the first time ever playing Let It Ride at Harrah's!

Reviews.Title: “Always good at Harrah's!”
Reviews.Author: Geordietravellers
Reviews.Content: Went to Harrah's originally in 2000, and we went back there this Easter, we got a fantastic deal by signing up to the guest book, was e-mailed a special offer and we paid ~£320 for 7 nights! When we got there I tried the charm offensive to see if I could get upgraded! The receptionist was fantastic & offered us either a strip view (usually $20 a night extra) or a newly refurbished room - asked his advice & took the new room & we weren't let down! The rooms are not the biggest in Vegas (but they are not tiny either!!), but the quality was certainly there, they have done a great job upgrading the rooms, the beds were huge (as always!) very comfortable, excellent pillows, and good quality bedding, just what you want (& need) after walking for miles up & down the strip! There is a large plasma screen in the main room, as well as a smaller one in the bathroom - although we didn't feel the need to use this one! The bathroom was well equipped, a good range of smellies provided, however the towels are a little on the small side, but there was plenty of them. The 'Flavors' buffet in Harrah's was always our favorite (we've been to Vegas 5 times now) & I'm pleased to say the quality (& quantity) remain as impressive as ever! They bake the best biscuits in Las Vegas period! (I love them!) Value for money & location I think Harrah's is the best on the strip! We've stayed at the following in the last 7 years: The Venetian, Ceasars Palace, The Flamingo, Golden Nugget (twice), Harrah's (twice), & the Barbary Coast (now Bills) so we've a fair range of hotels to compare against! You'll not go wrong picking to stay at Harrah's - honest!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WAReviewer
Reviews.Content: We checked in at the airport around 11AM on a Thursday. I requested a renovated room and was told they could assign one, but I would have to pick up the keys at the hotel. The room was ready when we arrived, but I don't know that it was a renovated room. I was expecting flat screen TV's, etc. and this room was just standard. Regardless, the room was clean and perfectly fine (Mardi Gras Tower 8th floor), so I didn't complain. Our friends were staying across the street at the Mirage, so we spent most of our time over there. We did have dinner at Penazzi and I wouldn't recommend it. The food and service were just OK. We tried to charge the meal to our room, but were told we'd have to have the little slip with our room number on it. I didn't have that with me at the time, so we just paid for the meal. The Starbucks in the lobby was convenient as was the McDonalds right next door. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just So So”
Reviews.Author: cmarie5
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for lots of glitz and glam, this hotel isn't for you. Their average room is just that....very average. The lobby isn't all that impressive, no seating to people watch. The casino is smokier than many, probably because of it's age. Everyone was very friendly and the place was clean. The location is pretty good on the strip, close to shopping. If you're on a budget, this might be a good choice but if you can spend a little more, I'd say go for it.

Reviews.Title: “HoHum Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: OhioStateFan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed @ Harrah's over Mother's Day weekend 2007. We usually travel to Vegas about once a year and like to stay on "The Strip". This hotel caught our eye do to the price and location. It's right in the heart of the action and it's an easy walk to the Mirage, Caesars, Flamingo and many others. It's also very close to Jimmy Buffets, which is one of our favorite hangouts. We aren't bigtime gamblers. Our time is spent drinking a few beers, hanging by the pool and enjoying our friends company. This doesn't mean we don't gamble but it's just not our #1 priority. This is a little info regarding the hotel: We arrived @ the hotel @ 9:00 a.m. on a Friday and was pleasantly surprised that our room was ready along with rooms for the other two couples that came with us. No extra charge for arriving early and our bedding requests were met. Our room was on the 11th floor in the Mardi Gras Tower. Quick elevator service and the hotel hallways and rooms all seemed very clean. Carpets appeared updated and plush. Our room was adequate. Nothing special but it seemed rather dark. Open the blinds and what a view (NOT!). Hello rooftop AC ducts and some other building that I have no idea what it was. Oh Well! who the heck cares about the view? We don't use our room for picture taking. This is a place to lay our heads and feel safe in doing so. This was never an issue. We took advantage of the free safe but didn't use the mini bar. If you don't want to be charged for it don't even look at it. Bed was comfy. Showers were hot and TV worked. Channel selection was weak but again...who comes to Vegas to watch tv? Head down to the pool and just realize this isn't the Hard Rock or Caesars Palace. It's just an average pool with a few cabanas and 2 sun decks. The pool bar was expensive but I'll tell you a little secret......there is a liquor store right next door to the hotel. Just head outside towards the strip to where the bands perform and take the walk around the shops and there it sits. You can buy beer, liquor and snacks and it will save you a ton of money. When you walk outside towards the strip you want to head left towards Imperial Palace. If you go right towards The Wynn you will not find a store for atleast a mile. If you like to hang out and hear some decent entertainment head over to the pavilion bar. This is a cool little spot with awesome bartenders and local acts that are aware that they aren't ever going to be on Billboard's Hot 100. You can get within touching distance of them. They are very crowd friendly and often speak to the patrons asking for suggestions or requests. Get there early on Friday or Saturday nights and you'll avoid the cover charge that comes later in the evening. The casino floor is very large and a bit Old School. Harrah's looks to cater towards a slightly older crowd but does have a cool gaming area called the "Party Pit". This is where we played and it isn't because we think we are cool. The dealers on these tables are there to have a good time and help you succeed. In my experience, losing money to a friendly dealer is always more pleasurable than losing it to some stiff. If you fall within this line try the Party Pit. We didn't win much but we had a great time. Overall, we thought Harrah's was a great value. You have a lot of choices in Vegas but if you just want a nice place to chill out and relax then Harrah's will be perfect. If you want pampered and need a young hip scene then this place probably isn't for you. We'd certainly stay here again. Happy Travels.

Reviews.Title: “No Total Rewards for us!”
Reviews.Author: evuavnu
Reviews.Content: We made our reservations for a room with a king bed in January of this year. We arrived on the evening of April 30. No king bedrooms were available. We took a room with two queen beds, thinking we might change rooms in the morning. We decided not too, as the room we had was quiet. I imagine if we had had a large sum in our Total Rewards, we might have received the room we originally reserved. At lunch time, the next day we made our way to the buffet at Harrah's. They wanted to seat us in a cramped noisy area. I asked for our money back twice, as I wanted to eat without much hubbub. They took us back to the Total Rewards area, because they did not want to refund us our money. It was very nice in that particular dining room. However, I think that we should be able to sit there even if we don't belong to the diamond or platinum groups. We should be able to eat there simply because we did Harrah's a favor by reserving a room in their hotel. Also, we live/work in a relatively smoke free environment. The fragrance of cigarette smoke was hard to take at Harrah's. We visited old Las Vegas and Laughlin. We like these areas much better than the strip.

Reviews.Title: “OK in LV”
Reviews.Author: R0adTrip
Reviews.Content: Harrah’s is a low-end strip hotel, did get somewhat of a room I initially requested. Room was very dark, needed better lighting, I had to iron my clothes in the bathroom since the lighting was so poor, however, the room was generally clean. What was odd was that it was a room with two king beds, one of the beds covered a wall outlet and to line up the beds in the room I guess the maid service thought it was okay to unplug a lamp, the internet connection and the clock. They also have an annoying internet TV system where it has to load a menu and you select a channel and if you want to change it has to go back to the menu screen (you have to wait until it loads again) to watch another channel. The employees were helpful and kind. I would prefer to stay at a higher end strip hotel during the off-season for the same rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place top stay if you don't mind your belongings stolen.”
Reviews.Author: Vegamaniac
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed there last week and had his ID, cash and credit cards stolen out of his room while he was sleeping. It is apparently a hotel employee as some of the items were recoverd in a linen closet. Stay there at your own peril!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: KellyBNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights the end of April, and were not sure what to expect due to some of the negative reviews. We checked in 8pm on Saturday night, were given a handicapped room on the 4th floor of the Carnaval Tower. We didnt ask for a handicapped room but it was nice, very spacious especially the bathroom. The room was clean, comfortable, the air-conditioning was good and the water pressure wasnt bad either. Maid service was prompt, always had clean fresh towels and the bed was comfortable. We LOVED the location, it was literally a 10 min walk to get to the Venitian, Mirage, TI, Bellagio and many others, you cant beat the location. We didnt eat at any of the restaurants at Harrah's, but did spend a lot of time in their carnaval court, we loved the band, entertainment and the bartenders! It was a great place and had lots of fun. Went to the pool, it wasnt fancy but it was big, clean, and didnt have any problems. Check In and Out was quick and smooth, would definatly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Will return to Harrah's!”
Reviews.Author: FireflyN10C
Reviews.Content: Checked in April 21st @ 11:30 am with upgrade to Junior Suite in Carnival Tower on 17th floor for a fantastic stay of 5 nights! Spacious room w/king bed, sofa, 2 large windows w/a lower pane that opened for fresh air along w/ a view of the Mirage volcano, also a plasma TV, safe, and coffee maker in room! The room was very clean, quiet, and most comfortable. The elevators were quick and access to the Casino was easy. Recommend a meal at the "Oyster Bar" - ate there twice and both times the service and food was excellent! The staff at Harrah's were friendly, available, and helpful. Will stay @ Harrah's again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A safe bet”
Reviews.Author: MichaelonLI
Reviews.Content: I wanted to give Harrah's a try and found a great rate on Expedia, $79 a night that included $25 food credit and two visits to the health club. We felt like we got a good deal for what we paid. I was traveling with my Mom and asked for a room near the elevator. The front desk was helpful in getting us what we needed. We were in the Carnival tower. The room was average but comfortable. The bathroom was a good size. The room was clean and maid service was efficient. I was disappointed in the casino, there were very few video poker machines. The health club was somewhat limited but the steam room and whirlpool were excellent. The breakfast buffet stood out as well above average in selection and quality of food. While I would not go out of my way to stay there again, I know it would be a safe bet if I return. One last thing. We saw Rita Rudner. Her show was perfect. She is a funny and classy lady. It was well worth the price of admission. When I inquired at the box office I was told they only had a few seats left. Not wanting to miss out I bought them right away: $57 each. We were seated in the back of the room and there were well over a hundred empty seats. The folks we sat with told us $99 VIP tickets were available at the half price ticket place. I felt a bit taken. Then five minutes before show time the Maitre-d asked all of us in the back rows to move up forward because the VIP seats were empty. We sat in the third row. So in the end it worked out great.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay”
Reviews.Author: VegasgirlPghPA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I always stay at Harrahs. However we were in Vegas April 3-6th and stayed at TI. We have always loved Harrah's and always enjoyed the Range Steakhouse so we went back there on April 5th for dinner. I have to say that I was highly disappointed with the changes that they have made to their menu. All of the prices increased dramatically and now everything is ala carte. I understand that it is Vegas, but Harrah's needs to realize that they are not the Wynn or the Bellagio. They are a nice, middle of the road property that is trying to make themselves something that they are not. Also, service was okay, it too has seemed to fallen. With all of the restaurant choices in Las Vegas, we will not return to the Range.

Reviews.Title: “Should have been a little better”
Reviews.Author: Sue2000
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms in the Carnival Tower for two nights. The rooms were amazingly dim and seemed to be missing some lights. The TV needed a few more channels. It also buzzed. Maintenance came right away to fix it, but of course it wasn't buzzing while they were there. The minibar is a complete ripoff. There are large signs on the minibar that you will be charged for even picking something up. How you are expected to see what is in there without picking them up is beyond me. They should stop annoying their customers and just make it a regular minibar. The beds should have been a little softer, especially the rollaway which you could feel the springs on. It never made sense that one of our rooms got turn down service every night, but the other room didn't. The central strip location is nice, as is the monorail stop. The buffet was pretty standard, but the furniture should have been nicer. We went to the Mirage across the street for most meals, since it is nicer. A group of loud drunks made a disturbance in the hall, but the hotel was fairly quick about responding and seemed to have no tolerance for it.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: RubyYork
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrahs March 31-April 4 with another couple. After arriving after 8pm it was hard to find 2 rooms with a view of the stip close to each other. The front desk staff went above and beyond. The first night we were on the 3 rd floor in the MG tower with plans to move the following day. Take note, the water pressure is excellent down there. Our room had a patio adjacent to the sun deck. You can hear some music from the pool but it wasn't enough to bother us. Our friends room was way down and accross the hall had no view much less a deck. The window was totally blocked by AC equipment. When I return I will ask for a patio room. We moved to the 12th floor in MG tower. It was basically the same room (not the renovated rooms but still nice). We had a view of the strip and the volcano and were much closer to our friends. The down side was the lack of water pressure. We really enjoyed the Carnival Bar during the day. It was a little too hip for us in the evening. The dueling piano bar was great and we loved the bands at Toby Keiths place. We also enjoyed a band at Margaritaville. The only place we ate at Harrahs was Toby Keiths, it's a little pricey but we the food was good. We had a breakfast at Ellis Island. The price was right but had to wait. It's a little dark and the service wasn't great. Afterward we walked to 7-11 and bought bottles of water for .79 to last the duration of our trip. If you cut through Ballys it's not a bad walk. Harrahs was just our speed. The price was great, we booked on the hot deals on their website, averaging to $80.00 per night. The rooms are nothing special but clean and the location cannot be beat. We liked the size of the casino, it wasn't hard to find eachother. Early in the day we walked to Casino Royal (low limits) so I could TRY to play craps but did most our gambling at Harrahs. We won enough at VP to pay for our trip so we left smiling. If you're going to enjoy LV and not to hangout in your room, Harrahs is the place to be. I'm sorry to read the other reviews from people that did not have a good experience there but we'll definitly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's? Not Again”
Reviews.Author: lawgrrl52
Reviews.Content: We wanted a few days of relaxation in the sun (we live in Portland, OR), so we booked a package with three nights at Harrah's. We chose Harrah's for the central location on the Strip, and because we didn't want to spring for a luxury resort. Most of our travel is for business, and most business hotel rooms are better outfitted than ours was. We stayed in a reno'd room in the Mardi Gras Tower (rm. 1504) with views of the heating & cooling for the casino, the TI volcano, and the TI tower. The room was smallish, but quiet and clean. The marble & granite in the bath were nice touches, but I would've preferred more room, a tub that drained, more water pressure, and a lighted makeup/shaving mirror, instead of a 2nd (small) flat screen TV. The buffet (Flavors) was very tasty at breakfast; we didn't eat there for any other meal. This would be an acceptable property for someone not expecting to spend much time in the room, and looking for entertainment outside of the hotel. Next time, we'll spend the extra $$ for a nicer experience.

Reviews.Title: “Locked out...again and again and again...”
Reviews.Author: perkyone
Reviews.Content: Due to flight delays, instead of arriving on Sunday night at 5:30pm, we arrived the next day at 2am. Although we prepaid for the room, since we didn’t call ahead to let them know we’d be late, they had no rooms that we requested. They upgraded us for one night. The upgraded rooms in the Carnival tower are far superior to the cheaper Mardi Gras rooms. During my frequent visits to the customer service desk (see below), I heard them offer to upgrade many people for one night. I also heard people being told to wait for housekeeping to finish cleaning their room. This leaves me to believe that they are overbooking right and left, and while it’s nice to be upgraded, it is a huge inconvenience to have to keep calling the next day to see if your room is ready, and then repack all of your things and move them! The lock on our door was broken. It wouldn’t read the code that they’d made for the card at check-in. We trekked down to check-in and back way too many times. It was suggested that we were somehow demagnetizing our cards! After two full days of getting new cards, having them not work, and being accompanied by security to let us in, they finally, a locksmith came and fixed the lock. But we will never stay at Harrah’s again. Though our room was nonsmoking, the sheets had cigarette burns. Housekeeping changed the bedding by leaving on the dirty sheets and turning the pillowcases inside out. We had 2 coffee mugs for three people. The drain in the tub was very slow. We also had the crappy view of the top of part of the hotel, as I’ve seen in other pics here. The buffet was delicious, but I could always eat there and stay elsewhere. The day of our departure I heard on the news that Harrah’s had been sold. Hmm... Did our no-customer service have anything to do with this shake-up? I’m not going back to find out!

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's hotel save your money”
Reviews.Author: Joann587
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's 3/31-4/7/07 It was a LONG week. It was so crowded and smoke filled. The noise level was so high at night with allthe slots we went to bed each night with a headache. Was told room would have a coffee pot but they dont have enough to go around, Would a $10. pot put them back much?? The buffett was not worth the long wait or the high price. All I got for my comp, for spending over $2,000. was $12.00 of a meal. I will be going back to MGM much better there. One more thing we rented a car to go to grand canyon skywalk, The Grand canyon is a must see BUT dont spend $25.00 to walk on the skywalk. A really big disappointment. They wont allow cameras on walk, they will take your picture for $15. A really big rip off. If going to las vegas I hope your time and money spent is not at Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “There was graffiti in our 200 a night room!”
Reviews.Author: travelerr33
Reviews.Content: For 200 a night, you shouldn't have to pay another $12 a night for internet access! Add two bucks more and that's what I pay for my dsl per month! There were also weird noises coming from the piping in the bathroom all night. I put the fan to mute them out. And the graffiti on the walls! Too many hotels to choose for this type of thing. On a good note, the front desk personnel was very friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room”
Reviews.Author: Marylanderkj
Reviews.Content: The room appeared to be recently renovated. It was large, clean, decor was very pleasing, bed and pillows were very comfortable. The tower we were in was about 1/2 block from the strip, but the window view was of the Rio in the distance. Bathroom was very spacious and clean. Breakfast was not included. A touch-and-you-buy mini-bar was included, so we didn't go near it. Room heat/air conditioning was reasonably quiet and efficient. Despite the hotel being quite full, the 10th floor room was quiet. Check-in required waiting for a few people, but it went quick and the receptionist was extremely friendly and helpfull. Short walk from the lobby to the strip, nearly across from Ceasar's Palace and the Mirage. Great location. Ample free car self-parking behind the hotel. Easy access to local roads which can bypass the strip traffic jams. Short drive to the airport. Very favorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “very pleased”
Reviews.Author: boat73
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my recent stay at Harrah's Las Vegas and will definately stay there again. My son and I were on a "guys" trip and we arrived on a Monday and left on a Thursday. Someone told me to request a room in the Mardi Gras Tower at check-in as they were the most recently remodeled. The room was great! Clean, flat screen TV. Our view overlooked the pool and was unremarkable but I wasn't staying there for the view. I was staying there because I got a great rate and I like Harrah's "center strip" location. I would definately stay there again! Last year I stayed at TI and had a strip view room but that was the only advantage the TI room had over the Harrah's room.

Reviews.Title: “harrah's so-so”
Reviews.Author: DOUGT
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay at Harrahs (March 20-24). had a great time and even brought home a little extra money, Harrah's however was having a terrible time, upon arrival their computer system had been down approx 24 hrs and they were "trying" to check people in manually. One member of our party was given a room twice that was already occupied by other guests. My party was 2nd in line to check in around 11:30 pm and waited almost 45 minutes to get checked in but at least the room I was given wasn't already occupied. The room was standard affair nothing fancy, clean but worn. But what bothered me was the noise from the hall. I'd have guessed I didn't have a door because anything that happened outside the room was clearly audible inside the room. Made it a little hard to sleep in the mornings. Overall it was a so-so stay, I enjoyed the buffet, great food and wonderful service. The casino was extremely noisy, as are most casino's but the cocktail waitresses were friendly and frequent and the machines actually paid out occasionally. Got a pretty good rate on the room with their hot deals from the website. Will definitely look at Harrah's for my next trip but unless they would have great rate will probably stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “great vegas experience”
Reviews.Author: brentom
Reviews.Content: Our fourth trip to Vegas, but our first stay at Harrahs, proved to be a good choice. Location is perfect for you are close to the big hotels, shopping (fashion show mall) and it does not take you two days to walk to your room through the casino. We checked in early - got the room we asked for - clean and met all our needs, but the carpet could use changing. Staff were incredible, always ensuring if there was anything "else" they could do for you. It is a older hotel and does not have all the fancy attractions the big ones have but certainly met our needs and at a good price

Reviews.Title: “Check in-BAD,everything else-AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: kristinr1108
Reviews.Content: My bf and I along with another couple flew out to Vegas for three nights and they were staying at the Aladdin, but we chose Harrah's b/c of the cheaper price. We got in on a late flight and we were both exhausted. We however wanted to start gambling right away. Well over an hour later we did! Check in was BAD!! We stood in line for 45mins before an agent helped us. Then as he helped us(nice new guy) he told us that our type of room was not available. We requested non smoking and one Queen. Well they had smoking and a double. I was livid, not only b/c we had to stand in like, but then not a good room. Well after 15mins of him going back and forth to his manager he said "All we have left is a suite so we will put you in that." I was excited, but downplayed it haha..I just said"oh okay" So after an hour of checking in we finally get to the 33rd floor suite..they have 35 floors total. IT WAS THE BEST ROOM I HAVE EVER STAYED IN.... I loved it! So did my bf. The living room was big and then the bedroom was too. The bed was very comfortable and then came my favorite part-The bathroom! It was as big as the bedroom. It had a huge jacuzzi type tub,two big sinks on either side of the tub,a separate shower and the toilet was even in its own little room. It even had blinds and a french type door connecting it to the bedroom. I could have stayed in there all night! haha.. The buffet was great and large. I thought the dinner buffet was a little pricey so we did not eat there. Not sure if it would have been worth it or not. The casino was not bad, but I did not use it that much. I think a couple slots and that was it. People told me the outdoor area with the bartenders was really cool, but we never got to check it out. Also I heard Toby Keith's bar and The Range Steakhouse were pretty good restaurants, but did not check them out either. I definitely suggest this hotel...especially if you want a suite. I did not get to see the standard rooms, but I am sure they are nice as well. Our rooms' view was pretty nice too of the Mirage and mountains. I would for sure stay here again. Also for a good Italian place to eat..just around the corner behind Bally's in the back of the strip is a great restaurant called Battista's Hole in the Wall Italian. You get huge portions of pasta,salad or soup,garlic bread and a cappucino at the end all for a great price!! Check it out!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat It!!!”
Reviews.Author: michman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrahs Casino and Resort the first part of March, Monday thru Thursday. My plane from Detroit was delayed for two hour so I did not arrive to the hotel until 1:00am Tuesday. Since I had little time in Las Vegas, after checking in which went very smoothly, I went to my room and unpacked. The room was clean and I especially like the armorie that was centered between the two beds. My original request was for a king bed, but arriving at the time I did I expected I wouldn't get a king bed. The clerk who was friendly advised me to check later in the day to see if a king bed room would be available. I had a great view of the Mirage Casino and the volcano so I decided I would just keep the room I had. I went walking down to the Fashion Mall and back to Harrahs. There was hardly anyone out at about 2:00am. However, when I went to the Carnival Court there was a DJ playing and the crowd were in there 20's. I hadn't eaten and was very hungry so I went back into Harrahs and at that time the Oyster Bar was open for food. It did take approximately 40 minutes for me to get a turkey club and fries. However, I watched the cooks/chefs prepare varioius subs and burgers, breakfast items while fresh so I didn't mind the wait and the other patrons didn't seem to mind either. During my stay I didn't spend a lot of time gambling at Harrahs so I didn't have much interaction with the employees. I did appear to me that the employees were assisting others well. Oh, I almost forgot to mention the Duel Piano Bar that had a pretty good crowd each night. The gaming area at first had me in circles, but when you figure out the the plastic figures of the man and woman holding money is the area of the hotel, to the left leds to the court area and the rights towards Ceasers and other hotels. I had a great time my short stay in Vegas and will definitely visit there again, soon I hope. I walked the strip one day towards the Riveria and the next day down to Mandelay Bay. My feet were sore. Tips: The Rio buffet was well worth it, lots of stations. For shows I suggest checking with Tickets4tonite or Tickets2nite (the one that has more locations has more discount tickets!) Well if you are reading this you have been to Vegas recently or going recently. Either way it goes, I had a great stay and time :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: cheesemakers
Reviews.Content: My husband and i recently stayed at the harrahs first time to vega s-loved it!Harrahs was a good hotel.We stayed in the mardi gras section-10th floor, room was average clean , the view was terrible not quite sure what we were overlooking- but all was well we were there to sleep bathroom was a just o.k could have been worse could have been better!No coffee maker in the room but there was a starbucks and just outside around the corner is a mcdonalds for those of you who dont care for starbucks!The pool was average nothing grand like some of the others.Was also closed for season,not sure what the seasons run. everyone was very friendly.We ate at the buffet twice not bad priced and the selection was wonderful we tried two other buffets and harrahs was by far the best!Wanted to do the range but my husband could not get over the buffet. watched the comedy show in the hotel late show very good!Casino was good,I played on the same 50 all wekend at harrahs-did not seem to be smokey at all-they also have non-smoking floors for the rooms!Overall was a very nice hotel-would we go back definately-but there are so many options i would have to take the best deal that was out there at the time!The location was really great smack center!We really did enjoy our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's was GREAT”
Reviews.Author: MistMountain
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful stay at Harrah's. The room was very nice. The service was excellent. It was easy to get around. The restaurants were excellent. It was easy access to go anywhere from there. I highly recommend staying there. The rates were reasonable and the whole stay was worth it. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: TSUAGD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Harrah's for a long weekend in February. We did not chose this hotel- it was the site of a business meeting he was attending. The best things about the hotel is the location. It is in the center of everything. The room was decent size, comfortable king size bed, table with two side chairs and a desk. The desk was small and uncomfortable for working on a laptop. High speed wireless was an additional charge, which I personally thing is ridiculous. Not business traveler friendly. The bathroom was nothing special, and the towels had seen better days. Very small single sink area. One thing that was very nice was a large in room safe, large enough to store our laptop. The casino was similar to the rest, but nothing special. We did not try the restaurants, but did shop in the convenience store and Starbucks. Overall it was fine, and the room was clean. It just wasn't anything special, and there is no service to speak of. Stay here if location is most imporant.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: nitesky014
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Feb 19-22, 2007. We had a $50/nt special. To get the best room ask for the ones with the Plasma TVs. Front desk person was happy to give us the room. Howwever, they will put you in another room if you don't make that request. Like everyone else said I never slept on a more comfortable bed. I even looked to see what kind it was - Simmons. Not a lot of drawer/closet space. Fine for two people but it will be tight if there are more. Never stayed here before but it was a great location. I would recommend it. Staff was cheerful. My only negative - because it is older and has low ceiling the ventilation in yhe casino is not that great. And for this non smoker with a cold, breathing was tough!

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: NJdudette
Reviews.Content: I arrived very late in Vegas on a recent Friday night and drove my rental as quickly as possible to Harrah’s as I was quickly losing steam – I had been awake for almost 24 hours straight. I like Harrah’s location, but getting to the front desk from Las Vegas Boulevard is a pain in the butt if you don’t know some of the short cuts. You drive down and around a bunch alleyways riddled with speed bumps until you finally reach their valet parking area. It’s rather small and don’t be surprised if you’re stuck waiting in line for 15-20 minutes until you can finally hand your keys over to the parking attendant. I recently attained “platinum” status and was looking forward to finally reaping some of the benefits, i.e. dedicated check-in for platinum club members. Unfortunately the platinum reception desk was closed with a note stating that one could obtain service in the diamond club reception area – ummmmm, does the phrase “turn around stupid” mean anything? I didn’t turn around and roamed around a bit before giving up and heading for the main front desk with my platinum card in hand hoping for some sort of upgrade. The staff was friendly enough, and I was advised that the hotel was booked and instead of a king/non-smoking room, they had a queen/non-smoking room. I figured I wouldn’t be spending much time in the room so it was no big deal. I know many people hate having the long walk from their room to/from the elevator, but it’s never bothered me as I find it to be a bit quieter due to the limited amount of foot traffic passing by my door. My room was located on the seventh floor and I found it to be clean, but rather small. The view was primarily of another rooftop, but had I been a bit higher I may have had more of a promising view. Again, not a big deal for a two night stay. As I mentioned, the room was rather small – for me it was fine, but for two people it may be an issue. The furniture wasn’t in bad shape and the bed was rather comfy. The bathroom was clean, but someone did a crummy grout job in the tub and it looked worse than it really was. The housecleaning staff was friendly and cleaned my room on a timely basis. I always try to give the buffet’s a try and Harrah’s wasn’t too bad. I only tried it for breakfast so I have no idea what their lunch and dinner buffet’s are like. There’s a café not too far from the buffet which was packed most of the time – I take that as a good sign. All and all I enjoyed my stay and I like their central location to most things on the strip. I’m sure at some point I’ll give it another try, but for now I plan on working my way through the other Harrah properties.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, newly remodeled rooms, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: bgonner
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Harrah's on and off for several years. This year we had our best experience ever. We got a great rate and three newly remodeled rooms. In the past, they didn't have safes; according to the front desk, the majority of the rooms now have safes, whice were added in mid-2006. When we arrived from late flights, we did, unfortunately, have to take three smoking rooms, because the hotel was booked almost solid. As promised though, they switched us to three rooms, separated by just a few doors, on a non-smoking, rennovated floor. The rooms had bigger than normal for Las Vegas bathrooms, which contained flat screen TVs, and some of the most comfortable beds I have ever encountered in or outside Las Vegas. The staff was great with even the smallest request, and we felt safe (there were six of us, all women) with the room key monitor near the elevators. The rooms were quiet and had a table and two chairs along with a beautiful combination TV cabinet/closet/mini bar. The only slight problem was a lack of hangers (they brought us extras within a few minutes of asking) and two out of seven days when they shorted us on towels and clean glasses. There is no doubt we will stay at Harrahs again. We love the location, the hotel, and their staff.

Reviews.Title: “I love Harrah's!”
Reviews.Author: Beau&KC
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 4 days at Harrah's and loved it. I changed my original reservation in another hotel to Harrah's due to the location and I could not have made a better decision. The hotel is colorful, bright and cheerful. Staff was the friendliest of anywhere else on the strip. Check in/out was very fast. We were upgraded to the newer Mardi Gras tower rooms. The decor was tasteful. Bed was extremely comfortable and there was a plasma TV in the bathroom! We had a small balcony which allowed us to see the Carnival court and the strip, including Bellagio's water show. In the Carnival court there is a covered bar and live bands til 2AM. Some people on this board complained that this kept them awake at night. I barely heard it with the sliding glass door closed. Besides, most nights I was there, or somewhere else til at least 2AM.... It's Vegas! The location of this hotel is the best on the strip. We were able to walk to most attractions and easilly caught the Deuce/cabs when needed. As beautiful as the more expensive hotels are I was very happy spending time at Harrhah's. I recommend this hotel and will definately stay again. PS... Only ate at the buffet for breakfast. Can't speak for the other restaurants. One thing... Please avoid Treasure Island's buffet. It was overpriced, had few choices and food was handled with ungloved hands!!! I left hungry.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: superez
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a girls weekend over the Veteran's Day 3-day weekend. This was sort of a last minute trip and since it was also a holiday weekend, we did not get a great deal on the room. We paid about $340/per nite, but we were willing to pay given the holiday, the fact that this was the only weekend we could plan this trip, and that Harrah's was on the Strip. When we arrived, we were very pleased to find that the hotel is in the middle of everything! It is beside both the Venetian and Caesar's Palace. The hotel itself is very nice. The lobby and casino area are typical but clean and well-maintained, and there are several restaurants in the hotel and right outside if you care to venture out. Check-in was quick and all the staff we came in contact with were very helpful and cordial. We stayed in the Carnival Tower and found our room to be just right for 3 people with 2 double beds, table with chair, armoir with TV and a decent sized bathroom. It was very clean and the decor was bright but not tacky, in keeping with their Mardi Gras theme. We didn't have much of a view but then again we weren't in the room very much and this wasn't a big deal for us. The only thing we were disappointed about was that the pool is closed for the winter season, even if the weather is warm. I would stay here again, but only if I found a better rate. I think making reservations waaayyy ahead time is key and I'm sure you can get a great deal online if you plan accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's was better than expected”
Reviews.Author: TennesseeZeke
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews here I was reluctant to stay at this property. I stayed only because the room was free due to my Total Rewards play. Everyone at the property was extremely nice and helpful from the casino and restaurant to housekeeping and front desk staff. My room was very large and clean with a comfortable bed. Some furniture was not new looking but overall I was pleased with the appearance. I would stay at Harrah's again even if the room is not free. The location is very good too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel location”
Reviews.Author: goldcardluke
Reviews.Content: We booked Harrah's as part of a flight & hotel deal through Expedia. We booked to stay at the Embassy Suites for our first 5 nights in Vegas and then Harrah's for the last 2 nights. Although there were 3 of us we stayed in one room with 2 double beds and a rollaway bed, which was brought up to our room just a few minutes after a smooth check in. Although space was limited with 3 people in the room, we managed fine, and saved cash by avoiding booking an extra room. The best thing about Harrah's is the central strip location. The front entrance is directly opposite the Forum Shops at Caesar's Palace. There is not a great deal to do inside the hotel apart from gamble, but considering the reasonable price I didn't consider this a problem. The quality of the room was very good. The bathroom was one of the largest I have seen in a hotel. We didn't have a strip view, but not a lot of time was spent in the room anyway. We didn't eat in the hotel as the queue for the buffet was quite long at dinner time, but we did find the Starbucks in the hotel useful. Although we were 12 floors up, the elevators were very quick. I recommend Harrah's as a well-priced central base to explore the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Best value on the strip”
Reviews.Author: caribou52
Reviews.Content: We travel to Las Vegas 2x year (minimum), but had never before stayed at Harrahs. I had heard it was outdated and small, but decided to see for myself. Was I ever wrong. We stayed for 4 nights in the Carnival Tower in early January. The room was very nice, clean, no complaints at all. Even more importantly, the Harrah's staff was the friendliest I have encountered in Las Vegas in a long time. Everyone I dealt with was helpful, friendly, customer-service oriented. It shouldn't be a surprise when you encounter such terrific service, but it was after some recent experiences in other hotels (including some costing 3 and 4x the price). Harrah's must have implemented a revamped customer service program because it was noticable not only by us but several of our friends as well. I also recommend this hotel because it is a wonderful location. Across from the Mirage and Caesar's, close enough to walk to Bally's, Paris (skip Imperial Palace and O'Shea's, please). There is also a trolley stop located in the Harrah's Hotel. It is convenient and nice, but a cab is often similarly priced. Overall, I highly recommend a stay at Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “2 Different experiences here”
Reviews.Author: BrassBryan
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at harrahs in July 06 and loved it. Booked thru their Hot deals and stayed 6 nights there. I was given a deluxe room - King size bed and there was a lot of space in the room and all the basic stuff included. The hotel has a pretty decent buffet and a cafe which serves sandwhiches till 5am or so untill they got to clean up. Entertainment here has nothing exciting except for the 2 twins who does their Piano act. I always noticed a full house here. My personal recommendation is to request for Carnival towers because that was where i first stayed.Maybe it was the 6 nights, maybe it was the tower I am not sure. I stayed there again in Dec 06 and was given the Mardi Gras Tower. This time i was given the corner units. AVOID this at all cost because they are smaller then the other units (as seen on the fire escape plan). However I noticed that the basic rooms are smaller then the one I stayed in (Carnival towers). The furniture in this hotel is old but the location is second to none being in the middle of the strip. The shuttle service is also very helpful for those who wants to visit the Rio for its buffet or other activities (voodoo or clubs etc). I have always found their Hot Deals to offer the best prices. For all of you out there, have a pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional customer service”
Reviews.Author: knucklenuck
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Harrah's---been to Vegas many times but always stay downtown and spend one day on the strip. Got an offer in the mail for 2 free nights and a free leather jacket at check in---couldn't pass that one up! Already had 4 nights free at the Nugget starting on Saturday so we booked Harrah's for Sunday and Monday and hopped back and forth. Check in at Harrah's was great, were offered an upgrade to a suite for $50 but passed seeing as we're seldom in our room anyway. Got our jacket just as they promised and it's a pretty nice one. Thought there'd be a catch but there wasn't. Our room was in the Carnival tower and yes it is a long walk to the rooms but all of the staff is so friendly and helpful that we didn't really mind. Anybody who's been to the strip knows it's a long walk to anything, which is why we usually stay downtown at the Nugget (won't anymore--see review at Nugget site). Our room was very quiet, tho other reviews have said the opposite. Room had a special heating/cooling system that you can set when you're in the room. It ahs a sensor that detects when you've left the room and lowers or raises the room temperature automatically according to the season to conserve energy. Pretty slick---no noisy fans blowing. The rooms in our towere all have minibars and ours hummed constantly but I kind of liked the "white noise". Our room had 2 queen beds that were very comfy as well as a table and chairs, bath was nice size and all was clean. We ate at the buffet twice, once for supper and once for breakfast---food was excellent both times---huge selection and great staff--both times there was a players club rep at the buffet line offering coupons and gifts for signing up for a player's card. Hubbie already had one so I signed up and got $15.00 in coupons for the buffet that night. I play penny slots and the service in the slot areas is fantastic---spoke with one of the managers and complimented him on the speed and friendliness of slot staff and beverage servers---they not only show up at your machine promptly (2 minutes) but they also introduce themselves and offer to help if you need anything else. Once when I hit the service light (for change) the slot manager came and was on his headset asking if the light on my machine had registered with the staff. They all wear headsets and get a signal when a service light is activated on a machine and they literally come running. The manager told me they don't have fountains, they have people. Their customer service training shows---great staff throughout the facility. The only problem we had with Harrah's was the comp system. Doesn't matter if you play tables or slots---you use the same card and accrue points towards comps. Gone are the days when you could play blackjack for a few hours and ask for a buffet or dinner comp. It all goes on the card and the credits are meager. Hubbie played blackjack off and on for 2 days while I played penny slots. He plays $100 per hand, sometimes more, and at the end of our stay I had more comps than he did---$24 for me and $9.52 for him. We used the credit to pay for the meal we charged to our room. I think we'd stay there again if the rooms were comped but we'd probably gamble where the table players are more appreciated. The casinos all seem to hand out comp rooms like candy, as long as you've used a player's card so there's really nothing special about getting those offers in the mail. How we're treated when we get there is what matters to us. Golden Nugget has gotten very tight with their comps as well. After both of us playing there for 3 days we had NO comp credits built up---not even enough for one meal. Hubbie played blackjack for one hour at the Las Vegas Club and they gave him a $20 meal comp (and they have good cafe food at the Upper Deck, with great staff). The smaller casinos seem more generous with the comps, more interested in keeping you there. The free shuttle to the Rio is nice, of course they're owned by the same company, as well as Caesar's, Bally's, Horseshoe, Flamingo and some others. So if you have a card and play at any of them it all adds up. Use your card! Charge your meals to your room and when you check out ask them to swipe your player's card and whatever credits you've earned can be credited towards your room bill. The credits are only good from the first of the year thru the end of the year so if you only go to Vegas once a year you'll lose them if you don't use them. The piano bar at Harrah's was fun, nice to have free live entertainment within the casino. Also an Elvis impersonator leading kaoroke.

Reviews.Title: “Love Harrah's!”
Reviews.Author: spaNC
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at Harrah's. We go every year for the long MLK weekend. This year we stayed from Jan 11-15. My husband gambles a lot, so after paying for our first stay, we have stayed free (on comps) for the past two years. Harrah's just has a great atmosphere. You can not beat the location. Room wise, last year we stayed in the Carnival tower and had an awesome view. This year, we were in the Mardi Gras tower on the 8th floor. Like someone else said, the walls are paper thin and you hear everything. There is live music down in the little courtyard area and they are loud til the wee hours of the morning - so if you are in the Mardi Gras tower and you go to bed early, you'll definitely hear the music. Our room was nice...king sized bed that was super comfy, two flat screen TV's, one of which was in the bathroom. The casino at Harrah's gets so packed on the weekends - it's hard to find a blackjack table at night. But again, the atmosphere is so fun, and for the location I just think it attracts a lot of folks. Food...Toby Keith Bar is a good place to go and watch games and drink and eat appetizers and what not. The Sports Bar also has good burgers and appetizers.
