The Cafe is pretty good and if you like clam chowder, YOU MUST GO THERE!!! They have the best clam chowder of anywhere, hands down! It is served in a bread bowl - I look forward to going to Vegas just to eat this!! As for the location...a big group of friends go with us every year as well and half of them stay at the Imperial Palace, which is next door to Harrah's. On the other side of Harrah's, there is a McDonalds, Chipotle, Dennys, Outback, Subway and a few other places...after you pass that little strip, you come up on the Venetian. Across the street from Harrah's is Caesar's Palace/Forum Shops, Treasure Island, Mirage. Everything is in good walking distance. There is also monorail access right behind Harrah's, which is convenient. Harrah's isn't as impressive as The Wynn, Bellagio or Venetian, but I love this place and we will continue to stay there for years to come, I'm sure!

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: 14The$Travelers
Reviews.Content: Went to LV 12/15-16 and stayed at Harrah's. Safe, a good value, pleasant staff, and excellent entertainment. Monorail transportation is clean, safe, and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Britt23
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a four night stay at Harrah's. 12/8 - 12/12 I had requested a king, nonsmoking, recently renovated room in the Carnival tower. All requests were met except we stayed in the Marty Gras tower which was fine. The room was on the small size and the bathroom was very small, but it was recently remodeled. Counters and table tops were marble. 2 LCD TV's (one in the bathroom). New carpeting, cabinets and dressers/amoires. The beds were exceptionally comfortable. Most comfortable bed I have ever slept on. We didn't have a view at all, but I wanted a quiet room vs. a view. Unfortunately, because the walls are paper thin, quiet is not an option at Harrah's. The first two nights were fairly good, but the third morning there was construction either right above us or in the elevator and they were hammering for hours. The fourth morning we were woken up by the talking in the next room. We could hear every word! The casino was a nice size and it didn't take long to learn how to navigate around. Waiters/waitresses were quick and polite. The piano bar was a blast and we enjoyed that very much. We ate at Toby Keith's and the wings and ribs were very good. Overall, the service, room, and casino were good, but we would not stay there again because we require a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs a good value”
Reviews.Author: jatillin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrah’s Las Vegas 11/30-12/4. We used our players card points to get a discount that worked out to an average of $60/night. Had read several reviews about dirty rooms and outside noise issues. We were pleasantly surprised that we had neither problem. Our first room was in the Marti Gras tower. Despite our request for rollaway bed, the room was far too small for that. Plus the A/C unit was running like a diesel on its last leg. We went back to the front desk and were placed in the Carnival tower 16th floor. Room was updated and well appointed. Only issue was a lack of soap, shampoo or lotion in the room, which one call to housekeeping rectified. Two queen beds were comfortable, as was the rollaway (which was a little short for my 6’1 brother, but otherwise OK). We had a handicap room (supposedly because of the extra space) which was fine except the shower was very low on water pressure. The casino was clean, if a little smokey. This may have been caused in part by the 10,000 rodeo fans that had swarmed to Vegas this particular week. Dealers were personable and helpful. Pit bosses were particularly good, making a point to dole out charm and helpful advice. The winner for the weekend was Pricilla who dealt Casino Texas Holdem (play against the house, not each other). Finding a cocktail waitress was sometimes a chore and the waits for drinks could be long, so when the first one arrives, order another on the spot just to be safe. Call liquors were no problem, but remember to name your brand or you get the house rotgut. The restaurants were less impressive. We ate at the Range Steakhouse and were unimpressed. The $42 ribeye steak was up to its billing as prime beef well cooked, but the service was only fair. The vegetables were particularly disappointing. We ordered creamed spinach for the table (usually a steak house staple) and received a bowl of gooey cream sauce with a pitiful amount of spinach (my brother returned from the restroom to see it and asked who ordered soup). It was also salted to the point on inedibility. We returned it for the sautéed red potatoes and were only marginally happier with the bitter oily flavor they sported. The Oyster bar served better fare. The crab cakes and Louisiana chicken nugget salad were winners. The Italian place next to it was also above average. Excellent bruchetta with pesto, good crusty bread, good service were all there. All three entrees (two beef and one chicken) were well done. The Spa at Harrah’s was a little disappointing. After staying at Rio, Luxor and Monte Carlo on prior visits, this was a small and unimpressive cousin. The masseuse was acceptable if a little older than I would have liked. The upside was the shower. The spa was right by the Carnival elevators on the 4th floor, so I used the shower in the spa instead of suffering in the no pressure room shower. Fairly convenient to reach and excellent water and space. On a side note, if you forget toiletries, DON’T buy the junk in the minibar. The Spa has toothbrushes, razors, shaving cream, and hair gel available. Locker space was tight, so be prepared just to camp out on a bench. Bottled water on the house at The Spa, so a good place to grab a few for the room since the Vegas tap water is awful. For a Spa with no access fee, it was not a bad deal. The location on the strip is perhaps the best feature of Harrah's. Easy access to Mirage, Bally's and Paris. Plus two of the lower level casino's are right next door, so if you want to go upscale to Paris or play $3 craps at the blue collar casino, all three are an easy walk. There is also in house access to the monorail which runs up and down the strip. Other notes from the visit: The buffet at Wynn was a treat. We had Friday lunch there and were extremely impressed. Great quality for around $25/head. Asian restaurant at MGM was also a winner, but pricey. Spearmint Rhino well worth the high cover and drink prices.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: portabello
Reviews.Content: When arriving at midnight, after a long flight all you want to do is get to your room. Its hard when they dont really have a room to put you in!!! We arrived to a line of people waiting to check in, with staff members in go slow mode. When we finally go to check in they asked if we would like to go to a different hotel (At the other end of the strip) for the night free of charge & come back tomorrow for our already pre booked room. As it was after midnight we said no then had to wait ten minutes while the staff member when off to consult some one about a room I guess. when she finally came back she could only offer us a room with one king size bed & offered us a roller bed. The room was nice and spacious & the hotel clean, however it was a bit annoying having booked at least 2 months earlier & arrive to not have the room we booked. The location of the hotel is great, right in the centre of the strip. when we checked out, we were charged for phone calls, even though we had a phone card with a toll free number that we had used across USA & never been charged to use the phone. However Harrahs tell us you are charged to use the phone even thought we didnt actually incure a connection fee. So at $1.25 for 4 calls & one apparent call for $5. It added up. The dodgy thing was we had a call on our list for a date that we wernt even at the hotel!!! Everything costs in LAS VEGAS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Customer Care”
Reviews.Author: njnjgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are diamond players at Harrahs here in New Jersey. We had received an offer for 3 free nights at Harrahs in Vegas. I booked directly with their promotions department and was told we could also have the 4th night comped. This was wonderful so we booked a 5 night stay from Oct. 29 to Nov. 3rd. knowing we would have to pay for the 5th night but of course that was no problem. When we checked in we were thrilled to be upgraded to a junior suite at no additional charge. Then, on our fifth day we were told that we should have been checked out. I told the front desk that they were mistaken, that we had a 5 night stay reserved. We fully expected to pay for that evening and we wanted to keep the room. They were not sure that we could do that and connected me with VIP services. The young lady was wonderful! After hearing what had happened she told us that not only could we remain in the room but she would pick up the cost! The next day when we checked out, we met her again and she also went out of her way to get as many room charges taken care of that she could. Our entire stay for 5 nights including breakfasts and dinners (one at the Range Steakhouse) cost us out of our pockets a measly $40.00. You just can't beat that! We have been to Harrahs Las Vegas many times. All the reviews are correct in their own way. Yes, the property is old but I think it is well cared for. The room is clean and if you should need anything housekeeping is more than happy to help you. We had a junior suite and it was adequate. This is not a glitzy fancy property but a great casual, kick your shoes off kind of place for people who like to gamble and it is located at the best part of the Strip. What I think is the best part of Harrahs in Vegas is the customer service and how well they treat their guests. The casino is a fun casino and like any other casino is good or bad based on your individual luck. The worst thing about it I would say is the food quality (except for the Range). The food is typical Vegas food which is just average. I would not hesitate to go again.

Reviews.Title: “So So hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmeeccee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after 4 nights at Paris. There is no comparison. We only moved hotels because we were comped 2 nights here for free. I can't complain too much since it was free but they could make simple improvements to make it a more pleasant experience. The walls were very thin. The maid was very loud. We heard he knock on every door down the hallway. She even knocked on our door twice, with the Privacy tag on the door. The tub backed up and turned into a bath by the end of the "shower". The bathroom was not very clean. The casino was crowned but I am OK with that. I witnessed several people win big on the slots, which is always a good sign. The location was great; especially how close it is to the monorail. We also enjoyed the free shuttle to the Rio. I would say this was similar to a Holiday Inn. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Jeff7
Reviews.Content: With a cheap room rate in the Central Strip, I was expecting the worse, but I was pleasantly surprised by Harrah's. The check-in staff was friendly and the room was clean and comfortable. The only problem was that the room requires a long walk through the casino, but until some Las Vegas hotel owner thinks there is a market of people visiting the city who aren't interested in gambling, long walks through the casino are an ever-present part of the experience.

Reviews.Title: “hotel ok - but worst pool on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: michelecm
Reviews.Content: i had to stay here because of my husband's biz trip and i'm just glad we didn't have to pay for it. the hotel in general was nice, the rooms were nice, service people were helpful, great buffet, cafe & starbucks in hotel BUT if you are a pool person DO NOT STAY HERE! for comparison in price and location i highly recommend the flamingo next door! harrah's should be ashamed of their pool, it's a common household pool, most suburban neighborhoods have nicer pools. Another negative was only ONE waitress for the whole pool area. hot tubs are old/worn and chairs are basic slatted plasic lounch chairs. =( pool is rooftop in between 3 tall buildings which shade the pool for most of the day...my parents were staying at treasure island and i got to see their room/pool/restaurants/etc and without question was 10x nicer....u've been warned. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “WILL STAY AT HARRAHS AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: HiMaintenance
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrah's 4 nights. 2 were comped and the other 2 were $59. Requested a room with a view, and received the best view you could get. It was on the 18th floor of the mardi gras tower and was very, very clean. Could see the strip all the way from the volcano at Mirage to the Bellagio watershow. What a view of the mountains with the sunrise and the Rio. Never had to wait for an elevator or stop at other floors. The check in girls were very friendly. Ate at Toby Keith's and loved it. Also ate at The Steakhouse and that was the best prime rib I've ever had with excellent service. The slots were also good to us. Won $750 on a red, white, blue machine. I saw other big winners also. There was always drink girls around too. The blackjack and sportsbook were not so good to us.. Friendly service in the sportsbook though. If you are not happy with your room when you walk in to it, go back to the desk and ask if they have anything else. They will try to make you happy. They did us!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BudandDee
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrah's first week of May. Arrived Sunday May 1st about 9:30 am and went directly to front desk to register. Very short line only waited about 5 minutes. Lady at check-in desk was extremely friendly. She originally said our room was located in Madri Gra tower. I asked for the Carnvial tower and she said no problem. I did not realize there was a difference in towers until I read reviews. Understand Carnival tower has been recently remodeled. We did get our room immediately , did not have to wait for check-in time which was 4 pm. Room was very large and everything was clean. The only problem was no coffee maker and for me this is a very big problem. Have to have my caffeine as soon as feet hit floor or my day is ruined. Had to walk to Walgreen's down the strip by MGM. Very hot day and was extremely tired. On the way back stopped at Alladin to rest for a while. Of course left there lighter in pocket book. My husband plays Keno and some slots, I only play slots. No luck except little pay offs the entire trip. One day going hit the big one. Had a wonderful trip. There are no frills at Harrahs just the basics which is okay since we only go to room to sleep for a few hours anyway. The only problem was the mattress was very uncomfortable, very hard. Remember to ask for a room not facing the band or you will be listening to loud music all night. This happened one year when we asked for a strip view. Never again, even with pillow over my head could still hear the very, very loud music. Keep us awake most of night. We should have asked to be moved to another room but didn't get around to it. We saw the new Wynn which is very impressive. Also took bus to Orleans. It was okay but wouldn't want to stay there because of location. Ate at buffet there, it was very good. Try to see new casino's ever year. Next year want to try Palace Station and Hard Rock. Have no desire to go to Hooters. By the way we did stay at Harrah's for 5 nights for $250, gamblers rate. Ate at Harrahs buffet a few times and the coffee shop first night. Food was very good at both restaurants. Comps are really down from what we use to receive. Only ate at buffet twice free. We use to eat the entire week free and couple nights the room were comped. Vegas is getting to be very high class. Wonder what is going to happen to middle class casino's. Have heard Imperial Palace and Harrah will be imploded to put up another Mega casino. This seems to be going on all over Vegas. Sure hope Vegas doesn't price itself out for the middle class travelers. Seems everyone is jumping on that bandwagon.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: DTJB
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Harrah's in Las Vegas for two nights and I would rate this hotel as less than average. The walls are paper thin. I could hear the people in the rooms next door, using the restroom, the toilet flushing, showering, talking, etc. The beds are very hard. They look like the cheapest mattresses ever made. No padding. I have had a nicer bed, staying in Super 8 or Motel 6. I really feel for as much as that place makes, they should have better rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: melispsych
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at Harrah's last weekend and had a great time. When we arrived at the hotel at 9am there was a room available and we were allowed to check in right away. The service was great. The room was a basic room, clean-no complaints. This hotel is a perfect location to walk to the other casinos. If you are on a budget there are 3 casinos within a 5 minute walk with low table limits ($3-$5). I would recommend skipping the Flavor's buffett at the hotel...it was pretty bad! Otherwise, I would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun show”
Reviews.Author: Mufaza
Reviews.Content: Bareback at Harrah's is a fun show for men and women. Try for discount tickets or comps though. Not much value for $50 a ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the money”
Reviews.Author: Brutus34
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a spur of the moment trip out to Vegas and I stayed at Harrah's. We got a great price on a package through US Airways and couldn't have asked for much more for the price. We arrived in Vegas after midnight and we had to wait in the check in line at Harrahs for about 30 minutes before getting our room keys. Unfortunately, we couldn't use the hotel check in at the airport because it was too late and they had closed. Had no problems checking in and was given a room in the Carnival Tower like we requested. The room itself was good, considering what we had paid for it. I had stayed at the Flammingo a few months earlier and I would say that room was better than the one at Harrah's. The beds were a little uncomfortable (firm) and the pillows seemed to be pretty old. The bathroom was decent sized and clean, no mildew smell. The ring around the shower head was loose and needed to be reattached to the tile but other than that the shower was fine. Not much water pressure in the sink and the water smelled like sulfer so drinking it was an act of desperation. No safe in the room, which I've seen some people complain about before, but it didn't bother us. Use common sense and if you have anything that needs to be in a safe there are safety deposit boxes in the lobby of the hotel. Coffee make worked great, as did the TV. The best part about starying at Harrah's was the location. Most of my trips to Vegas, I've stayed furhter south on the strip and it was nice to get a change. I've done all the sight seeing in Vegas, so walking up and down the strip doesn't appeal too much anymore. I liked that I had some casino's around me that I hadn't spent a lot of time at in the past. Like, I said the location is definatly the highlight of this resort. We didn't make it to the pool, but we could see it from our room. It got pretty busy during the day and it didn't look too big from where we were at. I've seen better pools in Vegas, but I've also seen worse. We ate breakfast one morning at the Flavors buffett and it was great! I would recommend it to anyone and it wasn't terrribly expensive either. The food was high quality and the selection was huge. The only issue I had was we requested a late check out because our flight didn't leave until midnight and the best they could do was noon. Not a big deal, but it would have been nice to have access to our room for the afternoon so we could have used the pool and had a place to shower and change before we left. I would recommend Harrah's to the budget traveler who isn't looking for high class ammenities. If you want that pay a little extra and you'll find it. THe location is great and you can't beat the price!

Reviews.Title: “Good service, but the property is a little worn.”
Reviews.Author: FrequentBizTraveler
Reviews.Content: Check in speed and courtesy was excellent. Room had worn, stained carpeting and a very worn bedspread but otherwise was very clean. Lack of in-room safe was disappointing. High speed internet cord won't reach beyond nightstand, making it akward to use my laptop. Room service speed was excellent. Bathroom was spotless. Overall good value, but the carpet and bedding could use a little attention.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: MartineMontreal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harrah's from June 11 to June 16 and we were very pleased. We requested a room with a safe at check-in and we were given a room on the 14th floor in the Carnaval tower and it looked fresly renovated. The bed was very comfortable and the room was spotless clean. Overall the hotel and casino is fine, there are better one in Vegas but the price and location can't be beat. We ate at Toby Keith's restaurant but we were disappointed, try Margaritaville at the Flamingo, it was perfect! Will go back to this Hotel our next time in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Girl at the front desk was really accomodating and friendly. I requested for a room at the carnaval tower and she gave us a room at the 24th floor with a double sized bed and in a non smoking floor just as requested. Room and bathroom were clean and well kept. I am very particular about sanitation and cleanliness and I really had no problems during my stay from May 9-12 . Although the bed was not that comfortable since I could feel some ofthe coil springs. Just like what the others have written the casino was very smoky . Would probably come back but if I have more money to spend I would try the fancier hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it Again 6/17-6/21”
Reviews.Author: jtona
Reviews.Content: Flew into Vegas Non stop from NH on SWA @ 0950. Retrieved baggage and went directly to hotel thinking too early for Check-in. Arrived at hotel by 1030am and went to Front desk to see about a room. Very nice Host named Lynn tried to find my Reservation but could not. I had booked thru Orbitz at the rate of $63 per night. Luckily i had taken toll-free Orbitz number and Res number . I called orbitz and after few minutes hold time i connected to the customer assistance. She was extremely helpful and called hotel and within few minutes my reservation was put in system. I recommend as does Harrahs if you book thru outside agency call a few days ahead to make sure your reservation has been put in system. After this I went back to Lynn at front desk and she pulled up my reservation. I asked for an upgrade and she stated she had a few Suites available for $75 /nt ,But being on a Saturday, she would have to check with mgr. Came back and said that I could not upgrade today , but come back on Sunday at 9am when she gets there and she will do it then. SO , she gave me a room on Sat in the carnaval tower. Very nice with inroom safe. Very clean. I stayed here 2 months ago and had room in Mardi Gras tower and the difference in rooms was amazing. Newer rooms in Carnaval tower, better view also. Went downstairs Sunday to go se Lynn ,BUT Checkin/Out line was EXTREMELYlong (Sun busiest day)and I decided my room was nice enough. Slots were tight as usual but still had fun. Played poker tourney at Harrahs Sun AM and finished 4th nice money. That evening took a helicopter tour of Strip at night. I recommend this as I found special of $99 for 2 and this was an amazing tour. If you have never been on a heli-ride ,I am deathly-scared of heights,but i found it did not bother me at all Beautiful lights and ride. took a Cab to Fremont $18 and enjoyed light show at night. Golden Nugget casino,Binions all were fun casinos,But as previous reviews I personally prefer Strip to downtown. On Tuesday did Price is Right Live @ Ballys and had a Blast. I was actually 1st name called to contestants row and I managed to get on stage with my bid of $1. Ended up winning 4 prizes. at end of show i was given cash option which being in Vegas I accepted. Altogether great deal for cost of ticket. Also saw Improv at Harrahs. Very funny comedians,Drink prices normal price. $9 for Long Island $3 for beer. Love Harrahs and Location.Cannot beat place on strip.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel ok for the $”
Reviews.Author: marriedtowine
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at Harrahs on a gambling trip with a friend. In my opinion, you get what you pay for. For 2 guys who were at the tables at least 8 hrs. a day spending an average of $75 per night (50 weeknights 120 weekend night), Harrahs was OK. If I were traveling with my wife, I would spend the extra $ and stay at the Wynn, Bellagio or the 4 Seasons. The location was good, the service was good (especially being able to check in at the airport) and the dealers were friendly. The food however, was definitely lacking. The buffet had long lines for "cafeteria" food. The new Italian restaurant seemed to have recently opened and was decorated nicely. However, the food and the service were compairable to a really bad chain restaurant with inflated pricing (4 beers, 2 apps, 2 entrees = 125.00 + tip). If you want a "decent" bottle of wine and don't want to drop a C note bring your own. If $ doesn't matter, they have a few nice reds on the list like current vintage Solaia for 400. The best dinning value I found was the breakfast buffet at the Bellagio for $15 (be there by 10:00 or wait in line). Bottom line!! If your going with some friends and want to gamble, save the $ and stay at Harrahs. If your going for a trip with someone special, stay at one of the above mentioned. Also, no matter where you stay remember to award good service with a little $. Remember, you get what you pay for!!

Reviews.Title: “Reviewers must be crazy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If I see one more person who says that a hotel in Las Vegas is to gambling oriented im going to cry. Im not sure if they realized what Las Vegas is! Ive stayed at Harrahs numerous times and found every experience enjoyable. If you have to wait in line even five minutes to check in someone was there handing you water bottles. The comps are fabulous I havent paid for a room since the first time I stayed and I basically stick to penny slots. The bufft is by far the best food ever. For a picky big city girl I find the decor and fun atmosphere of Harrahs just right. I dont know what you people are doing in Vegas if you spend that much time in your room anyway.

Reviews.Title: “harrah's-won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: PaluetteandJoe
Reviews.Content: So disappointed! This was our 1st trip to Vegas & Harrah's was soooo disappointing. The room was non- smoking--- but it was so stale, the towels, the sheets, all smelled from smoke. We were in the Mardi Gras Tower & we over looked a roof & air conditioning units. And the room was so small!!!The closet space was inefficient & the hangers did not fit on the rods. We will not stay at Harrah's on our next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Was Pretty Good - Love Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrahs for the weekend of June 2-4. Our room was very nice and clean, no complaints - except for the view, but oh well, we weren't in our room that much anyway. I do not recommend the buffet, very yucky! We ate breakfast at the Cafe one morning, and that was good, but pricey for breakfast, oh well, your in Vegas. I highly recommend the entertainment with the dualing pianos, saw some funny singing men that took requests all night. They were great. I also HIGHLY recommend the Improv - we saw funny man BOB MARLEY (the comedian, not the dead singer) and he was WONDERFUL - he will be back to do more shows in September.......so funny! The pool area was small for the size of the hotel, and the little cups of frozen drinks were $8 each, but they were good, and met some funny guys in the pool that were there for a bachelor party. All in all, we had a great time, and yes there are better places to stay on the strip, but Harrahs was just fine and we would stay here again.....just so we could go see BOB MARLEY.....hahah he still makes me laugh!!

Reviews.Title: “Not for me”
Reviews.Author: Massingberd
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 night stay at Harrah’s in Vegas and I have to say I wouldn’t really want to stay there again. The room was really small and was desperately in need of a refurb. It just felt really tatty and dirty and we didn’t really like spending too much time there. This was the general impression that we got from the hotel, it all looks a bit tired and when you compare it to some of the other newer resorts it really fails into insignificance. On the plus side though we did get a really cheap deal with Expedia for this hotel so we didn’t waste loads of money on it. There is also so much to do in Vegas that if you’re looking for somewhere just to sleep that is cheap then Harrah’s is an ok choice. The location is also really good as it’s right on the central strip, but with hindsight I would definitely prefer to pay a bit more and get a better standard of accommodation, particularly given how much choice there is in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Unsafe”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: So we arrived at Harrah's on Friday and checked out on Sunday. The people were nice at the front desk, but the hotel is definitely not somewhere I would like to stay again. The rooms do not have a safe and we mysteriously had $140 missing from my room. I'm assuming it was either somebody on the staff or the room next to us. The door between the rooms was not locked upon our arrival and we didn't realize it until the money was missing. While searching our room, we found a used condom, stains in the carpet that were probably semen, and lots of dust. We let hotel security know that there was money missing from our room, but it was one of those things where they took a report and told us to call back in three days. Why are we going to call back? Is something going to magically appear? I'm definitely not pleased with the hotel and would tell others to avoid this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the worst choice!”
Reviews.Author: Orthoram
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's when we were in Las Vegas for a convention. Out of all the hotels this was one of the worst. As soon as you enter the smell of urine, cigarette and Ozium hit you. You have to wait too long in the line just to check in or check out. The staff don't care when you have a problem and they wouldn't move their pinky to help you. The managers are condscending and rude. (They are called VIPs... yeah right!!!) The rooms are small and overpriced. Concierge is clueless about the town. The only dept that was working in this hotel was housekeeping for rooms. There is no security. Don't even consider using the business center unless you want to go broke. The service is always awful. They treat you like garbage at the restaurants and even worse at the front desk. That is if you can wait in the line for a long time and get in. If you go there trust me you will spend most of your time at another hotel like Bellagio, Mandalay Bay, Venetian, Mirage, Treasure Island or Ceasers so do yourself a favor stay away from Harrah's and book your room in any of these other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's Was Perfect for Us”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights in Harrah's last week. Arrived on Saturday, checked in at baggage claim at the airport (and a lousy airport too, but that's another subject). Stayed in Room 2328 in the Carnival Tower. Room was perfect, not too big, not too small, but clean and neat, with very new looking furnishings and bedding. Bathroom was tiled and very clean, including the corners and other places where dirt accumulates when the maids don't do their jobs. Not a problem here. Service was fine. We mostly slept and showered in the room and not much else. Hot water and water pressure were great. Maid service was good. Left her $2 each day and never even saw her. But the room was cleaned and bedding changed every day. The only complaint I have with the hotel is the small pool. A hotel of this size should have a pool at least 4 or 5 times larger. I would stay here again if I were coming back to Las Vegas. But probably won't, as it's reputation of having lots of things to do is way overrated. Gambling is about all there is to do, except for overpriced shows that don't really use up that much time.

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Trip: April 30 Thru May 2, 2006. Stayed at Harrah's, Carnival Tower, room with a view. Room was clean, but the view was terrible. Large pipes below, & we had to crook neck to see Treasure Island. Reser-vations were made in 2/2006. The cost of room was $270+tax. When we arrived at 11pm, the price was changed, but I had my confirmation from internet. Gambled at Harrahs, slots tight, Flamingo, slots tight, Ceasars, slots tight. All of those mentioned are Harrah properties. Rio, was like a party, & slots were not as tight. Food at the Harrah's 24 hr cafe was fine. Slots at Goldcoast were kind to us. My favorite place, "The Wynn". This place is beautiful, warm, & friendly. Slots were kind to us, and we were comped 2 buffets (19.95 each) with are new casino cards. This is the place to stay & play. Upon departure we received from Harrahs $68 off are bill. Not much for the amount lost in gambling at all their properties. The Deuce $5 pass for 24 hrs is a deal, but be prepared to wait for it. Downtown, Golden Nugget, beautiful. Binions is a dump. Forget downtown, & go see the Wynn!!!!!! Had a good time, weather was wonderful, & food was delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs”
Reviews.Author: PCMA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrahs in Las Vegas on 5/11/2006. If you like noise and young adult drinking this is the place for you. Between the two rock bands and the intoxicated young people it was almost unbearable. The room we stayed in was newly remodeled and was very nice. The staff that we had contact with were all very pleasant and helpfull. We have stayed at this hotel for many years but not again untill they get rid of the reasons for the high noise level

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed hotel”
Reviews.Author: jtona
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Vegas where I stayed at Harrahs from Sun 4/30-Wed 5/3 and I must say It was just what I thought it would be, A wonderful time. After reading the reviews I has no expectations tohis property. I knew from previous visits where it was located, so I was excited just to be in the middle of ALL the action. So, here goes my review. Upon arrival at airport approximately 230pm, the Hotel checkin at airport was VERY LONG. It spread all the way to beginning of baggage claim so, I opted to checkin at hotel, and Boy was this alot better. Got to hotel and there was only 3 ppl in line at 3pm ..very Fast check-in..Once i got to hotel, checkin to hotel room 10 minutes top. I booked a great deal with total rewards card $80 night for 3 nights, and I got just the room i expected. I did not ask for an upgrade, the deskperson asked if i wanted 1 or 2 beds and i chose 1, after a brief computer look-up i got rom 442 in the mardi gras tower. when i got to room it was just as expected. A regular Hotel room. Basic furnishings, wet bar, armoire w/ironing board, and Bathroom. I checked and sheets were clean and linens were clean too. TV channels are scarce, but do you really watch alot of TV in Vegas. I only needed room to sleep and shower. Did here a little noise in halls but overall not too bad. My room overloooked the Air conditioning unit as you will see in my photos. On my last night, new people checked in next door and they were very loud thru connecting door. no much noise proofing. The casino is Just like all the ohers. Smokey, loud, but thats is fun. Th drink service was Very good. The cocktailers were around every few minutes so I did not have to wait at all, every day i played. IMHO I thought the buffet was excellent for the money. I started with Sushi and Sweet and sour chicken, Then i had Crab legs w/fried shrimp and scallops. after that course I had Prime rib with Horeradish sauce and corn on the cob, and finally for dessert i had Creme Brulee and bread pudding. Excellent value at 19.99. I also ate at the cafe around 10pm one night and Marble rye patty melt was excellent. Finally slots were very tight. I saw 1 winner, Laady playing .25 slots. she was playing .75 a pull and won $225 1 pull then 5pulls later won $932. I just laughed as I was losing pull after pull. The Dualing Pianos and carnaval Bar are very nice. The Twins were Great and The outside bar was Hopping every night. So if you are looking for Location and Price with no firills,Harrahs is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Good....Not So Bad”
Reviews.Author: wahineman
Reviews.Content: First bit of advice.....Ask for a room that doesn't face the pool! Our first night was spent listening to the drone of some very loud music coming from the pool area. This lasted until 3:00 am. Of course the next day we changed to a different room in a different tower that was much quieter. Remember that there are 2 towers, The Mardi Gras, which is older, and The Carnival, which has larger rooms. A big problem at Harrah's is lack of affordable food options having no food courts. To have even a simple breakfast costs you dearly, especially at the coffee shop. Aside for the high prices, the service was horrible. We had to wait in a long line and even after we were seated it took forever to be served our food. This happened more than once so we ended up eating most of our meals outside the hotel. This was not so much a problem for us having rented a car but I could see this being a hassle if one were to stay strictly at the hotel. Now for the positive. Our dinner at "The Range Steak House" was superb and the service outstanding. One of the best steakhouses in Vegas...and we've been to a lot. The gambling environment is excellent and the gaming employees know how to make you feel welcome. All in all we would probably stay there again if the price is right. During peak season there are better values for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place Good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Harrah's has been around awhile and is overshadowed - literally - by many of the newer properties. The design and rooms are a little stodgy - nothing to write home about, but not bad either. The pool area is decent. It's best asset may be its location in the dead center of the strip. Basically I would rate the whole experience a solid okay. If you get a deal on the internet (I paid $80 at the last minute) then I think you'll be satisfied. Otherwise you might want to head to one of the newer properties nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the location, but inqure about noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: musikahl
Reviews.Content: We went with Harrah's because it was more reasonably priced than many of the other strip hotels. The best part about staying at Harrah's is definitely the location. It's right across the street from Caesar's and just south of the Venetian. The casino itself seemed to always be crowded and a little smokier than other casinos, so we didn't spend quite as much time there as at the other hotel casinos. We arrived early, and the woman at the front desk was super-friendly and we didn't have any problems with checking in early. The room was average - a bit rough around the edges but still clean and comfortable. I was really pleased with our view - overlooking the pool and looking south down the strip. However, that view proved to come with a price - it also overlooked the gazebo under which a band played pretty much non-stop from about noon until 2AM. Luckily, we were up late most nights, so it didn't bother us too much, but if you're a light sleeper, go to bed early, or like to take afternoon naps, don't stay in the South side of the Mardi Gras tower! The pool area was nice though - lots of loungechairs for sunbathing. If the price was right again, I would stay here again, but I would request a quieter room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: andipugs
Reviews.Content: While not quite as extravagant as the Bellagio, Wynn, or Venetian, it still provided a great experience. The location is right in the middle of the strip which makes it very convenient while taking in the sights. The room was very clean, updated and also very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Fun Fun”
Reviews.Author: foxywood3
Reviews.Content: First time staying at Harrah's, and all here had me scared!!! I brought earplugs for the noise, but never heard any and did not use them! The hotel and slot staff and the dealers are fun and friendly, every single one!!! The housekeeping staff on the 17th floor of the Mardi Gras Tower were quiet and respected the Privacy Please sign. Yeah, the view of the heating vents is yukky and the bathtub needs to be reglazed, but it was clean and the SHEETS were clean and the bed was comfy, that's my personal priority. Had room service 3 times, it was very good, it's expensive, but it's room service and the majority of us think nothing of throwing 40 into a machine we don't even know how to play and have no chance of winning because oops, I just bet the 40 credits on one line, oh well, let's find another machine!!! Please see Steve in the Spa for a WONDERFUL massage, he is great! The Spa itself was nothing extraordinary, I had my massage, used the whirlpool, steam and sauna but showered back in my room because the showers weren't that functional and the products were really cheap (99 cent a can White Rain hairspray? What are they thinking?) The entire hotel and casino is quite sprawling and I don't know how the senior citizens manage to find their way around as well as they do, because I got mixed-up and lost quite a bit! The comedy show at the Improv was just HYSTERICAL, it was a great crowd and the 3 comics were, well I already said it, HY-STERICAL!!! I will go back, friendly staff is a winner everytime!!!

Reviews.Title: “Agree with "At a price" review...”
Reviews.Author: BethAnnP
Reviews.Content: We must've had the SAME room as you - because our room also overlooked the A/C and generators!! If you were 4 floors above that or more - the view of the strip was nice (my mother in law was in that room). Anyway - the computers were broken when we checked in, so we got what we got & were allowed to change it - but it would've taken FOREVER since it took so long to check-in with the paper route. Each desk clerk had a thick stack of paper listing each room & would check off each room as they booked it. The computers were working later as our trip progressed but there was no point in changing rooms at that time because we had already unloaded all our stuff in the room with no view. Either way - hotel was nice, room was fine, casino (as they all usually are) was SMOKY! Food in the one restaurant where we ate breakfast every morning b/c we were being lazy in looking for other choices was great. Inexpensive, good food and in our hotel, which was great. All in all - it was a good trip. but as I have mentioned in another review for another strip hotel - I would stay more centrally located - like at Paris or Bellagio, if you can afford it. it is such a huge place and just much easier to be close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “best service on the strip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Vegas many times and have stayed at several hotels. We keep going back to Harrah's as they have the best service on the strip. We have decided we will no longer shop around trying out the different hotels when we always enjoy Harrah's stay the most. We are going back June 2006 and went on line to Harrah's website booking our room using our player's card. We were able to get quite the deal for $190 for the entire week. Not bad for low rollers. Harrah's rooms are always clean with a thorough cleaning staff to ensure your stay is pleasant. As for location, you are in the middle of everything with many of the larger casinos in short walking distance. As for food, Harrah's is fine for late night dining, otherwise we like to try other places with more choices and better quality of food. My husband loves the Carnival Court and stays out there most of the night, thoroughly entertained. I am a slot player and Harrah's casino has plenty to offer. Don't forget to get a player's card and reap the same hotel rate that we are. Can't wait for our vacation!

Reviews.Title: “We had a blast...”
Reviews.Author: CannibalsFan
Reviews.Content: Got an excellent Internet Email-Promotion Rate on Thanksgiving - $49. Checked-in late due to arriving from Europe on that day. Were told that there were no more Non-smoking rooms and were at once upgraded to a Non-Smoking Full Suite with Whirlpool. What a deal! Staff was very friendly, Casino is nice. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, fun casino”
Reviews.Author: Spike1958
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights begining March 16. Hotel comped the first and last nights based on prior casino play. Room was clean, reasonable size but didn't plan on spending much time there anyhow. The casino is one of the more customer friendly and the dealers were tops. The atmosphere at the tables is less uptight than some of the other strip casinos. The poker room was better than expected. The Range steak house was not worth the prices.....but that would be my only real complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Be very careful what you sign”
Reviews.Author: ckrakgirl
Reviews.Content: I booked a HotDeal through Harrah's site with reasonable rates while I attended a government conference 27-31 March. During my flight there I developed a migraine and just wanted to get to my room and take medicine so that I could attend the conference the next morning. I signed some papers, got my key, went to my room and slept. Check out was rather hurried due to a line and hurrying to catch a flight, so I discovered later that the rates I was quoted and actually charged were significantly different (higher). I called the hotel and was told (after some time on hold) that I had agreed to the rate when I checked in. I explained that I did not feel well when I checked in and should be charged the original rates. I was never given a clear answer as to why the rates changed and pretty much told "too bad you signed a piece of paper that says otherwise". Very poor customer relations

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience at Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: Starfire27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at Harrah's (March 27-30) and had a wonderful all-around experience. Hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly. I became ill in the casino and help was there within minutes, providing professional attention, advising me of my options and not leaving my side until they were sure I had recovered. Management followed up the next day by telephone, and the security chief himself located me in the casino later that night and asked me how I was doing. I was very impressed and made to feel more like a person than just a guest/player. Our room on the 16th floor of the Carnaval Tower was immaculate and comfortable, with plenty of room to move around, a decent supply of towels and a partial strip view. (Unless you're traveling over the strip by airplane, standing on top of the statue at the Venetian, or are an extremely high roller, a partial strip view is the best you can hope for; besides, a clean, comfortable and safe place to sleep is far more important than the view.) Amenities included an in-room safe, hair dryer, iron and ironing board, clock radio, desk, table and chairs, mini-refreshment bar and fridge, low-end lotion, soap and shampoo, full-length mirror, television and telephone with voice mail, nice plumpy pillows (extras in the closet) and a comfortable bed. Temperatures were comfortable. The bathroom was roomy. Security is visible in the casino and in the hotel, "privacy please" signs are respected, and the room was very quiet. Even when other rooms were being cleaned, I never heard any noise. Corridors are wide and well-lit, and the elevator arrived right away. Harrah's is right smack in the middle of the strip, and the cool March weather made walking long distances a pleasure, although it was a bit windy. A jacket, hoodie or sweater is a must in the early morning and after sundown at this time of year. Buy decent souvenir tee shirts and fleeces at Casino Royale next door ($5 for the tees, $10 for the fleeces). There are plenty of fair-priced restaurants nearby, including a Denny's where you can carbo-load for next to nothing and not feel hungry until dinner time. We ate twice at The Cafe at the hotel (one dinner, one breakfast) and found the food plentiful, good and decently-priced - $11.99 for a respectable prime rib, potato and vegetable, served with warm rolls. Service was a tad slow at dinner, but the waiter apologized for the delay. There was a line at breakfast time, but once seated, service was quick and the food was hot and good. I'm mainly a slot player and found plenty of machines of all denominations and types to play on. Harrah's Carnaval Court is a fun place to visit; although it's mainly a shopping plaza, there is live music and entertaining bartenders at night, and the crowd always seems to be having a good time. Harrah's free shuttle to its sister property, the Rio, comes every twenty minutes or so. Plan on taking it for the free show, which includes clowns and mimes who engage the audience and toss mardi gras beads, a short stage revue, and the magnificent overhead floats. We had dinner at the Twisted Kilt there, more a pub/bar than a restaurant and a bit noisy, but with interesting food and very affordable. At the moment, it seems that Vegas is "under construction." There are hotels, vacation properties and condos going up all over the place. Because of that, you will sometimes find your walking areas are narrow, but foot traffic flows smoothly. Road traffic is a different story; Las Vegas Boulevard ALWAYS seems congested, and you can make better time on foot if you're touring the strip than you can in a car. Make sure to observe walk/don't walk signs, though, because vehicles proceed as soon as their signal turns green. There are a number of pedestrian walkways which will take you over the roadways; in some cases, they are the only way to get across the street, and you can use them to get great views of the strip and orient yourself. In spite of the construction and the traffic, though, Vegas is noticeably clean. Be aware that everything is further away than it looks. Ditch the heels and thongs in favor of comfortable walking shoes. The public bus comes quickly and for $2 and about twenty minutes of your time, you can ride all the way downtown to Fremont Street for a taste of old Vegas refined. Make sure to visit some of the smaller casinos there, as well as the flashier establishments like the Golden Nugget; the little places have a charm all their own. The double-decker buses can get crowded and you may have to stand, but they're clean and pleasant to ride in, and a bus ride is a great way to see the whole strip and the area that lies between it and downtown. The bus makes stops at all the hotels from the Stratosphere to New York New York. Harrah's has a monorail stop, as well, as do several hotels; all are clearly marked. Time share sellers are all over Vegas, but all you need to say is no, thanks (or nothing at all); they don't hound you if you make it clear you're not interested. You'll also encounter a large number of people hawking girls for sale; these folks stand in groups on the sidewalk and snap their literature to get the attention of every guy who passes, even if they have to reach across his spouse or girlfriend to do it. Once again, you need only walk past them. It's true they can be annoying, but it's all a part of the cachet of the town. During the day at MGM Grand, you can catch a glimpse of lions descended from Leo the Lion (of MGM movie logo fame) as they play with their trainers in a specially-designed habitat before being returned to the ranch where they live. At night, be sure to take in the free entertainment. Cross the street to the Mirage to see the volcano, which goes off every hour, or walk down to the Bellagio to see the dancing waters; they "perform" every fifteen minutes or so. Stay to watch more than one show, since they are synched to a different song every time. Ooohs and Aaaahs are guaranteed. You can secure half-price tickets for same-day shows at the nearby outlets; you may not get the best seats, or even the best shows, but you'll certainly be entertained. Jimmy Buffet's Margheritaville also has a short live show which you can enjoy while you sip their signature drinks or dive into an astounding-sized plate of Volcano Nachos so immense you won't be able to finish it before your entree arrives. I've been to Vegas three times now and have stayed at three different center-strip hotels. I had good experiences at all of them, but I'm going back to Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “Forgot What Got Them Here”
Reviews.Author: rubberman9
Reviews.Content: 1.Never replaced shampoo or Lotion 2.Never refilled mini bar(I called 3 times) 3.Coffee shop food and service terrible 4.At their new property,Caesars staff was incompetant and rude. I believe they are unable to handle the new larger Harrahs and are forgetting how they got so many loyal customers.I have e-mailed and faxed in much greater detail the problems I encountered.They have yet to respond.They spend an awful lot of money in mailings to get and keep a customer,when sometimes just a quick phone call will do. Maybe they read this?

Reviews.Title: “Is there a better deal in Las Vegas? I think not.”
Reviews.Author: SimonSez
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrah's over Valentine's Day with my spouse and another couple. Three nights at Harrah's for total of just under $110.00 per room including tax. Rooms are clean, functional and hotel is located right in the middle of everything. Food is fine; service is better than most Vegas hotels. For someone who goes to Las Vegas to see the sights and the shows and gamble only when bored, the location of Harrah's is perfect. Last stay was at the Tropicana and although the pool area at the Trop is nice, the rooms are a little tattered. Not a problem at Harrah's. Everything is well maintained and it has a very relaxed feel. You can walk and watch at Venetian, Caesars, Mirage, Bellagio, Wynn, Paris and others, but if you want a nice comfortable place to rest and relax, I recommend Harrah's. Order rooms online as a member of their "club" and I'm told deals are even better.

Reviews.Title: “Smokey smelling Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mellieann
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights during Nascar. Mardi Gras tower, 15th (top) floor. Looked right across to the rooms at the IP Hotel. Could hear the thumping bass of the band down at Carnaval Court until past 3 am. Extremely thin walls between room and corridor, which surprised us as they advertised sound proof walls in their rooms! The room door wasn't sealed as I could see a bright line of light beaming into the room when I got up to use the bathroom in the wee hours. Chronic dripping tap in tub, what a waste of water in the desert LOL! No bath mat - no matter, we just used a towel instead. Bathroom tissue is of the cheapest grade ever - visited many other casinos and restaurants on the strip and I was surprised at how cheap Harrah's is to their guests. Bedside lamp was missing a bulb, it was never replaced. Ate at Flavors for breakfast, (it was $8 with a $5 off coupon)it was okay, regular trough food, would not pay full price. Room was cleaned at about 2 -3 pm. I think this hotel has seen better days, when it was a Holiday Inn. The air quality in the casino is on par with the cheaper casinos on the strip. We had a good time except for our hotel stay - paid over $450 for 3nights, one night over $200 for a king bed in a "premium room".

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: task13
Reviews.Content: We visited Harrahs Las Vegas from Feb 28 thru March 3. Check in was a breeze, our room wasn't quite ready but we checked our luggage & headed for the casino. The machines were pretty tight this time. We ended up on the 27th floor with a great view of Caesars & Bellagio and the mountains to the west. We've stayed at Harrahs' several times in the past & love it's location. The Carnival Court is a real fun time. We ordered drinks & appetizers & charged everything to our room. We tried the buffet called Flavors for lunch and would highly recommend it. There is such a wide variety of foods you couldn't go away hungry. The dessert selection is very good too. They even have several flavors of ice cream and you can build your own sundae or have a waffle cone. We also charged this lunch to our room. The reason to charge things to your room can be very benefical because as you use your Total Rewards cards in the slots (or at the table games) you can build up comps. We ended up getting our 3 nights for free and also our meals free. Oh - also charged a breakfast in the newly remodeled cafe one morning. When we checked out, our bill was only $3. It pays to use your card. The only drawback I can say is that several of the slot machines need to be replaced. It bothered me that many had cracked glass and the reels were so faded - I love to see all the vibrant colors, sometimes that's what draws me to a machine. They really needed an overhaul or just get new machines. Several of the stools by the machines were very dirty and had cigarette holes in them - not very appealing to sit down. Check out was very easy - no line at 1pm on Friday afternoon. Overall, Harrahs is a great place to stay, if they could just get some new slot machines! Oh, one more thing - pay the price $9 (but can get $2 off discount) to go up to the observation area of the Eiffel Tower in Paris. The view is spectacular at night! Lights as far as you can see. The fountains at Bellagio take on a whole new perspective from that height. So does the helicopter flying down the strip at your eye level! Very cool.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Harrahs with one exception”
Reviews.Author: msmills2u
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Harrahs on Feb 26 on my second night in Las Vegas. Check in was easy and courteous mainly because I was courteous to her and she thanked me for it. I had a non smoking king room in the Carnival Tower. I loved the room. It was VERY clean. My view was terrible but I didn't stay in my room except to sleep. The location was perfect. I felt very safe in the casinos, being a single female traveling alone. I don't have any complaints except for one. The business center is closed on Sundays and didn't open til Monday morning at 7 am. I need to check in for my flight that left the next morning online at 2 am. IF I had one complaint that would be the one.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's with a not so good Bang”
Reviews.Author: BellaMia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's Feb 20-22 - what a trip - we were given a good room on the 23rd floor of the Carnival Tower - non-smoking wing tho it smelled like smoke anyway! We were awakened at 5 am by a huge explosion - scared us to death. Called down to the desk to find out what was going on - the person said hold on and never came back. We had to learn about the problem on the news. A gunman had holed up on the 20th or so floor and the big explosion was from the police blowing out the window. After I called many more times, we were told by staff that we could not leave our rooms and that we would be notified when everything was over - No one ever notified us. Fox News did. We enjoyed playing in the casino and the bar staff was great, but the security staff is not so good checking ID's for one set of elevators, but not the other. I don't blame the hotel management for what happened; I blame them for poor communication and poor guest relations.

Reviews.Title: “A Nightmare from beginning to end!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrah's Feb 15-16th with my sister. Check-in seemed to go fine, we parked our car in their garage, hauled all our luggage up to our room and... the key card wouldn't work! Very annoyed we kept trying but had no luck. I walked down the hall towards the elevator and was getting ready to call the front desk when a bell boy came down the hall. I told him we had just checked in and our card wasn't working. He said 'aw man, I hope it's not the battery' checked our paperwork that showed the room we were in, used his card to let us in and told us to just let the front desk know our cards weren't working, they must not of been activated properly. So we proceded to get ourselves all settled in, unpacked some of our toiletries, used the restroom, and hung out for awhile looking at brochures and relaxing. We were in there probably 30 mins and decided it was time to 'hit the strip'. But first we need to stop by the desk and get our cards activated, no big deal right? WRONG!!! We told the man at the desk the situation and that our key wouldn't work and he asked to see my paperwork and ID which I gave to him, and he asked if the room was in my name and I said yes. He then took out this little purple strip of paper that was in the folder with the room key and asked if we knew the womans name that was on it. We said no and we had no idea what that paper was even for and I thought the womans name on it was the lady that checked me in. He explained that no it should of been my name on it and it was very strange but somehow when I checked in I was handed the wrong paper. That was why our key wouldn't work is because we were going to the wrong room. We explained that we went to the room we were told to go to and how were we to know any different! After asking us if we had been in the room long and if we had touched much and we said yes we had laid on the beds and used the restroom, he still made us move to a different room! He said he was sorry but the room we went to was registered to the lady who's name was on the paperwork and we were supposed to be in room xxx so we were going to have to move! Not only that but because it was a 'security issue' security would have to open the room for us and we had to identify our luggage before we could get it. So he called security and told them to meet us up there, gave us corrct paperwork, apologized again, etc. We hurried back up to our original room assuming security would already be there, but no one was in sight. By now our patience was extremely thin and I found it inexcuseable to have to wait for security, I picked up the house phone in the hall and angrily explained the situation and was put on hold, then security finally decided to saunter on up so I hung up. Security proceeded to watch our every move while we gathered our belongings making us feel practically like criminals. The one guy thought it was very weird we had to move to another room and told us to talk to the manager cause it wasn't right how we were treated. We agreed so we did stop by the managers desk where he apologized and comped our first night's stay. Now all that would of been good and fine if the rest of our stay had gone well, the one night free did go a long way towards making up for all our aggravation although it still stunk to start our night off with such a bad start. However we continued to have a bad experience at this hotel! The first morning there we had just got up and my sister was taking a shower when suddenly this very loud, obnoxious alarm goes off. I called the front desk and told them there was this hideous alarm going off and she asked if we were smoking and I said no and she said she'd look into it. Then we opened the door and there was a maid in the room across from us and she said everything is fine it's nothing to worry about. Ok well that's good to know, however it still took them a good 10 minutes to turn the blasted thing off, it was horrible! Later that day we came back to our room in the afternoon to relax for a little while and I went to get some ice to drink ice water and their ice machine was broken! It may seem like a minor thing but it was just one more irritation. Then to top it all off you would expect after such a bad stay to at least get good cutoomer service while checking out, but oh no not at Harrah's! I was all prepared to compain about everything that went wrong but when the woman checking us out asked how our stay was and I replied 'not very good' she just said 'oh, not very good huh'. I couldn't believe it! A normal response would of been oh I'm so sorry what was the problem? not 'oh not very good'! Then when I got my receipt I couldn't tell what had been charged to my card so I said 'can I get a total on here' and she snapped at me 'it's right there plain as day!' Well no, it was not! It had a charge with a minus sign, a room charge, the buffet we ate at Rio and then another charge with a minus sign. At the bottom where it said total it said zero. There was no total on the bill! I wanted to make darn sure the bill was correct and our one night had been comped so I went over to the manager again but he was busy with another customer. So finally another guy asked if he could help us and he explained our bill but when I said the lady checking us out had been rude he didn't respond so we just got the heck out of there! I honestly have never had such a bad experience at a hotel in my life and even if I was offered a free stay there I would hesitate to return!

Reviews.Title: “Good!”
Reviews.Author: Oklatraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Harrahs from Feb 12-14th, 2 nights. We used a promo code that offered 2 nights free. When making the reservation we looked into the rate for the 1st night, Feb 11th a Saturday, however it was $139 which was more than we were wanting to spend, so we booked at the MGM for a promo rate of $59 for just one night. When we checked in I asked for the Mardi Gras tower as I had heard that it was a little nicer than the Carnival tower. The lady said no that the Carnival tower was better, so we went with the Carnival tower. We actually liked Harrahs better than MGM. We liked the smaller hotel/casino. The rooms at Harrahs were just as nice as MGM, but maybe a little smaller but not a problem for us. When we checked in we ask for a room with a view, however they didn't really have one. Perhaps it was because we were getting the room for free, not sure. But it was OK. Unfortunately, I got sick the first night at Harrahs. The next day, Monday, I spent all day in bed with the flu and bronchitis. Lets just say this is the most I have stayed in bed in Vegas! But the bed was comfortable and the shower felt great. We had made reservations at Battista's for Monday night to celebrate Valentines Day, however, we had to cancel since I was sick. This was very disappointing as I was looking forward to it. Sunday night, before I got sick, we ate at Toby Keith's Bar & Grill. I had Nacho's and my husband had chicken fried steak. His was good but I didn't care for my nacho's. Meat tasted like it had taco seasoning sprinkled on it. But we did enjoy the live house band. The dancing is what brought on the bronchitis. :( The only problem that I can say that was only a minor problem was that the lighting in the bathroom was a low yellowish light. Not bright enough. Other than that, I have no complaints. We ordered room service one night, I was not hungry but my husband ordered a hamburger. He said it was very good. I just had a bowl of fresh fruit. I think the cost of the hamburger was $7.99 including fries. There is a refreshment center cabinet in the room and the stuff inside is expensive. M & M's, peanuts, crackers, coke's, etc. My husband took one item out, a bag of peanuts in the shell, just to look at them and then put them back. When we got ready to check out, we noticed there was a $7 charge on the bill. We called to the front desk and told them we took the item out but then put it back in. So they took it off the bill without a problem. So it is touch sensitive. Not everything in it is $7 though. Some less, not sure how much though because the brochure that is suppose to be posted was not, I had just ask about the prices at the front desk. The parking garage was easy to get to and of course it was free. Check-in and out was easy and no lines to speak of. Friendly service too! The slots weren't paying out too well, but then who's are? We didn't enjoy our stay at Harrahs only because I was sick. But we will go back and stay at Harrahs again. Even if it's not free. But I wouldn't pay more than like $79-89 a night. Location is great! Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Not for Non-smokers”
Reviews.Author: lovetotraveloften
Reviews.Content: Even the non-smoking floors and rooms smell very strongly of smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms in the Mardi Gras Tower were so small”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room in the Mardi Gras tower that was small, with little walking space between the bed and the entertainment center. The bathroom was small with old fixtures. The bath tub caulking had mold. And last but not least, there was a walk in closet that was approximately eight feet by eight feet. I am not sure what we were suppose to do with the closet. We didnt bring that much clothes. This room was at best a mediocre Holiday Inn type room. At $160, I will never go back here.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: mrnordy
Reviews.Content: Had a great time. Cafe not so good for breakfest but who cares. Could use more table games. Location is great. Clint Holmes show was terrific, super talent. Stay away from Casino Royale next store it's a dump. Will stay again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great at Harrahs”
Reviews.Author: kbpete
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas from Jan 4th-Jan.8th. We stayed at Harrahs, and had a junior suite. I will say, everything, and everyone at Harrahs was wonderful. The room was great, the people were great, the food was great, and the gambling was great. We found that our best luck was at Harrahs. We rented a car, so we just about went everywhere. But, we always came back to Harrahs. We actually won there the most. The food in Vegas is just plain awsome. We ate at the Paris Buffet, and the Wynn Buffet for Dinner. Those two dinner buffets are just wonderful.. Everyone must go to those 2 dinner buffets, and trust me, you wont have a bad meal. We ate at Harrahs breakfast buffet, and it was just great. You wont be disappointed in those choices. We had a great time, and am looking forward to going back. We usually go to Vegas at least 1 time a year, sometimes more. Have a great time when you all go.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's "Our favorite good times spot."”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Harrah's on the strip in March of last year. I wish to say that this is a very nice hotel with great employees. They were courteous and everything about our five day trip was very enjoyable and even though we are not big gamblers they mailed us comps to come and stay with them. I also wish to say that there is a very nice reservation clerk Paul, who the previous year gave us outstanding service. I should have sent a letter to his supervisor and made mention of how very nicely we were treated by Paul. Here we were, two senior citizens at 1 o'clock in the am walking into Harrah's on a Sunday nite looking for a room just for one nite, as we had reservations at the Rio for the four following nites. He was friendly, funny and said he would check and see what he could do. (Now again I wish to mention we are not high rollers, we are the couple you see at the quarter machines, having a ball.) He came back and said "I have a surprise for you. We have a lovely suite available and you can have it for $ 79.00." Well we were give a beautiful two room suite with a jacuzzi and giant bathroom with a shower that you could put several people in. A gold phone was on the wall next to the toilet. This was some thing that I'm sure was for a high roller. But you can see how Harrah's goes above and beyond to make the tourist happy, be it the working class Joe, like Chuck and myself, or the high rollers. Harrah's and the Rio will always have us as repeat customers. As I write this, Chuck and I are planning our next trip and you can guess which casino will be seeing us. If you want a nice time with nice people Harrah's and Rio are our choice in Vegas. We have been going to Vegas for ten years now. We are currently planning our next trip and we have the Harah's calendar that gives us free rooms in hand. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located and decent...”
Reviews.Author: WindowPlease
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Harrah’s from Dec. 22- 25th was enjoyable and fun. The location on the strip cannot be beat and the staff were very friendly and helpful despite the busy time of the holidays. We checked in and got two non-smoking rooms in the newly remodeled Carnival Tower. I was a bit lost at first, and a staff member personally escorted me to the correct elevators. The rooms did not adjoin, but as someone said earlier, the walls are paper thin so you can really hear what’s going on next door. Since we were family it was ok, but I can imagine the inconvenience if you have rowdy neighbors. Also, the TV was a Zenith from the Ice Age. It barely worked and made a buzzing noise the whole time. I didn't bother calling the front desk, but it made me wonder about their recent "renovation". The room didn’t have the bells and whistles of other hotels on the strip, but the central location makes it worth staying there. I highly recommend The Café at Harrah’s. It has reasonably priced, tasty comfort food 24 hrs. a day like pizza, burgers, soups & salads. The newly renovated buffet called Flavors had its grand opening when we were there, but the prices were quite high. Breakfast starts at $12.99 and dinner is a whopping $18.99. There were no coupons or discounts floating around. In fact, upon check in, the only buffet coupons we got were for Rio and the Flamingo. Another plus about Harrah’s is that the Monorail stops there. For about $20, an all day pass gives you unlimited trips up and down the strip. Also, the Carnival Court outside has a small marketplace and is home to the Ghiradelli Ice Cream Parlour which is our favorite. We also had comped tickets to Clint Holmes. The theater was seedier than I expected, and initially we weren’t seated together since the show was “sold out”. Luckily, there were lots of open seats and we managed to get a table together. The casino was very tight and I didn’t win much on the slots 25c and $1 slots, but I saw at least two people hit on the Blazing 777 slots and win $1500. The casino is always packed and touted as “Best Slots in Vegas” although my experience was very different. At the Venetian next door I won $450 on the Blazing 777’s and also won $100 at Wynn. So all in all, Harrah’s was a nice place to stay, but not gamble. One final annoyance is the Fairfield Resort desk and showroom on the 2nd floor. You pass by it to go to the garage and Monorail. Pesky salespeople flaunt show-tickets and other free stuff to entice you to take tour of the Grand Desert Timeshare. It’s not worth the 2 hours of torture to get a free dinner, because the sales people are so pushy and grill you for information. Don’t’ be tempted by their so-called free gifts.

Reviews.Title: “Never go there again...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 non-smoking rooms 12/28,but called them ahead saying that we are running late,will arrive little late.When we arrived at 7:00 PM,we were told only smoking rooms are available.We were not ready to take the smoking rooms,so they told us to wait for 1hour for the non-smoking rooms to be cleaned.We waited for 1 hour and 30minutes,when we checked the status,person in the front desk told us to wait for another 30minutes.Then checked the status again,they asked for my mobile #,so they can call me once the room is ready.Its almost 2hours past,i talk to the manager,he said the room cleaning could take upto 4hours.Then i asked them to cancel my rooms and refund the money back,the manager went in and came back saying wait for 30minutes,if its not ready by then we will see what we can do.Finally i got my non-smoking rooms ready but after waiting for 2hours and 30 minutes.I will never go there again. 2days ago 12/26 i stayed in monte carlo,that place is very nice and $20 more than Harrahs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - terrible staff”
Reviews.Author: psmcdoug
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location. The quality of the staff was very dissappointing. Our plane was delayed so we placed 2 calls to the hotel the day of arrival to let them know we would be arriving late. This apparently was a waste of time considering we were told a room wasn't ready for us when we checked in at 1:00 in the morning. The staff told us it would be around an hour and a half wait. We already had a reservation for a non-smoking king room but they stated that only smoking rooms were available. We walked around the casino for an hour and a half - tired and jet lagged (arrived from Baltimore). After checking on the status of our room, the staff said it still wasn't ready and would be at least another hour. We asked to speak to the manager and after the check in staff member talked to her boss (he never came over), she told us they had another room for us. This all seemed to be a ploy to get vistors to walk around and spend money at the casino - we felt like we were buying a used car with all the run around we got. A very unpleasant experience. We were woken numerous times each morning by the noisy cleaning staff and staff walking the halls with 2 way radios turned up to full volume. The walls of the room were paper thin and you could hear everything that went on in the surrounding rooms. We placed the "do not disturb" sign out but we have never been disturbed by inconsiderate people so much on one trip. We highly recommend the Imperial Palace next door. It has the same great location and we have always been pleased with the staff and price of the room. IP may not look like much from the outside, the rooms are clean and it is quiet!! While our room at Harrah's was clean and the shower fairly decent, we would not stay there again. The tv only had a few mediocre channels - mostly advertising for Harrah's! Overall - very noisy and disappointing! They don't treat their customers with very high regard!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Harrahs”
Reviews.Author: lisa96hd
Reviews.Content: My trip was comped when booked, so I can't comment on pricing. I booked a deluxe room with a view on a high floor and without asking was upgraded to a Junior Suite in Carnival Tower 19th floor, the newer tower overlooking the Mirage volcano.
