The room was great, soft king bed, couch, 2 tables, chair, armoire and 2 large windows with a fabulous view. The room also had a fridge which was great. The bathroom was spacious and clean, great water pressue. The food is not that good, or at least what I would consider good being a southerner. The staff was friendly, no problems, no noise. I will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs is total garbage”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There were many problems... 1. The air conditioning. It ran constantly, and smelled like cheap air freshener. I tried to turn it off, and after a while, the smell subsided. But once you open the door, it resets, and the air turns back on!! Very gross smell!!!! 2. The ceilings are way too low. I am almost 7 feet tall, and had to duck to avoid hitting the fire sprinklers and air vents, etc, on the hallways. I now they are trying to maximize vertical space, but my god, what about us tall people! 3. The casino has such a low ceiling also, that the smoke is trapped closer to people. It is the smokiest of the casinos on the strip. I noticed in all the other casinos that I walked thru, that the smoke level was well less then 1/10 as much everywhere else! I will never stay at harrahs again, mostly because of the smelly air conditioning, and smoky casino... if they didn't have these two problems, I'd deal with the ducking, but cannot because of the other problems.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's: A must to avoid”
Reviews.Author: HomeGoneHome
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Harrah's for three nights with a conference, and we were disappointed by the facilities. First, the room in the Mardi Gras Tower was small, dark, and noisy. The "view" consisted of other high-rises, rooftop A/C equipment, and construction. Also, the room was without amenities. The TV offered only a dozen (mostly local) channels, but plenty of advertisements for Harrah's facilities. The bedside clock radio was inoperable. Not only was the room without a micro/fridge, there was neither in-room coffee nor daily newspaper. Second, Harrah's food services were disappointing. The continental breakfast in the business center was attractive, but limited. Two meals (one breakfast, one lunch) were offered at The Range, both of which were far below expectations. The menu, presentation, and service were on par with typical cafeteria fare. The Chinese restaurant offered tasty dishes, however service was inexplicably slow, and the food chilled quickly after it was served. Third, the common areas of Harrah's were less than accommodating. There was no place to sit unless one was gambling, eating or drinking. There was no complementary coffee or paper, even at the front desk. Most disappointing was the lack of pool/spa facilities. I was shocked that a resort with the renown of Harrah's didn't have a year around pool. The only positive comment I have for Harrah's is its central location on the strip. This, however, wouldn't be reason enough for me to consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's , a Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: PamS18
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at Harrah's on 12/5 and 12/6 and it was great. We stayed in a recently renovated room in the Carnival Tower and it was very nice. The casino was always busy and a lot of fun. I would stay there again without any worry about the accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “things have changed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: things have changed at Harrah's. The staff is not as friendly as in years past. the food is just ok at best. The range restuarnt is not good as in the past stays. The gaming tables have increased the min. bets. The slots are tighter than a riverboat casino. All in all ovoid Harrah's. Try another casino.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: PageantGuru
Reviews.Content: The rooms and the Mardi Gras tower in general seemed to have deteriorated considerably since I stayed there last year. There is quite a musty smell in the hotel. Furniture/bedding/draperies are run down. Had requested a room with a view but did not get it. In addition, there was quite a bit of noise in the tower. Workers seemed in complete disregard of the guests. I know Harrahs is acquiring a lot of property now, but I was extremely disappointed that they let their flagship Las Vegas hotel/casino get to such a low level.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: sallywaxx
Reviews.Content: Checked in and got a dirty room that needed a major overhaul. I complained and over an hour later was moved to another room with 70's decor-YUCK! Also, a girl working the VIP desk needs major customer service training!! She put me on hold for 25 minutes while she tried to find someone to help me-- I hung up because I thought she forgot about me and when I called back she very rudely said "It' s just going to take much longer now, so you better not hang up again." A guy named mark finally got on the phone and he was also unfriendly. mark didn't make me feel like a guest in the hotel...he made me feel like I was a problem. I checked out and moved to a better hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs best deal on The Strip”
Reviews.Author: marriedinvegas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrahs for two nights during August, 2005. We decided to hotel hop for a week as well as get married while in Vegas which is why we were only at Harrahs for 2 nights. Because of its central location on The Strip, everything is within decent walking distance from Harrahs. Everything about our stay there was perfect except I would not recommend the Carnival Buffet. We upgraded to a suite in the Carnival Tower and it was well worth it. The two room suite included a jacuzzi tub with a television which was a wonderful way to end the day. The casino seemed to be one of the more active casinos during the daytime hours and it was a lot of fun. Harrahs is definitely one of the better deals on The Strip and we would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay on the strip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we arrived from calgary at 1000 am and immediatly went to the harrah. we checked our luggage and went to check in. no lne up at that time, wonderful lady at checkin and up graded us to a suite. our room was large with a king bed, huge bathroom with jet tub and shower the furniture was old and chipped in places but bed was comfortable and very clean. the living room had a wet bar and a coffee maker which was great to have and a fridge. we also had a connecting double room as there were five women.we always found the cleaning staff very friendly and helpful leaving extra coffee,towels or linen when asked. the elevaters we very fast and convient to get to. we appreciated the security check at night and always felt very safe. the room and hallway was very quiet we never knew there we others there. we were in the mardi gras tower on the one of the higher floors.we never ate at the hotel as ther were always line ups. we did go to the mac king free show and loved him a must see good for any age. my daughters 23 and 25 went to the improv but a commdian show was on and had a great time. we loved staying on the strip and close to all the other large hotels. we did little gambling but tried out a few penny slots. we did use the shuttle bus to go to the rio very easy and had fun over there. my daughters loved the pool at the rio,there was no cost. we also used the shuttle train. very fast and convient. we spent five days in vegas and had a blast'we would stay at the harrah again price was great and had wonderful friendly sevice from all the staff

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The restraunt situation was terrible. We would stand in line for 30 minutes while there were many empty tables. A special line for special card holders allowed those people to go to the head of the line. We were left standing like a herd of cattle. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay If You Want Lung Cancer”
Reviews.Author: cha747
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, nonsmokers, checked-in to Harrahs on Oct 16 and the entire time we were assulted by the odors of various tobacco smoke. Anytime we wanted to go into or out of our room we had to go into the smoke-filled casino lobby. We stayed at the Venetian later in our trip and even though people smoke there, you don't bathe in it. We walked through 10 different casinos and of those 10, Harrah's was definately the worst. And beware of getting a room in the Mardi Gras tower above the Carnaval Court. The music goes on until 2am and I had to be up at 6am for a conference. We were changed to the Carnaval Tower (ironically, not near the Carnaval Court) and had a partial strip view (if one considers Casino Royale a premiere strip location). If smoking and a seedy crowd is your thing, by all means, head to Harrah's!

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs resort and casino”
Reviews.Author: ChelseaBelleNewYork
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at Harrahs in Las Vegas for the first time. Harrahs is centrally located on the strip; which makes walking to any of the other strip casinos great. Also the monorail stops right at Harrahs so you only need to go the stations and get on. The rooms were nicely decorated and very clean. The buffet was under renovation but there was a cafe that served a nice variety of stuff,although the service was alittle slow. The only complaint I have is that the area around the pool was always shady because the sun is blocked by the Imperial Palace next door. All in all though it was very nice and I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: RprJL
Reviews.Content: Harrah's is not as bad as many of the reviews. The rooms are smaller and older than many in town, but most of us have stayed in worse hotel rooms. We never ate at the hotel so I have nothing to offer on the food. I tend to stay away from the all-you-can-slob and I'm not a Toby Keith fan. The hotel has one great feature and that is the location right in the middle of the strip. The hotel is located accross from the Forum Shops of Caesar's Palace. You have a great selection of restaurants. You have casinos like the Casino Royale or Imperial Palace for cheap tables on either side of you. The tables at Harrah's were always empty because they are over priced. The dealers were stuffy and just not fun. I think it may be the largely older crowd that causes this atmosphere. I think this is decent place to stay and a decent value. Just be prepared that the rooms aren't as nice as most places but the location makes it worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Most beautiful hotel on the strip????????????????”
Reviews.Author: willis2005
Reviews.Content: I am in Vegas 4 to 5 times a year. I obviously love it. I have stayed at almost every hotel on the strip. I just read the review that stated that Harrahs was the most beautiful hotel on the strip. You are joking right? You would have to be! Either that or blind. That hotel is old,stale and the price of the rooms are way over stated. I would stay there again if the rate was cheap but to be honest they are sometimes more expensive than some of the other newer and nicer hotels. That I don't get at all.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's still our favorite place to stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 night stay at Harrah's in September! We have stayed at other casinos on the strip ie mirage and luxor, but after staying at Harrah's a few years back, we decided this was definitely our favorite! It is definitely the most fun and what a great location! The Carnaval Court right outside is addictive! The bartenders there are such a source of entertainment, it's hard to tear yourself away. One word of warning, the drinks are expensive but you are paying for the entertainment value as well! And there's no skimping on the alcohol either. I'm sure most alcoholic beverages were doubles at least! The only complaint I have is that the rooms are very noisy. We stayed in the Mardis Gras tower and we heard every noise down the hall and the surrounding rooms, toilets flushing, taps running, bodily sounds etc. But I did hear that the rooms in the Carnival tower were newer and much quieter. I also heard that they were improving the Carnival Court so the noise from the outside didn't travel up to the rooms and they were also improving the buffet. So that's exciting. We wouldn't hesitate to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was quite surprised by the quality of our room in the Carnival tower. It had obviously been recently renovated and while smelled quite strongly of smokers, as did the whole hotel, it was a pretty nice room. I did hear stories of tiny, cramped rooms, that were dirty and in need of repair, ours was quite nice. Other than everything had a price - $10 for 10 minutes for internet access(outrageous!!), the hotel, for the price, exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “To Strip or not to Strip....”
Reviews.Author: vegasboys
Reviews.Content: If you like freying carpet, mould in the bathrooms and rooms with a lot of noise....then Harrah's Las Vegas is the place for you. We took advantage of a two nights free offer and booked a week at the Rio ( the sister property) 4 months in advance. Two weeks before we departed for Sunny Las Vegas I confirmed the reservation only to discover that we had been moved to Harrah's. What a complete disappointment. The room...small and standard overlooked the pool ( such as it is) and the carninval court. The noise from the courtyard carries right into the room and the pounding musics keeps you from sleeping anytime before 3am. Other than the housekeeping staff, no one appeared to be friendly. Don't bother with room service ammenities. The suprise gift basket that I had ordered for a 40th birthday suprise could not be delivered to our room prior to check in.......nor could it be delivered after check in. Despite being told it would arrive immediately after our arrival.......I had to call room service 4 hours later to find out where it was......What a dissapointment that was . We booked a higher end dinner at the Range Steakhouse. The food was excellent as was the service, but you are seated according to your Harrah's rewards card points. Apparently if you are a big spender in the casino, you get a better table. Our warning....be careful when taking advantage of the free night stays offers......they are not nearly as good as they appear!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been to vegas several times and stayed at most of the hotels on the strip. Although Harrahs is not the most beautiful hotel on the strip, it is by far the best place to stay. The hotel is located in the center of the strip, which is convenient for walking around and sightseeing. The casino is awesome, no other casino can beat it. There is always a waitress bringing drinks while you gamble and the casino is just set up to make you feel comfortable and relaxed. There is a bar outside the open lobby with nice live band music. The casino is always exciting, never boring or deserted in the AM like many other casinos. The rooms are also very nice, clean and spacious. The staff is always friendly and helpful. You will not find a hotel with better customer service than Harrahs. The buffet and other restaurants and cafes are excellent. The service is great and the food is wonderful. One of the best things I like about Harrahs hotel is that if your in vegas to party you can just walk out to the outdoor club, with great live band music and great drinks: and if you came to vegas for relaxation they have a great spa or you can just hang out and relax in the casino. Harrahs also has the best comps for players cards. For the last three years everytime I come to vegas I stay at Harrahs, and I have never been disapointed. I have always had a great time. You dont have to walk miles from the parking garage or lobby to get to your room. I just feel like Harrahs has a relaxing comfortable environment unlike most of the megas resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: ohiotraveler7687
Reviews.Content: I would highly reccommend Harrah's. We booked our room through AAA and when we got there somehow the reservation wasn't made so Harrah's gave us this beautiful 2 room suite with a hot tub. It was supposed to be for just the 1 night till a regular room came available but I talked to the hotel manager and let them know we didn't really feel like moving when this wasn't our fault and they let us keep the nice suite. The room was clean, the staff was friendly and the elevators were fast, The maids gave us coffee to make daily along with clean towels. It had a nic e pool though we never got in it. Also they have a great buffet. The casino was very nice with lotsa of entertainment. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip”
Reviews.Author: Turquoisewater
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back from our 5 night stay at Harrah's, and we had a good time. He is a seasoned Vegas veteran and always stays at Harrah's, mainly because of the fantastic comps we receive there (we also play at Harrah's in Chicago). First off, we booked through Harrah's travel company, they not only comped our flight but our four night stay. On our last day we asked for a late check out and they ended up comping us a whole other night so we could have our room until our flight left at midnight. I realize that it is an older hotel with less amenities then some but the service was fantastic. My boyfriend is a Diamond member which has it's perks but even our friends who aren't card holders were treated really well. Upon check-in we were supposed to be in a "Diamond" wing but they put us in one of the old rooms facing the parking garage. We immediately called the host and were reassigned to a "diamond" wing of the hotel in the Carnaval tower which was much much better. Maid service was good, so was room service, and security was actually friendly. We saw a little craziness at the hotel (it is Vegas after all) but it was handled quickly. The hotel had a nice balance of people not too young, not too old. There was always something fun going on and if you ever need to be entertained just step outside to Carnaval Court. As far as the casino, well we did really well. REALLY WELL. Believe it or not we won several thousand on the penny slots. It bacame the trip motto to "go down stairs and win a grand". We played a few tables, no big winnings but we did ok. All in all, we had a great time. Neither one of us need a huge casino or hotel to stay at so Harrah's did the trick. I recommend it for anyone looking for a decent room in great location. We will definately stay there again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Harrah's Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay here. Was upgraded to a Junior Suite upon check-in. The room was great and had an excellent view of the Mirage. Ordered room service once and it was very good. The Blackjack dealers were superb and very funny. Won some $$$! Excellent location on the strip. Self parking was easy and convenient. Harrah's can get a little pricey sometimes, but whenever the price is right give Harrah's a try. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “First-timers that loved Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: NorthCoastTraveller
Reviews.Content: We took a road trip from Cleveland, Ohio, to California and back in May 2005. We didn't intend on staying in Vegas, just driving through, but the neon seduced us and we decided to stay for the night. We tried the Stardust, which advertised low prices on billboards, but their reservation system was down. They comped us a buffet dinner, but the system was still down after dinner, so we used the wireless available in the lobby to book another (cheap) hotel. We found Harrah's for $50/night, and went there. Harrah's was a dream come true for us - reasonable prices, friendly and helpful staff, and a slots club that gave us freebies from the first night. Now, we're just frugal midwest tourists, not gamblers, so we didn't expect to be comped anything for the penny slots we played. The free dinners were an unexpected bonus. The rooms are not exceptionally large, and may seem smaller to claustrophobic people because of the massive wardrobe hiding a huge TV. The bathroom was marble, and not only was there plenty of water pressure in the bath, but the toilet's flushing power was so powerful we videotaped it for the amusement of our friends back home. We stayed in the Mardi Gras tower, which was above the Carnival Court. It was loud until about 3 AM, but being professional musicians, the music didn't bother us at all, and the desk clerks did warn us about it. We're planning on going back in December, since Harrah's keeps sending us offers for free nights. We really enjoyed havinh Harrah's as our headquarters for our unexpected Vegas stay.

Reviews.Title: “You got to try really hard to have a really bad service like this!”
Reviews.Author: BizTraveler75
Reviews.Content: I agree with another reviewer who said that everything is gambling-oriented at this hotel. I was here for 3 days attending a conference, and it is definitely not the place to stay at for business/conference purposes. I changed rooms twice, first because, I ended up in the "only available" room upon checking-in that was a smoking room, despite of my request for a non-smoking. Of course, the front desk Staff very conveniently pointed to their "policy" that they assign rooms based on availability, and there were no available non-smoking rooms when I checked in. Never mind the fact, that they are smart enough about charging a deposit for the 1st night's stay weeks in advance on your credit card, but they cannot show the same courtesy to pre-assign you the type of room you need, even with a guaranteed arrival/stay. When I had to change rooms b/c of this, to save myself the time & headaches, I asked specifically whether the next room I will stay at has high-speed Internet access capability and got a positive response. You can imagine after unpacking & packing twice, how frustrating it gets, that the 2nd room I was sent to did NOT actually have high-speed Internet access, which meant me losing half a day of productive work, waiting for 6 different staff people giving me 6 different responses in a 4-hour timeframe, and ultimately the front desk manager telling me at the end of all this "Oh, we have a problem with the high-speed Internet access in the Mardi Gras tower rooms"! So, why could you have not told me that from the beginning, and give me a room in the other tower, instead of causing all this headache and half a day of lost work! I was so upset that I did not have any desire to accept the $30 voucher which he offered that could be used for drinks and meals. I just wanted an ok service and a satisfactory response. I wanted to deal with trained staff who knew of all this. Ohh, one last thing, I travel quite a lot, and this was the only hotel I stayed at until now, that has a daily rate of $20, for using the fitness center!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hurrahs at Harrahs!”
Reviews.Author: Bukwaas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrahs for $US 49/night (plus taxes) from Aug 3-5/05. Great location on the North strip (north of Bally's), across from Caesar's Palace and Mirage, next to the Venetian. Definitely avoid staying in a room facing the Carnaval Court (aka. "Circle Bar") between Harrahs and the adjacent Imperial Palace as the noise makes it quite difficult to sleep, with music playing loud into the wee hours of the night. Staying in the Carnaval tower is better and newer than the Mardi Gras tower, although there was still some renovation construction noise during daytime hours. Room is pretty clean, bathroom was decent. Gym is an extra $20 per person per day, so we just used the private but very busy outdoor pool, which was average in size but clean enough. Lunch buffet isn't bad for $13 per person, there were enough vegetarian options. Overall, I'd give the place a 3.5 out of 5!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, terrible, hard bed”
Reviews.Author: ITraveLight
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a business trip to LV. I have stayed at Harrah's on 3 or 4 other trips with no issues. On this trip I had to call the desk after no sleep in one of the worst beds I have ever had the displeasure of experiencing. It was like a slab of hardwood. After the runaround with a rude desk person, I was eventually upgraded to a room with a more comfortable bed. For a hotel of this (supposed) caliber, the bed should never have been this bad to begin with. I will avoid this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's better than I remember”
Reviews.Author: moehill
Reviews.Content: Arrived 1 am fri night/sat morning via airport shuttle (greyline $9.50 roundtrip w/o gratuity) to a friendly staff of 4 @ reservations desk. I was surprised there were so many guests checking in @ this hour. Requested a view, which was not avail until night 2 of 3 night stay. Reservation agent was accomodating and honestly answered my questions about 1. noise level of rooms facing 'carnival court' 2. remodel schedule. Both rooms were in Mardi Graw tower: 1st on 10th floor, and then 2nd room (#1860 w/view of strip - Mirage volcano, Caesars, Rio & Palms in the distance). Because the room towers are built quite a distance from LV Blvd you will always have to look past the unatractive rooftop ac/electrical/mechanical equipment to the actual strip. I found rooms very clean and average sized. Ordered room service twice. Prompt & overpriced as room service always is. Ate @ 24 hour cafe. Food overall is mediocre. Service is above average from all staff; very friendly and accomodating. Monorail station @ this hotel which is awesome if you don't rent a car and want to get around faster than walking. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Carnaval Court was the highlight of my trip!”
Reviews.Author: ChicFlair1
Reviews.Content: I was in Vegas this month and found Harrah's Carnaval Court to be the best bar I visited. I loved that it was outdoors and had such a fun, inviting atmosphere. The bartenders were GREAT! Their skills and "flair" bartending were the reason I stayed there all night. They were so much fun to watch and were very attentive to everyone at the bar. The music they played at Carnaval Court was good and they had a nice dancefloor which was almost packed on the two nights I was there. I am definitely going back to Vegas soon and will probably be going to Harrah's every night!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the price for the location”
Reviews.Author: lov4vegas
Reviews.Content: Stayed hear July 11 to July 14. This my second time staying at Harrah's and I still like it. It may not be as flashy as the others but for what I payed it was perfect. I got a room on the 15th floor in the Mardi Gras tower with a view for $59/night. I dont like to gamble here though. I am not a high roller so I go down to the Westward HO or Slots-A-Fun to do most of my gambling ($3 BJ table and $2 Roulette tables). Back to the rooms. I have never had a problem with Noise or any other disturbances. I find the beds to be very comfortable. The size of the rooms are average, besides all you do is sleep there. I would highly recommend Harrah's for those budget minded people and for the great location. You can head either direction. The staff is very friendly and courtious.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Harrahs”
Reviews.Author: fontes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took my mother to Las Vegas July 5th and 6th. We were comped one room and had to pay 69.00 a night for the second room. Check in was wonderful, the lady who checked us in was great. The rooms were big and clean. We went to the Clint Holmes show. It was great. The whole trip was wonderful, didn't win too much in the casino, but overall, Harrah's was the place to be. Cocktail waitresses were around every time you wanted a drink.

Reviews.Title: “..an honest review”
Reviews.Author: Thomsarg
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 night stay at the Las Vegas Harrahs. For an overall rating, I give the property an 'adequate' rating.....nothing horrible, but nothing outstanding either. Cons: 1. This Harrah's is one of the older strip hotels, and it has that appearance in the casino/lobby/etc. 2. As mentioned in many reviews, here and elsewhere....the rooms tend to be somewhat noisy. My room was in the Carnival Towers, and I was originally assigned a room on the 10th floor, facing the pool/bar area (but well above it). The music from the bar was enough of a nusiance that I requested to be moved the next day (and was) I then went to the 28th floor, oppisite wing, facing the airport side. This room was much quieter for the most part. However, as the crowd increased towards the weekend.....it got worse. If there is ANY noise in the halls, it goes directly into the rooms. Even casual conversation is heard loud and clear in the rooms. In my case, there was a 'party' taking place in the hall which obviously was unbearable. After calling the front desk, 'security' came after about 20 mins and quieted things down. However, you could still 'hear' when other guests return to their rooms, turn on the TV's, etc. I guess this is a result of the age of property, but the lack of soundproofing is definitely an issue if you're a light sleeper, as I am. I would return for a mid-week stay, but the 'noise factor' would deter me from staying at Harrah's for a weekend. 3. Slots seemed to be 'tight' and there was a obvious lack of many of the newer games. Table games were always available, but limits go up at night of course. 4. The matteress in the first room was awful....the springs felt like they were going to come through the padding at any time. However, in the second room, the bed was quite comfortable. Pros: 1. Location. Obviously convenient to many of the other strip attractions. Walking distance to Venetian, Wynn, Ceasars, etc....even in 110 degree heat. The monorail station is right at the back of the hotel....an easy walk from the rooms. 2. Rooms were clean, and requests for extra towels/pillows were filled promptly. Housekeeping was always available, but not a 'nusiance'. 3. I ate at the 'Cafe' and the buffets. Both were good. 4. Rooms are convenient to the casino/rest......even if you're at the end of the hall, it's only a couple of minutes from the room to the casino. Not the case in some Vegas locations Bottom Line: If you know what to 'expect', Harrah's can be a 'good deal'. It is what it is, and if you can overlook the few 'bumps' and can tolerate a bit of noise, it's not a bad place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: southlvr
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a four day stay at Harrah's Las Vegas 7-4- thru 7-8 . We were very pleased with all the hotel services, the friendly staff and our room.The center strip location cant be beat and if you use the Monorail this is the station you want to be at (not far to get on). Casino was very tight but it was a fun place to play.We will be staying at Harrah's on our next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good place, good price, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 4 day stay at Harrah's. (it was 113 Fahrenheit!!!)Upon check-in, the lady at the desk was great (Elaine). She gave us a free upgrade to 15th floor strip view. That was nice. (king size bed) The room was very clean, everything worked and we were pleased. The casino is a little old but you don't stay at Harrah's for their casino. You stay there for their location and buffet. Where else would you pay $65 a night and be in the center strip??? All others there are $100+ per night. We took the shuttle everyday and hung out at the RIO pool. Thats a better place to be. Harrah's pool is not great. Go to the RIO! All in all, it was worth $65 per night, but all you do in the room is sleep anyways...it was clean and the housekeeping was good. Would stay there again, but not for more than $65 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Home at Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: southsideirish
Reviews.Content: Just got home from a three day trip to Vegas. Stayed at Harrah's for about the sixth time in the past year. Have also stayed at Caesars in the past year. Our room at Harrah's is comped with their generous offers that are sent out periodically-this trip we really planned first on only Sunday nite and Monday night-added Saturday night for what should have been a paid night but found on check-out that we got the entire trip comped. Room was in Masquerade Court and appeared to be recently re-done. Room was very clean upon arrival -it was after ten on Saturday night. No view but then we are not in the room much so it doesn't matter to us. Housekeeping was great, my request for more pillows and towels promptly handled. Bed was very comfortable. Staff at Harrah's are always great. That applies to the front desk, houskeeping, dealers and cocktail waitresses. We have gotten to know many staff members who always remember us and great us by name. We usually gamble some at Harrah's and also hit the strip. This trip found that the shuttle over to the Rio was now running much later (4am)on the weekend and that was great considering we use it to go to the Rio and then walk over to the Palms. Didn't eat at Harrah's this trip but did the champagne buffet at the Palms. I like it there and it is very reasonable. Also went to Cravings at the Mirage our last night for th first time and will certainly go back. Food was great and the room is very attractive. Staff there were very attentive. I like getting your salad tossed at the buffet, a nice personal touch. Sports Book at the Mirage is also very nice and the bar service exceeds other Sports Books. On the other hand service at the dice tables was lousey.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's was OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Harrah's was ok. My room was small with a pitiful view, but always clean and cool. I did not like the pool at all. It was small and overly crowded. The first and last time I went there, it was full of drunk adults who kept getting served more and more alcohol. They were big and obnoxious...crowded the kids out of the pool. I never once saw any of those guys leave to go to the little boys room. And they were steadily drinking a lot of beer. UGH!!! Lines for the buffet were long and poorly managed. I think I was the only one in line without some kind of buffet comp. I got no coupons at check-in, a real downer!! I loved the Monte Carlo next door for gambling. The margaritas and bottled Michelobes were the best buy in town -$1.00 each!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: Amcdon
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Vegas, June 8-11th. I was very pleased with Harrah's. Our room was in Mardi Gras Tower, 16th floor. It was nicely decorated and clean. I didn't have a good view, but that was ok. The location was perfect for me because my husband attended school during the day and I was able to walk everywhere that I wanted. We ate at the buffet and new cafe and it was very good. I am not a gambler so the casino was not an important feature for me. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The only thing I didn't like were the timeshare people bothering you everytime you walked by. I would stay at Harrah's again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: res0m3zt
Reviews.Content: Room in Carnival Tower was very nice. Great water pressure in the shower. Breakfast buffet was good. It was hard to get a bellman at check-in. The casino was TIGHT, TIGHTER, and TIGHTEST!!! Causing us not to spend any more time there other than sleeping. Too bad because we really like the hotel. I don't think we will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “expected more, but satisfied”
Reviews.Author: ht137
Reviews.Content: expected more from harrah's considering their reputation. stayed 2 days over this past memorial day weekend. rooms were of decent size, and fairly welll priced, but hotel basically ignores any special requests you make with the reservation unless you are a high roller with them. while I do gamble, I don't gamble anywhere near the levels they would like. staff were fairly friendly. casino was a bit tight, didn't really see too many winners, though didn't really gamble too much there myself. Best thing about harrahs is the location. right in the middle of the strip with access to all the major resorts nearby (caesars, mirage, TI, venetian....). Is a good value depending on the price you get. If you can get it for about $100/night on a weekend.... it's definitely worth the money just for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location....over-hyped!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: They always say location, location, location! But I think I would give up location to stay someplace better than Harrah's. The entrance is very difficult to find, the casino is VERY smoky and cluttered (they need a serious renovation). Luckily we used the time share price and were able to get a whole weekend for $99. But it still wasn't worth the $99 we spent. The seafood buffet is a joke as well. The crab legs were horrible. Being right across the street from Cesear's you would expect so much more. Try the Mirage or TI they are very nice & inexpensive hotels on the strip. Go during the week the rates are cheaper! Stay away from Harrah's

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas in February to get married. Stayed at Harrahs - it was wonderful. Very clean, all amenities, nice people. Only complaint is when you check in, the ladies there pushing the time share program.

Reviews.Title: “About what I expected”
Reviews.Author: ndfan01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Harrahs in March 2005. I am a slot club member and had 3 free nights coming, but I had always in the past stayed at the Rio when staying at a Harrah's property in Vegas. Rio was booked so I took Harrahs. The property is in need of an update to compete with the other strip hotels. It has the feel of a downtown Vegas hotel rather than the mega resorts now dominating the strip. The casino was very claustrophobic. A lot of machines and tables crammed into a small space. The walkways were confusing, some seemed to lead to nowhere. The ceiling throughout much of the casino seems very low. It is pretty dark in many areas. I was not comfortable there. The gambling was also horrible for me... The room I was in--in the older tower was okay. It was small but clean and pretty well appointed. I don't like shower curtains but other than that the bathroom was fine. The hotel staff was polite, efficient and helpful for the most part and the hotel's location is good. If you must stay on the strip, but you refuse to pay megaresort prices, this is an okay choice. But if you are like me and like to feel a little spoiled on your vacation, I wouldn't recommend it. I stayed free so no big deal, but for about the same nightly rates, I'd select the Nugget downtown. BTW: It's a challenge to find the entrance to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a great spring trip”
Reviews.Author: scottandkaren
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from vegas on 4-2 still tired, our stay at Harrahs was great... our room was called a "Mini-Suite" which was just a name for a larger room with 2 windows but besides that everything was great. This was the 4th time we have been out to vegas and the first time in the spring-it's awesome this time of year. Everyone we dealt with from the check-in lady to room service to the dealers at the tables were very professional and a lot of fun, especially BERT who dealt roulette, has to be the employee of the year there. We won some money at Dollar World and did see a lot of people winning money. We also saw the blue man group at the luxor--what a great show, those guys are amazing, a little pricey but well worth it. My wife and I don't hesitate to stay at Harrahs because we know what we are getting each time.

Reviews.Title: “helpful & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: CarlosFR
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 free nights Wed-Thurs 3/23-24 with reward credit. Room was well kept and clean. Staff was helpful and seemed friendly, even in the casino, especially on the craps tables. Enjoyed the stay and made some money on craps! Even without the free room felt that Harrah's was a good bargin (at least during the week) with a good location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Casino”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Older, but well-kept hotel. Very clean and comfortable. Good energy in casino compared to other casinos. Close to Margaritaville (a great place) at Flamingo. Centrally located and a better bargain than most hotels. Only wish it has better access to Rio which is it's sister casino, and which has a great Mardi Gras parade in the sky.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: oldtwo
Reviews.Content: We arrived Las Vegas Harrah's on 3-22-05, this is our ten trips to Las Vegas but it is the first time that we stayed in Harrah's. We stayed there because we have two free nights with our reward credit. We didn't expect too much from it. At first the hotel was over booked and they din't have the non-smoking room for what we requested, then they upgraded us to a suite (super nice) on the 21th floor with a view of the Mirage's volcano show. The room is better than all the hotel that we stayed before. We will adsolutely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay at the hotel. Excellent places to eat and have a good cup of coffee or something sweet. Prices on the weekends are a bit too high for my budget but I'm willing to pay the price because I really enjoy staying here. The hotel is in the middle of all the eye catching places. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Newer, Vegas'Mega Hotels w. More Frills Cant Beat Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hadn't stayed at a Harrah's since mid 80's, in Atlantic City; dont recall anything 'memorable!' Not so, for Harrah's Las Vegas, in Mar. '05; where our 3 day stay was perfect, from snappy human responses to phone calls for info. as well as room service! Being sensitive to smoke, I feared odors from other smoking floors might sneak thru the vent system, but air was so pure, I enjoyed just 'breathing' as well as any tangible ammenity! Soundproofing was fantastic, & much appreciated, since planes & helicopters were a constant source of noise for Nascar's wkend. Ne'er a clanging dish, or maid's vacuum was heard by this late, but normally 'light' sleeper; resulting in a most refreshing slumber. White glove test cud find NOTHING less than scrupulously clean! Even with a 'full house,' we were treated as if we were the only guests staying there, by an extremely friendly, & competent service staff. Food at sit down rest., buffet, & room service was fairly priced, attractively served, and turned out to be as tastey as it looked. Complimentary coffee made in our room, rivaled that of the downstairs Starbucks. The casino area is well laid out, with a nice variety of 'friendly' slots, table games, bars, restaurants, & shops, but not too many, to destroy that pleasant, 'airy' feeling I felt thruout. A terrific location, close to everything, right on the strip; I will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Carnaval Court is the best bar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although we did not stay at Harrah's we frequented Carnaval Court every night of our 5 night stay. This bar is by far the best bar in Las Vegas. It's outdoors, Great live entertainment, Awesome and cute bartenders, no dress code and if you get there early enough no cover charge. The bartenders really know how to make you feel like you are their only customer. Drinks are pricey but this is actually a bar that you get what you pay for. Can you say, " would you like some Coke with that Captain"? Great Bar. I go to Vegas 3-4 times a year and can't see myself having fun anywhere else. This bar is the MAIN reason for my returns to Vegas. Oh and the Fire Show is great as well. These bartenders are really talented. They certainly know how to put on a show.

Reviews.Title: “Improv/Mac King”
Reviews.Author: Vermonter38
Reviews.Content: Did not stay here, but attended 2 shows. Mac King was excellent. He is a master magician and very good comic. Joined slot club so we had 2/1. I would rate this as certainly one of the best matinees on the strip and easily worth the price. That evening we went to the Improv. Haven't laughed so hard in ages. There were a few off-colored jokes and 4 letter words, but the main attraction, Kivi Rogers(?) was fantastic! Drink service was a little slow, but we were so occupied by this guy's class act, we hardly noticed. Not only was he funny, but his message was right on.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK, not great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrahs for a training class. Room rate was $130/night, no deal there. My room overlooked the parking garage, very noisy, no other rooms available. Shower curtain was moldy, had to ask twice to get it changed. No bell help was available to get luggase to room, checked in around 8 pm due to flight delays. Whole place was smokey, even though I had asked for a non-smoking room. Better value and atmosphere at the Falmingo just down the street (that's where I stayed in the spring). Would rather stay down the street and walk to class.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, in the middle of the strip, across from Caesars Palace, and very close to Venetian, Mirage, Treasure Island, Paris, etc. The rooms were very nice, not fancy, but more than suited our tastes, and spacious enough for 4 in a room. Complimentary tickets to a show ($20.00 value x 4) and easy to get to casino and buffets etc. Enjoyed the Dueling Pianos Bar there too. Casino was large, but not overwhelming. Buffet was super excellent. Only complaint was that there was not coffee maker in the room, the lady at desk said that is what they hear about the most! ha seems like a simple solution, but not a big deal really. Biggest plus was the price and the location. Felt like you were in a classy hotel, not the fanciest or the biggest by far, but a treat none the less. We stayed there for $89 a night, middle of week in February. Best value for $$ I could find.

Reviews.Title: “This place is incredible!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Last May 2004 I stayed at Sam's - got a chance to go to Harrah's to play and WOW could not wait to stay here - so I stayed Dec 26 - 30, 2005 and what an experience. This place gets my vote big time- the STaff is incredible - can't seem to do enough for you! The rooms were fabulous - I did a side trip to Stateline so I checked out and checked back in and therefore had two separate rooms both terrific!! I won big time at Harrah's and at RIO also won at MGM and Bally's - both places had not gone to - it was fun. I am Diamond member and therefore was in the Diamond Lounge at lot and ate a lot there so other than Breakfast at the Garden Cafe I believe is the name of it did not eat anywhere else. The Cafe was excellent - good food! What I found very interesting is as I was going home I had about a hour to kill and just sat in the lobby watching people and Harrah's employees. Every time someone came through the door the employee would come up greet them and ask to help them - that kind of service you just don't see anymore!!! That impressed more than anything!! If you want a great experience and a fun place - this is it! I also went to the lounge and the Dueling Pianos was a BLAST! they are just "crazy" so much fun! I went to the Scinitas Show at the RIO - also incredible very funny and man can he play the PIANO WOW!! I am returning May 30th but this time to the RIO can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: chrislu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights, first two nights free and the other two at $60.00 a night. Can't beat the location. The room was clean and comfortable. We had a view of the Venetian parking garage, noisy unless you pull the drapes completely shut at night. Could see the Mirage volcano a bit over the roof of Casino Royale. Beds were quite comfortable, bathroom large. No frills, but clean and large enough. Given offers like this, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL...Can't Wait to Go Back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: MY husband and I stayed at Harrah's from February 10-14, 2005. I was afraid to stay there based on the reviews I read before going, so I booked a room for the followng day at the Venetian just in case. Well, we checked in at Harrah's with the friendliest people I have ever met. Our bags were taken to our room by the happiest Bellman I've seen in a while. We had a GREAT ROOM on the 27th floor, overlooking the strip, in the Carnaval Tower. The restaurant served a GREAT Breakfast Buffet and the Casino was smokey, (like most of them) but the waitresses kept the drinks coming. Harrahs is a great location for the Monorail. For the price we paid, you couldn't beat it ANYWHERE. I visited every hotel in Vegas to plan my trip back and for the price, location, and comfort, Harrahs is the BEST! If I could get RID of anything, it would have to be the "TIMESHARE" pushers and the people on the streets passing out "Call GIRL" booklets. GO AND HAVE A GREAT TIME!!

Reviews.Title: “Very mediocre”
Reviews.Author: WhoaBaby
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Vegas, but we were travelling with a couple who had been many times and were Harrah's Diamond club members, so they got us a good deal on a room - $238 for three nights from Thursday to Sunday. We arrived at the airport and our friends had arranged several days before for a limo to pick us up, but none ever showed. Check in was slow (and this was at the Diamond counter) and we got a really irritating lady with a high voice who needed some Prozac badly. The $20 trick got us nowhere and so we went to our room. Basic as basic can get. Clean and a nice size bathroom, with a view of the parking garage down below. No safe. We called to see if we could get a room with a safe but all of them were booked. Our friends had a junior suite, which they said was nothing impressive, and no safe in there either. No coffee maker. Which really ticked me off because every morning I swear they pumped coffee smell down the hallway, there was a Starbucks on the first floor and it must have come up with the elevators. The casino itself is fine, compared to some others we saw at the north end of the strip, and even next store to us. BUT, you go across the street to the Mirage, or to some of the other hotels like the Ventian, Mandalay Bay, or even Treasure Island, and you feel like you are checking into Motel 6 back at Harrah's. We gambled what I thought was a fair amount, $2500, almost exclusively in Harrah's, and got comped $82 off our final bill when we checked out. I was a bit disappointed with that. That covered our breakfast and lunch buffets and that's about it. If you like to play slots, the best times I found were before 11 a.m., I won a few hundred here and there, always in the morning. Then would pump it back into the slots and lose it later in the evening. The buffets were fine, I had read some bad reviews on them but did not have any problems, we ate at the dinner buffet one night and I thought it was very good. Did not go to any other buffets though so have nothing to compare to. The breakfast buffet Sunday morning seemed a little stale, but that was the second time we had eaten there. All in all I will not stay at Harrah's again unless the rooms are free. We may try the Rio. I really like the Mirage, and Treasure Island was very similar, will look into room rates there the next time we plan a trip.

Reviews.Title: “It's Okay...”
Reviews.Author: caligoodgirl2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Harrah's Jan 23. I felt the hotel was pretty average...something you might find at an aiport. It was clean and comfortable and that was about it. When we got to the hotel, we were informed that check-in is from 3-6. Which means you could have to wait until 6pm to get a room! Luckily this wasn't the case for me. But just be aware of the check-in policy. Unfortunately, we were given a room near the elevator and it was VERY noisy. Other than that, Harrah's was fine to stay at and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn quality, but OK.”
Reviews.Author: Crocodile1
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at Harrah's for 2 nights in October of '04. It was basic Holiday Inn quality rooms (tower), but I had just stayed the previous night at the Casino Royale next door, so Harrah's seemed like the Ritz. The food is OK and the room was quiet. Not much of a view and the walk back to the tower elevators is verrrrry long. The poker room was decent and the employees were very pleasant. The lady who checked me in was very nice and accomodated my high floor request; even though I bought the room through Priceline! She was also very beautiful! If you can score a tower room for under $70, it is certainly worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Trip!”
Reviews.Author: leo21
Reviews.Content: We stayed from January 10 to the 13th. We were scheduled for a Noon check-in and had an offer for two nights free and a third for $60. I have a Diamond card so we were able to use the Diamond check in where the service was attentive. We had a room on the 27th in the Carnaval Tower with a nice view of the mountains. It was smaller than the rooms at the some of the other Harrahs properties we've stayed in but it was cozy. The casino was attractive with lots going on everywhere we turned. The location was sooo perfect. We caught the Improv show and had a wonderful time. The Diamond lounge was a bit worn down but the service was excellent, the bathroom was incredible and we were assured that the facilities would be remodelled soon. We were disappointed that Asia and The Garden Cafe were closed. It was easier to get to the monorail at Harrahs than any of the other stations we used. We ended up not spending a lot of time at Harrahs but it felt like home when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Not so hot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the Xmas vaction. We had two rooms that overlooked a generator with a balcony that opened out onto a bird's eye view of a giant fan!! It was the Mardi Gras Tower. Asked to change rooms but was offer only smoking rooms or waiting till after 5 pm to check in (it was 11 am!) Rooms were fine typical, clean standard fare. I must admit the staff was very nice but the hotel is kinda dumpy....and very SMOKEY. If you have breathing issues stay elsewhere. The cafe leaves a lot to be desired...warning the "refill coffee" is a ripoff we had three orders they charged us $7.50 for them (how is that a deal?) Good location but I would not return there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting too much so it was ok in my standards. However, my bf who had stayed at the MGM Grand several years ago was pretty disappointed. After visiting the other hotels, this was probably one of the worst ones just looking at the lobby alone. But the casino itself was seemed to be fuller than the others, and smokier too. Stay here if you don't want to spend too much and can tolerate smoke!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, drinks, value...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's on 12/18/04-12/23/04 with the mostly $35 rate. We had two rooms in the Mardi Gras tower, one smoking on the 11th floor for the parents, and the 10th floor room 1048 (end unit) nonsmoking room for my fiance and I. From our room we could barely see over the Casino Royale facade for a view of Mirage's volcano, but I wasn't there to see volcanos, or for a wonderful stay in a room. For $35 a night on the strip, the hotel could not be beat. The beds aren't great, but they're not travelodge foam pads either. I personally didn't have a problem with them, and neither did my fiance who does extensive travel for work (usually staying at the Westin). The room reminded me of a trailer, the central air was loud when running and was activated by motion sensors that didn't sense anything when you were sleeping so I imagine it could get uncomfortable in the summer. We experienced a maid coming in on us in the morning, but that's what we get for not putting the privacy sign out. They did a good job, even folded the toilet paper into a triangle. The hotel had the Gilchrist Soames variety of toiletries with the godawful shampoo/conditioner combo goop, I recommend bringing your own travel variety. My hair was matted for five days. The shower curtain was another godawful component of the bathroom, there was so much???? caked on it that the curtain was stuck together at the bottom and would not allow for adequate protection around the tub. I could not bring myself to bend over to inspect or correct, I have poor eyes and enjoyed my ignorance. As for the common complaint of noise... This is my opinion, may not be a fair representation... We had an end unit (room number 1048 for your convenience) and was quiet, until Monday (20th). Then we had neighbors who liked to play Keno from their room on the TV. How did we know? Because we could hear them repeat the numbers on the TV and exclaim voluminous epithets to describe their losses. Again, for $35 a night, I could tolerate it and it reminded me that I wasn't here to sleep so I went down to play. My opinion is the larger hotels book every other room in a hallway to avoid this noise problem, there are tradeoffs though, it was a very short walk to anywhere within and out of the casino. I traveled with someone I met there to his room in the nearby Venetian and went through two separate elevators and wings to get to his room, in addition to two guards. It was a hike, and they pump some kind of funny smell in that place, my fiance liked it, I didn't care for it. I have stayed at the MGM and had a similar hike but no smell, still didn't care for it. Anyways, I was not intending to enjoy the room... While in Vegas I played craps at the Venetian, Casino Royale, Flamingo, and of course Harrah's. I found myself returning to Harrah's every time because of the people playing there and the quality service from the hotel staff. Drinks were fast (everywhere else was slow or fair), I drank Cointreau on the rocks so that they couldn't fool with it. After a couple of tips in Harrah's the drinks went from a shot of rocks and a dab of honey to a full glass of the good stuff. I was impressed. You can find $10 mins here from the hours of 10pm-2am, $5 and up otherwise. I played until 6am for three nights and managed to catch a cold in the process, so in those three nights I managed to get something like 477 credits for my play on mostly $5 min craps. 18+ hours of play for 477 credits, what did I do wrong? I think that could get me a breakfast comped. Some posts have complimented their comps but I can't agree. In addition, I think the points expire in 6 months so there isn't much use unless you are close to a Harrah's establishment. Someone else can confirm that. The food was fine, service within the restaurants was fine, nothing exceptional but these restaurants are designed to feed you and move you, I personally like the efficiency because there wasn't ever a wait (given 12/18-12/23). Time is money, no? We went to Cirque's "Ka" for $100 a head, it was good. I'm not a big fan of theatre altogether (we went to Chicago and saw Blue Man Group which was another godawful event) but I felt my money was well spent. They did a very good performance. My fiance is a Cirque fan and she said she loved it. It took 20 minutes for the valet to get our car at the MGM, another reason I would not return to the "city". The four of us decided to make one more night out of something so my dear mother, bless her heart, decided to go to a dinner theatre west of the 15 at a restaurant called the "Egg and I" for $50 a head. We thought that would include wine but we were mistaken to the tune of another $60. The food was prepared like one of those all inclusive resorts, you know what I mean, it was hard to swallow, and I had the cold then too. It was terrible, everything. I do not recommend it, especially for $260. For $35 a night this place can't be beat, I think when it reaches up into about the $80 mark I would begin to seriously consider weighing other choices. Big plusses for this place is the size (no hiking), the staff, the efficiency (no waiting anywhere from the elevators to the check in desk), and just plain fun. My fiance will not return because she does not gamble, so if fun=gambling, this is your place. I would go back. My budget for travel would scream at me for blowing $150+ a night when I could stay across the street for $35 and have a bigger bank roll for play. Casino Royale next door claims it gives you $50 in free slot play, I thought 'hey what the heck', it was $50 on a $1 slot machine sectioned off as 'promotional' and the only way to win was to hit jackpot. Time is money, I wasn't wasting my time... If you have read all of this thank you, and thank you all who have posted before, it was a major help in deciding where to visit in Vegas. If you have read this and you are the groom getting married in Vegas, make sure you get a limo, it is very tasteless for you to be dragging your wife across the street everywhere to get silly pictures of "landmarks" that will eventually implode in another decade or two. Thanks and enjoy your eventual/inevitable stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, great employees”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for two nights in Dec at $35/night on Harrah's website (hot deals). I've stayed at most of the properties on the strip, but never thought Harrah's seemed upscale enough. I decided to give it a try with that cheap rate and was VERY impressed. Check in was fast, hotel clerk very informative. Rooms not as large as the Bellagio, but for one fifth the price, they were more than adequate. The only gripe I have is there's no safe in the room. One thing I DID like is that you can get from the parking garage to the hotel lobby and your room without trudging all through the casino like at some other hotels. Every employee I met at Harrah's was friendly and helpful. The cocktail waitresses came around often in the casino, I never waited for a free drink at the bar, and the floor people were great. The only meal we had at Harrah's was the breakfast buffet, which was decent but nothing to write home about (LOVE the Paris breakfast buffet...so we took the short walk over there!). Great thing about Harrah's is the central location so you can get just about anywhere else on the strip you want to be. Overall, I was more than impressed with the quality of my stay for the price and would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Beds!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ILCPA
Reviews.Content: As the saying goes........ you get what you pay for. This hotel has very clean and updated rooms. They told me that all rooms are updated every two years and it shows, but they must not change the beds. The beds are very uncomfortable and you can hear alot of hall noise!!!! I must say that the location is very good. If you want a cheap clean room in Vegas this hotel is a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's - a great value & a good time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at Harrah's 12/4 - 12/7. Quick check-in (and a free room upgrade w/o asking), good service at all eating establishments, bars, and gaming tables. Excellent food & service at Andreotti's restaurant; Very good breakfast buffet 2x at Market Square Buffet. Decent burgers at Garden Cafe. Carnival Court was a blast every night! Live bands, juggling bartenders - a fun way to take a break from gaming & just hang out. Rooms were very clean in Carnival Tower, and after toying with the Heat/AC - quite comfortable. Had a beautiful view too. Could be a bit more soundproof - but heck, it's Vegas, people are out in the hallways day & night. I've stayed in much louder hotel rooms. Fantastic location - next to the Venetian & accross from Ceaser's/Mirage. Free shuttle to the Rio (don't miss the Rio!) I would stay there again, most definitely. (Just avoid the breakfast buffets next door at Imperial Palace - not very good, but the gaming was fun & relaxed there).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrahs 11/22-11/26/04 second time this year. I disagree with review that said Garden Cafe was terrible. We ate their a couple of times while service was a little slow we found the food to be very good and personnel friendly. We also felt that the food in the buffet has improved immensely. On the whole we found that Harrahs Personnel was very cooperative and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Harrahs”
Reviews.Author: genna88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Harrahs from Nov 13- Nov 19, and as usual we were not disapointed. Harrahs staff is friendly and helpful. As many times as we have stayed there we have never had a problem that was not rectified immediatly. I love the Hotel, the atmosphere, the people, and everything in general. The only thing that disturbs me. Is those Time Share people that jump you every time you walk through the door. But this is a common practice at most hotels. My husband and I adopted a system of splitting up a little when we enter a hotel or casino. If they don't think your a couple, they leave you alone. But stay a Harrahs, the fun and excitment never stop. We wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Carnaval Court”
Reviews.Author: brewersfan
Reviews.Content: I don't know if I would call Carnaval Court cheezy. It was great fun, everyone is very friendly, not alot of snobby "I'm too beautiful to talk to you" people. The bartenders are entertaining. Get the bucket of beers and save a buck apiece. Had the funnest afternoon of my trip here.

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs, expansion equals declining service”
Reviews.Author: Myvegasmom
Reviews.Content: I have stayed and been comped at Harrahs many times in the past ten years and have always been completely happy with the service. However, I booked 3 rooms for 7 people for Sept. 12 to 16 (one non-smoking and two smoking) and have found the service at check-in deplorable. We arrived at midnight Sun. and was advised that only one room (smoking) was ready and had to wait two hours or so for the others. Requested and verified high rooms, got one room on 3rd floor even with the airconditioning units for the hotel. Two rooms were in one tower and one in the other. Asked to change next day, were told to check at noon. However, only again only one room was ready and the other two would be only ready at 6 o'clock, again separate towers. Spoke with several people at various times including the Customer Service Rep. While all were polite, none were at all interested or helpful in satisfying us considering 7 gamblers, two of which earned Platinum status in 4 days. It seems the more property they buy and monopolize, the less they care, so I will stay elsewhere when returning in Dec. I must say though that the gambling was very good all during the stay although left some of my money as usual.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel/Casino”
Reviews.Author: twilsonb
Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas in December 2003 because of a great airfare and a better hotel bargain - Harrah's at $49 a night! I have stayed at lots of places and for the money this was great. Rooms were as nice as MGM, casino was great with lots of action and of course Harrah's is midstrip so everything is close to walk too. And I won some money in the casino. Food pretty okay too. Best part was Dueling Pianos in the lounge for free, I went both nights. Carnaval Court cheesy though. I would definately stay here again and always check the rates here, although I would say about $89 a night is my limit here.

Reviews.Title: “super place”
Reviews.Author: fireman441
Reviews.Content: just got back from harrah's 6 days a very good place to stay ,we were very happy with the room . serivce, food and tables at this hotel i will stay there next year also

Reviews.Title: “Food at Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: Tom2020
Reviews.Content: Didn't stay a Harrahs Las Vegas, but eat at the buffet for dinner. $16.95, stay away the food is terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Got a little nervous, knowing that this is not one of the "classic" Vegas hotels like Mirage, Paris or Bellagio. However, it was better than expected. Rooms were clean, the furnishings pretty, and a coffee maker was included in the room. They even welcomed us with cookies upon arrival, which is a nice touch - never had this experience in a Vegas hotel before (boyfriend and I have been to about 5 other hotels here). One major complaint I had: I could very clearly hear the neighbors next door. Not fun if the people next door are awake at 5AM.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Veroite
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrahs 8/23/04 for our 25th anniversary. Harrahs upgraded us to a suite without being asked and at no additional cost to us. We were pleasantly surprised when we opened the door and entered a lovely suite! Other reviewers complained of paper thin walls, but we never heard any noise at all in our suite. The room was lovely, and the casino/hotel was just the perfect size. Other casinos we visited were too large. We enjoyed our stay there and will definitely stay at Harrahs again. Thanks Harrahs!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July 2004. One of my worst hotel experiences ever! The walls are paper thin. We were awakened every morning by the people next door's alarm clock at 5:15am and the proceeded to hear every single word of their conversation as if they were in the same room as us. We could hear their phone ringing, knocking on their doors. We had a lovely view of a dirty alley way. The casino, because of it's age I'm assuming, reeked of smoke so bad that I couldn't wear my contact lenses downstairs. The bed was uncomfortable. I couldn't wait to leave so I could get a decent sleep! The pool was nice but closed way too early, but I think most hotels have pools that close early. The Carnival Court outside was fun though and seemed to get a good crowd and definitely Harrah's is centrally located. You get what you pay for....

Reviews.Title: “Loved Harah's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went to Las Vegas after 20 yrs. Harrah's made me feel special. Top notch staff and rooms. What a wonderful experience. I recommend it highly.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Here, there and everywhere - always on the go!
Reviews.Title: “AN AMAZING SURPRISE!!!”
Reviews.Author: SadieDelaney
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to Vegas a lot as it is within a 4 hour driving distance from us, but we never stayed at Harrah's as it has a bit of a cheap-looking exterior and we thought the rooms would be the same. We had tickets to see Elton John last week at Caeser's and just wanted someting reasonable and Caeser's rates were really high , so we booked this on one of the internet travel sites and got a terrific rate. Well were we ever surprised!!!! We had a FANTASTIC suite which was nicer than the suite we had at the Venetian when we paid three-four times as much in May. We were upgraded obviously from a standard room, but this was without our asking or without them even telling us we were upgraded until we asked at check-out. They must just automatically do this when they are slow! It was two beautifully decorated rooms a living room and a bedroom, a huge two-room bath area! with jacuzzi tub and separate shower. The pool was nice, noting glamourous but they have misters to cool you off which was nice. The specialty drinks by the pool ran about $7.00 each (which is NOT a lot in veags ) but you actually got a decent amount of ALCOHOL in them (which is not usual in Vegas.) The staff were terrifically friendly. The valet staff was so fast and effcient. Our only problem was the Garden Cafe, the food was terrific, but they were not staffdd well enough to manage the crowd of people. So Don't be put off by this hotel's less than beautiful exterior. We hardly ever repeat hotels in Vegas as we like to try them all out, and many are so disappointing, but we will definitely go back to Harrah's! !! !!!

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas at the end of June and stayed at Harrahs. The 2nd room we were in was fine - like a Holiday Inn - although a bit smaller than our 1st room. Our first room was awful and we had no choice but to stay there the 1st night as we were told the hotel was booked. The AC did not work. This was a HUGE problem as it was 104 degrees outside. Also, when we finally fell asleep, they started doing construction a few floors above us and it sounded like they were coming thru the ceiling. This was at 7 AM!!! They finally moved us to the Mardi Gras tower and all was fine for the remainder of the stay. It is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Still coming back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 nights at Harrahs. This was our 12th visit to Las Vegas, but I have to say that the rooms are looking a bit tired, and in need of some refurbishment. We were in the Mardi Gras tower as always, we have never been in the Carnival tower yet, and little things like no coffee maker in the room, chipped tiles in the bathroom, the drinks machine outside the lift on our floor (14th) not working for the entire stay were disappointing. However the staff were all most courteous and helpful, and the Casino personel were brilliant, especially those at the Roulette tables. Very much impressed that they took the trouble to learn your name and call you by your name At the end of five days all our our meals were taken care of by our Gold Cards. May try somewhere else next time

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs provides a good room for the price”
Reviews.Author: pictureit
Reviews.Content: I booked our rooms on the Harrahs website and got them for $70 a night and a $100 airline certificate for Sun-Thurs. We felt this was an excellent deal. When we arrived the room was ready and the staff was polite. It is an older hotel but everything was in good repair. I would classify this room as a good basic room and the mid strip location was convenient to everything. The only negatives were that we could hear the music from an outside bar but we always carry earplugs so it didn't bother us. The air conditioning blew over the bed but it was 105 degrees and a welcome relief from the heat.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to play”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Middle of May '04 played the slots at Harrah's including $5 THis is where we played the most. Both my wife & I won (slots were the loosest among the casinos we gambled at, although we also did pretty well at the Rio). We earned enough comps to dine at the Rio Buffet (the best in Vegas - we also ate at the Bellagio buffet) . Comps added up pretty fast. Rio & Harrahs are sister Casinos & Comps work both places. Free shuttle between Harrah's & Rio you can walk across the street to the Gold Coast & pick up a shuttle to Barbary Coast or Orleans so you can really get around easily without a car. Harrah's have already (June'04) comped us a room & dinner cruise out on lake Mead in August. We also got 3 nites comp room at Rio good for 1 year. We are going to Harrah's & look forward to a great stay & play.

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs was good...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrahs for 2 nights, was in front tower, room very nice, had a minibar with drinks and snacks, which we did take advantage of. Ordered pizza from room service late one night, which was good and prompt. Ordered coffee and tea both mornings, a little pricey, was not too bad considering we could linger around getting ready for the day and it was worth it to have coffee and tea in the room. Room was very quiet, hardly ever saw anyone in the hallways, we were just a few rooms down from the elevators, which was nice. View was of rooftops but who cares, if we wanted to see the lights, we just went out to the street at night and looked at them. The only complaint I have is about the casino being so tight, although the last day there I did win some money at Harrahs which was nice. Pool area looked nice and had intentions of using it one day but there was just not enough time. Sat in lounge one evening and enjoyed the dualing piano show, this is twin girls playing songs and it was alot of fun, don't miss this one. Ate at buffet, pretty good, most of meal and room charges were comped. Harrahs has a great location. Also saw their headliner show which was great. Went to the afternoon comedy show which was just okay. I think next trip we will try the Flamingo which is just a few doors down, loved their casino and won some money there also. Was there at the start of Memorial Day weekend and the strip got really crowded on Thursday and Friday. Just one other thing, I can't believe some of the women who wear spike heals in Las Vegas, how can anyone walk any distance in them. Visited several other hotel/casinos on the strip. Whole trip was great.

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs and special memory chapel”
Reviews.Author: GREYTHOUND
Reviews.Content: LAS VEGAS FOR WEEK OF MAY 12-18 Stayed at Harrahs for six nites first class service from beginning to end. Restaurants in Harrahs from buffett to steak house was very good. Got married in Special Memory Chapel on 4th st on fri nite at 7 pm wedding was beautiful and chapel is the most pretty chapel in las vegas and great staff. Got a room upgrade from Harrahs to suite upon arrival for diamond club player and was treated by staff at harrahs very well and the best. First time in las vegas and what a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: reddhott30
Reviews.Content: We were in Las Vegas May 9-12. This was our first time at Harrah's and we had a good time. Check in was speedy. Our room was okay, no extras and the view was of the parking garage but we weren't interested in the view. Had a great time at La Playa and the dueling pianos. Great show. Slots were okay but not enough Wheel of Fortune. We tried the buffet the first morning and was very disgusting. We wouldn't eat there again if it was the only food avaialble. There is a McDonald's just out the door on the strip . FYI. We had dinner at the Range and after telling us that we couldn't get a table till 8:45 (it was 5:30 and all the tables were empty) we sat at the bar and had dinner.
