Excellent food and the conversation and help were wonderful. For the past 4 years we have stayed at NYNY and we feel that when we go back in three months that's where we will stay. Harrah's location was great but the comps were so-so. and it is very smokey. Meet some nice people,we would return to play but no to stay.

Reviews.Title: “I was not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Trinity68
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at Harrah's April 12th to April 14th. The good points. The valet employees were very friendly and courteous. The check in was speedy and the young lady that checked us in went way beyond what customer service should be, Trish was excellent. The actual hotel room was OK. Our view sucked and the mini bar was empty. I choose hotels according to the amenities that are provided and I specifically emailed the hotel ahead of time to see if the pool and hot tub facilities would be open. I received an email back stating that they would be, but obviously I should have asked more detailed questions. The pool facilities were on the winter hours and closed at 5 PM. When I went to the pool area, to use the hot tub that area was blocked from hotel guests due to a private party that was going on. Needless to say, I was not impressed with the hotel beyond this point. Harrah's is a great location on the strip but with the price of the rates, I feel that the hotel falls short of expectation.

Reviews.Title: “We feel in Love at Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We took our first trip to Vegas four years ago and stayed at Harrah's. We are now getting ready to make our fourth trip to Vegas for our honeymoon and would not consider staying anywhere else! We stayed elsewhere on our last two trips and always ended up at Harrah's and having the time of our lives and we were always sad we didn't stay there. It will be so awesome to be back home! Great slots, grea service, great food! See you soon!

Reviews.Title: “A Room With a View Please!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Harrah's numerous times, as a Platinum player, then a Diamond player. Never have gotten a decent room, always faced ventilation, parking lots, and once a peep of the strip. Loosest slots I have found, and always win, but it doesn't seem that they acknowlede your play.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service - small room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The service we received was good, but the rooms were much smaller than we expected. We are use to the larger rooms at the Rio, so it was quite a shock.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Harrah's seven out of my last eight trips to Vegas. I will continue to stay there. Their service is unmatched! We always get a great room, good food, and lots of fun! Some say the casino is loud and smoky, it's a CASINO!

Reviews.Title: “Hoorah for Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: photomike
Reviews.Content: This place was wonderful from start to end.. From the time we walked in the door, we were surrouned with top notch service..Front desk, wait staff, buffet staff and even the phone operator were all fantastic. Speaking of the buffet ... thee BEST in Vegas. The room was incredible, although we did have one of their executive suites, it was worth it. If you play slots, their Wheel of Fortune machines seem to be the loosest in town. Oh yeah, the best location on the strip too..

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Chicago_ILAnonymous
Reviews.Content: Forgot something in earlier review...very thin walls! We heard complete conversations and noises from neighboring rooms. Thank goodness we're fairly heavy sleepers...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at the right price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Harrahs Feb 5-8 and had a room on the 25th floor of the Carnival Tower. Nice room with a great view of the Mirage. Service was excellent, I found this to be the only casino where I could always get a drink while playing, I was never empty. Great location as it is close to many casinos. I will stay at Harrah's again.

Reviews.Title: “Service was GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Harrah's in Las Vegas on January 22, 2004 for one night. This was my first stay. The location was great (in the center of everything), the price was awesome ($29), the room was large (a truly non-smoking room smell), and the service was GREAT. After returning home, I realized that I accidently left a pair of pajamas under the bed sheets. I called their lost and found (almost midnight) and they immediately identified my pajamas and promised to mail it back. Just got my pajamas safe and sound by Priority Mail delivery. Not sure if this is general policy in all Vegas hotels, but I was truly impressed and thankful. The only complaint I had about my room is that the shower was weak.

Reviews.Title: “H-O-R-R-I-B-L-E experience, POOR customer service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Found a great deal and reserved 3 rooms (3 separate reservations) for christmas night through travelocity. Stood in front of the front desk for 3 hours because they only found 1 of the 3 reservations, which all have confirmation numbers and were made within minutes of each other. No explanation of what happened. Poor customer service, both the staff and the manager are not helping. No meals/coupons, whatsoever. H-O-R-R-I-B-L-E. The only great things about Harrah's are its great deals and its location. But as you can tell from my experience, the great deals may not be all that great, especially if it happens to be on a busy day.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with great location, gamble elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I stayed at Harrah's from 1/2-1/5. They managed to check us in at 10am and we got the room we asked for. It was very clean and spacious. We didn't gamble at the hotel much since the layout and loudness of it (not to mention not being offered any drinks at any point) sent us in search of other casinos. We ate at the buffet on two occasions and it seemed ok, a tad pricey for what you got, though. Overall, the experience was good, you couldn't beat the location. My sister had moved something in the minibar at one point and we were charged $4.25 even though we didn't consume anything. The woman at the checkout explained they have sensors in the fridges that will charge anything removed to the room even if it is put back. She took the charge off our bill which I thought was very nice of her since we made the mistake. However, I just checked my credit card bill and they just added the $4.25 back onto it as a separate charge. All in all, Harrah's had everything we needed, nothin fancy, just the basics.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's Is Our Favorite”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I go to Las Vegas 2 or 3 times a year for fun. I always try to stay at Harrah's. Service is excellent, and ALL of the personnel from the check-in, to the cocktail waitresses, to those who pay off winnings are the friendliest in town. Fastest payoffs I have seen. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Food is good. For the price you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My son and I returned from a trip to Harrah's from Dec 21-24. Our experience was excellent. Check in was easy and quick. Room was adequate with a view of the parking lot but we were not in the room that much anyway. The slots were very generous to me. The first machine I sat down at paid $300. Won many more comparable pots in the Harrah's casino. Gambled at a few other places and won small pots but nothing compared to Harrah's. Everyone was super friendly and helpful. When we left we had run up a $160 room bill (room service and mini-bar) and they comped all of it. Complimentary tickets to Mac King comedy show were given upon check-in but we did not use the tickets. We instead chose to go to the Improv and the show was excellent and we asked for the tickets to be comped and they were happy to do it. Checkout was very fast. We never ate at any of the restaurants in Harrah's so can't comment on that. The line at the Garden Buffet was very long most of the time. A good place to eat if you visit the Hard Rock is Mr. Lucky's. They have a Steak and Shrimp that is worth the $7.77 you pay for it. Another excellent place to eat is Bellasarios at Caesar's. The food was excellent and medium priced. Overall our trip was great and we would gladly stay at Harrah's again for the location alone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - nothing fancy”
Reviews.Author: travel23
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT LOCATION and then it's an average hotel. Room was clean, view was bad (rooftop A/C and misc pipes) but at $59/nite I wasn't going to complain. They have quite a few things to do there, they have a outside stage / bar area that has live music and vendors (food and merchandise). We saw a great disco cover band there and they played for 2 hours with only 2 quick breaks. The bartenders put on a nice show while making the drinks. The casino got a little smokey at night time and the dealers were not very energetic when I was there. Nice location and good price, it's not a super fancy Vegas hotel but it serves its purpose well.

HotelInfo.Name: Harrah's Las Vegas
HotelInfo.Address: 3475 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89109
